item.trans: 1. V-T If you outwit someone, you use your intelligence or a trick to defeat them or to gain an advantage over them. 智胜; 骗过
1. N-PLURAL sources of alternative energy, such as wind and wave power 非传统性能量源; 如风能和波能
1. ADJ If something is elongated, it is very long and thin, often in an unnatural way. 过于细长的
1. V-T To restructure an organization or system means to change the way it is organized, usually in order to make it work more effectively. 重新建构 2. restructuring N-VAR 重新建构
1. N-MASS A sauce is a thick liquid which is served with other food. 酱; 调味汁
n. 莱茵河（位于欧洲西部）
1. N-COUNT Cobbles are the same as cobblestones. 同cobblestones [英国英语] 2. V to put together clumsily 粗制滥造
1. N-COUNT Your identity is who you are. 身份 2. N-VAR The identity of a person or place is the characteristics that distinguish them from others. 特性

1. V-I If something undesirable persists, it continues to exist. (尤指不合意的事物) 继续存在 2. V-I If you persist in doing something, you continue to do it, even though it is difficult or other people are against it. 坚持; 执意

1. V-T/V-I If you remember people or events from the past, you still have an idea of them in your mind and you are able to think about them. 记得 2. V-T If you remember that something is the case, you become aware of it again after a time when you did not think about it. 忆起; 回想起 3. V-T/V-I If you cannot remember something, you are not able to bring it back into your mind when you make an effort to do so. 记住 [usu with brd-neg] 4. V-T If you remember to do something, you do it when you intend to. 记住 (做某事) 5. V-T You tell someone to remember that something is the case when you want to emphasize its importance. It may be something that they already know about or a new piece of information. 要记住 (表示强调重要性) [强调]

1. N-COUNT The workforce is the total number of people in a country or region who are physically able to do a job and are available for work. 劳动力 2. N-COUNT The workforce is the total number of people who are employed by a particular company. 雇员总数
1. ADJ Onshore means happening on land, rather than at sea. 在陆地上的 2. ADV Onshore is also an adverb. 在陆地上 [ADV after v]
1. V-T If one thing underpins another, it helps the other thing to continue or succeed by supporting and strengthening it. 支撑; 加固 2. underpinning N-VAR

1. V-T If you evade something, you find a way of not doing something that you really ought to do. 逃避 2. V-T If you evade a question or a topic, you avoid talking about it or dealing with it. 回避 (问题、话题) 3. V-T If you evade someone or something, you move so that you can avoid meeting them or avoid being touched or hit. 避开

1. V-I Something that stretches over an area or distance covers or exists in the whole of that area or distance. 延伸 [no cont] 2. N-COUNT A stretch of road, water, or land is a length or area of it. 一段 3. V-T/V-I When you stretch, you put your arms or legs out straight and tighten your muscles. 伸直 4. N-COUNT Stretch is also a noun. 伸展 5. N-COUNT A stretch of time is a period of time. 一段 (时间) 6. V-I If something stretches from one time to another, it begins at the first time and ends at the second, which is longer than expected. 持续 7. V-I If a group of things stretch from one type of thing to another, the group includes a wide range of things. 涉及 8. V-T/V-I When something soft or elastic stretches or is stretched, it becomes longer or bigger as well as thinner, usually because it is pulled. 有弹性 9. V-T/V-I If you stretch an amount of something or if it stretches, you make it last longer than it usually would by being careful and not wasting any of it. 俭省 10. V-T If something stretches your money or re

1. V-RECIP When one person or group collaborates with another, they work together, especially on a book or on some research. (尤指著书或进行研究时的) 合作 2. V-I If someone collaborates with an enemy that is occupying their country during a war, they help them. 通敌 [表不满]

1. V-T If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly. 提倡 [正式] 2. N-COUNT An advocate of a particular action or plan is someone who recommends it publicly. 倡导者 [正式] 3. N-COUNT An advocate for a particular group is a person who works for the interests of that group. 为 (某团体) 谋利益者 [美国英语] 4. N-COUNT An advocate is a lawyer who speaks in favour of someone or defends them in a court of law. 辩护律师 [法律]

1. N-COUNT A directory is a book which gives lists of facts, for example, people's names, addresses, and telephone numbers, or the names and addresses of business companies, usually arranged in alphabetical order. (通常按字母顺序记录姓名、地址、电话、公司通讯录等的) 簿 2. N-COUNT A directory is an area of a computer disk which contains one or more files or other directories. (计算机磁盘中包含一个或多个文件的) 目录 [计算机] 3. N-COUNT On the World Wide Web, a directory is a list of the subjects that you can find information on. (万维网上的) 主题目录 [计算机]

1. N-COUNT A cap is a soft, flat hat with a curved part at the front which is called a visor. 软扁帽; 便帽 2. N-COUNT A cap is a special hat which is worn as part of a uniform. 制服帽 3. N-COUNT The cap of a bottle is its lid. 瓶盖 4. V-T If someone says that a good or bad event caps a series of events, they mean it is the final event in the series, and the other events were also good or bad. 成为…的结尾 [journalism]

1. V-T If you impose something on people, you use your authority to force them to accept it. 强制实行 2. imposition N-UNCOUNT 强制实行 3. V-T If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy. 把 (观点、信仰等) 强加于 4. V-T If something imposes strain, pressure, or suffering on someone, it causes them to experience it. 使承受 (令人不快之事物) 5. V-I If someone imposes on you, they unreasonably expect you to do something for them which you do not want to do. 不合理地要求 6. imposition N-COUNT 不合理的要求 7. V-T If someone imposes themselves on you, they force you to accept their company although you may not want to. 使强迫接受

1. V-T To protect someone or something means to prevent them from being harmed or damaged. 保护 2. V-T If an insurance policy protects you against an event such as death, injury, fire, or theft, the insurance company will give you or your family money if that event happens. 为…保险
1. ADJ If you describe something as ephemeral, you mean that it lasts only for a short time. 短暂的; 瞬间的 [正式]

1. ADJ If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before. 史无前例的 2. ADJ If you describe something as unprecedented, you are emphasizing that it is very great in quality, amount, or scale. (质量、数量或规模) 空前的 [强调]

1. ADJ If you describe memories and descriptions as vivid, you mean that they are very clear and detailed. (记忆和描写) 清晰的; 生动逼真的 2. vividly ADV 清晰地 3. ADJ Something that is vivid is very bright in colour. (颜色) 鲜艳的 4. vividly ADV 鲜艳地 [ADV -ed/adj]
1. ADJ Hands-on experience or work involves actually doing a particular thing, rather than just talking about it or getting someone else to do it. 亲身实践的
1. N-VAR If a dispute or series of negotiations reaches deadlock, neither side is willing to give in at all and no agreement can be made. 僵局
1. N-MASS A fluid is a liquid. 液体 [正式] 2. ADJ Fluid movements or lines or designs are smooth and graceful. 优雅流畅的

1. V-I When an animal snarls, it makes a fierce, rough sound in its throat while showing its teeth. (动物) 露齿嗥叫 2. N-COUNT Snarl is also a noun. 露齿嗥叫 3. N a vicious growl, utterance, or facial expression 咆哮; 嗥叫; 作嗥叫状 4. V to speak or express (something) viciously or angrily 咆哮地
n. 圣者像；圣者 adj. 神圣的
adj. 西南的；位于西南方的
1. ADJ If someone is edgy, they are nervous and anxious, and seem likely to lose control of themselves. 急躁不安的 [非正式]
abbr. 股份有限公司（incorporated）
1. N-COUNT An outpatient is someone who receives treatment at a hospital but does not spend the night there. 门诊病人

1. ADJ If you describe an object as unwieldy, you mean that it is difficult to move or carry because it is so big or heavy. 笨重的 2. ADJ If you describe a system as unwieldy, you mean that it does not work very well as a result of it being too large or badly organized. 庞大而难以控制的 (体制)
1. N a carved channel or groove, esp a vertical one as used on a Doric frieze 竖沟; 尤指多利安式横楣

1. N-SING Your spirit is the part of you that is not physical and that consists of your character and feelings. 精神 (包括性格、情感等) 2. N-COUNT A person's spirit is the nonphysical part of them that is believed to remain alive after their death. 灵魂 3. N-COUNT A spirit is a ghost or supernatural being. 幽灵 4. N-UNCOUNT Spirit is the courage and determination that helps people to survive in difficult times and to keep their way of life and their beliefs. 毅力 5. N-UNCOUNT Spirit is the liveliness and energy that someone shows in what they do. 活力 6. N-SING The spirit in which you do something is the attitude you have when you are doing it. 态度 7. N-UNCOUNT A particular kind of spirit is the feeling of loyalty to a group that is shared by the people who belong to the group. 忠诚 8. N-SING A particular kind of spirit is the set of ideas, beliefs, and aims that are held by a group of people. 群体的观念、信仰和目的 9. N-SING The spirit of something such as a law or an agreement is the way that it was intended to be interpreted or

1. ADJ You use compulsive to describe people or their behaviour when they cannot stop doing something wrong, harmful, or unnecessary. 欲罢不能的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ If a book or television programme is compulsive, it is so interesting that you do not want to stop reading or watching it. (书、电视节目) 使人着迷的

1. N-COUNT A tier is a row or layer of something that has other layers above or below it. 排; 层 2. COMB in ADJ Tier is also a combining form. (用于构成合成形容词) …排的; …层的 3. N-COUNT A tier is a level in an organization or system. (组织或系统中的) 级 4. COMB in ADJ Tier is also a combining form. (用于构成合成形容词) …级的 5. V to be or arrange in tiers 使层叠; 按层排列 1. N a person or thing that ties 捆绑的人(或物)
1. N-COUNT A dog's leash is a long thin piece of leather or a chain, which you attach to the dog's collar so that you can keep the dog under control. (牵狗的) 皮带或链条

1. N-COUNT A servant is someone who is employed to work at another person's home, for example, as a cleaner or a gardener. 仆人; 佣人 2. N-COUNT You can use servant to refer to someone or something that provides a service for people or can be used by them. 雇员 3. → see also civil servant

1. N-COUNT A lease is a legal agreement by which the owner of a building, a piece of land, or something such as a car allows someone else to use it for a period of time in return for money. 租约 2. V-T If you lease property or something such as a car from someone or if they lease it to you, they allow you to use it in return for regular payments of money. 租进; 租出
adj. 工业化前的；未工业化的

1. V-I When you bow to someone, you briefly bend your body toward them as a formal way of greeting them or showing respect. 鞠躬 2. N-COUNT Bow is also a noun. 鞠躬 3. V-T If you bow your head, you bend it downward so that you are looking toward the ground, for example, because you want to show respect or because you are thinking deeply about something. 低下 (头) 4. V-I If you bow to pressure or to someone's wishes, you agree to do what they want you to do. 屈从 1. N-COUNT The front part of a ship is called the bow or the bows. The plural bows can be used to refer either to one or to more than one of these parts. 船头 1. N-COUNT A bow is a knot with two loops and two loose ends that is used in tying shoelaces and ribbons. 蝴蝶结 2. N-COUNT A bow is a weapon for shooting arrows that consists of a long piece of curved wood with a string attached to both its ends. 弓 3. N-COUNT The bow of a violin or other stringed instrument is a long thin piece of wood with fibres stretched along it that you move across the strings

1. N-COUNT A deputy is the second most important person in an organization such as a business or government department. Someone's deputy often acts on their behalf when they are not there. 副手 2. N-COUNT In some legislatures, the elected members are called deputies. 议员 3. N-COUNT A deputy is a police officer. 警官 [美国英语] 4. N-COUNT A deputy is a person appointed to act on another person's behalf. 代理人
n. 比萨（意大利城市）

1. V-T If you skim something from the surface of a liquid, you remove it. 撇去 (液体表面的浮物) 2. V-T/V-I If something skims a surface, it moves quickly along just above it. 掠过 3. V-T/V-I If you skim a piece of writing, you read through it quickly. 略读; 浏览
1. N-COUNT A Zionist is someone who believes in Zionism. 锡安主义者; 犹太复国主义者 2. ADJ Zionist means relating to Zionism. 犹太复国运动的; 犹太复国主义的 [usu ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A loophole in the law is a small mistake which allows people to do something that would otherwise be illegal. 漏洞

1. N-COUNT The edge of something is the place or line where it stops, or the part of it that is farthest from the middle. 边缘; 边际 2. N-COUNT The edge of something sharp such as a knife or an axe is its sharp or narrow side. 刃 3. V-I If someone or something edges somewhere, they move very slowly in that direction. 慢慢移动 4. N-SING Theedgeof something, especially something bad, is the point at which it may start to happen. 边缘 5. N-SING If someone or something has an edge, they have an advantage that makes them stronger or more likely to be successful than another thing or person. 优势 6. N-SING If you say that someone or something has an edge, you mean that they have a powerful quality. 锐气 7. N-SING If someone's voice has an edge to it, it has a sharp, bitter, or emotional quality. 尖锐; 尖刻 8. → see also cutting edge, leading edge 9. PHRASE If you or your nerves are on edge, you are tense, nervous, and unable to relax. 紧张不安的 10. PHRASE If something takes the edge off an unpleasant situation, it weakens its
n. 塞尔维亚（南斯拉夫成员共和国名）

1. N-COUNT Your address is the number of the house or apartment and the name of the street and the town where you live or work. 地址 2. N-COUNT The address of a website is its location on the Internet, for example, http://www.thomson.com. 网址 [计算机] 3. V-T If a letter, envelope, or parcel is addressed to you, your name and address have been written on it. 写 (收信人的) 姓名地址 [usu passive] 4. V-T If you address a group of people, you give a speech to them. 作演讲 5. N-COUNT Address is also a noun. 演讲
1. N-UNCOUNT Vanilla is a flavoring used in ice cream and other sweet food. 香草
1. ADJ If someone is frank, they state or express things in an open and honest way. 坦率的 2. frankly ADV 坦率地 [ADV with v]

1. N-VAR The identification of something is the recognition that it exists, is important, or is true. 确认 2. N-VAR The identification of a particular person or thing is the ability to name them because you know them or recognize them. 验明 3. N-UNCOUNT If someone asks you for some identification, they want to see something such as a driving licence, that proves who you are. 身份证明 4. N-VAR The identification of one person or thing with another is the close association of one with the other. 密切关联 5. N-UNCOUNT Identification with someone or something is the feeling of sympathy and support for them. 同情; 支持
1. ADJ A fervent person has or shows strong feelings about something, and is very sincere and enthusiastic about it. 热情的; 热诚的 2. fervently ADV 热情地; 热诚地
n. 桑福德（男子名）
1. ADJ Administrative work involves organizing and supervising an organization or institution. 行政的; 管理的

1. N-COUNT The franc was the unit of currency that was used in France and Belgium, before it was replaced by the euro. It is also the unit of currency in some other countries where French is spoken. 法郎 [num N] 2. N-SING The franc was used to refer to the currency systems of France and Belgium, before it was replaced by the euro. It is also used to refer to the currency systems of some other countries where French is spoken. 法郎体系 ['the' N]

1. N-COUNT A franchise is an authority that is given by an organization to someone, allowing them to sell its goods or services or to take part in an activity which the organization controls. (公司授予某人的) 特许经营权 [商业] 2. V-T If a company franchises its business, it sells franchises to other companies, allowing them to sell its goods or services. 出售…的特许经营权 [商业] 3. N-UNCOUNT Franchise is the right to vote in an election. 选举权 [also 'the' N]
1. N-UNCOUNT Sulphur is a yellow chemical which has a strong smell. 硫磺
1. N-UNCOUNT If there is cohesion within a society, organization, or group, the different members fit together well and form a united whole. 凝聚力

1. ADJ A person or animal that is intelligent has the ability to think, understand, and learn things quickly and well. 有智慧的 2. intelligently ADV 有头脑地 3. ADJ Something that is intelligent can think and understand instead of doing things automatically or by instinct. 有智能的

1. V-T/V-I If you crunch something hard, such as a sweet, or if it crunches, you crush it noisily between your teeth. 嘎吱嘎吱地咬嚼 (某物); 发出嘎吱声 2. V-T/V-I If something crunches or if you crunch it, it makes a breaking or crushing noise, for example, when you step on it. 嘎吱嘎吱地碾或踩 (某物); 发出嘎吱声 3. N-COUNT Crunch is also a noun. 嘎吱嘎吱的声音 4. V-I If you crunch across a surface made of very small stones, you move across it causing it to make a crunching noise. 嘎吱嘎吱地踩 5. V-T To crunch numbers means to do a lot of calculations using a calculator or computer. (用计算器或电脑) 运算 6. N-SING You can refer to an important time or event, for example, when an important decision has to be made, as the crunch. 关键时刻 7. N-COUNT A situation in which a business or economy has very little money can be referred to as a crunch. 财政困难 [商业]
1. N the office, jurisdiction, or reign of a caliph 哈里发的职位、权力或统治

1. N-VAR Input consists of information or resources that a group or project receives. 信息; 资源 2. N-UNCOUNT Input is information that is put into a computer. (计算机的) 输入信息 [计算机] 3. V-T If you input information into a computer, you feed it in, for example, by typing it on a keyboard. 输入 (信息) [计算机]
办公室；行政办公室；经理办公室

1. ADJ You use own to indicate that something belongs to a particular person or thing. 自己的 [poss ADJ] 2. PRON Own is also a pronoun. 自己的 [poss PRON] 3. ADJ You use own to indicate that something is used by, or is characteristic of, only one person, thing, or group. 自己独有的 [poss ADJ] 4. PRON Own is also a pronoun. 自己独有的 [poss PRON] 5. ADJ You use own to indicate that someone does something without any help from other people. 自己的 [poss ADJ] 6. PRON Own is also a pronoun. 自己的 [poss PRON] 7. V-T If you own something, it is your property. 拥有 8. PHRASE If you have something you can call your own, it belongs only to you, rather than being controlled by or shared with someone else. 专属于自己的 9. PHRASE If someone or something comes into their own, they become very successful or start to perform very well because the circumstances are right. 得心应手 10. PHRASE If you get your own back on someone, you have your revenge on them because of something bad that they have done to you. 报复 [英国英语] [非正式] 11. PHRASE If you sa

1. V-T/V-I If you decide to do something, you choose to do it, usually after you have thought carefully about the other possibilities. 决定 2. V-T If a person or group of people decides something, they choose what something should be like or how a particular problem should be solved. 裁定 3. V-T If an event or fact decides something, it makes it certain that a particular choice will be made or that there will be a particular result. 决定 4. V-T If you decide that something is true, you form that opinion about it after considering the facts. 断定
n. 标语；品牌口号
n. 供应者；养家者

1. V-T If you owe money to someone, they have lent it to you and you have not yet paid it back. 欠 2. V-T If someone or something owes a particular quality or their success to a person or thing, they only have it because of that person or thing. 把…归功于 [no passive] 3. V-T If you say that you owe a great deal to someone or something, you mean that they have helped you or influenced you a lot, and you feel very grateful to them. 感激 4. V-T If you say that something owes a great deal to a person or thing, you mean that it exists, is successful, or has its particular form mainly because of them. 得益于 5. V-T If you say that you owe someone gratitude, respect, or loyalty, you mean that they deserve it from you. 应给予 6. V-T If you say that you owe it to someone to do something, you mean that you should do that thing because they deserve it. 该为 (某人做某事) [no passive] 7. PHRASE You use owing to when you are introducing the reason for something. 由于
n. 费萨尔（沙特阿拉伯国王）

1. N-UNCOUNT Bail is a sum of money that an arrested person or someone else puts forward as a guarantee that the arrested person will attend their trial in a law court. If the arrested person does not attend it, the money will be lost. 保释金 2. N-UNCOUNT Bail is permission for an arrested person to be released after bail has been paid. 保释许可 3. V-T If someone is bailed, they are released while they are waiting for their trial, after paying an amount of money to the court. 保释 [usu passive] 4. V-I If you bail, you use a container to remove water from a boat or from a place which is flooded. (从船里或某处) 往外舀水 5. PHRASAL VERB Bail out means the same as . (从船里或某处) 往外舀水 6. PHRASE If someone who has been arrested makes bail, or if another person makes bail for them, the arrested person is released on bail. 保释 7. PHRASE If a prisoner jumps bail, he or she does not come back for his or her trial after being released on bail. 弃保潜逃 8. N either of two small wooden bars placed across the tops of the stumps to form the w
1. N-COUNT Your mentality is your attitudes and your way of thinking. 心态

1. V-T If you elicit a response or a reaction, you do or say something that makes other people respond or react. 引起 (反应) 2. V-T If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions. 探得 (信息) [正式]
1. ADV If something happens or exists partially, it happens or exists to some extent, but not completely. 在一定程度上地 [ADV with cl/group]

1. N-UNCOUNT Correspondence is the act of writing letters to someone. 通信 [also 'a' N, oft N 'with' n] 2. N-UNCOUNT Someone's correspondence is the letters that they receive or send. 信件 3. N-COUNT If there is a correspondence between two things, there is a close similarity or connection between them. 一致

1. ADJ Someone who is separated from their wife or husband lives apart from them, but is not divorced. 分居的 [v-link ADJ] 2. ADJ If you are separated from someone, for example, your family, you are not able to be with them. 分开的

1. N-COUNT A broker is a person whose job is to buy and sell securities, foreign money, real estate, or goods for other people. 经纪人; 掮客 [商业] 2. V-T If a country or government brokers an agreement, a ceasefire, or a round of talks, they try to negotiate or arrange it. 斡旋

1. V-T/V-I When you halve something or when it halves, it is reduced to half its previous size or amount. 使减半; 减为一半 2. V-T If you halve something, you divide it into two equal parts. 把…对半分开 3. Halves is the plural of . (half)的复数形式
1. N-UNCOUNT Revenue is money that a company, organization, or government receives from people. (公司、组织或政府的) 收入 [商业] [also N in pl] 2. → see also Internal Revenue Service

1. V-T If you renew an activity, you begin it again. 重新开始 2. V-RECIP If you renew a relationship with someone, you start it again after you have not seen them or have not been friendly with them for some time. 恢复 (关系) 3. V-T When you renew something such as a licence or a contract, you extend the period of time for which it is valid. 延长 (执照、合同的) 有效期 4. V-T You can say that something is renewed when it grows again or is replaced after it has been destroyed or lost. 获得新生; (遭毁坏或损失后) 再生 [usu passive]
1. N-COUNT A boutique is a small shop that sells fashionable clothes, shoes, or jewellery. 时尚精品小店
1. N-COUNT An easel is a frame that supports a picture which an artist is painting or drawing. 画架
1. N-UNCOUNT Esteem is the admiration and respect that you feel toward another person. 敬重 [正式] 2. → see also self-esteem
1. ADJ If you say that an event is predictable, you mean that it is obvious in advance that it will happen. 可预见的 2. predictably ADV 可预见地

1. V-I If you commute, you travel a long distance every day between your home and your place of work. 通勤 2. commuter N-COUNT 通勤者 3. N-COUNT A commute is the journey that you make when you commute. 通勤的路程
adj. 不清楚的；定义不清晰的

1. V-I If you say that someone or something degenerates, you mean that they become worse in some way, for example, weaker, lower in quality, or more dangerous. 退化; 恶化; 堕落 2. degeneration N-UNCOUNT 退化; 恶化; 堕落 3. ADJ If you describe a person or their behaviour as degenerate, you disapprove of them because you think they have low standards of behaviour or morality. 堕落的 [表不满]
1. Leapt is a past tense and past participle of . leap的过去式和过去分词
n. 卡斯特罗（男子名）

1. ADJ Dire is used to emphasize how serious or terrible a situation or event is. 严重的; 可怕的 [强调] 2. ADJ If you describe something as dire, you are emphasizing that it is of very low quality. 质量低劣的 [非正式]

1. N-COUNT A cult is a fairly small religious group, especially one which is considered strange. 异教团体 2. N-COUNT The cult of something is a situation in which people regard that thing as very important or special. 狂热崇拜 [表不满] 3. ADJ Cult is used to describe things that are very popular or fashionable among a particular group of people. 受到狂热崇拜的 [ADJ n] 4. N-SING Someone or something that is a cult has become very popular or fashionable among a particular group of people. 时尚
1. N-UNCOUNT Rapture is a feeling of extreme happiness or pleasure. 狂喜 [文学性]
1. N-COUNT A contractor is a person or company that does work for other people or organizations. 承包人; 承包商 [商业]

1. N-PLURAL a game in which each player writes down a part of a story, folds over the paper, and passes it on to another player who continues the story. After several stages, the resulting (nonsensical) stories are read out 连环叙事游戏; 每位玩家写下故事的一部分,将纸对折,传给下一位玩家继续叙写故事,最后再将故事念出 [英国英语]

1. N-COUNT A crane is a large machine that moves heavy things by lifting them in the air. 起重机 2. N-COUNT A crane is a kind of large bird with a long neck and long legs. 鹤 3. V-T/V-I If you crane your neck or head, you stretch your neck in a particular direction in order to see or hear something better. 伸长 (脖子)

1. ADJ If you say that someone is ruthless, you mean that you disapprove of them because they are very harsh or cruel, and will do anything that is necessary to achieve what they want. 残酷的 [表不满] 2. ruthlessly ADV 残酷地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ A ruthless action or activity is done forcefully and thoroughly, without much concern for its effects on other people. 坚决无情的 4. ruthlessly ADV 坚决无情地

1. ADJ If someone is innocent, they did not commit a crime that they have been accused of. 清白的 2. ADJ If someone is innocent, they have no experience or knowledge of the more complex or unpleasant aspects of life. 阅历浅的; 天真的 3. N-COUNT An innocent is someone who is innocent. 阅历浅的人; 天真的人 4. innocently ADV 天真地 5. ADJ Innocent people are those who are not involved in a crime or conflict, but are injured or killed as a result of it. 无辜受害的 6. ADJ An innocent question, remark, or comment is not intended to offend or upset people, even if it does so. 无恶意的

1. ADJ Ethical means relating to beliefs about right and wrong. 道德上的 2. ethically ADV 道德上地 3. ADJ If you describe something as ethical, you mean that it is morally right or morally acceptable. 合乎道德的 4. ethically ADV 合乎道德地 [ADV after v]

1. ADJ You use religious to describe things that are connected with religion or with one particular religion. 宗教的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Someone who is religious has a strong belief in a god or gods. 虔诚的; 笃信宗教的
1. N-COUNT A retailer is a person or business that sells goods to the public. 零售商 [商业]
n. 乌干达（非洲国家）
1. N-COUNT A teenager is someone who is between thirteen and nineteen years old. 十几岁 (指13至19岁) 的人

1. V-T If one thing outweighs another, the first thing is of greater importance, benefit, or significance than the second thing. (在重要性或意义上) 超过 [正式] 2. V-T If you outweigh someone, you are heavier than them. 比 (某人) 重
1. N-COUNT A memo is a short official note that is sent by one person to another within the same company or organization. 简报

1. N-COUNT A symptom of an illness is something wrong with your body or mind that is a sign of the illness. 症状 2. N-COUNT A symptom of a bad situation is something that happens which is considered to be a sign of this situation. 征兆

1. N-VAR If you have an obligation to do something, it is your duty to do that thing. 义务 2. N-VAR If you have an obligation to a person, it is your duty to take care of them or protect their interests. 义务; 责任 3. PHRASE In advertisements, if a product or a service is available without obligation, you do not have to pay for that product or service until you have tried it and are satisfied with it. 无义务地
日以继夜地，连续一整天
1. N-COUNT A pseudonym is a name that someone, usually a writer, uses instead of his or her real name. 假名; 笔名
1. N-COUNT A buttonhole is a hole that you push a button through in order to fasten a shirt, coat, or other piece of clothing. 扣眼

1. N-COUNT An occasion is a time when something happens, or a case of it happening. (某事发生的) 时候; 场景 2. N-COUNT An occasion is an important event, ceremony, or celebration. 重大场合 3. N-COUNT An occasion for doing something is an opportunity for doing it. 机会 [正式] 4. PHRASE If you have occasion to do something, you have the opportunity to do it or have a need to do it. 有机会; 有必要 5. PHRASE If you say that someone rose to the occasion, you mean that they did what was necessary to successfully overcome a difficult situation. 应付自如
adj. 有…相貌的；有…样子的
1. ADJ If you say that you are pressed for time or pressed for money, you mean that you do not have enough time or money at the moment. 紧缺的 [v-link ADJ] 2. → see also hard-pressed

1. V-I If a building or other structure collapses, it falls down very suddenly. 坍塌 2. N-UNCOUNT Collapse is also a noun. 坍塌 3. V-I If something, for example a system or institution, collapses, it fails or comes to an end completely and suddenly. (系统或制度等) 崩溃; 瓦解 4. N-UNCOUNT Collapse is also a noun. (系统或制度等的) 崩溃; 瓦解 5. V-I If you collapse, you suddenly faint or fall down because you are very ill or weak. 晕倒; 倒下 6. N-UNCOUNT Collapse is also a noun. 晕倒; 倒下 7. V-I If you collapse onto something, you sit or lie down suddenly because you are very tired. (因极度疲倦而) 瘫坐; 瘫倒

1. N-UNCOUNT Roulette is a gambling game in which a ball is dropped onto a wheel with numbered holes in it while the wheel is spinning around. The players bet on which hole the ball will be in when the wheel stops spinning. 轮盘赌
1. N-UNCOUNT Ethanol is another name for . alcohol的别称 [技术]
1. N-UNCOUNT If you do something with aplomb, you do it with confidence in a relaxed way. 沉着; 镇定 [正式] [usu 'with' N]
1. N-COUNT If you describe someone as a titan of a particular field, you mean that they are very important and powerful or successful in that field. 巨人; 巨头 [usu N n, N 'of' n]
vt. 使融合 vi. 干预 n. (Mell)人名；(德、英、法、西、瑞典)梅尔

1. ADJ If something is well suited to a particular purpose, it is right or appropriate for that purpose. If someone is well suited to a particular job, they are right or appropriate for that job. 适合的 [v-link ADJ]
1. N-VAR An opera is a play with music in which all the words are sung. 歌剧 2. → see also soap opera 3. Opera is an alternative plural of . (opus)的两种复数形式之一

1. V-I If several things meld, or if something melds them, they combine or blend in a pleasant or useful way. (使)融合; 融合 [正式] 2. V-I If several things meld into another thing, or if they are melded into another thing, they combine and become the other thing. 融合为 [正式] 3. N-COUNT A meld of things is a mixture or combination of them that is useful or pleasant. (有益或愉快的)混合 [正式] [usu sing: 'a' N 'of' n]
1. N-COUNT If you refer to an action, or the result of an action, as a feat, you admire it because it is an impressive and difficult achievement. 功绩 [表赞许]
1. N-VAR An indication is a sign that suggests, for example, what people are thinking or feeling. 象征; 迹象

1. N-COUNT A romance is a relationship between two people who are in love with each other but who are not married to each other. 恋爱 2. N-UNCOUNT Romance refers to the actions and feelings of people who are in love, especially behaviour that is very caring or affectionate. (爱情中) 浪漫的感觉 3. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the pleasure and excitement of doing something new or exciting as romance. 浪漫新奇的感受 4. N-COUNT A romance is a novel or movie about a love affair. 爱情小说; 爱情电影

1. N-COUNT A tremor is a small earthquake. 小地震 2. N-COUNT If an event causes a tremor in a group or organization, it threatens to make the group or organization less strong or stable. (团体或组织内的) 波动 3. N-COUNT A tremor is a shaking of your body or voice that you cannot control. (身体或声音的) 颤抖

1. ADJ Someone who is fluent in a particular language can speak the language easily and correctly. You can also say that someone speaks fluent French, Chinese, or some other language. 流利的 2. fluency N-UNCOUNT 流利 3. ADJ If your speech, reading, or writing is fluent, you speak, read, or write easily, smoothly, and clearly with no mistakes. 流畅的 4. fluency N-UNCOUNT 流畅

1. N-COUNT An accord between countries or groups of people is a formal agreement; for example, to end a war. 协议 2. V-T If you are accorded a particular kind of treatment, people act toward you or treat you in that way. 给予 (某种待遇) [正式] 3. → see also according to##according to 4. PHRASE If something happens of its own accord, it seems to happen by itself, without anyone making it happen. 自动地 5. PHRASE If you do something of your own accord, you do it because you want to, without being asked or forced. 自愿地

1. ADJ You use surrogate to describe a person or thing that is given a particular role because the person or thing that should have the role is not available. 替代的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT Surrogate is also a noun. 替代者; 替代物

1. ADJ Jordanian means belonging or relating to the country of Jordan, or to its people or culture. 约旦国的; 约旦人的; 约旦国文化的 2. N-COUNT A Jordanian is a Jordanian citizen, or a person of Jordanian origin. 约旦人

1. ADJ A knowing gesture or remark is one that shows that you understand something, for example the way that someone is feeling or what they really mean, even though it has not been mentioned directly. 会意的 2. knowingly ADV 会意地

1. N-VAR A debate is a discussion about a subject on which people have different views. 辩论 2. N-COUNT A debate is a formal discussion, for example, in a parliament or institution, in which people express different opinions about a particular subject and then vote on it. (议会投票前的) 正式讨论 3. V-RECIP If people debate a topic, they discuss it fairly formally, putting forward different views. You can also say that one person debates a topic with another person. 辩论 4. V-T If you debate whether to do something or what to do, you think or talk about possible courses of action before deciding exactly what you are going to do. 考虑
1. PHRASAL VERB If you lose out, you suffer a loss or disadvantage because you have not succeeded in what you were doing. 损失; 失利
1. N-VAR Inclusion is the act of making a person or thing part of a group or collection. 包括
n. 内罗比（肯尼亚首都）
1. N-UNCOUNT Determination is the quality that you show when you have decided to do something and you will not let anything stop you. 决心 2. → see also determine

1. N-COUNT If you describe something such as a task or an activity as, for example, a difficult proposition or an attractive proposition, you mean that it is difficult or pleasant to do. 事情 2. N-COUNT A proposition is a statement or an idea that people can consider or discuss to decide whether it is true. 主张; 观点 [正式] 3. N-COUNT A proposition is a question or statement about an issue of public policy that appears on a voting paper so that people can vote for or against it. 提案 4. N-COUNT A proposition is an offer or a suggestion that someone makes to you, usually concerning some work or business that you might be able to do together. 建议
n. 爱沙尼亚
1. N-VAR A meritocracy is a society or social system in which people get status or rewards because of what they achieve, rather than because of their wealth or social status. 贤能社会

1. N-SING If one amount or value is the equivalent of another, they are the same. 等量物; 等价物 2. ADJ Equivalent is also an adjective. 等量的; 等值的 3. N-COUNT The equivalent of someone or something is a person or thing that has the same function in a different place, time, or system. 等效对象 4. ADJ Equivalent is also an adjective. 等效的 5. N-SING You can use equivalent to emphasize the great or severe effect of something. 等效对象 [强调]

1. PHRASE If you are on the verge of something, you are going to do it very soon or it is likely to happen or begin very soon. 即将 2. N an edge or rim; margin 边缘 3. N-COUNT The verge of a road is a narrow piece of ground by the side of a road, which is usually covered with grass or flowers. (通常种有花草的) 路边 [英国英语] 4. V to be near (to) 接近; 濒临 5. V to move or incline in a certain direction 趋向; 倾向

1. N-COUNT If you get a glimpse of someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well. 一瞥 2. V-T If you glimpse someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well. 瞥见 3. N-COUNT A glimpse of something is a brief experience of it or an idea about it that helps you understand or appreciate it better. 初步的感受
1. ADJ If you have an intuitive idea or feeling about something, you feel that it is true although you have no evidence or proof of it. 直觉的 2. intuitively ADV 凭直觉地

1. V-T/V-I To pass someone or something means to go past them without stopping. 经过 2. V-I When someone or something passes in a particular direction, they move in that direction. 穿过 3. V-I If something such as a road or pipe passes along a particular route, it goes along that route. (沿某路线) 穿过 4. V-T If you pass something through, over, or around something else, you move or push it through, over, or around that thing. 穿; 越; 绕 5. V-T If you pass something to someone, you take it in your hand and give it to them. 传递 6. V-T/V-I If something passes or is passed from one person to another, the second person then has it instead of the first. 转给 7. V-T If you pass information to someone, you give it to them because it concerns them. 传达 8. PHRASAL VERB Pass on means the same as pass. 传达 9. V-T/V-I If you pass, or pass the ball to someone on your team in a game such as football or basketball, you throw it to them. 传 (球) 给 10. V-I When a period of time passes, it happens and finishes. (时间) 消逝 11. V-T If you
1. N-PLURAL The outskirts of a city or town are the parts of it that are farthest away from its centre. (市、镇的) 外围地带
1. ADJ having a distinct physical shape or form, often provided by an internal structure (构造)有型的
1. V-T If you conserve a supply of something, you use it carefully so that it lasts for a long time. 节省 2. V-T To conserve something means to protect it from harm, loss, or change. 保护
n. 严重；严格；猛烈
1. N-UNCOUNT-COLL Animals such as cattle and sheep which are kept on a farm are referred to as livestock. 家畜
1. V-T/V-I If a meeting or trial is adjourned or if it adjourns, it is stopped for a short time. (会议或审判) 暂停

1. V-T If someone such as a lawyer or a politician represents a person, a group of people, or a place, they act on behalf of that person, group, or place. 代表; 代理 2. V-T If you represent a person or group at an official event, you go there on their behalf. 代表 (出席) 3. V-T If you represent your country or city in a competition or sports event, you take part in it on behalf of the country or city where you live. 代表 (参赛) 4. V-T PASSIVE If a group of people or things is well represented in a particular activity or in a particular place, a lot of them can be found there. 使有代表性 5. V-T If a sign or symbol represents something, it is accepted as meaning that thing. 代表; 表示; 象征 [no cont] 6. V-T To represent an idea or quality means to be a symbol or an expression of that idea or quality. 代表; 象征; 反映 [no cont, no passive] 7. V-T If you represent a person or thing as a particular thing, you describe them as being that thing. 描写; 描绘
1. N-UNCOUNT Food can be referred to as chow. 食物 [美国英语] [非正式] 2. N-COUNT A chow is a kind of dog that has a thick coat and a curled tail. Chows originally came from China. 原产中国的厚毛卷尾狗

1. ADJ If a place is crammed with things or people, it is full of them, so that there is hardly room for anything or anyone else. 塞满的 2. ADJ If people or things are crammed into a place or vehicle, it is full of them. 挤满的 [v-link ADJ]

1. N-COUNT The subject of something such as a conversation, letter, or book is the thing that is being discussed or written about. 话题; 主题 2. N-COUNT Someone or something that is the subject of criticism, study, or an investigation is being criticized, studied, or investigated. (批评、研究或调查的) 对象 3. N-COUNT A subject is an area of knowledge or study, especially one that you study in school, or college. (尤指在学校学习的) 科目 4. N-COUNT In an experiment or piece of research, the subject is the person or animal that is being tested or studied. 实验对象; 研究对象 [正式] 5. N-COUNT An artist's subjects are the people, animals, or objects that he or she paints, models, or photographs. (绘画、摄影等的) 题材 6. N-COUNT In grammar, the subject of a clause is the noun group that refers to the person or thing that is doing the action expressed by the verb. For example, in "My cat keeps catching birds," "my cat" is the subject. 主语 7. ADJ To be subject to something means to be affected by it or to be likely to be affected by it. (可能) 受…影响的 [v-li
1. N-COUNT A marketer is someone whose job involves marketing. 商人 [商业]

1. V-T If you defend someone or something, you take action in order to protect them. 保护 2. V-T If you defend someone or something when they have been criticized, you argue in support of them. 为…争辩 3. V-T When a lawyer defends a person who has been accused of something, the lawyer argues on their behalf in a court of law that the charges are not true. 为…辩护 4. V-T When a sports player plays in the tournament which they won the previous time it was held, you can say that they are defending their title. 卫冕 [journalism]

1. V-I If something ceases, it stops happening or existing. 停止 [正式] 2. V-T If you cease to do something, you stop doing it. 停止; 不再 (做某事) [正式] 3. V-T If you cease something, you stop it happening or working. 停止 [正式]
n. 埃及人
1. ADJ Built-in devices or features are included in something as a part of it, rather than being separate. 内置的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T When soldiers, police, or guards patrol an area or building, they move around it in order to make sure that there is no trouble there. 在…巡逻 2. N-COUNT Patrol is also a noun. 巡逻 3. PHRASE Soldiers, police, or guards who are on patrol are patrolling an area. 在巡逻 4. N-COUNT A patrol is a group of soldiers or vehicles that are patrolling an area. 巡逻队
1. V-I When something such as a contract, deadline, or visa expires, it comes to an end or is no longer valid. 到期; 失效
以便；所以

1. N-COUNT If something has a parallel, it is similar to something else, but exists or happens in a different place or at a different time. If it has no parallel or is without parallel, it is not similar to anything else. (存在或发生在不同地点或不同时间的) 类似的事情 2. N-COUNT If there are parallels between two things, they are similar in some ways. 相似之处 3. V-T If one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and often seem to be connected. 与…同时发生 4. ADJ Parallel events or situations happen at the same time as one another, or are similar to one another. 同时发生的; 相似的 5. ADJ If two lines, two objects, or two lines of movement are parallel, they are the same distance apart along their whole length. 平行的 6. N-COUNT A parallel is an imaginary line round the earth that is parallel to the equator. Parallels are shown on maps. 纬线 [usu 'the' ord N]
n. 广州（广东省省会）
1. N-COUNT The upside of an unpleasant situation is the aspect of it that is more pleasant or positive. 好的方面

1. N-UNCOUNT The clarity of something such as a book or argument is its quality of being well explained and easy to understand. 明晰; 清楚 2. N-UNCOUNT Clarity is the ability to think clearly. (思路的) 清晰 3. N-UNCOUNT Clarity is the quality of being clear in outline or sound. (指轮廓、声音等) 清晰

1. PHRASAL VERB If something stands up to bad conditions, it is not damaged or harmed by them. 经受住 2. PHRASAL VERB If you stand up to someone, especially someone more powerful than you are, you defend yourself against their attacks or demands. 抵抗
1. N-UNCOUNT Shrinkage is a decrease in the size or amount of something. (体积或数量上的)缩减

1. N-UNCOUNT Administration is the range of activities connected with organizing and supervising the way that an organization or institution functions. 行政工作; 管理工作 2. N-UNCOUNT The administration of something is the process of organizing and supervising it. 监管 3. N-SING The administration of a company or institution is the group of people who organize and supervise it. 管理层; 行政部门 4. N-COUNT You can refer to a country's government as the administration; used especially in the United States. 政府 (尤用于美国)
1. N-COUNT Tulips are flowers that grow in the spring from bulbs, and have oval or pointed petals packed closely together. 郁金香

1. ADJ You use partial to refer to something that is not complete or whole. 部分的 2. ADJ If you are partial to something, you like it. 偏爱的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n/-ing] 3. ADJ Someone who is partial supports a particular person or thing, for example, in a competition or dispute, instead of being completely fair. 偏袒的 [v-link ADJ]
1. ADV You use purely to emphasize that the thing you are mentioning is the most important feature or that it is the only thing which should be considered. 纯粹地; 完全地 [ADV with cl/group] [强调]
1. ADJ If you describe an amount, quantity, or size as measly, you are critical of it because it is very small or inadequate. (数目、数量或大小)微不足道的; 少的可怜的 [非正式]

1. PHRASE You use in spite of to introduce a fact which makes the rest of the statement you are making seem surprising. 尽管 2. PHRASE If you do something in spite of yourself, you do it although you did not really intend to or expect to. 不由自主地 3. N-UNCOUNT If you do something cruel out of spite, you do it because you want to hurt or upset someone. 恶意 4. V-T If you do something cruel to spite someone, you do it in order to hurt or upset them. 存心伤害 [only to-inf]

1. V-T When someone finances something such as a project or a purchase, they provide the money that is needed to pay for them. 资助 2. N-UNCOUNT Finance is also a noun. 资助 3. N-UNCOUNT Finance is the commercial or government activity of managing money, debt, credit, and investment. 金融; 财政 [also N in pl] 4. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the amount of money that you have and how well it is organized as your finances. 财务状况 [also N in pl]

1. N-COUNT If you make a concession to someone, you agree to let them do or have something, especially in order to end an argument or conflict. 让步 2. N-COUNT A concession is a special right or privilege that is given to someone. 特许权 3. N-COUNT A concession is an arrangement where someone is given the right to sell a product or to run a business, especially in a building belonging to another business. (尤指在另一公司的建筑物内) 特许经营 [美国英语] [商业]
1. N-COUNT A jellyfish is a sea creature that has a clear soft body and can sting you. 水母
n. 合作，协作；[劳经] 协力
1. N-COUNT If you have a headache, you have a pain in your head. 头痛 2. N-COUNT If you say that something is a headache, you mean that it causes you difficulty or worry. 棘手的事
1. N the act of capitalizing 资本化 2. N the sum so derived 资本额

1. N-COUNT A spiral is a shape which winds around and around, with each curve above or outside the previous one. 螺旋形 2. ADJ Spiral is also an adjective. 螺旋形的 [ADJ n] 3. V-T/V-I If something spirals or is spiralled somewhere, it grows or moves in a spiral curve. 使…螺旋式生长或移动; 螺旋式生长或移动 4. N-COUNT Spiral is also a noun. 螺旋式运动 5. V-I If an amount or level spirals, it rises quickly and at an increasing rate. 加速上升 6. N-SING Spiral is also a noun. 加速上升 7. V-I If an amount or level spirals downward, it falls quickly and at an increasing rate. 加速下降 8. N-SING Spiral is also a noun. 加速下降
n. 内华达（美国州名）
1. V-T/V-I If you opt for something, or opt to do something, you choose it or decide to do it in preference to anything else. 选择

1. ADJ A peripheral activity or issue is one that is not very important compared with other activities or issues. 次要的 2. ADJ Peripheral areas of land are ones that are on the edge of a larger area. 周边的 3. N-COUNT Peripherals are devices that can be attached to computers. (计算机的) 外围设备 [计算机]
1. N-VAR Perils are great dangers. 极大危险 [正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT Competition is a situation in which two or more people or groups are trying to get something which not everyone can have. (为获取难得之物而进行的) 竞争 2. N-UNCOUNT Competition is an activity involving two or more companies, in which each company tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to the other companies' goods. (商业上的) 竞争 3. N-UNCOUNT The competition is the goods or services that a rival organization is selling. 竞争产品; 竞争服务 4. N-SING Thecompetition is the person or people you are competing with. 竞争对手 5. N-VAR A competition is an event in which many people take part in order to find out who is best at a particular activity. 竞赛
1. N-UNCOUNT If you are living in seclusion, you are in a quiet place away from other people. 与世隔绝
1. N-COUNT Your motive for doing something is your reason for doing it. 动机
1. N-FAMILY/N-TITLE Someone's uncle is the brother of their mother or father, or the husband of their aunt. 舅父; 伯父; 叔父; 姨父; 姑父

1. N-COUNT Your impression of a person or thing is what you think they are like, usually after having seen or heard them. Your impression of a situation is what you think is going on. 印象; 认识 2. N-SING If someone gives you a particular impression, they cause you to believe that something is the case, often when it is not. (常指错误的) 印象 3. N-COUNT An impression is an amusing imitation of someone's behaviour or way of talking, usually someone well-known. 滑稽模仿 4. N-COUNT An impression of an object is a mark or outline that it has left after being pressed hard onto a surface. 压印 5. PHRASE If someone or something makes an impression, they have a strong effect on people or a situation. 造成强烈影响 6. PHRASE If you are under the impression that something is the case, you believe that it is the case, usually when it is not actually the case. (通常是错误地) 认为

1. N-COUNT A commune is a group of people who live together and share many of their possessions and responsibilities. 群居团体 2. N intimate conversation; exchange of thoughts; communion 亲密的谈话; 互换想法; 交流 3. V to talk or converse intimately 亲密地交谈
1. N-UNCOUNT Protestantism is the set of Christian beliefs that are held by Protestants. 新教; 新教教义
1. N-UNCOUNT Morale is the amount of confidence and cheerfulness that a group of people have. 士气

1. N-UNCOUNT Geography is the study of the countries of the world and of such things as the land, seas, climate, towns, and population. 地理学 2. N-UNCOUNT The geography of a place is the way that features such as rivers, mountains, towns, or streets are arranged within it. 地形
n. 罗塞塔（城市名）
1. ADJ If you say that something is pricey, you mean that it is expensive. 价格高的 [非正式]
adv. 全体一致地
adv. 稀疏地；贫乏地
n. 科学（science的复数）
梁/亮；莱翁 n. (Leung)人名；(西)莱昂

1. V-T If resources such as money are earmarked for a particular purpose, they are reserved for that purpose. 留出 2. V-T If something has been earmarked for closure or disposal, for example, people have decided that it will be closed or got rid of. 确定 (关闭或放弃) [usu passive] 3. N-COUNT The earmark of something or someone is their most typical quality or feature. 标记; 特征 [美国英语] [with poss]

1. N-COUNT If you refer to a long speech by one person during a conversation as a monologue, you mean it prevents other people from talking or expressing their opinions. 长篇大论 2. N-VAR A monologue is a long speech which is spoken by one person as an entertainment, or as part of an entertainment such as a play. 独白; 独角戏

1. PHRASE If you talk about something in terms of something or in particular terms, you are specifying which aspect of it you are discussing or from what point of view you are considering it. 从…角度来看 2. PHRASE If you say something in particular terms, you say it using a particular type or level of language or using language which clearly shows your attitude. 以某种语言 3. N-COUNT A term is a word or expression with a specific meaning, especially one which is used in relation to a particular subject. 术语 4. V-T If you say that something is termed a particular thing, you mean that that is what people call it or that is their opinion of it. 把…称作 5. N-VAR A term is one of the periods of time that a school, college, or university divides the year into. 学期 6. N-COUNT A term is a period of time between two elections during which a particular party or government is in power. (政党或政府的) 任期 7. N-COUNT A term is a period of time that someone spends doing a particular job or in a particular place. (工作或居住) 期间 8. N-COUNT A
n. 哈瓦那（古巴城市）；哈瓦那雪茄烟

1. N-COUNT A throne is a decorative chair used by a king, queen, or emperor on important official occasions. (君王的) 宝座 2. N-SING You can talk about the throne as a way of referring to the position of being king, queen, or emperor. 王位; 皇位
adv. 随后，其后；后来
1. ABBREVIATION for prostatic specific antigen: an enzyme secreted by the prostate gland, increased levels of which are found in the blood of patients with cancer of the prostate 前列腺特异性抗原
1. N-COUNT A nightgown is the same as a . 同nightdress

1. N-UNCOUNT Religion is belief in a god or gods and the activities that are connected with this belief, such as praying or worshipping in a building such as a church or temple. 宗教 2. N-COUNT A religion is a particular system of belief in a god or gods and the activities that are connected with this system. (一种) 宗教
1. N-SING The harvest is the gathering of a crop. 收割 2. N-COUNT A harvest is the crop that is gathered in. 收成 3. V-T When you harvest a crop, you gather it in. 收割

1. ADJ If you describe someone or their ideas as imaginative, you are praising them because they are easily able to think of or create new or exciting things. 富于想像力的 [表赞许] 2. imaginatively ADV 富于想像力地 [ADV with v]

1. V-T If you say that someone is exploiting you, you think that they are treating you unfairly by using your work or ideas and giving you very little in return. 利用; 剥削 2. exploitation N-UNCOUNT 利用; 剥削 3. V-T If you say that someone is exploiting a situation, you disapprove of them because they are using it to gain an advantage for themselves, rather than trying to help other people or do what is right. 利用 (某种情势) [表不满] 4. exploitation N-SING (对某种情势的) 利用 5. V-T If you exploit something, you use it well, and achieve something or gain an advantage from it. 充分利用 6. V-T To exploit resources or raw materials means to develop them and use them for industry or commercial activities. 开发利用 (资源、原材料) 7. exploitation N-UNCOUNT (对资源、原材料的) 开发利用 8. N-COUNT If you refer to someone's exploits, you mean the brave, interesting, or amusing things that they have done. 英勇事迹
1. N-COUNT The Pontiff is the Pope. 教皇 [正式] [usu 'the' N]
1. V-T If someone in authority oversees a job or an activity, they make sure that it is done properly. 监督
1. ADJ Yemeni means belonging or relating to Yemen, or to its people or culture. 也门的; 也门人的; 也门文化的 2. N-COUNT A Yemeni is a Yemeni citizen, or a person of Yemeni origin. 也门人

1. N-UNCOUNT Jurisdiction is the power that a court of law or an official has to carry out legal judgments or to enforce laws. 司法权; 管辖权 [正式] 2. N-COUNT A jurisdiction is a state or other area in which a particular court and system of laws has authority. 管辖范围 [法律]
1. ADJ Something that is unsolicited has been given without being asked for and may not have been wanted. 未被请求的; 主动提供的
n. 伊斯兰教中马利基教派（强调获取穆斯林孩子抚养权的非穆斯林，不能给孩子伊斯兰所禁止的饮料和食物，如酒和猪肉）
1. N-COUNT An itinerary is a plan of a trip, including the route and the places that you will visit. 旅行计划
1. ADJ If you say that something is questionable, you mean that it is not completely honest, reasonable, or acceptable. 可疑的; 不合理的; 不能接受的 [正式]
1. ADJ An ongoing situation has been happening for quite a long time and seems likely to continue for some time in the future. 进行中的; 继续存在的
n. 研究人员，研究者（researcher的复数形式）
1. N-UNCOUNT Trigonometry is the branch of mathematics that is concerned with calculating the angles of triangles or the lengths of their sides. 三角学
1. V-T If a road or an area of ground has been paved, it has been covered with asphalt or concrete, so that it is suitable for walking or driving on. 铺 (路) [usu passive]
1. N-COUNT A loyalist is a person who remains firm in their support for a government or ruler. (统治者或政府的)忠诚支持者
1. ADJ A measuring cup or spoon is specially designed for measuring quantities, especially in cooking. (尤指烹饪用的杯或勺)测量用的; 称量用的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ A person or thing that is reliant on something needs it and often cannot live or work without it. 依赖的; 依靠的 [v-link ADJ 'on/upon' n]
1. N-COUNT A tycoon is a person who is successful in business and so has become rich and powerful. (工商界的) 大亨

1. ADV Ultimately means finally, after a long and often complicated series of events. 最终 2. ADV You use ultimately to indicate that what you are saying is the most important point in a discussion. 最重要地 [ADV with cl]
1. ADV If something changes substantially or is substantially different, it changes a lot or is very different. 很大程度地 [正式]
1. ADJ of, concerned with, or caused by the spatial arrangement of atoms in a molecule 空间排列的; 位的 [chem]

1. N-UNCOUNT If something has merit, it has good or worthwhile qualities. 优点; 价值 2. N-PLURAL The merits of something are its advantages or other good points. 好处 3. V-T If someone or something merits a particular action or treatment, they deserve it. 应受到 [正式]
1. N-COUNT The inhabitants of a place are the people who live there. 居民
n. 坦桑尼亚（东非国家）

1. N-COUNT A subcontinent is part of a larger continent, made up of a number of countries that form a large mass of land. The subcontinent is often used to refer to the area that contains India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. 次大陆 [usu sing]
n. 弗雷则河（加拿大西南部河流）；弗雷泽（男子名）
1. ADJ Corporate means relating to business corporations or to a particular business corporation. 公司的 [商业] [ADJ n]
1. ADJ Tropical means belonging to or typical of the tropics. 热带的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Tropical weather is hot and damp weather typical of the tropics. 湿热的

1. N-UNCOUNT Erosion is the gradual destruction and removal of rock or soil in a particular area by rivers, the sea, or the weather. 侵蚀 2. N-UNCOUNT The erosion of a person's authority, rights, or confidence is the gradual destruction or removal of them. 削弱 3. N-UNCOUNT The erosion of support, values, or money is a gradual decrease in its level or standard. 逐渐降低

1. N-COUNT A fragment of something is a small piece or part of it. 碎片; 片段 2. V-T/V-I If something fragments or is fragmented, it breaks or separates into small pieces or parts. 碎裂 3. fragmentation N-UNCOUNT 分裂
1. ADJ If you describe something as wide-ranging, you mean it deals with or affects a great variety of different things. 广泛的
adv. 以指数方式

1. N-COUNT A coalition is a government consisting of people from two or more political parties. 联合政府 2. N-COUNT A coalition is a group consisting of people from different political or social groups who are cooperating to achieve a particular aim. 联盟

1. N-VAR A battle is a violent fight between groups of people, especially one between military forces during a war. 战役 2. N-COUNT A battle is a conflict in which different people or groups compete in order to achieve success or control. 斗争; 较量 3. N-COUNT You can use battle to refer to someone's efforts to achieve something in spite of very difficult circumstances. 斗争 4. V-RECIP To battle with an opposing group means to take part in a fight or contest against them. You can also say that one group or person is battling another. 与…搏斗; 与…较量 5. V-T/V-I To battle means to try hard to do something in spite of very difficult circumstances. You can also battle something, or battle against something or with something. 与…作斗争; 斗争 6. PHRASE If one group or person battles it out with another, they take part in a fight or contest against each other until one of them wins or a definite result is reached. You can also say that two groups or two people battle it out. 战斗到底
1. PREP You use barring to indicate that the person, thing, or event that you are mentioning is an exception to your statement. 除…之外

1. ADJ Something that is concise says everything that is necessary without using any unnecessary words. 简洁的 2. concisely ADV 简洁地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ A concise edition of a book, especially a dictionary, is shorter than the original edition. 简明的 (版本) [ADJ n]

1. V-T/V-I If a liquid is diluted or dilutes, it is added to or mixes with water or another liquid, and becomes weaker. 稀释; 变淡 2. V-T If someone or something dilutes a belief, quality, or value, they make it weaker and less effective. 削弱 3. ADJ A dilute liquid is very thin and weak, usually because it has had water added to it. 稀释的
n. 克里斯蒂娜（电视剧中的人物）
1. N-COUNT Someone's accomplice is a person who helps them to commit a crime. 同犯
1. ADJ If something is inevitable, it is certain to happen and cannot be prevented or avoided. 必然发生的 2. N-SING The inevitable is something that is inevitable. 必然发生的事

1. V-I When you react to something that has happened to you, you behave in a particular way because of it. 作出反应 2. V-I If you react against someone's way of behaving, you deliberately behave in a different way because you do not like the way they behave. 反抗 3. V-I If you react to a substance such as a drug, or to something you have touched, you are affected unpleasantly or made ill by it. (对药物或其他所碰触的东西等) 起不良反应 4. V-RECIP When one chemical substance reacts with another, or when two chemical substances react, they combine chemically to form another substance. 起化学反应
1. ADJ Something that is spotted has a pattern of spots on it. 有斑点的 [oft ADJ 'with' n] 2. → see also spot
1. N-UNCOUNT Calculus is a branch of advanced mathematics which deals with variable quantities. 微积分学
1. V-T If someone perpetrates a crime or any other immoral or harmful act, they do it. 犯 (罪); 做 (不道德、有害之事) [正式] 2. perpetrator N-COUNT 罪犯; 作恶的人
1. N-UNCOUNT Longevity is long life. 长寿 [正式]

1. ADJ Something that is trim is neat, and attractive. 整洁美观的 2. ADJ If you describe someone's figure as trim, you mean that it is attractive because there is no extra fat on their body. 苗条的 [表赞许] 3. V-T If you trim something, for example, someone's hair, you cut off small amounts of it in order to make it look neater. 修剪 4. N-SING Trim is also a noun. 修剪 5. V-T If a government or other organization trims something such as a plan, policy, or amount, they reduce it slightly in extent or size. 削减 6. V-T If something such as a piece of clothing is trimmed with a type of material or design, it is decorated with it, usually along its edges. 镶边于 [usu passive] 7. N-VAR The trim on something such as a piece of clothing is a decoration, for example, along its edges, that is in a different colour or material. 镶边

1. N-COUNT A casualty is a person who is injured or killed in a war or in an accident. 死伤者 2. N-COUNT A casualty of a particular event or situation is a person or a thing that has suffered badly as a result of that event or situation. 受害者 3. N-UNCOUNT Casualty is the part of a hospital where people who have severe injuries or sudden illnesses are taken for emergency treatment. 急救室 [英国英语]

1. N (formerly) a title borne by medieval Chinese emperors and Mongol and Turkic rulers: usually added to a name (旧时)汗; 中古时期对中国帝王以及蒙古、土耳其对君主的尊称 2. N such a ruler 中古时期中国帝王以及蒙古、土耳的君主 1. N an inn in Turkey, certain Arab countries, etc; caravanserai 小客栈; 位于土耳其与阿拉伯国家

1. ADJ If you are susceptible to something or someone, you are very likely to be influenced by them. 易受…影响的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n] 2. ADJ If you are susceptible to a disease or injury, you are very likely to be affected by it. 易受 (伤) 的; 易患 (病) 的
adj. 喝醉了的；淡黄色的

1. V-T If you maintain something, you continue to have it, and do not let it stop or grow weaker. 保持 2. V-T If you say that someone maintains that something is true, you mean that they have stated their opinion strongly but not everyone agrees with them or believes them. 坚持说; 坚持认为 3. V-T If you maintain something at a particular rate or level, you keep it at that rate or level. 维持 4. V-T If you maintain a road, building, vehicle, or machine, you keep it in good condition by regularly checking it and repairing it when necessary. 维修; 保养 5. V-T If you maintain someone, you provide them with money and other things that they need. 供养

1. ADJ If you are unhappy, you are sad and depressed. 不幸福的 2. unhappily ADV 不快乐地 3. ADJ If you are unhappy about something, you are not pleased about it or not satisfied with it. 对…不高兴的; 对…不满意的 [v-link ADJ] 4. unhappiness N-UNCOUNT 不高兴; 不满意 5. ADJ An unhappy situation or choice is not satisfactory or desirable. 不令人满意的; 不理想的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place. 对应的人或物
1. ADJ Deviant behaviour or thinking is different from what people normally consider to be acceptable. (行为或思想) 反常的 2. deviance N-UNCOUNT 反常
1. V-T To license a person or activity means to give official permission for the person to do something or for the activity to take place. 准许 2. N-COUNT [美国英语] →see licence

1. V-T If you mount a campaign or event, you organize it and make it take place. 组织; 发动 2. V-I If something mounts, it increases in intensity. 增强 3. V-I If something mounts, it increases in quantity. 增加 4. PHRASAL VERB To mount up means the same as to . 增加 5. V-T If you mount the stairs or a platform, you go up the stairs or go up onto the platform. 登上 [正式] 6. V-T If you mount a horse or motorcycle, you climb on to it so that you can ride it. 骑上 7. V-T If you mount an object on something, you fix it there firmly. 安装 8. -mounted COMB in ADJ 安装在…上的 9. V-T If you mount an exhibition or display, you organize and present it. 举办 10. N-IN-NAMES Mount is used as part of the name of a mountain. (冠于山名之前) 山 11. N a backing, setting, or support onto which something is fixed (固定东西的)背板; 底座; 支架 12. → see also mounted
1. ADJ Maternity is used to describe things relating to the help and medical care given to a woman when she is pregnant and when she gives birth. 孕妇的; 产妇的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T If you can identify someone or something, you are able to recognize them or distinguish them from others. 识别 2. V-T If you identify someone or something, you name them or say who or what they are. 确认 3. V-T If you identify something, you discover or notice its existence. 发现; 察觉 4. V-T If a particular thing identifies someone or something, it makes them easy to recognize, by making them different in some way. 是…的标志; 使易于辨认 5. V-I If you identify with someone or something, you feel that you understand them or their feelings and ideas. 理解; 认同 6. V-T If you identify one person or thing with another, you think that they are closely associated or involved in some way. 认为…密切相关

1. N-COUNT In a university or college, a tutorial is a regular meeting between a tutor or professor and one or several students, for discussion of a subject that is being studied. (大学里师生之间定期的) 辅导班 2. N-COUNT A tutorial is part of a book or a computer program which helps you learn something step-by-step without a teacher. 学习指南; 使用说明 3. ADJ Tutorial means relating to a tutor or tutors, especially one at a university or college. 助教的 [ADJ n]
1. N-UNCOUNT Cannabis is the hemp plant when it is used as a drug. 大麻
n. 肯尼亚（东非国家）

1. V-T If you describe a person, object, event, or situation, you say what they are like or what happened. 描述 2. V-T If a person describes someone or something as a particular thing, he or she believes that they are that thing and says so. 讲成; 称作
1. ADJ Leafy trees and plants have lots of leaves on them. 多叶的 2. ADJ You say that a place is leafy when there are lots of trees and plants there. 树木茂密的

1. V-T If you divest yourself of something that you own or are responsible for, you get rid of it or stop being responsible for it. 抛弃 [正式] 2. V-T If something or someone is divested of a particular quality, they lose that quality or it is taken away from them. 从...中去除; 被剥夺(...的能力) [正式]
1. N-VAR Your intuition or your intuitions are unexplained feelings that something is true even when you have no evidence or proof of it. 直觉
n. (Rubio)人名；(意、葡)鲁比奥；(西)鲁维奥

1. N-COUNT A tangle of something is a mass of it twisted together in a messy way. 乱糟糟的一团 2. V-T/V-I If something is tangled or tangles, it becomes twisted together in a messy way. 使缠结; 缠结 3. V to come into conflict; contend 与...打架; 争执
n. 遗弃；开小差；逃亡

1. V-T/V-I If you travel, you go from one place to another, often to a place that is far away. 旅行 2. N-UNCOUNT Travel is the activity of travelling. 旅行 3. V-T If you travel the world, the country, or the area, you go to many different places in the world or in a particular country or area. 游历 4. V-I When light or sound from one place reaches another, you say that it travels to the other place. (光或声音) 传播 5. V-I When news becomes known by people in different places, you can say that it travels to them. (消息) 流传 6. N-PLURAL Someone's travels are the trips that they make to places a long way from their home. 旅游 7. PHRASE If you travel light, you travel without taking much luggage. 轻装旅行

1. V-T If something tends to happen, it usually happens or it often happens. 倾向于; 往往会 2. V-I If you tend toward a particular characteristic, you often display that characteristic. 趋向… 3. V-T You can say that you tend to think something when you want to give your opinion, but do not want it to seem too forceful or definite. 倾向于 (认为) [含糊] 4. V to attend (to) 照顾; 照管 5. V to care for 护理 6. V to handle or control 处理; 控制

1. N-VAR A theory is a formal idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something. 理论 2. N-COUNT If you have a theory about something, you have your own opinion about it which you cannot prove but which you think is true. 观点 3. N-UNCOUNT The theory of a practical subject or skill is the set of rules and principles that form the basis of it. 基础理论 4. PHRASE You use in theory to say that although something is supposed to be true or to happen in the way stated, it may not in fact be true or happen in that way. 从理论上说

1. N-COUNT Something or someone that is an asset is considered useful or helps a person or organization to be successful. 资本 2. N-PLURAL The assets of a company or a person are all the things that they own. 资产 [商业]

1. N-VAR If you refer to someone's disappearance, you are referring to the fact that nobody knows where they have gone. 失踪 2. N-COUNT If you refer to the disappearance of an object, you are referring to the fact that it has been lost or stolen. 丢失 3. N-UNCOUNT The disappearance of a type of thing, person, or animal is a process in which it becomes less common and finally no longer exists. 绝迹

1. N-COUNT The residents of a house or area are the people who live there. 居民 2. ADJ Someone who is resident in a country or a town lives there. 居住的 [v-link ADJ] 3. N-COUNT A resident or a resident doctor is a doctor who is receiving a period of specialized training in a hospital after completing his or her internship. 住院医师 [美国英语]
1. V-T To optimize a plan, system, or machine means to arrange or design it so that it operates as smoothly and efficiently as possible. 使优化 [正式]
n. 恩斯特（人名）；艾伦斯特（人名）

1. ADJ You use tremendous to emphasize how strong a feeling or quality is, or how large an amount is. 非常的; 巨大的 [强调] 2. tremendously ADV 非常地; 极大地 3. ADJ You can describe someone or something as tremendous when you think they are very good or very impressive. 极好的; 精彩的
1. N-SING In the grammar of some languages, the nominative or the nominative case is the case used for a noun when it is the subject of a verb. Compare . 主格 ['the' N]
1. N-UNCOUNT Telephony is a system of sending voice signals using electronic equipment. 电话通讯系统
1. ADJ You use wretched to describe someone or something that you dislike or feel angry with. 讨厌的 [非正式] [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Someone who feels wretched feels very unhappy. 极不愉快的 [正式]

1. V-T/V-I To divert vehicles or travellers means to make them follow a different route or go to a different destination than they originally intended. You can also say that someone or something diverts from a particular route or to a particular place. 使改道; 改道 2. V-T To divert money or resources means to cause them to be used for a different purpose. 转移 3. V-T To divert a phone call means to send it to a different number or place from the one that was dialled by the person making the call. 转接 (电话) 4. V-T If you say that someone diverts your attention from something important or serious, you disapprove of them behaving or talking in a way that stops you thinking about it. 转移…的注意力 [表不满]

1. N-COUNT A sound is something that you hear. 声音 2. N a relatively narrow channel between two larger areas of sea or between an island and the mainland 海峡 3. N-UNCOUNT Sound is energy that travels in waves through air, water, or other substances, and can be heard. 声能 4. N-SING Thesound on a television, radio, or CD player is what you hear coming from the machine. Its loudness can be controlled. (可调大小声的) 播音 5. N-COUNT A singer's or band's sound is the distinctive quality of their music. 音乐风格 6. V-T/V-I If something such as a horn or a bell sounds or if you sound it, it makes a noise. 使发出声音; 发出声音 7. V-T If you sound a warning, you publicly give it. If you sound a note of caution or optimism, you say publicly that you are cautious or optimistic. 宣告 8. V to seek to discover (someone's views, etc), as by questioning 通过询问了解(某人的观点) 9. V to measure the depth of (a well, the sea, etc) by lowering a plumb line, by sonar, etc 测量(井、海等的)深度 10. V-LINK When you are describing a noise, you can talk about the way
1. N-UNCOUNT Defamation is the damaging of someone's good reputation by saying something bad and untrue about them. 诽谤 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A handbill is a small printed notice which is used to advertise a particular company, service, or event. 传单

1. N-COUNT A bowler is someone who plays bowls or goes bowling. 保龄球手 2. N-COUNT The bowler in a sport such as cricket is the player who is bowling the ball. 投球手 3. N a stiff felt hat with a rounded crown and narrow curved brim 圆顶硬呢帽 (US and Canadian name derby)
1. ADJ Recondite areas of knowledge or learning are difficult to understand, and not many people know about them. 深奥的 [正式] [usu ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A valedictorian is the student who has the highest grade point average in their class when they graduate from high school or college, and who gives a speech at their graduation ceremony. 致告别辞的最优秀毕业生 [美国英语]

1. N-COUNT A dose of medicine or a drug is a measured amount of it which is intended to be taken at one time. 一次用量 2. V-T If you dose a person or animal with medicine, you give them an amount of it. 给 (药) 3. PHRASAL VERB Dose up means the same as . 给 (药)
1. V to extract (the essence or active principle) from (a medicinal or similar substance) by boiling 煎煮(药物等)

1. N-VAR An alignment is support for a particular group, especially in politics, or for a side in a quarrel or struggle. 结盟 2. N-UNCOUNT The alignment of something is its position in relation to something else or to its correct position. 位置
1. ADJ Metric means relating to the metric system. 公制的
过去进行时

1. N-COUNT The trajectory of a moving object is the path that it follows as it moves. 抛物线 [with supp] 2. N-COUNT The trajectory of something such as a person's career is the course that it follows over time. 轨迹 [with supp]

1. N-VAR The withdrawal of something is the act or process of removing it, or ending it. 去除; 结束 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Someone's withdrawal from an activity or an organization is their decision to stop taking part in it. 退出 3. N-COUNT A withdrawal is an amount of money that you take from your bank account. 所取钱款 4. N-UNCOUNT Withdrawal is the period during which someone feels ill after they have stopped taking a drug they were addicted to. 戒毒过程
adj. 供应快餐的 n. 快餐食品
1. N-VAR A whim is a wish to do or have something that seems to have no serious reason or purpose behind it, and often occurs suddenly. 突发的念头

1. ADJ Someone who is extravagant spends more money than they can afford or uses more of something than is reasonable. 奢侈的; 浪费的 2. extravagantly ADV 奢侈地; 浪费地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ Something that is extravagant costs more money than you can afford or uses more of something than is reasonable. 贵不可及的; 耗费过多的 4. extravagantly ADV 贵不可及地; 耗费过多地 [ADV adj/-ed] 5. ADJ Extravagant behaviour is extreme behaviour that is often done for a particular effect. 过分的 (行为) 6. extravagantly ADV 过分地 7. ADJ Extravagant claims or ideas are unrealistic or impractical. 不切实际的 [表不满]
1. ADJ If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious. 有洞察力的 [表赞许]
1. N-UNCOUNT The firepower of an army, ship, tank, or aircraft is the amount of ammunition it can fire. 火力
1. ADJ artful and scheming; conniving; crafty 狡诈的; 狡猾的; 诡计多端的

1. N-COUNT/N-TITLE/N-VOC A nurse is a person whose job is to care for people who are ill. 护士 2. V-T If you nurse someone, you care for them when they are ill. 护理 3. V-T If you nurse an illness or injury, you allow it to get better by resting as much as possible. 调治 4. V-T If you nurse an emotion or desire, you feel it strongly for a long time. 怀有

1. ADJ A turbulent time, place, or relationship is one in which there is a lot of change, confusion, and disorder. 动荡的 2. ADJ Turbulent water or air contains strong currents which change direction suddenly. (水流或气体) 湍急的

1. ADJ Something that is slight is very small in degree or quantity. 轻微的; 细微的 2. ADJ A slight person has a fairly thin and delicate looking body. 瘦小的; 纤细的 3. slightly ADV 瘦小地; 纤细地 [ADV -ed] 4. V-T If you are slighted, someone does or says something that insults you by treating you as if your views or feelings are not important. 轻蔑; 怠慢 [usu passive] 5. N-COUNT Slight is also a noun. 轻视; 冷落 6. PHRASE You use in the slightest to emphasize a negative statement. (用于加强否定的陈述语气) 一点也 [强调]
1. V-T/V-I If you enrol or are enrolled at an institution or in a class, you officially join it. 注册

1. N-UNCOUNT Your status is your social or professional position. 社会地位; 职业地位 2. N-UNCOUNT Status is the importance and respect that someone has among the public or a particular group. (在公众中或某一团体中的) 威望; 地位 3. N-UNCOUNT The status of something is the importance that people give it. 重要性 4. N-UNCOUNT A particular status is an official description that says what category a person, organization, or place belongs to, and gives them particular rights or advantages. 身份 5. N-UNCOUNT The status of something is its state of affairs at a particular time. 状况

1. V-T To isolate a person or organization means to cause them to lose their friends or supporters. 孤立 2. isolated ADJ 孤立的 3. V-T If you isolate yourself, or if something isolates you, you become physically or socially separated from other people. 使孤立; 孤立 4. V-T If you isolate something such as an idea or a problem, you separate it from others that it is connected with, so that you can concentrate on it or consider it on its own. 单独考虑 5. V-T To isolate a substance means to obtain it by separating it from other substances using scientific processes. 使离析 [技术] 6. V-T To isolate a sick person or animal means to keep them apart from other people or animals, so that their illness does not spread. 隔离 7. isolation N-UNCOUNT 隔离 [oft N n]
1. ADJ Something that is overblown makes something seem larger, more important, or more significant than it really is. 夸张的

1. N-VAR If you are given promotion or a promotion in your job, you are given a more important job or rank in the organization that you work for. 晋升 2. N-VAR A promotion is an attempt to make a product or event popular or successful, especially by advertising. 促销; 推广 [商业] 3. → see also promote
