1. N-UNCOUNT Heating is the process of heating a building or room, considered especially from the point of view of how much this costs. 供暖 2. N-UNCOUNT Heating is the system and equipment that is used to heat a building. 供暖系统和设备 3. → see also central heating
1. N-COUNT If you do or say something as an afterthought, you do or say it after something else as an addition, perhaps without careful thought. 事后的想法; 马后炮 [usu sing, usu 'a' N]
1. N-COUNT An amputee is someone who has had all or part of an arm or a leg amputated. 被截肢者

1. ADJ A brisk activity or action is done quickly and in an energetic way. 轻快的 2. briskly ADV 轻快地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If trade or business is brisk, things are being sold very quickly and a lot of money is being made. (买卖、生意) 兴隆的 4. briskly ADV 兴隆地 [ADV after v] 5. ADJ If the weather is brisk, it is cold and fresh. 寒冷而清新的 6. ADJ Someone who is brisk behaves in a busy, confident way which shows that they want to get things done quickly. 干脆利索的 7. briskly ADV 脆利索地 [ADV with v]

1. ADJ A crippling illness or disability is one that severely damages your health or your body. 严重损害健康的; 致残的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ If you say that an action, policy, or situation has a crippling effect on something, you mean it has a very serious, harmful effect. 极有害的
1. N → a variant spelling of Immanuel

1. ADJ A fact, situation, or experience that is negative is unpleasant, depressing, or harmful. 负面的; 消极的 2. negatively ADV 负面地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If someone is negative or has a negative attitude, they consider only the bad aspects of a situation, rather than the good ones. 消极的; 持否定态度的 4. negatively ADV 消极地 5. ADJ A negative reply or decision indicates the answer "no." 否定的 6. negatively ADV 否定地 [ADV after v] 7. N-COUNT A negative is a word, expression, or gesture that means "no" or "not." 否定词; 表示否定的动作或姿态 8. ADJ In grammar, a negative clause contains a word such as "not," "never," or "no one." (语法中) 含否定词的 9. ADJ If a medical test or scientific test is negative, it shows no evidence of the medical condition or substance that you are looking for. (医检、试验等) 呈阴性的 10. HIV negative →see HIV 11. N-COUNT In photography, a negative is an image that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark. Negatives are made from camera film, and are used to print photographs. 底片 12. ADJ A negative charge or curre

1. ADJ If you describe someone or something as peculiar, you think that they are strange or unusual, sometimes in an unpleasant way. 不寻常的; 古怪的 2. peculiarly ADV 不寻常地; 奇怪地 3. ADJ If something is peculiar to a particular thing, person, or situation, it belongs or relates only to that thing, person, or situation. 特有的; 独特的 4. peculiarly ADV 特有地; 独特地
1. N-COUNT A farmer is a person who owns or manages a farm. 农场主
adv. 明智地；聪明地；精明地 n. (Wisely)人名；(英)怀斯利
1. N-COUNT A monastery is a building or collection of buildings in which monks live. 修道院

1. N-SING Someone's advocacy of a particular action or plan is their act of recommending it publicly. 倡议 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT An advocacy group or organization is one that tries to influence the decisions of a government or other authority. 游说 (组织) [美国英语]
n. 马里兰（美国州名）
1. N-COUNT An organism is an animal or plant, especially one that is so small that you cannot see it without using a microscope. 生物; 微生物

1. N-MASS Oil is a smooth, thick liquid that is used as a fuel and for making the parts of machines move smoothly. Oil is found underground. 石油 2. V-T If you oil something, you put oil onto or into it, for example, to make it work smoothly or to protect it. 给某物上油 3. N-MASS Oil is a smooth, thick liquid made from plants and is often used for cooking. 植物油 4. N-MASS Oil is a smooth, thick liquid, often with a pleasant smell, that you rub into your skin or add to your bath. 润肤油; 沐浴液 5. → see also crude oil, olive oil 6. to burn the midnight oil →see midnight
1. ADJ If something is compulsory, you must do it or accept it, because it is the law or because someone in a position of authority says you must. 强制性的

1. N-UNCOUNT A message of condolence is a message in which you express your sympathy for someone because one of their friends or relatives has died recently. 吊唁 2. N-PLURAL When you offer or express your condolences to someone, you express your sympathy for them because one of their friends or relatives has died recently. 哀悼
1. ADJ Timid people are shy, nervous, and lack courage or confidence in themselves. 羞怯的 2. timidity N-UNCOUNT 羞怯
1. N-COUNT-COLL A congress is a large meeting that is held to discuss ideas and policies. 代表大会

1. ADJ If something written or spoken is vague, it does not explain or express things clearly. 含糊的 2. vaguely ADV 含糊地 3. ADJ If you have a vague memory or idea of something, the memory or idea is not clear. 模糊的 4. vaguely ADV 模糊地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ If you are vague about something, you deliberately do not tell people much about it. 含糊其辞的 6. ADJ If something such as a feeling is vague, you experience it only slightly. (感觉等) 轻微的 7. ADJ A vague shape or outline is not clear and is therefore not easy to see. 模糊不清的
1. V-T If you simplify something, you make it easier to understand or you remove the things which make it complex. 简化
1. ADJ If a person or organization is cash-strapped, they do not have enough money to buy or pay for the things they want or need. 资金短缺的 [journalism] [usu ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A streak is a long stripe or mark on a surface which contrasts with the surface because it is a different colour. 条纹 2. V-T If something streaks a surface, it makes long stripes or marks on the surface. 在…上留下条痕 3. N-COUNT If someone has a streak of a particular type of behaviour, they sometimes behave in that way. 性格特征 [usu sing, with supp] 4. V-I If something or someone streaks somewhere, they move there very quickly. 疾驰 5. V to run naked through a crowd of people in a public place in order to shock or amuse them 裸奔 [非正式] 6. N-COUNT A winning streak or a lucky streak is a continuous series of successes, for example in gambling or sports. A losing streak or an unlucky streak is a series of failures or losses. (赌博或体育比赛中的) 运气

1. N-COUNT Lead time is the time between the original design or idea for a particular product and its actual production. 从最初设计到投产的时间 [商业] 2. N-COUNT Lead time is the period of time that it takes for goods to be delivered after someone has ordered them. 从订货到交货的时间 [商业]

1. N-VAR Your imagination is the ability that you have to form pictures or ideas in your mind of things that are new and exciting, or things that you have not experienced. 想像力 2. N-COUNT Your imagination is the part of your mind that allows you to form pictures or ideas of things that do not necessarily exist in real life. 想像 3. PHRASE If you say that someone or something captured your imagination, you mean that you thought they were interesting or exciting when you saw them or heard them for the first time. 引起某人的兴趣 4. not by any stretch of the imagination →see stretch

1. N-VAR An impulse is a sudden desire to do something. 冲动 2. N-COUNT An impulse is a short electrical signal that is sent along a wire or nerve or through the air, usually as one of a series. 脉冲 3. ADJ An impulse buy or impulse purchase is something that you decide to buy when you see it, although you had not planned to buy it. 一时心血来潮的 [ADJ n] 4. PHRASE If you do something on impulse, you suddenly decide to do it, without planning it. 凭一时冲动
1. N-COUNT A translation is a piece of writing or speech that has been put into a different language. 译文 [also 'in' N] 2. → see also translate

1. ADJ Norwegian means belonging or relating to Norway, or to its people, language, or culture. 挪威的; 挪威人的; 挪威语的; 挪威文化的 2. N-COUNT A Norwegian is a person who comes from Norway. 挪威人 3. N-UNCOUNT Norwegian is the language spoken by people who live in Norway. 挪威语

1. V-T/V-I If you resign from a job or position, you formally announce that you are leaving it. 辞职 2. V-T If you resign yourself to an unpleasant situation or fact, you accept it because you realize that you cannot change it. 使屈从 3. → see also resigned
1. N-UNCOUNT Revenge involves hurting or punishing someone who has hurt or harmed you. 报复 2. V-T If you revenge yourself on someone who has hurt you, you hurt them in return. 报复 [书面]

1. V-T/V-I When you chew food, you use your teeth to break it up in your mouth so that it becomes easier to swallow. 咀嚼 2. V-T If you chew gum or tobacco, you keep biting it and moving it around your mouth to taste the flavour of it. You do not swallow it. 嚼 (口香糖、烟) 3. V-T If you chew your lips or your fingernails, you keep biting them because you are nervous. 咬 (嘴唇、手指) 4. V-T/V-I If a person or animal chews an object or chews on it, they bite it with their teeth. 咬
1. ADJ Sterling means very good in quality; used to describe someone's work or character. (工作或品格) 优秀的 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Sterling is the money system of Great Britain. 英镑
n. 迈阿密（美国美国佛罗里达州东南部港市）
1. N-COUNT A voucher is a ticket or piece of paper that can be used instead of money to pay for something. 代币券; 购物券

1. N-COUNT If you get a scholarship to a school or university, your studies are paid for by the school or university or by some other organization. 奖学金 2. N-UNCOUNT Scholarship is serious academic study and the knowledge that is obtained from it. 学术研究; 学问成就

1. N-VAR A person's gender is the fact that they are male or female. 性别 2. N-COUNT You can refer to all male people or all female people as a particular gender. 性 3. N-VAR In grammar, the gender of a noun, pronoun, or adjective is whether it is masculine, feminine, or neuter. A word's gender can affect its form and behaviour. In English, only personal pronouns such as "she," reflexive pronouns such as "itself," and possessive determiners such as "his" have gender. (语法上的) 性

1. V-T If you breach an agreement, a law, or a promise, you break it. 违反 2. N-VAR A breach of an agreement, a law, or a promise is an act of breaking it. 违反 3. N-COUNT A breach in a relationship is a serious disagreement which often results in the relationship ending. (关系中的) 裂痕 [正式] 4. V-T If someone or something breaches a barrier, they make an opening in it, usually leaving it weakened or destroyed. 使破开 [正式] 5. V-T If you breach someone's security or their defences, you manage to get through and attack an area that is heavily guarded and protected. 攻破 (某人的防范) 6. N-COUNT Breach is also a noun. 攻破

1. N-COUNT Dissidents are people who disagree with and criticize their government, especially because it is undemocratic. 异议分子 2. ADJ Dissident people disagree with or criticize their government or a powerful organization they belong to. 持不同政见的 [ADJ n]
1. N a construction toy consisting of plastic bricks and other standardized components that fit together with studs 乐高; 塑料拼装玩具品牌 [trademark]
n. (Nieto)人名；(意、西、葡)涅托

1. V-T When you greet someone, you say "Hello" or shake hands with them. 向…问好; 迎接 2. V-T If something is greeted in a particular way, people react to it in that way. 对…作出反应 [usu passive] 3. V to weep; lament 哭泣

1. N-COUNT A ballot is a secret vote in which people select a candidate in an election, or express their opinion about something. 无记名投票 2. N-COUNT A ballot is a piece of paper on which you indicate your choice or opinion in a secret vote. 无记名选票 3. V-T If you ballot a group of people, you find out what they think about a subject by organizing a secret vote. 组织…进行秘密投票
vt. 担保；证明；传出庭作证 vi. 保证；证明；确定
1. N-VAR Croissants are bread rolls in the shape of a crescent that are eaten for breakfast. 牛角面包

1. N-UNCOUNT Sailing is the activity or sport of sailing boats. 驾船; 帆船运动 2. N-COUNT Sailings are trips made by a ship carrying passengers. 水运航班 3. PHRASE If you say that a task was not all plain sailing, you mean that it was not very easy. 轻而易举; 一帆风顺
1. V-T If you omit something, you do not include it in an activity or piece of work, deliberately or accidentally. 删节; 省略; 遗漏 2. V-T If you omit to do something, you do not do it. 未 (做) [正式]

1. N-COUNT A queue is a list of computer tasks which will be done in order. 队列 (指等待计算机逐个处理的任务列表) [计算机] 2. V-T To queue a number of computer tasks means to arrange them to be done in order. 将 (计算机任务) 排序 [计算机] 3. N-COUNT A queue is a line of people or vehicles that are waiting for something. (等候的) 一队人; 一列车辆 [英国英语] 4. N-COUNT If you say there is a queue of people who want to do or have something, you mean that a lot of people are waiting for an opportunity to do it or have it. 众多 [英国英语] 5. V-I When people queue, they stand in a line waiting for something. 排队等候 [英国英语] 6. PHRASAL VERB Queue up means the same as . 排队等候
1. N ACRONYM for North American Free Trade Agreement 北美自由贸易协定
abbr. 异步，非同步（asynchronous）
n. 多伦多（加拿大城市）
1. N-UNCOUNT If you talk about the sanctity of something, you mean that it is very important and must be treated with respect. 神圣
1. N-COUNT A plumber is a person whose job is to connect and repair things such as water and drainage pipes, bathtubs, and toilets. 管子工; 水暖工

1. N-VAR Depression is a mental state in which you are sad and feel that you cannot enjoy anything, because your situation is so difficult and unpleasant. 抑郁 2. N-COUNT A depression is a time when there is very little economic activity, which causes a lot of unemployment and poverty. 萧条期 3. N-COUNT A depression in a surface is an area which is lower than the parts surrounding it. 洼地 4. N-COUNT A depression is a mass of air that has a low pressure and that often causes rain. 低气压

1. N-COUNT-COLL A panel is a small group of people who are chosen to do something, for example, to discuss something in public or to make a decision. 专门小组 2. N-COUNT A panel is a flat rectangular piece of wood or other material that forms part of a larger object such as a door. (门等的) 镶板; 嵌板 3. N-COUNT A control panel or instrument panel is a board or surface that contains switches and controls to operate a machine or piece of equipment. (控制) 面板; (仪表) 板 [n N]

1. V-T If you initiate something, you start it or cause it to happen. 使开始; 发起 2. V-T If you initiate someone into something, you introduce them to a particular skill or type of knowledge and teach them about it. 使初步了解; 传授 3. V-T If someone is initiated into something such as a religion, secret society, or social group, they become a member of it by taking part in special ceremonies. (常通过特殊仪式) 使加入

1. N-COUNT A defect is a fault or imperfection in a person or thing. 缺陷 2. V-I If you defect, you leave your country, political party, or other group, and join an opposing country, party, or group. 背叛 3. defection N-VAR 背叛

1. V-I If you resort to a course of action that you do not really approve of, you adopt it because you cannot see any other way of achieving what you want. 不得不求助 2. N-UNCOUNT If you achieve something without resort to a particular course of action, you succeed without carrying out that action. To have resort to a particular course of action means to have to do that action in order to achieve something. 诉诸 3. PHRASE If you do something as a last resort, you do it because you can find no other way of getting out of a difficult situation or of solving a problem. 作为最后手段 4. N-COUNT A resort is a place where a lot of people spend their holiday. (度假) 胜地
1. ADJ Someone who is profligate spends too much money or uses too much of something. 挥霍的; 浪费的 [正式]
n. 西奈

1. ADJ Manual work is work in which you use your hands or your physical strength rather than your mind. 手工的; 靠劳力的 2. ADJ Manual is used to talk about movements which are made by someone's hands. 用手的 [正式] [ADJ n] 3. ADJ Manual means operated by hand, rather than by electricity or a motor. 用手操作的 [ADJ n] 4. manually ADV 用手操作地 [ADV with v] 5. N-COUNT A manual is a book which tells you how to do something or how a piece of machinery works. 使用手册
n. 火山爆发；出疹（eruption的复数形式）
1. N-VAR A hypothesis is an idea which is suggested as a possible explanation for a particular situation or condition, but which has not yet been proved to be correct. 假设 [正式]
1. N-VAR Deception is the act of deceiving someone or the state of being deceived by someone. 欺骗; 受骗
1. ADJ Judicial means relating to the legal system and to judgments made in a court of law. 司法的; 审判的 [ADJ n] 2. judicially ADV 司法地; 审判地 [ADV with v]
1. N a trifling amount of money 少量的钱 [slang]
1. N-SING The underworld in a city is the organized crime there and the people who are involved in it. 黑社会

1. V-T If you neglect someone or something, you fail to take care of them properly. 疏于照管 2. N-UNCOUNT Neglect is also a noun. 疏于照管 3. V-T If you neglect someone or something, you fail to give them the amount of attention that they deserve. 忽视 4. neglected ADJ 被忽视的 5. V-T If you neglect to do something that you ought to do or neglect your duty, you fail to do it. 疏忽
1. N-VAR If there is a precedent for an action or event, it has happened before, and this can be regarded as an argument for doing it again. 先例 [正式]

1. V-T If a doctor prescribes medicine or treatment for you, he or she tells you what medicine or treatment to have. 开 (药、处方) 2. V-T If a person or set of laws or rules prescribes an action or duty, they state that it must be carried out. 规定 [正式]

1. V-T/V-I If you clutch at something or clutch something, you hold it tightly, usually because you are afraid or anxious. (因为害怕或焦虑而) 抓牢 2. N-PLURAL If someone is in another person's clutches, that person has captured them or has power over them. 掌控 3. N-COUNT In a vehicle, the clutch is the pedal that you press before you change gear. 离合器踏板 4. N-COUNT a hatch of eggs laid by a particular bird or laid in a single nest 一窝蛋 5. to clutch at straws →see straw

1. PHRASAL VERB If people put up a wall, building, tent, or other structure, they construct it so that it is upright. 建造 2. PHRASAL VERB If you put up a poster or notice, you attach it to a wall or board. 张贴 3. PHRASAL VERB To put up resistance to something means to resist it. 进行 (抵抗) 4. PHRASAL VERB If you put up money for something, you provide the money that is needed to pay for it. 提供 5. PHRASAL VERB To put up the price of something means to cause it to increase. 提高 (价格) 6. PHRASAL VERB If a person or hotel puts you up or if you put up somewhere, you stay there for one or more nights. 留宿 7. PHRASAL VERB If a political party puts up a candidate in an election or if the candidate puts up, the candidate takes part in the election. 提名 (为选举侯选人); 参加选举
1. V-T If someone harries you, they keep bothering you or trying to get something from you. (不断)骚扰; 纠缠 2. harried ADJ
1. ADJ (of a muscle) attached to the bone that it moves (肌肉)附着的 [anatomy]

1. N-COUNT A bully is someone who uses their strength or power to hurt or frighten other people. 恃强凌弱者 2. V-T If someone bullies you, they use their strength or power to hurt or frighten you. 欺负 3. bullying N-UNCOUNT 欺凌行为 4. V-T If someone bullies you into something, they make you do it by using force or threats. 威逼 5. INTERJ well done! bravo! 真棒 (Also bully for you) [非正式] 6. N any of various small freshwater fishes of the genera Gobiomorphus and Philynodon of New Zealand (新西兰)塘鲤 (Also called (NZ) pakoko, titarakura, toitoi)

1. PHRASAL VERB If you mix up two things or people, you confuse them, so that you think that one of them is the other one. 混淆 2. PHRASAL VERB If you mix up a number of things, you put things of different kinds together or place things so that they are not in order. 把不同类的事物混放在一起; 弄乱 3. → see also mixed up
adj. 缺钱，手头紧

1. V-T To justify a decision, action, or idea means to show or prove that it is reasonable or necessary. 证明…有理 2. V-T To justify printed text means to adjust the spaces between the words so that each line of type is exactly the same length. 使 (文本) 对齐 3. → see also left-justify
主持开会
n. 研究员

1. V-T To expose something that is usually hidden means to uncover it so that it can be seen. 使显露 2. V-T To expose a person or situation means to reveal that they are bad or immoral in some way. 揭露 3. V-T If someone is exposed to something dangerous or unpleasant, they are put in a situation in which it might affect them. 使暴露于 (危险或令人不快的境地) 4. V-T If someone is exposed to an idea or feeling, usually a new one, they are given experience of it, or introduced to it. 使体验 (观念、情感); 引入 (观念、情感)
n. 克拉克（男子名） n. (Clark)人名；(瑞典、葡、西、芬、斐、意、德、匈、英、土)克拉克
1. ADJ Something that is depressing makes you feel sad and disappointed. 令人沮丧的 2. depressingly ADV 令人沮丧地

1. N-COUNT A buyer is a person who is buying something or who intends to buy it. 买主 2. N-COUNT A buyer is a person who works for a large shop deciding what goods will be bought from manufacturers to be sold in the shop. 采购员

1. V-T When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it. 提炼 [usu passive] 2. refining N-UNCOUNT 提炼 3. V-T If something such as a process, theory, or machine is refined, it is improved by having small changes made to it. 完善 [usu passive]
1. N an encysted zygote of sporozoan protozoans that undergoes sporogony to produce infective sporozoites 卵囊
1. ADJ If you have preconceived ideas about something, you have already formed an opinion about it before you have enough information or experience. (观点)事先形成的; 先入为主的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT-COLL Tribe is sometimes used to refer to a group of people of the same race, language, and customs, especially in a developing country. Some people disapprove of this use. 部落
n. 卡内基（姓氏）

1. N-COUNT A quest is a long and difficult search for something. (长久而艰难的) 搜寻; 探求 [LITERARY, HUMOROUS] 2. PHRASE If you go in quest of something, you try to find or obtain it. 寻找; 寻求 3. V-I If you are questing for something, you are searching for it. 搜寻; 探求 [文学性] [usu cont]
1. N-COUNT A contender is someone who takes part in a competition. 竞争者 [journalism]

1. N-COUNT A filling is a small amount of metal or plastic that a dentist puts in a hole in a tooth to prevent further decay. (补牙用的) 填料 2. N-MASS The filling in something such as a cake, pie, or sandwich is a substance or mixture that is put inside it. (糕点里的) 馅 3. N-MASS The filling in a piece of soft furniture or in a cushion is the soft substance inside it. (软家具或垫子的) 芯 4. ADJ Food that is filling makes you feel full when you have eaten it. (食物) 易使人饱的
1. ADJ Something that is bulky is large and heavy. Bulky things are often difficult to move or deal with. 大而笨重的
1. N-COUNT An allergen is a substance that causes an allergic reaction in someone. 过敏源 [技术]
1. N-COUNT A heist is a robbery, especially one in which money, jewellery, or art is stolen. (尤指对金钱、珠宝或艺术品的)抢盗 [journalism] [oft n N]
全新的；崭新的
口碑差；无理指责
1. N-COUNT If you make or draw an analogy between two things, you show that they are similar in some way. 类比
1. ADJ Sectarian means resulting from the differences between different religions. 派系的

1. N-COUNT A trap is a device which is placed somewhere or a hole which is dug somewhere in order to catch animals or birds. (捉捕动物或鸟类的) 捕捉器; 陷阱 2. V-T If a person traps animals or birds, he or she catches them using traps. 用捕捉器捕捉; 设陷阱捕捉 3. N-COUNT A trap is a trick that is intended to catch or deceive someone. 圈套 4. V-T If you trap someone into doing or saying something, you trick them so that they do or say it, although they did not want to. 诱骗 5. V-T To trap someone, especially a criminal, means to capture them. 抓捕 6. N-COUNT A trap is an unpleasant situation that you cannot easily escape from. 困境 7. V-T If you are trapped somewhere, something falls onto you or blocks your way and prevents you from moving or escaping. 困住 8. V-T When something traps gas, water, or energy, it prevents it from escaping. 留住 (气体、水或能量) 9. → see also trapped, deathtrap

1. N-VAR Hesitation is an unwillingness to do something, or a delay in doing it, because you are uncertain, worried, or embarrassed about it. 迟疑; 不愿意 2. → see also hesitate 3. PHRASE If you say that you have no hesitation in doing something, you are emphasizing that you will do it immediately or willingly because you are certain that it is the right thing to do. 毫不犹豫 [强调] 4. PHRASE If you say that someone does something without hesitation, you are emphasizing that they do it immediately and willingly. 毫不犹豫地 [强调]
n. 希思罗机场（位于英国伦敦）

1. V-T If you defeat someone, you win a victory over them in a battle, game, or contest. 击败 2. V-T If a proposal or motion in a debate is defeated, more people vote against it than for it. (以多数票) 挫败 [usu passive] 3. V-T If a task or a problem defeats you, it is so difficult that you cannot do it or solve it. 难倒 4. V-T To defeat an action or plan means to cause it to fail. 使受挫 5. N-VAR Defeat is the experience of being beaten in a battle, game, or contest, or of failing to achieve what you wanted to. 失败

1. ADJ Someone who is corrupt behaves in a way that is morally wrong, especially by doing dishonest or illegal things in return for money or power. 腐败的 2. V-T/V-I If someone is corrupted by something, it causes them to become dishonest and unjust and unable to be trusted. 使…腐化; 腐化 3. V-T To corrupt someone means to cause them to stop caring about moral standards. 使…堕落
1. N-VAR A sculpture is a work of art that is produced by carving or shaping stone, wood, clay, or other materials. 雕塑 2. N-UNCOUNT Sculpture is the art of creating sculptures. 雕塑 (艺术)

1. N-COUNT A barrier is something such as a rule, law, or policy that makes it difficult or impossible for something to happen or be achieved. 障碍 2. N-COUNT A barrier is a problem that prevents two people or groups from agreeing, communicating, or working with each other. 障碍; 隔阂 3. N-COUNT A barrier is something such as a fence or wall that is put in place to prevent people from moving easily from one area to another. 栅栏; 围墙 4. N-COUNT A barrier is an object or layer that physically prevents something from moving from one place to another. 屏障 5. N-SING You can refer to a particular number or amount as a barrier when you think it is significant, because it is difficult or unusual to go above it. (数量) 大关

1. N-COUNT A trademark is a name or symbol that a company uses on its products and that cannot legally be used by another company. 商标 [商业] 2. N-COUNT If you say that something is the trademark of a particular person or place, you mean that it is characteristic of them or typically associated with them. 标志

1. ADJ Celsius is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C. 摄氏的 (简写为C) [n/num ADJ] 2. N-UNCOUNT Celsius is also a noun. 摄氏温度
1. V-I If you tell someone to beware of a person or thing, you are warning them that the person or thing may harm them or be dangerous. 当心; 提防 [only imper and inf]

1. N-COUNT A dial is the part of a machine or instrument such as a clock or watch which shows you the time or a measurement that has been recorded. 刻度盘 2. N-COUNT A dial is a control on a device or piece of equipment which you can move in order to adjust the setting, for example, to select or change the frequency on a radio or the temperature of a heater. (收音机、加热器等的) 调谐钮 3. V-T/V-I If you dial or if you dial a number, you turn the dial or press the buttons on a telephone in order to phone someone. 拨号
1. V-T If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it. 谴责 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Censure is also a noun. 谴责
n. (板球中投手投出的球恰好落在击球员前面的)脚前球，球板前球
1. N-PLURAL A person's or a company's wares are the things that they are selling. 商品

1. V-T If you conclude that something is true, you decide that it is true using the facts you know as a basis. 断定 2. V-T/V-I When you conclude, you say the last thing that you are going to say. 结束 (说话) [正式] 3. V-T/V-I When something concludes, or when you conclude it, you end it. 使…结束; 结束 [正式] 4. V-T If one person or group concludes an agreement, such as a treaty or business deal, with another, they arrange it. You can also say that two people or groups conclude an agreement. 达成 (协议) [正式]
adj. 最靠近的（close的最高级）
1. N-SING If you are on the brink of something, usually something important, terrible, or exciting, you are just about to do it or experience it. 边缘

1. V-T If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy left. 使精疲力竭 2. exhausted ADJ 精疲力竭的 3. V-T If you exhaust something such as money or food, you use or finish it all. 用完 4. V-T If you have exhausted a subject or topic, you have talked about it so much that there is nothing more to say about it. 说尽 5. N-UNCOUNT Exhaust is the gas or steam that is produced when the engine of a vehicle is running. 废气 [also N in pl] 6. N-COUNT The exhaust is the same as the . 排气管 [英国英语]
1. N-COUNT An optimist is someone who is hopeful about the future. 乐观主义者

1. V-T If you grip something, you take hold of it with your hand and continue to hold it firmly. 紧握 2. N-COUNT A grip is a firm, strong hold on something. 紧握 3. N-SING Someone's grip on something is the power and control they have over it. 掌控 4. V-T If something grips you, it affects you very strongly. 强烈地影响 5. V-T If you are gripped by something such as a story or a series of events, your attention is concentrated on it and held by it. 吸引 [usu passive] 6. gripping ADJ 吸引人的 7. N-UNCOUNT If things such as shoes or car tyres have grip, they do not slip. 抓力 8. PHRASE If you come to grips with a problem, you consider it seriously, and start taking action to deal with it. 认真着手处理 9. PHRASE If you get a grip on yourself, you make an effort to control or improve your behaviour or work. 控制 ; 完善 10. PHRASE If a person, group, or place is in the grip of something, they are being severely affected by it. 在某事的强烈影响下 11. PHRASE If you lose your grip, you become less efficient and less confident, and less able to

1. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to problems or difficulties as trouble. 麻烦; 困难 [oft 'in' N, also N in pl] 2. N-SING If you say that one aspect of a situation is the trouble, you mean that it is the aspect which is causing problems or making the situation unsatisfactory. 问题 (指引起麻烦的事情) 3. N-PLURAL Your troubles are the things that you are worried about. 烦恼 4. N-UNCOUNT If you have kidney trouble or back trouble, for example, there is something wrong with your kidneys or your back. 疾病 5. N-UNCOUNT If there is trouble somewhere, especially in a public place, there is fighting or rioting there. 骚乱 [also N in pl] 6. N-UNCOUNT If you tell someone that it is no trouble to do something for them, you are saying politely that you can or will do it, because it is easy or convenient for you. 麻烦 [礼貌] 7. N-UNCOUNT If you say that a person or animal is no trouble, you mean that they are very easy to look after. 令人操心的人 (或动物) 8. V-T If something troubles you, it makes you feel worried. 使烦恼 9. troubling ADJ 令人烦恼的 10. V-T
依据；按照；在…方面；以…措词

1. ADJ Something that is delicate is small and beautifully shaped. 精巧的; 精美的 2. delicately ADV 精巧地; 精美地 [ADV adj/-ed] 3. ADJ Something that is delicate has a colour, taste, or smell which is pleasant and not strong or intense. 柔和的 (颜色); 清淡可口的 (味道) 4. delicately ADV 清淡可口地 [ADV -ed/adj] 5. ADJ If something is delicate, it is easy to harm, damage, or break, and needs to be handled or treated carefully. 易碎的; 脆弱的 6. ADJ Someone who is delicate is not healthy and strong, and becomes ill easily. 病弱的 7. ADJ You use delicate to describe a situation, problem, matter, or discussion that needs to be dealt with carefully and sensitively in order to avoid upsetting things or offending people. 微妙的 8. delicately ADV 微妙地 [ADV with v] 9. ADJ A delicate task, movement, action, or product needs or shows great skill and attention to detail. 棘手的; 需要小心处理的 10. delicately ADV 棘手地 [ADV with v]

1. N-COUNT Planners are people whose job is to make decisions about what is going to be done in the future. For example, town planners decide how land should be used and what new buildings should be built. 规划者
1. N-COUNT An entrepreneur is a person who sets up businesses and business deals. 创业者 [商业]
1. N-UNCOUNT If you refer to someone's incompetence, you are criticizing them because they are unable to do their job or a task properly. 无能 [表不满]
adj. 事实上的，实际上的
1. N-UNCOUNT Mistrust is the feeling that you have toward someone who you do not trust. 不信任 2. V-T If you mistrust someone or something, you do not trust them. 不信任

1. N-COUNT A grid is something which is in a pattern of straight lines that cross over each other, forming squares. On maps, the grid is used to help you find a particular thing or place. 网格; (地图上的) 坐标方格 2. N-COUNT A grid is a network of wires and cables by which sources of power, such as electricity, are distributed throughout a country or area. 系统网络 (指输电网等) 3. N-COUNT Thegrid or the starting grid is the starting line on a car-racing track. 赛车起跑线

1. N-VAR Expense is the money that something costs you or that you need to spend in order to do something. 花费 2. N-PLURAL Expenses are amounts of money that you spend while doing something in the course of your work, which will be paid back to you afterwards. (由雇主报销的工作) 开支 [商业] 3. PHRASE If you do something at someone's expense, they provide the money for it. 由…付费 4. PHRASE If someone laughs or makes a joke at your expense, they do it to make you seem foolish. 捉弄 (某人) 5. PHRASE If you achieve something at the expense of someone, you do it in a way that might cause them some harm or disadvantage. 以牺牲 (某人的利益) 为代价 6. PHRASE If you say that someone does something at the expense of another thing, you are expressing concern that they are not doing the second thing, because the first thing uses all their resources. 以牺牲 (某物) 为代价 [表不满] 7. PHRASE If you go to the expense of doing something, you do something that costs a lot of money. If you go to great expense to do something, you spend a lot of money in order

1. N-COUNT A framework is a particular set of rules, ideas, or beliefs which you use in order to deal with problems or to decide what to do. 体系 2. N-COUNT A framework is a structure that forms a support or frame for something. 构架

1. N-COUNT In Scandinavian mythology, trolls are creatures who look like ugly people. They live in caves or on mountains and steal children. (斯堪的纳维亚神话中居于洞穴或山上、专门偷小孩的)丑陋怪物 2. V-I If you troll somewhere, you go there in a casual and unhurried way. 闲逛 [英国英语] [非正式] 3. V-I If you troll through papers or files, you look through them in a fairly casual way. 随便浏览(报纸或文件) [英国英语] [非正式] 4. V to post deliberately inflammatory articles on an internet discussion board (在网络论坛)故意发布煽动性文章 [计算机] [slang]
1. N-VAR Disclosure is the act of giving people new or secret information. 公开

1. ADJ Someone who is partisan strongly supports a particular person or cause, often without thinking carefully about the matter. 盲目拥护的 2. N an adherent or devotee of a cause, party, etc 事业或党派的追随者 3. N-COUNT Partisans are ordinary people, rather than soldiers, who join together to fight enemy soldiers who are occupying their country. 游击队员 4. N a spear or pike with two opposing axe blades or spikes 戟
1. N a tall fizzy iced drink made with gin, vodka, rum, etc, mixed with fruit juice, soda water, and sugar 柯林斯酒; 冰冻果子酒
adj. 无事实证明的；无正式文件的

1. ADJ You use precise to emphasize that you are referring to an exact thing, rather than something vague. 确切的 [ADJ n] [强调] 2. ADJ Something that is precise is exact and accurate in all its details. 精确的
西班牙人

1. N-VAR A flame is a hot bright stream of burning gas that comes from something that is burning. 火焰 2. N-COUNT A flame is an e-mail message which severely criticizes or attacks someone. 攻击性电子邮件 [计算机] [非正式] 3. V-T Flame is also a verb. 发送攻击性电子邮件 4. → see also flaming 5. PHRASE If something bursts into flames or bursts into flame, it suddenly starts burning strongly. 突然猛烈燃烧起来 6. PHRASE Something that is in flames is on fire. 着火
1. V-T If something appals you, it disgusts you because it seems so bad or unpleasant. 使厌恶
adv. 全国性地；以国民立场地；举国一致地

1. N-COUNT Your perception of something is the way that you think about it or the impression you have of it. 理解; 看法 2. N-UNCOUNT Someone who has perception realizes or notices things that are not obvious. 洞察力 3. N-COUNT Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight. (尤指通过视觉的) 感知

1. N-COUNT-COLL The cast of a play or film is all the people who act in it. 全体演员 2. V-T To cast an actor in a play or film means to choose them to act a particular role in it. 选…扮演角色 3. V-T If you cast your eyes or cast a look in a particular direction, you look quickly in that direction. 扫视 [书面] 4. V-T If something casts a light or shadow somewhere, it causes it to appear there. 投射 [书面] 5. V-T To cast doubt on something means to cause people to be unsure about it. 使人生疑 6. V-T When you cast your vote in an election, you vote. 投票 7. V-T To cast an object means to make it by pouring a liquid such as hot metal into a specially shaped container and leaving it there until it becomes hard. 铸造 8. N-COUNT A cast is a model that has been made by pouring a liquid such as plaster or hot metal onto something or into something, so that when it hardens it has the same shape as that thing. 模型 9. N-COUNT A cast is the same as a . 石膏模型 10. to cast your mind back →see mind
告别
例如
1. V to shake out and loosen (hay), so as to dry it 翻开(草)晒干 1. N teddy boy的缩写 [非正式] → short for teddy boy
1. V-T To clarify something means to make it easier to understand, usually by explaining it in more detail. 澄清 [正式] 2. clarification N-VAR 澄清
1. N-UNCOUNT If there is unrest in a particular place or society, people are expressing anger and dissatisfaction about something, often by demonstrating or rioting. 骚乱 [journalism]
1. N-COUNT A rupee is a unit of money that is used in India, Pakistan, and some other countries. 卢比
n. 津巴布韦（国家名，位于非洲）

1. N-UNCOUNT Justice is fairness in the way that people are treated. 公正 2. N-UNCOUNT The justice of a cause, claim, or argument is its quality of being reasonable, fair, or right. 正当性 3. N-UNCOUNT Justice is the legal system that a country uses in order to deal with people who break the law. 司法 4. N-COUNT A justice is a judge. 法官 [美国英语] 5. N-TITLE Justice is used before the names of judges. 法官 (表示头衔) 6. PHRASE If a criminal is brought to justice, he or she is punished for a crime by being arrested and tried in a court of law. 依法惩处 7. PHRASE To do justice to a person or thing means to reproduce them accurately and show how good they are. 准确再现优点 8. PHRASE If you do justice to someone or something, you deal with them properly and completely. 恰如其分地处理 9. PHRASE If you do yourself justice, you do something as well as you are capable of doing it. 充分发挥某人能力
1. ADJ If you describe someone as xenophobic, you disapprove of them because they show strong dislike or fear of people from other countries. 排外的; 有恐外症的 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A cask is a wooden barrel that is used for storing things, especially alcoholic drink. (用来储存东西，特别是酒的)木桶

1. N-PROPER The Kremlin is the building in Moscow where Russian government business takes place. 克里姆林宫; 位于莫斯科，为俄国政府处理公务的地方 ['the' N] 2. N-PROPER The Kremlin is also used to refer to the central government of Russia and of the former Soviet Union. 俄罗斯中央政府; 前苏联政府 ['the' N]
1. N-UNCOUNT Xenophobia is strong and unreasonable dislike or fear of people from other countries. 排外情绪; 恐外症 [正式]
1. ADJ Occasional means happening sometimes, but not regularly or often. 偶尔的 2. occasionally ADV 偶尔地

1. N-UNCOUNT Cash is money in the form of bills and coins rather than cheques. 现金 2. → see also hard cash, petty cash 3. N-UNCOUNT Cash means the same as money, especially money which is immediately available. 现钱 [非正式] 4. N-UNCOUNT any of various Chinese, Indonesian, or Indian coins of low value (中国、印度尼西亚或印度等国的)任何低价值硬币 5. V-T If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth. 兑现

1. V-T/V-I If a piece of writing circulates or is circulated, copies of it are passed around among a group of people. 散发; 流传 2. circulation N-UNCOUNT 流传 3. V-T/V-I If something such as a rumour circulates or is circulated, the people in a place tell it to each other. 散布; 流传 4. V-I When something circulates, it moves easily and freely within a closed place or system. 循环 5. circulation N-UNCOUNT 循环 6. V-I If you circulate at a party, you move among the guests and talk to different people. (在聚会上) 往来应酬
n. [会计] 收入；税收；[会计] 收益；营业收入（revenue的复数形式）
1. ADV You use thereby to introduce an important result or consequence of the event or action you have just mentioned. 由此 [正式] [ADV with cl]
1. ADJ If you describe something or someone as formidable, you mean that you feel slightly frightened by them because they are very great or impressive. 可怕的; 令人敬畏的

1. N-COUNT Someone who is a beneficiary of something is helped by it. 受益者 2. N-COUNT The beneficiaries of a will are legally entitled to receive money or property from someone when that person dies. (遗嘱的) 受益人

1. ADJ Something that is extensive covers or includes a large physical area. 广阔的 2. extensively ADV 广阔地 [ADV after v] 3. ADJ Something that is extensive covers a wide range of details, ideas, or items. 广泛的 4. extensively ADV 广泛地 5. ADJ If something is extensive, it is very great. 巨大的 6. extensively ADV 巨大地

1. ADJ If something such as a legal procedure is pending, it is waiting to be dealt with or settled. 待处理的 [正式] 2. PREP If something is done pending a future event, it is done until that event happens. 待 (某未来事件) 发生 [正式] 3. ADJ Something that is pending is going to happen soon. 即将发生的 [正式]
n. 肯塔基州

1. N-UNCOUNT Surgery is medical treatment in which someone's body is cut open so that a doctor can repair, remove, or replace a diseased or damaged part. 外科手术 2. → see also cosmetic surgery, plastic surgery 3. N-COUNT A surgery is the room or house where a doctor or dentist works. 诊室 [英国英语] 4. N-COUNT A doctor's surgery is the period of time each day when a doctor sees patients at his or her surgery. 诊疗时间 [英国英语] 5. N-COUNT A surgery is the area in a hospital with operating rooms where surgeons operate on their patients. 手术室 [美国英语]

1. ADJ If a place is gloomy, it is almost dark so that you cannot see very well. 昏暗的 2. ADJ If people are gloomy, they are unhappy and have no hope. 忧伤的 3. gloomily ADV 忧伤地 [ADV with v] 4. ADJ If a situation is gloomy, it does not give you much hope of success or happiness. 前景暗淡的
1. ADV Eventually means in the end, especially after a lot of delays, problems, or arguments. 终于 2. ADV Eventually means at the end of a situation or process or as the final result of it. 最终

1. V-T If something reinforces a feeling, situation, or process, it makes it stronger or more intense. 加强 2. V-T If something reinforces an idea or point of view, it provides more evidence or support for it. 巩固 3. V-T To reinforce an object means to make it stronger or harder. 加固 4. V-T To reinforce an army or a police force means to make it stronger by increasing its size or providing it with more weapons. To reinforce a position or place means to make it stronger by sending more soldiers or weapons. 增援
1. N-UNCOUNT Permafrost is land that is permanently frozen to a great depth. 永冻土层

1. V-T When you throw an object that you are holding, you move your hand or arm quickly and let go of the object, so that it moves through the air. 投; 扔 2. N-COUNT Throw is also a noun. 投; 扔 3. V-T If you throw your body or part of your body into a particular position or place, you move it there suddenly and with a lot of force. 猛然移动 (身体或身体部位) 4. V-T If you throw something into a particular place or position, you put it there in a quick and careless way. (漫不经心地) 扔下 5. V-T To throw someone into a particular place or position means to force them roughly into that place or position. 使摔倒 6. V-T If you say that someone is thrown into prison, you mean that they are put there by the authorities. 把…关进 (监狱) 7. V-T If a horse throws its rider, it makes him or her fall off, by suddenly jumping or moving violently. (马) 摔落 (骑手) 8. V-T If a person or thing is thrown into a bad situation or state, something causes them to be in that situation or state. 使陷入 (困境等) 9. V-T If something throws light or a shadow on a su

1. N-COUNT A cart is an old-fashioned wooden vehicle that is used for transporting goods or people. Some carts are pulled by animals. 老式板车 2. N-COUNT A cart is a small vehicle with a motor. 小型机动车 [美国英语] 3. N-COUNT A cart or a shopping cart is a large metal basket on wheels which is provided by shops such as supermarkets for customers to use while they are in the shop. 购物推车 [美国英语] 4. N-COUNT cartridge的缩写 [radio] → short for cartridge 5. V-T If you cart things or people somewhere, you carry them or transport them there, often with difficulty. (常指费力地) 运送 [非正式]

1. V-T If someone in authority sanctions an action or practice, they officially approve of it and allow it to be done. 批准; 认可 2. N-UNCOUNT Sanction is also a noun. 批准; 认可 3. N-PLURAL Sanctions are measures taken by countries to restrict trade and official contact with a country that has broken international law. 国际制裁

1. N-COUNT A bid for something or a bid to do something is an attempt to obtain it or do it. 努力尝试 [journalism] 2. N-COUNT A bid is an offer to pay a particular amount of money for something that is being sold. 出价 3. V-T/V-I If you bid for something or bid to do something, you try to obtain it or do it. 力求获得; 努力争取 4. V-I If you bid for something that is being sold, you offer to pay a particular amount of money for it. 出价

1. N-COUNT A handout is a gift of money, clothing, or food, which is given free to poor people. 施舍物; 救济品; 救济金 2. N-COUNT If you call money that is given to someone a handout, you disapprove of it because you believe that the person who receives it has done nothing to earn or deserve it. 不劳而获的钱 [表不满] 3. N-COUNT A handout is a document which contains news or information about something and which is given, for example, to journalists or members of the public. 传单; 宣传品 4. N-COUNT A handout is a paper given out to students by a teacher, that contains a summary of the information or topics that will be dealt with in a lesson. (教师给学生的) 讲义

1. V-RECIP If two or more people or groups conspire to do something illegal or harmful, they make a secret agreement to do it. 合谋 2. V-T/V-I If events conspire to produce a particular result, they seem to work together to cause this result. 协同

1. N-COUNT You can describe a place as a hub of an activity when it is a very important centre for that activity. 活动中心 2. N-COUNT The hub of a wheel is the part at the centre. 轮毂 3. N-COUNT A hub or a hub airport is a large airport from which you can travel to many other airports. 枢纽机场 4. N-COUNT A hub is a device for connecting computers in a network. 集线器 [计算机]
1. V-I If people or businesses prosper, they are successful and do well. 兴隆; 成功 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A pail is a bucket, usually made of metal or wood. (木或铁)桶 [美国英语]
1. N-UNCOUNT If there is parity between two things, they are equal. 平等; 相等 [正式] 2. N the condition or fact of having given birth 分娩或分娩状态

1. V-T/V-I If you care about something, you feel that it is important and are concerned about it. 关注 [no cont] 2. V-I If you care for someone, you feel a lot of affection for them. 喜爱 [no cont] [表赞许] 3. caring N-UNCOUNT 体贴 4. V-I If you care for someone or something, you look after them and keep them in a good state or condition. 照顾 5. N-UNCOUNT Care is also a noun. 照顾 6. V-T/V-I You can ask someone if they would care for something or if they would care to do something as a polite way of asking if they would like to have or do something. 想要 [no cont] [礼貌] 7. N-UNCOUNT If you do something with care, you give careful attention to it because you do not want to make any mistakes or cause any damage. 谨慎 8. N-COUNT Your cares are your worries, anxieties, or fears. 烦恼 9. → see also caring, day care, intensive care 10. PHRASE You can use for all I care to emphasize that it does not matter at all to you what someone does. 不关某人的事 [强调] 11. PHRASE If you say that you couldn't care less about someone or someth
1. ADJ Fiscal is used to describe something that relates to government money or public money, especially taxes. 财政的 [ADJ n]
除

1. ADJ Spontaneous acts are not planned or arranged, but are done because someone suddenly wants to do them. 自然的; 自发的 (行为) 2. spontaneously ADV 自然地; 自发地 3. ADJ A spontaneous event happens because of processes within something rather than being caused by things outside it. 自然的 (事件) 4. spontaneously ADV 自然地 [ADV after v]

1. N-COUNT A sensation is a physical feeling. 感觉 2. N-UNCOUNT Sensation is your ability to feel things physically, especially through your sense of touch. 感觉能力 3. N-COUNT You can use sensation to refer to the general feeling or impression caused by a particular experience. (某种经历所产生的) 整体感觉 4. N-COUNT If a person, event, or situation is a sensation, it causes great excitement or interest. 引起轰动的人或事物 5. N-SING If a person, event, or situation causes a sensation, they cause great interest or excitement. 轰动

1. N-COUNT A revolution is a successful attempt by a large group of people to change the political system of their country by force. 革命 2. N-COUNT A revolution in a particular area of human activity is an important change in that area. 重大变革

1. ADJ Something that is legitimate is acceptable according to the law. 合法的 2. legitimacy N-UNCOUNT 合法性 3. ADJ If you say that something such as a feeling or claim is legitimate, you think that it is reasonable and justified. 合理的 4. legitimacy N-UNCOUNT 合理性
n. 野村证券；野村（日本企业）

1. V-T If a piece of equipment is overhauled, it is cleaned, checked thoroughly, and repaired if necessary. 全面检修 [usu passive] 2. N-COUNT Overhaul is also a noun. 全面检修 3. V-T If you overhaul a system or method, you examine it carefully and make many changes in it in order to improve it. 改革; 修订 4. N-COUNT Overhaul is also a noun. 改革; 修订

1. ADJ Annual events happen once every year. 每年一次的 [ADJ n] 2. annually ADV 每年一次地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ Annual quantities or rates relate to a period of one year. 年度的 [ADJ n] 4. annually ADV 年度地 5. N-COUNT An annual is a book or magazine that is published once a year. 年鉴; 年刊 6. N-COUNT An annual is a plant that grows and dies within one year. 一年生植物

1. ADJ Something that is implicit is expressed in an indirect way. 含蓄的 2. implicitly ADV 含蓄地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If a quality or element is implicit in something, it is involved in it or is shown by it. 内含的 [正式] [v-link ADJ 'in' n] 4. ADJ If you say that someone has an implicit belief or faith in something, you mean that they have complete faith in it and no doubts at all. 绝对的 (信任) 5. implicitly ADV 绝对地 [ADV after v]
1. ADJ If people or their opinions are upbeat, they are cheerful and hopeful about a situation. 乐观的 [非正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT Concentration on something involves giving all your attention to it. 专注 2. N-VAR A concentration of something is a large amount of it or large numbers of it in a small area. 集中 3. N-VAR The concentration of a substance is the proportion of essential ingredients or substances in it. 浓度
1. V-T/V-I If a bad situation escalates or if someone or something escalates it, it becomes greater in size, seriousness, or intensity. 使…加剧; 加剧 [journalism] 2. escalation N-VAR 加剧

1. ADJ A quarterly event happens four times a year, at intervals of three months. 一年四次的; 每季的 2. ADV Quarterly is also an adverb. 一年四次地; 每季地 [ADV after v] 3. N-COUNT A quarterly is a magazine that is published four times a year, at intervals of three months. 季刊
紧的（ tight的比较级 ）
1. N-COUNT A kickback is a sum of money that is paid to someone illegally, for example money which a company pays someone to arrange for the company to be chosen to do an important job. 回扣

1. V-T/V-I If you tighten your grip on something, or if your grip tightens, you hold the thing more firmly or securely. 抓紧 2. V-T/V-I If you tighten a rope or chain, or if it tightens, it is stretched or pulled hard until it is straight. 使 (绳或链) 拉紧; 拉紧 3. V-T/V-I If a government or organization tightens its grip on a group of people or an activity, or if its grip tightens, it begins to have more control over it. 对…加强控制; 加强控制 4. V-T When you tighten a screw, nut, or other device, you turn it or move it so that it is more firmly in place or holds something more firmly. 拧紧 (螺丝、螺帽等) 5. PHRASAL VERB Tighten up means the same as . 拧紧 (同 )(tighten) 6. V-I If a part of your body tightens, the muscles in it become tense and stiff, for example, because you are angry or afraid. (身体部位因生气或害怕) 变得僵硬 7. V-T If someone in authority tightens a rule, a policy, or a system, they make it stricter or more efficient. 使 (规定、政策或制度) 更严格; 使更有效 8. PHRASAL VERB Tighten up means the same as . 使…更严格 9. to tighten your belt →see b
n. UNIX工具程序；可做文件内的字符串查找 n. (Grep)人名；(苏里)格雷普

1. N-COUNT A technique is a particular method of doing an activity, usually a method that involves practical skills. 技术 2. N-UNCOUNT Technique is skill and ability in an artistic, sporting, or other practical activity that you develop through training and practice. 技艺; 技能

1. N-UNCOUNT Transit is the carrying of goods or people by vehicle from one place to another. 运输 2. PHRASE If people or things are in transit, they are travelling or being taken from one place to another. 在途中; 在被运送中 3. ADJ A transit area is an area where people wait or where goods are kept between different stages of a journey. 中转的 (地方) [ADJ n] 4. N-UNCOUNT [美国英语] →see transport system

1. V-T You can use render with an adjective that describes a particular state to say that someone or something is changed into that state. For example, if someone or something makes a thing harmless, you can say that they render it harmless. 使成为; 使变得
萧条的市场 市场不景气
n. 非法交易（尤指毒品买卖） vi. 交易（traffic的现在分词）

1. V-T If someone is nominated for a job or position, their name is formally suggested as a candidate for it. (为工作、职位) 提名 2. V-T If you nominate someone to a job or position, you formally choose them to hold that job or position. 任命 3. V-T If someone or something such as an actor or a film is nominated for an award, someone formally suggests that they should be given that award. (某人或某物) 被提名 (某奖项)
1. ADJ aggressively or harshly critical (esp in the phrase slashing attack) 严厉批判的

1. ADJ If you describe something or someone as incredible, you like them very much or are impressed by them, because they are extremely or unusually good. 极好的 [表赞许] 2. incredibly ADV 极好地 [ADV adj/adv] 3. ADJ If you say that something is incredible, you mean that it is very unusual or surprising, and you cannot believe it is really true, although it may be. 难以置信的 4. incredibly ADV 难以置信地 5. ADJ You use incredible to emphasize the degree, amount, or intensity of something. 非常的 [强调] 6. incredibly ADV 非常地 [ADV adj/adv]
1. N-UNCOUNT Diabetes is a medical condition in which someone has too much sugar in their blood. 糖尿病

1. ADJ If you say that something such as a resource is precious, you mean that it is valuable and should not be wasted or used badly. (资源等) 宝贵的 2. ADJ Precious objects and materials are worth a lot of money because they are rare. (物品、材料等) 珍贵的 3. ADJ If something is precious to you, you regard it as important and do not want to lose it. (对某人来讲) 珍贵的

1. N-COUNT A banner is a long strip of cloth with something written on it. Banners are usually attached to two poles and carried during a protest or rally. (游行或集合用的) 横幅 2. PHRASE If someone does something under the banner of a particular cause, idea, or belief, they do it saying that they support that cause, idea, or belief. 在…旗帜下; 在…名义下
adj. 囊状的
1. ABBREVIATION for fast-moving consumer goods 快速消费品
n. (Hadi)人名；(阿拉伯、伊朗、土、印尼)哈迪
1. V-T If something encompasses particular things, it includes them. 包含 2. V-T To encompass a place means to completely surround or cover it. 围住; 覆盖
好好利用，充分利用；发挥…最大功效；最有效地使用

1. N-UNCOUNT Jazz is a style of music that was invented by African American musicians in the early part of the twentieth century. Jazz music has very strong rhythms and often involves improvisation. 爵士乐

1. N-COUNT A spook is a ghost. 鬼 [非正式] 2. N-COUNT A spook is a spy. 间谍 [美国英语] [非正式] 3. V-T If people are spooked, something has scared them or made them nervous. 使...吓坏; 使...紧张 [美国英语] [v-link ADJ] 4. spooked ADJ

1. V-T If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly. 假设 2. V-T If someone assumes power or responsibility, they take power or responsibility. 接受 (权利、责任) 3. V-T If you assume a particular expression or way of behaving, you start to look or behave in this way. 做出 (某表情); 采取 (某行为方式)
1. N-PLURAL pins, cotton, ribbon, and similar wares used for sewing; haberdashery 缝纫用的或男装店的针、棉、丝或相似制品 [美国英语]
1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES The high street of a town is the main street where most of the stores and banks are. 主要街道 [英国英语]
1. N-COUNT A spoof is something such as an article or television programme that seems to be about a serious matter but is actually a joke. (关于严肃事件的)玩笑性文章; 玩笑性电视节目
精华；最优秀的人

1. ADJ If you refer to the fact that people are mortal, you mean that they have to die and cannot live forever. 终有一死的 2. mortality N-UNCOUNT 终有一死 3. N-COUNT You can describe someone as a mortal when you want to say that they are an ordinary person. 凡人 4. ADJ You can use mortal to show that something is very serious or may cause death. 致命的 [ADJ n] 5. mortally ADV 致命地 6. ADJ You can use mortal to emphasize that a feeling is extremely great or severe. 极度的 [ADJ n] [强调] 7. mortally ADV 极度地 [ADV -ed/adj/adv]
1. ADJ A substance that is lethal can kill people or animals. 致命的 2. ADJ If you describe something as lethal, you mean that it is capable of causing a lot of damage. 危害极大的

1. ADJ If two things are equal or if one thing is equal to another, they are the same in size, number, standard, or value. 相等的 2. ADJ If different groups of people have equal rights or are given equal treatment, they have the same rights or are treated the same as each other, however different they are. 平等的 (权利、待遇等) 3. ADJ If you say that people are equal, you mean that they have or should have the same rights and opportunities as each other. (权利、机会等) 平等的 [v-link ADJ] 4. N-COUNT Someone who is your equal has the same ability, status, or rights as you have. (能力、地位或权利等) 同等的人 5. ADJ If someone is equal to a particular job or situation, they have the necessary ability, strength, or courage to deal successfully with it. 能成功应付 (某工作、某情形等) 的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n] 6. V-LINK If something equals a particular number or amount, it is the same as that amount or the equivalent of that amount. (数量上) 等于 7. V-T To equal something or someone means to be as good or as great as them. 比得上 8. PHRASE If you say "other things
1. ADJ To be notorious means to be well known for something bad. 声名狼藉的 2. notoriously ADV 声名狼藉地

1. N-UNCOUNT The welfare of a person or group is their health, comfort, and happiness. 健康; 幸福; 福利 2. ADJ Welfare services are provided to help with people's living conditions and financial problems. 福利的 3. N-UNCOUNT Welfare is money that is paid by the government to people who are unemployed, poor, or sick. 社会保障金

1. V-T If you trust someone, you believe that they are honest and sincere and will not deliberately do anything to harm you. 信任 2. N-UNCOUNT Your trust in someone is your belief that they are honest and sincere and will not deliberately do anything to harm you. 信任 3. V-T If you trust someone to do something, you believe that they will do it. 相信 (某人会做某事) 4. V-T If you trust someone with something important or valuable, you allow them to look after it or deal with it. 托付 5. N-UNCOUNT Trust is also a noun. 托付 [also 'a' N] 6. V-T If you do not trust something, you feel that it is not safe or reliable. (不) 相信 (某物安全或可靠) 7. V-T If you trust someone's judgment or advice, you believe that it is good or right. 相信 (某人的判断或建议) 8. V-T If you say you trust that something is true, you mean you hope and expect that it is true. 相信 (某事的真实性) [正式] 9. V-I If you trust in someone or something, you believe strongly in them, and do not doubt their powers or their good intentions. 信任 [正式] 10. N-COUNT A trust is a financial

1. PHRASAL VERB If something sets you back or sets back a project or plan, it causes a delay. 延误; 推迟 2. PHRASAL VERB If something sets you back a certain amount of money, it costs you that much money. 使花费 [非正式] 3. → see also setback

1. ADJ If you describe an object, idea, or course of action as impractical, you mean that it is not sensible or realistic, and does not work well in practice. 不切实际的 2. ADJ If you describe someone as impractical, you mean that they do not have the abilities or skills to do practical work such as making, repairing, or organizing things. 缺乏实际能力的

1. N-UNCOUNT Abuse of someone is cruel and violent treatment of them. 虐待 [also N in pl] 2. N-UNCOUNT Abuse is extremely rude and insulting things that people say when they are angry. 辱骂 3. N-VAR Abuse of something is the use of it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose. 滥用 [with supp] 4. V-T If someone is abused, they are treated cruelly and violently. 虐待 5. V-T You can say that someone is abused if extremely rude and insulting things are said to them. 侮辱 6. V-T If you abuse something, you use it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose. 滥用

1. ADJ If you describe a situation as shaky, you mean that it is weak or unstable, and seems unlikely to last long or be successful. 不牢靠的 2. ADJ If your body or your voice is shaky, you cannot control it properly and it shakes, for example, because you are ill or nervous. (身体、声音) 颤抖的

1. N-VAR Your resignation is a formal statement of your intention to leave a job or position. 辞呈 2. N-UNCOUNT Resignation is the acceptance of an unpleasant situation or fact because you realize that you cannot change it. 无奈的顺从

1. ADJ Something that is Catalan belongs or relates to Catalonia, its people, or its language. Catalonia is a region of Spain. 加泰罗尼亚的; 加泰罗尼亚人的; 加泰罗尼亚语的 [usu ADJ n] 2. N-UNCOUNT Catalan is one of the languages spoken in Catalonia. 加泰罗尼亚语
adj. 较短的；更短的；更矮的（short的比较级） n. (Shorter)人名；(英)肖特

1. N-COUNT A swathe of land is a long strip of land. (土地的)一长条; 一长片 [usu N 'of' n] 2. N-COUNT A swathe of cloth is a long strip of cloth, especially one that is wrapped around someone or something. (包裹用布料)一长条 [usu N 'of' n] 3. V-T To swathe someone or something in cloth means to wrap them in it completely. (用布料)把…包裹住

1. N-UNCOUNT If you are given credit, you are allowed to pay for goods or services several weeks or months after you have received them. 赊购 2. N-UNCOUNT If you get the credit for something good, people praise you because you are responsible for it, or are thought to be responsible for it. 赞扬 3. V-T When a sum of money is credited to an account, the bank adds that sum of money to the total in the account. 存入 4. V-T If people credit someone with an achievement or if it is credited to them, people say or believe that they were responsible for it. 归功于 5. N-COUNT A credit is a sum of money which is added to an account. 贷方款额 6. N-COUNT A credit is an amount of money that is given to someone. 补助 7. N-PLURAL The list of people who helped to make a film, a CD, or a television programme is called the credits. 摄制人员名单 8. N-COUNT A credit is a successfully completed part of a higher education course, representing about one hour of instruction a week. At universities and colleges you need a certain number of credi
1. V-T/V-I If someone unifies different things or parts, or if the things or parts unify, they are brought together to form one thing. 使成一体; 成为一体 2. unified ADJ 统一的

1. ADJ Someone who is qualified has a certificate, licence, diploma or degree in order to work in a particular profession. 有资格的; 有文凭的 2. ADJ If you give someone or something qualified support or approval, your support or approval is not total because you have some doubts. 有限度的; 有保留的 [ADJ n] 3. PHRASE If you describe something as a qualified success, you mean that it is only partly successful. 局部成功

1. N-COUNT A parcel is something wrapped in paper, in a bag or large envelope, or in a box, usually so that it can be sent to someone by mail. 包裹; 邮包 2. PHRASE If you say that something is part and parcel of something else, you are emphasizing that it is involved or included in it. 重要部分 [强调]

1. N-COUNT A mystery is something that is not understood or known about. 迷 2. N-UNCOUNT If you talk about the mystery of someone or something, you are talking about how difficult they are to understand or know about, especially when this gives them a rather strange or magical quality. 神秘 (性) 3. ADJ A mystery person or thing is one whose identity or nature is not known. 来历不明的 [ADJ n] 4. N-COUNT A mystery is a story in which strange things happen that are not explained until the end. 悬疑 (推理) 故事
最真诚的 最虔诚的(sincere的最高级)

1. V-I If a person, company, or country defaults on something that they have legally agreed to do, such as paying some money or doing a piece of work before a particular time, they fail to do it. 不履行 (义务); 违约 [法律] 2. N-UNCOUNT Default is also a noun. 不履行; 违约 3. ADJ A default situation is what exists or happens unless someone or something changes it. 原样的 [ADJ n] 4. N-UNCOUNT In computing, the default is a particular set of instructions which the computer always uses unless the person using the computer gives other instructions. 默认值 [计算机] 5. PHRASE If something happens by default, it happens only because something else which might have prevented it or changed it has not happened. 在另外的可能性没有发生的情况下 [正式]
1. N-MASS Dough is a fairly firm mixture of flour, water, and sometimes also fat and sugar. It can be cooked to make bread or pastry. 面团 2. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to money as dough. 钱 [非正式]
1. ADJ If you describe someone or something as tiresome, you mean that you find them irritating or boring. 讨厌的; 无聊的
1. N-COUNT A diadem is a small crown with precious stones in it. (镶有宝石的)小王冠
1. N-UNCOUNT In finance, your equity is the sum of your assets, for example the value of your house, once your debts have been subtracted from it. 资产净值 [商业]
1. N-COUNT An insider is someone who is involved in a situation and who knows more about it than other people. 知情者; 圈内人
1. ADJ If you describe something as intriguing, you mean that it is interesting or strange. 新奇的 2. intriguingly ADV 新奇地

1. V-T If something inhibits an event or process, it prevents it or slows it down. 阻碍; 抑制 2. V-T To inhibit someone from doing something means to prevent them from doing it, although they want to do it or should be able to do it. 禁止; 阻止
1. N →see FBI
1. ADJ A photovoltaic cell or panel is a device that uses sunlight to cause a chemical reaction which produces electricity. 光电的 [技术] [ADJ n]

1. N-VAR Cane is used to refer to the long, hollow, hard stems of plants such as bamboo. Strips of cane are often used to make furniture, and some types of cane can be crushed and processed to make sugar. (竹或甘蔗的) 茎 2. N-COUNT A cane is a long thin stick with a curved or round top which you can use to support yourself when you are walking, or which in the past was fashionable to carry with you. 手杖 3. V to whip or beat with or as if with a cane 用笞杖打; 鞭打
1. N-SING The upshot of a series of events or discussions is the final result of them, usually a surprising result. (通常指出乎意外的) 结果

1. V-T If you estimate a quantity or value, you make an approximate judgment or calculation of it. 估计 2. estimated ADJ 估计的 3. N-COUNT An estimate is an approximate calculation of a quantity or value. 估计 4. N-COUNT An estimate is a judgment about a person or situation that you make based on the available evidence. 判断 5. N-COUNT An estimate from someone who you employ to do a job for you, such as a builder or a plumber, is a written statement of how much the job is likely to cost. 估价

1. N-COUNT A dentist is a medical practitioner who is qualified to examine and treat people's teeth. 牙科医生 2. N-SING The dentist or the dentist's is used to refer to the office or clinic where a dentist works. 牙医诊所

1. V-RECIP If one thing corresponds to another, there is a close similarity or connection between them. You can also say that two things correspond. 相一致; 相对应 2. corresponding ADJ 相应的 [ADJ n] 3. V-RECIP If you correspond with someone, you write letters to them. You can also say that two people correspond. 通信
1. N-COUNT A quip is a remark that is intended be amusing or clever. 俏皮话; 妙语 [书面]
小抄；备忘单
1. ADJ If you are stressed, you feel tense and anxious because of difficulties in your life. 焦虑不安的
n. 尼克松（美国第37任总统）
n. 柬埔寨（位于亚洲）
1. N-COUNT If you say that a place or region is a stronghold of a particular attitude or belief, you mean that most people there share this attitude or belief. (大多数人有共同态度或信仰的) 大本营
1. N-COUNT A transaction is a piece of business, for example, an act of buying or selling something. 交易 [商业] [正式]
1. V-T When you orient yourself to a new situation or course of action, you learn about it and prepare to deal with it. 适应 [正式] 2. → see also oriented

1. V-T To restore a situation or practice means to cause it to exist again. 恢复 2. restoration N-UNCOUNT 恢复 3. V-T To restore someone or something to a previous condition or place means to cause them to be in that condition or place once again. 使复原 4. restoration N-UNCOUNT 复原 5. V-T When someone restores something such as an old building, painting, or piece of furniture, they repair and clean it, so that it looks like it did when it was new. 修复 6. restoration N-VAR 修复 7. V-T If something that was lost or stolen is restored to its owner, it is returned to them. 归还 [正式] [usu passive]
1. N-COUNT A workout is a period of physical exercise or training. 体育锻炼; 体育训练
1. N-VAR Ethnicity is the state or fact of belonging to a particular ethnic group. 种族特点; 种族渊源
adv. 庄严地；严肃地

1. N-COUNT Your conscience is the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is right or wrong. If you have a guilty conscience, you feel guilty about something because you know it was wrong. If you have a clear conscience, you do not feel guilty because you know you have done nothing wrong. 良知 2. N-UNCOUNT Conscience is doing what you believe is right even though it might be unpopular, difficult, or dangerous. 凭良知行事 3. N-UNCOUNT Conscience is a feeling of guilt because you know you have done something that is wrong. 负疚感 4. PHRASE If you have something on your conscience, you feel guilty because you know you have done something wrong. 引起内疚
1. ADJ An inquisitive person likes finding out about things, especially secret things. 好奇的; 爱打听的
1. V to satisfy (a desire or appetite) fully 充分满足(欲望或食欲) 1. V sit的过去式和过去分词 [archaic] → a past tense and past participle of sit

1. N-UNCOUNT Networking is the process of trying to meet new people who might be useful to you in your job, often through social activities. 建立关系网 [商业] 2. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the things associated with a computer system or the process of establishing such a system as networking. (计算机) 网络
n. 哈珀（英语姓氏）

1. ADJ Temporal powers or matters relate to ordinary institutions and activities rather than to religious or spiritual ones. 凡尘的; 普通的 [正式] [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Temporal means relating to time. 时间的 [正式] [ADJ n] 3. ADJ of, relating to, or near the temple or temples 颞部的; 太阳穴的 [anatomy]
1. N-COUNT The destination of someone or something is the place to which they are going or being sent. 目的地
adj. 长期的 n. 最后
1. ADJ An unofficial action or statement is not organized or approved by a person or group in authority. 非官方的; 未经官方批准的 2. unofficially ADV 非官方地; 未经官方批准地

1. N-COUNT An inspector is a person, usually employed by a government agency, whose job is to find out whether people are obeying official regulations. 检查员; 督察员 2. N-COUNT/N-TITLE/N-VOC An inspector is an officer in the police who is next in rank to a superintendent or police chief. 巡官 (官阶仅次于警长或警察局长的警官)

1. N-VAR Territory is land which is controlled by a particular country or ruler. 领土 2. N-COUNT A territory is a country or region that is controlled by another country. 属地 3. N-UNCOUNT You can use territory to refer to an area of knowledge or experience. 领域 [with supp] 4. virgin territory →see virgin 5. N-VAR An animal's territory is an area which it regards as its own and which it defends when other animals try to enter it. (动物的) 地盘 6. N-UNCOUNT Territory is land with a particular character. (具有某种特征的) 地带

1. N-COUNT A schedule is a plan that gives a list of events or tasks and the times at which each one should happen or be done. 日程安排 2. N-UNCOUNT You can use schedule to refer to the time or way something is planned to be done. For example, if something is completed on schedule, it is completed at the time planned. 计划的时间 3. V-T If something is scheduled to happen at a particular time, arrangements are made for it to happen at that time. 计划; 安排 [usu passive] 4. N-COUNT A schedule is a written list of things, for example, a list of prices, details, or conditions. (价格、细节或条件的) 明细表 5. N-COUNT A schedule is a list of all the times when trains, boats, buses, or aircraft are supposed to arrive at or leave a particular place. 时刻表 [美国英语] 6. N-COUNT In a school or college, a schedule is a diagram that shows the times in the week at which particular subjects are taught. 课程表 [美国英语]
n. 网飞公司
1. V to express great sorrow over (a person or thing); lament 哀悼

1. N-COUNT A pillar is a tall solid structure that is usually used to support part of a building. 柱子 2. N-COUNT If something is the pillar of a system or agreement, it is the most important part of it or what makes it strong and successful. (系统、协议的) 核心 3. N-COUNT If you describe someone as a pillar of society or as a pillar of the community, you approve of them because they play an important and active part in society or in the community. 栋梁 [表赞许]

1. N-UNCOUNT The extinction of a species of animal or plant is the death of all its remaining living members. (物种的) 灭绝 2. N-UNCOUNT If someone refers to the extinction of a way of life or type of activity, they mean that the way of life or activity stops existing. (生活方式、活动的) 消亡

1. V-T If you grab something, you take it or pick it up suddenly and roughly. 抓住 2. V-I If you grab at something, you try to grab it. (设法) 抓住 3. N-COUNT Grab is also a noun. 抓住 [usu sing, N 'for/at' n] 4. V-T If you grab someone who is walking past, you succeed in getting their attention. 引起…的注意 [非正式] 5. V-T If you grab someone's attention, you do something in order to make them notice you. 引起 (注意) 6. V-T If you grab something such as food, drink, or sleep, you manage to get some quickly. 匆忙地做 [非正式] 7. to grab hold of →see hold 8. PHRASE If something is up for grabs, it is available to anyone who is interested. 任何人都可竞购的 [非正式]
n. 日本丰田汽车（公司名）
1. N-COUNT A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet. 行星
1. N-COUNT A pact is a formal agreement between two or more people, organizations, or governments to do a particular thing or to help each other. 条约; 协议

1. N-COUNT A hoe is a gardening tool with a long handle and a small square blade, which you use to remove small weeds and break up the surface of the soil. 锄头 2. V-T If you hoe a field or crop, you use a hoe on the weeds or soil there. 锄 (以除杂草或松土)
n. 斯诺登（姓氏）

1. V-I If something or someone plunges in a particular direction, especially into water, they fall, rush, or throw themselves in that direction. 纵身跳向; 猛冲向 2. N-COUNT Plunge is also a noun. 投入 (水中); 俯冲 3. V-T If you plunge an object into something, you push it quickly or violently into it. (猛地) 将…推入 4. V-T/V-I If a person or thing is plunged into a particular state or situation, or if they plunge into it, they are suddenly in that state or situation. 使突然陷入; 突然陷入 5. N-COUNT Plunge is also a noun. 突然陷入 6. V-T/V-I If you plunge into an activity or are plunged into it, you suddenly get very involved in it. 使突然开始; 突然开始 7. N-COUNT Plunge is also a noun. 突然开始 8. V-I If an amount or rate plunges, it decreases quickly and suddenly. 骤降 9. N-COUNT Plunge is also a noun. 骤降 10. PHRASE If you take the plunge, you decide to do something that you consider difficult or risky. 决定冒险一试
n. 采用；收养；接受

1. V-T/V-I When you pack a bag, you put clothes and other things into it, because you are leaving a place or going on holiday. 打点 (行装) 2. packing N-UNCOUNT 打包; 包装 3. V-T When people pack things, for example, in a factory, they put them into containers or boxes so that they can be shipped and sold. 包装; 把…装箱 4. packing N-UNCOUNT 包装; 装箱 5. V-T/V-I If people or things pack into a place or if they pack a place, there are so many of them that the place is full. 挤满 6. V to fill (a legislative body, committee, etc) with one's own supporters 把自己的支持者安插进(立法机构等) 7. N-COUNT A pack of things is a collection of them that is sold or given together in a box or bag. 盒; 包 8. N-COUNT You can refer to a group of people who go around together as a pack, especially when it is a large group that you feel threatened by. 一群 (尤指令人感到受到威胁的) 9. N-COUNT a bundle or load, esp one carried on the back (背的)一捆 10. N-COUNT (as modifier) 驮 11. N-COUNT A pack of wolves or dogs is a group of them that hunt together. 一群 (狼或狗) 12. N-COUN
1. N → another name for jellyfish, jellyfish
经济适用房；可支付住宅

1. V-T If someone infringes a law or a rule, they break it or do something that disobeys it. 违反 2. V-T/V-I If something infringes people's rights, or infringes on them, it interferes with these rights and does not allow people the freedom they are entitled to. 侵犯

1. N-COUNT A plough is a large farming tool with sharp blades that is pulled across the soil to turn it over, usually before seeds are planted. 犁 2. → see also snowplough 3. V-T When someone ploughs an area of land, they turn over the soil using a plough. 犁 (地)

1. N-COUNT A fundraiser is an event which is intended to raise money for a particular purpose, for example, for a charity. 募集资金的活动 2. N-COUNT A fundraiser is someone who works to raise money for a particular purpose, for example, for a charity. 募集资金者
1. ADV Relatively means to a certain degree, especially when compared with other things of the same kind. 相对地 [ADV adj/adv]

1. V-T If one thing indicates another, the first thing shows that the second is true or exists. 表明 2. V-T If you indicate an opinion, an intention, or a fact, you mention it in an indirect way. 暗示 3. V-T If you indicate something to someone, you show them where it is, especially by pointing to it. 指示 [正式] 4. V-T If one thing indicates something else, it is a sign of that thing. 象征; 代表 5. V-T If a technical instrument indicates something, it shows a measurement or reading. (仪器等) 指示 6. V-T/V-I When drivers indicate, they make lights flash on one side of their vehicle to show that they are going to turn in that direction. (车辆打转向灯) 指示转向 [英国英语]

1. V-I If you retreat, you move away from something or someone. 退出; 离开 2. V-I When an army retreats, it moves away from enemy forces in order to avoid fighting them. 撤退 3. N-VAR Retreat is also a noun. 撤退 4. V-I If you retreat from something such as a plan or a way of life, you give it up, usually in order to do something safer or less extreme. 放弃 5. N-VAR Retreat is also a noun. 放弃 6. N-COUNT A retreat is a quiet, isolated place that you go to in order to rest or to do things in private. 隐居处; 休养处
1. ADJ If something or someone is lacking in a particular quality, they do not have any of it or enough of it. 缺乏的; 没有的 [v-link ADJ]

1. ADJ Colonial means relating to countries that are colonies, or to colonialism. 殖民地的; 殖民主义的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ A colonial building or piece of furniture was built or made in a style that was popular in America in the 17th and 18th centuries. (17和18世纪美洲) 殖民地时期风格的 [美国英语]

1. V-T If you untangle something that is knotted or has become twisted around something, you undo the knots in it or free it. 解开纠结 2. V-T If you untangle a confused or complicated situation, you make the different things involved clear, or put the situation right. 理清(混乱复杂的情况)
1. N-UNCOUNT CCTV is an abbreviation for "closed-circuit television." 闭路电视
n. 水藻 n. (Alga)人名；(法、俄)阿尔加

1. N-COUNT A bay is a part of a coast where the land curves inward. 海湾 2. N-COUNT A bay is a partly enclosed area, inside or outside a building, that is used for a particular purpose. (建筑物内或外辟作特定用途的) 隔区 3. N-COUNT A bay is an area of a room that extends beyond the main walls of a house, especially an area with a large window at the front of a house. (尤指位于房屋前端并装有大窗的) 凸出部分 4. ADJ A bay horse is reddish-brown in colour. 红棕色的 5.
