V-I If a number of people are baying for something, they are demanding something angrily, usually that someone should be punished. 愤怒地要求 [usu cont] 6. V-I If a dog or wolf bays, it makes loud, long cries. (犬或狼等) 嚎叫 7. PHRASE If you keep something or someone at bay, or hold them at bay, you prevent them from reaching, attacking, or affecting you. 使无法近身

1. ADJ If food, wood, or another substance is rotten, it has decayed and can no longer be used. 腐烂了的 2. ADJ If you describe something as rotten, you think it is very unpleasant or of very poor quality. 极差的 [非正式] 3. ADJ If you feel rotten, you feel bad, either because you are ill or because you are sorry about something. 糟糕的 [非正式]
adv. 商业上；通商上

1. ADV You use essentially to emphasize a quality that someone or something has, and to say that it is their most important or basic quality. 本质上 [正式] [ADV with cl/group] 2. ADV You use essentially to indicate that what you are saying is mainly true, although some parts of it are wrong or more complicated than has been stated. 基本上 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A bar is a place where you can buy and drink alcoholic drinks. 酒吧 [美国英语] 2. → see also snack bar, wine bar 3. N-COUNT A bar is a room in a hotel or other establishment where alcoholic drinks are served. (旅馆等的) 酒吧间 4. N-COUNT A bar is a counter on which alcoholic drinks are served. 吧台 5. N-COUNT A bar is a long, straight, stiff piece of metal. (金属)棒 6. PHRASE If you say that someone is behind bars, you mean that they are in prison. 在狱中的 7. N-COUNT A bar of something is a piece of it which is roughly rectangular. (长方形的) 条 8. V-T If you bar a door, you place something in front of it or a piece of wood or metal across it in order to prevent it from being opened. 闩 (门) 9. V-T If you bar someone's way, you prevent them from going somewhere or entering a place, by blocking their path. 挡 (路) 10. V-T If someone is barred from a place or from doing something, they are officially forbidden to go there or to do it. 禁止 [usu passive] 11. N-COUNT If something is a bar to doing a particular thing, it p
1. N-COUNT An incident is something that happens, often something that is unpleasant. 事件; 事故 [正式] [also 'without' N]
1. N-UNCOUNT The likelihood of something happening is how likely it is to happen. 可能性 2. N-SING If something is a likelihood, it is likely to happen. 可能发生的事情

1. V-T If you suspend something, you delay it or stop it from happening for a while or until a decision is made about it. 暂停 2. V-T If someone is suspended, they are prevented from holding a particular job or position for a fixed length of time or until a decision is made about them. 使停职 3. V-T If something is suspended from a high place, it is hanging from that place. 悬挂 [usu passive]

1. N-COUNT An echo is a sound caused by a noise being reflected off a surface such as a wall. 回声 2. V-I If a sound echoes, it is reflected off a surface and can be heard again after the original sound has stopped. 回响 3. V-I In a place that echoes, a sound is reflected off a surface, and is repeated after the original sound has stopped. 发出回声 4. V-T If you echo someone's words, you repeat them or express agreement with their attitude or opinion. 附和 5. N-COUNT A detail or feature that reminds you of something else can be referred to as an echo. 启示 6. V-T If one thing echoes another, the first is a copy of a particular detail or feature of the other. 反映 7. V-I If something echoes, it continues to be discussed and remains important or influential in a particular situation or among a particular group of people. 流传

1. N-SING The ocean is the sea. 大海 2. N-COUNT An ocean is one of the five very large areas of sea on the Earth's surface. 洋 3. N-COUNT If you say that there is an ocean of something, you are emphasizing that there is a very large amount of it. 极大量 [非正式] 4. PHRASE If you say that something is a drop in the ocean, you mean that it is a very small amount which is unimportant compared to the cost of other things or is so small that it has very little effect on something. 沧海一粟 [强调]
1. N the movement of a cell or organism in a particular direction in response to an external stimulus 趋性
n. 合作；协作
1. N the central core of dark hard wood in tree trunks, consisting of nonfunctioning xylem tissue that has become blocked with resins, tannins, and oils 心材 → compare sapwood

1. N-UNCOUNT Displacement is the removal of something from its usual place or position by something which then occupies that place or position. 替代 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Displacement is the forcing of people away from the area or country where they live. 逐出家园
1. N-VAR Diagnosis is the discovery and naming of what is wrong with someone who is ill or with something that is not working properly. 诊断

1. N-COUNT A question is something that you say or write in order to ask a person about something. 问题 2. V-T If you question someone, you ask them a lot of questions about something. 询问 3. questioning N-UNCOUNT 询问 4. V-T If you question something, you have or express doubts about whether it is true, reasonable, or worthwhile. 怀疑 5. N-SING If you say that there is some question about something, you mean that there is doubt or uncertainty about it. If something is in question or has been called into question, doubt or uncertainty has been expressed about it. 疑问; 不确定 6. N-COUNT A question is a problem, matter, or point which needs to be considered. (需考虑的) 问题 7. N-COUNT The questions on an examination are the problems that test your knowledge or ability. 试题 8. → see also questioning 9. PHRASE The person, thing, or time in question is one which you have just been talking about or which is relevant. 正被提及的; 有关的 10. PHRASE If you say that something is out of the question, you are emphasizing that it is com

1. N-UNCOUNT If you treat someone or something with scorn, you show contempt for them. 轻蔑; 鄙视 2. V-T If you scorn someone or something, you feel or show contempt for them. 鄙视; 看不起 3. V-T If you scorn something, you refuse to have it or accept it because you think it is not good enough or suitable for you. 摈弃

1. N-COUNT An umbrella is an object which you use to protect yourself from the rain or hot sun. It consists of a long stick with a folding frame covered in cloth. 伞 2. N-SING Umbrella is used to refer to a single group or description that includes a lot of different organizations or ideas. 总组织; 总称
adv. 慎重地，谨慎地
1. ABBREVIATION for independent publicly owned company 独立上市公司

1. N-COUNT An assault by an army is a strong attack made on an area held by the enemy. 猛攻 2. ADJ Assault weapons such as rifles are intended for soldiers to use in battle rather than for purposes such as hunting. 用于战争的 (武器) [ADJ n] 3. N-VAR An assault on a person is a physical attack on them. 袭击 [oft N 'on/upon' n] 4. V-T To assault someone means to physically attack them. 袭击

1. ADJ Soviet is used to describe something that belonged or related to the former Soviet Union. 前苏联的 [usu ADJ n] 2. N-PLURAL The Soviets were the people of the former Soviet Union. 前苏联人 3. N-COUNT A soviet was an elected local, regional, or national council in the former Soviet Union. (前苏联地方、区域或国家)代表议会

1. V-T/V-I In a sport or game, if a player scores a goal or a point, they gain a goal or point. (比赛中) 得分; 进球 2. V-T/V-I If you score a particular number or amount, for example, as a mark in a test, you achieve that number or amount. (测试) 得分 3. N-COUNT Someone's score in a game or test is a number, for example, a number of points or runs, which shows what they have achieved or what level they have reached. 得分; 分数 4. N-COUNT The score in a game is the result of it or the current situation, as indicated by the number of goals, runs, or points obtained by the two teams or players. 比分 5. V-T If you score a success, a victory, or a hit, you are successful in what you are doing. 赢得 [书面] 6. N-COUNT The score of a movie, play, or similar production is the music which is written or used for it. (电影、戏剧等演出的) 配乐 7. N-COUNT The score of a piece of music is the written version of it. 乐谱 8. QUANT If you refer to scores of things or people, you are emphasizing that there are very many of them. 大量 [书面] [QUANT 'of' pl-

1. ADJ Miniature is used to describe something that is very small, especially a smaller version of something which is normally much bigger. 微型的 [ADJ n] 2. PHRASE If you describe one thing as another thing in miniature, you mean that it is much smaller in size or scale than the other thing, but is otherwise exactly the same. 缩影 3. N-COUNT A miniature is a very small, detailed painting, often of a person. 袖珍画像
1. N-COUNT Cranberries are red berries with a sour taste. They are often used to make juice, or a sauce or jelly that you eat with meat. 小红莓 [usu pl, oft N n]
1. ADJ When you are conciliatory in your actions or behaviour, you show that you are willing to end a disagreement with someone. 愿意和解的
1. ADJ (of an animal) trained to perform tricks before an audience, as in a circus (动物)受过训练会玩把戏的
adv. 电子地
1. ADJ Statistical means relating to the use of statistics. 统计的; 统计学的 2. statistically ADV 统计上地; 统计学上地
1. ADJ When people begin an open-ended discussion or activity, they do not start with any intention of achieving a particular decision or result. 无预期结论的

1. N-COUNT You can refer to the most powerful, rich, or talented people within a particular group, place, or society as the elite. 精英 2. ADJ Elite people or organizations are considered to be the best of their kind. 精英的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A dilemma is a difficult situation in which you have to choose between two or more alternatives. 进退两难的局面
n. 斯坦福（姓氏，男子名）；斯坦福大学（美国一所大学）

1. ADJ In grammar, the past perfect tenses of a verb are the ones used to talk about things that happened before a specific time. The simple past perfect tense uses "had" and the past participle of the verb, as in "She had seen him before." It is sometimes called the . 过去完成时 [ADJ n]

1. ADJ A cosmopolitan place or society is full of people from many different countries and cultures. 世界性的 [表赞许] 2. ADJ Someone who is cosmopolitan has had a lot of contact with people and things from many different countries and as a result is very open to different ideas and ways of doing things. 见多识广的 [表赞许]

1. V-T If one thing spurs you to do another, it encourages you to do it. 鼓动; 激励 2. PHRASAL VERB Spur on means the same as . 鼓动; 激励 (同)(spur) 3. V-T If something spurs a change or event, it makes it happen faster or sooner. 使更快发生; 加速 [journalism] 4. N-COUNT Something that acts as a spur to something else encourages a person or organization to do that thing or makes it happen more quickly. 促进因素; 推动 5. PHRASE If you do something on the spur of the moment, you do it suddenly, without planning it beforehand. 一时冲动之下
n. 热带草原 n. (Campos)人名；(法、西、葡、英)坎波斯

1. N-COUNT A patch on a surface is a part of it that is different in appearance from the area around it. (与周围不同的) 块; 片 2. N-COUNT A patch of land is a small area of land where a particular plant or crop grows. 小块田地 3. N-COUNT A patch is a piece of material that you use to cover a hole in something. 补丁 4. N-COUNT A patch is a small piece of material that you wear to cover an injured eye. (保护受伤眼睛的) 眼罩 5. V-T If you patch something that has a hole in it, you repair it by fastening a patch over the hole. 打补丁 6. N-COUNT A patch is a piece of computer program code written as a temporary solution for dealing with a computer virus and distributed by the makers of the original program. (对付计算机病毒的) 补丁 [计算机] 7. PHRASE If you have or go through a rough patch, you have a lot of problems for a time. 一段艰难时期

1. N-UNCOUNT Conquest is the act of conquering a country or group of people. 征服 [also N in pl, oft N 'of' n] 2. N-SING Theconquestof something such as a problem is success in ending it or dealing with it. 克服
v. 合作；协作（co-operate的ing形式）

1. N-UNCOUNT-COLL In a game of cards, trumps is the suit which is chosen to have the highest value in one particular game. (牌戏中的) 王牌 2. N-COUNT In a game of cards, a trump is a playing card which belongs to the suit which has been chosen as trumps. (一张) 王牌 3. N a trumpet or the sound produced by one 小号; 小号声 4. V-T If you trump what someone has said or done, you beat it by saying or doing something else that seems better. (因说或做得更好而) 胜过 5. V to produce a sound upon or as if upon the trumpet 发出小号声; 发出小号似的声音 6. PHRASE Your trump card is something powerful that you can use or do, which gives you an advantage over someone. 某人的王牌
1. N-UNCOUNT Slavery is the system by which people are owned by other people as slaves. 奴隶制
n. 佛瑞德（男子名）

1. N-COUNT A mantra is a word or phrase repeated by Buddhists and Hindus when they meditate, or to help them feel calm. (佛教和印度教中的) 祷语 2. N-COUNT You can use mantra to refer to a statement or a principle that people repeat very often because they think it is true, especially when you think that it not true or is only part of the truth. 准则
1. N-UNCOUNT A person's sanity is their ability to think and behave normally and reasonably. 心智健全; 神志正常

1. V-T If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly. 扔下; 倾倒 [非正式] 2. V-T If something is dumped somewhere, it is put or left there because it is no longer wanted or needed. 丢弃 [非正式] 3. dumping N-UNCOUNT 倾倒; 丢弃 4. V-T To dump something such as an idea, policy, or practice means to stop supporting or using it. 抛弃 (念头、政策或惯例) [非正式] 5. V-T If a firm or company dumps goods, it sells large quantities of them at prices far below their real value, usually in another country, in order to gain a bigger market share or to keep prices high in the home market. 倾销 [商业] 6. V-T If you dump someone, you end your relationship with them. 抛弃 (某人) [非正式] 7. V-T To dump computer data or memory means to copy it from one storage system onto another, such as from disk to magnetic tape. 转储 [计算机] 8. N-COUNT A dump is a place where rubbish and waste material are left, for example, on open ground outside a town. 垃圾场 9. N-COUNT If you say that a place is a dump, you think it is ugly and unp

1. N-UNCOUNT Plague or the plague is a very infectious disease that usually results in death. The patient has a severe fever and swellings on his or her body. 瘟疫 [also 'the' N] 2. N-COUNT A plague of unpleasant things is a large number of them that arrive or happen at the same time. 泛滥 3. V-T If you are plagued by unpleasant things, they continually cause you a lot of trouble or suffering. 使困扰

1. V-RECIP If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap. 重叠 2. V-RECIP If one idea or activity overlaps another, or overlaps with another, they involve some of the same subjects, people, or periods of time. 与…重合 3. N-VAR Overlap is also a noun. 重合

1. N-UNCOUNT You use jargon to refer to words and expressions that are used in special or technical ways by particular groups of people, often making the language difficult to understand. 行话 2. V to use or speak in jargon 说行话; 使用术语 3. N a golden yellow, smoky, or colourless variety of zircon 黄锆英石 (Also jargoon) [mineralogy] [RARE]

1. N-COUNT A bribe is a sum of money or something valuable that one person offers or gives to another in order to persuade him or her to do something. 贿赂 2. V-T If one person bribes another, they give them a bribe. 贿赂
1. ADJ If you are punctual, you do something or arrive somewhere at the right time and are not late. 准时的 2. punctually ADV 准时地
1. ADJ A repressive government is one that restricts people's freedom and controls them by using force. (政府) 镇压的; 压迫的 [表不满]

1. ADJ Someone who is dumb is completely unable to speak. 哑的 2. ADJ If someone is dumb on a particular occasion, they cannot speak because they are angry, shocked, or surprised. 说不出话的 [文学性] [v-link ADJ] 3. ADJ If you call a person dumb, you mean that they are stupid or foolish. 蠢的 [非正式] 4. ADJ If you say that something is dumb, you think that it is silly and annoying. 愚蠢而恼人的 [美国英语] [非正式]

1. V-I When people or things sway, they lean or swing slowly from one side to the other. 摇摆 2. V-T If you are swayed by someone or something, you are influenced by them. 影响 3. PHRASE If someone or something holds sway, they have great power or influence over a particular place or activity. 统治

1. N-UNCOUNT Someone's property is all the things that belong to them or something that belongs to them. 财产 [正式] 2. N-VAR A property is a building and the land belonging to it. 房地产 [正式] 3. N-COUNT The properties of a substance or object are the ways in which it behaves in particular conditions. (物质、物体的) 特性

1. V-T If someone hijacks a plane or other vehicle, they illegally take control of it by force while it is travelling from one place to another. 劫持 2. N-COUNT Hijack is also a noun. 劫持 3. hijacking N-COUNT 劫持 4. V-T If you say that someone has hijacked something, you disapprove of the way in which they have taken control of it when they had no right to do so. 强行控制 [表不满]

1. V-T To demonstrate a fact means to make it clear to people. 证明 2. V-T If you demonstrate a particular skill, quality, or feeling, you show by your actions that you have it. 展现 (才能、品质、感情) 3. V-I When people demonstrate, they march or gather somewhere to show their opposition to something or their support for something. 游行示威 4. V-T If you demonstrate something, you show people how it works or how to do it. 展示
1. Threw is the past tense of . (throw)的过去式

1. N-COUNT A tightrope is a tightly stretched piece of rope on which someone balances and performs tricks in a circus. (马戏团表演用的)绷索; 钢丝 2. N-COUNT You can use tightrope in expressions such as walk a tightrope and live on a tightrope to indicate that someone is in a difficult situation and has to be very careful about what they say or do. (走)钢丝; 比喻处境艰难，必须小心行事 [usu sing]
1. N-COUNT A gramophone is an old-fashioned type of record player. 留声机

1. N-COUNT Ripples are little waves on the surface of water caused by the wind or by something moving in or on the water. 涟漪 2. V-T/V-I When the surface of an area of water ripples or when something ripples it, a number of little waves appear on it. 使泛起涟漪; 泛起涟漪 3. V-I If something such as a feeling ripples over someone's body, it moves across it or through it. (感觉等) 扩散全身 [文学性] 4. N-COUNT If an event causes ripples, its effects gradually spread, causing several other events to happen one after the other. 连锁反应 5. N a special kind of comb designed to separate the seed from the stalks in flax, hemp, or broomcorn 麻梳(用来梳除亚麻茎、棕榈或高粱上籽的粗钢梳) 6. V to comb with this tool (用麻梳)梳理
1. ADJ A manned vehicle such as a spacecraft has people in it who are operating its controls. 载人的 2. → see also man
1. V-T If you swat something such as an insect, you hit it with a quick, swinging movement, using your hand or a flat object. 抽打

1. ADV If you say that something duly happened or was done, you mean that it was expected to happen or was requested, and it did happen or it was done. 如期地 [ADV before v] 2. ADV If something is duly done, it is done in the correct way. 适当地 [正式] [ADV before v]

1. V-RECIP If you swap something with someone, you give it to them and receive a different thing in exchange. 交换 2. N-COUNT Swap is also a noun. 交换 3. V-T If you swap one thing for another, you remove the first thing and replace it with the second, or you stop doing the first thing and start doing the second. 调换

1. N-VAR A dispute is an argument or disagreement between people or groups. 争论 2. V-T If you dispute a fact, statement, or theory, you say that it is incorrect or untrue. 反驳 3. V-RECIP When people dispute something, they fight for control or ownership of it. You can also say that one group of people dispute something with another group. 争夺 (控制权、所有权) 4. PHRASE If two or more people or groups are in dispute, they are arguing or disagreeing about something. (人或组织) 有争议的 5. PHRASE If something is in dispute, people are questioning it or arguing about it. (某事物) 有争议的

1. PHRASAL VERB When you set out, you start a journey. 启程; 出发 2. PHRASAL VERB If you set out to do something, you start trying to do it. 开始努力 3. PHRASAL VERB If you set things out, you arrange or display them somewhere. 摆出; 陈列 4. PHRASAL VERB If you set out a number of facts, beliefs, or arguments, you explain them in writing or speech in a clear, organized way. 阐述; 提出

1. N-COUNT A nightmare is a very frightening dream. 恶梦 2. N-COUNT If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you mean that it is very frightening and unpleasant. 噩梦 (指可怕处境) 3. N-COUNT If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you are saying in a very emphatic way that it is irritating because it causes you a lot of trouble. 噩梦 (指恼人的情况) [强调]
1. V-I If you cower, you bend forward and downward because you are very frightened. 萎缩; 蜷缩
1. ADJ If you are proficient in something, you can do it well. 精通的
1. N-COUNT A repository is a place where something is kept safely. 贮存处; 存放处 [正式]

1. V-T If you remove something from a place, you take it away. 移开 [书面] 2. V-T If you remove clothing, you take it off. 脱下; 摘下 [书面] 3. V-T If you remove a stain from something, you make the stain disappear by treating it with a chemical or by washing it. 去除 (痕迹); 洗掉 (污渍) 4. V-T If people remove someone from power or from something such as a committee, they stop them from being in power or being a member of the committee. 把…免职 5. V-T If you remove an obstacle, a restriction, or a problem, you get rid of it. 去除 (障碍或限制); 解决 (问题)
与此相反；比较起来

1. V-T/V-I If someone underperforms in something such as a sports contest, or if one thing underperforms another thing, they do not perform as well as they could, or they perform less well than the other thing. 表现不佳 2. underperformer N-COUNT
1. ADJ Investigative work, especially journalism, involves investigating things. 调查的

1. N-COUNT An executive is someone who is employed by a business at a senior level. Executives decide what the business should do, and ensure that it is done. 执行总监 2. ADJ The executive sections and tasks of an organization are concerned with the making of decisions and with ensuring that decisions are carried out. 执行的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ Executive goods are expensive products designed or intended for executives and other people at a similar social or economic level. 高级的 [ADJ n] 4. N-SING The executive committee or board of an organization is a committee within that organization that has the authority to make decisions and ensures that these decisions are carried out. 执行委员会 ['the' N, N n] 5. N-SING The executive is the part of the government of a country that is concerned with carrying out decisions or orders, as opposed to the part that makes laws or the part that deals with criminals. (政府的) 行政部门 ['the' N, N n]

1. N-COUNT A retrospective is an exhibition or showing of work done by an artist over many years, rather than his or her most recent work. (艺术家作品的) 回顾展 2. ADJ Retrospective feelings or opinions concern things that happened in the past. 回顾的 3. retrospectively ADV 回顾地 4. ADJ Retrospective laws or legal actions take effect from a date before the date when they are officially approved. 有追溯力的 (法律) [英国英语]

1. N (in Roman tradition) the king and ruler of the Olympian gods (罗马传说中的)朱庇特; 奥林匹亚的众神之主 (Greek counterpart Zeus) 1. N the largest of the planets and the fifth from the sun. It has 16 satellites and is surrounded by a transient planar ring system consisting of dust particles. Mean distance from sun: 778 million km; period of revolution around sun: 11.86 years; period of axial rotation: 9.83 hours; diameter and mass: 11.2 and 317.9 times that of earth respectively 木星 →see Galilean satellite

1. V-T If you undermine something such as a feeling or a system, you make it less strong or less secure than it was before, often by a gradual process or by repeated efforts. 逐渐削弱; 逐渐动摇 2. V-T If you undermine someone or undermine their position or authority, you make their authority or position less secure, often by indirect methods. (通常以间接方式) 动摇 (某人的地位或权威) 3. V-T If you undermine someone's efforts or undermine their chances of achieving something, you behave in a way that makes them less likely to succeed. 破坏; 损害 (某人的努力或成功的机会)
1. ADJ Multilingual means involving several different languages. 多种语言的 [usu ADJ n] 2. ADJ A multilingual person is able to speak more than two languages very well. 懂多种语言的; 能说多种语言的
1. N-COUNT A procession is a group of people who are walking, riding, or driving in a line as part of a public event. (行走、骑行、开车等的) 队伍
1. V-T If you spurn someone or something, you reject them. 拒绝
1. V-RECIP If one event coincides with another, they happen at the same time. 同时发生 2. V-RECIP If the ideas or interests of two or more people coincide, they are the same. (观点或兴趣) 一致

1. V-I If you plead with someone to do something, you ask them in an intense, emotional way to do it. 恳求 2. V-I When someone charged with a crime pleads guilty or not guilty in a court of law, they officially state that they are guilty or not guilty of the crime. 表示服罪/不服罪 3. V-T If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence. 为…辩护 4. V-T If you plead a particular thing as the reason for doing or not doing something, you give it as your excuse. 以…为借口
1. N-UNCOUNT Bliss is a state of complete happiness. 极乐
1. N-UNCOUNT Gambling is the act or activity of betting money, for example in card games or on horse racing. 赌博
1. ADJ boiling or foaming as if boiling 沸腾的
n. 拉斐尔（男子名，来源于圣经故事）

1. V-T If you hit someone or something, you deliberately touch them with a lot of force, with your hand or an object held in your hand. 打 2. V-T When one thing hits another, it touches it with a lot of force. 猛撞 3. V-T If a bomb or missile hits its target, it reaches it. (炸弹或导弹) 击中 4. N-COUNT Hit is also a noun. 击中 5. V-T If something hits a person, place, or thing, it affects them very badly. 对…造成严重影响 [journalism] 6. V-T When a feeling or an idea hits you, it suddenly affects you or comes into your mind. 使突然意识到 7. V-T If you hit a particular high or low point on a scale of something such as success or health, you reach it. 达到 [journalism] 8. N-COUNT If a CD, film, or play is a hit, it is very popular and successful. (唱片、电影或戏剧的) 成功 9. N-COUNT A hit is a single visit to a website. (网站的) 点击 [计算机] 10. N-COUNT If someone who is searching for information on the Internet gets a hit, they find a website where there is that information. (在互联网上搜到) 所要找的网页 11. PHRASE If two people hit it off, they like each
1. N-COUNT A fairy is an imaginary creature with magical powers. Fairies are often represented as small people with wings. 仙女
1. N-COUNT A duke is a man with a very high social rank in the nobility of some countries. 公爵

1. V-T If you derive something such as pleasure or benefit from a person or from something, you get it from them. 获得 [正式] 2. V-T/V-I If you say that something such as a word or feeling derives or is derived from something else, you mean that it comes from that thing. 衍生

1. ADJ If you say that someone has a rosy face, you mean that they have pink cheeks and look very healthy. (面色) 红润的 2. ADJ If you say that a situation looks rosy or that the picture looks rosy, you mean that the situation seems likely to be good or successful. 乐观的
1. N-COUNT An inquisition is an official investigation, especially one that is very thorough and uses harsh methods of questioning. 官方调查
1. PHRASAL VERB If you hand back something that you have borrowed or taken from someone, you return it to them. 归还
1. ADJ Someone who is pessimistic thinks that bad things are going to happen. 悲观的
n. (Goodluck)人名；(英)古德勒克

1. V-T/V-I If you manoeuvre something into or out of an awkward position, you skilfully move it there. (熟练地) 移动 2. N-VAR Manoeuvre is also a noun. 移动 3. V-T/V-I If you manoeuvre a situation, you change it in a clever and skilful way so that you can benefit from it. 操控 4. N-COUNT Manoeuvre is also a noun. 操控手段 5. N-PLURAL Military manoeuvres are training exercises which involve the movement of soldiers and equipment over a large area. 演习

1. ADV You use positively to emphasize that you really mean what you are saying. 绝对地 [ADV adj-superl] [强调] 2. ADV You use positively to emphasize that something really is the case, although it may sound surprising or extreme. 真正地 [强调]

1. ADJ Triple means consisting of three things or parts. 三个的; 三部分的 [ADJ n] 2. V-T/V-I If something triples or if you triple it, it becomes three times as large in size or number. 使成为三倍; 变成三倍 3. PREDET If something is triple the amount or size of another thing, it is three times as large. 3倍的 [PREDET 'the' n]

1. N-COUNT The gears on a machine or vehicle are a device for changing the rate at which energy is changed into motion. 排挡 2. N-UNCOUNT The gear involved in a particular activity is the equipment or special clothing that you use. (用于特定活动的) 设备、服装 3. N-UNCOUNT Gear means clothing. 衣服 [非正式] 4. V-T PASSIVE If someone or something is geared to or toward a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose. 使适合

1. N-VAR A recession is a period when the economy of a country is doing badly, for example because industry is producing less and more people are becoming unemployed. 经济衰退; 萧条 2. N the act of restoring possession to a former owner 物归原主
adj. 较小，更小的

1. N-COUNT If you say that a good event is a miracle, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected. 奇迹 2. ADJ A miracle drug or product does something that was thought almost impossible. 神奇的 [journalism] [ADJ n] 3. N-COUNT A miracle is a wonderful and surprising event that is believed to be caused by God. 上帝创造的奇迹
1. N-VAR A mishap is an unfortunate but not very serious event that happens to someone. 小灾难
1. N-COUNT A physicist is a person who does research connected with physics or who studies physics. 物理学家
1. ADJ (of a plant) having a long stem which spreads over the ground or hangs loosely (植物)蔓生的

1. ADJ Evangelical Christians emphasize the importance of the Bible and the need for a personal belief in Christ. 福音派的 2. ADJ If you describe someone's behaviour as evangelical, you mean that it is very enthusiastic. 热衷的; 狂热的 [usu ADJ n]
n. 迁移；移民；移动

1. ADJ Something that is sacred is believed to be holy and to have a special connection with God. 神圣的 2. ADJ Something connected with religion or used in religious ceremonies is described as sacred. 宗教的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ You can describe something as sacred when it is regarded as too important to be changed or interfered with. 不容更改的; 不容干涉的
n. 萨利赫（人名）
1. N-COUNT A facet of something is a single part or aspect of it. 方面 2. N-COUNT The facets of a diamond or other precious stone are the flat surfaces that have been cut on its outside. (钻石等的) 刻面
n. 人口统计资料
1. V-T To facilitate an action or process, especially one that you would like to happen, means to make it easier or more likely to happen. 促进
1. N-COUNT A ligament is a band of strong tissue in a person's body which connects bones. 韧带

1. ADJ If you are disposed to do something, you are willing or eager to do it. 愿意的 [正式] [v-link ADJ to-inf] 2. ADJ You can use disposed when you are talking about someone's general attitude or opinion. For example, if you are well or favourably disposed to or toward someone or something, you like them or approve of them. 持…态度的; 有…看法的 [正式]
赫尔佐克（人名）

1. N-COUNT A rider is someone who rides a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a hobby or job. You can also refer to someone who is riding a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a rider. 骑手; 骑 (马、自行车、摩托车) 的人
1. ADJ Something that is arcane is secret or mysterious. 秘密的; 神秘的 [正式]
1. ADJ High-tech activities or equipment involve or result from the use of high technology. 高科技的

1. N-COUNT Someone's wages are the amount of money that is regularly paid to them for the work that they do. 工资 2. V-T If a person, group, or country wages a campaign or a war, they start it and continue it over a period of time. 发动 (运动或战争)
1. N-UNCOUNT Parenting is the activity of bringing up and taking care of your child. 养育子女
n. (Piketty)人名；(法)皮凯蒂
n. 白沙瓦（巴基斯坦北部城市）
adj. 有某种面孔或表情的；有…表面的 v. 面对（face的过去分词）
n. 利物浦
唐宁
1. ADJ If you say that something, usually something bad, is rife in a place or that the place is rife with it, you mean that it is very common. (常指坏事) 普遍的; 猖獗的 [v-link ADJ]

1. ADJ If something is destined to happen or if someone is destined to behave in a particular way, that thing seems certain to happen or be done. 注定的 2. ADJ If someone is destined for a particular place, or if goods are destined for a particular place, they are travelling toward that place or will be sent to that place. 去往某地的 [v-link ADJ 'for' n]

1. V-T If you anticipate an event, you realize in advance that it may happen and you are prepared for it. 预期 2. V-T If you anticipate a question, request, or need, you do what is necessary or required before the question, request, or need occurs. 预先准备

1. N-COUNT Your stomach is the organ inside your body where food is digested before it moves into the intestines. 胃 2. N-COUNT You can refer to the front part of your body below your waist as your stomach. 肚子 3. N-COUNT If the front part of your body below your waist feels uncomfortable because you are feeling worried or frightened, you can refer to it as your stomach. 心窝 4. N-COUNT If you say that someone has a strong stomach, you mean that they are not disgusted by things that disgust most other people. 忍耐力 5. V-T If you cannot stomach something, you cannot accept it because you dislike it or disapprove of it. 忍受 [with brd-neg] 6. PHRASE If you do something on an empty stomach, you do it without having eaten. 空腹

1. V-I If you intervene in a situation, you become involved in it and try to change it. 干预 2. V-I If you intervene, you interrupt a conversation in order to add something to it. 插话 3. V-I If an event intervenes, it happens suddenly in a way that stops, delays, or prevents something from happening. 干扰
n. [机] 熔模铸造 v. 投资；授与（invest的现在分词）

1. ADJ If you are mistaken about something, you are wrong about it. 弄错的 [v-link ADJ] 2. PHRASE You use expressions such as if I'm not mistaken and unless I'm very much mistaken as a polite way of emphasizing the statement you are making, especially when you are confident that it is correct. 如果我没搞错的话 (委婉地表示强调，尤指自信为正确) [强调] 3. ADJ A mistaken belief or opinion is incorrect. (信念或观点) 错误的 [ADJ n] 4. mistakenly ADV 错误地 [ADV with v]

1. N-UNCOUNT Leverage is the ability to influence situations or people so that you can control what happens. 影响力 2. V-T To leverage a company or investment means to use borrowed money in order to buy it or pay for it. 举债经营 [商业]
1. N-UNCOUNT Annoyance is the feeling that you get when someone makes you feel fairly angry or impatient. 厌烦 2. N-COUNT An annoyance is something that makes you feel angry or impatient. 烦人的事物
1. N a bag made of brown paper, often used for carrying a packed lunch or alcohol (常用来装午餐或瓶酒的)棕色纸袋 2. V to take a packed lunch in a brown bag 用棕色袋带午餐
n. 施密特（姓氏）
1. N-UNCOUNT Sunlight is the light that comes from the sun during the day. 阳光

1. N-COUNT A disability is a permanent injury, illness, or physical or mental condition that tends to restrict the way that someone can live their life. (身体或精神方面的) 残疾 2. N-UNCOUNT Disability is the state of being disabled. 残疾状态
n. 米歇尔（男子名）
1. ADJ A transitive verb has a direct object. (动词) 及物的
1. ADJ You use proverbial to show that you know the way you are describing something is one that is often used or is part of a popular saying. 谚语的 [ADJ n]

1. ADV If people have a particular number of things apiece, they have that number each. 每人地 [amount ADV] 2. ADV If a number of similar things are for sale at a certain price apiece, that is the price for each one of them. 各 [amount ADV]
1. V-T If you refute an argument, accusation, or theory, you prove that it is wrong or untrue. 驳倒 [正式] 2. V-T If you refute an argument or accusation, you say that it is not true. 否认 [正式]
1. V-T If you scold someone, you speak angrily to them because they have done something wrong. 责骂 [正式]
1. ADV You use strictly to emphasize that something is of one particular type, or intended for one particular thing or person, rather than any other. 仅限于 [ADV group] [强调]
1. N a method of issuing securities to the public using an intermediary, such as a stockbroking firm 配售; 一种通过中介机构，比如证券经纪公司，发行证券的方法 [stock exchange]

1. V-T If you manage an organization, business, or system, or the people who work in it, you are responsible for controlling them. 管理; 经营 (机构、企业、系统等) 2. V-T If you manage time, money, or other resources, you deal with them carefully and do not waste them. 管理 (时间、金钱等) 3. V-T If you manage to do something, especially something difficult, you succeed in doing it. 设法 (做成某事) 4. V-I If you manage, you succeed in coping with a difficult situation. 成功应对 5. V-T If you say that you can manage an amount of time or money for something, you mean that you can afford to spend that time or money on it. 腾出 (时间、金钱等) 6. V-T If you say that someone managed a particular response, such as a laugh or a greeting, you mean that it was difficult for them to do it because they were feeling sad or upset. 勉强做出 (某种回应) 7. CONVENTION You say "I can manage" or "I'll manage" as a way of refusing someone's offer of help and insisting on doing something by yourself. 我能应付

1. N-COUNT The wheels of a vehicle are the circular objects that are attached underneath it and that enable it to move along the ground. 车轮 2. N-COUNT A wheel is a circular object that forms a part of a machine, usually a moving part. 机轮 3. N-COUNT The wheel of a car or other vehicle is the circular object that is used to steer it. The wheel is used in expressions to talk about who is driving a vehicle. For example, if someone is at the wheel or behind the wheel of a car, they are driving it. 方向盘 4. V-T If you wheel an object that has wheels somewhere, you push it along. 推 (带轮子的物体) 5. N-PLURAL People talk about the wheels of an organization or system to mean the way in which it operates. (组织或系统的) 运作方式 6. → see also steering wheel

1. V-T If someone violates an agreement, law, or promise, they break it. 违反 [正式] 2. violation N-VAR 违反 3. V-T If you violate someone's privacy or peace, you disturb it. 侵犯 [正式] 4. V-T If someone violates a special place such as a grave, they damage it or treat it with disrespect. 亵渎 5. violation N-UNCOUNT 亵渎
1. ADJ Something that is intrusive disturbs your mood or your life in a way you do not like. 打扰的
1. N-COUNT Mammals are animals such as humans, dogs, lions, and whales. In general, female mammals give birth to babies rather than laying eggs, and feed their young with milk. 哺乳动物
极右派；极端保守主义

1. ADJ Philosophical means concerned with or relating to philosophy. 哲学的 2. philosophically ADV 哲学地 3. ADJ Someone who is philosophical does not get upset when disappointing or disturbing things happen. 泰然自若的 [表赞许] 4. philosophically ADV 泰然自若地 [ADV after v]
1. ADJ When someone in authority is lenient, they are not as strict or severe as expected. 宽大的 2. leniently ADV 宽大地 [ADV after v]

1. V-T/V-I If you snatch something or snatch at something, you take it or pull it away quickly. 迅速拿走; 夺取 2. V-T If something is snatched from you, it is stolen, usually using force. If a person is snatched, they are taken away by force. 强抢 [usu passive] 3. V-T If you snatch an opportunity, you take it quickly. If you snatch something to eat or a rest, you have it quickly in between doing other things. 抓紧 (时机或时间) 4. V-T If you snatch victory in a competition, you defeat your opponent by a small amount or just before the end of the contest. 侥幸获得 5. N-COUNT A snatch of a conversation or a song is a very small piece of it. (谈话或歌曲的) 片断
1. V-T To reveal something means to make people aware of it. 透露; 显示 2. V-T If you reveal something that has been out of sight, you uncover it so that people can see it. 使显露; 揭露
1. N-COUNT Your forebears are your ancestors. 祖先 [文学性] [usu with poss]

1. N-MASS Perfume is a pleasant-smelling liquid that women put on their skin to make themselves smell nice. 香水 2. N-MASS Perfume is the ingredient that is added to some products to make them smell nice. 香料 3. V-T If something is used to perfume a product, it is added to the product to make it smell nice. 给…添加香味
n. 里韦拉（乌拉圭北部最重要的边境城市，里韦拉省首府）

1. N-COUNT A hazard is something which could be dangerous to you, your health or safety, or your plans or reputation. 危险 2. V-T If you hazard or if you hazard a guess, you make a suggestion about something which is only a guess and which you know might be wrong. 大胆猜测
1. N-VAR Theft is the crime of stealing. 盗窃

1. V-T If you deliver something somewhere, you take it there. 递送 2. V-T/V-I If you deliver something that you have promised to do, make, or produce, you do, make, or produce it. 实现; 履行 3. V-T If you deliver a lecture or speech, you give it in public. 发表 [正式] 4. V-T When someone delivers a baby, they help the woman who is giving birth to the baby. 给 (产妇) 接生 5. V-T If someone delivers a blow to someone else, they hit them. 给予 (打击) [书面]
1. N-COUNT A wrapper is a piece of paper, plastic, or thin metal that covers and protects something that you buy, especially food. (尤指食品的) 外包装
1. N-SING If there is an upsurge in something, there is a sudden, large increase in it. 剧增
1. N-UNCOUNT Parenthood is the state of being a parent. 父母的身份
1. N-COUNT A clinic is a building where people go to receive medical advice or treatment. 诊所
1. N-COUNT An occurrence is something that happens. 发生的事情 [正式] 2. N-COUNT The occurrence of something is the fact that it happens or is present. (某事物的) 发生; 存在
1. ADJ Bureaucratic means involving complicated rules and procedures which can cause long delays. 官僚主义的 [表不满]
尽管；虽然
n. 免疫力；豁免权；免除

1. V-T When you receive something, you get it after someone gives it to you or sends it to you. 接到; 收到 2. V-T You can use receive to say that certain kinds of things happen to someone. For example if they are injured, you can say that they received an injury. 受到; 遭受 3. V-T When you receive a visitor or a guest, you greet them. 接待; 迎接 4. V-T If you say that something is received in a particular way, you mean that people react to it in that way. (用某种特定方式) 回应 [usu passive] 5. V-T When a radio or television receives signals that are being transmitted, it picks them up and converts them into sound or pictures. 接收 (信号) 6. PHRASE If you are on the receiving end or at the receiving end of something unpleasant, you are the person that it happens to. 成为 (不愉快事件的) 承受方

1. N-SING The gamut of something is the complete range of things of that kind, or a wide variety of things of that kind. 全范围; 所有 [usu 'the' N 'of' n] 2. PHRASE To run the gamut of something means to include, express, or experience all the different things of that kind, or a wide variety of them. 囊括…的全部
1. ADJ If you describe something or someone as wonderful, you think they are extremely good. 极好的 2. wonderfully ADV 极好地

1. N-VAR A monarchy is a system in which a country has a monarch. 君主制 2. N-COUNT A monarchy is a country that has a monarch. 君主国 3. N-COUNT The monarchy is used to refer to the monarch and his or her family. 王室

1. N-COUNT A deposit is a sum of money which is part of the full price of something, and which you pay when you agree to buy it. 保证金 2. N-COUNT A deposit is a sum of money which is in a bank account or savings account, especially a sum which will be left there for some time. 存款 3. N-COUNT A deposit is an amount of a substance that has been left somewhere as a result of a chemical or geological process. 沉积物; 矿床 4. N-COUNT A deposit is a sum of money which you pay when you start renting something. The money is returned to you if you do not damage what you have rented. 押金 [usu sing] 5. N-COUNT A deposit is a sum of money which you put into a bank account. 银行存款 6. V-T If you deposit a sum of money, you put it into a bank account or savings account. 存储 7. V-T To deposit someone or something somewhere means to put them or leave them there. 放置 8. V-T If you deposit something somewhere, you put it where it will be safe until it is needed again. 寄存
1. V-T To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it. 使遭受 (伤害或破坏等)

1. N-COUNT The roof of a building is the covering on top of it that protects the people and things inside from the weather. 屋顶 2. N-COUNT The roof of a car or other vehicle is the top part of it, which protects passengers or goods from the weather. (车的) 顶篷 3. N-COUNT The roof of your mouth is the highest part of the inside of your mouth. 上腭 4. PHRASE If the level of something such as the price of a product or the rate of inflation goes through the roof, it suddenly increases very rapidly indeed. 突然猛涨 [非正式] 5. PHRASE If you hit the roof or go through the roof, you become very angry, and usually show your anger by shouting at someone. 怒气冲天 [非正式] 6. PHRASE If a number of things or people are under one roof or under the same roof, they are in the same building. 在同一建筑物里

1. N-COUNT A witness to an event such as an accident or crime is a person who saw it. 目击者 2. V-T If you witness something, you see it happen. 目击 3. N-COUNT A witness is someone who appears in a court of law to say what they know about a crime or other event. 证人 4. N-COUNT A witness is someone who writes their name on a document that you have signed, to confirm that it really is your signature. 连署人 5. V-T If someone witnesses your signature on a document, they write their name after it, to confirm that it really is your signature. 连署 6. V-T If you say that a place, period of time, or person witnessed a particular event or change, you mean that it happened in that place, during that period of time, or while that person was alive. 见证

1. N-UNCOUNT Commitment is a strong belief in an idea or system. 信奉 2. N-COUNT A commitment is something which regularly takes up some of your time because of an agreement you have made or because of responsibilities that you have. 投身的事 3. N-COUNT If you make a commitment to do something, you promise that you will do it. 承诺 4. N-VAR Commitment is the process of officially sending someone to a prison or a hospital. 送交 (监狱、医院) [美国英语]
1. N-COUNT A truffle is a soft round sweet made with chocolate. 圆形巧克力软糖 2. N-COUNT A truffle is a round type of fungus which is expensive and considered very good to eat. 松露

1. PRON-REFL A speaker or writer uses myself to refer to himself or herself. Myself is used as the object of a verb or preposition when the subject refers to the same person. 我自己 [v PRON, prep PRON] 2. PRON-REFL-EMPH You use myself to emphasize a first person singular subject. In more formal English, myself is sometimes used instead of "me" as the object of a verb or preposition, for emphasis. 我自己 (用于强调第一人称单数主语) [强调] 3. PRON-REFL-EMPH If you say something such as "I did it myself," you are emphasizing that you did it, rather than anyone else. 我独自 [强调]

1. N-COUNT A spectacle is a strange or interesting sight. 奇观 2. N-VAR A spectacle is a grand and impressive event or performance. 盛大的活动; 盛大的演出 3. N-PLURAL Glasses are sometimes referred to as spectacles. 眼镜 [老式] [also 'a pair of' N]

1. V-T If someone permits something, they allow it to happen. If they permit you to do something, they allow you to do it. 允许 [正式] 2. N-COUNT A permit is an official document which says that you may do something. For example, you usually need a permit to work in a foreign country. 许可证 3. V-T/V-I If a situation permits something, it makes it possible for that thing to exist, happen, or be done or it provides the opportunity for it. 使成为可能; 成为可能 [正式]
1. V to become detached 离开; 脱开

1. N-COUNT An excuse is a reason that you give in order to explain why something has been done or has not been done, or in order to avoid doing something. 借口 2. PHRASE If you say that there is no excuse for something, you are emphasizing that it should not happen, or expressing disapproval that it has happened. 没有理由 [表不满] 3. V-T To excuse someone or excuse their behaviour means to provide reasons for their actions, especially when other people disapprove of these actions. 为…开脱 4. V-T If you excuse someone for something wrong that they have done, you forgive them for it. 原谅 5. V-T If someone is excused from a duty or responsibility, they are told that they do not have to carry it out. 免除…的责任 [usu passive] 6. V-T If you excuse yourself, you use a phrase such as "Excuse me" as a polite way of saying that you are about to leave. 准许…离开 7. CONVENTION You say "Excuse me" when you want to politely get someone's attention, especially when you are about to ask them a question. 打扰一下 (用于礼貌地引起某人的注意) [套语] 8. CONVE

1. N-UNCOUNT In animals and plants, tissue consists of cells that are similar to each other in appearance and that have the same function. (动植物的) 组织 [also N in pl] 2. N-UNCOUNT Tissue paper is thin paper that is used for wrapping things that are easily damaged, such as objects made of glass or china. (包装易碎物品的) 薄棉纸 3. N-COUNT A tissue is a piece of thin soft paper that you use to blow your nose. 面巾纸

1. N-COUNT A charter is a formal document describing the rights, aims, or principles of an organization or group of people. 宪章 2. ADJ A charter plane or boat is one which is rented for use by a particular person or group and which is not part of a regular service. 包租的 [ADJ n] 3. V-T If a person or organization charters a plane, boat, or other vehicle, they rent it for their own use. 包租
停火命令，停火协议；停止射击

1. N-UNCOUNT Awe is the feeling of respect and amazement that you have when you are faced with something wonderful and often rather frightening. 敬畏 2. V-T If you are awed by someone or something, they make you feel respectful and amazed, though often rather frightened. 对…感到敬畏 [usu passive, no cont]

1. V-I If something rebounds from a solid surface, it bounces or springs back from it. 弹回 2. V-I If an action or situation rebounds on you, it has an unpleasant effect on you, especially when this effect was intended for someone else. 反作用于 (尤指对自己产生本想施与别人的不良影响)
1. N-UNCOUNT Hindsight is the ability to understand and realize something about an event after it has happened, although you did not understand or realize it at the time. 后见之明
1. ADJ If you describe a task as onerous, you dislike having to do it because you find it difficult or unpleasant. 繁重的; 费力的 [正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT Anticipation is a feeling of excitement about something pleasant or exciting that you know is going to happen. 期待 2. PHRASE If something is done in anticipation of an event, it is done because people believe that event is going to happen. 预期某事的发生

1. ADJ A federal country or system of government is one in which the different states or provinces of the country have important powers to make their own laws and decisions. 联邦制的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Federal also means belonging or relating to the national government of a federal country rather than to one of the states within it. 联邦政府的 [ADJ n] 3. federally ADV 联邦政府地 [ADV -ed]

1. ADJ If you are discreet, you are polite and careful in what you do or say, because you want to avoid embarrassing or offending someone. (言行) 谨慎的 2. discreetly ADV 谨慎地 3. ADJ If you are discreet about something you are doing, you do not tell other people about it, in order to avoid being embarrassed or to gain an advantage. 谨慎保密的 4. discreetly ADV 谨慎保密地 5. ADJ If you describe something as discreet, you approve of it because it is small in size or degree, or not easily noticed. 小巧的; 不显眼的 [表赞许] 6. discreetly ADV 小巧地; 不显眼地 [ADV -ed/adj]

1. V-I When a volcano erupts, it throws out a lot of hot, melted rock called lava, as well as ash and steam. 喷发 2. eruption N-VAR 喷发 3. V-I If violence or fighting erupts, it suddenly begins or gets worse in an unexpected, violent way. 爆发 [journalism] 4. eruption N-COUNT 爆发 5. V-I When people in a place suddenly become angry or violent, you can say that they erupt or that the place erupts. 爆发骚乱 [journalism] 6. V-I You say that someone erupts when they suddenly have a change in mood, usually becoming quite noisy. 爆发 (某种情绪) 7. eruption N-COUNT (某种情绪的) 爆发

1. N-UNCOUNT Shipping is the transportation of cargo or goods as a business, especially on ships. 航运业 [usu with supp] 2. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the amount of money that you pay to a company to transport cargo or goods as shipping. 运费

1. N-COUNT A discount is a reduction in the usual price of something. 折扣 2. V-T If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price. 对…打折 3. V-T If you discount an idea, fact, or theory, you consider that it is not true, not important, or not relevant. 不理会
n. 米切尔（男子名，等于Michael）
1. N-SING If movement or activity comes to or is brought to a standstill, it stops completely. 停止
1. ADJ Arid land is so dry that very few plants can grow on it. 干旱的

1. V-T/V-I If you substitute one thing for another, or if one thing substitutes for another, it takes the place or performs the function of the other thing. 以…代替; 代替 2. substitution N-VAR 代替 3. N-COUNT A substitute is something that you have or use instead of something else. 替代者 4. N-COUNT If you say that one thing is no substitute for another, you mean that it does not have certain desirable features that the other thing has, and is therefore unsatisfactory. If you say that there is no substitute for something, you mean that it is the only thing which is really satisfactory. 可替代者 5. N-COUNT In team games such as football, a substitute is a player who is brought into a game to replace another player. 替补队员

1. V-T/V-I If rock or soil erodes or is eroded by the weather, sea, or wind, it cracks and breaks so that it is gradually destroyed. 侵蚀 2. V-T/V-I If someone's authority, right, or confidence erodes or is eroded, it is gradually destroyed or removed. 削弱 [正式] 3. V-T/V-I If the value of something erodes or is eroded by something such as inflation or age, its value decreases. 降低

1. PHRASAL VERB If you say that someone is showing off, you are criticizing them for trying to impress people by showing in a very obvious way what they can do or what they own. 卖弄; 炫耀 [表不满] 2. PHRASAL VERB If you show off something that you have, you show it to a lot of people or make it obvious that you have it, because you are proud of it. 炫耀 3. → see also show-off
1. N-VAR An entitlement to something is the right to have it or do it. 权利 [正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT When a building is destroyed, the pieces of brick, stone, or other materials that remain are referred to as rubble. 瓦砾 2. N-UNCOUNT Rubble is used to refer to the small pieces of bricks and stones that are used as a bottom layer on which to build roads, paths, or houses. (铺路、建房用的) 碎石; 碎砖
1. V-T/V-I If someone, especially an official, investigates an event, situation, or claim, they try to find out what happened or what is the truth. 调查 2. investigation N-VAR 调查
n. 执行，实行；完成；死刑
1. N-UNCOUNT Inflation is a general increase in the prices of goods and services in a country. 通货膨胀 [商业]

1. N-COUNT A scaffold was a raised platform on which criminals were hanged or had their heads cut off. 绞刑台 2. N-COUNT A scaffold is a temporary raised platform on which workers stand to paint, repair, or build high parts of a building. 脚手架

1. N-UNCOUNT The members of royal families are sometimes referred to as royalty. 王室 2. N-PLURAL Royalties are payments made to authors and musicians when their work is sold or performed. They usually receive a fixed percentage of the profits from these sales or performances. 版税 3. N-COUNT Payments made to someone whose invention, idea, or property is used by a commercial company can be referred to as royalties. (发明、创意、财产等的) 使用费
n. (Samaras)人名；(希)萨马拉斯
1. ADJ Churning water is moving about violently. 漩涡的 [文学性] [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT Your cousin is the child of your uncle or aunt. 堂兄弟姐妹; 表兄弟姐妹
1. N-COUNT A reporter is someone who writes news articles or who broadcasts news reports. 记者

1. V-T If someone insults you, they say or do something that is rude or offensive. 辱骂; 侮辱; 冒犯 2. insulted ADJ 被侮辱的 3. N-COUNT An insult is a rude remark, or something a person says or does which insults you. 侮辱; 辱骂; 冒犯 4. PHRASE You say to add insult to injury when mentioning an action or fact that makes an unfair or unacceptable situation even worse. 更糟糕的是

1. V-T You use suspect when you are stating something that you believe is probably true, in order to make it sound less strong or direct. 觉得 [含糊] 2. V-T If you suspect that something dishonest or unpleasant has been done, you believe that it has probably been done. If you suspect someone of doing an action of this kind, you believe that they probably did it. 怀疑 3. N-COUNT A suspect is a person who the police or authorities think may be guilty of a crime. 嫌疑犯 4. ADJ Suspect things or people are ones that you think may be dangerous or may be less good or genuine than they appear. 可疑的
1. V-T/V-I If you devolve power, authority, or responsibility to a less powerful person or group, or if it devolves upon them, it is transferred to them. (权力、责任) 下放

1. N-COUNT A champion is someone who has won the first prize in a competition, contest, or fight. 冠军 2. N-COUNT If you are a champion of a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them. 拥护者; 捍卫者 3. V-T If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them. 拥护; 捍卫
1. N-COUNT A trafficker in particular goods, especially drugs, is a person who illegally buys or sells these goods. (尤指毒品的) 非法买卖者

1. ADJ If a place is bursting with people or things, it is full of them. 充满的 [v-link ADJ] 2. ADJ If you say that someone is bursting with a feeling or quality, you mean that they have a great deal of it. 满怀着的 [v-link ADJ 'with' n] 3. → see also burst

1. V-T If you say that something illustrates a situation that you are drawing attention to, you mean that it shows that the situation exists. 表明; 显示 2. V-T If you use an example, story, or diagram to illustrate a point, you use it to show that what you are saying is true or to make your meaning clearer. (用例子、故事或图表) 阐明 3. illustration N-UNCOUNT 例证 4. V-T If you illustrate a book, you put pictures, photographs or diagrams into it. 给 (书) 加插图 5. illustration N-UNCOUNT (书的) 插图

1. N-COUNT You can refer to the political issues that are important at a particular time as an agenda. (政治) 议题 2. → see also hidden agenda 3. N-COUNT An agenda is a list of the items that have to be discussed at a meeting. 议事日程
n. 平壤（朝鲜民主主义人民共和国首都）

1. V-T/V-I If you nod, you move your head downward and upward to show that you are answering "yes" to a question, or to show agreement, understanding, or approval. 点头 [no passive] 2. N-COUNT Nod is also a noun. 点头 3. V-I If you nod in a particular direction, you bend your head once in that direction in order to indicate something or to give someone a signal. (朝某方向) 点头示意 [no passive] 4. V-T/V-I If you nod, you bend your head once, as a way of saying hello or goodbye. 点头 (以示打招呼或告别) [no passive]
1. V-T If one thing engulfs another, it completely covers or hides it, often in a sudden and unexpected way. 吞没 2. V-T If a feeling or emotion engulfs you, you are strongly affected by it. 使陷于

1. PHRASAL VERB If something calls for a particular action or quality, it needs it or makes it necessary. 须有; 需要 2. PHRASAL VERB If you call for someone, you go to the building where they are, so that you can both go somewhere. 前往接某人 3. PHRASAL VERB If you call for something, you demand that it should happen. 要求
信用评级

1. V-T/V-I If a situation or emotion deepens or if something deepens it, it becomes stronger and more intense. 使加剧; 加剧 2. V-T If you deepen your knowledge or understanding of a subject, you learn more about it and become more interested in it. 使加深 3. V-T/V-I When a sound deepens or is deepened, it becomes lower in tone. 使变低沉; 变低沉 4. V-T If people deepen something, they increase its depth by digging out its lower surface. 加深
1. N-COUNT Your compatriots are people from your own country. 同国人
1. N-COUNT A thinker is a person who spends a lot of time thinking deeply about important things, especially someone who is famous for thinking of new or interesting ideas. 思想家
n. 芝加哥（美国城市名）
adv. 长期地；慢性地；习惯性地
n. 肯尼迪（姓氏，美国第35任总统）
n. 递归

1. ADJ Preliminary activities or discussions take place at the beginning of an event, often as a form of preparation. 初步的 2. N-COUNT A preliminary is something that you do at the beginning of an activity, often as a form of preparation. (程序性或礼节性的) 预备事务
1. ADJ A splitting headache is a very severe and painful one. (头痛)欲裂的 [ADJ n]

1. ADJ If you describe a person's speech or something that they write as wordy, you disapprove of the fact that they use too many words, especially words which are very long, formal, or literary. 冗长的; 过于正式的 [表不满]
1. ADJ If you describe a task or problem as tricky, you mean that it is difficult to do or deal with. 难对付的
1. ADJ Something that is exotic is unusual and interesting, usually because it comes from or is related to a distant country. (常因来自遥远的他国而显得) 奇异的 2. exotically ADV 奇异地

1. V-T If one player or team thrashes another in a game or contest, they defeat them easily or by a large score. (在比赛或竞赛中) 轻松击败 [非正式] 2. V-T If you thrash someone, you hit them several times as a punishment. 揍 (作为惩罚) 3. V-T/V-I If someone thrashes around or thrashes their arms or legs around, they move in a wild or violent way, often hitting against something. You can also say that someone's arms or legs thrash around. 使剧烈扭动; 剧烈扭动 4. V-T/V-I If a person or thing thrashes something, or thrashes at something, they hit it continually in a violent or noisy way. 猛烈地连续击打 5. → see also thrashing

1. V-T/V-I When something rolls or when you roll it, it moves along a surface, turning over many times. 滚动 2. V-I If you roll somewhere, you move on a surface while lying down, turning your body over and over, so that you are sometimes on your back, sometimes on your side, and sometimes on your front. 打滚 3. V-I When vehicles roll along, they move along slowly. (车辆) 缓行 4. V-I If a machine rolls, it is operating. (机器) 运转 5. V-I If drops of liquid roll down a surface, they move quickly down it. (液体) 滚落 6. V-T If you roll something flexible into a cylinder or a ball, you form it into a cylinder or a ball by wrapping it several times around itself or by shaping it between your hands. 卷; 绕 (成柱形或团) 7. PHRASAL VERB Roll up means the same as . 卷; 绕 (成柱形或团) 8. N-COUNT A roll of paper, plastic, cloth, or wire is a long piece of it that has been wrapped many times around itself or around a tube. (一) 卷 9. V-T If you roll up something such as a car window or a blind, you cause it to move upward by turning a handl
n. 郊区，市郊
1. N a person who creates something that brings about his ruin 弗兰肯斯坦; 一个创造了某样东西结果导致其毁灭的人

1. N-VAR Dialogue is communication or discussion between people or groups of people such as governments or political parties. 对话 2. N-VAR A dialogue is a conversation between two people in a book, film, or play. (书籍、影视、戏剧中的) 对白
1. V-I If you decamp, you go away from somewhere secretly or suddenly. 潜逃

1. ADJ If something such as a decision or an arrangement is definite, it is firm and clear, and unlikely to be changed. 明确的 2. ADJ Definite evidence or information is true, rather than being someone's opinion or guess. 确切的 3. ADJ You use definite to emphasize the strength of your opinion or belief. 无疑的 [ADJ n] [强调] 4. ADJ Someone who is definite behaves or talks in a firm, confident way. 肯定的
n. 加拉加斯（委内瑞拉首都）

1. N-VAR A duck is a common water bird with short legs, a short neck, and a large flat beak. 鸭 2. N-UNCOUNT Duck is the flesh of this bird when it is eaten as food. 鸭肉 3. N a score of nothing by a batsman 零分 [cricket] 4. N a heavy cotton fabric of plain weave, used for clothing, tents, etc 粗布 → see also ducks 5. N an amphibious vehicle used in World War II (第二次世界大战中用的)水陆两用车 6. V-I If you duck, you move your head or the top half of your body quickly downward to avoid something that might hit you, to avoid being seen, or to hide the expression on your face. 迅速低头; 猛然俯身 7. V-T If you duck something such as a blow, you avoid it by moving your head or body quickly downward. 闪避 8. V-T If you duck your head, you move it quickly downward to hide the expression on your face. 迅速低下 (头) 9. V-T You say that someone ducks a duty or responsibility when you disapprove of the fact that they avoid it. 逃避 (责任) [非正式] 10. V to submerge or plunge suddenly and often briefly under water 忽潜忽露
1. V-T If people discuss something, they talk about it, often in order to reach a decision. 讨论 2. V-T If you discuss something, you write or talk about it in detail. 详述
1. N-COUNT Someone's disposition is the way that they tend to behave or feel. 性情

1. N-COUNT An instant is an extremely short period of time. 瞬间; 刹那 2. N-SING If you say that something happens at a particular instant, you mean that it happens at exactly the time you have been referring to, and you are usually suggesting that it happens quickly or immediately. 时刻 3. PHRASE To do something the instant something else happens means to do it immediately. 一…就… [强调] 4. ADJ You use instant to describe something that happens immediately. 立即的 5. instantly ADV 立即地 6. ADJ Instant food is food that you can prepare very quickly, for example, by just adding water. 调制快速方便的 (食品) [ADJ n]
1. N-VAR A jail is a place where criminals are kept in order to punish them, or where people waiting to be tried are kept. 监狱 2. V-T If someone is jailed, they are put into jail. 监禁 [usu passive]
1. V-T If a government or other authority subsidizes something, they pay part of the cost of it. 补贴 2. subsidized ADJ 被补贴了的

1. V-T To evacuate someone means to send them to a place of safety, away from a dangerous building, town, or area. 疏散; 使…撤离 2. evacuation N-VAR 疏散; 撤离 3. V-T If people evacuate a place, they move out of it for a period of time, especially because it is dangerous. (尤指因为危险而) 撤离 4. evacuation N-VAR 撤离
1. N-VAR An inflammation is a painful redness or swelling of a part of your body that results from an infection, injury, or illness. 炎症
1. N-UNCOUNT Populism refers to political activities or ideas that claim to promote the interests and opinions of ordinary people. 平民主义; 民粹主义 [正式]
1. ADJ If you describe something as outrageous, you are emphasizing that it is unacceptable or very shocking. 不可接受的; 令人震惊的 [强调] 2. outrageously ADV 不可接受地; 令人震惊地

1. N-COUNT The motor in a machine, vehicle, or boat is the part that uses electricity or fuel to produce movement, so that the machine, vehicle, or boat can work. 发动机 2. ADJ Motor vehicles and boats have a petrol or diesel engine. 机动的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ Motor is used to describe activities relating to vehicles such as cars and buses. 汽车的 [英国英语] 4. → see also motoring

1. N-UNCOUNT Comedy consists of types of entertainment, such as plays and film, or particular scenes in them, that are intended to make people laugh. 喜剧 2. N-COUNT A comedy is a play, film, or television programme that is intended to make people laugh. 喜剧
adv. 表面上；外表

1. N-COUNT If you have an injection, a doctor or nurse puts a medicine into your body using a device with a needle called a syringe. 注射 [also 'by' N] 2. N-COUNT An injection of money or resources into an organization is the act of providing it with more money or resources, to help it become more efficient or profitable. (资金或资源的) 注入 [商业]

1. V-T/V-I If you wander in a place, you walk around there in a casual way, often without intending to go in any particular direction. 漫步 2. N-SING Wander is also a noun. 漫步 3. V-I If a person or animal wanders from a place where they are supposed to stay, they move away from the place without going in a particular direction. 走开 4. V-I If your mind wanders or your thoughts wander, you stop concentrating on something and start thinking about other things. 心不在焉 5. V-I If your eyes wander, you stop looking at one thing and start looking around at other things. (目光) 无目的地移动
1. N-COUNT A crayon is a rod of coloured wax used for drawing. 彩色蜡笔
1. ADJ Someone or something that is robust is very strong or healthy. 健壮的 2. ADJ Robust views or opinions are strongly held and forcefully expressed. 强有力的 (观点、见解)

1. V-I If you glance at something or someone, you look at them very quickly and then look away again immediately. 瞥 2. V-I If you glance through or at a newspaper, report, or book, you spend a short time looking at it without reading it very carefully. 浏览 3. N-COUNT A glance is a quick look at someone or something. 一瞥 4. PHRASE If you see something at a glance, you see or recognize it immediately, and without having to think or look carefully. 看(一眼就...) 5. PHRASE If you say that something is true or seems to be true at first glance, you mean that it seems to be true when you first see it or think about it, but that your first impression may be wrong. 乍一看 6. N-MASS any mineral having a metallic lustre, esp a simple sulphide 辉金属
1. ABBREVIATION for illicit diamond buying 非法钻石购买
1. N-UNCOUNT Prudence is care and good sense that someone shows when making a decision or taking action. 谨慎 [正式]
1. ADJ Something that is minimal is very small in quantity, value, or degree. 尽可能少的; 最低限度的
1. ADJ A hapless person is unlucky. 不幸的 [正式] [ADJ n]
1. N the act of subsuming or the state of being subsumed 归纳; 包含
1. ADJ Ostensible is used to describe something that seems to be true or is officially stated to be true, but about which you or other people have doubts. 声称的; 表面上的 [正式] [ADJ n] 2. ostensibly ADV

1. ADJ You use tactical to describe an action or plan which is intended to help someone achieve what they want in a particular situation. 战术上的 2. tactically ADV 有策略地 3. ADJ Tactical weapons or forces are those which a military leader can decide for themselves to use in a battle, rather than waiting for a decision by a political leader. (武器或军队) 战术性的 [ADJ n]
1. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the movement of ships as navigation. 航行 2. → see also navigate

1. N-VAR Transition is the process in which something changes from one state to another. 转型 2. V-I If someone transitions from one state or activity to another, they move gradually from one to the other. (逐渐地) 转向 [商业]

1. V-T If you urge someone to do something, you try hard to persuade them to do it. 敦促 (某人做某事) 2. V-T If you urge someone somewhere, you make them go there by touching them or talking to them. 鼓动 (某人去某地) 3. V-T If you urge a course of action, you strongly advise that it should be taken. 竭力主张 4. N-COUNT If you have an urge to do or have something, you have a strong wish to do or have it. 强烈欲望
构成威胁；形成一种威胁

1. N-UNCOUNT If a prisoner is given parole, he or she is released before the official end of their prison sentence and has to promise to behave well. 假释 2. PHRASE If a prisoner is on parole, he or she is released before the official end of their prison sentence and will not be sent back to prison if their behaviour is good. 获假释 3. V-T If a prisoner is paroled, he or she is given parole. 获假释 [usu passive]
n. 夏威夷岛；夏威夷（美国州名）
1. ADJ If you find someone's words or actions reassuring, they make you feel less worried about something. 安慰的 2. reassuringly ADV 安慰地
1. ADJ If you say that something is pointless, you are criticizing it because it has no sense or purpose. 无意义的; 无益的 [表不满] 2. pointlessly ADV 无意义地
n. 劳伦（法国数学家）

1. N-COUNT Your profile is the outline of your face as it is seen when someone is looking at you from the side. (面部的) 侧面轮廓 2. N-UNCOUNT If you see someone in profile, you see them from the side. 从侧面 3. N-COUNT A profile of someone is a short article or programme in which their life and character are described. (有关某人的) 简介 4. N-COUNT If the police make a profile of someone they are looking for, they write a description of the sort of person they are looking for. (书面的) 描述 [oft N 'of' n] 5. profiling N-UNCOUNT 进行描画 [usu with supp] 6. PHRASE If someone has a high profile, people notice them and what they do. If you keep a low profile, you avoid doing things that will make people notice you. 高关注度 7. → see also high-profile

1. N-COUNT-COLL In the United States and some other countries, the Treasury is the government department that deals with the country's finances. 财政部 2. N-PLURAL Treasuries are financial bonds that are issued by the United States government in order to raise money. (美国政府发行的) 国库券 [美国英语]

1. N-VAR An assessment is a consideration of someone or something and a judgment about them. 评估 2. N-VAR An assessment of the amount of money that something is worth or that should be paid is a calculation or estimate of the amount. 估算
洗钱

1. V-T If you perceive something, you see, notice, or realize it, especially when it is not obvious. 感知到 2. V-T If you perceive someone or something as doing or being a particular thing, it is your opinion that they do this thing or that they are that thing. 认为

1. ADJ If you are satisfied with something, you are happy because you have got what you wanted or needed. 满意的 2. ADJ If you are satisfied that something is true or has been done properly, you are convinced about this after checking it. 确信的 [v-link ADJ]

1. N-UNCOUNT Controlof an organization, place, or system is the power to make all the important decisions about the way that it is run. (对某组织机构的) 控制 2. PHRASE If something is under your control, you have the power to make all the important decisions about the way that it is run. 处于…控制之下 3. PHRASE If you are in control of something, you have the power to make all the important decisions about the way it is run. 掌管 4. N-UNCOUNT If you have control of something or someone, you are able to make them do what you want them to do. (对某物或某人的) 控制 [oft N 'of/over' n] 5. controlled ADJ 受控制的 6. N-UNCOUNT If you show control, you prevent yourself behaving in an angry or emotional way. (对愤怒情绪等的) 克制 7. V-T The people who control an organization or place have the power to make all the important decisions about the way that it is run. 管理 8. V-T To control a piece of equipment, process, or system means to make it work in the way that you want it to work. 控制 (设备系统等) 9. V-T When a government controls prices, wages, or t
严格的（ strict的比较级 ）

1. N-COUNT A receipt is a piece of paper that you get from someone as proof that they have received money or goods from you. 收据 2. N-PLURAL Receipts are the amount of money received during a particular period, for example by a shop or theatre. 收入 3. N-UNCOUNT The receipt of something is the act of receiving it. 收到 [正式] 4. PHRASE If you are in receipt of something, you have received it or you receive it regularly. 已收到; 定期收到 [正式]
漏油；浮油
1. ADJ Arabian means belonging or relating to Arabia, especially to Saudi Arabia. 阿拉伯的; (尤指)沙特阿拉伯的

1. V-T If a physical object is mangled, it is crushed or twisted very forcefully, so that it is difficult to see what its original shape was. 严重损毁 [usu passive] 2. V-T to press or dry in a mangle (在榨干机中)榨干 3. N a machine for pressing or drying wet textiles, clothes, etc, consisting of two heavy rollers between which the cloth is passed (衣服)脱水机 (Also called wringer)
1. V-T When something such as a nuclear reactor or a large machine is decommissioned, it is taken out of use and taken apart because it is no longer going to be used. 停止使用
1. ADJ Gravitational means relating to or resulting from the force of gravity. 与引力有关的; 引力所致的 [技术] [ADJ n]
n. 支持者，支持单位；支持单元
1. N-COUNT Beverages are drinks. 饮料 [书面]
小村
1. N-VAR The convergence of different ideas, groups, or societies is the process by which they stop being different and become more similar. 趋同性 [正式]

1. V-T If you install a piece of equipment, you put it somewhere so that it is ready to be used. 安装 2. installation N-UNCOUNT 安装 3. V-T If someone is installed in a new job or important position, they are officially given the job or position, often in a special ceremony. 正式任命 4. installation N-UNCOUNT 任命仪式; 就职仪式 5. V-T If you install yourself in a particular place, you settle there and make yourself comfortable. 安顿 [正式]

1. N-VAR In a court of law, someone's testimony is a formal statement that they make about what they saw someone do or what they know of a situation, after having promised to tell the truth. (法庭上的) 证词 2. N-UNCOUNT If you say that one thing is testimony to another, you mean that it shows clearly that the second thing has a particular quality. 明证 [also 'a' N, usu N 'to' n]
n. 一帆风顺
1. N-COUNT An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature. 方面 2. N-COUNT The aspect of a building or window is the direction in which it faces. (建筑物或窗子的) 朝向 [正式]

1. V-T If you encounter problems or difficulties, you experience them. 遭遇 2. V-T If you encounter someone, you meet them, usually unexpectedly. 邂逅 [正式] 3. N-COUNT An encounter with someone is a meeting with them, particularly one that is unexpected or significant. 邂逅 4. N-COUNT An encounter is a particular type of experience. 特殊经历
1. N-COUNT A payout is a sum of money, especially a large one, that is paid to someone, for example, by an insurance company or as a prize. (尤指大笔) 钱款
adj. 长时间的；为时甚久的 adv. 长久地

1. N-COUNT A magazine's or a newspaper's subscribers are the people who pay to receive copies of it regularly. (杂志或报纸的) 订户 2. N-COUNT Subscribers to a service are the people who pay to receive the service. 用户
n. 确认；批准；生效
1. ADV You can add happily to a statement to indicate that you are glad that something happened. 幸运的是 [ADV with cl] 2. → see also happy
n. 汉城，首尔（韩国首都）

1. N-COUNT The entrance to a place is the way into it, for example, a door or gate. 入口 2. N-COUNT You can refer to someone's arrival in a place as their entrance, especially when you think that they are trying to be noticed and admired. 登场; 莅临 3. N-COUNT When a performer makes his or her entrance onto the stage, he or she comes onto the stage. 出场 4. N-UNCOUNT If you gain entrance to a particular place, you manage to get in there. 进入许可 [正式] 5. N-UNCOUNT If you gain entrance to a particular profession, society, or institution, you are accepted as a member of it. 入 (行、会、学) 许可 6. N-SING If you make an entrance into a particular activity or system, you succeed in becoming involved in it. 进入 1. V-T If something or someone entrances you, they cause you to feel delight and wonder, often so that all your attention is taken up and you cannot think about anything else. 使着迷 2. entranced ADJ 着迷的

1. ADJ Something that is untouched by something else is not affected by it. 不受影响的 [v-link ADJ, ADJ after v] 2. ADJ If something is untouched, it is not damaged in any way, although it has been in a situation where it could easily have been damaged. 未受损害的 [v-link ADJ, ADJ after v] 3. ADJ An untouched area or place is thought to be beautiful because it is still in its original state and has not been changed or damaged in any way. 保持原样的; 未受破坏的 4. ADJ If food or drink is untouched, none of it has been eaten or drunk. 未被吃过的; 未被喝过的
n. 仰光（缅甸首都，等于Rangoon）
1. N-COUNT A writer is a person who writes books, stories, or articles as a job. 作家 2. N-COUNT The writer of a particular article, report, letter, or story is the person who wrote it. 撰写者
1. ADJ An aromatic plant or food has a strong, pleasant smell of herbs or spices. 芳香的
n. 靖国神社
扎克伯格

1. N any wrestling hold in which a wrestler places his arm or arms under his opponent's arm or arms from behind and exerts pressure with his palms on the back of his opponent's neck 纳尔逊擒拿法; 肩下握颈法 →see full nelson, half-nelson
1. N-PLURAL Glasses are two lenses in a frame that some people wear in front of their eyes in order to help them see better. 眼镜
1. N the use of such securities as eurobonds to enable investors to lend directly to borrowers with a minimum of risk but without using banks as intermediaries 证券化 [finance]

1. N-COUNT A collector is a person who collects things of a particular type as a hobby. 收藏家 2. N-COUNT You can use collector to refer to someone whose job is to take something such as money, tickets, or rubbish from people. For example, a rent collector collects rent from people. (钱款、票据或垃圾的) 收取人

1. ADJ Someone who is furious is extremely angry. 狂怒的 2. furiously ADV 狂怒地 3. ADJ Furious is also used to describe something that is done with great energy, effort, speed, or violence. 激烈的; 玩命的; 迅猛的 4. furiously ADV 激烈地; 玩命地; 迅猛地
