1. N-VAR A ribbon is a long, narrow piece of cloth that you use for tying things together or as a decoration. 装饰带 2. N-COUNT A typewriter or printer ribbon is a long, narrow piece of cloth containing ink and is used in a typewriter or printer. 色带

1. ADJ Someone who is naked is not wearing any clothes. 裸体的 2. nakedness N-UNCOUNT 裸体 3. ADJ If an animal or part of an animal is naked, it has no fur or feathers on it. 没有毛的 4. ADJ You can describe an object as naked when it does not have its normal covering. 无 (正常) 遮盖的 5. ADJ You can use naked to describe unpleasant or violent actions and behaviour which are not disguised or hidden in any way. 公然的; 赤裸裸的 (行为等) [journalism] [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A guardian is someone who has been legally appointed to take charge of the affairs of another person, for example a child or someone who is mentally ill. 监护人 2. N-COUNT The guardian of something is someone who defends and protects it. 保护者
1. N-MASS Sedge is a plant that looks like grass and grows in wet ground. 苔草

1. V-T If you muster something such as support, strength, or energy, you gather as much of it as you can in order to do something. 聚集 (支持、力量、精力等) 2. V-T/V-I When soldiers muster or are mustered, they gather together in one place in order to take part in a military action. 召集; (军队等) 集合

1. N-COUNT A marker is an object which is used to show the position of something, or is used to help someone remember something. 标示物 2. N-COUNT A marker or a marker pen is a pen with a thick tip made of felt, which is used for drawing and for colouring things. 毡笔
1. ADJ of or relating to Cambodia or its inhabitants 柬埔寨(人)的 2. N a native or inhabitant of Cambodia 柬埔寨人
1. ADJ Semiprecious stones are stones such as turquoises and amethysts that are used in jewellery but are less valuable than precious stones such as diamonds and rubies. 半宝石的 [usu ADJ n]

1. ADJ Electrical goods, equipment, or appliances work by means of electricity. 电力的 2. electrically ADV 电力地 [ADV -ed] 3. ADJ Electrical systems or parts supply or use electricity. 电的 4. ADJ Electrical energy is energy in the form of electricity. 电的 5. electrically ADV 电地 6. ADJ Electrical industries, engineers, or workers are involved in the production and supply of electricity or electrical products. 与电有关的 [ADJ n]

1. ADJ You use lesser in order to indicate that something is smaller in extent, degree, or amount than another thing that has been mentioned. (范围或程度) 较小的; (数量) 较少的 [ADJ n, 'the' ADJ 'of' n] 2. ADV Lesser is also an adverb. (范围或程度) 较小地; (数量) 较少地 [ADV -ed] 3. ADJ You can use lesser to refer to something or someone that is less important than other things or people of the same type. 次要的; 较轻的 [ADJ n, 'the' ADJ 'of' n] 4. the lesser of two evils →see evil
1. ADJ If you describe something as trivial, you think that it is unimportant and not serious. 无关紧要的
adv. 彻底地；激烈地
1. V-T If you conjure something out of nothing, you make it appear as if by magic. 使如变魔术般凭空出现 2. PHRASAL VERB Conjure up means the same as . 使如变魔术般凭空出现

1. PHRASAL VERB If a particular thing accounts for a part or proportion of something, that part or proportion consists of that thing, or is used or produced by it. (数量、比例上) 占 2. PHRASAL VERB If something accounts for a particular fact or situation, it causes or explains it. 导致; 解释 3. PHRASAL VERB If you can account for something, you can explain it or give the necessary information about it. 解释 4. PHRASAL VERB If someone has to account for an action or policy, they are responsible for it, and may be required to explain it to other people or be punished if it fails. 对…负责 5. PHRASAL VERB If a sum of money is accounted for in a budget, it has been included in that budget for a particular purpose. 列入预算

1. N-VAR An interpretation of something is an opinion about what it means. 解释 2. N-COUNT A performer's interpretation of something such as a piece of music or a role in a play is the particular way in which they choose to perform it. 演奏; 表演

1. N-VAR If you have a preference for something, you would like to have or do that thing rather than something else. 偏爱 2. N-UNCOUNT If you give preference to someone with a particular qualification or feature, you choose them rather than someone else. 优先考虑

1. N-UNCOUNT Rubber is a strong, waterproof, elastic substance made from the juice of a tropical tree or produced chemically. It is used for making tyres, boots, and other products. 橡胶 2. N-COUNT A rubber is a condom. 保险套 [美国英语] [非正式] 3. N-COUNT A rubber is a small piece of rubber or other material that is used to remove mistakes that you have made while writing, drawing, or typing. 橡皮 [英国英语] 4. N a match of three games 决胜局 5. N the deal that wins such a match 胜局比赛
1. ADJ If something is tempting, it makes you want to do it or have it. 诱人的 2. temptingly ADV 诱人地

1. N any of various lowland breeds of sheep, typically of stocky build and having dense close wool, originating from various parts of southern England, such as Oxford, Hampshire, etc 低地羊种 → see also Dorset Down

1. ADJ If something is inadequate, there is not enough of it or it is not good enough. 不足的; 不够好的 2. inadequately ADV 不足地; 不够好地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If someone feels inadequate, they feel that they do not have the qualities and abilities necessary to do something or to cope with life in general. 能力不足的
商业友好
1. ADJ of or relating to Nepal or its inhabitants 尼泊尔的; 尼泊尔人的 2. N a native or inhabitant of Nepal 尼泊尔人

1. ADV If something often happens, it happens many times or much of the time. 经常 2. ADV You use how often to ask questions about frequency. You also use often in reported clauses and other statements to give information about the frequency of something. 时常的 3. PHRASE If something happens every so often, it happens regularly, but with fairly long intervals between each occasion. 偶尔 4. PHRASE If you say that something happens as often as not, or more often than not, you mean that it happens fairly frequently, and that this can be considered as typical. 往往

1. V-T/V-I If someone poaches fish, animals, or birds, they illegally catch them on someone else's property. 偷猎 2. poacher N-COUNT 偷猎者 3. V-T If an organization poaches members or customers from another organization, they secretly or dishonestly persuade them to join them or become their customers. (通过不正当的手段或秘密) 挖走 (其他组织的成员或顾客) 4. poaching N-UNCOUNT 挖人 5. V-T If someone poaches an idea, they dishonestly or illegally use the idea. 窃取 (别人的想法) 6. V-T If you poach food such as fish, you cook it gently in boiling water, milk, or other liquid. 小火煮 7. poaching N-UNCOUNT 烹煮
1. V-T To regulate an activity or process means to control it, especially by means of rules. 控制 (尤指通过规则)
1. N-COUNT The workload of a person or organization is the amount of work that has to be done by them. 工作量

1. V-T To retort means to reply angrily to someone. 反驳 [书面] 2. N-COUNT Retort is also a noun. 反驳 3. N a glass vessel with a round bulb and long tapering neck that is bent down, used esp in a laboratory for distillation 曲颈瓶 4. V to heat in a retort 在曲颈瓶里加热
adj. 市长的 n. (Mayoral)人名；(西)马约拉尔

1. N-UNCOUNT If you have responsibility for something or someone, or if they are your responsibility, it is your job or duty to deal with them and to make decisions relating to them. 责任 2. N-UNCOUNT If you accept responsibility for something that has happened, you agree that you were to blame for it or you caused it. 责任 3. N-PLURAL Your responsibilities are the duties that you have because of your job or position. 职责 4. N-UNCOUNT If someone is given responsibility, they are given the right or opportunity to make important decisions or to take action without having to get permission from anyone else. 职权 5. N-SING If you think that you have a responsibility to do something, you feel that you ought to do it because it is morally right to do it. 责任 6. N-SING If you think that you have a responsibility to someone, you feel that it is your duty to take action that will protect their interests. 义务

1. N-SING The establishment of an organization or system is the act of creating it or beginning it. 建立; 创立 [正式] 2. N-COUNT An establishment is a shop, business, or organization occupying a particular building or place. 商店; 企业; 机构 [正式] 3. N-SING You refer to the people who have power and influence in the running of a country, society, or organization as the establishment. 当权者

1. V-T/V-I If someone or something topples somewhere or if you topple them, they become unsteady or unstable and fall over. 倒下 2. PHRASAL VERB Topple over means the same as . 同(topple) 3. V-T To topple a government or leader, especially one that is not elected by the people, means to cause them to lose power. 推翻 [journalism]
起源于
1. ADJ A long-awaited event or thing is one that someone has been waiting for for a long time. 等待已久的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ A prestigious institution, job, or activity is respected and admired by people. 有声望的
1. ADJ If you describe someone as astute, you think they show an understanding of behaviour and situations, and are skilful at using this knowledge to their own advantage. 精明的

1. N-COUNT A consultant is a person who gives expert advice to a person or organization on a particular subject. 顾问 2. N-COUNT A consultant is an experienced doctor with a high position, who specializes in one area of medicine. 顾问医生 [英国英语]
1. N-VAR Velocity is the speed at which something moves in a particular direction. (沿某一方向运动的) 速度 [技术]

1. N-COUNT The hero of a book, play, film, or story is the main male character, who usually has good qualities. 男主人公 2. N-COUNT A hero is someone, especially a man, who has done something brave, new, or good, and who is therefore greatly admired by a lot of people. 英雄 3. N-COUNT If you describe someone as your hero, you mean that you admire them a great deal, usually because of a particular quality or skill that they have. 偶像
1. N-UNCOUNT If you refer to someone's inability to do something, you are referring to the fact that they are unable to do it. 无力
1. V-RECIP When people bicker, they argue or quarrel about unimportant things. (为琐事的) 吵嘴 2. bickering N-UNCOUNT (为琐事) 吵嘴
1. V-I If someone wheezes, they breathe with difficulty and make a whistling sound. 气喘
n. 玛丽亚（女名）
1. N → a less common word for pseudonym

1. N-COUNT The function of something or someone is the useful thing that they do or are intended to do. 作用 2. N-COUNT A function is a large formal dinner or party. 宴会; 社交聚会 3. V-I If a machine or system is functioning, it is working or operating. 运转 4. V-I If someone or something functions as a particular thing, they do the work or fulfil the purpose of that thing. (作为某物) 起作用

1. N-VAR A lime is a green fruit that tastes like a lemon. Limes grow on trees in tropical countries. 酸橙 2. N-VAR any linden tree, such as Tilia europaea, planted in many varieties for ornament 欧椴树 3. N-UNCOUNT Lime is a substance containing calcium. It is found in soil and water. 石灰

1. N-UNCOUNT Someone who shows modesty does not talk much about their abilities or achievements. 谦虚 [表赞许] 2. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the modesty of something such as a place or amount when it is fairly small. (某地或数量等) 小 3. N-UNCOUNT If someone, especially a woman, shows modesty, they are cautious about the way they dress and behave because they are aware that other people may view them in a sexual way. (尤指妇女) 端庄

1. N-COUNT A sequence of events or things is a number of events or things that come one after another in a particular order. 一系列; 一连串 2. N-COUNT A particular sequence is a particular order in which things happen or are arranged. 次序; 顺序

1. ADJ Someone who is eligible to do something is qualified or able to do it, for example, because they are old enough. 有资格的 2. eligibility N-UNCOUNT 资格; 合格 3. ADJ An eligible man or woman is not yet married and is thought by many people to be a suitable partner. (指结婚对象) 令人中意的
1. ADJ able to or tending to change 可变的; 会变的
1. N-VAR The diversity of something is the fact that it contains many very different elements. 多样性 2. N-SING A diversity of things is a range of things which are very different from each other. 各种各样
1. N-COUNT An amateur is someone who does something as a hobby and not as a job. 业余爱好者 2. ADJ Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job. 业余的 [ADJ n]

1. N-UNCOUNT Exposureto something dangerous means being in a situation where it might affect you. 暴露 2. N-UNCOUNT Exposure is the harmful effect on your body caused by very cold weather. 受冻 3. N-UNCOUNT The exposure of a well-known person is the revealing of the fact that they are bad or immoral in some way. 揭发 4. N-UNCOUNT Exposure is publicity that a person, company, or product receives. 宣传 5. N-COUNT In photography, an exposure is a single photograph. 底片 [技术]
1. N-COUNT If you make an assumption that something is true or will happen, you accept that it is true or will happen, often without any real proof. 假设
1. N-COUNT A town hall is a building or hall used for local government business, usually a building which is the main office of a town council. 市政厅
1. N-UNCOUNT Locomotion is the ability to move and the act of moving from one place to another. 移动能力 [正式]

1. ADJ You use mutual to describe a situation, feeling, or action that is experienced, felt, or done by both of two people mentioned. 相互的 2. mutually ADV 相互地 3. →see exclusive 4. ADJ You use mutual to describe something such as an interest which two or more people share. 共同的 5. ADJ If an insurance company or savings bank has mutual status, it is not owned by shareholders but by its customers, who receive a share of the profits. (保险公司或储蓄银行) 互助的 [商业] [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT You can refer to any living thing that is not a plant as a creature, especially when it is of an unknown or unfamiliar kind. People also refer to imaginary animals and beings as creatures. (尤指不明的或想像中的) 生物; 动物
1. ADJ An experience or action that is rewarding gives you satisfaction or brings you benefits. 令人满意的; 令人有所收获的
1. ADJ A double-digit number is between 10 and 99. 双数 [ADJ n]

1. N-VAR A rhythm is a regular series of sounds or movements. 节奏 2. N-COUNT A rhythm is a regular pattern of changes, for example changes in your body, in the seasons, or in the tides. (身体、季节等的) 规律性变化

1. N-COUNT A scheme is someone's plan for achieving something, especially something that will bring them some benefit. 计划 2. V-T/V-I If you say that people are scheming, you mean that they are making secret plans in order to gain something for themselves. 密谋 [oft cont] [表不满] 3. N-COUNT A scheme is a plan or arrangement involving many people which is made by a government or other organization. (政府或其他机构的) 大规模计划 [英国英语] 4. PHRASE When people talk about the scheme of things or the grand scheme of things, they are referring to the way that everything in the world seems to be organized. 天地万物的格局

1. N-COUNT If you refer to a government or system of running a country as a regime, you are critical of it because you think it is not democratic and uses unacceptable methods. 统治 [表不满] 2. N-COUNT A regime is the way that something such as an institution, company, or economy is run, especially when it involves tough or severe action. (机构、公司或经济等的) 管理方式 3. N-COUNT A regime is a set of rules about food, exercise, or beauty that some people follow in order to stay healthy or attractive. 养生法
n. 事务，事宜；风流韵事
1. N-COUNT A couplet is two lines of poetry which come next to each other, especially two lines that rhyme with each other and are the same length. 对句; 对联
1. N-COUNT A photograph is a picture that is made using a camera. 照片 2. V-T When you photograph someone or something, you use a camera to obtain a picture of them. 给…照相 [正式]
1. ADJ extremely strong or powerful 强力无比 [幽默]

1. V-T/V-I When a liquid solidifies or is solidified, it changes into a solid. 使凝固; 凝固 2. V-T/V-I If something such as a position or opinion solidifies, or if something solidifies it, it becomes firmer and more definite and unlikely to change. 使稳固; 变稳固
adv. 可能地，潜在地
1. V-I If things abound, or if a place abounds with things, there are very large numbers of them. 充满 [正式]

1. ADJ You use minor when you want to describe something that is less important, serious, or significant than other things in a group or situation. 次要的 2. ADJ A minor illness or operation is not likely to be dangerous to someone's life or health. 不严重的 3. N-COUNT A minor is a person who is still legally a child. In most states in the United States, people are minors until they reach the age of eighteen. 未成年者 4. ADJ A minor scale is one in which the third note is three semitones higher than the first. 小调的

1. N-UNCOUNT Someone's residency in a particular place, especially in a country, is the fact that they live there or that they are officially allowed to live there. 居住; 居住权 2. N-COUNT A doctor's residency is the period of specialized training in a hospital that he or she receives after completing an internship. (医生的)实习期 [美国英语]

1. N-VAR Criticism is the action of expressing disapproval of something or someone. A criticism is a statement that expresses disapproval. 批评; 反对意见 2. N-UNCOUNT Criticism is a serious examination and judgment of something such as a book or play. 评论

1. N-UNCOUNT The reformation of something is the act or process of changing and improving it. 改革; 革新 2. N-PROPER The Reformation is the movement to reform the Catholic Church in the sixteenth century, which led to the Protestant church being set up. (16世纪天主教会的)宗教改革运动 ['the' N]
1. V-T If one thing or person resembles another, they are similar to each other. 像 [no cont]
n. 警告者；报警器 n. (Warner)人名；(英)沃纳；(德、瑞典)瓦尔纳
1. V-I If something bad or undesirable abates, it becomes much less strong or severe. 减弱 [正式]

1. ADJ You use verbal to indicate that something is expressed in speech rather than in writing or action. 口头的 2. verbally ADV 口头地 3. ADJ You use verbal to indicate that something is connected with words and the use of words. 词语的; 文字的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ In grammar, verbal means relating to a verb. 动词的
1. ADJ If a decision, action, or change is irrevocable, it cannot be changed or reversed. 不可改变的 [正式] 2. irrevocably ADV 不可改变地

1. N-COUNT A legacy is money or property which someone leaves to you when they die. 遗产 2. N-COUNT A legacy of an event or period of history is something which is a direct result of it and which continues to exist after it is over. 遗留问题

1. N-VAR A tribute is something that you say, do, or make to show your admiration and respect for someone. 称赞; 敬意 2. N-SING If one thing is a tribute to another, the first thing is the result of the second and shows how good it is. 有成效的结果
1. ADJ Savoury food has a salty or spicy flavour rather than a sweet one. 咸味的; 辛辣的

1. N-COUNT A template is a thin piece of metal or plastic which is cut into a particular shape. It is used to help you cut wood, paper, metal, or other materials accurately, or to reproduce the same shape many times. (用于切割木材、纸、金属等的) 模板 2. N-COUNT In computing, a template is a model of a document that you can use as a guide when creating a document of your own. (计算机中用于创建文档的) 模板 [计算机] 3. N-COUNT If one thing is a template for something else, the second thing is based on the first thing. 样板

1. N-COUNT A residence is a house where people live. 住宅 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Your place of residence is the place where you live. 住所 [正式] 3. N-UNCOUNT Someone's residence in a particular place is the fact that they live there or that they are officially allowed to live there. 居住 4. → see also residence hall 5. PHRASE If someone is in residence in a particular place, they are living there. 住在 (某处)
1. N-VAR If something is at a particular altitude, it is at that height above sea level. 海拔高度
1. N-COUNT A bow tie is a tie in the form of a bow. Bow ties are worn by men, especially for formal occasions. (男士佩戴的)蝴蝶领结
adj. 国有的；国营的；州立的
n. 威尔逊（姓氏）

1. N-COUNT An invoice is a document that lists goods that have been supplied or services that have been done, and says how much money you owe for them. 费用清单; 发票 2. V-T If you invoice someone, you send them a bill for goods or services you have provided them with. 给…开具发票
1. N-COUNT If you describe someone as a zealot, you think that their views and actions are very extreme, especially in following a particular political or religious belief. (尤指政治或宗教的)狂热分子; 极端分子 [表不满]

1. N-COUNT A tendril is something light and thin, for example, a piece of hair which hangs loose and is away from the main part. 一束; 一缕 2. N-COUNT Tendrils are thin stems which grow on some plants so that they can attach themselves to supports such as walls or other plants. (植物的)卷须; 蔓 [usu pl]

1. V-T To manufacture something means to make it in a factory, usually in large quantities. 生产 [商业] 2. N-UNCOUNT Manufacture is also a noun. 生产 3. manufacturing N-UNCOUNT 生产 4. N-COUNT In economics, manufactures are goods or products which have been made in a factory. 工业品 [商业] 5. V-T If you say that someone manufactures information, you are criticizing them because they invent information that is not true. 捏造 [表不满]
adv. 傲慢地，自负地；得意洋洋地

1. N-VAR A parody is a humorous piece of writing, drama, or music that imitates the style of a well-known person or represents a familiar situation in an exaggerated way. 滑稽模仿作品 (指文章、戏剧、音乐作品的滑稽模仿作) 2. V-T When someone parodies a particular work, thing, or person, they imitate it in an amusing or exaggerated way. 夸张地演绎; 滑稽地模仿
n. 协调；配合

1. V-T If an organization or an individual sponsors something such as an event or someone's training, they pay some or all of the expenses connected with it, often in order to get publicity for themselves. 赞助 (某事、某人的培训等) 2. V-T If you sponsor someone who is doing something to raise money for charity, for example trying to walk a certain distance, you agree to give them a sum of money for the charity if they succeed in doing it. 赞助 (为慈善事业募集资金者) 3. V-T If you sponsor a proposal or suggestion, you officially put it forward and support it. 倡议 4. V-T When a country or an organization such as the United Nations sponsors negotiations between countries, it suggests holding the negotiations and organizes them. 提议并组织 (商谈) 5. V-T If one country accuses another of sponsoring attacks on it, they mean that the other country does not do anything to prevent the attacks, and may even encourage them. 纵容 6. V-T If a company or organization sponsors a television programme, they pay to have a special advertisement shown at

1. ADJ If you accuse someone of saying or doing inflammatory things, you mean that what they say or do is likely to make people react very angrily. 使人激愤的 [表不满] 2. ADJ An inflammatory condition or disease is one in which the patient suffers from inflammation. 炎症的 [正式] [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A robber is someone who steals money or property from a bank, shop, or vehicle, often by using force or threats. 抢劫者
1. N-COUNT A decade is a period of ten years, especially one that begins with a year ending in 0, for example, 1980 to 1989. 10年 (尤指起始年末尾为0)
1. N-VAR A toxin is any poisonous substance produced by bacteria, animals, or plants. 毒素
1. N-COUNT A bloc is a group of countries that have similar political aims and interests and that act together over some issues. (具有相似政治目标和利益的国家结成的) 阵营

1. N-COUNT A span is the period of time between two dates or events during which something exists, functions, or happens. (两时间点之间的) 时间段 2. N-COUNT Your concentration span or your attention span is the length of time you are able to concentrate on something or be interested in it. (注意力的) 持续时间 3. V-T If something spans a long period of time, it lasts throughout that period of time or relates to that whole period of time. 持续 [no passive] 4. V-T If something spans a range of things, all those things are included in it. 包括 [no passive] 5. N-COUNT The span of something that extends or is spread out sideways is the total width of it from one end to the other. 宽距 [usu with supp] 6. N a team of horses or oxen, esp two matched animals 马队或牛队 7. V-T A bridge or other structure that spans something such as a river or a valley stretches right across it. 横跨
1. ADJ Someone who is conscientious is very careful to do their work properly. 认真的 2. conscientiously ADV 认真地
n. 共同创立者

1. N-VAR Conspiracy is secret planning by a group of people to do something illegal. 合谋 2. N-COUNT A conspiracy is an agreement between a group of people which other people think is wrong or is likely to be harmful. 阴谋
adv. 合法地；法律上
宽松的 散漫的 不牢固的 不精确的（loose的比较级） n. (Looser)人名；(瑞典)洛塞
1. N-COUNT A pretext is a reason that you pretend has caused you to do something. 托词

1. V-T If someone loosens restrictions or laws, for example, they make them less strict or severe. 放宽 (限制或法律) 2. loosening N-SING 放宽 3. V-T/V-I If someone or something loosens the ties between people or groups of people, or if the ties loosen, they become weaker. 疏远; 减弱 4. V-T If you loosen your clothing or something that is tied or fastened, you undo it slightly so that it is less tight or less firmly held in place. 略微松开 5. V-T/V-I If you loosen your grip on something, or if your grip loosens, you hold it less tightly. 放开 6. V-T/V-I If a government or organization loosens its grip on a group of people or an activity, or if its grip loosens, it begins to have less control over it. 放松 (控制)
1. N-COUNT A tunnel is a long passage which has been made under the ground, usually through a hill or under the sea. 隧道 2. V-I To tunnel somewhere means to make a tunnel there. 挖掘隧道

1. V-I If you have to contend with a problem or difficulty, you have to deal with it or overcome it. 解决 2. V-T If you contend that something is true, you state or argue that it is true. 辩称 [正式] 3. V-RECIP If you contend with someone for something such as power, you compete with them to try to get it. 争夺 (权力等)
1. ADJ A formative period of time or experience is one that has an important and lasting influence on a person's character and attitudes. 形成的 (时期、经历)
adv. 众所周知地；声名狼藉地；恶名昭彰地
1. N-COUNT A dagger is a weapon like a knife with two sharp edges. 匕首
n. 渗透；突破；侵入；洞察力
1. ADJ A populous country or area has a lot of people living in it. 人口众多的 [正式] [usu ADJ n]

1. ADJ If you describe someone or something as unpredictable, you mean that you cannot tell what they are going to do or how they are going to behave. 不可预测的 2. unpredictability N-UNCOUNT 不可预测性 [oft with poss]
1. V-T If you deride someone or something, you say that they are stupid or have no value. 嘲笑 [正式]

1. PREP Not counting a particular thing means not including that thing. Counting a particular thing means including that thing. 算上; 把...计算在内 2. PHRASE If you say and counting after a number or an amount of something, you mean that the number or amount is continuing to increase. (数量)继续增长 [amount PHR]

1. ADJ Someone who is lonely is unhappy because they are alone or do not have anyone they can talk to. (人) 孤独的 2. ADJ A lonely situation or period of time is one in which you feel unhappy because you are alone or do not have anyone to talk to. 孤独的 (情形、时期) 3. ADJ A lonely place is one where very few people come. 偏僻的
1. ADJ involving, relating to, seeing with or intended for both eyes 用双眼看的

1. N-COUNT The impact that something has on a situation, process, or person is a sudden and powerful effect that it has on them. 影响 2. N-VAR An impact is the action of one object hitting another, or the force with which one object hits another. 撞击; 撞击力 3. V-T/V-I To impact a situation, process, or person means to affect them. 对…造成影响; 产生影响 4. V-T/V-I If one object impacts on another, it hits it with great force. 撞击 [正式]

1. V-I If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them. 谈及 2. V-I If you refer to someone or something as a particular thing, you use a particular word, expression, or name to mention or describe them. 称 3. V-I If a word refers to a particular thing, situation, or idea, it describes it in some way. 描述 4. V-T If a person who is ill is referred to a hospital or a specialist, they are sent there by a doctor in order to be treated. 把…送往 [usu passive] 5. V-T If you refer a task or a problem to a person or an organization, you formally tell them about it, so that they can deal with it. 提交 6. V-T If you refer someone to a person or organization, you send them there for the help they need. 介绍 7. V-I If you refer to a book or other source of information, you look at it in order to find something out. 参考; 查看 8. V-T If you refer someone to a source of information, you tell them the place where they will find the information they need or that you think will interest them. 指点…查
1. N-UNCOUNT The mortality in a particular place or situation is the number of people who die. 死亡人数

1. V-I If a proposal, principle, or opinion prevails, it gains influence or is accepted, often after a struggle or argument. 占上风 2. V-I If a situation, attitude, or custom prevails in a particular place at a particular time, it is normal or most common in that place at that time. 盛行; 普遍存在 3. V-I If one side in a battle, contest, or dispute prevails, it wins. 获胜
1. N-UNCOUNT Hemp is a plant used for making rope or the drug marijuana. 大麻(植物)
1. ADJ Something that is divisive causes unfriendliness and argument between people. 造成不和的; 引起纷争的
1. V-T If you disinfect something, you clean it using a substance that kills germs. 给…消毒
n. [金融] 货币化；定为货币；货币铸造
关节镜

1. V-T If you do not dare to do something, you do not have enough courage to do it, or you do not want to do it because you fear the consequences. If you dare to do something, you do something which requires a lot of courage. 敢于 2. MODAL Dare is also a modal. 敢; 竟敢 3. V-T If you dare someone to do something, you challenge them to prove that they are not frightened of doing it. 向…挑战 4. N-COUNT A dare is a challenge which one person gives to another to do something dangerous or frightening. 挑战 5. PHRASE If you say to someone "don't you dare" do something, you are telling them not to do it and letting them know that you are angry. 看你敢… [口语] 6. PHRASE You say "how dare you" when you are very shocked and angry about something that someone has done. 你竟敢… [口语] 7. PHRASE You can use "I daresay" or "I dare say" before or after a statement to indicate that you believe it is probably true. 我相信

1. N-UNCOUNT Ginger is the root of a plant that is used to flavour food. It has a sweet, spicy flavour and is often sold in powdered form. 姜 2. COLOR Ginger is used to describe things that are orangey brown in colour. 姜黄色的

1. N-COUNT An animal's rump is its rear end. (动物的) 臀部 2. N-UNCOUNT Rump or rump steak is meat cut from the rear end of a cow. 牛后臀尖 3. N-SING The rump of a group, organization, or country consists of the members who remain in it after the rest have left. (集团、组织或国家的) 残余部分 [英国英语]
1. ADJ (of a loan) made to a borrower with a poor credit rating, usually at a high rate of interest (贷款)次级的 2. N a loan made to a borrower with a poor credit rating 次级贷款

1. ADJ Someone who is privileged has an advantage or opportunity that most other people do not have, often because of their wealth or connections with powerful people. 有特权的 2. N-PLURAL The privileged are people who are privileged. 有特权的人 3. ADJ Privileged information is known by only a small group of people, who are not legally required to give it to anyone else. 特许保密的

1. ADV You use scarcely to emphasize that something is only just true or only just the case. 几乎不; 简直不 [强调] 2. ADV You can use scarcely to say that something is not true or is not the case, in a humorous or critical way. 决不 3. ADV If you say scarcely had one thing happened when something else happened, you mean that the first event was followed immediately by the second. 刚…就… [ADV before v]

1. N-COUNT A vendor is someone who sells things such as newspapers, cigarettes, or food from a small stall or cart. 小贩 2. N-COUNT A vendor is a company or person that sells a product or service, especially one who sells to other companies that sell to the public. 卖主 [法律]
1. N-MASS A vaccine is a substance containing a harmless form of the germs that cause a particular disease. It is given to people, usually by injection, to prevent them from getting that disease. 疫苗

1. N-UNCOUNT Air is the mixture of gases that forms the Earth's atmosphere and that we breathe. 空气 2. N-UNCOUNT Air is used to refer to travel in aircraft. 空运 3. N-SING Theair is the space around things or above the ground. 空中 4. V-T If a broadcasting company airs a television or radio programme, they show it on television or broadcast it on the radio. 播放 [美国英语] 5. airing N-SING 播放 6. V-T If you air a room or building, you let fresh air into it. 使通风 7. PHRASE If you do something to clear the air, you do it in order to resolve any problems or disagreements that there might be. 澄清视听 8. PHRASE If something is in the air it is felt to be present, but it is not talked about. 可感觉到 (但不说出来) 9. PHRASE If someone is on the air, they are broadcasting on radio or television. If a programme is on the air, it is being broadcast on radio or television. If it is off the air, it is not being broadcast. (人) 播报; (节目) 播放 10. PHRASE If someone or something disappears into thin air, they disappear completely. If someone
adv. 意味深长地；值得注目地
1. ADJ hinted at or suggested; not directly expressed 暗指的; 暗示的; 不直接表达的
adv. 独立地；自立地
1. V-T If something ails a group or area of activity, it is a problem or source of trouble for that group or for people involved in that activity. 困扰; 使烦恼
1. N-VAR Walnuts are edible nuts that have a wrinkled shape and a hard round shell that is light brown in colour. 胡桃; 核桃
1. ADJ Gusty winds are very strong and irregular. 大风的 [usu ADJ n]

1. V-T/V-I When you chill something or when it chills, you lower its temperature so that it becomes colder but does not freeze. 使冷却; 冷却 2. V-T When cold weather or something cold chills a person or a place, it makes that person or that place feel very cold. 使很冷 3. N-COUNT If something sends a chill through you, it gives you a sudden feeling of fear or anxiety. 害怕的感觉 4. N-COUNT A chill is a mild illness which can give you a slight fever and headache. 风寒 5. ADJ Chill weather is cold and unpleasant. 寒冷的 [ADJ n] 6. N-SING Chill is also a noun. 寒冷

1. N-COUNT A consultancy is a company that gives expert advice on a particular subject. 咨询公司 2. N-UNCOUNT Consultancy is expert advice on a particular subject which a person or group is paid to provide to a company or organization. 咨询 [英国英语]

1. N-COUNT A cubicle is a very small enclosed area, for example, one where you can take a shower or change your clothes. (用于淋浴、更衣等的) 小单间 2. N-COUNT A cubicle is an area in an office that is separated from the rest of the room by thin walls. (办公室内的) 格子间
n. 马尔科（人名）；显示地图；展现地图
1. ADJ If you describe someone as meticulous, you mean that they do things very carefully and with great attention to detail. 小心谨慎的 2. meticulously ADV 细致地
1. N-UNCOUNT If flooding occurs, an area of land that is usually dry is covered with water after heavy rain or after a river or lake flows over its banks. 洪水泛滥

1. N-COUNT A particular constituency is a section of society that may give political support to a particular party or politician. (会支持某政党或政客的) 选民阵营 2. N-COUNT A constituency is an area for which someone is elected as the representative in a legislature or government. 选区
1. V-I If a drink fizzes, it produces a lot of little bubbles of gas and makes a sound like a long "s." (饮料) 嘶嘶地冒泡 2. N-UNCOUNT Fizz is also a noun. 气泡
1. N-COUNT A correspondent is a newspaper or television journalist, especially one who specializes in a particular type of news. (尤指对某一专题进行报道的) 记者
n. 威廉姆斯（男子名）

1. N-VAR Loss is the fact of no longer having something or having less of it than before. 丧失 2. N-VAR Loss of life occurs when people die. 死亡 3. N-UNCOUNT The loss of a relative or friend is their death. (亲人、朋友的) 亡故 4. N-UNCOUNT Loss is the feeling of sadness you experience when someone or something you like is taken away from you. 失落感 5. N-COUNT A loss is the disadvantage you suffer when a valuable and useful person or thing leaves or is taken away. 损失 6. N-UNCOUNT The loss of something such as heat, blood, or fluid is the gradual reduction of it or of its level in a system or in someone's body. (热量、血液或液体等的) 流失 7. N-VAR If a business makes a loss, it earns less than it spends. 亏损 [英国英语] 8. PHRASE If a business produces something at a loss, they sell it at a price which is less than it cost them to produce it or buy it. 亏本地 [商业] 9. PHRASE If you say that you are at a loss, you mean that you do not know what to do in a particular situation. 不知所措

1. N-COUNT If someone or something creates a vacuum, they leave a place or position that then needs to be filled by another person or thing. 空缺 2. PHRASE If something is done in a vacuum, it is not affected by any outside influences or information. 在与世隔绝的状态中 3. N-COUNT A vacuum is a space that contains no air or other gas. 真空 4. N-COUNT A vacuum is the same as a . 真空吸尘器 5. V-T/V-I If you vacuum something, you clean it using a vacuum cleaner. 用真空吸尘器清洁
1. N-PROPER The Exchequer is the department in the British government responsible for receiving, issuing, and accounting for money belonging to the state. (英国政府的)财政部

1. ADJ If you describe someone as inconsistent, you are criticizing them for not behaving in the same way every time a similar situation occurs. 反复无常的 [表不满] 2. ADJ Someone or something that is inconsistent does not stay the same, being sometimes good and sometimes bad. 不稳定的; 时好时坏的 3. ADJ If two statements are inconsistent, one cannot possibly be true if the other is true. 不一致的 4. ADJ If something is inconsistent with a set of ideas or values, it does not fit in well with them or match them. 与…不相合的 [v-link ADJ 'with' n]

1. ADV If something is situated inland, it is away from the coast, toward or near the middle of a country. If you go inland, you go away from the coast, toward the middle of a country. 在内地 (或内陆); 向内地 (或内陆) 2. ADJ Inland areas, lakes, and places are not on the coast, but in or near the middle of a country. 内地的; 内陆的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ being the older: used to distinguish the father from the son with the same first name or names 长辈的; 用于区分同名父子 (Abbreviation Sr, Sen) [美国英语]
1. V-T If something perturbs you, it worries you quite a lot. 使焦虑; 使不安 [正式] → see also perturbed

1. ADJ Mighty is used to describe something that is very large or powerful. 强大的 [文学性] 2. ADV Mighty is used in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize the quality that they are describing. 非常 [美国英语] [非正式] [ADV adj/adv] 3. → see also high-and-mighty

1. N-COUNT A textbook is a book containing facts about a particular subject that is used by people studying that subject. 教科书 2. ADJ If you say that something is a textbook case or example, you are emphasizing that it provides a clear example of a type of situation or event. 典型的 [ADJ n] [强调]

1. ADJ Something that is experimental is new or uses new ideas or methods, and might be modified later if it is unsuccessful. 试验性的 2. ADJ Experimental means using, used in, or resulting from scientific experiments. 实验的 [ADJ n] 3. experimentally ADV 实验地 [ADV with v] 4. ADJ An experimental action is done in order to see what it is like, or what effects it has. 试验性的 5. experimentally ADV 试验性地 [ADV with v]

1. N-UNCOUNT Spawn is a soft, jelly-like substance containing the eggs of fish, or of animals such as frogs. (鱼、蛙等的)卵 [usu n N] 2. V-I When fish or animals such as frogs spawn, they lay their eggs. (鱼、蛙等)产卵 3. V-T If something spawns something else, it causes it to happen or to be created. 引发 [文学性]
n. 官窑瓷器 n. (Kuan)人名；(俄)库安
n. 斯特拉斯堡（法国东北部城市）

1. ADJ You can use acute to indicate that an undesirable situation or feeling is very severe or intense. 严峻的 2. ADJ An acute illness is one that becomes severe very quickly but does not last very long. Compare . 急性的 [医学] [ADJ n] 3. ADJ If a person's or animal's sight, hearing, or sense of smell is acute, it is sensitive and powerful. 敏锐的 4. ADJ An acute angle is less than 90°. Compare angle. 锐 (角) 5. ADJ An acute accent is a symbol that is placed over vowels in some languages in order to indicate how that vowel is pronounced or over one letter in a word to indicate where it is stressed. You refer to a letter with this accent as, for example, e acute. For example, there is an acute accent over the letter "e" in the French word "café." 尖音符的 (E)(上的符号) [ADJ n, n ADJ]
n. 折旧；贬值
1. V to negotiate again in order to alter or change previously agreed terms 重新谈判(之前已同意的条款)

1. V-T If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it. 使能够 2. V-T To enable something to happen means to make it possible for it to happen. 使成为可能 3. V-T To enable someone to do something means to give them permission or the right to do it. 允许

1. ADJ Something that is Portuguese belongs or relates to Portugal, or its people, language, or culture. 葡萄牙的; 葡萄牙人的; 葡萄牙语的; 葡萄牙文化的 2. N-PLURAL The Portuguese are the people of Portugal. 葡萄牙人 ['the' N] 3. N-UNCOUNT Portuguese is the language spoken in Portugal, Brazil, Angola, and Mozambique. 葡萄牙语

1. N-VAR The probability of something happening is how likely it is to happen, sometimes expressed as a fraction or a percentage. 概率 2. N-VAR You say that there is a probability that something will happen when it is likely to happen. 可能性 [含糊] 3. PHRASE If you say that something will happen in all probability, you mean that you think it is very likely to happen. 很可能 [含糊]

1. N-VAR If a company, person, or state has a monopoly on something such as an industry, they have complete control over it, so that it is impossible for others to become involved in it. 垄断 [商业] 2. N-COUNT A monopoly is a company which is the only one providing a particular product or service. 垄断企业 [商业] 3. N-SING If you say that someone does not have a monopoly on something, you mean that they are not the only person who has that thing. 独有

1. ADJ A piece of information that is speculative is based on guesses rather than knowledge. 猜测性的 2. ADJ Speculative is used to describe activities which involve buying goods or shares, or buildings and properties, in the hope of being able to sell them again at a higher price and make a profit. 投机性的

1. N-COUNT If you have a preoccupation with something or someone, you keep thinking about them because they are important to you. 关注 2. N-UNCOUNT Preoccupation is a state of mind in which you think about something so much that you do not consider other things to be important. 专注
n. 海地
1. ADJ If you are circumspect, you are cautious in what you do and say and do not take risks. (指说话做事)谨慎小心的 [正式] [ADV after v] 2. circumspectly ADV
n. （伦敦的）泰晤士河
1. ADJ If you are disgruntled, you are angry and dissatisfied because things have not happened the way that you wanted them to happen. 生气的; 不满的
1. ABBREVIATION for optical character reader or recognition 光符识别器

1. V-T/V-I If the authorities prosecute someone, they charge them with a crime and put them on trial. 对…提起公诉; 提起公诉 2. V-T When a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person who is on trial is guilty. (原告律师) 起诉
1. ADJ If something is unconstitutional, it breaks the rules of a constitution. 违反宪法的 2. unconstitutionally ADV 违反宪法地 [ADV with v]

1. N-VAR A metaphor is an imaginative way of describing something by referring to something else which is the same in a particular way. For example, if you want to say that someone is very shy and frightened of things, you might say that they are a mouse. 隐喻 2. N-VAR If one thing is a metaphor for another, it is intended or regarded as a symbol of it. 象征 3. PHRASE If you mix your metaphors, you use two conflicting metaphors. People do this accidentally, or sometimes deliberately as a joke. 把两个矛盾的隐喻混用在一起

1. ADJ Something that is real actually exists and is not imagined, invented, or theoretical. 真实的 2. ADJ If something is real to someone, they experience it as though it really exists or happens, even though it does not. 逼真的 3. ADJ A material or object that is real is natural or functioning, and not artificial or an imitation. 天然的; 非仿制的 4. ADJ You can use real to describe someone or something that has all the characteristics or qualities that such a person or thing typically has. 名副其实的; 真正的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ You can use real to describe something that is the true or original thing of its kind, in contrast to one that someone wants you to believe is true. 真实的; 最初的 [ADJ n] 6. ADJ You can use real to describe something that is the most important or typical part of a thing. 最重要的; 最典型的 [ADJ n] 7. ADJ You can use real when you are talking about a situation or feeling to emphasize that it exists and is important or serious. 确实存在的; 真切而严重的 [强调] 8. ADJ You can use real to emphasize a quality that is genuine and si
1. N-COUNT A clearing is a small area in a forest where there are no trees or bushes. 林中空地

1. N-COUNT A modifier is a word or group of words that modifies another word or group. In some descriptions of grammar, only words that are used before a noun are called modifiers. 修饰语; 用于修饰其他词或词性。某些语法认为只有用于名词前时才能称为修饰语。
n. 医疗保健；健康护理，健康服务；卫生保健

1. N-UNCOUNT Tolerance is the quality of allowing other people to say and do what they like, even if you do not agree with or approve of it. 宽容 [表赞许] 2. N-UNCOUNT Tolerance is the ability to bear something painful or unpleasant. 忍耐力

1. ADJ A critical time, factor, or situation is extremely important. 关键的 2. critically ADV 关键地 3. ADJ A critical situation is very serious and dangerous. 危急的 4. critically ADV 危急地 5. ADJ If a person is critical or in a critical condition in a hospital, they are seriously ill. 病危的 6. critically ADV 病危地 7. ADJ To be critical of someone or something means to criticize them. 批评的 8. critically ADV 批评地 9. ADJ A critical approach to something involves examining and judging it carefully. 批判性的 [ADJ n] 10. critically ADV 批判性地 11. ADJ If something or someone receives critical acclaim, critics say that they are very good. 获好评的 [ADJ n]
1. N-PLURAL The overheads of a business are its regular and essential expenses, such as salaries, rent, electricity, and telephone bills. (企业的) 日常费用 [商业]
1. N-COUNT A medal is a small metal disc which is given as an award for bravery or as a prize in a sports event. 奖章
adj. 加州的；加利福尼亚的 n. 加利福尼亚州人
n. 达康（公司名）；网站
正如；与…一样；就…来说
1. N-UNCOUNT Sovereignty is the power that a country has to govern itself or another country or state. 统治权
1. ADJ Someone who is scrupulous takes great care to do what is fair, honest, or morally right. 讲良心的 [表赞许] 2. ADJ Scrupulous means thorough, exact, and careful about details. 谨小慎微的
1. N-COUNT An heir is someone who has the right to inherit a person's money, property, or title when that person dies. 继承人
培尔·金特（配乐组曲名）
n. 联合利华（财富500强公司之一，总部位于荷兰和英国，主要经营食品）
1. ADJ having features as specified 有...特色的
1. ADJ Convivial people or occasions are pleasant, friendly, and relaxed. 快活的 [正式]
1. N-UNCOUNT The empowerment of a person or group of people is the process of giving them power and status in a particular situation. 权利赋予

1. N-COUNT A strip of something such as paper, cloth, or food is a long, narrow piece of it. (纸、布或食物的) 条 2. N-COUNT A strip of land or water is a long narrow area of it. 狭长 (地带或水域) 3. N-COUNT A strip is a long street in a city or town, where there are a lot of stores, restaurants, and hotels. 商业街 [美国英语] 4. V-I If you strip, you take off your clothes. 脱衣服 5. PHRASAL VERB Strip off means the same as . 脱衣服 6. V-T If someone is stripped, their clothes are taken off by another person, for example in order to search for hidden or illegal things. 脱掉…的衣服 [usu passive] 7. V-T To strip something means to remove everything that covers it. 剥离 8. V-T If you strip an engine or a piece of equipment, you take it to pieces so that it can be cleaned or repaired. 拆卸 9. V to cut or divide into strips 切成或分成条 10. PHRASAL VERB Strip down means the same as . 拆卸 11. V-T To strip someone of their property, rights, or titles means to take those things away from them. 剥夺 (财产、权利); 撤销 (头衔) 12. N-COUNT In a newspaper or magazi

1. V-T/V-I If you cross something such as a room, a road, or an area of land or water, you move or travel to the other side of it. If you cross to a place, you move or travel over a room, road, or area of land or water in order to reach that place. 穿过; 穿过去 2. V-T A road, railway, or bridge that crosses an area of land or water passes over it. 横跨 3. V-T If someone or something crosses a limit or boundary, for example, the limit of acceptable behaviour, they go beyond it. 越过 (可以被容忍的限度) 4. V-T If an expression crosses someone's face, it appears briefly on their face. 闪过 [书面] 5. V-T If you cross your arms, legs, or fingers, you put one of them on top of the other. 交叉 6. V-RECIP Lines or roads that cross meet and go across each other. 相交 7. N-COUNT A cross is a shape that consists of a vertical line or piece with a shorter horizontal line or piece across it. It is the most important Christian symbol. 十字架 (基督教最重要的标志) 8. N-COUNT A cross is a written mark in the shape of an X. You can use it, for example, to

1. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the amusing things that people say as their humour. 幽默 2. → see also sense of humour 3. N-UNCOUNT Humour is a quality in something that makes you laugh, for example in a situation, in someone's words or actions, or in a book or film. 幽默性; 令人发笑之处 4. N-VAR If you are in a good humour, you feel cheerful and happy, and are pleasant to people. If you are in a bad humour, you feel bad tempered and unhappy, and are unpleasant to people. 心情 5. N-UNCOUNT If you do something with good humour, you do it cheerfully and pleasantly. 精神状态 6. V-T If you humour someone who is behaving strangely, you try to please them or pretend to agree with them, so that they will not become upset. 迁就
n. 探测；探究；踏勘

1. V-T If a person or company employs you, they pay you to work for them. 雇用 2. V-T If you employ certain methods, materials, or expressions, you use them. 使用 3. V-T If your time is employed in doing something, you are using the time you have to do that thing. 利用 [usu passive]

1. V-T To ruin something means to severely harm, damage, or spoil it. 毁坏 2. V-T To ruin someone means to cause them to no longer have any money. 使倾家荡产 3. N-UNCOUNT Ruin is the state of no longer having any money. 破产 4. N-UNCOUNT Ruin is the state of being severely damaged or spoiled, or the process of reaching this state. 毁坏; 破落 5. N-PLURAL The ruins of something are the parts of it that remain after it has been severely damaged or weakened. 残存部分 6. N-COUNT Theruins of a building are the parts of it that remain after the rest has fallen down or been destroyed. 废墟 7. → see also ruined 8. PHRASE If something is in ruins, it is completely spoiled. 毁灭了的 9. PHRASE If a building or place is in ruins, most of it has been destroyed and only parts of it remain. 成为废墟了的
1. V-T If the government repeals a law, it officially ends it, so that it is no longer valid. 撤销; 废止 (法令) 2. N-UNCOUNT Repeal is also a noun. 撤销; (法令的) 废止

1. N-VAR Reconciliation between two people or countries who have quarrelled is the process of their becoming friends again. A reconciliation is an instance of this. 和解 2. N-SING The reconciliation of two beliefs, facts, or demands that seem to be opposed is the process of finding a way in which they can both be true or both be successful. 调和; 一致

1. V-I If you recline on something, you sit or lie on it with the upper part of your body supported at an angle. 斜靠 2. V-T/V-I When a seat reclines or when you recline it, you lower the back so that it is more comfortable to sit in. 使向后倾斜; 向后倾斜

1. V-T If you interpret something in a particular way, you decide that this is its meaning or significance. 解释 2. V-T/V-I If you interpret what someone is saying, you translate it immediately into another language. 口译; 作口译
n. 阿尔卑斯山脉
n. 格拉斯哥（英国城市名）
adj. 罗马尼亚的 罗马尼亚人的 罗马尼亚语的 罗马尼亚的 罗马尼亚人的 罗马尼亚语的 n. 罗马尼亚人 罗马尼亚语 罗马尼亚人 罗马尼亚语

1. N-COUNT A sink is a large fixed container in a kitchen or bathroom, with faucets to supply water. In the kitchen, it is used for washing dishes, and in the bathroom, it is used to wash your hands and face. (固定在厨房里的) 洗涤槽; (固定在浴室里的) 洗脸盆 2. V-T/V-I If a boat sinks or if someone or something sinks it, it disappears below the surface of a mass of water. 使沉没; 下沉 3. V-I If something sinks, it disappears below the surface of a mass of water. 沉没 4. V-I If something sinks, it moves slowly downward. 下沉 5. V-I If something sinks to a lower level or standard, it falls to that level or standard. 下降 6. V-I If your heart or your spirits sink, you become depressed or lose hope. (心情) 沮丧; (情绪) 低落 7. V-T/V-I If something sharp sinks or is sunk into something solid, it goes deeply into it. 深深切入 8. V-T If someone sinks a well, mine, or other large hole, they make a deep hole in the ground, usually by digging or drilling. 打 (水井); 挖 (矿井) 9. V-T If you sink money into a business or project, you spend money on it in the h
n. （意）意大利式脆饼（biscotto的复数） n. (Biscotti)人名；(意)比斯科蒂

1. V-LINK If someone keeps or is kept in a particular state, they remain in it. 保持 (特定状态) 2. V-T/V-I If you keep or you are kept in a particular position or place, you remain in it. 留在 3. V-I If you keep off something or keep away from it, you avoid it. If you keep out of something, you avoid getting involved in it. 避开 4. V-T If you keep doing something, you do it repeatedly or continue to do it. 继续 5. PHRASAL VERB Keep on means the same as keep. 继续 6. V-T Keep is used with some nouns to indicate that someone does something for a period of time or continues to do it. For example, if you keep a grip on something, you continue to hold or control it. 继续 (持有或控制) 7. V-T If you keep something, you continue to have it in your possession and do not throw it away, give it away, or sell it. 保留 8. V-T If you keep something in a particular place, you always have it or store it in that place so that you can use it whenever you need it. 保存 9. V-T When you keep something such as a promise or an appointment, you do

1. V-T If someone is tortured, another person deliberately causes them terrible pain over a period of time, in order to punish them or to make them reveal information. 拷打; 拷问 2. N-VAR Torture is also a noun. 拷打; 拷问 3. V-T To torture someone means to cause them to suffer mental pain or anxiety. (精神上) 折磨
1. N-COUNT A spate of things, especially unpleasant things, is a large number of them that happen or appear within a short period of time. 一连串
1. N-UNCOUNT Yoga is a type of exercise in which you move your body into various positions in order to become more fit or flexible, to improve your breathing, and to relax your mind. 瑜伽
1. ADJ Celestial is used to describe things relating to heaven or to the sky. 天上的; 天堂的 [文学性]
adv. 同时地
1. ADJ A person who is comatose is in a coma. 昏迷不醒的 [医学] 2. ADJ A person who is comatose is in a deep sleep, usually because they are tired or have drunk too much alcohol. 昏睡的 [非正式] [oft ADJ after v]
1. ADJ If you describe a person or a piece of writing as verbose, you are critical of them because they use more words than are necessary, and so make you feel bored or annoyed. 罗嗦的 [正式]

1. V-T/V-I If people loot, or loot stores or houses, they steal things from them, for example, during a war or riot. (战争或暴乱时) 抢劫 (商店或房屋) 2. looting N-UNCOUNT 抢劫 3. V-T If someone loots things, they steal them, for example, during a war or riot. (战争或暴乱时) 掠夺
1. N-VAR A paradigm is a model for something that explains it or shows how it can be produced. 范例 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A duster is a cloth which you use for removing dust from furniture, ornaments, or other objects. 抹布 → see also feather duster

1. N-COUNT An issue is an important subject that people are arguing about or discussing. 议题 2. N-SING If something is the issue, it is the thing you consider to be the most important part of a situation or discussion. 要点 3. N-COUNT An issue of something such as a magazine or newspaper is the version of it that is published, for example, in a particular month or on a particular day. (杂志或报刊的) 期 4. V-T If you issue a statement or a warning, you make it known formally or publicly. 发表 (声明); 发出 (警告) 5. V-T If you are issued with something, it is officially given to you. 分发 [usu passive] 6. N-UNCOUNT Issue is also a noun. 分发 7. PHRASE The question or point at issue is the question or point that is being argued about or discussed. 争论中的 8. PHRASE If you make an issue of something, you try to make other people think about it or discuss it, because you are concerned or annoyed about it. 挑起对…的争论 9. PHRASE If you take issue with someone or something they said, you disagree with them, and start arguing about it.
adj. free market的变形 自由市场
1. N-PLURAL The minutiae of something such as someone's job or life are the very small details of it. 细枝末节; 琐事 [正式] [usu 'the' N 'of' n]

1. V-I If something looms over you, it appears as a large or unclear shape, often in a frightening way. (常以可怕的方式) 赫然出现; 隐约显现 2. V-I If a worrying or threatening situation or event is looming, it seems likely to happen soon. (令人担忧的或危险的情形或事件) 可能发生; 逐渐逼近 [journalism] 3. N-COUNT A loom is a machine that is used for weaving thread into cloth. 织布机
1. ADJ Something that is viable is capable of doing what it is intended to do. 可行的 2. viability N-UNCOUNT 可行性

1. V-I When a telephone rings, it makes a sound to let you know that someone is phoning you. (电话) 响铃 2. N-COUNT Ring is also a noun. (电话) 响铃声 3. ringing N-UNCOUNT (电话) 响铃 4. V-T/V-I When you ring someone, you telephone them. 给…打电话 [英国英语] 5. PHRASAL VERB Ring up means the same as ring. 给…打电话; 打电话 6. V to emit or cause to emit a sonorous or resonant sound, characteristic of certain metals when struck (撞击金属时)叮叮响 7. V-T/V-I When you ring a bell or when a bell rings, it makes a sound. 使 (铃) 响; (铃) 响 8. N-COUNT Ring is also a noun. (铃的) 响声 9. ringing N-UNCOUNT (铃) 响 10. V-I If you say that a place is ringing with sound, usually pleasant sound, you mean that the place is completely filled with that sound. (优美的声音) 回荡 [文学性] 11. N-SING You can use ring to describe a quality that something such as a statement, discussion, or argument seems to have. For example, if an argument has a familiar ring, it seems familiar. 感觉 12. PHRASE If you give someone a ring, you phone them. 给某人电话 [英国英语] [非正式] 13. PHRASE If a
1. ADJ If one thing is akin to another, it is similar to it in some way. 相似的 [正式] [v-link ADJ 'to' n]
[会计] 净收益；收益净额

item.word: well well well well well well
item.trans: 1. ADV You say well to indicate that you are about to say something. 哦 (用于将要说的话之前) [ADV cl] 2. ADV You say well just before or after you pause, especially to give yourself time to think about what you are going to say. (用于说话停顿的前后，尤用于给自己考虑的时间) 嗯 [ADV cl] 3. ADV You say well when you are correcting something that you have just said. (用于更正刚说过的话) 哦 [ADV cl/group] 4. ADV You say well to express your doubt about something that someone has said. (用于表示对别人说过的话的怀疑) 啊 [ADV cl] [情感] 5. INTERJ You say well to express your surprise or anger at something that someone has just said or done. (用于表达惊讶或气愤) 哎呀 [情感] 6. CONVENTION You say well to indicate that you are waiting for someone to say something and often to express your irritation with them. (用于等待别人回应，常表示不耐烦) 嗯 [情感] 7. CONVENTION You use well to indicate that you are amused by something you have heard or seen, and often to introduce a comment on it. (表示高兴并常引出评价) 好啊 [情感] 8. CONVENTION You say oh well to indicate that you accept a situation or that someone else sho
可能的（likely的比较级）

1. N-PLURAL Equities are shares in a company that are owned by people who have a right to vote at the company's meetings and to receive part of the company's profits after the holders of preference shares have been paid. 普通股 [商业] 2. → see also preference shares
1. N the act or process of returning or running back 递归

1. V-T If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread. 促进 2. promotion N-UNCOUNT 促进 3. V-T If a firm promotes a product, it tries to increase the sales or popularity of that product. 促销 4. V-T If someone is promoted, they are given a more important job or rank in the organization that they work for. 晋升 [usu passive]
1. N-COUNT A scab is a hard, dry covering that forms over the surface of a wound. 痂

1. V-T If you bypass someone or something that you would normally have to get involved with, you ignore them, often because you want to achieve something more quickly. (为了更快地达成某事而) 不顾 2. N-COUNT A bypass is a surgical operation performed on or near the heart, in which the flow of blood is redirected so that it does not flow through a part of the heart that is diseased or blocked. 心脏分流手术 3. N-COUNT A bypass is a main road that takes traffic around the edge of a town or city rather than through its centre. (绕过城镇中心的) 旁道 4. V-T If a road bypasses a place, it goes around it rather than through it. 绕过 5. V-T If you bypass a place when you are travelling, you avoid going through it. 避开
莫尔西（地名）

1. ADJ Colombian means belonging or relating to Colombia or its people or culture. 哥伦比亚的; 哥伦比亚人的; 哥伦比亚文化的 2. N-COUNT A Colombian is a Colombian citizen, or a person of Colombian origin. 哥伦比亚人; 哥伦比亚血统的人
n. 健康；适当；适合性

1. N-UNCOUNT Theformationof something is the starting or creation of it. 始创 2. N-UNCOUNT Theformationof an idea, habit, relationship, or character is the process of developing and establishing it. (观念、习惯、关系、性格等的) 形成 3. N-COUNT If people or things are in formation, they are arranged in a particular pattern as they move. 编队 4. N-COUNT A rock or cloud formation is rock or cloud of a particular shape or structure. (岩石或云的) 形成物

1. V-T If you retrieve something, you get it back from the place where you left it. 找回; 取回 2. V-T If you manage to retrieve a situation, you succeed in bringing it back into a more acceptable state. 挽回 3. V-T To retrieve information from a computer or from your memory means to get it back. (从电脑中) 读取 (信息)
1. ADJ A miscellaneous group consists of many different kinds of things or people that are difficult to put into a particular category. 各式各样的 [ADJ n]
1. V to grieve; distress; afflict 使痛苦

1. N-COUNT A disadvantage is a factor which makes someone or something less useful, acceptable, or successful than other people or things. 不利条件 2. PHRASE If you are at a disadvantage, you have a problem or difficulty that many other people do not have, which makes it harder for you to be successful. 处于劣势 3. PHRASE If something is to your disadvantage or works to your disadvantage, it creates difficulties for you. 对 (某人) 不利

1. N-COUNT A volunteer is someone who does work without being paid for it, because they want to do it. 志愿者 2. N-COUNT A volunteer is someone who offers to do a particular task or job without being forced to do it. 自告奋勇者 3. V-I If you volunteer to do something, you offer to do it without being forced to do it. 主动要求做 4. V-T If you volunteer information, you tell someone something without being asked. 主动提供 (信息) [正式] 5. N-COUNT A volunteer is someone who chooses to join the armed forces, especially during a war, as opposed to someone who is forced to join by law. 志愿兵

1. N-UNCOUNT The division of a large unit into two or more distinct parts is the act of separating it into these parts. 分割; 分裂 2. N-UNCOUNT The division of something among people or things is its separation into parts which are distributed among the people or things. 分配 3. N-UNCOUNT Division is the arithmetical process of dividing one number into another number. 除法 4. N-VAR A division is a significant distinction or argument between two groups, which causes the two groups to be considered as very different and separate. 分歧; 不和 5. N-COUNT In a large organization, a division is a group of departments whose work is done in the same place or is connected with similar tasks. 部门 6. N-COUNT A division is a group of military units which fight as a single unit. 师 (军队的作战单位) 7. N-COUNT In some sports, such as football, baseball, and basketball, a division is one of the groups of teams which make up a league. The teams in each division are of the same level, and they all play against each other during the season.

1. N-COUNT A spark is a tiny bright piece of burning material that flies up from something that is burning. 火花 2. N-COUNT A spark is a flash of light caused by electricity. It often makes a loud sound. 电火花 3. V-I If something sparks, sparks of fire or light come from it. 发出火花 4. V-T If a burning object or electricity sparks a fire, it causes a fire. 引发 (一场火) 5. N-COUNT A spark of a quality or feeling, especially a desirable one, is a small but noticeable amount of it. 一点 (品质或情感) 6. V-T If one thing sparks another, the first thing cause the second thing to start happening. 引发 7. PHRASAL VERB Spark off means the same as . 引发 (同)(spark) 8. PHRASE If sparks fly between people, they discuss something in an excited or angry way. 唇枪舌剑地争论
1. N-COUNT A miner is a person who works underground in mines in order to obtain minerals such as coal, diamonds, or gold. 矿工

1. N-COUNT Your tongue is the soft movable part inside your mouth which you use for tasting, eating, and speaking. 舌头 2. N-COUNT You can use tongue to refer to the kind of things that a person says. 话语 3. N-COUNT A tongue is a language. 语言 [文学性] 4. PHRASE A tongue-in-cheek remark or attitude is not serious, although it may seem to be. 无诚意的 5. to bite your tongue →see bite

1. V-T If you pinch a part of someone's body, you take a piece of their skin between your thumb and first finger and give it a short squeeze. 掐; 拧 2. N-COUNT Pinch is also a noun. 掐; 拧 3. N-COUNT A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger. 撮 4. V-T To pinch something, especially something of little value, means to steal it. 偷拿 (尤为不太值钱的东西) [非正式] 5. PHRASE If a person or company is feeling the pinch, they do not have as much money as they used to, and so they cannot buy the things they would like to buy. 感到手头拮据
n. 消音装置；消声器 adj. 更安静的（quiet的比较级）
1. ADJ Perceptual means relating to the way people interpret and understand what they see or notice. 理解的; 感知的 [正式] [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT An electron is a tiny particle of matter that is smaller than an atom and has a negative electrical charge. 电子 [技术]

1. N-UNCOUNT Direct mail is a method of marketing which involves companies sending advertising material directly to people who they think may be interested in their products. 广告直邮 (指给潜在的顾客直接邮寄广告资料) [商业]
1. N → a variant spelling of Kohen
1. ADV If you say that something is presumably the case, you mean that you think it is very likely to be the case, although you are not certain. 很可能 [含糊]
1. N-COUNT Theblurb about a new book, film, or exhibition is information about it that is written in order to attract people's interest. 推介 [非正式] [usu sing, oft 'the' N]
n. 蒂姆（男子名）
1. N → a plural of automaton

1. N-COUNT When someone makes a pledge, they make a serious promise that they will do something. 誓言 2. V-T When someone pledges to do something, they promise in a serious way to do it. When they pledge something, they promise to give it. 保证 (做某事); 保证给予 (某物) 3. V-T If you pledge a sum of money to an organization or activity, you promise to pay that amount of money to it at a particular time or over a particular period. 承诺支付 (一笔款) 4. N-COUNT Pledge is also a noun. 承诺拨款 5. V-T If you pledge yourself to something, you commit yourself to following a particular course of action or to supporting a particular person, group, or idea. 保证 6. V-T If you pledge something such as a valuable possession or a sum of money, you leave it with someone as a guarantee that you will repay money that you have borrowed. 抵押
1. N-COUNT A gunman is a man who uses a gun to commit a crime such as murder or robbery. 持枪歹徒 [journalism]

1. ADJ If you describe something as straightforward, you approve of it because it is easy to do or understand. 容易的; 易懂的 [表赞许] 2. ADJ If you describe a person or their behaviour as straightforward, you approve of them because they are honest and direct, and do not try to hide their feelings. 坦率的 [表赞许]

1. ADJ Coarse things have a rough texture because they consist of thick threads or large pieces. 粗糙的 2. coarsely ADV 粗糙地 3. ADJ If you describe someone as coarse, you mean that he or she talks and behaves in a rude and offensive way. 粗鲁的; 粗俗的 [表不满] 4. coarsely ADV 粗鲁地; 粗俗地 [ADV with v]
1. V-T To encapsulate particular facts or ideas means to represent all their most important aspects in a very small space or in a single object or event. 概括

1. ADJ Someone who is receptive to new ideas or suggestions is prepared to consider them or accept them. (对新思想或建议) 乐于接受的 2. ADJ If someone who is ill is receptive to treatment, they start to get better when they are given treatment. (对治疗) 有反映的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n]
1. V-T If you wield a weapon, tool, or piece of equipment, you carry and use it. 拿着 (武器、工具或设备) 2. V-T If someone wields power, they have it and are able to use it. 掌握 (权力)
1. ADJ In music, chromatic means related to the scale that consists only of semitones. 半音的 2. ADJ Chromatic means related to colours. 色彩的 [usu ADJ n]

1. N-SING The nadir of something such as someone's career or the history of an organization is its worst time. (职业生涯或机构历史上的)最低点 [文学性] [usu with poss] 2. N-SING In astronomy, the nadir is the point at which the sun or moon is directly below you, on the other side of the earth. Compare . 天底 [技术] ['the' N]

1. ADJ If a future event is foreseeable, you know that it will happen or that it can happen, because it is a natural or obvious consequence of something else that you know. 可预见的 2. PHRASE If you say that something will happen for the foreseeable future, you think that it will continue to happen for a long time. 在可预见的将来

1. V-T/V-I If you vomit, food and drink comes back up from your stomach and out through your mouth. 呕吐 2. N-UNCOUNT Vomit is partly digested food and drink that has come back up from someone's stomach and out through their mouth. 呕吐物

1. N-VAR The landscape is everything you can see when you look across an area of land, including hills, rivers, buildings, trees, and plants. 风景 2. N-COUNT A landscape is all the features that are important in a particular situation. 局面 3. N-COUNT A landscape is a painting which shows a scene in the countryside. 乡村风景画 4. V-T If an area of land is landscaped, it is changed to make it more attractive, for example, by adding streams or ponds and planting trees and bushes. 对…做景观美化 5. landscaping N-UNCOUNT 景观美化 6. N-UNCOUNT If a sheet of paper is in landscape format or mode, the longer edge of the paper is horizontal and the shorter edge is vertical. 横排格式 [oft N n]
1. N-VAR Expulsion is when someone is forced to leave a school, university, or organization. 被开除 2. N-VAR Expulsion is when someone is forced to leave a place. 被逐出 [正式]

1. N-COUNT The chief of an organization is the person who is in charge of it. 长官 2. N-COUNT/N-TITLE The chief of a tribe is its leader. (部落) 首领 3. ADJ Chief is used in the job titles of the most senior worker or workers of a particular kind in an organization. 首席的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ The chief cause, part, or member of something is the most important one. 首要的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ If you are consumed with a feeling or idea, it affects you very strongly. 极受影响的 [文学性] [v-link ADJ 'with/by' n]
1. ADJ Stringent laws, rules, or conditions are very severe or are strictly controlled. (法律、规定或条件) 严格的 [正式]

1. ADJ Strategic means relating to the most important, general aspects of something such as a military operation or political policy, especially when these are decided in advance. 战略上的 2. strategically ADV 战略上地 3. ADJ Strategic weapons are very powerful missiles that can be fired only after a decision to use them has been made by a political leader. 战略性的 4. ADJ If you put something in a strategic position, you place it cleverly in a position where it will be most useful or have the most effect. 巧妙的 5. strategically ADV 巧妙地

1. V-I If you scramble over rocks or up a hill, you move quickly over them or up it using your hands to help you. 攀爬 2. V-I If you scramble to a different place or position, you move there in a hurried, awkward way. 仓促行动 3. V-T/V-I If a number of people scramble for something, they compete energetically with each other for it. 争夺 4. N-COUNT Scramble is also a noun. 争夺 5. V-T If you scramble eggs, you break them, mix them together and then cook them in butter. 炒 (蛋) 6. scrambled ADJ 炒的 7. V-T If a device scrambles a radio or telephone message, it interferes with the sound so that the message can only be understood by someone with special equipment. 对 (无线电或电话信号) 作扰频处理

1. N-COUNT A philosopher is a person who studies or writes about philosophy. 哲学家 2. N-COUNT If you refer to someone as a philosopher, you mean that they think deeply and seriously about life and other basic matters. 哲人

1. ADJ Radical changes and differences are very important and great in degree. 重大的; 彻底的 2. radically ADV 重大地; 彻底地 3. ADJ Radical people believe that there should be great changes in society and try to bring about these changes. 激进的 4. N-COUNT A radical is someone who has radical views. 激进分子

1. ADJ If a fact, action, or event is decisive, it makes certain a particular result. 决定性的 2. decisively ADV 决定性地 3. ADJ If someone is decisive, they have or show an ability to make quick decisions in a difficult or complicated situation. 果断的 4. decisively ADV 果断地

1. N-COUNT The interior of something is the inside part of it. 内部 2. ADJ You use interior to describe something that is inside a building or vehicle. (建筑或者车辆) 内部的 [ADJ n] 3. N-SING The interior of a country or continent is the central area of it. 内地 4. ADJ An interior minister, ministry, or department in some countries deals with affairs within that country, such as law and order. 内政的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T If you smear a surface with an oily or sticky substance or smear the substance onto the surface, you spread a layer of the substance over the surface. 涂抹 2. N-COUNT A smear is a dirty or oily mark. 污迹; 油迹 3. V-T To smear someone means to spread unpleasant and untrue rumours or accusations about them in order to damage their reputation. 诽谤; 诋毁 [journalism] 4. N-COUNT A smear is an unpleasant and untrue rumour or accusation that is intended to damage someone's reputation. 诽谤; 诋毁 [journalism] 5. N-COUNT A smear or a smear test is a medical test in which a few cells are taken from a woman's cervix and examined to see if any cancer cells are present. (一种从妇女子宫颈膜取样检验有无癌细胞的) 涂片试验 [英国英语]

1. V-T If you heed someone's advice or warning, you pay attention to it and do what they suggest. 注意; 听从 [正式] 2. PHRASE If you take heed of what someone says or if you pay heed to them, you pay attention to them and consider carefully what they say. 注意 [正式]
adv. 故意地，有意地

1. N-COUNT If you refer to something or someone as a relic of an earlier period, you mean that they belonged to that period but have survived into the present. 遗物; 遗迹 2. N-COUNT A relic is something which was made or used a long time ago and which is kept for its historical significance. 纪念物

1. N-COUNT A trail is a rough path across open country or through forests. (乡间或林中的) 崎岖小路 2. N-COUNT A trail is a route along a series of paths or roads, often one that has been planned and marked out for a particular purpose. (有特定目的的) 路线; 路径 3. N-COUNT A trail is a series of marks or other signs of movement or other activities left by someone or something. 痕迹 4. V-T If you trail someone or something, you follow them secretly, often by finding the marks or signs that they have left. 跟踪 5. N-COUNT You can refer to all the places that a politician visits in the period before an election as their campaign trail. (竞选巡回宣传) 路线 6. V-T/V-I If you trail something or it trails, it hangs down loosely behind you as you move along. 拖 7. PHRASE If you are on the trail of a person or thing, you are trying hard to find them or find out about them. 追踪
1. N-COUNT The components of something are the parts that it is made of. 组成部分 2. ADJ The component parts of something are the parts that make it up. 组成的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A millionaire is a very rich person who has money or property worth at least a million dollars. 百万富翁

1. N-VAR Conversion is the act or process of changing something into a different state or form. (状态或形式的) 改变 2. N-VAR If someone changes their religion or beliefs, you can refer to their conversion to their new religion or beliefs. 皈依
1. N-UNCOUNT Asthma is a lung condition that causes difficulty in breathing. 哮喘
1. N a member of an oligarchy 寡头政治执政者
1. N-COUNT A restaurateur is a person who owns and manages a restaurant. 餐馆老板; 饭店主人 [正式]

1. ADJ Something that is described as giant is much larger or more important than most others of its kind. 巨大的; 重大的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT Giant is often used to refer to any large, successful business organization or country. 大企业; 大国 [journalism] 3. N-COUNT A giant is an imaginary person who is very big and strong, especially one mentioned in old stories. (尤指古老故事中虚构的) 巨人

1. ADJ You use potential to say that someone or something is capable of developing into the particular kind of person or thing mentioned. 潜在的 [ADJ n] 2. potentially ADV 潜在地 [ADV with cl/group] 3. N-UNCOUNT If you say that someone or something has potential, you mean that they have the necessary abilities or qualities to become successful or useful in the future. 潜力; 潜质 4. N-UNCOUNT If you say that someone or something has potential for doing a particular thing, you mean that it is possible they may do it. If there is the potential for something, it may happen. 潜在性

1. N-VAR A disorder is a problem or illness which affects someone's mind or body. 紊乱 2. N-VAR Disorder is violence or rioting in public. 动乱 3. N-UNCOUNT Disorder is a state of being untidy, badly prepared, or badly organized. 混乱
1. ADJ A dress or blouse with a plunging neckline is cut in a very low V-shape at the front. 深V形领口的; 深开的 [ADJ n]
1. N-UNCOUNT Animosity is a strong feeling of dislike and anger. Animosities are feelings of this kind. 强烈敌意 [also N in pl]
n. 合理性（等于rationalization）
1. ADJ A concentrated liquid has been increased in strength by having water removed from it. 浓缩的 2. ADJ A concentrated activity is directed with great intensity in one place. 集中的
n. 投机；推测；思索；投机买卖

1. N-VAR A cable is a kind of very strong, thick rope, made of wires twisted together. 缆绳 2. N-VAR A cable is a thick wire, or a group of wires inside a rubber or plastic covering, which is used to carry electricity or electronic signals. 电缆 3. N-UNCOUNT Cable is used to refer to television systems in which the signals are sent along underground wires rather than by radio waves. 有线电视

1. ADJ You use token to describe things or actions which are small or unimportant but are meant to show particular intentions or feelings which may not be sincere. 装样子的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT A token is a round flat piece of metal or plastic that is sometimes used instead of money. 代用币 3. N-COUNT A token is a piece of paper or card that can be exchanged for goods, either in a particular shop or as part of a special offer. 代金券; 购物卡 [英国英语] 4. PHRASE You use by the same token to introduce a statement that you think is true for the same reasons that were given for a previous statement. 同样地
n. [经] 重新分配

1. V-T When an actor or actress portrays someone, he or she plays that person in a play or movie. 扮演 2. V-T When a writer or artist portrays something, he or she writes a description or produces a painting of it. 描绘 (事物) 3. V-T If a movie, book, or television programme portrays someone in a certain way, it represents them in that way. (以某种方式) 刻画 (某人)

1. ADJ If you say that a change or an event is overdue, you mean that you think it should have happened before now. 早该发生的 2. ADJ Overdue sums of money have not been paid, even though it is later than the date on which they should have been paid. 到期未付的 3. ADJ An overdue library book has not been returned to the library, even though the date on which it should have been returned has passed. 逾期未还的

1. V-T If you pretend that something is the case, you act in a way that is intended to make people believe that it is the case, although in fact it is not. 假装 (某事是事实) 2. V-T If children or adults pretend that they are doing something, they imagine that they are doing it, for example, as part of a game. 假装 (在做某事) 3.
