V-T If you do not pretend that something is the case, you do not claim that it is the case. 假称 [with neg]

1. ADJ Something that is sour has a sharp, unpleasant taste like the taste of a lemon. 酸的 2. ADJ Sour milk is milk that has an unpleasant taste because it is no longer fresh. 馊的 3. ADJ Someone who is sour is bad-tempered and unfriendly. 脾气坏的; 不友好的 4. sourly ADV 脾气坏地; 不友好地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ If a situation or relationship turns sour or goes sour, it stops being enjoyable or satisfactory. 令人失望的 6. V-T/V-I If a friendship, situation, or attitude sours or if something sours it, it becomes less friendly, enjoyable, or hopeful. 使变糟; 变糟
1. N-MASS Soup is liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in water. 汤
1. N-COUNT A highway is a main road, especially one that connects towns or cities. (尤指城市间的) 公路 [美国英语]
1. V-T If people proclaim something, they formally make it known to the public. 宣布 2. V-T If you proclaim something, you state it in an emphatic way. 强调

1. N-COUNT A balance sheet is a written statement of the amount of money and property that a company or person has, including amounts of money that are owed or are owing. Balance sheet is also used to refer to the general financial state of a company. 资产负债表 [商业]
1. V to continue without interruption 继续 2. N text matter composed without indenting 连续编排 3. N (as modifier) 连续编排的
1. V-T/V-I When an organization or person diversifies into other things, or diversifies their product line, they increase the variety of things that they do or make. 使多样化 2. diversification N-VAR 多样化
1. N-COUNT An exporter is a country, company, or person that sells and sends goods to another country. 出口国; 出口公司; 出口商
1. ADJ Entrepreneurial means having the qualities that are needed to succeed as an entrepreneur. 具有创业素质的 [商业]
1. ADJ Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing. 构成整体所必需的
1. ADJ Something that is perilous is very dangerous. 险恶的 [文学性] 2. perilously ADV 险恶地

1. N-COUNT Your opinion about something is what you think or believe about it. 看法 2. N-SING Your opinion of someone is your judgment of their character or ability. 评价 3. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to the beliefs or views that people have as opinion. 舆论 4. N-COUNT An opinion from an expert is the advice or judgment that they give you in the subject that they know a lot about. (专家的) 意见 5. → see also public opinion, second opinion 6. PHRASE You add expressions such as "in my opinion" or "in their opinion" to a statement in order to indicate that it is what you or someone else thinks, and is not necessarily a fact. 据…的意见 7. PHRASE If someone is of the opinion that something is the case, that is what they believe. 持…观点 [正式]

1. ADJ If you are tired, you feel that you want to rest or sleep. 疲倦的 2. tiredness N-UNCOUNT 疲倦 3. ADJ You can describe a part of your body as tired if it looks or feels as if you need to rest it or to sleep. (身体部位) 疲劳的 4. ADJ If you are tired of something, you do not want it to continue because you are bored of it or unhappy with it. 厌烦的 [v-link ADJ 'of' n/-ing]

1. ADJ If you do something that is deliberate, you planned or decided to do it beforehand, and so it happens on purpose rather than by chance. 故意的 2. deliberately ADV 故意地 3. ADJ If a movement or action is deliberate, it is done slowly and carefully. 从容谨慎的 4. deliberately ADV 从容谨慎地 [ADV after v] 5. V-T/V-I If you deliberate, you think about something carefully, especially before making a very important decision. 仔细考虑

1. N-COUNT Your homeland is your native country. 祖国 [书面] 2. N-COUNT The homelands were regions within South Africa in which black South Africans had a limited form of self-government. (过去南非种族隔离制度下的) 黑人家园
1. V-T If someone utters sounds or words, they say them. 发出 (声音); 说 [文学性] 2. ADJ You use utter to emphasize that something is great in extent, degree, or amount. 完全的; 彻底的 [ADJ n] [强调]

1. ADJ If you are blunt, you say exactly what you think without trying to be polite. 直言不讳的 2. bluntly ADV 直言不讳地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ A blunt object has a rounded or flat end rather than a sharp one. 钝的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ A blunt knife or blade is no longer sharp and does not cut well. 不锋利的 5. V-T If something blunts an emotion, a feeling or a need, it weakens it. 使减弱
1. ADV Consequently means as a result. 结果 [正式] [ADV with cl]

1. N-COUNT If one thing is an alternative to another, the first can be found, used, or done instead of the second. 替代品 2. ADJ An alternative plan or offer is different from the one that you already have, and can be done or used instead. 另外的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ Alternative is used to describe something that is different from the usual things of its kind, or the usual ways of doing something, in modern Western society. For example, an alternative lifestyle does not follow conventional ways of living and working. 另类的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ Alternative medicine uses traditional ways of curing people, such as medicines made from plants, massage, and acupuncture. 替代性的 (疗法) [ADJ n] 5. ADJ Alternative energy uses natural sources of energy such as the sun, wind, or water for power and fuel, rather than oil, coal, or nuclear power. 可再生的 (能源) [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A confession is a signed statement by someone in which they admit that they have committed a particular crime. 供状 2. N-VAR Confession is the act of admitting that you have done something that you are ashamed of or embarrassed about. 承认 3. N-VAR If you make a confession of your beliefs or feelings, you publicly tell people that this is what you believe or feel. (对信念、情感的) 表白 4. N-VAR In the Catholic church and in some other churches, if you go to confession, you privately tell a priest about your sins and ask for forgiveness. (私下对神父的) 忏悔

1. V-T If you interpolate a comment into a conversation or some words into a piece of writing, you put it in as an addition. 插入; 补充 [正式] 2. V-T/V-I To interpolate means to estimate the value of a function between two known values. 插值 [技术]

1. N-VAR A contrast is a great difference between two or more things which is clear when you compare them. (巨大的) 差别 2. PHRASE You say by contrast or in contrast, or in contrast to something, to show that you are mentioning a very different situation from the one you have just mentioned. 相比之下 3. PHRASE If one thing is in contrast to another, it is very different from it. 与…截然不同 4. V-T If you contrast one thing with another, you point out or consider the differences between those things. 对比 (事物以指出不同点) 5. V-RECIP If one thing contrasts with another, it is very different from it. 与…形成对比 6. N-UNCOUNT Contrast is the degree of difference between the darker and lighter parts of a photograph, television picture, or painting. (图片、电视画面、绘画中深浅的) 对比度

1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES A gallery is a place that has permanent exhibitions of works of art in it. (艺术作品的) 陈列室; 美术馆 2. N-COUNT A gallery is a privately owned building or room where people can look at and buy works of art. 私人字画店 3. N-COUNT A gallery is an area high above the ground at the back or at the sides of a large room or hall. 廊台 4. N-COUNT The gallery in a theatre or concert hall is an area high above the ground that usually contains the cheapest seats. (剧场或音乐厅内通常票价最低的) 顶层楼座 5. PHRASE If you play to the gallery, you do something in public in a way which you hope will impress people. 哗众取宠
1. V-T If you reckon that something is true, you think that it is true. 想 [非正式] 2. V-T If something is reckoned to be a particular figure, it is calculated to be roughly that amount. 估算 [usu passive]
n. 数百 百 百分之百 成百上千
n. 改革（reform的复数） v. 改革（reform的单数第三人称）

1. ADJ You use classical to describe something that is traditional in form, style, or content. 传统的 2. ADJ Classical music is music that is considered to be serious and of lasting value. (指音乐) 古典的 3. ADJ Classical is used to describe things which relate to the ancient Greek or Roman civilizations. (指古希腊罗马) 古典文化的

1. V to swell or cause to swell, as with a liquid, air, or wind (使)膨胀 2. N an abnormal distention of the abdomen in cattle, sheep, etc, caused by accumulation of gas in the stomach (牛、羊等的)胃气胀 [vet science]

1. V-T If you enjoy something, you find pleasure and satisfaction in doing it or experiencing it. 享受…的乐趣 2. V-T If you enjoy yourself, you do something that you like doing or you take pleasure in the situation that you are in. (自) 得其乐 3. V-T If you enjoy something such as a right, benefit, or privilege, you have it. 享有 [正式]

1. N-COUNT The director of a play, film, or television programme is the person who decides how it will appear on stage or screen, and who tells the actors and technical staff what to do. 导演 2. N-COUNT In some organizations and public authorities, the person in charge is referred to as the director. 主任; 主管 3. N-COUNT The directors of a company are its most senior managers, who meet regularly to make important decisions about how it will be run. 董事 [商业] 4. N-COUNT The director of a choir is the person who is conducting it. (合唱团的) 指挥 [美国英语]

1. N-COUNT A partition is a wall, screen, or divider that separates one part of a room, vehicle, or other space from another. 隔断 2. V-T If you partition a room, you separate one part of it from another by means of a partition. (用隔断) 隔开 3. V-T If a country is partitioned, it is divided into two or more independent countries. 分割 4. N-UNCOUNT Partition is also a noun. 分裂
1. N (in 14th- and 15th-century England) a substantial landholder of free but not noble birth (在14世纪和15世纪的英国)非貴族出身的地主

1. V-T/V-I If you can distinguish one thing from another or distinguish between two things, you can see or understand how they are different. 辨别; 区分 2. V-T A feature or quality that distinguishes one thing from another causes the two things to be regarded as different, because only the first thing has the feature or quality. 有别于 3. V-T If you can distinguish something, you can see, hear, or taste it although it is very difficult to detect. 辨别出 [正式] 4. V-T If you distinguish yourself, you do something that makes you famous or important. 使著名
1. N-PLURAL the fifth of the nine orders into which the angels are traditionally divided in medieval angelology 美德天使(中世纪天使学九个级别中的第五等级)

1. N-UNCOUNT Net is a kind of cloth that you can see through. It is made of fine threads woven together so that there are small equal spaces between them. 网 2. N-COUNT A net is a piece of netting which is used as a protective covering for something, for example to protect vegetables from birds. (保护性的) 网罩 3. N-COUNT A net is a piece of netting which is used for catching fish, insects, or animals. (用于捕猎的) 罗网 4. V-T If you net a fish or other animal, you catch it in a net. 捕捞 5. V-T If you net something, you manage to get it, especially by using skill. (尤指运用技巧) 获取 6. V-T If you net a particular amount of money, you gain it as profit after all expenses have been paid. 净赚 7. N-SING The Net is the same as the . 互联网 8. → see also safety net 1. ADJ A net amount is one which remains when everything that should be subtracted from it has been subtracted. 净数的 [ADJ n, v-link ADJ 'of' n] 2. ADV Net is also an adverb. 净数地 3. ADJ The net weight of something is its weight without its container or the material that

1. V-I When you sigh, you let out a deep breath, as a way of expressing feelings such as disappointment, tiredness, or pleasure. 叹气 2. N-COUNT Sigh is also a noun. 叹气 3. PHRASE If people breathe or heave a sigh of relief, they feel happy that something unpleasant has not happened or is no longer happening. 松了口气

1. N-UNCOUNT Fiction refers to books and stories about imaginary people and events, rather than books about real people or events. 小说 2. → see also science fiction 3. N-UNCOUNT A statement or account that is fiction is not true. 虚构 4. N-COUNT If something is a fiction, it is not true, although people sometimes pretend that it is true. 假象
1. N-COUNT The mayor of a town or city is the person who has been elected for a fixed period of time to run its government. 市长

1. N-COUNT An ideal is a principle, idea, or standard that seems very good and worth trying to achieve. 理想 2. N-SING Your ideal of something is the person or thing that seems to you to be the best possible example of it. 完美典范 3. ADJ The ideal person or thing for a particular task or purpose is the best possible person or thing for it. 理想的 4. ADJ An ideal society or world is the best possible one that you can imagine. 完美的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T/V-I When a broken bone or other injury heals, or if someone or something heals it, it becomes healthy and normal again. 治愈; 痊愈 2. V-T/V-I If you heal something such as a rift or a wound, or if it heals, the situation is put right so that people are friendly or happy again. 弥合

1. N-UNCOUNT Honesty is the quality of being honest. 诚实 2. PHRASE You say in all honesty when you are saying something that might be disappointing or upsetting, and you want to soften its effect by emphasizing your sincerity. 坦白地说 [强调] 3. N-COUNT a purple-flowered SE European plant, Lunaria annua, cultivated for its flattened silvery pods, which are used for indoor decoration: family Brassicaceae (crucifers) (Also called moonwort, satinpod)

1. V-T To prompt someone to do something means to make them decide to do it. 促使 2. V-T If you prompt someone when they stop speaking, you encourage or help them to continue. If you prompt an actor, you tell them what their next line is when they have forgotten what comes next. 提示; 给 (演员) 提示词 3. ADJ A prompt action is done without any delay. 立即的 (行动) 4. ADJ If you are prompt to do something, you do it without delay or you are not late. (做某事) 迅速的 [v-link ADJ]

1. N-COUNT If the government gives a tax break to a particular group of people or type of organization, it reduces the amount of tax they have to pay or changes the tax system in a way that benefits them. 减税 [美国英语] [商业]
1. N the worldwide economic depression of the early 1930s, when there was mass unemployment 上世纪30年代初期的全球性经济萧条 (Also known as the Great Depression, the Slump)

1. V-I If something flourishes, it is successful, active, or common, and developing quickly and strongly. 繁荣; 兴旺 2. flourishing ADJ 繁荣的; 兴旺的 3. V-I If a plant or animal flourishes, it grows well or is healthy because the conditions are right for it. (动植物因环境适宜而) 旺盛 4. flourishing ADJ 繁盛的 5. V-T If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it. 挥舞 6. N-COUNT Flourish is also a noun. 挥动

1. N-COUNT A company's competitors are companies who are trying to sell similar goods or services to the same people. 竞争对手 2. N-COUNT A competitor is a person who takes part in a competition or contest. 参赛者
n. 穆巴拉克（姓氏）
adv. 用力地；强制地；有说服力地
1. ADJ Pioneering work or a pioneering individual does something that has not been done before, for example, by developing or using new methods or techniques. 开创性的

1. N-COUNT A subsidiary or a subsidiary company is a company which is part of a larger and more important company. 子公司 [商业] 2. ADJ If something is subsidiary, it is less important than something else with which it is connected. 辅助的

1. ADJ Tentative agreements, plans, or arrangements are not definite or certain, but have been made as a first step. 初步的 2. tentatively ADV 初步地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If someone is tentative, they are cautious and not very confident because they are uncertain or afraid. 犹豫的 4. tentatively ADV 犹豫地 [ADV with v]
1. ADJ Something that is pronounced is very noticeable. 明显的
1. ADJ Something that is finite has a definite fixed size or extent. 有限的 [正式]

1. ADJ If one thing is unrelated to another, there is no connection between them. You can also say that two things are unrelated. 不相关的 2. ADJ If one person is unrelated to another, they are not members of the same family. You can also say that two people are unrelated. 无亲属关系的 [书面]
adv. 正确地；得体地

1. N-COUNT In debates and negotiations, the moderator is the person who is in charge of the discussion and makes sure that it is conducted in a fair and organized way. (争论和谈判的) 主持人 [正式] 2. N-COUNT In some Protestant churches, a moderator is a senior member of the clergy who is in charge at large and important meetings. (基督教的) 会议主席
总而言之；头等重要的东西
1. ADV Fortunately is used to introduce or indicate a statement about an event or situation that is good. 幸好

1. N-COUNT A plum is a small, sweet fruit with a smooth purple, red, or yellow skin and a pit in the middle. 李子 2. N a small rosaceous tree, Prunus domestica, with white flowers and an edible oval fruit that is purple, yellow, or green and contains an oval stone 西洋李; 欧洲李 → see also greengage, damson 3. COLOR Something that is plum or plum-coloured is a dark reddish-purple colour. 紫红色的
1. ADJ A pithy comment or piece of writing is short, direct, and full of meaning. 简明扼要的 [书面] [usu ADJ n] 2. pithily ADV

1. N-COUNT A plug on a piece of electrical equipment is a small plastic object with two or three metal pins that fit into the holes of an electric outlet and connects the equipment to the electricity supply. 插头 2. N-COUNT A plug is an electric outlet. 插座 [非正式] 3. N-COUNT A plug is a thick, circular piece of rubber or plastic that you use to block the hole in a bathtub or sink when it is filled with water. (浴缸、洗涤槽的) 塞子 4. N-COUNT A plug is a small, round piece of wood, plastic, or wax that is used to block holes. (木头、塑料或腊制的) 塞子 5. V-T If you plug a hole, you block it with something. 堵; 塞 6. V-T If someone plugs a commercial product, especially a book or a film, they praise it in order to encourage people to buy it or see it because they have an interest in it doing well. 大力宣传 (商品，尤为图书或电影) 7. N-COUNT Plug is also a noun. 大力宣传 8. PHRASE If someone in a position of power pulls the plug on a project or on someone's activities, they use their power to stop them from continuing. (利用权力) 终止 (方案或活动)
1. PHRASAL VERB If you say that someone is butting in, you are criticizing the fact that they are joining in a conversation or activity without being asked to. 插进来 [表不满]

1. N-VAR Tax is an amount of money that you have to pay to the government so that it can pay for public services such as road and schools. 税 [商业] 2. V-T When a person or company is taxed, they have to pay a part of their income or profits to the government. When goods are taxed, a percentage of their price has to be paid to the government. (对个人、公司、货物) 征税 [商业] 3. → see also taxing, income tax
1. ADJ Something that is spectacular is very impressive or dramatic. 壮观的 2. spectacularly ADV 可观地 3. N-COUNT A spectacular is a show or performance which is very grand and impressive. 盛大的演出 [usu n N]
1. V-T If you predict an event, you say that it will happen. 预言
n. 意大利
adv. 追溯地；逆动地
1. N a major taxonomic division of living organisms that contain one or more classes. An example is the phylum Arthropoda (insects, crustaceans, arachnids, etc, and myriapods) 门

1. N-COUNT A tap is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas from a pipe or container, for example, on a sink or on a cask or barrel. 阀门 [英国英语] 2. V-T/V-I If you tap something, you hit it with a quick light blow or a series of quick light blows. 轻敲 3. N-COUNT Tap is also a noun. 轻敲 4. V-T If you tap your fingers or feet, you make a regular pattern of sound by hitting a surface lightly and repeatedly with them, especially while you are listening to music. (随着音乐) 打拍子 5. V-T If someone taps your telephone, they attach a special device to the line so that they can secretly listen to your conversations. 窃听 (电话) 6. N-COUNT Tap is also a noun. 电话窃听 7. PHRASE If drinks are on tap, they come from a tap rather than from a bottle. 从阀门流出 [usu v-link PHR]
n. 多样化；变化

1. V-T If you recruit people for an organization, you select them and persuade them to join it or work for it. 招收; 招募 2. recruiting N-UNCOUNT 招收; 招募 3. N-COUNT A recruit is a person who has recently joined an organization or an army. 新成员; 新兵
1. ADJ Cubic is used in front of units of length to form units of volume such as "cubic metre" and "cubic foot." 立方的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T/V-I When you choke or when something chokes you, you cannot breathe properly or get enough air into your lungs. 使窒息; 窒息 2. V-T To choke someone means to squeeze their neck until they are dead. (卡住喉咙) 使停止呼吸 3. V-T If a place is choked with things or people, it is full of them and they prevent movement in it. 使阻塞 [usu passive] 4. N-COUNT The choke in a car, truck, or other vehicle is a device that reduces the amount of air going into the engine and makes it easier to start. 阻气门

1. N-COUNT-COLL/N-IN-NAMES A council is a group of people who are elected to govern a local area such as a city. 政务委员会 2. N-COUNT-COLL Council is used in the names of some organizations. 委员会 3. N-COUNT-COLL In some organizations, the council is the group of people that controls or governs it. 管理委员会 4. N-COUNT A council is a specially organized, formal meeting that is attended by a particular group of people. 会议

1. N-TITLE/N-COUNT A prince is a male member of a royal family, especially the son of the king or queen of a country. 王子 2. N-TITLE/N-COUNT A prince is the male royal ruler of a small country or state. (小国的) 君王

1. ADJ Vigorous physical activities involve using a lot of energy, usually to do short and repeated actions. 用力的 2. vigorously ADV 用力地 [ADV after v] 3. ADJ A vigorous person does things with great energy and enthusiasm. A vigorous campaign or activity is done with great energy and enthusiasm. 精力充沛的 (人); 强有力的 (运动、活动) 4. vigorously ADV 强烈地 [ADV with v]

1. N-COUNT A track is a rough, unpaved road or path. (崎岖不平的) 小路 2. N-COUNT A track is a piece of ground, often oval-shaped, that is used for races involving running, cars, bicycles, horses, or dogs called greyhounds. 跑道 3. N-COUNT Railway tracks are the rails that a train travels along. 铁轨 4. N-COUNT A track is one of the songs or pieces of music on a CD, record, or tape. (录制在CD、唱片或磁带上的) 一首歌曲; 一首乐曲 5. N-PLURAL Tracks are marks left in the ground by the feet of animals or people. 足迹 6. V-T If you track animals or people, you try to follow them by looking for the signs that they have left behind, for example, the marks left by their feet. 跟踪 7. V-T To track someone or something means to follow their movements by means of a special device, such as a satellite or radar. (用卫星、雷达等特殊装置) 追踪 8. → see also fast track, racetrack, soundtrack 9. PHRASE If you keep track of a situation or a person, you make sure that you have the newest and most accurate information about them all the time. 了解…的动向 10. PHRASE If

1. N-VAR An inheritance is money or property that you receive from someone who has died. 继承物; 遗产 2. N-COUNT If you get something such as a job, problem, or attitude from someone who used to have it, you can refer to this as an inheritance. 转接物; 沿袭物 3. N-SING Your inheritance is the particular characteristics or qualities that your family or ancestors had and that you are born with. 遗传特征

1. V-T When you steer a car, boat, or plane, you control it so that it goes in the direction that you want. 驾驶 2. V-T If you steer people toward a particular course of action or attitude, you try to lead them gently in that direction. 引导 3. V-T If you steer someone in a particular direction, you guide them there. 引领 4. PHRASE If you steer clear of someone or something, you deliberately avoid them. 有意避开某人/某物 5. N a castrated male ox or bull; bullock 犍牛; 小公牛

1. V-T If you trace the origin or development of something, you find out or describe how it started or developed. 追溯 2. PHRASAL VERB Trace back means the same as . 追溯 3. V-T If you trace someone or something, you find them after looking for them. 找到 4. V-T If you trace something such as a pattern or a shape, for example, with your finger or toe, you mark its outline on a surface. 勾画出 (轮廓) 5. V-T If you trace a picture, you copy it by covering it with a piece of transparent paper and drawing over the lines underneath. (用透明纸盖在底样上) 描摹 6. N-COUNT A trace of something is a very small amount of it. 少许 7. PHRASE If you say that someone or something disappears without a trace, you mean that they stop existing or stop being successful very suddenly and completely. 消失得无影无踪

1. ADJ A steep slope rises at a very sharp angle and is difficult to go up. 陡峭的 2. steeply ADV 陡峭地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ A steep increase or decrease in something is a very big increase or decrease. 急剧的 4. steeply ADV 急剧地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ If you say that the price of something is steep, you mean that it is expensive. (价格) 高昂的 [非正式] 6. V to soak or be soaked in a liquid in order to soften, cleanse, extract an element, etc 浸; 泡 7. V to saturate; imbue 使浸透

1. N-VAR If you make an accusation against someone, you criticize them or express the belief that they have done something wrong. 指责 2. N-COUNT An accusation is a statement or claim by a witness or someone in authority that a particular person has committed a crime, although this has not yet been proved. 指控

1. ADV If something or someone is uphill or is moving uphill, they are near the top of a hill or are going up a slope. 靠近山顶; 上坡地; 在高处 2. ADJ Uphill is also an adjective. 在高处的; 上坡的 3. ADJ If you refer to something as an uphill battle or an uphill struggle, you mean that it requires a lot of effort and determination, but it should be possible to achieve it. (战斗或斗争) 艰难的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT Stakeholders are people who have an interest in a company's or organization's affairs. 股东; 利益相关者 [商业]

1. V-T If someone or something inspires you to do something new or unusual, they make you want to do it. 鼓舞; 激励 2. V-T If someone or something inspires you, they give you new ideas and a strong feeling of enthusiasm. 唤起; 激起 3. V-T If a book, work of art, or action is inspired by something, that thing is the source of the idea for it. 赋…以灵感; 给…以启示 [usu passive] 4. -inspired COMB in ADJ 受…灵感启示的 5. V-T Someone or something that inspires a particular emotion or reaction in people makes them feel that emotion or reaction. 唤起; 激起
1. ADJ If you describe someone or their behaviour as immoral, you believe that their behaviour is morally wrong. 不道德的 [表不满]
1. N-COUNT An otter is a small animal with brown fur, short legs, and a long tail. Otters swim well and eat fish. 水獭
1. N-COUNT A trade-off is a situation where you make a compromise between two things, or where you exchange all or part of one thing for another. 妥协; 交换 [journalism]

1. V-T If someone or something convinces you to do something, they persuade you to do it. 说服 2. V-T If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists. 使信服

1. N-COUNT A desire is a strong wish to do or have something. 愿望 2. V-T If you desire something, you want it. 想要 [正式] [no cont] 3. desired ADJ 想要的; 渴望的 [ADJ n] 4. N-UNCOUNT Desire for someone is a strong feeling of wanting to have sex with them. 性欲

1. ADJ A linear process or development is one in which something changes or progresses straight from one stage to another, and has a starting point and an ending point. 线性的 2. ADJ A linear shape or form consists of straight lines. 由直线组成的 3. ADJ Linear movement or force occurs in a straight line rather than in a curve. 直线的

1. V-T If you monitor something, you regularly check its development or progress, and sometimes comment on it. 监控 2. V-T If someone monitors radio broadcasts from other countries, they record them or listen carefully to them in order to obtain information. 监听 3. N-COUNT A monitor is a machine that is used to check or record things, for example processes or substances inside a person's body. 监控器 4. N-COUNT A monitor is a screen which is used to display certain kinds of information, for example on a computer, in airports, or in television studios. 显示屏 5. N-COUNT You can refer to a person who checks that something is done correctly, or that it is fair, as a monitor. 监督员
n. 削减成本 v. 削减成本（cost-cut的ing形式）

1. N-COUNT An interval between two events or dates is the period of time between them. (时间上的) 间隔 2. N-COUNT An interval during a concert, show, film, or game is a short break between two of the parts. 幕间休息; 中场休息 [英国英语] 3. PHRASE If something happens at intervals, it happens several times with gaps or pauses in between. 不时 4. PHRASE If things are placed at particular intervals, there are spaces of a particular size between them. 每隔

1. V-T If something scares you, it frightens or worries you. 惊吓 2. PHRASE If you want to emphasize that something scares you a lot, you can say that it scares the hell out of you or scares the life out of you. 吓死了 [非正式] 3. N-SING If a sudden unpleasant experience gives you a scare, it frightens you. 惊吓 4. N-COUNT A scare is a situation in which many people are afraid or worried because they think something dangerous is happening which will affect them all. 恐慌; 恐惧 5. N-COUNT A bomb scare or a security scare is a situation in which there is believed to be a bomb in a place. (炸弹或安全) 恐慌 6. → see also scared

1. N-COUNT A file is a box or a folded piece of heavy paper or plastic in which letters or documents are kept. 文件盒; 文件夹 2. N-COUNT A file is a collection of information about a particular person or thing. 卷宗 3. N-COUNT In computing, a file is a set of related data that has its own name. 文件 4. N-COUNT A file is a hand tool which is used for rubbing hard objects to make them smooth, shape them, or cut through them. 锉刀 5. V-T If you file a document, you put it in the correct file. 使归档 6. V-T/V-I If you file a formal or legal accusation, complaint, or request, you make it officially. 提起 7. V-T When someone files a report or a news story, they send or give it to their employer. 提交 8. V-T If you file an object, you smooth it, shape it, or cut it with a file. 锉 9. V to march or walk in a file or files 排成纵队行进 10. → see also rank and file 11. PHRASE A group of people who are walking or standing in single file or single file are in a line, one behind the other. 成单行

1. ADJ Oral communication is spoken rather than written. 口头的 2. orally ADV 口头地 [ADV after v] 3. N-COUNT An oral is an examination, especially in a foreign language, that is spoken rather than written. 口试 4. ADJ You use oral to indicate that something is done with a person's mouth or relates to a person's mouth. 用口的; 与口有关的 5. orally ADV 用口地; 与口有关地

1. ADV If something is going to happen soon, it will happen after a short time. If something happened soon after a particular time or event, it happened a short time after it. 不久 2. PHRASE If you say that something happens as soon as something else happens, you mean that it happens immediately after the other thing. 一…就 3. PHRASE If you say that you would just as soon do something or you'd just as soon do it, you mean that you would prefer to do it. 宁愿

1. ADJ You can use virtual to indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true. 事实上的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Virtual objects and activities are generated by a computer to simulate real objects and activities. (计算机仿真) 虚拟的 [计算机] [ADJ n] 3. virtuality N-UNCOUNT 虚拟性
abbr. 瑞士联合银行（United Bank of Switzerland）

1. N-COUNT A transistor is a small electronic part in something such as a television or radio, which controls the flow of electricity. 晶体管 2. N-COUNT A transistor or a transistor radio is a small portable radio. 晶体管收音机 [老式]
n. 化肥（等于fertilizer）
n. 视察，检查
1. Indices is a plural form of . (index)的复数形式
1. V-T If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it. 丢弃

1. N-COUNT A route is a way from one place to another. 路线 2. N-COUNT A bus, air, or shipping route is the way between two places along which buses, planes, or ships travel regularly. (公共汽车的) 行车路线; (飞机、轮船的) 航线 3. N-IN-NAMES In the United States, Route is used in front of a number in the names of main roads between major cities. (…号) 公路 4. N-COUNT Your route is the series of visits you make to different people or places, as part of your job. 巡访 [美国英语] 5. N-COUNT You can refer to a way of achieving something as a route. 途径 6. V-T If vehicles, goods, or passengers are routed in a particular direction, they are made to travel in that direction. 为…规定路线 [usu passive] 7. PHRASE En routeto a place means on the way to that place. En route is sometimes spelled on route in nonstandard English. 在途中 8. PHRASE Journalists sometimes use en route when they are mentioning an event that happened as part of a longer process or before another event. 在…的过程中; 在…之前
1. ADJ If you say that something is vital, you mean that it is necessary or very important. 至关重要的 2. vitally ADV 至关重要地

1. V-T If you acknowledge a fact or a situation, you accept or admit that it is true or that it exists. 承认 (事实或情况) [正式] 2. V-T If someone's achievements, status, or qualities are acknowledged, they are known about and recognized by a lot of people, or by a particular group of people. 认可 (某人的成就、地位或品质) 3. V-T If you acknowledge a message or letter, you write to the person who sent it in order to say that you have received it. 确认收到 4. V-T If you acknowledge someone, for example, by moving your head or smiling, you show that you have seen and recognized them. (点头或微笑) 向…致意
1. V-T/V-I If you strive to do something or strive for something, you make a great effort to do it or get it. 努力
1. ADJ To be disruptive means to prevent something from continuing or operating in a normal way. 妨碍的; 扰乱的
支持民主
1. ADJ High-end products, especially electronic products, are the most expensive of their kind. 高端的

1. ADJ If you are casual, you are, or you pretend to be, relaxed and not very concerned about what is happening or what you are doing. 放松的 2. casually ADV 放松地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ A casual event or situation happens by chance or without planning. 不经意的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ Casual clothes are ones that you normally wear at home or on holiday, and not on formal occasions. (服装) 休闲的 [ADJ n] 5. casually ADV 休闲地 6. ADJ Casual work is done for short periods and not on a permanent or regular basis. 临时的 [英国英语]
1. N-VAR A fragrance is a pleasant or sweet smell. 香味 2. N-MASS Fragrance is a pleasant-smelling liquid which people put on their bodies to make themselves smell nice. 香水

1. ADJ If someone's behaviour or action is foolish, it is not sensible and shows a lack of good judgment. 愚蠢的 2. foolishly ADV 愚蠢地 3. ADJ If you look or feel foolish, you look or feel so silly or ridiculous that people are likely to laugh at you. 傻乎乎的 4. foolishly ADV 傻乎乎地 [ADV after v]

1. ADJ If something is done in an orderly fashion or manner, it is done in a well-organized and controlled way. 有秩序的 2. ADJ Something that is orderly is neat or arranged in a neat way. 整齐的 3. orderliness N-UNCOUNT 整齐 4. N-COUNT An orderly is a person who works in a hospital and does jobs that do not require special medical training. 护理员
1. N-UNCOUNT Nostalgia is an affectionate feeling you have for the past, especially for a particularly happy time. (尤指对幸福时光的) 怀旧

1. N-UNCOUNT Custody is the legal right to keep and take care of a child, especially the right given to a child's mother or father when they get divorced. 监护权 2. N-UNCOUNT If someone is being held in a particular type of custody, they are being kept in a place that is similar to a prison. 拘留 3. PHRASE Someone who is in custody or has been taken into custody has been arrested and is being kept in prison until they can be tried in a court. 在押候审

1. N-COUNT A brand of a product is the version of it that is made by one particular manufacturer. 品牌 2. N-COUNT A brand of something such as a way of thinking or behaving is a particular kind of it. (思维或行为方式等的) 独特类型 3. V-T If someone is branded as something bad, people think they are that thing. 归为 (不好的事物) 4. V-T When you brand an animal, you put a permanent mark on its skin in order to show who it belongs to, usually by burning a mark onto its skin. 给…打上烙印 5. N-COUNT Brand is also a noun. 烙印

1. N-COUNT A flower is the part of a plant which is often brightly coloured, grows at the end of a stem, and only survives for a short time. 花 (朵) 2. N-COUNT A flower is a stem of a plant that has one or more flowers on it and has been picked, usually with others, for example, to give as a present or to put in a vase. 花 (株) 3. N-COUNT Flowers are small plants that are grown for their flowers as opposed to trees, shrubs, and vegetables. 花卉 4. V-I When a plant or tree flowers, its flowers appear and open. 开花 5. V-I When something flowers, for example, a political movement or a relationship, it gets stronger and more successful. (政治运动等) 壮大; (关系等) 变得更好
adj. 最长的 n. (Longest)人名；(英)朗格斯特

1. N-COUNT An explosion is a sudden, violent burst of energy, such as one caused by a bomb. 爆炸 2. N-VAR Explosion is the act of deliberately causing a bomb or similar device to explode. 引爆 3. N-COUNT An explosion is a large rapid increase in the number or amount of something. 暴增; 暴涨 4. N-COUNT An explosion is a sudden violent expression of someone's feelings, especially anger. (情感、尤指愤怒的) 暴发 5. N-COUNT An explosion is a sudden and serious political protest or violence. (抗议、暴力行为的) 爆发

1. V-T When you lock something such as a door, drawer, or case, you fasten it, usually with a key, so that other people cannot open it. 锁 2. N-COUNT The lock on something such as a door or a drawer is the device which is used to keep it shut and prevent other people from opening it. Locks are opened with a key. 锁 3. V-T If you lock something or someone in a place, room, or container, you put them there and fasten the lock. 将…锁起来 4. V-T/V-I If you lock something in a particular position, or if it locks there, it is held or fitted firmly in that position. 锁定 5. N-COUNT On a canal or river, a lock is a place where walls have been built with gates at each end so that boats can move to a higher or lower section of the canal or river, by gradually changing the water level inside the gates. 水闸 6. N-COUNT A lock of hair is a small bunch of hairs on your head that grow together and curl or curve in the same direction. (一) 绺

1. N-COUNT Theimplicationsof something are the things that are likely to happen as a result. 可能的结果 2. N-COUNT Theimplication of a statement, event, or situation is what it implies or suggests is the case. 含意 3. PHRASE If you say that something is the case by implication, you mean that a statement, event, or situation implies that it is the case. 言下之意; 暗示地 4. → see also implicate

1. N-MASS Cereal or breakfast cereal is a food made from grain. It is mixed with milk and eaten for breakfast. 麦片 2. N-COUNT Cereals are plants such as wheat, corn, or rice that produce grain. (小麦、高粱、米等) 谷类植物
大舌头
1. ADJ Parliamentary is used to describe things that are connected with a parliament or with members of parliament. 议会的; 议员的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T/V-I If you exaggerate, you indicate that something is, for example, worse or more important than it really is. 夸大 2. exaggeration N-VAR 夸大 3. V-T If something exaggerates a situation, quality, or feature, it makes the situation, quality, or feature appear greater, more obvious, or more important than it really is. 夸大
n. 泰勒
1. N-COUNT If you have a weakness for something, you like it very much, although this is perhaps surprising or undesirable. 癖好 2. → see also weak
n. 日本黑田精工
1. ADJ A budgetary matter or policy is concerned with the amount of money that is available to a country or organization, and how it is to be spent. 预算的 [正式] [ADJ n]
n. 喀布尔（阿富汗的首都）

1. N-UNCOUNT Someone's sight is their ability to see. 视力 2. N-SING The sight of something is the act of seeing it or an occasion on which you see it. 看见 3. N-COUNT A sight is something that you see. 景象 4. V-T If you sight someone or something, you suddenly see them, often briefly. (在一瞬间) 突然看见 5. N-PLURAL Thesights are the places that are interesting to see and that are often visited by tourists. 名胜; 风景 6. → see also sighting 7. PHRASE If you catch sight of someone, you suddenly see them, often briefly. 瞬间内突然看见某人 8. PHRASE If you say that something seems to have certain characteristics at first sight, you mean that it appears to have the features you describe when you first see it but later it is found to be different. 乍一看 9. PHRASE If something is in sight or within sight, you can see it. If it is out of sight, you cannot see it. 看得见/看不见 10. PHRASE If a result or a decision is in sight or within sight, it is likely to happen within a short time. 即将发生 11. PHRASE If you lose sight of an important as
n. 埃塞俄比亚
1. N-COUNT Mites are very tiny creatures that live on plants, for example, or in animals' fur. (生活在植物或动物皮毛中的) 螨 2. N-COUNT a very small particle, creature, or object 微粒; 微小的生物(或物体)

1. N-COUNT A process is a series of actions which are carried out in order to achieve a particular result. 过程 2. N-COUNT A process is a series of things that happen naturally and result in a biological or chemical change. 进程 3. V-T When raw materials or foods are processed, they are prepared in factories before they are used or sold. 加工 4. N-COUNT Process is also a noun. 过程 5. processing N-UNCOUNT 加工 [usu with supp] 6. V to subject to a routine procedure; handle 工艺流程; 处理 7. V-T When people process information, they put it through a system or into a computer in order to deal with it. 处理 8. processing N-UNCOUNT 处理 9. → see also word processing 10. V-T When people are processed by officials, their case is dealt with in stages and they pass from one stage of the process to the next. 按程序处理 [usu passive] 11. V to proceed in or as if in a procession 列队行进 12. PHRASE If you are in the process of doing something, you have started to do it and are still doing it. 在…过程中 13. PHRASE If you are doing something
不符合标准
1. ADV If you move headfirst in a particular direction, your head is the part of your body that is furthest forward as you are moving. 头向前地 [ADV after v]
1. N-UNCOUNT Consistency is the quality or condition of being consistent. 连贯性; 一致性 2. N-UNCOUNT The consistency of a substance is how thick or smooth it is. 黏稠度

1. N-COUNT A monument is a large structure, usually made of stone, which is built to remind people of an event in history or of a famous person. 纪念碑 2. N-COUNT A monument is something such as a castle or bridge that was built a very long time ago and is regarded as an important part of a country's history. 历史遗迹 3. N-COUNT If you describe something as a monument to someone's qualities, you mean that it is a very good example of the results or effects of those qualities. 典范
1. ADJ In the stock market, if there is a bullish mood, prices are expected to rise. Compare . (股票市场) 牛市的; 行情看涨的 (比较)(bearish) [商业]
1. V-T If something is sullied by something else, it is damaged so that it is no longer pure or of such high value. 玷污; 败坏 [正式] 2. V-T If someone sullies something, they make it dirty. 弄脏 [正式]
1. ADJ Reformist groups or policies are trying to reform a system or law. 改革主义的; 改良主义的 2. N-COUNT A reformist is someone with reformist views. 改革者; 改良者

1. N-COUNT A switch is a small control for an electrical device which you use to turn the device on or off. 开关 2. N-PLURAL On a railway track, the switches are the levers and rails at a place where two tracks join or separate. The switches enable a train to move from one track to another. 转辙器 [美国英语] 3. V-T/V-I If you switch to something different, for example to a different system, task, or subject of conversation, you change to it from what you were doing or saying before. 转向 4. N-COUNT Switch is also a noun. 转变 [usu with supp] 5. PHRASAL VERB Switch over means the same as . 转变 6. V-T/V-I If you switch your attention from one thing to another or if your attention switches, you stop paying attention to the first thing and start paying attention to the second. 转移 (注意力) 7. V-T If you switch two things, you replace one with the other. 调换

1. N-VAR Collaboration is the act of working together to produce a piece of work, especially a book or some research. (尤指著书或进行研究时的) 合作 2. N-COUNT A collaboration is a piece of work that has been produced as the result of people or groups working together. 合作成果 3. N-UNCOUNT Collaboration is the act of helping an enemy who is occupying your country during a war. 通敌行为 [表不满]
1. ADJ Substantial means large in amount or degree. 大量的; 很大程度的 [正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT Maturity is the state of being fully developed or adult. 发育成熟 2. N-UNCOUNT Someone's maturity is their quality of being fully developed in their personality and emotional behaviour. (性格、情感) 成熟 3. N-VAR When an investment such as an insurance policy or bond reaches maturity, it reaches the stage when the company pays you back the money you have saved, and the interest your money has earned. (保险单、债券等的) 到期 [商业]
1. N-COUNT A pogrom is organized, official violence against a group of people for racial or religious reasons. 大屠杀

1. N-UNCOUNT Steam is the hot mist that forms when water boils. Steam vehicles and machines are operated using steam as a means of power. 蒸汽 2. V-I If something steams, it gives off steam. 冒蒸汽 3. V-T/V-I If you steam food or if it steams, you cook it in steam rather than in water. 蒸 4. PHRASE If something such as a plan or a project goes full steam ahead, it progresses quickly. 全速推进 5. PHRASE If you run out of steam, you stop doing something because you have no more energy or enthusiasm left. 筋疲力尽 [非正式]
abbr. 最低能效标准（Minimum Energy Performance Standards）；海洋生态进程（Marine Ecology Progress Series）

1. ADJ If you describe something as dubious, you mean that you do not consider it to be completely honest, safe, or reliable. 可疑的; 不太可靠的 2. dubiously ADV 可疑地; 不太可靠地 3. ADJ If you are dubious about something, you are not completely sure about it and have not yet made up your mind about it. 有疑虑的 [v-link ADJ] 4. dubiously ADV 迟疑地

1. N-COUNT A churn is a container which is used for making butter. (制黄油的) 搅乳器 2. V-T If something churns water, mud, or dust, it moves it about violently. 剧烈搅动 3. PHRASAL VERB Churn up means the same as . 剧烈搅动 4. V-T/V-I If you say that your stomach is churning, you mean that you feel sick. You can also say that something churns your stomach. 使恶心; 及物动词; 恶心; 不及物动词
1. ADJ A revealing statement, account, or action tells you something that you did not know, especially about the person doing it or making it. 透露内情的
n. （爱尔兰）哭丧女（尤指职业的哭丧女人） n. (Keener)人名；(英)基纳

1. N-COUNT Someone who has a pension receives a regular sum of money from a former employer because they have retired or because they are widowed or disabled. 养老金; 抚恤金 2. V to grant a pension to 给予…养老金 3. N in France and some other countries a relatively cheap boarding house 廉租屋

1. N-COUNT An accordion is a musical instrument in the shape of a fairly large box which you hold in your hands. You play the accordion by pressing keys or buttons on either side while moving the two sides together and apart. Accordions are used especially to play traditional popular music. 手风琴

1. V-T If you pitch something somewhere, you throw it with some force, usually aiming it carefully. 投掷 2. V-T In the game of baseball, when you pitch the ball, you throw it to the batter for them to hit it. 投 (球) 给击球手 3. V-T/V-I To pitch somewhere means to fall forwards suddenly and with a lot of force. (向前) 跌倒 4. V-T If someone is pitched into a new situation, they are suddenly forced into it. 迫使进入 (一种新的处境) 5. N the degree of elevation or depression 程度 6. N-UNCOUNT The pitch of a sound is how high or low it is. 音调 7. V-T If a sound is pitched at a particular level, it is produced at the level indicated. 使 (音调)达到(指定水准) [usu passive] 8. → see also high-pitched 9. V-T If something is pitched at a particular level or degree of difficulty, it is set at that level. 给…设定水平 (或难度) 10. N-SING If something such as a feeling or a situation rises to a high pitch, it rises to a high level. (感情或形势等的) 程度 11. V-T If someone pitches an idea for something such as a new product, they try to persuade people to accept

1. ADJ The sole thing or person of a particular type is the only one of that type. 惟一的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ If you have sole charge or ownership of something, you are the only person in charge of it or who owns it. 惟一的; 独占的 [ADJ n] 3. N-COUNT The sole of your foot or of a shoe or sock is the underneath surface of it. 脚掌; 鞋底; 袜底 4. N any tongue-shaped flatfish of the family Soleidae, esp Solea solea (European sole): most common in warm seas and highly valued as food fishes 舌鰨

1. N-COUNT A plot is a secret plan by a group of people to do something that is illegal or wrong, usually against a person or a government. 阴谋 2. V-T If people plot to do something or plot something that is illegal or wrong, they plan secretly to do it. 密谋 3. V-T When people plot a strategy or a course of action, they carefully plan each step of it. 制订 4. N-VAR The plot of a film, novel, or play is the connected series of events which make up the story. 情节 5. N-COUNT A plot of land is a small piece of land, especially one that has been measured or marked out for a special purpose, such as building houses or growing vegetables. 小块圈地 6. V to arrange or divide (land) into plots 划分(土地); 把(土地)分成小块 7. V-T When someone plots something on a graph, they mark certain points on it and then join the points up. (在曲线图上) 绘制 8. V-T When someone plots the position or course of a plane or ship, they mark it on a map using instruments to obtain accurate information. 标绘 9. V-T If someone plots the progress or developme

1. N-COUNT A mob is a large, disorganized, and often violent crowd of people. 一大群乱民 2. N-SING You can refer to the people involved in organized crime as the Mob. 犯罪团伙 [非正式] 3. N-SING People sometimes use the mob to refer in a disapproving way to the majority of people in a country or place, especially when these people are behaving in a violent or uncontrolled way. 暴民 [英国英语] 4. V-T If you say that someone is being mobbed by a crowd of people, you mean that the people are trying to talk to them or get near them in an enthusiastic or threatening way. 成群围住 [usu passive]
1. ADJ Psychological means concerned with a person's mind and thoughts. 心理的 2. psychologically ADV 心理上地 3. ADJ Psychological means relating to psychology. 心理学的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ You use scant to indicate that there is very little of something or not as much of something as there should be. 少量的; 不足的
1. ADJ shining with a glistening or tremulous light 闪闪发光的; 微微发亮的
1. ADJ A faltering attempt, effort, or movement is uncertain because the person doing it is nervous or weak, or does not really know what to do. (尝试、努力、行动等)犹豫的; 蹒跚的

1. V-I When something occurs, it happens. 发生 2. V-I When something occurs in a particular place, it exists or is present there. (某事物在某地) 出现 3. V-I If a thought or idea occurs to you, you suddenly think of it or realize it. (想法、主意在某人脑海中) 突然出现 [no passive, no cont]

1. N-COUNT A lump of something is a solid piece of it. 块 2. N-COUNT A lump on or in someone's body is a small, hard swelling that has been caused by an injury or an illness. 肿块 3. N-COUNT A lump of sugar is a small cube of it. 一小方块 (糖) 4. → see also lump sum 5. PHRASE If you say that you have a lump in your throat, you mean that you have a tight feeling in your throat because of a strong emotion such as sorrow or gratitude. 喉咙哽咽 6. V to collect into a mass or group (积成)块; 团 7. V to tolerate or put up with; endure (in the phrase lump it) 容忍; 忍耐 [非正式]

1. V-T/V-I If someone rasps, their voice or breathing is harsh and unpleasant to listen to. 刺耳地说; 发出刺耳声 2. N-SING Rasp is also a noun. 刺耳的声音 3. V-T/V-I If something rasps or if you rasp it, it makes a harsh, unpleasant sound as it rubs against something hard or rough. 使发出刺耳的刮擦声; 发出刺耳的刮擦声 4. V to scrape or rub (something) roughly, esp with a rasp; abrade (用锉子)锉; 刮擦 5. N-SING Rasp is also a noun. 刺耳的刮擦声 6. N → an informal or scot word for raspberry

1. N-COUNT A domain is a particular field of thought, activity, or interest, especially one over which someone has control, influence, or rights. 领域 [正式] 2. N-COUNT On the Internet, a domain is a set of addresses that shows, for example, the category or geographical area that an Internet address belongs to. (网络) 域 [计算机] 3. N-COUNT the highest level of classification of living organisms. Three domains are recognized: Archaea (see archaean), Bacteria (see bacteria), and Eukarya (see eukaryote) 超界 (Also called superkingdom) [biology]
1. V-I If an amount, rate, or price plummets, it decreases quickly by a large amount. (数量、比率、价格) 暴跌 [journalism]
1. ADJ An in-depth analysis or study of something is a very detailed and complete study of it. 深入彻底的 [usu ADJ n]

1. ADJ If someone is rash or does rash things, they act without thinking carefully first, and therefore make mistakes or behave foolishly. 轻率的 2. rashly ADV 轻率地 3. N-COUNT A rash is an area of red spots that appears on your skin when you are ill or have a bad reaction to something that you have eaten or touched. 疹子 4. N-SING If you talk about a rash of events or things, you mean a large number of unpleasant events or undesirable things, which have happened or appeared within a short period of time. (短期内出现的) 一连串 (不悦之事)
1. N-UNCOUNT Someone's mismanagement of a system or organization is the bad way they have dealt with it or organized it. 处置不当

1. N-COUNT A ferry is a boat that transports passengers and sometimes also vehicles, usually across rivers or short stretches of sea. 渡船; 渡轮 [also 'by' N] 2. V-T If a vehicle ferries people or goods, it transports them, usually by means of regular trips between the same two places. 运送

1. ADJ Something that is filthy is very dirty. 污秽的 2. ADJ If you describe something as filthy, you mean that you think it is morally very unpleasant and disgusting, sometimes in a sexual way. 淫秽的 [表不满]
1. N-VAR Someone's candidacy is their position of being a candidate in an election. 候选资格; 候选人之身份

1. N-UNCOUNT Speaking is the activity of giving speeches and talks. 讲话; 演讲 2. PHRASE You can say "speaking as a parent" or "speaking as a teacher," for example, to indicate that the opinion you are giving is based on your experience as a parent or as a teacher. 作为…来说 3. PHRASE You use speaking in expressions such as generally speaking and technically speaking to indicate which things or which particular aspect of something you are talking about. 一般说来/大致说来/等
1. N-COUNT A pathway is a path that you can walk along or a route that you can take. 路径 2. N-COUNT A pathway is a particular course of action or a way of achieving something. 途径
1. N-VAR An auction is a public sale where items are sold to the person who offers the highest price. 拍卖 2. V-T If something is auctioned, it is sold in an auction. 被拍卖
1. N-VAR Someone's aspirations are their desire to achieve things. 志向

1. ADJ A humble person is not proud and does not believe that they are better than other people. 谦卑的; 谦逊的 2. humbly ADV 谦卑地; 谦逊地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ People with low social status are sometimes described as humble. (社会地位) 低下的 4. ADJ A humble place or thing is ordinary and not special in any way. 普通的 5. ADJ People use humble in a phrase such as in my humble opinion as a polite way of emphasizing what they think, even though they do not feel humble about it. 愚拙的 (用以自谦地表达想法) [礼貌] 6. humbly ADV 愚拙地 (用以自谦地表达想法) [ADV before v] 7. PHRASE If you eat humble pie, you speak or behave in a way which tells people that you admit you were wrong about something. 赔礼道歉 8. V-T If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily. 轻易击败 (重要或强大对手) 9. V-T If something or someone humbles you, they make you realize that you are not as important or good as you thought you were. 使感到惭愧 10. humbling ADJ 使羞辱的

1. N-COUNT A stick is a thin branch which has fallen off a tree. 枝条 2. N-COUNT A stick is a long thin piece of wood which is used for a particular purpose. 棍 3. N-COUNT Some long thin objects that are used in sports are called sticks. 球棒 4. N-COUNT A stick of something is a long thin piece of it. 条状物 5. N-COUNT A stick is a long thin piece of wood which is used for supporting someone's weight or for hitting people or animals. 拐杖; (袭击用的) 棍子 [英国英语] 6. PHRASE If someone gets the wrong end of the stick or gets hold of the wrong end of the stick, they do not understand something correctly and get the wrong idea about it. 误解 [非正式] 1. V-T If you stick something somewhere, you put it there in a rather casual way. 随意放置 [非正式] 2. V-T/V-I If you stick a pointed object in something, or if it sticks in something, it goes into it or through it by making a cut or hole. 使扎入; 扎入 3. V-I If something is sticking out from a surface or object, it extends up or away from it. If something is sticking into a surface or obje
1. N-SING You can refer to an unpleasant or difficult situation as a mire of some kind. 困境; 艰难处境 [文学性] [oft N 'of' n] 2. N-UNCOUNT Mire is dirt or mud. 污泥; 淤泥 [文学性]
1. ADJ A gay person is homosexual. 同性恋的 2. N-PLURAL Gays are homosexual people, especially homosexual men. (尤指男性) 同性恋者 3. gayness N-UNCOUNT 同性恋

1. N-UNCOUNT The steering in a car or other vehicle is the mechanical parts of it which make it possible to steer. 转向装置 2. ADJ A steering committee or a steering group is a group of people that organizes the early stages of a project, and makes sure it progresses in a satisfactory way. (委员会或小组)筹划指导的 [ADJ n]

1. N-UNCOUNT The distribution of things involves giving or delivering them to a number of people or places. 分发 2. N-VAR The distribution of something is how much of it there is in each place or at each time, or how much of it each person has. 分配; 分布

1. N-UNCOUNT Gas is a substance like air that is neither liquid nor solid and burns easily. It is used as a fuel for cooking and heating. 煤气 2. N-VAR A gas is any substance that is neither liquid nor solid, for example oxygen or hydrogen. 气体 3. N-MASS Gas is a poisonous gas that can be used as a weapon. 毒气 4. N-UNCOUNT Gas is the same as . 汽油 [美国英语] 5. V-T To gas a person or animal means to kill them by making them breathe poisonous gas. 用毒气杀死 6. → see also gas mask, greenhouse gas, tear gas

1. N-VAR Suspicion or a suspicion is a belief or feeling that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong. 怀疑 2. N-VAR If there is suspicion of someone or something, people do not trust them or consider them to be reliable. 猜疑 3. N-COUNT A suspicion is a feeling that something is probably true or is likely to happen. 不确定的感觉

1. N-COUNT A gap is a space between two things or a hole in the middle of something solid. 缺口; 裂缝 2. N-COUNT A gap is a period of time when you are not busy or when you stop doing something that you normally do. 间隔期 3. N-COUNT If there is something missing from a situation that prevents it from being complete or satisfactory, you can say that there is a gap. 缺漏 4. N-COUNT A gap between two groups of people, things, or sets of ideas is a big difference between them. 差距
1. N-UNCOUNT Adolescence is the period of your life in which you develop from being a child into being an adult. 青春期
1. N-UNCOUNT Cinnamon is a sweet spice used for flavouring food. 肉桂

1. V-T/V-I If someone will not budge on a matter, or if nothing budges them, they refuse to change their mind or to come to an agreement. 使让步; 做让步 [with brd-neg] 2. V-T/V-I If someone or something will not budge, they will not move. If you cannot budge them, you cannot make them move. 使移动; 移动 [with brd-neg]
1. PHRASAL VERB If you mull something over, you think about it for a long time before deciding what to do. 斟酌
1. N-UNCOUNT You use parlance when indicating that the expression you are using is normally used by a particular group of people. 术语 [正式] [supp N, usu 'in' N]
1. N-COUNT An earner is someone or something that earns money or produces profit. 赚钱的人; 盈利的东西
1. N-PROPER The House of Representatives is the larger of the two parts of Congress in the United States, or the equivalent part of the system of government in some other countries. (美国等的) 众议院
n. 詹尼弗（女子名）
1. N-COUNT A powerhouse is a person, country, or organization that has a lot of power or influence. 权威人士; 强国; 权势集团

1. N-COUNT A bureaucracy is an administrative system operated by a large number of officials. 官僚体制 2. N-UNCOUNT Bureaucracy refers to all the rules and procedures followed by government departments and similar organizations, especially when you think that these are complicated and cause long delays. 官僚作风 [表不满]

1. V-T If you reject something such as a proposal, a request, or an offer, you do not accept it or you do not agree to it. 拒绝; 不同意 2. rejection N-VAR 拒绝; 不同意 3. V-T If you reject a belief or a political system, you refuse to believe in it or to live by its rules. 摈弃 4. rejection N-VAR 摈弃 5. V-T If someone is rejected for a job or course of study, it is not offered to them. 拒绝 (录用或录取) 6. rejection N-COUNT 拒绝 7. V-T If someone rejects another person who expects affection from them, they are cold and unfriendly toward them. 拒绝 (某人的爱情) 8. rejection N-VAR 拒绝 9. V-T If a person's body rejects something such as a new heart that has been transplanted into it, it tries to attack and destroy it. 排斥 (移植的器官等) 10. rejection N-VAR 排斥 11. N-COUNT A reject is a product that has not been accepted for use or sale, because there is something wrong with it. 不合格品
1. ADJ If you describe something as immense, you mean that it is extremely large or great. 巨大的
n. 赢利能力；收益性；利益率
n. 福岛（日本城市）
1. ADV Furthermore is used to introduce a piece of information or opinion that adds to or supports the previous one. 此外 [正式] [ADV with cl]

1. ADJ You use prior to indicate that something has already happened, or must happen, before another event takes place. 事先的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ A prior claim or duty is more important than other claims or duties and needs to be dealt with first. 优先的 [ADJ n] 3. N a prior probability 先验的 [statistics] 4. N the superior of a house and community in certain religious orders (一些宗教教派中的社区)长老; 德高望重者 5. PHRASE If something happens prior to a particular time or event, it happens before that time or event. 在 (某时间或事件) 之前 [正式]
1. N-COUNT An agnostic believes that it is not possible to know whether God exists or not. Compare . 不可知论者
1. N-COUNT A setback is an event that delays your progress or reverses some of the progress that you have made. 挫折; 倒退 [oft N 'for/in/to' n]

1. ADJ Someone who is disabled has an illness, injury, or condition that tends to restrict the way that they can live their life, especially by making it difficult for them to move about. 残疾的 2. N-PLURAL People who are disabled are sometimes referred to as the disabled. 残疾人
n. 加西亚（姓氏）
1. V-T/V-I If you remark that something is the case, you say that it is the case. 说; 评论 2. N-COUNT If you make a remark about something, you say something about it. 议论; 评论
1. V-I If something glistens, it shines, usually because it is wet or oily. (因有水或有油而) 发光

1. N-SING Someone's presence in a place is the fact that they are there. 在场 2. N-UNCOUNT If you say that someone has presence, you mean that they impress people by their appearance and manner. 风采 [表赞许] 3. N-COUNT A presence is a person or creature that you cannot see, but that you are aware of. 幽灵 [文学性] 4. N-SING If a country has a military presence in another country, it has some of its armed forces there. 驻扎 5. N-UNCOUNT If you refer to the presence of a substance in another thing, you mean that it is in that thing. 存在 6. PHRASE If you are in someone's presence, you are in the same place as that person, and are close enough to them to be seen or heard. 在某人面前
1. N-COUNT A priestess is a woman in a non-Christian religion who has particular duties and responsibilities in a place where people worship. (非基督教的) 女祭司
1. N-COUNT In some countries, administrative areas are called prefectures. 辖区 [oft in names]
adj. 与上年同期数字相比的
1. N-VAR If there is an infusion of one thing into another, the first thing is added to the other thing and makes it stronger or better. 输入 [正式] [usu N 'of' n]
n. 匿名；匿名者；无名之辈
米哈伊尔（人名）
n. (Pistorius)人名；(德、捷)皮斯托留斯
参与率，参加率

1. N-UNCOUNT Ivory is a hard cream-coloured substance that forms the tusks of elephants and some other animals. It is valuable and can be used for making carved ornaments. (象或其他一些动物的) 长牙 2. COLOR Ivory is a creamy-white colour. 乳白色 (的)

1. N-COUNT A celebration is a special enjoyable event that people organize because something pleasant has happened or because it is someone's birthday or anniversary. 庆祝活动 2. N-SING The celebration of something is praise and appreciation which is given to it. 颂扬
1. N-COUNT A headwind is a wind which blows in the direction opposite the one in which you are moving. 逆风
adj. 烧煤的
1. V-T When you compile something such as a report, book, or programme, you produce it by collecting and putting together many pieces of information. 汇编; 汇集
1. N-MASS Claret is a type of French red wine. 法国的一种红葡萄酒 2. COLOR Something that is claret is purplish red in colour. 紫红色 [文学性]

1. V-T To filter a substance means to pass it through a device which is designed to remove certain particles contained in it. 过滤 2. V-I If light or sound filters into a place, it comes in weakly or slowly, either through a partly covered opening, or from a long distance away. (光、声) 透入 3. V-I When news or information filters through to people, it gradually reaches them. (新闻、信息等) 逐渐传开 4. N-COUNT A filter is a device through which a substance is passed when it is being filtered. 过滤器 5. N-COUNT A filter is a device through which sound or light is passed and which blocks or reduces particular sound or light frequencies. 滤声器; 滤光器
1. ADJ Something that is enormous is extremely large in size or amount. 巨大的 2. ADJ You can use enormous to emphasize the great degree or extent of something. (程度、范围) 极大的 [强调] 3. enormously ADV 极其地

1. V-T If a country, group, or person boycotts a country, organization, or activity, they refuse to be involved with it in any way because they disapprove of it. 联合抵制 2. N-COUNT Boycott is also a noun. 联合抵制
1. N-COUNT The people on the payroll of a company or an organization are the people who work for it and are paid by it. 在职人员工薪名册 [商业]

1. N-VAR The infrastructure of a country, society, or organization consists of the basic facilities such as transportation, communications, power supplies, and buildings, which enable it to function. (国家、社会、组织赖以行使职能的) 基础设施

1. V-T If you teach someone something, you give them instructions so that they know about it or how to do it. 教 2. V-T To teach someone something means to make them think, feel, or act in a new or different way. 教导 3. V-T/V-I If you teach or teach a subject, you help students to learn about it by explaining it or showing them how to do it, usually as a job at a school or college. 教 (某一科目); 教书 4. → see also teaching 5. to teach someone a lesson →see lesson

1. N-COUNT Your rival is a person, business, or organization who you are competing or fighting against in the same area or for the same things. 对手 2. N-COUNT If you say that someone or something has no rivals or is without rival, you mean that it is best of its type. 可匹敌者 3. V-T If you say that one thing rivals another, you mean that they are both of the same standard or quality. 与…相匹敌

1. N-UNCOUNT If there is a similarity between two or more things, they are similar to each other. 相似; 类似 2. N-COUNT Similarities are features that things have which make them similar to each other. 相似之处
1. N-COUNT A tariff is a tax that a government collects on goods coming into a country. (政府对进口货物征收的) 关税 [商业]
1. N-COUNT Someone's spouse is the person they are married to. 配偶
n. 塞内加尔（非洲国家）
n. 有义务；有责任；可说明性

1. N-UNCOUNT Mint is an herb with fresh-tasting leaves. 薄荷 2. N-COUNT A mint is a sweet with a peppermint flavour. Some people suck mints in order to make their breath smell fresher. 薄荷糖 3. N-COUNT Themint is the place where the official coins of a country are made. 造币厂 4. V-T To mint coins or medals means to make them in a mint. 铸造
1. N-UNCOUNT If you say that someone is on the road to perdition, you mean that their behaviour is likely to lead them to failure and punishment. 失败; 毁灭 [文学性] [usu prep N]
1. ADJ Action that is wasteful uses too much of something valuable such as time, money, or energy. 浪费的
v. 使……协调 n. 坐标 adj. [生物] 同等的；并列的
n. 重整；改进；变换（reform的ing形式）
1. Phenomena is the plural of . phenomenon 的复数

1. ADJ You use prime to describe something that is most important in a situation. 主要的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You use prime to describe something that is of the best possible quality. 最佳的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ You use prime to describe an example of a particular kind of thing that is absolutely typical. 最典型的 [ADJ n] 4. N-UNCOUNT If someone or something is in their prime, they are at the stage in their existence when they are at their strongest, most active, or most successful. 鼎盛时期 5. V-T If you prime someone to do something, you prepare them to do it, for example, by giving them information about it beforehand. 事先交代 (某人做某事) 6. V-T If someone primes a bomb or a gun, they prepare it so that it is ready to explode or fire. 事先准备 (炸弹、枪)

1. ADJ You use fundamental to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or essential. They affect the basic nature of other things or are the most important element upon which other things depend. 基本的 2. ADJ You use fundamental to describe something which exists at a deep and basic level, and is therefore likely to continue. 根本的 3. ADJ If one thing is fundamental to another, it is absolutely necessary to it, and the second thing cannot exist, succeed, or be imagined without it. 绝对必要的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n] 4. ADJ You can use fundamental to show that you are referring to what you consider to be the most important aspect of a situation, and that you are not concerned with less important details. 主要的 [ADJ n]

1. ADV You use definitely to emphasize that something is the case, or to emphasize the strength of your intention or opinion. 一定地 [强调] 2. ADV If something has been definitely decided, the decision will not be changed. 确定地 [ADV before v]
adj. 销售的，售货的；有关销售的 n. 销售（sale的复数）；销售额 n. (Sales)人名；(意、西、葡)萨莱斯；(法)萨勒；(英)塞尔斯

1. N-COUNT A substance is a solid, powder, liquid, or gas with particular properties. 物质 2. N-UNCOUNT Substance is the quality of being important or significant. 实质 [正式] 3. N-SING The substance of what someone says or writes is the main thing that they are trying to say. 要旨 4. N-UNCOUNT If you say that something has no substance, you mean that it is not true. 正确性 [正式]

1. N-COUNT The purpose of something is the reason for which it is made or done. 目的; 用途 2. N-COUNT Your purpose is the thing that you want to achieve. 目标 3. N-UNCOUNT Purpose is the feeling of having a definite aim and of being determined to achieve it. 意志 4. PHRASE If you do something on purpose, you do it intentionally. 故意地
1. N a binding used for holding together two ropes, two spars, etc, esp by lashing with a separate rope 连接绳索、帆柱等的绑绳 [nautical]
1. N-COUNT A glacier is an extremely large mass of ice which moves very slowly, often down a mountain valley. 冰川
1. N-SING-COLL The intelligentsia in a country or community are the most educated people there, especially those interested in the arts, philosophy, and politics. 知识分子 [usu 'the' N]

1. N-COUNT A soapbox is a small temporary platform on which a person stands when he or she is making a speech outdoors. 临时小讲台 2. N-COUNT If you say that someone is on their soapbox, you mean that they are speaking or writing about something they have strong feelings about. 极有感触之事

1. V-T If something relieves an unpleasant feeling or situation, it makes it less unpleasant or causes it to disappear completely. 缓解; 减轻; 解除 2. V-T If someone or something relieves you of an unpleasant feeling or difficult task, they take it from you. 使解脱; 使摆脱 3. V-T If you relieve someone, you take their place and continue to do the job or duty that they have been doing. 接 (某人) 的班; 接替 4. V-T If someone is relieved of their duties or is relieved of their post, they are told that they are no longer required to continue in their job. 使解除 (职务); 使免除 (职位) [正式] [usu passive]
n. 底特律（美国一座城市）
1. ADJ Something that is inconvenient causes problems or difficulties for someone. 不方便的
1. N-MASS Diesel or diesel oil is the heavy fuel used in a diesel engine. 柴油 2. N-COUNT A diesel is a vehicle which has a diesel engine. 柴油车
1. N-UNCOUNT If you do something by proxy, you arrange for someone else to do it for you. 代理权

1. N-COUNT A corridor is a long passage in a building, with doors and rooms on one or both sides. 走廊 [英国英语] 2. N-COUNT A corridor is a strip of land that connects one country to another or gives it a route to the sea through another country. 走廊地带 (与另一国家相连或穿越另一国取得出海通道的狭长地带) 3. N-COUNT A corridor is an area of land between 2 large cities. (两大城市之间的) 走廊地带

1. V-RECIP If two substances mix or if you mix one substance with another, you stir or shake them together, or combine them in some other way, so that they become a single substance. 混合 2. V-T If you mix something, you prepare it by mixing other things together. 调制 3. N-VAR A mix is a powder containing all the substances that you need in order to make something such as a cake or a sauce. When you want to use it, you add liquid. (制作蛋糕或调味汁等的) 混合干配料 4. N-COUNT A mix of different things or people is two or more of them together. 混合体 5. V-RECIP If two things or activities do not mix, it is not a good idea to have them or do them together, because the result would be unpleasant or dangerous. 相协调 [usu with brd-neg] 6. V-RECIP If you mix with other people, you meet them and talk to them. You can also say that people mix. 交往 7. → see also mixed 8. to mix your metaphors →see metaphor
1. N-SING If there is a resurgence of an attitude or activity, it reappears and grows. 复苏 [正式] [also no det, oft N 'of' n]

1. ADJ In a bitter argument or conflict, people argue very angrily or fight very fiercely. 激烈的 2. bitterly ADV 激烈地 3. ADJ If someone is bitter after a disappointing experience or after being treated unfairly, they continue to feel angry about it. 依然愤怒的 4. bitterly ADV 依然愤怒地 5. ADJ A bitter taste is sharp, not sweet, and often slightly unpleasant. 苦的 6. ADJ A bitter experience makes you feel very disappointed. You can also use bitter to emphasize feelings of disappointment. 惨痛的 7. bitterly ADV 惨痛地 8. ADJ Bitter weather, or a bitter wind, is extremely cold. 严寒的; 刺骨的 9. bitterly ADV 严寒地; 刺骨地 [ADV adj] 10. a bitter pill →see pill
1. N-COUNT The secretary-general of an international political organization is the person in charge of its administration. 秘书长
1. V-T/V-I If you brag, you say in a very proud way that you have something or have done something. 吹嘘说; 吹嘘 [表不满]

1. V-T/V-I When someone navigates a ship or an aircraft somewhere, they decide which course to follow and steer it there. 给 (船或飞机) 导航 2. navigation N-VAR 导航 3. V-T/V-I When a ship or boat navigates an area of water, it sails on or across it. 航行 4. V-I When someone in a car navigates, they decide what roads the car should be driven along in order to get somewhere. (为汽车) 导航 5. V-I When fish, animals, or insects navigate somewhere, they find the right direction to go and travel there. (鱼、动物或昆虫) 找到正确的行进方向 6. V-T If you navigate an obstacle, you move carefully in order to avoid hitting the obstacle or hurting yourself. 绕过
1. PRON-REL A system or action whereby something happens is one that makes that thing happen. 凭借 [正式]
1. V-T In grammar, if you parse a sentence, you examine each word and clause in order to work out their grammatical type. 做语法分析 [技术] [V n]

1. N-COUNT Your veins are the thin tubes in your body through which your blood flows toward your heart. Compare . 静脉 2. N-COUNT Something that is written or spoken in a particular vein is written or spoken in that style or mood. 风格; 语气 3. N-COUNT A vein of a particular quality is evidence of that quality that someone often shows in their behaviour or work. 迹象 4. N-COUNT The veins on a leaf are the thin lines on it. 叶脉
adj. 航空电子学的；航电

1. N-COUNT A veil is a piece of thin soft cloth that women sometimes wear over their heads and that can also cover their face. 面纱 2. N-COUNT You can refer to something that hides or partly hides a situation or activity as a veil. 掩饰物 3. N-COUNT You can refer to something that you can partly see through, such as a mist, as a veil. (薄雾等) 半透明物 [文学性]

1. N-COUNT In a machine or piece of equipment, a mechanism is a part, often consisting of a set of smaller parts, which performs a particular function. 机械装置 2. N-COUNT A mechanism is a special way of getting something done within a particular system. 机制 3. N-COUNT A mechanism is a part of your behaviour that is automatic and that helps you to survive or to cope with a difficult situation. (行为的) 机制

1. N-COUNT The rand is the unit of currency used in South Africa. 兰特; 南非货币单位 [usu num N] 2. N-SING The rand is also used to refer to the South African currency system. 兰特 ['the' N] 3. N a leather strip put in the heel of a shoe before the lifts are put on (鞋后跟与鞋底中间的)垫皮 [shoemaking]
1. ADJ A fibrous object or substance contains a lot of fibres or fibre, or looks as if it does. 含纤维的; 似含纤维的 [usu ADJ n]

1. ADJ If you say that someone is being unrealistic, you mean that they do not recognize the truth about a situation, especially about the difficulties involved in something they want to achieve. 不切实际的

1. N-COUNT A bullet is a small piece of metal with a pointed or rounded end, which is fired out of a gun. 子弹 2. PHRASE If someone bites the bullet, they accept that they have to do something unpleasant but necessary. 硬着头皮接受 [journalism]

1. V-T If something is reserved for a particular person or purpose, it is kept specially for that person or purpose. 预留 [usu passive] 2. V-T If you reserve something such as a table, ticket, or magazine, you arrange for it to be kept specially for you, rather than sold or given to someone else. 预订 3. N-COUNT A reserve is a supply of something that is available for use when it is needed. 储备 4. N-COUNT A nature reserve is an area of land where the animals, birds, and plants are officially protected. 保护区 [英国英语] 5. N-UNCOUNT If someone shows reserve, they keep their feelings hidden. 矜持 6. PHRASE If you have something in reserve, you have it available for use when it is needed. 保留备用 7. to reserve judgment →see judgment 8. to reserve the right →see right
1. N-COUNT The inmates of a prison or mental hospital are the prisoners or patients who are living there. 监犯; (精神病院的) 住院者
1. N-COUNT Tactics are the methods that you choose to use in order to achieve what you want in a particular situation. 战术
1. N-UNCOUNT Extremism is the behaviour or beliefs of extremists. 极端主义

1. V-T If you parry a question or argument, you cleverly avoid answering it or dealing with it. 巧妙回避 2. V-T/V-I If you parry a blow from someone who is attacking you, you push aside their arm or weapon so that you are not hurt. 挡开
1. N-SING The status quo is the state of affairs that exists at a particular time, especially in contrast to a different possible state of affairs. 现状

1. ADJ A tragic event or situation is extremely sad, usually because it involves death or suffering. 悲惨的; 不幸的 2. tragically ADV 悲惨地; 不幸地 3. ADJ Tragic is used to refer to tragedy as a type of literature. 悲剧的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ If you describe someone as discerning, you mean that they are able to judge which things of a particular kind are good and which are bad. 有辨别力的 [表赞许]

1. N-PLURAL The contents of a container such as a bottle, box, or room are the things that are inside it. (瓶子、盒子或房间的) 所容之物 2. N-PLURAL The contents of a book are its different chapters and sections, usually shown in a list at the beginning of the book. (书的) 目录 3. N-UNCOUNT If you refer to the content or contents of something such as a book, television programme, or website, you are referring to the subject that it deals with, the story that it tells, or the ideas that it expresses. (书、电视节目或网站等的) 内容 [also N in pl, usu N 'of' n] 4. N-UNCOUNT The content of something such as an educational course or a programme of action is the elements that it consists of. (课程或计划的) 内容 5. N-SING You can use content to refer to the amount or proportion of something that a substance contains. 含量 1. ADJ If you are content with something, you are willing to accept it, rather than wanting something more or something better. 满足的 [v-link ADJ] 2. ADJ If you are content, you are fairly happy or satisfied. 满意的 [v-link ADJ] 3. V t

1. N-UNCOUNT If a person, a country, or an organization has prestige, they are admired and respected because of the position they hold or the things they have achieved. 威望 2.
