ADJ Prestige is used to describe products, places, or activities that people admire because they are associated with being rich or having a high social position. 名贵的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T If you are obliged to do something, a situation, rule, or law makes it necessary for you to do that thing. 迫使 2. V-T/V-I To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do. (通过满足要求而) 帮助 3. CONVENTION If you tell someone that you would be obliged or should be obliged if they would do something, you are telling them in a polite but firm way that you want them to do it. (如蒙…) 将不胜感激 [正式]
1. N-UNCOUNT If a married person commits adultery, they have sex with someone that they are not married to. 通奸
1. N-UNCOUNT Swimming is the activity of swimming, especially as a sport or for pleasure. 游泳运动
adv. [数] 可交换地

1. V-T When someone or something reverses a decision, policy, or trend, they change it to the opposite decision, policy, or trend. 使 (决定、政策、趋势) 转向; 逆转 2. V-T If you reverse the order of a set of things, you arrange them in the opposite order, so that the first thing comes last. 颠倒 (顺序) 3. V-T If you reverse the positions or functions of two things, you change them so that each thing has the position or function that the other one had. 调换 (位置、功能) 4. V-T/V-I When a car reverses or when you reverse it, the car is driven backward. 倒 (车); (车) 倒过来 [英国英语] 5. N-UNCOUNT If your car is in reverse, you have changed gears so that you can drive it backward. (汽车的) 倒档 6. ADJ Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described. 相反的 7. N-SING If you say that one thing is the reverse of another, you are emphasizing that the first thing is the complete opposite of the second thing. 相反物; 相反面 8. N-SING Thereverse or the reverse side of a flat object which has two sides is the less important or
1. N a precious or semiprecious stone associated with a month or sign of the zodiac and thought to bring luck if worn by a person born in that month or under that sign 诞生石

1. ADV You use hence to indicate that the statement you are about to make is a consequence of what you have just said. 因此 [正式] [ADV cl/group] 2. ADV You use hence in expressions such as "several years hence" or "six months hence" to refer to a time in the future, especially a long time in the future. 此后 [正式] [amount ADV]

1. ADJ If you are fond of someone, you feel affection for them. 喜爱的 [v-link ADJ 'of' n] 2. fondness N-UNCOUNT 喜爱 3. ADJ You use fond to describe people or their behaviour when they show affection. 慈爱的 [ADJ n] 4. fondly ADV 慈爱地 [ADV after v] 5. ADJ If you are fond of something, you like it or you like doing it very much. 很喜欢 [v-link ADJ 'of' n/-ing] 6. fondness N-UNCOUNT 钟爱 7. ADJ If you have fond memories of someone or something, you remember them with pleasure. (回忆) 美好的 [ADJ n] 8. fondly ADV 愉快地 [ADV with v] 9. ADJ You use fond to describe hopes, wishes, or beliefs which you think are foolish because they seem unlikely to be fulfilled. (希望、想法或信仰等) 不切实际的 [ADJ n] 10. fondly ADV 不切实际地 [ADV with v] 11. N the background of a design, as in lace (如花边)设计背景
1. CONJ You use whereas to introduce a comment that contrasts with what is said in the main clause. 而 (引导与主句内容相对比的评论)
n. （打扮成 Robin Hood 等传奇人物跳的）莫理斯舞 n. (Morris)人名；(丹、德、法、捷、葡、西、意、英)莫里斯

1. N-COUNT An embassy is a group of government officials, headed by an ambassador, who represent their government in a foreign country. The building in which they work is also called an embassy. 大使及其随员; 大使馆
n. 最小的儿子；年纪最小的人 adj. 最年轻的

1. N-UNCOUNT Distress is a state of extreme sorrow, suffering, or pain. 悲痛; 疼痛 2. N-UNCOUNT Distress is the state of being in extreme danger and needing urgent help. 危难; 危急 3. V-T If someone or something distresses you, they cause you to be upset or worried. 使心烦; 使忧虑

1. ADJ You use double to indicate that something includes or is made of two things of the same kind. 双的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You use double before a singular noun to refer to two things of the same type that occur together, or that are connected in some way. 成对的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ You use double to describe something which is twice the normal size or can hold twice the normal quantity of something. 双倍的 4. ADJ A double room is a room intended for two people, usually a couple, to stay or live in. 双人的 5. N-COUNT Double is also a noun. 双人房间 6. ADJ A double bed is a bed that is wide enough for two people to sleep in. 双人的 [ADJ n] 7. ADJ You use double to describe a drink that is twice the normal measure. (酒类饮料) 双份的 [ADJ n] 8. N-COUNT Double is also a noun. 双份酒类饮料 9. PREDET If something is double the amount or size of another thing, it is twice as large. 双倍的 [PREDET 'the' n] 10. PRON Double is also a pronoun. 两倍 11. V-T/V-I When something doubles or when you double it, it becomes twice as great in number, amount,
1. N-COUNT If something is done by fiat, it is done because of an official order given by someone in authority. 命令; 法令 [正式] [also 'by' N]
1. N-UNCOUNT Prostitution means having sex with people in exchange for money. 卖淫
1. N-UNCOUNT The removal of something is the act of removing it. 移动; 搬动; 去除 2. N-VAR Removal is the process of transporting furniture or equipment from one building to another. (家具、设备的) 搬运 [英国英语]

1. V-T To inject a substance such as a medicine into someone means to put it into their body using a device with a needle called a syringe. 给…注射 2. V-T If you inject a new, exciting, or interesting quality into a situation, you add it. 注入; 增添 3. V-T If you inject money or resources into a business or organization, you provide more money or resources for it. 注入 (资金或资源) [商业]
1. V-T If you endeavour to do something, you try very hard to do it. 努力 [正式] 2. N-VAR An endeavour is an attempt to do something, especially something new or original. 尝试 [正式]
1. ADJ A shrubby plant is like a shrub. 灌木状的 [usu ADJ n]

1. ADJ If you say that one thing is rooted in another, you mean that it is strongly influenced by it or has developed from it. 源于…的 [v-link ADJ 'in' n] 2. ADJ If someone has deeply rooted opinions or feelings, they believe or feel something extremely strongly and are unlikely to change. 根深蒂固的 3. PHRASE If you are rooted to the spot, you are unable to move because you are very frightened or shocked. 呆着不动的

1. N-UNCOUNT Prayer is the activity of speaking to God. 祈祷 2. N-COUNT A prayer is the words a person says when they speak to God. 祷词 3. N-COUNT You can refer to a strong hope that you have as your prayer. 祈求 4. N-PLURAL A short religious service at which people gather to pray can be referred to as prayers. 祈祷仪式 5. N a person who prays 祈祷者

1. N-SING If there is a renewal of an activity or a situation, it starts again. 重新开始; 恢复 2. N-VAR The renewal of a document such as a licence or a contract is an official increase in the period of time for which it remains valid. (有效期的) 延长 3. N-UNCOUNT Renewal of something lost, dead, or destroyed is the process of it growing again or being replaced. 新生; 复兴

1. ADJ You use civil to describe events that happen within a country and that involve the different groups of people in it. 国民的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You use civil to describe people or things in a country that are not connected with its armed forces. 民用的 3. ADJ You use civil to describe things that are connected with the state rather than with a religion. 民政的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ You use civil to describe the rights that people have within a society. 公民的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ Someone who is civil is polite in a formal way, but not particularly friendly. 文明的 [正式] 6. civility N-UNCOUNT 礼貌

1. ADJ If you are unwilling to do something, you do not want to do it and will not agree to do it. 不愿意的 2. unwillingness N-UNCOUNT 不愿意 3. ADJ You can use unwilling to describe someone who does not really want to do the thing they are doing. 不情愿的 4. unwillingly ADV 不情愿地
1. N ACRONYM for Panhellenic Socialist Movement 泛希腊社会主义运动
1. ADJ If you describe evidence or a report as damning, you mean that it suggests very strongly that someone is guilty of a crime or has made a serious mistake. (罪证等) 确凿的; 导致定罪的

1. ADJ Editorial means involved in preparing a newspaper, magazine, or book for publication. 编辑的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Editorial means involving the attitudes, opinions, and contents of something such as a newspaper, magazine, or television programme. 社论的 [ADJ n] 3. N-COUNT An editorial is an article in a newspaper that gives the opinion of the editor or owner on a topic or item of news. 社论

1. N-COUNT A contract is a legal agreement, usually between two companies or between an employer and employee, which involves doing work for a stated sum of money. 合同 2. V-T If you contract with someone to do something, you legally agree to do it for them or for them to do it for you. (与某人) 签订合同 [正式] 3. V-T/V-I When something contracts or when something contracts it, it becomes smaller or shorter. 缩小; 缩短; 使缩小; 使缩短 4. contraction N-VAR 收缩 5. V-I When something such as an economy or market contracts, it becomes smaller. (经济、市场等) 萎缩 6. V-T If you contract a serious illness, you become ill with it. 染 (重病) [正式] [no cont] 7. PHRASE If you are under contract to someone, you have signed a contract agreeing to work for them, and for no one else, during a fixed period of time. 已经与…签订合同

1. ADJ Military means relating to the armed forces of a country. 军事的 2. militarily ADV 在军事上 3. N-COUNT-COLL The military are the armed forces of a country, especially officers of high rank. 军方 (尤指高级军官) 4. ADJ Military means well organized, controlled, or neat, in a way that is typical of a soldier. 军人般的
1. N a state, position, or opportunity affording superiority or advantage 优势
n. 芬兰人（Finn的复数形式）

1. V-T If you sustain something, you continue it or maintain it for a period of time. 保持 2. V-T If you sustain something such as a defeat, loss, or injury, it happens to you. 遭受 [正式] 3. V-T If something sustains you, it supports you by giving you help, strength, or encouragement. 支撑 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A range of things is a number of different things of the same general kind. (同类事物的) 一系列 2. N-COUNT A range is the complete group that is included between two points on a scale of measurement or quality. 范围 3. N-COUNT The range of something is the maximum area in which it can reach things or detect things. (能够到达或探知的) 最大范围 4. V-I If things range between two points or range from one point to another, they vary within these points on a scale of measurement or quality. (在一定幅度内) 变化 5. N-COUNT A range of mountains or hills is a line of them. 山脉 6. N-COUNT A rifle range or a shooting range is a place where people can practise shooting at targets. 射击场 7. N-COUNT A range is a large area of open land, especially land in the United States, where cattle are kept. (尤指美国的) 大牧场 8. N-COUNT A range or kitchen range is a large metal device for cooking food using gas or electricity. A range consists of a grill, an oven, and some gas or electric burners. 炉灶 [美国英语] 9. → see also free-range 10. PHRASE If somet
1. ADJ A painstaking search, examination, or investigation is done extremely carefully and thoroughly. 十分小心的; 极其仔细的 2. painstakingly ADV 十分小心地; 极其仔细地

1. N-COUNT A polyp is a small unhealthy growth on a surface inside your body. 息肉 2. N-COUNT A polyp is a small animal that lives in the sea. It has a hollow body like a tube and long parts called tentacles around its mouth. 水螅
1. N-PLURAL the sittings or a sitting of justice in court 开庭 →see magistrates' court, quarter sessions
1. N-PLURAL articles of food; provisions 粮食; 供给 [非正式]

1. V-T If you uphold something such as a law, a principle, or a decision, you support and maintain it. 维护 2. V-T If a court of law upholds a legal decision that has already been made, it decides that it was the correct decision. 维持 (原判)
1. N-UNCOUNT Schooling is education that children receive at school. 学校教育
1. ADJ Proprietary substances or products are sold under a brand name. 品牌专卖的 [正式] [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT Scallops are large shellfish with two flat fan-shaped shells. Scallops can be eaten. 扇贝 [usu pl]
1. V-T If something such as power, a custom, or an idea is entrenched, it is firmly established, so that it would be difficult to change it. 巩固 2. entrenched ADJ 巩固的

1. N-COUNT A zone is an area that has particular features or characteristics. (有某些特征或特点的) 地带 2. V-T If an area of land is zoned, it is formally set aside for a particular purpose. 将…划为特殊区域 [usu passive] 3. zoning N-UNCOUNT 分区制
1. N-VAR If you say that someone has an obsession with a person or thing, you think they are spending too much time thinking about them. 迷恋

1. V-T When you conduct an activity or task, you organize it and do it. 组织并实施 2. V-T If you conduct yourself in a particular way, you behave in that way. (以某种方式) 表现 3. V-T/V-I When someone conducts an orchestra or choir, they stand in front of it and direct its performance. 指挥 (交响乐、合唱等) 4. V-T If something conducts heat or electricity, it allows heat or electricity to pass through it or along it. 传导 (热、电) [no cont] 5. N-SING The conduct of a task or activity is the way in which it is organized and carried out. 进行实施 6. N-UNCOUNT Someone's conduct is the way they behave in particular situations. (某人在某情形中的) 行为方式

1. N-PLURAL You can refer to people as folk or folks. 人 2. N-PLURAL You can refer to your close family, especially your mother and father, as your folks. 家人 [非正式] 3. N-VOC You can use folks as a term of address when you are talking to several people. 各位 [非正式] 4. ADJ Folk art and customs are traditional or typical of a particular community or nation. 民间的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ Folk music is music which is traditional or typical of a particular community or nation. 民间的 (音乐) [ADJ n] 6. N-UNCOUNT Folk is also a noun. 民间 (音乐)

1. N-COUNT A merchant is a person who buys or sells goods in large quantities, especially one who imports and exports them. 商人 2. N-COUNT A merchant is a person who owns or runs a shop, or other business. 店主 [美国英语] 3. ADJ Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade. 商船的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T If you tolerate a situation or person, you accept them although you do not particularly like them. 容忍 2. V-T If you can tolerate something bad or painful, you are able to bear it. 忍受 (坏的或痛苦的事物)
1. N-PLURAL needs; necessities 需要; 必需品

1. V-T If you scatter things over an area, you throw or drop them so that they spread all over the area. 撒 2. V-T/V-I If a group of people scatter or if you scatter them, they suddenly separate and move in different directions. 使散开; 散开 3. → see also scattered, scattering
n. 穆罕默德（穆斯林真主）；（阿拉伯）穆罕默德（男子名）

1. V-T/V-I If a group of people or things unite or if something unites them, they join together and act as a group. 使联合; 联合 1. N an English gold coin minted in the Stuart period, originally worth 20 shillings 统一金币; 英国斯图尔特时期的金币，约合20先令

1. V-T If you fold something such as a piece of paper or cloth, you bend it so that one part covers another part, often pressing the edge so that it stays in place. 折叠 2. V-T/V-I If a piece of furniture or equipment folds or if you can fold it, you can make it smaller by bending or closing parts of it. 翻折 3. PHRASAL VERB Fold up means the same as . fold up同fold 4. V-T If you fold your arms or hands, you bring them together and cross or link them, for example, over your chest. 交叠 (双臂或双手) 5. V to mix (a whisked mixture) with other ingredients by gently turning one part over the other with a spoon (将被搅拌过的混合物)拌入 (Also fold in) 6. N-COUNT A fold in a piece of paper or cloth is a bend that you make in it when you put one part of it over another part and press the edge. 折痕 7. N-COUNT The folds in a piece of cloth are the curved shapes which are formed when it is not hanging or lying flat. 褶皱 8. N a small enclosure or pen for sheep or other livestock, where they can be gathered (圈养羊等其他家畜的)小围栏 9. N the sheep
adj. 快些（quick的形容词比较级）

1. V-T The things that something is composed of are its parts or members. The separate things that compose something are the parts or members that form it. 组成 2. V-T/V-I When someone composes a piece of music or composes, they write music. 创作 (乐曲); 作曲 3. V-T If you compose something such as a letter, poem, or speech, you write it, often using a lot of concentration or skill. (用心) 写 (信、诗、演讲稿) [正式]
1. V-T If you define something, you show, describe, or state clearly what it is and what its limits are, or what it is like. 给…下定义; 解释
1. N-UNCOUNT Academia refers to all the academics in a particular country or region, the institutions they work in, and their work. 学术界

1. N-COUNT A squad is a section of a police force that is responsible for dealing with a particular type of crime. (专门处理某类犯罪的) 警察分队 2. N-COUNT A squad is a group of players from which a sports team will be chosen. (将从中挑选运动员组队参赛的) 运动代表队

1. V-T If you brace yourself for something unpleasant or difficult, you prepare yourself for it. 准备 (面对不愉快或困难之事) 2. V-T If you brace yourself against something or brace part of your body against it, you press against something in order to steady your body or to avoid falling. 抵住 3. V-T If you brace your shoulders or knees, you keep them stiffly in a particular position. 绷紧 (肩或膝盖) 4. V-T To brace something means to strengthen or support it with something else. 支撑 5. N-COUNT A brace is a device attached to a part of a person's body, for example, to a weak leg, in order to strengthen or support it. 支架 6. N-PLURAL Braces are a metal device that can be fastened to a person's teeth in order to help them grow straight. 牙箍 7. N-COUNT [美国英语] →see curly brackets 8. N-PLURAL Braces are a pair of straps that pass over your shoulders and fasten to your trousers at the front and back in order to stop them from falling down. (裤子的) 背带 [英国英语]
n. 休斯顿（美国得克萨斯州港市）

1. N the anterior portion of the brain of vertebrates, consisting of two lateral hemispheres joined by a thick band of fibres: the dominant part of the brain in man, associated with intellectual function, emotion, and personality 大脑 →see telencephalon
1. V-T If you solve a problem or a question, you find a solution or an answer to it. 解决

1. N-COUNT An accumulation of something is a large number of things that have been collected together or acquired over a period of time. 积累 2. N-UNCOUNT Accumulation is the collecting together of things over a period of time. 积累
n. 戴维斯（男子名）

1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES A bureau is an office, organization, or government department that collects and distributes information. 局 2. N-COUNT A bureau is an office of a company or organization that has its main office in another city or country. 分公司 [美国英语] [商业] 3. N-COUNT A bureau is a chest of drawers. 五斗橱 [美国英语] 4. N-COUNT A bureau is a writing desk with shelves and drawers and a lid that opens to form the writing surface. 写字台 [英国英语]
1. V-T If you shun someone or something, you deliberately avoid them or keep away from them. 有意回避

1. N-COUNT A figure is a particular amount expressed as a number, especially a statistic. 数字 2. N-COUNT A figure is any of the ten written symbols from 0 to 9 that are used to represent a number. 个位数字 3. N-COUNT You refer to someone that you can see as a figure when you cannot see them clearly or when you are describing them. 身影 4. N-COUNT In art, a figure is a person in a drawing or a painting, or a statue of a person. 人像 5. N-COUNT Your figure is the shape of your body. 身材 6. N-COUNT Someone who is referred to as a figure of a particular kind is a person who is well-known and important in some way. 重要人物 7. N-COUNT If you say that someone is, for example, a mother figure or a hero figure, you mean that other people regard them as the type of person stated or suggested. 代表 8. N-COUNT In books and magazines, the diagrams which help to show or explain information are referred to as figures. 图表 [also N num] 9. N-COUNT In geometry, a figure is a shape, especially a regular shape. 几何图形 [技术] 10. N-PLURAL
1. N-COUNT A magistrate is an official who acts as a judge in law courts which deal with minor crimes or disputes. 治安法官
1. ADJ If someone has a simian face, they look a little like a monkey. 长得像猿猴的 [正式] [usu ADJ n] 2. ADJ Simian is used to describe things relating to monkeys or apes. 猴的; 类人猿的 [技术] [usu ADJ n]
1. ADJ Monetary means relating to money, especially the total amount of money in a country. 货币的 [商业] [ADJ n]
1. N-MASS Toothpaste is a thick substance which you put on your toothbrush and use to clean your teeth. 牙膏

1. V-T To execute someone means to kill them as a punishment for a serious crime. 处死 2. execution N-VAR 处死 3. V-T If you execute a plan, you carry it out. 执行 (计划等) [正式] 4. execution N-UNCOUNT 执行 5. V-T If you execute a difficult action or movement, you successfully perform it. 完成 (高难动作)

1. N-COUNT A cheque is a printed form on which you write an amount of money and who it is to be paid to. Your bank then pays the money to that person from your account. 支票 2. → see also blank cheque, traveller's cheque

1. PHRASE If you do something with ease, you do it easily, without difficulty or effort. 轻易地 2. N-UNCOUNT If you talk about the ease of a particular activity, you are referring to the way that it has been made easier to do, or to the fact that it is already easy to do. 简便 3. N-UNCOUNT Ease is the state of being very comfortable and able to live as you want, without any worries or problems. 舒适; 悠闲 4. V-T/V-I If something unpleasant eases or if you ease it, it is reduced in degree, speed, or intensity. 减轻; 减缓 5. V-T/V-I If you ease your way somewhere or ease somewhere, you move there slowly, carefully, and gently. If you ease something somewhere, you move it there slowly, carefully, and gently. 小心缓慢地移动 6. PHRASE If you are at ease, you are feeling confident and relaxed, and are able to talk to people without feeling nervous or anxious. If you put someone at ease, you make them feel at ease. 放松的; 自在的 7. PHRASE If you are ill at ease, you feel somewhat uncomfortable, anxious, or worried. 不舒适; 不自在
1. N a card game in which players must avoid winning tricks containing hearts or the queen of spades 红心牌戏 (Also called Black Maria)
1. ADJ If a material is translucent, some light can pass through it. 半透明的

1. N-UNCOUNT Wholesale is the activity of buying and selling goods in large quantities and therefore at cheaper prices, usually to stores who then sell them to the public. Compare . 批发 [商业] 2. ADV If something is sold wholesale, it is sold in large quantities and at cheaper prices, usually to stores. 批发地 [商业] [ADV after v] 3. ADJ You use wholesale to describe the destruction, removal, or changing of something when it affects a very large number of things or people. (破坏、迁移或变动) 大规模的 [ADJ n] [强调]

1. ADJ Foster parents are people who officially take a child into their family for a period of time, without becoming the child's legal parents. The child is referred to as their foster child. 收养的 [ADJ n] 2. V-T If you foster a child, you take it into your family for a period of time, without becoming its legal parent. 收养 3. V-T To foster something such as an activity or idea means to help it to develop. 促进

1. V-RECIP If something or someone connects one thing to another, or if one thing connects to another, or if two things connect, the two things are joined together. (某物、某人) 连接 (某物); (一物与另一物) 相连 2. V-RECIP If two things or places connect or if something connects them, they are joined and people or things can pass between them. (两物或两地) 相连通 3. V-I If one train or plane, for example, connects with another, it arrives at a time which allows passengers to change to the other one in order to continue their trip. (与火车、飞机等) 联运 4. V-T If a piece of equipment or a place is connected to a source of power or water, it is joined to that source so that it has power or water. 将 (设备、某地与水源、电源等) 接通 [usu passive] 5. PHRASAL VERB Connect up means the same as . 接通 6. V-T If you connect a person or thing with something, you realize that there is a link or relationship between them. 将 (某人、某物与某事物) 联系起来 7. V-T Something that connects a person or thing with something else shows or provides a link or relationship between them. 显
三层
n. 推荐；赞扬；奖状

1. N-COUNT If you refer to a male political leader as a strongman, you mean that he has great power and control over his country, although his methods may sometimes be violent or morally wrong. 独裁者 [journalism]

1. V-T If you earn money, you receive money in return for work that you do. 挣 (钱) 2. V-T If something earns money, it produces money as profit or interest. 赢 (利) 3. V-T If you earn something such as praise, you get it because you deserve it. 赢得

1. N-COUNT A crossing is a journey by boat or ship to a place on the other side of an ocean, river, or lake. 横渡 2. N-COUNT A crossing is a place where two roads, paths, or lines cross. 交叉路口 3. N-COUNT A crossing is the same as a or a . 平交道口

1. N-COUNT A spy is a person whose job is to find out secret information about another country or organization. 间谍 2. ADJ A spy satellite or spy plane obtains secret information about another country by taking photographs from the sky. 承担间谍任务的 (卫星、飞机) [ADJ n] 3. V-I Someone who spies for a country or organization tries to find out secret information about another country or organization. (为某国、某组织) 从事间谍活动 4. spying N-UNCOUNT 从事间谍活动 5. V-I If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly. 秘密监视

1. ADJ A patchy substance or colour exists in some places but not in others, or is thick in some places and thin in others. 分布不均衡的 2. ADJ If something is patchy, it is not completely reliable or satisfactory because it is not always good. 不很可靠的; 不很令人满意的
1. N-COUNT A refinery is a factory where a substance such as oil or sugar is refined. 精炼厂

1. V-I If the amount, value, level, or volume of something soars, it quickly increases by a great deal. 急剧增加 [journalism] 2. V-I If something such as a bird soars into the air, it goes quickly up into the air. 高飞 [文学性]
1. ADJ If you are enthusiastic about something, you show how much you like or enjoy it by the way that you behave and talk. 热衷的; 热烈的 2. enthusiastically ADV 热衷地; 热烈地

1. N-COUNT If someone is a defender of a particular thing or person that has been criticized, they argue or act in support of that thing or person. 捍卫者 2. N-COUNT A defender in a game such as football or hockey is a player whose main task is to try and stop the other side from scoring. 防守队员

1. V-T/V-I If you soak something or leave it to soak, you put it into a liquid and leave it there. 浸泡 2. V-T If a liquid soaks something or if you soak something with a liquid, the liquid makes the thing very wet. 使浸湿 3. V-I If a liquid soaks through something, it passes through it. 渗透 4. V-I If someone soaks, they spend a long time in a hot bath, because they enjoy it. 长时间泡浴 5. N-COUNT Soak is also a noun. 泡浴 6. → see also soaked, soaking

1. V-T When soldiers raid a place, they make a sudden armed attack against it, with the aim of causing damage rather than occupying any of the enemy's land. 突袭 2. N-COUNT Raid is also a noun. 突袭 3. → see also air raid 4. V-T If the police raid a building, they enter it suddenly and by force in order to look for dangerous criminals or for evidence of something illegal, such as drugs or weapons. 突击搜查 5. N-COUNT Raid is also a noun. 突击搜查
1. N-COUNT An NGO is an organization which is not run by the government. NGO is an abbreviation for . nongovernmental organization的缩写; 即非政府组织

1. V-T If someone recommends a person or thing to you, they suggest that you would find that person or thing good or useful. 推荐 2. recommended ADJ 被推崇的 3. V-T If you recommend that something is done, you suggest that it should be done. 建议 4. V-T If something or someone has a particular quality to recommend them, that quality makes them attractive or gives them an advantage over similar things or people. 使受欢迎; 使有优势
1. N-COUNT A regulator is a person or organization appointed by a government to regulate an area of activity such as banking or industry. 监管人; 监管机构 2. regulatory ADJ 监管的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A placard is a large notice that is carried in a march or displayed in a public place. 标语牌; 布告
1. N-COUNT A synonym is a word or expression which means the same as another word or expression. 同义词
vt. 用参数表示；确定…的参数
1. ADJ Someone who is outspoken gives their opinions about things openly and honestly, even if they are likely to shock or offend people. 直言不讳的 2. outspokenness N-UNCOUNT 直言不讳
1. N-COUNT If you say that someone is a control freak, you mean that they want to be in control of every situation they find themselves in. 控制狂 [非正式]
1. N-VAR Referral is the act of officially sending someone to a person or authority that is qualified to deal with them. A referral is an instance of this. 移交; 送交
adv. 出乎意料地，意外地

1. N-COUNT Bubbles are small balls of air or gas in a liquid. (液体中的) 气泡 2. N-COUNT A bubble is a hollow ball of soapy liquid that is floating in the air or standing on a surface. 肥皂泡 3. N-COUNT In a cartoon, a speech bubble is the shape which surrounds the words which a character is thinking or saying. (圈注漫画中人物心理活动或对白的) 泡状框 4. V-I When a liquid bubbles, bubbles move in it, for example, because it is boiling or moving quickly. 冒泡; 沸腾 5. V-I A feeling, influence, or activity that is bubbling away continues to occur. 继续发生 [usu cont]
1. N-COUNT Supporters are people who support someone or something, for example a political leader or a sports team. 支持者

1. N-VAR An amnesty is an official pardon granted to a group of prisoners by the state. 赦免 2. N-COUNT An amnesty is a period of time during which people can admit to a crime or give up weapons without being punished. 赦免时段

1. N-COUNT An ornament is an attractive object that you display in your home or in your garden. 装饰品 2. N-UNCOUNT Decorations and patterns on a building or a piece of furniture can be referred to as ornament. (建筑、家具上的) 装饰 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A press release is a written statement about a matter of public interest that is given to the press by an organization concerned with the matter. (向记者发布的) 新闻稿

1. ADJ If something you want or need is available, you can find it or obtain it. 可获得的 2. availability N-UNCOUNT 可获得性 3. ADJ Someone who is available is not busy and is therefore free to talk to you or to do a particular task. 有空的 [v-link ADJ]
1. N-UNCOUNT Debris is pieces from something that has been destroyed or pieces of rubbish or unwanted material that are spread around. 碎片; 散乱的垃圾
1. ADJ A canny person is clever and able to think quickly. You can also describe a person's behaviour as canny. 精明的 [usu ADJ n]

1. ADJ If you describe an event, action, or procedure as symbolic, you mean that it represents an important change, although it has little practical effect. 有象征意义的 2. symbolically ADV 有象征意义地 3. ADJ Something that is symbolic of a person or thing is regarded or used as a symbol of them. 用作象征的 4. symbolically ADV 象征性地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ Symbolic is used to describe things involving or relating to symbols. 符号的 [ADJ n]
1. N-MASS Moss is a very small, soft, green plant which grows on damp soil, or on wood or stone. 青苔

1. ADJ Someone or something that is mysterious is strange and is not known about or understood. 神秘的; 难以理解的 2. mysteriously ADV 神秘地 3. ADJ If someone is mysterious about something, they deliberately do not talk much about it, sometimes because they want to make people more interested in it. 诡秘的 [v-link ADJ] 4. mysteriously ADV 诡秘地 [ADV after v]

1. N-COUNT A blast is a big explosion, especially one caused by a bomb. (尤指炸弹引起的) 大爆炸 2. V-T If something is blasted into a particular place or state, an explosion causes it to be in that place or state. If a hole is blasted in something, it is created by an explosion. 由爆炸生成; 由爆炸引起 3. V-T If workers are blasting rock, they are using explosives to make holes in it or destroy it, for example, so that a road or tunnel can be built. 用炸药炸 4. V-T To blast someone means to shoot them with a gun. 向…射击 [journalism] 5. N-COUNT Blast is also a noun. 枪击 6. V-T If someone blasts their way somewhere, they get there by shooting at people or causing an explosion. 借助射击或爆炸打开 (通道) 7. V-T If something blasts water or air somewhere, it sends out a sudden, powerful stream of it. 强速喷射 (水流或气流) 8. N-COUNT Blast is also a noun. 强劲的 (气或水) 流 9. V-T/V-I If you blast something such as a car horn, or if it blasts, it makes a sudden, loud sound. If something blasts music, or music blasts, the music is very loud. 突然大声按响; 大声放 (音乐);
vi. 锤击；敲打；重复 n. 铁锤；链球；[解剖] 锤骨；音锤 vt. 锤击；锤打 n. (Hammer)人名；(法)阿梅；(德、英、芬、捷、瑞典、荷、丹、挪)哈默

1. ADJ You use militant to describe people who believe in something very strongly and are active in trying to bring about political or social change, often in extreme ways that other people find unacceptable. 激进的 2. N-COUNT Militant is also a noun. 激进分子 3. militancy N-UNCOUNT 好战性
1. ADJ Behaviour that is unethical is wrong and unacceptable according to rules or beliefs about morality. 不道德的
1. N-UNCOUNT A person's or thing's reliance on something is the fact that they need it and often cannot live or work without it. 依赖; 依靠

1. N-UNCOUNT Concrete is a substance used for building which is made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones, and water. 混凝土 2. V-T When you concrete something such as a path, you cover it with concrete. 给 (道路等) 浇混凝土 3. ADJ You use concrete to indicate that something is definite and specific. 明确具体的 4. ADJ A concrete object is a real, physical object. 实物的 5. ADJ A concrete noun is a noun that refers to a physical object rather than to a quality or idea. 具体的 (名词) [ADJ n]
1. N-PLURAL A pair of pyjamas consists of loose trousers and a top that people wear to bed. 睡衣 [also 'a' 'pair' 'of' N]

1. N-COUNT A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house. 家庭; 同住一所房子的人 2. N-SING The household is your home and everything that is connected with taking care of it. 家务 3. ADJ Someone or something that is a household name or word is very well known. 家喻户晓的 [ADJ n]

1. ADJ If an action or procedure is mandatory, people have to do it, because it is a rule or a law. 法定的 [正式] 2. ADJ If a crime carries a mandatory punishment, that punishment is fixed by law for all cases, in contrast to crimes for which the judge or magistrate has to decide the punishment for each particular case. (刑罚) 强制性的 [正式]
1. V-RECIP If you haggle, you argue about something before reaching an agreement, especially about the cost of something that you are buying. 争论 (尤指讨价还价) 2. haggling N-UNCOUNT 讨价还价
1. N-COUNT Someone's obituary is an account of their life and character which is presented in a newspaper or broadcast soon after they die. 讣文
v. 诱拐，绑架（kidnap过去时形式）
1. N-UNCOUNT If you accuse someone of self-interest, you disapprove of them because they always want to do what is best for themselves rather than for anyone else. 自私自利 [表不满]
n. 货币贬值

1. V-T If a person or animal is released from somewhere where they have been locked up or cared for, they are set free or allowed to go. 放走 [usu passive] 2. N-COUNT When someone is released, you refer to their release. 释放 [with supp] 3. V-T If someone or something releases you from a duty, task, or feeling, they free you from it. 解除 [正式] 4. N-UNCOUNT Release is also a noun. 解除 [also 'a' N, oft N 'from' N] 5. V-T To release feelings or abilities means to allow them to be expressed. 释放 6. N-UNCOUNT Release is also a noun. 释放 7. V-T If someone in authority releases something such as a document or information, they make it available. 发放 8. N-COUNT Release is also a noun. 发放 9. V-T If you release someone or something, you stop holding them. 放开 [正式] 10. V-T If something releases gas, heat, or a substance, it causes it to leave its container or the substance that it was part of and enter the surrounding atmosphere or area. 释放 11. N-COUNT Release is also a noun. 释放 12. V-T When an entertainer or company

1. N-COUNT If you refer to someone's plight, you mean that they are in a difficult or distressing situation that is full of problems. 困境 2. V to give or pledge (one's word) 保证; 宣誓 3. N a solemn promise, esp of engagement; pledge 誓约; 婚约 [archaic, DIALECT]
adv. 不成比例地
1. N-COUNT Taxpayers are people who pay a percentage of their income to the government as tax. 纳税人 [商业]

1. V-T/V-I To trample on someone's rights or values or to trample them means to deliberately ignore them. 无视 2. V-T If someone is trampled, they are injured or killed by being stepped on by animals or by other people. 踩伤; 踩死 [usu passive] 3. V-T/V-I If someone tramples something or tramples on it, they step heavily and carelessly on it and damage it. 践踏; 踩坏

1. N-UNCOUNT The essence of something is its basic and most important characteristic that gives it its individual identity. 本质 2. PHRASE If you say that something is of the essence, you mean that it is absolutely necessary in order for a particular action to be successful. 至关重要 [正式] 3. PHRASE You use in essence to emphasize that you are talking about the most important or central aspect of an idea, situation, or event. 本质上 [正式] 4. N-MASS Essence is a very concentrated liquid that is used for flavouring food or for its smell. 精油
1. ADJ fairly new 较新的

1. ADJ If something is overwhelming, it affects you very strongly, and you do not know how to deal with it. 强悍而令人难以应对的 2. overwhelmingly ADV 强悍而令人难以应对地 [ADV adj] 3. ADJ You can use overwhelming to emphasize that an amount or quantity is much greater than other amounts or quantities. (数量上) 压倒性的 [强调] 4. overwhelmingly ADV (数量上) 压倒性地

1. N-COUNT A counsellor is a person whose job is to give advice to people who need it, especially advice on their personal problems. 咨询师 2. N-COUNT A counsellor is a young person who supervises children at a summer camp. (儿童夏令营的) 辅导员
1. N-VAR If you have a grievance about something that has happened or been done, you believe that it was unfair. 委屈; 不满
1. V-T If someone smuggles things or people into a place or out of it, they take them there illegally or secretly. 走私; 偷运 2. smuggling N-UNCOUNT 走私
1. N-COUNT If you describe a country, company, or product as laggard, you mean that it is not performing as well as its competitors. 落后者; 技不如人者 2. ADJ Laggard is also an adjective. 落后的
1. N-COUNT You can refer to a person's children or to an animal's young as their offspring. 子女; 幼崽 [正式]
1. N-UNCOUNT Strife is strong disagreement or fighting. 冲突 [正式]

1. N-SING Fuss is anxious or excited behaviour which serves no useful purpose. 无谓的忙乎 [also no det] 2. V-I If you fuss, you worry or behave in a nervous, anxious way about unimportant matters or rush around doing unnecessary things. 瞎紧张; 瞎操心; 瞎忙乎 3. V-I If you fuss over someone, you pay them a lot of attention and do things to make them happy or comfortable. 宠爱 4. PHRASE If you make a fuss or kick up a fuss about something, you become angry or excited about it and complain. 大发牢骚 [非正式]
1. ADJ If you describe something as crucial, you mean it is extremely important. 至关重要的 2. crucially ADV 至关重要地
1. N (in Greek legend) a complicated knot, tied by King Gordius of Phrygia, that Alexander the Great cut with a sword (希腊传说中)戈耳迪之结; 佛里吉亚的戈耳狄俄斯国王系得复杂的结，后被伟大的亚历山大以剑割开

1. V-T If you exercise something such as your authority, your rights, or a good quality, you use it or put it into effect. 行使; 运用 [正式] 2. N-SING Exercise is also a noun. 行使; 运用 3. V-I When you exercise, you move your body energetically in order to get in shape and to remain healthy. 锻炼 4. N-UNCOUNT Exercise is also a noun. 锻炼 5. V-T If a movement or activity exercises a part of your body, it keeps it strong, healthy, or in good condition. 锻炼 (身体某一部位) 6. N-COUNT Exercises are a series of movements or actions that you do in order to get in shape, remain healthy, or practise for a particular physical activity. 锻炼 7. N-COUNT Exercises are military activities and operations that are not part of a real war, but that allow the armed forces to practise for a real war. (军事) 演习 [usu pl, also 'on' N] 8. N-COUNT An exercise is a short activity or piece of work that you do, in school for example, which is designed to help you learn a particular skill. 练习
1. N a physical object or quantity, such as a pointer on a dial or a voltage, used to measure or represent another quantity 模拟物; 类比量 2. N (as modifier) 作修饰词

1. V-T/V-I If you lobby someone such as a member of a government or council, you try to persuade them that a particular law should be changed or that a particular thing should be done. 游说 2. N-COUNT A lobby is a group of people who represent a particular organization or campaign, and try to persuade a government or council to help or support them. 游说团体 3. N-COUNT In a hotel or other large building, the lobby is the area near the entrance that usually has corridors and staircases leading off it. 大厅
1. ADJ If you describe an event or situation as calamitous, you mean it is very unfortunate or serious. 灾难的 [正式]
n. 信号传输法；发信号

1. V-T If you proceed to do something, you do it, often after doing something else first. (做完某事之后) 接着 (做另一事) 2. V-I If you proceed with a course of action, you continue with it. 继续进行 (某行动) [正式] 3. V-I If an activity, process, or event proceeds, it goes on and does not stop. (活动、过程、事件等) 继续 4. N-PLURAL The proceeds of an event or activity are the money that has been obtained from it. (某事件或活动带来的) 收入
稀少；彼此相距很远；不常发生
n. 参与；分享；参股
1. N-COUNT A thimble is a small metal or plastic object which you use to protect your finger when you are sewing. 顶针; 针箍
1. N-VAR The subtext is the implied message or subject of something that is said or written. 潜在的意思 [usu with supp]

1. N-PROPER Mecca is a city in Saudi Arabia, which is the holiest city in Islam because the Prophet Mohammed was born there. All Muslims face toward Mecca when they pray. 麦加; 沙特城市，伊斯兰教圣城，先知穆罕默德的诞生地，所有穆斯林祈祷朝拜的方向 2. N-COUNT If you describe a place as a mecca or Mecca for a particular thing or activity, you mean that many people who are interested in it go there. 众人向往的地方; 胜地 [usu sing, with supp]
1. ADJ not reported or recorded 未报道的; 未记录的
1. N-COUNT An enzyme is a chemical substance found in living creatures that produces changes in other substances without being changed itself. 酶 [技术]
在增加；在上涨

1. V-I When people or animals creep somewhere, they move quietly and slowly. 悄悄地缓慢行进 2. V-I If something creeps somewhere, it moves very slowly. 渐渐蔓延 3. V-I If something creeps in or creeps back, it begins to occur or becomes part of something without people realizing or without them wanting it. 悄悄出现 4. V-I If a rate or number creeps up to a higher level, it gradually reaches that level. 攀升 5. to make someone's flesh creep →see flesh

1. ADJ If you describe someone as tolerant, you approve of the fact that they allow other people to say and do as they like and that they are willing to accept different races, religions, and lifestyles. 宽容的 [表赞许] 2. ADJ If a plant, animal, or machine is tolerant of particular conditions or types of treatment, it is able to bear them without being damaged or hurt. 能耐…的 [v-link ADJ 'of' n]
n. [农] 农民（farmer的复数）
仍然；不相上下；依旧

1. V-I If cloth or clothing shrinks, it becomes smaller in size, usually as a result of being washed. 缩水 2. V-T/V-I If something shrinks or something else shrinks it, it becomes smaller. 使缩小; 缩小 3. V-I If you shrink away from someone or something, you move away from them because you are frightened, shocked, or disgusted by them. (因害怕、震惊或厌恶) 避开 4. V-I If you do not shrink from a task or duty, you do it even though it is unpleasant or dangerous. 逃避 (不愉快或危险的事) [usu with neg] 5. N-COUNT A shrink is a psychiatrist. 精神病医生 [非正式] 6. no shrinking violet →see violet
1. N-UNCOUNT Fury is violent or very strong anger. 狂怒
1. ADJ If you describe someone as fractious, you disapprove of them because they become upset or angry very quickly about small unimportant things. 易怒的 [表不满]

1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES A tower is a tall, narrow building, that either stands alone or forms part of another building such as a church or castle. 塔 2. V-I Someone or something that towers over surrounding people or things is a lot taller than they are. 高出许多 3. N-COUNT A tower is a tall structure that is used for sending radio or television signals. (无线电或电视信号的) 发射塔 4. N-COUNT A tower is a tall box that contains the main parts of a computer, such as the hard disk and the drives. (计算机) 机箱 [计算机]

1. ADJ If something is vacant, it is not being used by anyone. 空着的 2. ADJ If a job or position is vacant, no one is doing it or in it at present, and people can apply for it. 空缺的 3. ADJ A vacant look or expression is one that suggests that someone does not understand something or that they are not thinking about anything in particular. 茫然的 4. vacantly ADV 茫然地 [ADV after v]
1. N-SING The demise of something or someone is their end or death. 终止; 死亡 [正式]

1. ADJ If you are realistic about a situation, you recognize and accept its true nature and try to deal with it in a practical way. 现实的; 务实的 2. realistically ADV 现实地; 务实地 3. ADJ Something such as a goal or target that is realistic is one that you can sensibly expect to achieve. 现实可行的 4. ADJ You say that a painting, story, or movie is realistic when the people and things in it are like people and things in real life. 逼真的 5. realistically ADV 逼真地

1. V-T/V-I If you attend a meeting or other event, you are present at it. 参加; 出席 2. V-T If you attend an institution such as a school, college, or church, you go there regularly. 上 (学); 去 (教堂) 3. V-I If you attend to something, you deal with it. If you attend to someone who is hurt or injured, you care for them. 处理; 照料

1. N-VAR Insurance is an arrangement in which you pay money to a company, and they pay you if something unpleasant happens to you, for example, if your property is stolen or damaged, or if you get a serious illness. 保险 2. N-VAR If you do something as insurance against something unpleasant happening, you do it to protect yourself in case the unpleasant thing happens. 预防措施

1. N-VAR Prosecution is the action of charging someone with a crime and putting them on trial. 起诉 2. N-SING The lawyers who try to prove that a person on trial is guilty are called the prosecution. 原告律师
1. N-COUNT A philanthropist is someone who freely gives money and help to people who need it. 慈善家
1. N-UNCOUNT Extortion is the crime of obtaining something from someone, especially money, by using force or threats. 勒索

1. N-COUNT A register is an official list or record of people or things. 登记簿 2. V-T/V-I If you register to do something, you put your name on an official list, in order to be able to do that thing or to receive a service. 登记; 注册 3. V-T If you register something, such as the name of a person who has just died or information about something you own, you have these facts recorded on an official list. 登记 4. V-T/V-I When something registers on a scale or measuring instrument, it shows on the scale or instrument. (在仪表上) 显示 5. V-T If you register your feelings or opinions about something, you do something that makes them clear to other people. 表示 (感情或看法) 6. V-I If a feeling registers on someone's face, their expression shows clearly that they have that feeling. (面部表情) 流露 7. V-T/V-I If a piece of information does not register or if you do not register it, you do not really pay attention to it, and so you do not remember it or react to it. 留意; 留下印象 8. → see also cash register
n. 印孚瑟斯（印度历史上第一家在美国上市的公司）

1. N-COUNT The price of something is the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy it. 价格 2. N-SING The price that you pay for something that you want is an unpleasant thing that you have to do or suffer in order to get it. 代价 3. V-T If something is priced at a particular amount, the price is set at that amount. 将…定价 4. pricing N-UNCOUNT 定价 5. → see also retail price index, selling price 6. PHRASE If you want something at any price, you are determined to get it, even if unpleasant things happen as a result. 不惜任何代价 7. PHRASE If you can buy something that you want at a price, it is for sale, but it is extremely expensive. 以极高的价格 8. PHRASE If you get something that you want at a price, you get it but something unpleasant happens as a result. 以一定代价 9. to price yourself out of the market →see market

1. ADJ If you remain anonymous when you do something, you do not let people know that you were the person who did it. 匿名的 2. anonymity N-UNCOUNT 匿名 3. ADJ Something that is anonymous does not reveal who you are. 不记名的 4. anonymity N-UNCOUNT 不记名
1. ADJ A person who is stateless is not a citizen of any country and therefore has no nationality. 无国籍的

1. ADJ Something that is comparable to something else is roughly similar, for example in amount or importance. (数量、重要性等) 相当的 2. ADJ If two or more things are comparable, they are of the same kind or are in the same situation, and so they can reasonably be compared. 可比的

1. V-T When you chuck something somewhere, you throw it there in a casual or careless way. 随意丢弃 [非正式] 2. V-T If you chuck your job or some other activity, you stop doing it. 放弃; 停止 (工作或其他活动) [非正式] 3. PHRASE If someone chucks it all, they stop doing their job, and usually move somewhere else. 放弃工作 (并前往他处) 4. N-COUNT A chuck is a device for holding a tool in a machine such as a drill. (钻机等机器中固定工具的) 卡盘 5. N-UNCOUNT Chuck is a cut of beef. 牛颈部至肩部的肉 6. V → a less common word for cluck

1. ADJ If a situation or action is fraught with problems or risks, it is filled with them. 充满 (问题或风险) 的 [v-link ADJ 'with' n] 2. ADJ If you say that a situation or action is fraught, you mean that it is worrisome or difficult. 令人担忧的
1. N-COUNT A deity is a god or goddess. 神; 女神 [正式]
1. N-COUNT The peso is the unit of money that is used in Argentina, Colombia, Cuba, the Dominican Republic, Mexico, the Philippines, and Uruguay. 比索
1. N-COUNT A sceptic is a person who has doubts about things that other people believe. 怀疑论者
1. N-COUNT Shrimps are small shellfish with long tails and many legs. 小虾

1. N-COUNT A skunk is a small black and white animal which releases an unpleasant smelling liquid if it is frightened or attacked. Skunks live in North America. 臭鼬 2. N-UNCOUNT Skunk is a type of powerful, strong-smelling marijuana. 超劲大麻 [非正式]
1. N-COUNT A visitor is someone who is visiting a person or place. 访问者
n. 巴基斯坦人（Pakistani的复数）
1. N-SING The tempo of an event is the speed at which it happens. (事件发展的) 速度 2. N-VAR The tempo of a piece of music is the speed at which it is played. (音乐的) 节奏

1. V-T If you construct something such as a building, road, or machine, you build it or make it. 建造 2. V-T If you construct something such as an idea, a piece of writing, or a system, you create it by putting different parts together. 构建
adv. 充分地；足够地
1. N-COUNT The rush hour is one of the periods of the day when most people are travelling to or from work. (上下班交通) 高峰期 [also 'at/during' N]

1. PHRASAL VERB If someone or something backs up a statement, they supply evidence to suggest that it is true. 证实 2. PHRASAL VERB If you back up a computer file, you make a copy of it that you can use if the original file is damaged or lost. 备份 [计算机] 3. PHRASAL VERB If an idea or intention is backed up by action, action is taken to support or confirm it. (以行动) 支持 4. PHRASAL VERB If you back someone up, you show your support for them. 支持 (某人) 5. PHRASAL VERB If you back someone up, you help them by confirming that what they are saying is true. 证实…的话 6. PHRASAL VERB If you back up, the car or other vehicle that you are driving moves back a short distance. 倒车 7. PHRASAL VERB If you back up, you move backward a short distance. 后退 (一小段距离) 8. PHRASAL VERB When a car backs up or when you back it up, the car is driven backward. (车) 向后倒; 倒 (车) [美国英语] 9. → see also backup
1. N-COUNT An environmentalist is a person who is concerned with protecting and preserving the natural environment, for example, by preventing pollution. 环保主义者
1. ADJ If you say that something is guaranteed to happen, you mean that you are certain that it will happen. 肯定的; 保证的 [v-link ADJ] → see also guarantee
1. ADJ A person or organization that is insolvent does not have enough money to pay their debts. 无清偿能力的; 破产的 [商业] [正式]

1. ADJ To be prone to something, usually something bad, means to have a tendency to be affected by it or to do it. 易于 (受某事物影响或做某事) 的 [v-link ADJ] 2. COMB in ADJ -prone combines with nouns to make adjectives that describe people who are frequently affected by something bad. 易受…影响的 (与名词结合构成形容词) 3. ADJ If you are lying prone, you are lying on your front. 面朝下的 [正式] [ADJ after v, ADJ n]
1. V-T If you squander money, resources, or opportunities, you waste them. 浪费 (金钱、资源或机会)

1. N-SING Themoon is the object that you can often see in the sky at night. It goes around the earth once every four weeks, and as it does so its appearance changes from a circle to part of a circle. 月亮 [usu 'the' N, also 'full/new' N] 2. N-COUNT A moon is an object similar to a small planet that travels around a planet. 卫星
受到严厉批评；遭到攻击
1. Mice is the plural of . (mouse)的复数形式

1. N-COUNT Perks are special benefits that are given to people who have a particular job or belong to a particular group. 特殊待遇 2. ADJ pert; brisk; lively 活跃的; 活泼的; 轻快的 3. V →see perk up 4. V (of coffee) to percolate (咖啡)过滤 5. V to percolate (coffee) 过滤(咖啡)
1. ADJ If you think that a type of behaviour or an idea is very bad and morally wrong, you can say that it is reprehensible. 应受斥责的; 应该谴责的 [正式] [usu v-link ADJ]
1. N-COUNT If people or things are divided into categories, they are divided into groups in such a way that the members of each group are similar to each other in some way. 种类; 范畴

1. N-UNCOUNT Syntax is the ways that words can be put together, or are put together, in order to make sentences. 句法规则; 句法 [技术] 2. N-UNCOUNT Syntax is the set of rules that describes how a computer language can be used to make programs. (计算机)语法 [计算机]

1. ADJ Ethnic means connected with or relating to different racial or cultural groups of people. 种族的 2. ethnically ADV 种族上地 3. ADJ You can use ethnic to describe people who belong to a particular racial or cultural group but who, usually, do not live in the country where most members of that group live. 少数民族的 [ADJ n] 4. ethnically ADV 少数民族地 [ADV adj] 5. ADJ Ethnic clothing, music, or food is characteristic of the traditions of a particular ethnic group, and different from what is usually found in modern Western culture. 具有民族特色的

1. ADJ If something is deadly, it is likely or able to cause someone's death, or has already caused someone's death. 致命的; 致死的 2. ADJ If you describe a person or their behaviour as deadly, you mean that they will do or say anything to get what they want, without caring about other people. 不择手段的; 肆无忌惮的 [表不满] 3. ADJ A deadly situation has unpleasant or dangerous consequences. 极有害的 4. ADV You can use deadly to emphasize that something has a particular quality, especially an unpleasant or undesirable quality. 极度地 [ADV adj] [强调]
1. ADJ Something that is lopsided is uneven because one side is lower or heavier than the other. 两边高低不平的; 不均衡的

1. N-COUNT An envoy is someone who is sent as a representative from one government or political group to another. 使者; 代表 2. N-COUNT An envoy is a diplomat in an embassy who is immediately below the ambassador in rank. 公使 3. N a brief dedicatory or explanatory stanza concluding certain forms of poetry, notably ballades (尤指歌谣的)结尾诗节

1. ADJ If you describe someone as passive, you mean that they do not take action but instead let things happen to them. 被动的 [表不满] 2. passively ADV 被动地 3. ADJ A passive activity involves watching, looking at, or listening to things rather than doing things. 消极的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ Passive resistance involves showing opposition to the people in power in your country by not cooperating with them and protesting in nonviolent ways. 非暴力的 [ADJ n] 5. N-SING In grammar, the passive or the passive voice is formed using "be" and the past participle of a verb. The subject of a passive clause does not perform the action expressed by the verb but is affected by it. For example, in "He's been murdered," the verb is in the passive. Compare . 被动语态
1. N-VAR Pregnancy is the condition of being pregnant or the period of time during which a female is pregnant. 怀孕; 怀孕期
n. 伊斯坦布尔（土耳其城市）
1. ADJ Something that is staggering is very surprising. 令人震惊的

1. ADJ A murky place or time of day is dark and rather unpleasant because there is not enough light. 阴暗的 2. ADJ Murky water or fog is so dark and dirty that you cannot see through it. 混浊的 3. ADJ If you describe something as murky, you mean that the details of it are not clear or that it is difficult to understand. 含糊不清的; 晦涩难懂的

1. Drove is the past tense of . (drive)的过去式 2. N a herd of livestock being driven together (被驱赶着一起前进的)畜群 3. V to drive (a group of livestock), usually for a considerable distance 驱赶(畜群) 4. V to be employed as a drover 做赶畜群工作的人
1. N-COUNT If you are a proponent of a particular idea or course of action, you actively support it. (某观念或行为的) 支持者 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A colony is a country which is controlled by a more powerful country. 殖民地 2. N-COUNT You can refer to a place where a particular group of people lives as a particular kind of colony. (某一类人的) 聚居区 3. N-COUNT A colony of birds, insects, or animals is a group of them that live together. (生物) 居住在一起的群体
1. N-UNCOUNT When there is parallelism between two things, there are similarities between them. 相似性 [正式]

1. V-T/V-I If you tilt an object or if it tilts, it moves into a sloping position with one end or side higher than the other. 使倾斜; 倾斜 2. V-T If you tilt part of your body, usually your head, you move it slightly upward or to one side. 使 (常指头部) 侧倾; 使微仰 3. N-COUNT Tilt is also a noun. 倾斜 4. N-COUNT The tilt of something is the fact that it tilts or slopes, or the angle at which it tilts or slopes. 倾斜; 倾斜度 5. N an awning or canopy, usually of canvas, for a boat, booth, etc 罩棚 6. V to cover or provide with a tilt 罩上 7. V-I If a person or thing tilts toward a particular opinion or if something tilts them toward it, they change slightly so that they become more in agreement with that opinion or position. 倾向

1. N-COUNT A surge is a sudden large increase in something that has previously been steady, or has only increased or developed slowly. 剧增 2. V-I If something surges, it increases suddenly and greatly, after being steady or developing only slowly. 剧增 3. V-I If a crowd of people surge forward, they suddenly move forward together. 涌动 4. N-COUNT A surge is a sudden powerful movement of a physical force such as wind or water. (风、水等) 突然的涌动 5. V-I If a physical force such as water or electricity surges through something, it moves through it suddenly and powerfully. (水、电流等) 涌
1. N-COUNT Your skull is the bony part of your head which encloses your brain. 颅骨; 头颅
1. N-COUNT A city dweller or slum dweller, for example, is a person who lives in the kind of place or house indicated. 居住者

1. ADJ Something that is restricted is quite small or limited. 受限制的 2. ADJ If something is restricted to a particular group, only members of that group have it. If it is restricted to a particular place, it exists only in that place. 仅限的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n] 3. ADJ A restricted area is one that only people with special permission can enter. 不对外开放的

1. ADJ You use gross to describe something unacceptable or unpleasant to a very great amount, degree, or intensity. 严重的 [ADJ n] 2. grossly ADV 严重地 [ADV -ed/adj] 3. ADJ If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable. 粗俗的 [表不满] 4. ADJ If you describe something as gross, you think it is very unpleasant. 不雅的 [非正式] 5. ADJ If you describe someone as gross, you mean that they are extremely fat and unattractive. 肥胖臃肿的 [v-link ADJ] [表不满] 6. ADJ Gross means the total amount of something, especially money, before any has been taken away. (尤指钱) 总的; 毛的 [ADJ n] 7. ADV Gross is also an adverb. 总地 [ADV after v] 8. ADJ Gross means the total amount of something, after all the relevant amounts have been added together. 总共的 [ADJ n] 9. V-T If a person or a business grosses a particular amount of money, they earn that amount of money before tax has been taken away. 税前收入赚得 [商业] 10. NUM A gross is a group of 144 things. 一罗 (合144个)

1. ADJ If you say that you are indebted to someone for something, you mean that you are very grateful to them for something. 感激的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n] 2. ADJ Indebted countries, organizations, or people are ones that owe money to other countries, organizations, or people. 负债的
1. ADJ Kenyan means belonging or relating to Kenya, or to its people or culture. 肯尼亚的; 肯尼亚人的; 肯尼亚文化的 2. N-COUNT A Kenyan is a Kenyan citizen, or a person of Kenyan origin. 肯尼亚人; 肯尼亚后裔
1. ADJ If you describe something as nebulous, you mean that it is vague and not clearly defined or not easy to describe. 朦胧的; 模糊的

1. N-COUNT A parade is a procession of people or vehicles moving through a public place in order to celebrate an important day or event. 游行 2. V-I When people parade somewhere, they walk together in a formal group or a line, usually with other people watching them. 游行 3. N-VAR Parade is a formal occasion when soldiers stand in lines to be seen by an officer or important person, or march in a group. 阅兵式 [oft 'on' N] 4. V-T If prisoners are paraded through the streets of a town or on television, they are shown to the public, usually in order to make the people who are holding them seem more powerful or important. 把…游街; 把…示众 [usu passive] 5. V-T If you say that someone parades a person, you mean that they show that person to others only in order to gain some advantage for themselves. (为使自己获益而) 展示 [usu passive] 6. V-T If people parade something, they show it in public so that it can be admired. (为炫耀而) 展示 7. V-T/V-I If you say that something parades as or is paraded as a good or important thing, you mean t

1. N-COUNT A profession is a type of job that requires advanced education or training. 职业 [also 'by' N] 2. N-COUNT-COLL You can use profession to refer to all the people who have the same profession. 同业的全体人员

1. ADV If someone or something is afloat, they remain partly above the surface of water and do not sink. 漂浮着地 2. ADV If a person, business, or country stays afloat or is kept afloat, they have just enough money to pay their debts and continue operating. (人、企业、国家等) 仅够还债维持下去地 [商业]

1. N-UNCOUNT Dismay is a strong feeling of fear, worry, or sadness that is caused by something unpleasant and unexpected. 恐慌; 悲伤 [正式] 2. V-T If you are dismayed by something, it makes you feel afraid, worried, or sad. 使恐慌; 使悲伤 [正式] 3. dismayed ADJ 恐慌的; 悲伤的
1. V-T/V-I If you sip a drink or sip at it, you drink by taking just a small amount at a time. 小口地喝 2. N-COUNT A sip is a small amount of drink that you take into your mouth. 一小口的量

1. N-UNCOUNT The signing of a document is the act of writing your name to indicate that you agree with what it says or to say that you have been present to witness other people writing their signature. 签署 2. N-COUNT A signing is someone who has recently signed a contract agreeing to play for a sports team or work for a record company. (运动队或唱片公司的) 签约者 [usu with supp] 3. N-UNCOUNT The signing of a player by a sports team or a group by a record company is the act of drawing up a legal document setting out the length and terms of the association between them. (与运动队或唱片公司) 签约 4. N-UNCOUNT Signing is the use of sign language to communicate with someone who is deaf. 手势语的使用
1. N-UNCOUNT Walking is the activity of taking walks for exercise or pleasure, especially in the country. 郊游; 远足

1. N-COUNT A reflection is an image that you can see in a mirror or in glass or water. 影像; 映像 2. N-UNCOUNT Reflection is the process by which light and heat are sent back from a surface and do not pass through it. 反射 3. N-COUNT If you say that something is a reflection of a particular person's attitude or of a situation, you mean that it is caused by that attitude or situation and therefore reveals something about it. 反映 4. N-SING If something is a reflection or a sad reflection on a person or thing, it gives a bad impression of them. 坏的影响 5. N-UNCOUNT Reflection is careful thought about a particular subject. Your reflections are your thoughts about a particular subject. 认真思考 [also N in pl] 6. PHRASE If someone admits or accepts something on reflection, they admit or accept it after having thought carefully about it. 经过认真思考
1. V-I If someone or something complies with an order or set of rules, they do what is required or expected. 遵从
买进销售权

1. N-COUNT A ratio is a relationship between two things when it is expressed in numbers or amounts. For example, if there are ten boys and thirty girls in a room, the ratio of boys to girls is 1:3, or one to three. 比率

1. N-UNCOUNT Liberalism is a belief in gradual social progress by changing laws, rather than by revolution. 改良主义 2. N-UNCOUNT Liberalism is the belief that people should have a lot of political and individual freedom. (主张个体拥有广泛的政治和个人自由的)自由主义
1. N-VAR A drought is a long period of time during which no rain falls. 干旱
1. N-COUNT A pollster is a person or organization that asks large numbers of people questions to find out their opinions on particular subjects. 民意调查者; 民意测验机构
1. N-COUNT/SOUND A tweet is a short, high-pitched sound made by a small bird. (小鸟的)吱喳声

1. N-COUNT Reverberations are serious effects that follow a sudden, dramatic event. 反响; 轰动 [usu pl] 2. N-VAR A reverberation is the shaking and echoing effect that you hear after a loud sound has been made. 回响; 回声
裂开；突进；横撞直闯；猛烈爆炸

1. V-I If you refrain from doing something, you deliberately do not do it. 忍住; 克制 2. N-COUNT A refrain is a short, simple part of a song, which is repeated many times. 副歌 3. N-COUNT A refrain is a comment or saying that people often repeat. 一再重复的话
1. N-VAR A justification for something is an acceptable reason or explanation for it. 正当的理由
n. 霍华德（男子名）
1. ADJ Someone who is illiterate does not know how to read or write. 文盲的 2. N-COUNT An illiterate is someone who is illiterate. 文盲
确信，相信

1. ADV You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous point. 反正 (用以表示某陈述解释或支撑前一观点) [ADV with cl] 2. ADV You use anyway or anyhow to suggest that a statement is true or relevant in spite of other things that have been said. 不管怎样 (用以表示某陈述是事实) [ADV with cl] 3. ADV You use anyway or anyhow to correct or modify a statement, for example, to limit it to what you definitely know to be true. 用以纠正或限定某陈述 [cl/group ADV] 4. ADV You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you are asking what the real situation is or what the real reason for something is. 究竟 [cl ADV] 5. ADV You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you are leaving out some details in a story and are passing on to the next main point or event. 如此这般之后 (用以表示略掉一些细节进入下一要点或事件) [ADV with cl] 6. ADV You use anyway or anyhow to change the topic or return to a previous topic. 用以转换话题或回到先前的话题 [ADV cl] 7. ADV You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you want to end the conversation. 好了 (用以表示想结束对话) [ADV cl]
1. ADJ A sponsored event is an event in which people try to do something such as walk or run a particular distance in order to raise money for charity. (活动或比赛)为慈善筹款而发起的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T When an egg from the ovary of a woman or female animal is fertilized, a sperm from the male joins with the egg, causing a baby or young animal to begin forming. A female plant is fertilized when its reproductive parts come into contact with pollen from the male plant. 使受精; 使授粉 2. fertilization N-UNCOUNT 受精; 授粉 3. V-T To fertilize land means to improve its quality in order to make plants grow well on it, by spreading solid animal waste or a chemical mixture on it. 使肥沃
1. N-SING The gist of a speech, conversation, or piece of writing is its general meaning. 要点
1. V-I Something that consists of particular things or people is formed from them. (以…) 为组成部分 2. V-I Something that consists in something else has that thing as its main or only part. (以…) 为主要组成部分

1. N-VAR A profit is an amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make, get, or do it. 利润 2. V-I If you profit from something, you earn a profit from it. (从…中) 获利 3. V-T/V-I If you profit from something, or it profits you, you gain some advantage or benefit from it. 使 (某人) 获利; 获利 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A gadget is a small machine or device which does something useful. You sometimes refer to something as a gadget when you are suggesting that it is complicated and unnecessary. 小器械 (有时暗指复杂、不必要的东西)
1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES A corporation is a large business or company with special rights and powers. 大公司; 企业 [商业]

1. V-T/V-I When something such as the economy, a business, a trend, or a feeling is revived or when it revives, it becomes active, popular, or successful again. 恢复; 复兴 2. V-T When someone revives a play, opera, or ballet, they present a new production of it. 重新上演 (作品的新版) 3. V-T/V-I If you revive someone who has fainted or if they revive, they become conscious again. 使苏醒; 苏醒

1. N-VAR An emotion is a feeling such as happiness, love, fear, anger, or hatred, which can be caused by the situation that you are in or the people you are with. 感情 2. N-UNCOUNT Emotion is the part of a person's character that consists of their feelings, as opposed to their thoughts. (与思想相对的) 情感
轮班工作；倒班，换岗
n. 罗马尼亚（欧洲巴尔干半岛东北部国家）

1. V-I If you shuffle somewhere, you walk there without lifting your feet properly off the ground. 拖着脚走 2. N-SING Shuffle is also a noun. 拖着脚走 3. V-T/V-I If you shuffle around, you move your feet about while standing or you move your bottom about while sitting, often because you feel uncomfortable or embarrassed. (因不舒服或尴尬) 站着的脚来回挪动; 坐立不安 4. V-T If you shuffle playing cards, you mix them up before you begin a game. 洗 (牌)

1. N-UNCOUNT Honour means doing what you believe to be right and being confident that you have done what is right. 道义; 气节 2. N-COUNT An honour is a special award that is given to someone, usually because they have done something good or because they are greatly respected. 荣誉 3. V-T If someone is honoured, they are given public praise or an award for something they have done. 给…以荣誉 [usu passive] 4. N-SING If you describe doing or experiencing something as an honour, you mean you think it is something special and desirable. 荣幸 5. V-T PASSIVE If you say that you would be honoured to do something, you are saying very politely and formally that you would be pleased to do it. If you say that you are honoured by something, you are saying that you are grateful for it and pleased about it. 给予荣幸 [礼貌] 6. V-T To honour someone means to treat them or regard them with special attention and respect. 尊重 7. V-T If you honour an arrangement or promise, you do what you said you would do. 执行 (安排); 履行 (诺言) 8. N-VOC Judge
1. N-COUNT A peacock is a large bird. The male has a very large tail covered with blue and green spots, which it can spread out like a fan. 孔雀

1. ADJ If you describe someone or something as feeble, you mean that they are weak. 虚弱的 2. feebly ADV 虚弱地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If you describe something that someone says as feeble, you mean that it is not very good or convincing. 不可信的 4. feebly ADV 薄弱地 [ADV with v]

1. V-T If an area is populated by certain people or animals, those people or animals live there, often in large numbers. 聚居; 栖息 2. populated ADJ 聚居了的; 栖息了的 [adv ADJ] 3. V-T To populate an area means to cause people to live there. 使聚居

1. N-UNCOUNT Foam consists of a mass of small bubbles that are formed when air and a liquid are mixed together. 泡沫 (橡胶); 海绵 2. N-MASS Foam is used to refer to various kinds of manufactured products which have a soft, light texture like a thick liquid. 泡沫 3. N-MASS Foam or foam rubber is soft rubber full of small holes which is used, for example, to make mattresses and cushions. 泡沫 (橡胶); 海绵
智能手机（smartphone的复数）

1. N-COUNT A watchdog is a person or committee whose job is to make sure that companies do not act illegally or irresponsibly. 监察员; 监察委员会 2. N-COUNT A watchdog is a fierce dog that has been specially trained to protect a particular place. 看门狗 [美国英语]
1. N-COUNT Someone's descendants are the people in later generations who are related to them. 后代 2. N-COUNT Something modern which developed from an older thing can be called a descendant of it. 衍生物

1. DET You use last in expressions such as last Friday, last night, and last year to refer, for example, to the most recent Friday, night, or year. 上一个的 2. ADJ The last event, person, thing, or period of time is the most recent one. 最近的 [det ADJ] 3. PRON Last is also a pronoun. 最近发生的事情 4. ADV If something last happened on a particular occasion, that is the most recent occasion on which it happened. 最近一次 [ADV with v] 5. ORD The last thing, person, event, or period of time is the one that happens or comes after all the others of the same kind. 最后的 6. PRON Last is also a pronoun. 最后的人或事物 7. ADV If you do something last, you do it after everyone else does, or after you do everything else. 最后地 [ADV after v] 8. PRON If you are the last to do or know something, everyone else does or knows it before you. 最后的人 [PRON to-inf] 9. ADJ Last is used to refer to the only thing, person, or part of something that remains. 仅剩的 [det ADJ] 10. N-SING Last is also a noun. 剩下的东西 (或人) 11. ADJ You can use last to indicate
n. 招聘人员，征兵人员

1. V-I If you subscribe to an opinion or belief, you are one of a number of people who have this opinion or belief. 持有 (意见或信仰) 2. V-I If you subscribe to a magazine or a newspaper, you pay to receive copies of it regularly. 订阅 3. V-I If you subscribe to an online newsgroup or service, you send a message saying that you wish to receive it or belong to it. 申请加入 (在线新闻组); 申请 (在线服务) [计算机] 4. V-I If you subscribe for shares in a company, you apply to buy shares in that company. 申购 (股份) [商业]

1. N any invertebrate of the phylum Cnidaria (formerly Coelenterata), having a saclike body with a single opening (mouth), which occurs in polyp and medusa forms. Coelenterates include the hydra, jellyfishes, sea anemones, and corals 腔肠动物门动物 2. ADJ (loosely) any invertebrate of the phyla Cnidaria or Ctenophora 腔肠动物的

1. N-COUNT A particular sector of a country's economy is the part connected with that specified type of industry. (经济的) 部门 2. → see also public sector, private sector 3. N-COUNT A sector of a large group is a smaller group which is part of it. 部分 4. N-COUNT A sector is an area of a city or country which is controlled by a military force. 军事管制区

1. V-T If equipment or services are upgraded, they are improved or made more efficient. 使升级 [usu passive] 2. N-COUNT Upgrade is also a noun. 升级 3. V-T If someone is upgraded, their job or status is changed so that they become more important or receive more money. 提升 [usu passive] 4. V-T/V-I If you upgrade or are upgraded, you change something such as your plane ticket or your hotel room to one that is more expensive. 使升舱; 使 (旅馆房间等) 升级; 升舱; 升级
n. 违反；妨碍，侵害；违背；强奸
1. ADJ Classified information or documents are officially secret. 机密的
1. ADJ having a large or coarse grain 纹理粗大的

1. V-T When you express an idea or feeling, or express yourself, you show what you think or feel. 表达 2. V-T If an idea or feeling expresses itself in some way, it can be clearly seen in someone's actions or in its effects on a situation. (想法、情感) 流露; 呈现 3. ADJ An express command or order is one that is clearly and deliberately stated. 明确陈述的 (命令、指令) [正式] [ADJ n] 4. expressly ADV 明确陈述地 [ADV before v] 5. ADJ If you refer to an express intention or purpose, you are emphasizing that it is a deliberate and specific one that you have before you do something. 特定的 (意图、目的) [ADJ n] [强调] 6. expressly ADV 特定地 7. ADJ Express is used to describe special services provided by companies or organizations such as the U.S. Postal Service, in which things are sent or done faster than usual for a higher price. 快递的 [ADJ n] 8. ADV Express is also an adverb. 快递地 9. N-COUNT An express or an express train is a fast train that stops at very few stations. 快速列车
1. N-VAR Your intonation is the way that your voice rises and falls as you speak. 语调; 声调
n. 尼古拉斯（男子名）

1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES A harbour is an area of the sea at the coast which is partly enclosed by land or strong walls, so that boats can be left there safely. 港口 2. V-T If you harbour an emotion, thought, or secret, you have it in your mind over a long period of time. 长期怀有 3. V-T If a person or country harbours someone who is wanted by the police, they let them stay in their house or country and offer them protection. 窝藏
adv. 顽固地；倔强地

1. N-SING A respite is a short period of rest from something unpleasant. (某种不快中的) 小间歇 [正式] [also no det, oft N 'from' n] 2. N-SING A respite is a short delay before a very unpleasant or difficult situation which may or may not take place. 暂缓 [正式] [also no det]
1. N-VAR The cuisine of a country or district is the style of cooking that is characteristic of that place. 烹调风格
1. N-COUNT A trade deficit is a situation in which a country imports goods worth more than the value of the goods that it exporvts. 贸易逆差 [商业] [usu sing]
1. N-UNCOUNT Complacency is being complacent about a situation. 自满 [表不满]

1. V-T If you cannot afford something, you do not have enough money to pay for it. 支付得起 2. V-T If you say that you cannot afford to do something or allow it to happen, you mean that you must not do it or must prevent it from happening because it would be harmful or embarrassing to you. 承担得起

1. ADJ Teenage children are aged between thirteen and nineteen years old. 十几岁 (指13至19岁) 的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Teenage is used to describe things such as movies, magazines, bands, or activities that are aimed at or are done by teenage children. 关于青少年的 [ADJ n]
1. V-I If you disapprove of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not like them or do not approve of them. 不赞同; 不喜欢
n. 菲莱（埃及岛屿）
1. V seal的过去分词 → the past participle of seal 2. ADJ (of a road) having a hard surface; made-up (路面)硬的 [AUSTRALIAN]

1. V-T If you bolster something such as someone's confidence or courage, you increase it. 增强 2. V-T If someone tries to bolster their position in a situation, they try to strengthen it. 巩固 3. N-COUNT A bolster is a firm pillow shaped like a long tube which is sometimes put across a bed instead of pillows, or under the ordinary pillows. 长枕
1. ADJ A wasted action is one that is unnecessary. 无用的 2. ADJ Someone who is wasted is very tired and weak, often because of an illness. (常指因病而)憔悴的

1. V-T If you stroke someone or something, you move your hand slowly and gently over them. 轻抚 2. N-COUNT If someone has a stroke, a blood vessel in their brain bursts or becomes blocked, which may kill them or make them unable to move one side of their body. 中风 3. N-COUNT The strokes of a pen or brush are the movements or marks that you make with it when you are writing or painting. 笔画 4. N-COUNT When you are swimming or rowing, your strokes are the repeated movements that you make with your arms or the oars. 划水; 划桨 5. N-COUNT A swimming stroke is a particular style or method of swimming. 游泳姿势 6. N-COUNT The strokes of a clock are the sounds that indicate each hour. 钟声 7. N-COUNT In sports such as tennis, baseball, golf, and cricket, a stroke is the action of hitting the ball. 击球 8. N-SING A stroke of luck or good fortune is something lucky that happens. 一次 (好运) 9. N-SING A stroke of genius or inspiration is a very good idea that someone suddenly has. (天才或灵感的) 一举 10. PHRASE If someone does not do a
1. N-COUNT In countries where the legal system distinguishes between very serious crimes and less serious ones, a felony is a very serious crime such as armed robbery. 重罪 [法律]

1. N-COUNT A window is a space in the wall of a building or in the side of a vehicle, which has glass in it so that light can come in and you can see out. 窗户 2. N-COUNT A window is a glass-covered opening above a counter, for example, in a bank, post office, train station, or museum, which the person serving you sits behind. (银行、邮局、火车站、博物馆等提供服务的) 窗口 3. N-COUNT On a computer screen, a window is one of the work areas that the screen can be divided into. (电脑屏幕上的) 视窗 [计算机] 4. PHRASE If you say that something such as a plan or a particular way of thinking or behaving has gone out of the window or is out the window, you mean that it has disappeared completely. (计划或某种思维或行为方式) 完全消失
1. N-SING A plethora of something is a large amount of it, especially an amount of it that is greater than you need, want, or can cope with. 过剩 [正式]
