1. N-COUNT A landslide is a victory in an election in which a person or political party gets far more votes or seats than their opponents. (选举中) 压倒性优势的胜利 2. N-COUNT A landslide is a large amount of earth and rocks falling down a cliff or the side of a mountain. 山崩

1. ADJ A dotted line is a line which is made of a row of dots. 由点构成的 2. PHRASE If you sign on the dotted line, you formally agree to something by signing an official document. 正式签约接受 3. ADJ If a place or object is dotted with things, it has many of those things scattered over its surface. 布满的 [v-link ADJ 'with' n] 4. ADJ If things are dotted around a place, they can be found in many different parts of that place. 分散的 [v-link ADJ prep] 5. → see also dot

1. V-T/V-I If you suck something, you hold it in your mouth and pull at it with the muscles in your cheeks and tongue, for example in order to get liquid out of it. 吮吸 2. V-T If something sucks a liquid, gas, or object in a particular direction, it draws it there with a powerful force. 吸 (物体); 抽 (液体、气体) 3. V-T PASSIVE If you are sucked into a bad situation, you are unable to prevent yourself from becoming involved in it. 使卷入
1. N-COUNT A strategist is someone who is skilled in planning the best way to gain an advantage or to achieve success, especially in war. 战略家
1. N-COUNT Your ancestry is the fact that you are descended from certain people. 家世

1. V-T/V-I When an object such as a ball bounces or when you bounce it, it moves upward from a surface or away from it immediately after hitting it. 使…弹起; 弹起 2. N-COUNT Bounce is also a noun. 弹 3. V-T/V-I If sound or light bounces off a surface or is bounced off it, it reaches the surface and is reflected back. 使…反射; 反射 4. V-T/V-I If something bounces or if something bounces it, it swings or moves up and down. 使…跳动; 跳动 5. V-I If you bounce on a soft surface, you jump up and down on it repeatedly. 蹦跳 6. V-I If someone bounces somewhere, they move there in an energetic way, because they are feeling happy. (因为开心) 蹦跳着走 7. V-T If you bounce your ideas off someone, you tell them to that person, in order to find out what they think about them. 征求别人的看法 8. V-T/V-I If a cheque bounces or if someone bounces it, the bank refuses to accept it and pay out the money, because the person who wrote it does not have enough money in their account. 拒付 (支票) 9. V-I If an e-mail or other electronic message bounces, it is r

1. ADJ Supreme is used in the title of a person or an official group to indicate that they are at the highest level in a particular organization or system. 最高的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You use supreme to emphasize that a quality or thing is very great. 极其的 [强调] 3. supremely ADV 极其地 [ADV adj/adv]
n. 罗姆尼羊；罗姆尼（男性名）
1. V-T If someone has garnered something useful or valuable, they have gained it or collected it. 获得; 收集 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A garment is a piece of clothing; used especially in contexts where you are talking about the manufacture or sale of clothes. 衣服 (尤用于衣服生产和销售的领域)
1. ADJ If you are disillusioned with something, you are disappointed, because it is not as good as you had expected or thought. 幻灭的

1. N-COUNT If you give an explanation of something that has happened, you give people reasons for it, especially in an attempt to justify it. 解释 (原因) [also 'of/in' N] 2. N-COUNT If you say there is an explanation for something, you mean that there is a reason for it. 原因 3. N-COUNT If you give an explanation of something, you give details about it or describe it so that it can be understood. 详细说明
1. V-I To innovate means to introduce changes and new ideas in the way something is done or made. 创新; 革新
n. 哥伦比亚人（Colombian的复数）

1. V-T If a person or thing is tainted by something bad or undesirable, their status or reputation is harmed because they are associated with it. 玷污 2. tainted ADJ 受玷污的 3. N-COUNT A taint is an undesirable quality which ruins the status or reputation of someone or something. 污点 4. V-T If an unpleasant substance taints food or medicine, the food or medicine is spoiled or damaged by it. 使 (食品或药品) 变坏
adv. 明确地；明白地

1. ADJ If you describe something such as a fact or remark as irrelevant, you mean that it is not connected with what you are discussing or dealing with. 不相关的 2. ADJ If you say that something is irrelevant, you mean that it is not important in a situation. 不重要的

1. N-COUNT A fibre is a thin thread of a natural or artificial substance, especially one that is used to make cloth or rope. 纤维 2. N-COUNT A fibre is a thin piece of flesh like a thread which connects nerve cells in your body or which muscles are made of. 纤维组织 3. N-VAR A particular fibre is a type of cloth or other material that is made from or consists of threads. 纤维制品 4. N-UNCOUNT Fibre consists of the parts of plants or seeds that your body cannot digest. Fibre is useful because it makes food pass quickly through your body. (植物) 纤维
1. V-T To retain something means to continue to have that thing. 保留 [正式]

1. V-T If you revise the way you think about something, you adjust your thoughts, usually in order to make them better or more suited to how things are. 修正 (对某事的想法) 2. V-T If you revise a price, amount, or estimate, you change it to make it more fair, realistic, or accurate. 调整 (使更合理、实际、准确) 3. V-T When you revise an article, a book, a law, or a piece of music, you change it in order to improve it, make it more modern, or make it more suitable for a particular purpose. 修改; 修订 (使改进、更时尚、更适于某目的) 4. V-I When you revise for an examination, you read things again and make notes in order to be prepared for the examination. (为考试) 复习 [英国英语]

1. N-UNCOUNT Retail is the activity of selling products direct to the public, usually in small quantities. Compare . 零售 [商业] 2. ADV If something is sold retail, it is sold in ordinary shops direct to the public. 以零售方式地 [商业] [ADV after v] 3. V-I If an item in a shop retails at or for a particular price, it is for sale at that price. (按某种价格) 零售 [商业] 4. → see also retailing
n. 倾向独立；支持独立的人

1. V-T If you toss something somewhere, you throw it there lightly, often in a careless way. 扔 2. V-T If you toss your head or toss your hair, you move your head backward, quickly and suddenly, often as a way of expressing an emotion such as anger or contempt. 甩 (表达愤怒、蔑视等情感) 3. N-COUNT Toss is also a noun. 后甩 4. V-T In sports and informal situations, if you decide something by tossing a coin, you spin a coin into the air and guess which side of the coin will face upward when it lands. 抛 (硬币) 5. N-COUNT Toss is also a noun. 抛硬币的方法 6. PHRASE If you toss and turn, you keep moving around in bed and cannot sleep, for example, because you are sick or worried. 辗转反侧

1. V-T If you regard someone or something as being a particular thing or as having a particular quality, you believe that they are that thing or have that quality. 看待 2. V-T If you regard something or someone with a feeling such as dislike or respect, you have that feeling about them. (以某种感情) 看待 3. N-UNCOUNT If you have regard for someone or something, you respect them and care about them. If you hold someone in high regard, you have a lot of respect for them. 尊重 4. N-PLURAL Regards are greetings. You use regards in expressions such as best regards and with kind regards as a way of expressing friendly feelings toward someone, especially in a letter. 用在(best regards)和(with kind regards)等表达方式中，表示对某人的良好祝愿，多用于书信中 [套语] 5. PHRASE You can use as regards to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about. 关于; 至于 6. PHRASE You can use with regard to or in regard to to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about. 关于; 至于

1. V-T If you tweak something, especially part of someone's body, you hold it between your finger and thumb and twist it or pull it. 扭; 扯 2. V-T If you tweak something such as a system or a design, you improve it by making a slight change. 稍稍改进(如系统或设计) [非正式] 3. N-COUNT Tweak is also a noun. 稍稍改进
1. N-COUNT A warrior is a fighter or soldier, especially one in former times who was very brave and experienced in fighting. 武士; 勇士
辛恩（手表品牌）
1. V-T If a court or a group in authority impeaches a president or other senior official, it charges them with committing a crime that makes them unfit for office. 弹劾; 控告
1. N-UNCOUNT Malaria is a serious disease carried by mosquitoes, which causes periods of fever. 疟疾

1. ADJ If you go somewhere by a roundabout route, you do not go there by the shortest and quickest route. 迂回的 2. ADJ If you do or say something in a roundabout way, you do not do or say it in a simple, clear, and direct way. 拐弯抹角的 3. N-COUNT A roundabout is a circular structure in the road at a place where several roads meet. You drive around it until you come to the road that you want. (交通) 环岛 [英国英语] 4. N-COUNT A roundabout at an amusement park is a large, circular mechanical device with seats, often in the shape of animals or cars, on which children sit and go around and around. (游乐园的) 旋转木马 [英国英语] 5. N-COUNT A roundabout in a park or school play area is a circular platform that children sit or stand on. People push the platform to make it spin around. (公园、学校的) 转椅 [英国英语]
1. N-COUNT A miller is a person who owns or operates a mill in which grain is crushed to make flour. 磨坊主; 磨粉工

1. QUANT A myriad or myriads of people or things is a very large number or great variety of them. 大量; 各种各样 [QUANT 'of' pl-n] 2. ADJ Myriad means having a large number or great variety. 大量的; 各种各样的 [ADJ n]
1. V-T A person who molests someone, especially a woman or a child, interferes with them in a sexual way against their will. 对…性骚扰 (尤指妇女或孩子)
1. N-UNCOUNT Someone who has humility is not proud and does not believe they are better than other people. 谦逊

1. V-T If an object embeds itself in a substance or thing, it becomes fixed there firmly and deeply. 嵌入 2. embedded ADJ 嵌入的 3. V-T If something such as an attitude or feeling is embedded in a society or system, or in someone's personality, it becomes a permanent and noticeable feature of it. 使根深蒂固 [usu passive] 4. embedded ADJ 根深蒂固的
1. N-COUNT A clan is a group which consists of families that are related to each other. 家族 2. N-COUNT You can refer to a group of people with the same interests as a clan. 帮派 [非正式]
1. N-VAR A distraction is something that turns your attention away from something you want to concentrate on. 分心的事物
痛骂；训斥

1. N-COUNT The founder of an institution, organization, or building is the person who got it started or caused it to be built, often by providing the necessary money. 创建人 2. N a person who makes metal castings 浇铸工 3. N (in combination) 制造(某种)金属铸件的人 4. V-I If something such as a plan or project founders, it fails because of a particular point, difficulty, or problem. 失败 5. V (of a ship) to sink (船只)沉没
1. ADJ Someone or something that is sturdy looks strong and is unlikely to be easily injured or damaged. 结实的; 坚固的 2. sturdily ADV 结实地; 坚固地

1. ADJ Fuzzy hair sticks up in a soft, curly mass. 绒卷的 (头发) 2. ADJ If something is fuzzy, it has a covering that feels soft and like fur. 绒软的 3. ADJ A fuzzy picture, image, or sound is unclear and hard to see or hear. 模糊的 (图片、图像、声音等) 4. ADJ If you or your thoughts are fuzzy, you are confused and cannot think clearly. (人、思路) 糊涂
1. Torn is the past participle of . (tear)的过去分词 2. ADJ If you are torn between two or more things, you cannot decide which to choose, and so you feel anxious or troubled. 犹豫的

1. ADJ In grammar, the present perfect tenses of a verb are the ones used to talk about things that happened before the time you are speaking or writing but are relevant to the present situation, or things that began in the past and are still happening. The simple present perfect tense uses "have" or "has" and the past participle of the verb, as in "They have decided what to do." 现在完成时的 [ADJ n]
1. N any enzyme involved in proteolysis 蛋白酶
1. N-UNCOUNT Censorship is the censoring of books, plays, movies, or reports, especially by government officials, because they are considered immoral or secret in some way. (官方对书刊、剧本、电影或新闻报道的) 审查
1. ADJ If something is founded on a particular thing, it is based on it. 以…为基础 [v-link ADJ 'on' n] 2. → see also found

1. V-T/V-I When soldiers march somewhere, or when a commanding officer marches them somewhere, they walk there with very regular steps, as a group. 使齐步走; 行军 2. N-COUNT March is also a noun. 行军 3. N-COUNT a frontier, border, or boundary or the land lying along it, often of disputed ownership (所有权常有争议的)边界; 边疆; 边地 (Also called marchland) 4. V-I When a large group of people march for a cause, they walk somewhere together in order to express their ideas or to protest about something. 游行 5. N-COUNT March is also a noun. 游行 6. marcher N-COUNT 游行者 7. V-I If you say that someone marches somewhere, you mean that they walk there quickly and in a determined way, for example because they are angry. (坚定地) 快步走 8. V-T If you march someone somewhere, you force them to walk there with you, for example by holding their arm tightly. 迫使…同行 9. N-SING Themarchof something is its steady development or progress. 进展 10. N-COUNT A march is a piece of music with a regular rhythm that you can march to. 进行曲

1. N-UNCOUNT Havoc is great disorder and confusion. 大混乱 2. PHRASE If one thing plays havoc with another or wreaks havoc on it, it prevents it from continuing or functioning as normal, or damages it. 打乱
1. V-T If someone or something disrupts an event, system, or process, they cause difficulties that prevent it from continuing or operating in a normal way. 妨碍; 扰乱
1. ADJ If you describe a person, machine, or method as unreliable, you mean that you cannot trust them. 不可靠的
1. N-COUNT A semicolon is the punctuation mark ; which is used in writing to separate different parts of a sentence or list or to indicate a pause. 分号 (；)

1. N-UNCOUNT Influence is the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want. 权势 2. V-T If you influence someone, you use your power to make them agree with you or do what you want. 影响 3. N-COUNT To have an influence on people or situations means to affect what they do or what happens. 影响 4. V-T If someone or something influences a person or situation, they have an effect on that person's behaviour or that situation. 影响 5. N-COUNT Someone or something that is a good or bad influence on people has a good or bad effect on them. 有影响的人 (或事物) 6. PHRASE If you are under the influence of someone or something, you are being affected or controlled by them. 在…影响之下
adj. 狡猾的；机警的 (tricky的变形)

1. V-T If people stockpile things such as food or weapons, they store large quantities of them for future use. 大量储备 2. N-COUNT A stockpile of things is a large quantity of them that have been stored for future use. 储备物资

1. ADJ If you are energetic in what you do, you have a lot of enthusiasm and determination. 精力充沛的 2. energetically ADV 精力充沛地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ An energetic person is very active and does not feel at all tired. An energetic activity involves a lot of physical movement and power. 精力旺盛的; 剧烈的 4. energetically ADV 干劲十足地 [ADV with v]

1. ADJ If something is coherent, it is well planned, so that it is clear and sensible and all its parts go well with each other. 连贯的 2. coherence N-UNCOUNT 连贯性 3. ADJ If someone is coherent, they express their thoughts in a clear and calm way, so that other people can understand what they are saying. 条理清楚的 [v-link ADJ] 4. coherence N-UNCOUNT 条理性

1. N-COUNT Ingredients are the things that are used to make something, especially all the different foods you use when you are cooking a particular dish. (尤指烹调用的) 原料 2. N-COUNT An ingredient of a situation is one of the essential parts of it. 要素

1. V-T If you dislike someone or something, you consider them to be unpleasant and do not like them. 不喜爱 2. N-UNCOUNT Dislike is the feeling that you do not like someone or something. 厌恶 3. N-COUNT Your dislikes are the things that you do not like. 不喜欢的事物 4. PHRASE If you take a dislike to someone or something, you decide that you do not like them. 讨厌
1. N a biography or historical account, esp one based on personal knowledge 回忆录
让某人难堪；赶鸭子上架

1. V-T/V-I If you chase someone, or chase after them, you run after them or follow them quickly in order to catch or reach them. 追赶 2. N-COUNT Chase is also a noun. 追赶 3. V-T/V-I If you are chasing something you want, such as work or money, or are chasing after it, you are trying hard to get it. 追求 (事业、金钱等) 4. N-SING Chase is also a noun. (对事业、金钱等的) 追求 [N 'for' n] 5. V-T/V-I If someone chases someone that they are attracted to, or chases after them, they try hard to persuade them to have a sexual relationship with them. 追求 (异性) 6. N-SING Chase is also a noun. (对异性的) 追求 7. V-T If someone chases you from a place, they force you to leave by using threats or violence. 驱逐 8. V-T To chase someone from a job or a position or from power means to force them to leave it. 逼迫卸职 9. V-I If you chase somewhere, you run or rush there. 冲 10. V to cut a groove, furrow, or flute in (a surface, column, etc) 雕刻(表面、柱子等) (Also chamfer) 11. PHRASE If someone cuts to the chase, they start talking about or dealing with wha

1. N-UNCOUNT If there is congestion in a place, the place is extremely crowded and blocked with traffic or people. 拥塞 2. N-UNCOUNT Congestion in a part of the body is a medical condition in which the part becomes blocked. (身体部位的) 堵塞
1. N-VAR The deployment of troops, resources, or equipment is the organization and positioning of them so that they are ready for quick action. 部署
1. N-UNCOUNT Asparagus is a vegetable that is long and green and has small shoots at one end. It is cooked and usually served whole. 芦笋

1. CONVENTION You say "Sorry" or "I'm sorry" as a way of apologizing to someone for something that you have done which has upset them or caused them difficulties, or when you bump into them accidentally. 对不起 [套语] 2. ADJ If you are sorry about a situation, you feel regret, sadness, or disappointment about it. 遗憾的; 悲伤的 [v-link ADJ] 3. CONVENTION You use I'm sorry or sorry as an introduction when you are telling a person something that you do not think they will want to hear, for example when you are disagreeing with them or giving them bad news. 抱歉 (用于表示不同意或不好的消息) 4. PHRASE You use the expression I'm sorry to say to express regret together with disappointment or disapproval. 很遗憾 [情感] 5. CONVENTION You say "I'm sorry" to express your regret and sadness when you hear sad or unpleasant news. 很难过 [情感] 6. ADJ If you feel sorry for someone who is unhappy or in an unpleasant situation, you feel sympathy and sadness for them. 同情的 [v-link ADJ 'for' n] 7. ADJ You say that someone is feeling sorry for themselves w
1. ADJ Something that is varied consists of things of different types, sizes, or qualities. 各种各样的 2. → see also vary
adv. 相当地；非常地
n. 叙利亚人（Syrian的复数）
1. V-T When you undertake a task or job, you start doing it and accept responsibility for it. 从事; 承担 2. V-T If you undertake to do something, you promise that you will do it. 承诺

1. V-T To derail something such as a plan or a series of negotiations means to prevent it from continuing as planned. 打乱 (原定计划) [journalism] 2. V-T/V-I If a train is derailed or if it derails, it comes off the track on which it is running. 脱轨

1. N-COUNT A chart is a diagram, picture, or graph which is intended to make information easier to understand. 图表 2. → see also bar chart, flow chart, pie chart 3. N-COUNT A chart is a map of the sea or stars. 海图; 星图 4. V-T If you chart an area of land, sea, or sky, or a feature in that area, you make a map of the area or show the feature in it. 绘制 5. V-T If you chart the development or progress of something, you observe it and record or show it. You can also say that a report or graph charts the development or progress of something. 用图表记录
1. N-VAR If you accuse someone of hypocrisy, you mean that they pretend to have qualities, beliefs, or feelings that they do not really have. 虚伪 [表不满]

1. N-COUNT A canal is a long, narrow stretch of water that has been made for boats to travel along or to bring water to a particular area. 运河 2. N-COUNT A canal is a narrow tube inside your body for carrying food, air, or other substances. (体内的) 管道

1. N-UNCOUNT Land is an area of ground, especially one that is used for a particular purpose such as farming or building. 土地 2. N-COUNT You can refer to an area of land which someone owns as their land or their lands. 地产 3. N-SING If you talk about the land, you mean farming and the way of life in farming areas, in contrast to life in the cities. 农村生活 4. N-UNCOUNT Land is the part of the world that consists of ground, rather than sea or air. 陆地 [also 'the' N] 5. N-COUNT You can use land to refer to a country in a poetic or emotional way. 国家 [文学性] 6. V-I When someone or something lands, they come down to the ground after moving through the air or falling. 降落 7. V-T/V-I When someone lands a plane, ship, or spacecraft, or when it lands, it arrives somewhere after a journey. 抵达 8. V-T/V-I If you land in an unpleasant situation or place or if something lands you in it, something causes you to be in it. 陷入 (不愉快境地) [非正式] 9. V-I If something lands somewhere, it arrives there unexpectedly, often causing prob
1. N a decorating technique in which paint is applied with a specially modified brush to create a marbled or grainy effect 拖曳效果
1. ADJ Prehistoric people and things existed at a time before information was written down. 史前的
1. V-T/V-I If you intensify something or if it intensifies, it becomes greater in strength, amount, or degree. 加强; 强化

1. V-T If a situation, a rule, or a person compels you to do something, they force you to do it. 迫使 2. PHRASE If you feel compelled to do something, you feel that you must do it, because it is the right thing to do. 感到必须 (做某事)

1. PREP You use versus to indicate that two figures, ideas, or choices are opposed. 与…相对 2. PREP Versus is used to indicate that two teams or people are competing against each other in a sports event. (体育比赛中) …对… 3. PREP Versus is used in a court of law to indicate that two people or organizations are involved in a law suit. The abbreviation v is also used. (在法庭上) …诉…
1. V-T If a person or thing disillusions you, they make you realize that something is not as good as you thought. 使醒悟 2. N-UNCOUNT Disillusion is the same as . 幻灭

1. V-T If you coordinate an activity, you organize the various people and things involved in it. 协调 2. coordinated ADJ 协调的 3. V-T If you coordinate the different parts of your body, you make them work together efficiently to perform particular movements. 使 (身体各部位) 协调 4. V-RECIP If you coordinate clothes or furnishings that are used together, or if they coordinate, they are similar in some way and look nice together. 搭配 (衣服、饰品) 5. N-COUNT The coordinates of a point on a map or graph are the two sets of numbers or letters that you need in order to find that point. 坐标 [技术]

1. V-T If you abandon a place, thing, or person, you leave the place, thing, or person permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so. 抛弃 2. V-T If you abandon an activity or piece of work, you stop doing it before it is finished. 中途放弃 3. V-T If you abandon an idea or way of thinking, you stop having that idea or thinking in that way. 放弃 (想法或思想方式) 4. N-UNCOUNT If you say that someone does something with abandon, you mean that they behave in a wild, uncontrolled way and do not think or care about how they should behave. 放纵 [usu 'with' N] [表不满] 5. → see also abandoned 6. PHRASE If people abandon ship, they get off a ship because it is sinking. (因船舶下沉而) 弃船

1. V-T If something saps your strength or confidence, it gradually weakens or destroys it. 消耗; 削弱 2. V-T to undermine (a fortification, etc) by digging saps 挖地道以摧毁(工事等) 3. N-UNCOUNT Sap is the watery liquid in plants and trees. (植物的) 汁液 4. N-COUNT a gullible or foolish person 容易上当的人 [slang] 5. N-COUNT energy; vigour 精力 6. N-COUNT a deep and narrow trench used to approach or undermine an enemy position, esp in siege warfare 地道
1. ADJ The outer parts of something are the parts which contain or enclose the other parts, and which are furthest from the centre. 外面的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A lamp is a light that works by using electricity or by burning oil or gas. 灯

1. N-COUNT A shed is a small building that is used for storing things such as garden tools. (用于存放园艺工具等的) 棚屋 2. N-COUNT A shed is a large shelter or building, for example, at a train station, port, or factory. (车站、港口、工厂等的) 棚式建筑 3. V-T When a tree sheds its leaves, its leaves fall off in the autumn. When an animal sheds hair or skin, some of its hair or skin drops off. 落 (叶); 脱 (发); 蜕 (皮) 4. V-T To shed something means to get rid of it. 去除; 摆脱 [正式] 5. V-T If you shed tears, you cry. 落 (泪) 6. V-T To shed blood means to kill people in a violent way. If someone sheds their blood, they are killed in a violent way, usually when they are fighting in a war. 洒 (热血) [正式] 7. to shed light on something →see light
1. N-COUNT The alumni of a school, college, or university are the people who used to be students there. 校友 [美国英语]
1. →see rich
1. N-VAR A prison is a building where criminals are kept as punishment. 监狱
1. N-COUNT If you talk about a likely or possible scenario, you are talking about the way in which a situation may develop. 设想; 可能的情况

1. ADJ A test, system, or procedure that is rigorous is very thorough and strict. (测试、制度、程序) 严格缜密的 2. rigorously ADV 严格缜密地 3. ADJ If someone is rigorous in the way that they do something, they are very careful and thorough. 一丝不苟的; 缜密的

1. N-UNCOUNT Fidelity is loyalty to a person, organization, or set of beliefs. 忠诚 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Fidelity is being loyal to your husband, wife, or partner by not having a sexual relationship with anyone else. 忠贞

1. V-T/V-I If you widen something or if it widens, it becomes greater in measurement from one side or edge to the other. 使变宽; 变宽 2. V-T/V-I If you widen something or if it widens, it becomes greater in range or it affects a larger number of people or things. 扩大 3. V-T/V-I If a difference or gap widens or if something widens it, it becomes greater. 拉大 (不同或差距)

1. ADV If you say that something is not necessarily the case, you mean that it may not be the case or is not always the case. 必要地 [含糊] 2. CONVENTION If you reply "Not necessarily," you mean that what has just been said or suggested may not be true. 不一定 3. ADV If you say that something necessarily happens or is the case, you mean that it has to happen or be the case and cannot be any different. 必然地

1. ADV If something has been done specially for a particular person or purpose, it has been done only for that person or purpose. 专门地 2. ADV Specially is used to mean more than usually or more than other things. 特别地 [非正式]

1. V-T/V-I If you operate a business or organization, you work to keep it running. If a business or organization operates, it carries out its work. 经营; 运营 2. operation N-UNCOUNT 经营 3. V-I The way that something operates is the way that it works or has a particular effect. 起作用 4. operation N-UNCOUNT 运行 5. V-T/V-I When you operate a machine or device, or when it operates, you make it work. 操作; 运转 6. operation N-UNCOUNT 操作 7. V-I When surgeons operate on a patient in a hospital, they cut open a patient's body in order to remove, replace, or repair a diseased or damaged part. 动手术
1. N-TITLE/N-COUNT A sheikh is a male Arab chief or ruler. (阿拉伯的男性) 酋长; 统治者

1. V-T If you invite someone to something such as a party or a meal, you ask them to come to it. 邀请 2. V-T If you are invited to do something, you are formally asked or given permission to do it. 邀请; 聘请 3. V-T If something you say or do invites trouble or criticism, it makes trouble or criticism more likely. 招致 4. N-COUNT An invite is an invitation to something such as a party or a meal. 请贴 [非正式]

1. V-T/V-I If you wonder about something, you think about it, either because it interests you and you want to know more about it, or because you are worried or suspicious about it. 想知道 2. V-T/V-I If you wonder at something, you are very surprised about it or think about it in a very surprised way. 对…感到惊讶 3. N-SING If you say that it is a wonder that something happened, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected. 奇事 4. N-UNCOUNT Wonder is a feeling of great surprise and pleasure that you have, for example, when you see something that is very beautiful, or when something happens that you thought was impossible. 惊奇 5. N-COUNT A wonder is something that causes people to feel great surprise or admiration. 奇迹 6. ADJ If you refer, for example, to a young man as a wonder boy, or to a new product as a wonder drug, you mean that they are believed by many people to be very good or very effective. 神奇的 [ADJ n] 7. PHRASE You can say "I wonder" if you want to be very polite when you are asking someone to do
adj. 中等收入的
1. ADJ If you describe something or someone as ubiquitous, you mean that they seem to be everywhere. 无所不在的 [正式]

1. ADJ An intermediate stage, level, or position is one that occurs between two other stages, levels, or positions. 中间的 2. ADJ Intermediate learners of something have some knowledge or skill but are not yet advanced. 中级的 3. N-COUNT An intermediate is an intermediate learner. 中级生

1. N-COUNT A barricade is a line of vehicles or other objects placed across a road or open space to stop people from getting past, for example, during street fighting or as a protest. 街垒; 路障 2. V-T If you barricade something such as a road or an entrance, you place a barricade or barrier across it, usually to stop someone from getting in. 在…设路障 3. V-T If you barricade yourself inside a room or building, you place barriers across the door or entrance so that other people cannot get in. 把…堵在
1. N-UNCOUNT Broadband is a method of sending many electronic messages at the same time by using a wide range of frequencies. 宽带 [计算机] [oft N n]

1. N-UNCOUNT Development is the gradual growth or formation of something. 发育; 逐渐形成 2. N-UNCOUNT Development is the growth of something such as a business or an industry. 发展 [商业] 3. N-UNCOUNT Development is the process of making an area of land or water more useful or profitable. 开发 4. N-VAR Development is the process or result of making a basic design gradually better and more advanced. 改良 5. N-COUNT A development is an event or incident which has recently happened and is likely to have an effect on the present situation. 进展 6. N-COUNT A development is an area of houses or buildings which have been built by property developers. 开发区

1. ADJ If you describe a person, group, or organization as embattled, you mean that they are having a lot of problems or difficulties. 问题缠身的; 处于困境的 [usu ADJ n] 2. ADJ An embattled area is one that is involved in the fighting in a war, especially one that is surrounded by enemy forces. 卷入战争的; 四面楚歌的 [ADJ n]
1. N-PLURAL The grassroots of an organization or movement are the ordinary people who form the main part of it, rather than its leaders. (组织、运动的) 基层

1. N-COUNT A gown is a dress, usually a long dress, which women wear on formal occasions. (女用) 长礼服 2. N-COUNT A gown is a loose black garment worn on formal occasions by people such as lawyers and academics. (律师、大学教师等在正式场合穿的) 黑色礼袍
1. ADJ Something that is dormant is not active, growing, or being used at the present time but is capable of becoming active later on. 休眠的

1. N-MASS Polish is a substance that you put on the surface of an object in order to clean it, protect it, and make it shine. 抛光剂; 亮漆 2. V-T If you polish something, you put polish on it or rub it with a cloth to make it shine. (用抛光剂等) 擦亮 3. N-SING Polish is also a noun. 擦亮; 磨光 4. polished ADJ 擦亮的; 磨光的 5. N-UNCOUNT If you say that a performance or piece of work has polish, you mean that it is of a very high standard. 完美; 上乘境界 [表赞许] 6. V-T If you polish your technique, performance, or skill at doing something, you work on improving it. 使完美; 改进 7. PHRASAL VERB Polish up means the same as . 使完美; 改进 8. → see also polished

1. N-COUNT The shell of a nut or egg is the hard covering which surrounds it. (坚果或蛋的) 壳 2. N-UNCOUNT Shell is the substance that a shell is made of. 壳料 3. N-COUNT The shell of an animal such as a tortoise, snail, or crab is the hard protective covering that it has around its body or on its back. (动物的) 甲壳 4. N-COUNT Shells are hard objects found on beaches. They are usually pink, white, or brown and are the coverings which used to surround small sea creatures. 贝壳 5. V-T If you shell nuts, peas, shrimp, or other food, you remove their natural outer covering. 剥…的壳 6. N-COUNT If someone comes out of their shell, they become more friendly and interested in other people and less quiet, shy, and reserved. 矜持 7. N-COUNT The shell of a building, boat, car, or other structure is the outside frame of it. 框架 8. N-COUNT A shell is a weapon consisting of a metal container filled with explosives that can be fired from a large gun over long distances. 炮弹 9. V-T To shell a place means to fire explosive shells at it.
1. N-COUNT A dictator is a ruler who has complete power in a country, especially power which was obtained by force and is used unfairly or cruelly. 独裁者
n. 易卜拉欣（与阿丹、努哈、穆萨、尔撒和穆罕默德并称为安拉的六大使者，亦系犹太教和基督教推崇的圣人和希伯来人的祖先）
1. N-COUNT A commodity is something that is sold for money. 商品 [商业]

1. N-COUNT A shelf is a flat piece of wood, metal, or glass which is attached to a wall or to the sides of a cabinet. Shelves are used for keeping things on. 架子 2. PHRASE If you buy something off the shelf, you buy something that is not specially made for you. 现货出售的

1. ADJ Primitive means belonging to a society in which people live in a very simple way, usually without industries or a writing system. 原始的 (社会) 2. ADJ Primitive means belonging to a very early period in the development of an animal or plant. 原始的 (动物、植物) 3. ADJ If you describe something as primitive, you mean that it is very simple in style or very old-fashioned. 简陋的; 旧式的

1. N-COUNT A marine is a member of an armed force, for example the U.S. Marine Corps or the Royal Marines, who is specially trained for military duties at sea as well as on land. 海军陆战队士兵 2. ADJ Marine is used to describe things relating to the sea or to the animals and plants that live in the sea. 海洋的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ Marine is used to describe things relating to ships and their movement at sea. 海事的 [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT The tone of a sound is its particular quality. 音质 2. N-COUNT Someone's tone is a quality in their voice which shows what they are feeling or thinking. 语气 3. N-SING The tone of a speech or piece of writing is its style and the opinions or ideas expressed in it. > 风格; (讲话或文章的) 口气 [also 'in' N] 4. N-SING The tone of a place or an event is its general atmosphere. 氛围 5. N-UNCOUNT The tone of someone's body, especially their muscles, is its degree of firmness and strength. (尤指肌肉的) 结实度 6. V-T/V-I Something that tones your body makes it firm and strong. 使强健 7. PHRASAL VERB Tone up means the same as . 同(tone) 8. N-VAR A tone is one of the lighter, darker, or brighter shades of the same colour. 色调 9. N-SING A tone is one of the sounds that you hear when you are using a telephone, for example, the sound that tells you that a number is busy, or no longer exists. (电话的) 提示音
穆罕默德（伊斯兰男名）

1. N-COUNT A quilt is a bed cover made by sewing layers of cloth together, usually with different colours sewn together to make a design. 被子 2. N-COUNT A quilt is a thin cover filled with feathers or some other warm, soft material, which you put over your blankets when you are in bed. 羽绒床罩 [英国英语] 3. V-T/V-I If you quilt, or if you quilt a piece of fabric, you make a quilt. 缝制 (被子); 缝制被子

1. V-I If you probe into something, you ask questions or try to discover facts about it. 调查; 探寻 2. N-COUNT Probe is also a noun. 调查; 探寻 3. V-I If a doctor or dentist probes, he or she uses a long instrument to examine part of a patient's body. 用探针探查 4. N-COUNT A probe is a long thin instrument that doctors and dentists use to examine parts of the body. 探针 5. V-T If you probe a place, you search it in order to find someone or something that you are looking for. 搜索
1. N-COUNT An intermediary is a person who passes messages or proposals between two people or groups. 中间人

1. N-COUNT A galaxy is an extremely large group of stars and planets that extends over many billions of light years. 星系 2. N-PROPER The Galaxy is the extremely large group of stars and planets to which the Earth and the solar system belong. 银河系
1. ADJ A disease that is infectious can be caught by being near a person who has it. Compare . 传染的 2. ADJ If a feeling is infectious, it spreads to other people. 有感染力的

1. V-T If someone mocks you, they show or pretend that they think you are foolish or inferior, for example by saying something funny about you, or by imitating your behaviour. 嘲笑; (为了取笑) 模仿 2. ADJ You use mock to describe something which is not real or genuine, but which is intended to be very similar to the real thing. 假装的 [ADJ n]
n. 房利美（房产经济公司）；范妮（女子名，等于Frances）
n. 极点（pole的复数形式）；雪杖；杆位次数 n. (Poles)人名；(德、捷)波勒斯

1. N-COUNT A prune is a dried plum. 李子干 2. V-T/V-I When you prune, or prune a tree or bush, you cut off some of the branches so that it will grow better the next year. 修剪 (树木) 3. PHRASAL VERB Prune back means the same as . 修剪 (树木) 4. V-T If you prune something, you cut out all the parts that you do not need. 删减 5. PHRASAL VERB Prune back means the same as . 删减 6. V → an archaic word for preen
1. N-COUNT A fez is a round, red hat with no brim and a flat top. 毡帽

1. V-T/V-I If someone grumbles, they complain about something in a bad-tempered way. 抱怨 2. N-COUNT Grumble is also a noun. 抱怨 3. V-I If something grumbles, it makes a low continuous sound. 隆隆作响 [文学性] 4. N-SING Grumble is also a noun. 隆隆响声 [usu N 'of' n]

1. N-COUNT A lake is a large area of fresh water, surrounded by land. 湖 2. N-COUNT a bright pigment used in textile dyeing and printing inks, produced by the combination of an organic colouring matter with an inorganic compound, usually a metallic salt, oxide, or hydroxide 色淀; 沉淀染料

1. DET You use a few to indicate that you are talking about a small number of people or things. You can also say a very few. 几个 2. PRON Few is also a pronoun. 几个 3. QUANT Few is also a quantifier. 几个 [QUANT 'of' def-pl-n] 4. DET You use few to indicate that you are talking about a small number of people or things. You can use "so," "too," and "very" in front of few. 很少 5. PRON Few is also a pronoun. 很少 6. QUANT Few is also a quantifier. 很少 [QUANT 'of' def-pl-n] 7. ADJ Few is also an adjective. 很少的 8. ADJ You use few after adjectives and determiners to indicate that you are talking about a small number of things or people. 少数的 [adj/det ADJ n] 9. N-SING The few means a small set of people considered as separate from the majority, especially because they share a particular opportunity or quality that the others do not have. 少数人 10. PHRASE You use as few as before a number to suggest that it is surprisingly small. 少到只有 [强调] 11. PHRASE Things that are few and far between are very rare or do not happen
1. V-T If someone or something is diagnosed as having a particular illness or problem, their illness or problem is identified. If an illness or problem is diagnosed, it is identified. 诊断
n. 行业，工业；实业公司（industry的复数）
1. N God regarded as a source of illuminating grace and strength 灵光; 上帝认为的，有启迪的恩赐及力量之源泉
1. N-COUNT An aroma is a strong, pleasant smell. 芳香
1. N the act of consolidating or state of being consolidated 巩固; 变坚固

1. N-UNCOUNT If a group or person has representation in a legislature or on a committee, someone in the legislature or on the committee supports them and makes decisions on their behalf. 代表 2. → see also proportional representation 3. N-COUNT You can describe a picture, model, or statue of a person or thing as a representation of them. 描写; 描绘 [正式]
1. N-UNCOUNT Agriculture is farming and the methods that are used to raise and take care of crops and animals. 农业
1. ADJ Someone who is assertive states their needs and opinions clearly, so that people take notice. 坚定自信的 2. assertiveness N-UNCOUNT 坚定自信
1. ADJ Things that are identical are exactly the same. 完全相同的 2. identically ADV 完全相同地
1. N-VAR An amendment is a section that is added to a law or rule in order to change it. 修正案 2. N-COUNT An amendment is a change that is made to a piece of writing. 修改
1. N-COUNT A writ is a legal document that orders a person to do a particular thing. 传票 2. V write的过去式和过去分词 [archaic, DIALECT] → a past tense and past participle of write

1. V-T If you fulfil something such as a promise, dream, or hope, you do what you said or hoped you would do. 实现 (承诺、梦想、希望等) 2. V-T To fulfil a task, role, or requirement means to do or be what is required, necessary, or expected. 完成 (任务、角色); 达到 (要求) 3. V-T If something fulfils you, or if you fulfil yourself, you feel happy and satisfied with what you are doing or with what you have achieved. 使感到满足 4. fulfilled ADJ 感到满足的
1. N-COUNT The recipient of something is the person who receives it. 接受者 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A primate is a member of the group of mammals that includes humans, monkeys, and apes. 灵长目动物 2. ADJ of, relating to, or belonging to the order Primates 大主教的; 首席主教的 3. N-COUNT The Primate of a particular country or region is the most important priest in that country or region. 大主教

1. V-I If you peer at something, you look at it very hard, usually because it is difficult to see clearly. 费力地看; 盯着 2. N-COUNT Your peers are the people who are the same age as you or who have the same status as you. 同龄人; 同等地位的人 3. N a member of a nobility; nobleman 贵族
n. 密西西比河（美国河流，世界上最大的河流之一）；密西西比州（美国州名）

1. ADJ Something that is resilient is strong and not easily damaged by being hit, stretched, or squeezed. 有弹性的 2. resilience N-UNCOUNT 弹性 [also 'a' N] 3. ADJ People and things that are resilient are able to recover easily and quickly from unpleasant or damaging events. 立即复原的 4. resilience N-UNCOUNT 复原能力 [also 'a' N]

1. V-I If you peep, or peep at something, you take a quick look at it, often secretly and quietly. 瞥一眼 2. N-SING Peep is also a noun. 一瞥 ['a' N] 3. V-I If something peeps out from behind or under something, a small part of it is visible or becomes visible. (从后面或下面) 探出; 露出 4. V (esp of young birds) to utter shrill small noises (尤指幼鸟)唧唧叫; 啾啾叫 5. N a peeping sound 唧唧声; 啾啾声 6. PHRASE If you say that you don't hear a peep from someone, you mean that they do not say anything or make any noise. 听到一点声音 [非正式]
1. ADJ Pharmaceutical means connected with the industrial production of medicines. 制药的 [ADJ n] 2. N-PLURAL Pharmaceuticals are medicines. 药品

1. V-T If something confirms what you believe, suspect, or fear, it shows that it is definitely true. 证实 (某人的观点、猜疑、担心的事) [no cont] 2. confirmation N-UNCOUNT 证实 3. V-T If you confirm something that has been stated or suggested, you say that it is true because you know about it. 证实 (陈述或建议的事物) 4. confirmation N-UNCOUNT 确认 5. V-T If you confirm an arrangement or appointment, you say that it is definite, usually in a letter or on the telephone. (常指通过信件或电话) 确认 (安排、预约) 6. confirmation N-UNCOUNT 确准 7. V-T If someone is confirmed, they are formally accepted as a member of a Christian church during a ceremony in which they say they believe what the church teaches. 给…施坚信礼 [usu passive] 8. confirmation N-VAR 施坚信礼 9. V-T If something confirms you in your decision, belief, or opinion, it makes you think that you are definitely right. 使…坚信 (其决定、信念、观点的正确性) [no cont] 10. V-T If something confirms you as something, it shows that you definitely deserve a name, role, or position. 证明 (某人是当之无愧的…)
n. [计] 兼容性
1. N-COUNT A merger is the joining together of two separate companies or organizations so that they become one. 合并 [商业]
1. V-T If someone or something is reviled, people hate them intensely or show their hatred of them. 憎恨; 谩骂 [正式] 2. reviled ADJ
adv. 大声一点
n. 哈撒韦（衬衫品牌）；海瑟薇（人名）
1. N-COUNT A catastrophe is an unexpected event that causes great suffering or damage. 灾难

1. N-COUNT A torrent is a lot of water falling or flowing rapidly or violently. 急流 2. N-COUNT A torrent of abuse or questions is a lot of abuse or questions directed continuously at someone. (漫骂或问题的) 迸发
1. N-UNCOUNT Larceny is the crime of stealing. 盗窃罪 [法律]

1. V-T/V-I When a bell tolls or when someone tolls it, it rings slowly and repeatedly, often as a sign that someone has died. 敲 (常指丧钟); (常指丧钟) 鸣响 2. N-COUNT A toll is a sum of money that you have to pay in order to use a particular bridge or road. (桥梁或道路的) 通行费 3. N-COUNT A toll road or toll bridge is a road or bridge that you have to pay to use. (道路或桥梁) 收费 [N n] 4. N-COUNT A toll is a total number of deaths, accidents, or disasters that occur in a particular period of time. (死亡、事故或灾难的) 总数 [journalism] 5. → see also death toll 6. PHRASE If you say that something takes its toll or takes a heavy toll, you mean that it has a bad effect or causes a lot of suffering. 造成坏影响 (或痛苦)

1. N-COUNT A tablet is a small solid mass of medicine which you swallow. 药片 2. N-COUNT Clay tablets or stone tablets are the flat pieces of clay or stone which people used to write on before paper was invented. (黏土或石头制的、用以铭刻文字的) 匾; 碑 3. tablets of stone →see stone
1. ADJ Things that are contiguous are next to each other or touch each other. 邻近的 [正式] [oft ADJ 'to/with' n]

1. ADV Absolutely means totally and completely. 绝对地 [强调] 2. ADV Some people say absolutely as an emphatic way of saying yes or of agreeing with someone. They say absolutely not as an emphatic way of saying no or of disagreeing with someone. 绝对地 [ADV as reply] [强调]
n. 放松；松驰

1. N-SING Thehorizon is the line in the far distance where the sky seems to meet the land or the sea. 地平线 2. N-COUNT Your horizons are the limits of what you want to do or of what you are interested or involved in. 眼界; 阅历 3. PHRASE If something is on the horizon, it is almost certainly going to happen or be done quite soon. 即将来临的

1. N-UNCOUNT Courtesy is politeness, respect, and consideration for others. 彬彬有礼 [正式] 2. N-SING If you refer to the courtesy of doing something, you are referring to a polite action. 彬彬有礼的举止 [正式] 3. ADJ Courtesy is used to describe services that are provided free of charge by an organization to its customers, or to the general public. 免费的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect. 出于礼节的 [ADJ n] 5. PHRASE If something is provided courtesy of someone or by courtesy of someone, they provide it. You often use this expression in order to thank them. 蒙…的好意
1. N-UNCOUNT Ketchup is a thick, cold sauce, usually made from tomatoes, that is sold in bottles. 番茄酱
adv. 焦虑地；烦恼地

1. N-UNCOUNT Production is the process of manufacturing or growing something in large quantities. 生产 2. N-UNCOUNT Production is the amount of goods manufactured or grown by a company or country. 产量 3. N-UNCOUNT The production of something is its creation as the result of a natural process. 产生; 生成 4. N-UNCOUNT Production is the process of organizing and preparing a play, movie, programme, or CD, in order to present it to the public. (戏剧、电影、节目等的) 制作 5. N-COUNT A production is a play, opera, or other show that is performed in a theatre. 演出 6. PHRASE When you can do something on production of or on the production of documents, you need to show someone those documents in order to be able to do that thing. 凭某物的出示

1. N-COUNT A reunion is a party attended by members of the same family, school, or other group who have not seen each other for a long time. (家庭、学校及其他团体成员的) 重聚会 2. N-VAR A reunion is a meeting between people who have been separated for some time. 重逢

1. V-T If large numbers of people or animals are slaughtered, they are killed in a way that is cruel or unnecessary. 屠杀 [usu passive] 2. N-UNCOUNT Slaughter is also a noun. 屠杀 3. V-T To slaughter animals such as cows and sheep means to kill them for their meat. 屠宰 4. N-UNCOUNT Slaughter is also a noun. 屠宰

1. N-COUNT A tailor is a person whose job is to make men's clothes. (缝制男装的) 裁缝 2. V-T If you tailor something such as a plan or system to someone's needs, you make it suitable for a particular person or purpose by changing the details of it. 调整
1. ADJ Someone who is triumphant has gained a victory or succeeded in something and feels very happy about it. (因胜利或成功而) 得意洋洋的 2. triumphantly ADV 得意洋洋地
n. 接种疫苗；种痘
1. Laid is the past tense and past participle of lay. (lay)的过去式和过去分词
尽管；不管，不顾
更是这样， 尤其如此

1. ADJ You use primary to describe something that is very important. 首要的 [正式] [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Primary education is the first few years of formal education for children. 初级的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ Primary is used to describe something that occurs first. 最初的 [ADJ n] 4. N-COUNT A primary or a primary election is an election in an American state in which people vote for someone to become a candidate for a political office. Compare . (美国各州的) 初选
1. ABBREVIATION for melting point 熔点 1. the INTERNET DOMAIN NAME for Northern Mariana Islands 北马里亚纳群岛

1. ADJ Something that is desirable is worth having or doing because it is useful, necessary, or popular. 值得拥有的; 值得做的 2. desirability N-UNCOUNT 可取性 3. ADJ Someone who is desirable is considered to be sexually attractive. 性感的 4. desirability N-UNCOUNT 性感
1. V to lengthen or extend (a speech, etc); prolong in time 延长
1. V-T If something saddens you, it makes you feel sad. 使悲伤; 使难过 [no cont] 2. saddened ADJ 悲伤的; 难过的 [v-link ADJ]

1. ADJ Spatial is used to describe things relating to areas. 空间的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Your spatial ability is your ability to see and understand the relationships between shapes, spaces, and areas. 感悟空间的 (能力) [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT The monarch of a country is the king, queen, emperor, or empress. 君主
1. ADJ You use eventual to indicate that something happens or is the case at the end of a process or period of time. 最终的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A database is a collection of data that is stored in a computer and that can easily be used and added to. 数据库
1. V to arouse the passions of; inflame 唤醒激情; 点燃

1. N-COUNT A proportion of a group or an amount is a part of it. 部分 [正式] 2. N-COUNT The proportion of one kind of person or thing in a group is the number of people or things of that kind compared to the total number of people or things in the group. (某部分在总体中所占的) 比例 3. N-COUNT The proportion of one amount to another is the relationship between the size of the two amounts. (一个量与另一个量的) 比值 4. N-PLURAL If you refer to the proportions of something, you are referring to its size, usually when this is extremely large. (某物的) 大小 [书面] 5. PHRASE If one thing increases or decreases in proportion to another thing, it increases or decreases to the same degree as that thing. (与…) 成比例地 6. PHRASE If something is small or large in proportion to something else, it is small or large when compared with that thing. (与…) 比 7. PHRASE If you say that something is out of all proportion to something else, you think that it is far greater or more serious than it should be. (与…) 完全不成比例

1. N-COUNT-COLL The crew of a ship, an aircraft, or a spacecraft is the people who work on and operate it. 全体船员; 全体机务人员 2. N-COUNT A crew is a group of people with special technical skills who work together on a task or project. 一组工作人员 3. V-T/V-I If you crew a boat, you work on it as part of the crew. 当船员; 充当…的船员 4. V crow的过去式 → a past tense of crow
1. V-T If you regain something that you have lost, you get it back again. 重新获得
n. 爱德华多（姓氏）
1. N-COUNT When there is a reduction in something, it is made smaller. 缩减 2. N-UNCOUNT Reduction is the act of making something smaller in size or amount, or less in degree. (尺寸、数量或程度上的) 削减

1. N-COUNT A fleet is a group of ships organized to do something together, for example, to fight battles or to catch fish. 舰队; 船队 2. N-COUNT A fleet of vehicles is a group of them, especially when they all belong to a particular organization or business, or when they are all going somewhere together. 车队 3. ADJ rapid in movement; swift 疾驰的
1. V-T If you lob something, you throw it so that it goes quite high in the air. (向高空中)扔 2. N a ball struck in a high arc 高弧球 3. N lobworm的缩写 → short for lobworm

1. N-PLURAL You refer to how likely something is to happen as the odds that it will happen. 可能性 2. N-PLURAL In betting, odds are expressions with numbers such as "10 to 1" and "7 to 2" that show how likely something is thought to be, for example, how likely a particular horse is to lose or win a race. (赌博中的) 赔率 3. PHRASE If someone is at odds with someone else, or if two people are at odds, they are disagreeing or arguing with each other. (与某人) 不合 4. PHRASE If you say that the odds are against something or someone, you mean that they are unlikely to succeed. (某人、某事物) 不大可能成功 5. PHRASE If something happens against all odds, it happens or succeeds although it seemed impossible or very unlikely. 貌似不可能 (却发生或成功) 6. PHRASE If you say that the odds are in someone's favour, you mean that they are likely to succeed in what they are doing. (某人) 可能会成功

1. V-T If you exclude someone from a place or activity, you prevent them from entering it or taking part in it. 拒 (某人) 于 (某地、活动) 之外; 不包括 2. V-T If you exclude something that has some connection with what you are doing, you deliberately do not use it or consider it. 故意不用; 故意不考虑 3. V-T To exclude a possibility means to decide or prove that it is wrong and not worth considering. 排除 (某种可能性) [usu with brd-neg] 4. V-T To exclude something such as the sun's rays or harmful germs means to prevent them physically from reaching or entering a particular place. 阻挡
1. N-UNCOUNT Divinity is the study of religion. 神学 2. N-UNCOUNT Divinity is the quality of being divine. 神力 [oft with poss] 3. N-COUNT A divinity is a god or goddess. 神; 女神

1. V-T If you mull something, you think about it for a long time before deciding what to do. 斟酌 [美国英语] 2. V-T to heat (wine, ale, etc) with sugar and spices to make a hot drink 加糖和香料并烫热(葡萄酒、麦芽酒等) 3. N a promontory 岬; 海角 [SCOTTISH]

1. V-T If you request something, you ask for it politely or formally. 请求; 正式要求 [正式] 2. V-T If you request someone to do something, you politely or formally ask them to do it. 要求 [正式] 3. N-COUNT If you make a request, you politely or formally ask someone to do something. 请求 4. PHRASE If you do something at someone's request, you do it because they have asked you to. 应某人的要求 5. PHRASE If something is given or done on request, it is given or done whenever you ask for it. 应要求
n. 法国雷诺公司；雷诺（姓氏）

1. V-T If you bear something somewhere, you carry it there or take it there. 运送 [文学性] 2. V-T If you bear something such as a weapon, you hold it or carry it with you. 携带 [正式] 3. V-T If one thing bears the weight of something else, it supports the weight of that thing. 承受; 支撑 4. V-T If something bears a particular mark or characteristic, it has that mark or characteristic. 带有 (标记或特征) 5. V-T If you bear an unpleasant experience, you accept it because you are unable to do anything about it. 忍受 6. V-T If you can't bear someone or something, you dislike them very much. 容忍 [with neg] 7. V-T When a woman bears a child, she gives birth to him or her. 生 (孩子) [老式] 8. V-T If someone bears the cost of something, they pay for it. 承担(费用) 9. V-T If you bear the responsibility for something, you accept responsibility for it. 承担 (责任) 10. V-T If one thing bears no resemblance or no relationship to another thing, they are not at all similar. 具有 (相似之处或关系) [usu with brd-neg] 11. V-T When a plant or tree bears flowers,

1. V-RECIP If you synchronize two activities, processes, or movements, or if you synchronize one activity, process, or movement with another, you cause them to happen at the same time and speed as each other. 使同步
1. N-PLURAL Australian Rules的缩写 → short for Australian Rules

1. ADJ You use exceptional to describe someone or something that has a particular quality, usually a good quality, to an unusually high degree. 非凡的 [表赞许] 2. exceptionally ADV 非凡地 [ADV adj/adv] 3. ADJ Exceptional situations and incidents are unusual and only likely to happen infrequently. 例外的 [正式] 4. exceptionally ADV 例外地 [ADV with cl]
1. V-I If you splurge on something, you spend a lot of money, usually on things that you do not need. 挥霍

1. N-COUNT An instrument is a tool or device that is used to do a particular task, especially a scientific task. 器械 2. N-COUNT A musical instrument is an object such as a piano, guitar, or flute, which you play in order to produce music. 乐器 3. N-COUNT An instrument is a device that is used for making measurements of something such as speed, height, or sound, for example, on a ship or plane or in a car. 仪器 4. N-COUNT Something that is an instrument for achieving a particular aim is used by people to achieve that aim. 手段
1. N-COUNT A conveyance is a vehicle. 交通工具 [文学性] 2. N-UNCOUNT The conveyance of something is the process of carrying or transporting it from one place to another. 输送 [正式] [with supp]
n. 恐吓，威胁
n. (Recep)人名；(土)雷杰普
1. N-COUNT If you describe someone as a stay-at-home, you mean that they stay at home rather than going out to work or travelling. 守在家里的人 [usu N n]

1. V-I If one thing morphs into another thing, especially something very different, the first thing changes into the second. (尤指很大的、质的)改变; 变化 [非正式] 2. N the phonological representation of a morpheme 语素 [linguistics] 3. N any of the different forms of individual found in a polymorphic species (多态种的)形态 [biology]
n. 加密；加密术
1. N-COUNT A projection is an estimate of a future amount. 预计 2. N-UNCOUNT The projection of a film or picture is the act of projecting it onto a screen or wall. 投映
1. N-COUNT If you have a conversation with someone, you talk with them, usually in an informal situation. (非正式的) 交谈
1. N-UNCOUNT Christianity is a religion that is based on the teachings of Jesus Christ and the belief that he was the son of God. 基督教
1. ADJ If you describe the amount or level of something as excessive, you disapprove of it because it is more or higher than is necessary or reasonable. 过多的; 过度的 [表不满] 2. excessively ADV 过多地; 过度地

1. ADJ Complementary things are different from each other but make a good combination. 互补的 [正式] 2. ADJ Complementary medicine refers to ways of treating patients which are different from the ones used by most Western doctors, for example acupuncture and homeopathy. 辅助性的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ You use industrial to describe things that relate to or are used in industry. 工业的 2. ADJ An industrial city or country is one in which industry is important or highly developed. 工业高度发达的
n. 恩里克（男子名）
vt. 使失去个性（等于depersonalize）
1. N-COUNT An airline is a company that provides regular services carrying people or goods in aeroplanes. 航空公司

1. V-T/V-I If you quote someone as saying something, you repeat what they have written or said. 引用; 引述 2. N-COUNT A quote from a book, poem, play, or speech is a passage or phrase from it. 引文; 引语 3. V-T If you quote something such as a law or a fact, you state it because it supports what you are saying. 引用 (法律条款、事实等) 4. V-T If someone quotes a price for doing something, they say how much money they would charge you for a service they are offering or a for a job that you want them to do. 报 (价) 5. N-COUNT A quote for a piece of work is the price that someone says they will charge you to do the work. 报价 6. V-T PASSIVE If a company's shares, a substance, or a currency is quoted at a particular price, that is its current market price. 报 (公司股票、物质、货币) 的牌价 [商业] 7. N-PLURAL Quotes are the same as quotation marks. 引号 [非正式]
1. ADJ Holistic means based on the principles of holism. 整体主义的 [正式]

1. N-COUNT The tentacles of an animal such as an octopus are the long thin parts that are used for feeling and holding things, for getting food, and for moving. 触须 2. N-COUNT If you talk about the tentacles of a political, commercial, or social organization, you are referring to the power and influence that it has in the outside community. (政治、经济或社会组织的影响) 触角 [表不满]

1. ADJ A brutal act or person is cruel and violent. 残暴的 2. brutally ADV 残暴地 3. ADJ If someone expresses something unpleasant with brutal honesty or frankness, they express it in a clear and accurate way, without attempting to disguise its unpleasantness. 不留情面的 (诚实、直白) 4. brutally ADV 不留情面地
1. ADJ A charismatic person attracts, influences, and inspires people by their personal qualities. 有魅力的

1. V-T If you imagine something, you think about it and your mind forms a picture or idea of it. 想像 2. V-T If you imagine that something is the case, you think that it is the case. 猜想 3. V-T If you imagine something, you think that you have seen, heard, or experienced that thing, although actually you have not. 幻想
1. ADJ An instinctive feeling, idea, or action is one that you have or do without thinking or reasoning. 本能的 2. instinctively ADV 本能地 [ADV with v]

1. N-UNCOUNT Peat is decaying plant material that is found under the ground in some cool, wet regions. Peat can be added to soil to help plants grow, or can be burned to produce coal. 泥炭 2. N a person, esp a woman (尤指女)人 [archaic, derogatory]
1. N-COUNT The debut of a performer or sports player is their first public performance, appearance, or recording. 首次登台
1. ADJ Something that is intact is complete and has not been damaged or changed. 完整无缺的

1. N-PLURAL Communications are the systems and processes that are used to communicate or broadcast information, especially by means of electricity or radio waves. 通信 2. N-COUNT A communication is a message. 信息 [正式] 3. → see also communicate

1. ADJ A charitable organization or activity helps and supports people who are ill, disabled, or very poor. 慈善的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Someone who is charitable to people is kind or understanding toward them. 仁慈的
1. ADJ Homogeneous is used to describe a group or thing which has members or parts that are all the same. 同种类的 [正式]

1. V-I To cater to a group of people means to provide all the things that they need or want. 满足…需要; 迎合 2. V-I To cater to something means to take it into account. 考虑 3. V-T If a person or company caters an occasion such as a wedding or a party, they provide food and drink for all the people there. (在婚礼、派对等场合) 提供餐饮服务; 承办酒席 4. → see also catering

1. N-COUNT The peak of a process or an activity is the point at which it is at its strongest, most successful, or most fully developed. (过程、活动的) 顶峰 2. V-I When something peaks, it reaches its highest value or its highest level. 达到峰值 3. ADJ The peak level or value of something is its highest level or value. 峰值的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ Peak times are the times when there is most demand for something or most use of something. 高峰的 (时期) [ADJ n] 5. N-COUNT A peak is a mountain or the top of a mountain. 山峰 6. N-COUNT The peak of a cap is the part at the front that sticks out over your eyes. 帽檐 [英国英语]
1. N extremely happy 极乐 [英国英语] [非正式]
1. N-COUNT An aisle is a long narrow gap that people can walk along between rows of seats in a public building such as a church or between rows of shelves in a supermarket. (座位间或货架间的) 通道

1. V-T To confine something to a particular place or group means to prevent it from spreading beyond that place or group. 将 (某事物) 控制 (在某地范围内) 2. V-T If you confine somebody or something, you prevent them from leaving or escaping. 监禁 3. V-T If you confine yourself or your activities to something, you do only that thing and are involved with nothing else. 将 (自己或自己的活动) 局限于
为什么 怎么会…(那样)
1. N-COUNT A haven is a place where people or animals feel safe, secure, and happy. 安全处所 2. → see also safe haven
n. 诺贝尔（瑞典化学家及发明家，发明炸药，创设诺贝奖）；诺贝尔（姓氏）

1. N the body constituted by the French Third Estate in June 1789 after the calling of the Estates General. It was dissolved in Sept 1791 to be replaced by the new Legislative Assembly (法国)国民议会 [French history]
1. ADJ An illicit activity or substance is not allowed by law or the social customs of a country. 违法的; 不正当的

1. ADJ If you are inclined to behave in a particular way, you often behave in that way, or you want to do so. 常表现出…的; 有…意向的 [v-link ADJ] 2. ADJ If you say that you are inclined to have a particular opinion, you mean that you hold this opinion but you are not expressing it strongly. 倾向于…的 [v-link ADJ to-inf] [含糊] 3. ADJ Someone who is mathematically inclined or artistically inclined, for example, has a natural talent for mathematics or art. 有…天赋的 [adv ADJ] 4. → see also incline
adv. 突然地；唐突地

1. V-T/V-I If you practise, or practise something, you keep doing it regularly in order to be able to do it better. 练习 2. → see also practised 3. V-T When people practise something such as a custom, craft, or religion, they take part in the activities associated with it. 遵循; 信奉; 从事 4. practising ADJ 信奉的 [ADJ n] 5. V-T If something cruel is regularly done to people, you can say that it is practised on them. 施行 [usu passive] 6. V-T/V-I Someone who practises medicine or law works as a doctor or a lawyer. 从事 (医药、法律等工作)

1. ADJ If you are sympathetic to someone who is in a bad situation, you are kind to them and show that you understand their feelings. 同情的 2. sympathetically ADV 同情地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If you are sympathetic to a proposal or action, you approve of it and are willing to support it. 赞同的 4. sympathetically ADV 赞同地 [ADV with v]

1. V-T If a building or space can accommodate someone or something, it has enough room for them. 容纳 [no cont] 2. V-T To accommodate someone means to provide them with a place to live or stay. 为…提供住宿 3. V-T If something is planned or changed to accommodate a particular situation, it is planned or changed so that it takes this situation into account. 使…适应 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A rogue is a man who behaves in a dishonest or criminal way. 流氓; 无赖 2. N-COUNT If a man behaves in a way that you do not approve of but you still like him, you can refer to him as a rogue. 捣蛋鬼; 小坏蛋 [情感] 3. ADJ A rogue element is someone or something that behaves differently from others of its kind, often causing damage. 行为异常的 [ADJ n]
1. V-T To reshape something means to change its structure or organization. 改变; 重塑 2. reshaping N-SING [also no det, usu N 'of' n]
n. 田纳西州（美国州名）
n. 乌拉圭（拉丁美洲国家）
1. ADJ Something that is catastrophic involves or causes a sudden terrible disaster. 灾难性的 2. ADJ If you describe something as catastrophic, you mean that it is very bad or unsuccessful. 极糟的; 失败的

1. N-COUNT A sheet is a large rectangular piece of cotton or other cloth that you sleep on or cover yourself with in a bed. 床单; 被单 2. N-COUNT A sheet of paper is a rectangular piece of paper. (一) 张 (纸) 3. N-COUNT You can use sheet to refer to a piece of paper which gives information about something. (一份) 资料 4. N-COUNT A sheet of glass, metal, or wood is a large, flat, thin piece of it. (一) 块 (玻璃、金属或木头等) 5. N-COUNT A sheet of something is a thin wide layer of it over the surface of something else. (一) 大层 (覆盖物) 6. V to provide with, cover, or wrap in a sheet 包裹 7. V (of rain, snow, etc) to fall heavily (雨，雪等)下得很大 8. → see also balance sheet, broadsheet, fact sheet, spreadsheet, worksheet

1. ADJ You can use sheer to emphasize that a state or situation is complete and does not involve or is not mixed with anything else. 纯粹的 [ADJ n] [强调] 2. ADJ A sheer cliff or drop is extremely steep or completely vertical. 陡峭的; 完全垂直的 3. ADJ Sheer material is very thin, light, and delicate. 极轻薄的
1. ADJ If something is sufficient for a particular purpose, there is enough of it for the purpose. 足够的 2. sufficiently ADV 足够地
1. ADJ Unintended results were not planned to happen, although they happened. 非故意的
n. 卢森堡公国；卢森堡（卢森堡公国首都）

1. ADJ Revolutionary activities, organizations, or people have the aim of causing a political revolution. 革命的 2. N-COUNT A revolutionary is a person who tries to cause a revolution or who takes an active part in one. 革命者 3. ADJ Revolutionary ideas and developments involve great changes in the way that something is done or made. 革命性的

1. N-COUNT The coast is an area of land that is next to the sea. 海岸 2. V-I If a vehicle coasts somewhere, it continues to move there with the motor switched off, or without being pushed or pedalled. (车辆的) 惯性滑行

1. N-COUNT If you make a detour on a trip, you go by a route which is not the shortest way, because you want to avoid something such as a traffic jam, or because there is something you want to do on the way. 绕行 2. N-COUNT A detour is a special route for traffic to follow when the normal route is blocked, for example, because it is being repaired. 绕行道 [美国英语]
1. V-T If you endorse someone or something, you say publicly that you support or approve of them. 公开支持; 赞同 2. V-T If you endorse a product or company, you appear in advertisements for it. 代言
富有的（wealthy的比较级）
1. N-VAR The amount of something is how much there is, or how much you have, need, or get. 数量 2. V-I If something amounts to a particular total, all the parts of it add up to that total. 总计
n. 卡特（男子名）
1. N-UNCOUNT Illiteracy is the state of not knowing how to read or write. 文盲

1. N-COUNT A needle is a small, very thin piece of polished metal which is used for sewing. It has a sharp point at one end and a hole in the other for a thread to go through. 针 2. N-COUNT A needle is a thin hollow metal rod with a sharp point, which is part of a medical instrument called a syringe. It is used to put a drug into someone's body, or to take blood out. 注射针 3. N-COUNT Knitting needles are thin sticks that are used for knitting. They are usually made of plastic or metal and have a point at one end. (编织) 针 4. N-COUNT A needle is a thin metal rod with a point which is put into a patient's body during acupuncture. (针灸用的) 银针 5. N-COUNT On an instrument which measures something such as speed or weight, the needle is the long strip of metal or plastic on the dial that moves backward and forward, showing the measurement. (仪表上的) 指针 6. N-COUNT The needles of a fir or pine tree are its thin, hard, pointed leaves. (杉树、松树等的) 针叶
1. ADJ A fatal action has very undesirable effects. 后果严重的 2. fatally ADV 后果严重地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ A fatal accident or illness causes someone's death. (事故、疾病) 致命的 4. fatally ADV (事故、疾病) 致命地

1. N-COUNT Sponge is a very light soft substance with lots of little holes in it, which can be either artificial or natural. It is used to clean things or as a soft layer. 海绵 2. N-COUNT A sponge is a piece of sponge that you use for washing yourself or for cleaning things. (洗澡或清洁用的) 海绵块 3. V-T If you sponge something, you clean it by wiping it with a wet sponge. 用湿海绵擦拭 4. PHRASAL VERB Sponge down means the same as . 用湿海绵擦洗 5. V-I If you say that someone sponges off other people or sponges on them, you mean that they regularly get money from other people when they should be trying to support themselves. 揩油 [非正式] 6. N-VAR A sponge is a light cake or pudding made from flour, eggs, sugar, and sometimes shortening. 松软蛋糕; 松软布丁 [英国英语]
1. N-COUNT Someone's successor is the person who takes their job after they have left. 继任者

1. V-T/V-I If one thing is converted or converts into another, it is changed into a different form. 转变 2. V-T If someone converts a room or building, they alter it in order to use it for a different purpose. 改建 3. V-T If you convert a vehicle or piece of equipment, you change it so that it can use a different fuel. 改装 4. V-T If you convert a quantity from one system of measurement to another, you calculate what the quantity is in the second system. 换算 5. V-T/V-I If someone converts you, they persuade you to change your religious or political beliefs. You can also say that someone converts to a different religion. 改变信仰 6. N-COUNT A convert is someone who has changed their religious or political beliefs. 改变信仰的人 [oft N 'to' n] 7. N-COUNT If you describe someone as a convert to something, you mean that they have recently become very enthusiastic about it. 热衷…的人 [usu N 'to' n]
n. 天安门
1. V-T/V-I If money or interest accrues, it gradually increases in amount over a period of time. 累积 (过程) [商业]

1. V-I If you groan, you make a long, low sound because you are in pain, or because you are upset or unhappy about something. 呻吟 2. N-COUNT Groan is also a noun. 呻吟 3. V-T If you groan something, you say it in a low, unhappy voice. 呻吟着说 4. V-I If you groan about something, you complain about it. 抱怨 5. N-COUNT Groan is also a noun. 抱怨 6. V-I If wood or something made of wood groans, it makes a loud sound when it moves. (木头移动时) 发吱嘎声 7. V-I If you say that something such as a table groans under the weight of food, you are emphasizing that there is a lot of food on it. 堆满 [强调] 8. V-I If you say that someone or something is groaning under the weight of something, you think there is too much of that thing. 受重压 [usu cont] [表不满]

1. ADJ You use elaborate to describe something that is very complex because it has a lot of different parts. 复杂的 2. ADJ Elaborate plans, systems, and procedures are complicated because they have been planned in very great detail, sometimes too much detail. (有时过于) 周密的 3. elaborately ADV 周密地 4. ADJ Elaborate clothing or material is made with a lot of detailed artistic designs. 设计繁丽的 5. V-T If you elaborate a plan or theory, you develop it by making it more complicated and more effective. 周密制定; 周密发展 6. elaboration N-UNCOUNT 周密的制定; 周密的发展 7. V-I If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details. 作详细阐述

1. N-COUNT A distinction between similar things is a difference. 区别 2. PHRASE If you draw a distinction or make a distinction, you say that two things are different. 区分 3. N-COUNT A distinction is a special award or honour that is given to someone because of their very high level of achievement. 荣誉 4. N-UNCOUNT Distinction is the quality of being very good or better than other things of the same type. 卓越 [正式] 5. N-SING If you say that someone or something has the distinction of being something, you are drawing attention to the fact that they have the special quality of being that thing. Distinction is normally used to refer to good qualities, but can sometimes also be used to refer to bad qualities. 特质

1. ADV If something is routinely done, it is done as a normal part of a job or process. 例行地; 常规性地 2. ADV If something happens routinely, it happens repeatedly and is not surprising, unnatural, or new. 照例地 [ADV with v]

1. N-COUNT A review of a situation or system is its formal examination by people in authority. This is usually done in order to see whether it can be improved or corrected. (上级的) 审查 [oft N 'of' n, also prep N] 2. V-T If you review a situation or system, you consider it carefully to see what is wrong with it or how it could be improved. 审裁; 审度 3. N-COUNT A review is a report in the media in which someone gives their opinion of something such as a new book or movie. 评论 4. V-T If someone reviews something such as a new book or movie, they write a report or give a talk on television or radio in which they express their opinion of it. 对 (新作品) 作评论 5. V-T/V-I When you review for an examination, you read things again and make notes in order to be prepared for the examination. 复习 [美国英语] 6. N-COUNT Review is also a noun. 复习
1. ABBREVIATION for Very Worshipful 最尊敬的
1. V-I If someone or something squeals, they make a long, high-pitched sound. 发出长而尖的声音 2. N-COUNT Squeal is also a noun. 长而尖的声音

1. N-COUNT A continent is a very large area of land, such as Africa or Asia, that consists of several countries. 洲 2. N-PROPER People sometimes use the Continent to refer to the continent of Europe except for Britain. (除英国外的) 欧洲大陆 [英国英语] 3. ADJ able to control urination and defecation 能控制大小便的
n. （法）瑞士（等于Switzerland）

1. N-VAR A descent is a movement from a higher to a lower level or position. 下降 2. N-COUNT A descent is a surface that slopes downward, for example, the side of a steep hill. 下坡 3. N-SING When you want to emphasize that a situation becomes very bad, you can talk about someone's or something's descent into that situation. 沉沦; 没落 [强调] 4. N-UNCOUNT You use descent to talk about a person's family background, for example, their nationality or social status. 出身 [正式]
1. N-VAR A hospital is a place where people who are ill are cared for by nurses and doctors. 医院
乌里韦 乌里韦

1. V-T If someone in authority suppresses an activity, they prevent it from continuing, by using force or making it illegal. 镇压; 压制 2. suppression N-UNCOUNT 镇压; 压制 3. V-T If a natural function or reaction of your body is suppressed, it is stopped, for example by drugs or illness. 抑制 (身体功能或反应) 4. suppression N-UNCOUNT 抑制 5. V-T If you suppress your feelings or reactions, you do not express them, even though you might want to. 抑制 (情感或反应) 6. suppression N-UNCOUNT 抑制 7. V-T If someone suppresses a piece of information, they prevent other people from learning it. 封锁 8. suppression N-UNCOUNT 封锁 9. V-T If someone or something suppresses a process or activity, they stop it continuing or developing. 阻止 (活动); 抑制 (过程)

1. N-UNCOUNT Lace is a very delicate cloth which is made with a lot of holes in it. It is made by twisting together very fine threads of cotton to form decorative patterns. 花边 2. N-COUNT Laces are thin pieces of material that are put through special holes in some types of clothing, especially shoes. The laces are tied together in order to tighten the clothing. 系带 3. V-T If you lace something such as a pair of shoes, you tighten the shoes by pulling the laces through the holes, and usually tying them together. 系…的带子 4. PHRASAL VERB Lace up means the same as . 系…的带子 (同)(lace) 5. V-T To lace food or drink with a substance such as alcohol or a drug means to put a small amount of the substance into the food or drink. 在 (食物、饮料) 中添加

1. N-VAR A sentiment that people have is an attitude which is based on their thoughts and feelings. 情绪 2. N-COUNT A sentiment is an idea or feeling that someone expresses in words. 观点; 感想 3. N-UNCOUNT Sentiment is feelings such as pity or love, especially for things in the past, and may be considered exaggerated and foolish. 伤感; 感情

1. V-LINK If something constitutes a particular thing, it can be regarded as being that thing. 构成 [no cont] 2. V-LINK If a number of things or people constitute something, they are the parts or members that form it. (某数量的物或人) 构成 (某事物) [no cont]
1. ADJ If you describe someone's actions as dogged, you mean that they are determined to continue with something even if it becomes difficult or dangerous. 顽强的 [ADJ n] 2. doggedly ADV 顽强地
崭新的

1. N-UNCOUNT Triage is the process of quickly examining sick or injured people, for example, after an accident or a battle, so that those who are in the most serious condition can be treated first. (如事故、战斗后迅速查看伤员以决定哪些人应优先治疗的)伤病员鉴别分类 [医学] [oft N n]
1. N-COUNT A villa is a fairly large house, especially one in a hot country or a resort. (尤指热带国家或风景区的) 别墅

1. V-T If you commend someone or something, you praise them formally. 表杨; 称赞 [正式] 2. commendation N-COUNT 表扬; 称赞 3. V-T If someone commends a person or thing to you, they tell you that you will find them good or useful. 推荐 [正式]

1. N-SING A gloss is a bright shine on the surface of something. 光泽 2. N-UNCOUNT Gloss is an appearance of attractiveness or good quality which sometimes hides less attractive features or poor quality. 表面光 3. N-SING If you put a gloss on a bad situation, you try to make it seem more attractive or acceptable by giving people a false explanation or interpretation of it. 粉饰 4. N-MASS Gloss is the same as . 有光涂料 5. V-T If you gloss a difficult word or idea, you provide an explanation of it. 注解 6. N-COUNT a short or expanded explanation or interpretation of a word, expression, or foreign phrase in the margin or text of a manuscript, etc 引申的注解
1. V-T To commemorate an important event or person means to remember them by means of a special action, ceremony, or specially created object. 纪念 2. commemoration N-VAR 纪念

1. N-MASS An acid is a chemical substance, usually a liquid, which contains hydrogen and can react with other substances to form salts. Some acids burn or dissolve other substances that they come into contact with. 酸 2. ADJ An acid substance contains acid. 酸性的 3. acidity N-UNCOUNT 酸性 [oft N 'of' n]
1. ADJ Wearable clothes are practical, comfortable, and suitable for ordinary people to wear, rather than being very unusual or extreme. 适于穿着的

1. N-COUNT If you describe a problem or a responsibility as a burden, you mean that it causes someone a lot of difficulty, worry, or hard work. 负担 2.
