N-COUNT A burden is a heavy load that is difficult to carry. 重负 [正式] 3. V-T If someone burdens you with something that is likely to worry you, for example, a problem or a difficult decision, they tell you about it. 使烦恼 4. N a line of words recurring at the end of each verse of a ballad or similar song; chorus or refrain 叠句

1. N-UNCOUNT Consideration is careful thought about something. 仔细考虑 2. N-UNCOUNT If something is under consideration, it is being discussed. 在讨论中 3. N-UNCOUNT If you show consideration, you pay attention to the needs, wishes, or feelings of other people. 体贴 4. N-COUNT A consideration is something that should be thought about, especially when you are planning or deciding something. 考虑因素 5. PHRASE If you take something into consideration, you think about it because it is relevant to what you are doing. 考虑到某事物
休息几分钟，休息一下
1. ADJ (of a person, part of the body, etc) extremely cold (人、身体部位等)冰冷的 [非正式]
1. NUM A trillion is 1,000,000,000,000,000,000. 百万兆 [英国英语] 2. NUM A trillion is 1,000,000,000,000. 万亿 [美国英语]

1. ADJ If a person or country adopts a neutral position or remains neutral, they do not support anyone in a disagreement, war, or contest. 中立的 2. N-COUNT A neutral is someone who is neutral. 中立者 3. neutrality N-UNCOUNT 中立 4. ADJ If someone speaks in a neutral voice or if the expression on their face is neutral, they do not show what they are thinking or feeling. 不动声色的 5. neutrality N-UNCOUNT 不动声色 6. ADJ If you say that something is neutral, you mean that it does not have any effect on other things because it lacks any significant qualities of its own, or it is an equal balance of two or more different qualities, amounts, or ideas. 不引起变化的; 中和的 7. N-UNCOUNT Neutral is the position between the gears of a vehicle such as a car, in which the gears are not connected to the engine. 空档 8. ADJ In an electrical device or system, the neutral wire is one of the three wires needed to complete the circuit so that the current can flow. The other two wires are called the ground wire and the live or positive wire. (电

1. N-COUNT A pilot is a person who is trained to fly an aircraft. 飞行员 2. N-COUNT A pilot is a person who steers a ship through a difficult stretch of water, for example, the entrance to a harbour. 领航员 3. V-T If someone pilots an aircraft or ship, they act as its pilot. 驾驶 (飞机); 为 (船只) 领航 4. ADJ A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale. 试验性的 5. V-T If a government or organization pilots a programme or project, they test it, before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale. 试行 (计划或方案)
全风；鼓风炉全风
1. N quantitative data on any subject, esp data comparing the distribution of some quantity for different subclasses of the population 统计数据

1. ADJ Something that is clean is free from dirt or unwanted marks. 清洁的 2. ADJ You say that people or animals are clean when they keep themselves or their surroundings clean. 爱干净的 3. ADJ A clean fuel or chemical process does not create many harmful or polluting substances. 无污染的 4. ADJ If you describe something such as a book, joke, or lifestyle as clean, you think that they are not sexually immoral or offensive. 纯洁的; 不淫秽的 [表赞许] 5. ADJ If someone has a clean reputation or record, they have never done anything illegal or wrong. 清白的 6. ADJ A clean game or fight is carried out fairly, according to the rules. 公正的 7. cleanly ADV 公正地 8. ADJ A clean sheet of paper has no writing or drawing on it. (纸张) 空白的 9. V-T/V-I If you clean something or clean dirt off it, you make it free from dirt and unwanted marks, for example by washing or wiping it. If something cleans easily, it is easy to clean. 把…弄干净; 清洁 10. cleaning N-UNCOUNT 清洁 11. V-T/V-I If you clean a room or house, you make the inside of it and the furn
1. V-T If you reassure someone, you say or do things to make them stop worrying about something. 使安心; 使消除疑虑

1. V-T/V-I If your skin chafes or is chafed by something, it becomes sore as a result of something rubbing against it. 擦痛; 蹭疼 2. V-I If you chafe at something such as a restriction, you feel annoyed about it. 恼火 [正式] [no passive]
1. PHRASAL VERB If workers are laid off, they are told by their employers to leave their job, usually because there is no more work for them to do. 解雇 [商业] 2. → see also layoff
1. N-PLURAL Binoculars consist of two small telescopes joined together side by side, which you look through in order to look at things that are a long distance away. 双筒望远镜 [also 'a pair of' N]

1. N-TITLE/N-COUNT/N-VOC In the army, navy, and some other armed forces, a captain is an officer of middle rank. (陆军、海军及其他军种的) 上尉 2. N-COUNT The captain of a sports team is the player in charge of it. (体育运动队) 队长 3. N-COUNT The captain of a ship is the sailor in charge of it. 船长 4. N-COUNT/N-TITLE The captain of an aeroplane is the pilot in charge of it. 机长 5. N-COUNT/N-TITLE In the United States and some other countries, a captain is a police officer or firefighter of fairly senior rank. 警察局副巡官; 消防中队长 6. V-T If you captain a team or a ship, you are the captain of it. 率队; 指挥

1. V-T If one thing displaces another, it forces the other thing out of its place, position, or role, and then occupies that place, position, or role itself. 取代 2. V-T If a person or group of people is displaced, they are forced to move away from the area where they live. 使背井离乡 [usu passive]
1. N-VAR Adversity is a very difficult or unfavourable situation. 困境; 逆境
1. N-COUNT A palace is a very large impressive house, especially one that is the official home of a king, queen, or president. 宫殿
1. N a variation in the strength of received radio signals due to variations in the conditions of the transmission medium 信号时强时弱
斯卡利亚（人名）

1. ADJ If a part of your body is poised, it is completely still but ready to move at any moment. 摆好姿势准备行动的 2. ADJ If someone is poised to do something, they are ready to take action at any moment. 随时准备行动的 [v-link ADJ] 3. ADJ If you are poised, you are calm, dignified, and self-controlled. 镇定的
adv. 主观地；臆想地；内省地
1. N-COUNT A missive is a letter or other message that someone sends. 书信; 函件 [HUMOROUS, LITERARY]
1. N-COUNT A hurricane is an extremely violent storm that begins over ocean water. 飓风

1. V-T/V-I When you respond to something that is done or said, you react to it by doing or saying something yourself. 回应 2. V-I When you respond to a need, crisis, or challenge, you take the necessary or appropriate action. 应对 3. V-I If a patient or their injury or illness is responding to treatment, the treatment is working and they are getting better. 作出反映
1. N-VAR Your allegiance is your support for and loyalty to a particular group, person, or belief. 拥护

1. PHRASE If you do something for the sake of something, you do it for that purpose or in order to achieve that result. You can also say that you do it for something's sake. 为了…的目的 2. PHRASE If you do something for its own sake, you do it because you want to, or because you enjoy it, and not for any other reason. You can also talk about, for example, art for art's sake or sport for sport's sake. 由于自身原因 3. PHRASE When you do something for someone's sake, you do it in order to help them or make them happy. 为帮助某人; 为使某人开心 4. PHRASE Some people use expressions such as for God's sake, for heaven's sake, for goodness' sake, or for Pete's sake in order to express annoyance or impatience, or to add force to a question or request. The expressions "for God's sake" and "for Christ's sake" could cause offence. (用以加强质问或请求的语气，表示厌恶或烦躁) 看在上帝的份上 [非正式]
1. Shrunk is the past participle of . (shrink)的过去分词

1. N-VAR Misery is great unhappiness. 苦难 2. N-UNCOUNT Misery is the way of life and unpleasant living conditions of people who are very poor. 穷困 3. PHRASE If someone makes your life a misery, they behave in an unpleasant way towards you over a period of time and make you very unhappy. 使某人的生活非常不开心 4. PHRASE If you put someone out of their misery, you tell them something that they are very anxious to know. 告知情况 (使不再焦虑) [非正式] 5. PHRASE If you put an animal out of its misery, you kill it because it is sick or injured and cannot be cured or healed. 杀死 (动物) 以使其摆脱痛苦
联合国千年发展目标（Millennium Development Goals）
1. N-COUNT A publisher is a person or a company that publishes books, newspapers, or magazines. 出版者; 出版公司
1. V-T To endanger something or someone means to put them in a situation where they might be harmed or destroyed completely. 危害
1. N-COUNT A constraint is something that limits or controls what you can do. 限制 2. N-UNCOUNT Constraint is control over the way you behave which prevents you from doing what you want to do. 约束
n. 莫拉莱斯（人名）

1. V-T If a building or window overlooks a place, you can see the place clearly from the building or window. 俯瞰 2. V-T If you overlook a fact or problem, you do not notice it, or do not realize how important it is. 忽视 3. V-T If you overlook someone's faults or bad behaviour, you forgive them and take no action. 不理会
1. V-T If you idolize someone, you admire them very much. 崇拜
1. ADJ Hefty means large in size, weight, or amount. 庞大的; 沉重的 [非正式] 2. ADJ A hefty movement is done with a lot of force. 有力的 [非正式]
n. 体重…克者 n. 格拉默公司（德国知名的汽车业供应商）

1. V-T If someone establishes something such as an organization, a type of activity, or a set of rules, they create it or introduce it in such a way that it is likely to last for a long time. 建立; 确立 2. V-RECIP If you establish contact with someone, you start to have contact with them. You can also say that two people, groups, or countries establish contact. 建立 (联系) [正式] 3. V-T If you establish that something is true, you discover facts that show that it is definitely true. 证实 [正式] 4. established ADJ 被证实了的 5. V-T If you establish yourself, your reputation, or a good quality that you have, you succeed in doing something, and achieve respect or a secure position as a result of this. 确立 (地位)

1. V-T To cleave something means to split or divide it into two separate parts, often violently. 劈开 [文学性] 2. V-I If someone cleaves to something or to someone else, they begin or continue to have strong feelings of loyalty towards them. 坚忠于 [正式]
1. ADJ If you describe a person or their behaviour as brazen, you mean that they are very bold and do not care what other people think about them or their behaviour. 无所顾忌的 2. brazenly ADV 无所顾忌地
1. N-UNCOUNT Platinum is a very valuable, silvery-grey metal. It is often used for making jewellery. 铂; 白金
1. ADJ If someone is muddled, they are confused about something. 糊涂的

1. N-UNCOUNT Presentation is the appearance of something, that someone has worked to create. 外观 2. N-COUNT A presentation is a formal event at which someone is given a prize or award. 颁奖仪式 3. N-COUNT When someone gives a presentation, they give a formal talk, often in order to sell something or get support for a proposal. 讲座 4. → see also present
n. 协同程序

1. ADJ Intense is used to describe something that is very great or extreme in strength or degree. 剧烈的; 极度的 2. intensely ADV 剧烈地; 极度地 3. ADJ If you describe an activity as intense, you mean that it is very serious and concentrated, and often involves doing a lot in a short time. 集中的; 紧张的 4. ADJ If you describe the way someone looks at you as intense, you mean that they look at you very directly and seem to know what you are thinking or feeling. 热切的 5. intensely ADV 热切地 [ADV with v] 6. ADJ If you describe a person as intense, you mean that they appear to concentrate very hard on everything that they do, and they feel their emotions very strongly. 很认真的 7. intensity N-UNCOUNT 过分认真

1. N-UNCOUNT Success is the achievement of something that you have been trying to do. 成效 2. N-UNCOUNT Success is the achievement of a high position in a particular field, for example in business or politics. (在商业、政治等领域的) 成功 3. N-UNCOUNT The success of something is the fact that it works in a satisfactory way or has the result that is intended. (某事物的) 成功 4. N-COUNT Someone or something that is a success achieves a high position, makes a lot of money, or is admired a great deal. 成功的人; 成功的事物
1. N-COUNT A noun is a word such as "car," "love," or "Anne" which is used to refer to a person or thing. 名词 2. → see also count noun, proper noun

1. V-T If you reclaim something that you have lost or that has been taken away from you, you succeed in getting it back. 拿回; 收回 2. V-T If you reclaim an amount of money, for example tax that you have paid, you claim it back. 要求归还 3. V-T When people reclaim land, they make it suitable for a purpose such as farming or building, for example by draining it or by building a barrier against the sea. 开垦; 改造 4. V-T If a piece of land that was used for farming or building is reclaimed by a desert, forest, or the sea, it turns back into desert, forest, or sea. 重新变成 (沙漠、森林、海洋) [usu passive]
1. V-T If someone is imprisoned, they are locked up or kept somewhere, usually in prison, as a punishment for a crime or for political opposition. 监禁
1. ADJ If someone is a part-time worker or has a part-time job, they work for only part of each day or week. 部分时间的; 兼职的 2. ADV Part-time is also an adverb. 部分时间地; 兼职地 [ADV after v]

1. N-UNCOUNT Accommodation is buildings or rooms where people live or stay. 住所 [英国英语] [also N in pl] 2. N-UNCOUNT Accommodation is space in buildings or vehicles that is available for certain things, people, or activities. (楼内或车内等) 专用空间 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A tune is a series of musical notes that is pleasant and easy to remember. 曲调 2. N-COUNT You can refer to a song or a short piece of music as a tune. 歌曲; 乐段 3. V-T When someone tunes a musical instrument, they adjust it so that it produces the right notes. 为 (乐器) 调音 4. PHRASAL VERB Tune up means the same as . 调音 5. V-T When an engine or machine is tuned, it is adjusted so that it works well. 调整 (发动机或机器) [usu passive] 6. PHRASAL VERB Tune up means the same as . 调整 7. V-T If your radio or television is tuned to a particular channel or broadcasting station, you are listening to or watching the programmes being broadcast by that station. 调整 (频道或频率) [usu passive] 8. → see also fine-tune 9. PHRASE If you say that a person or organization is calling the tune, you mean that they are in a position of power or control in a particular situation. 定调子; 发号施令 10. PHRASE If you say that someone has changed their tune, you are criticizing them because they have changed their opinion or way of doing thing
1. N-COUNT-COLL A tribunal is a special court or committee that is appointed to deal with particular problems. 特别法庭; 特别委员会

1. N-COUNT An estate is a large area of land in the country which is owned by a person, family, or organization. 庄园 2. N-COUNT Someone's estate is all the money and property that they leave behind when they die. 遗产 [法律] 3. → see also real estate

1. N-COUNT A taboo against a subject or activity is a social custom to avoid doing that activity or talking about that subject, because people find them embarrassing or offensive. 禁忌 2. ADJ Taboo is also an adjective. 禁忌的

1. V-T If you eject someone from a place, you force them to leave. 逐出 2. ejection N-VAR 逐出 3. V-T To eject something means to remove it or push it out forcefully. 用力排出; 用力推出 4. V-I When a pilot ejects from an aircraft, he or she leaves the aircraft quickly using an ejector seat, usually because the plane is about to crash. (从飞机里) 弹射出来

1. ADJ An uneven surface or edge is not smooth, flat, or straight. 不平坦的; 不直的 2. ADJ Something that is uneven is not regular or consistent. 不规则的; 不一致的 3. ADJ An uneven system or situation is unfairly arranged or organized. 不均衡的
1. N-COUNT A weasel is a small wild animal with a long thin body, a tail, short legs, and reddish-brown fur. 鼬
1. N-VAR A tradition is a custom or belief that has existed for a long time. 传统

1. ADJ A paramilitary organization is organized like an army and performs either civil or military functions in a country. (组织) 准军事性的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT Paramilitaries are members of a paramilitary organization. 准军事组织成员 3. ADJ A paramilitary organization is an illegal group that is organized like an army. 非法军事组织的 [ADJ n] 4. N-COUNT Paramilitaries are members of an illegal paramilitary organization. 非法军事组织成员
1. ADJ Something that is grisly is extremely unpleasant, and usually involves death and violence. 恐怖的 2. N [OBSOLETE] → a variant spelling of grizzly
1. N-COUNT A ceremony is a formal event such as a wedding. 仪式; 典礼 2. N-UNCOUNT Ceremony consists of the special things that are said and done on very formal occasions. (全套) 仪式
1. N-UNCOUNT Journalism is the job of collecting news and writing about it for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio. 新闻工作

1. V-T If you squeeze something, you press it firmly, usually with your hands. (常指用手) 挤压; 紧捏 2. N-COUNT Squeeze is also a noun. 紧捏; 挤压 3. V-T If you squeeze a liquid or a soft substance out of an object, you get the liquid or substance out by pressing the object. 挤; 压榨 (液体等) 4. V-T/V-I If you squeeze a person or thing somewhere or if they squeeze there, they manage to get through or into a small space. 塞进; 挤进 5. N-SING If you say that getting a number of people into a small space is a squeeze, you mean that it is only just possible for them all to get into it. 满塞 [非正式]
1. N-COUNT A derivative is something which has been developed or obtained from something else. 衍生物

1. N-COUNT Vegetables are plants such as cabbages, potatoes, and onions that you can cook and eat. 蔬菜 2. ADJ Vegetable matter comes from plants. 植物的 [正式] 3. N-COUNT If someone refers to a brain-damaged person as a vegetable, they mean that the person cannot move, think, or speak. 植物人 [非正式，侮辱] [usu sing]

1. V-T If someone forces you to do something, they make you do it even though you do not want to, for example, by threatening you. 强迫 2. V-T If a situation or event forces you to do something, it makes it necessary for you to do something that you would not otherwise have done. 迫使 3. V-T If someone forces something on or upon you, they make you accept or use it when you would prefer not to. 强加 4. V-T If you force something into a particular position, you use a lot of strength to make it move there. 用力压住 5. V-T If someone forces a lock, a door, or a window, they break the lock or fastening in order to get into a building without using a key. 强行 (打开) 6. V to cause (plants or farm animals) to grow or fatten artificially at an increased rate 人工提速育肥(植物和家禽) 7. PHRASE If you force your way through or into somewhere, you have to push or break things that are in your way in order to get there. 强行进入 1. N-UNCOUNT If someone uses force to do something, or if it is done by force, strong and violent physical actio
1. N-VAR A trellis is a frame which supports climbing plants. (支撑攀缘植物的)棚架
1. N-SING The gloom is a state of near darkness. 昏暗 2. N-UNCOUNT Gloom is a feeling of sadness and lack of hope. 忧郁
1. N-UNCOUNT The brevity of something is the fact that it is short or lasts for only a short time. 短暂 [正式] [oft N 'of' n]

1. N-VAR A revolt is an illegal and often violent attempt by a group of people to change their country's political system. 造反; 叛乱 2. V-I When people revolt, they make an illegal and often violent attempt to change their country's political system. 造反; 叛乱 3. N-VAR A revolt by a person or group against someone or something is a refusal to accept the authority of that person or thing. 反抗; 抵制 4. V-I When people revolt against someone or something, they reject the authority of that person or reject that thing. 反抗; 抵制

1. V-I If something glimmers, it produces or reflects a faint, gentle, often unsteady light. 闪烁微光 2. N-COUNT A glimmer is a faint, gentle, often unsteady light. 微光 3. N-COUNT A glimmer of something is a faint sign of it. 一丝 (迹象)
1. N-UNCOUNT Candour is the quality of speaking honestly and openly about things. 直率; 直言不讳
adv. 在军事上；从军事角度；以武力；以军事行动
1. ADJ having a present right to the immediate or future possession and enjoyment of property 既定的 [property law]
1. N-UNCOUNT Coercion is the act or process of persuading someone forcefully to do something that they do not want to do. 胁迫
1. ADJ If you describe an amount as whopping, you are emphasizing that it is large. 庞大的 [非正式] [ADJ n]
1. N the son of Isaac, twin brother of Esau, and father of the twelve patriarchs of Israel 雅各; 以撒的儿子 [Old Testament]

1. V-T If you align yourself with a particular group, you support them because you have the same political aim. 与…结盟 2. V-T If you align something, you place it in a certain position in relation to something else, usually parallel to it. 使对齐

1. N-COUNT If something is a priority, it is the most important thing you have to do or deal with, or must be done or dealt with before everything else you have to do. 优先处理的事 2. PHRASE If you give priority to something or someone, you treat them as more important than anything or anyone else. 优先考虑 3. PHRASE If something takes priority or has priority over other things, it is regarded as being more important than them and is dealt with first. 有优先性
1. ADJ If someone or something is conspicuous, people can see or notice them very easily. 显眼的 2. conspicuously ADV 显眼地

1. V-I If something conforms to something such as a law or someone's wishes, it is of the required type or quality. (与法律、愿望等) 相符合 2. V-I If you conform, you behave in the way that you are expected or supposed to behave. 守规矩

1. N-COUNT A subscription is an amount of money that you pay regularly in order to belong to an organization, to help a charity or campaign, or to receive copies of a magazine or newspaper. 会员费; 捐赠款; 征订费 2. ADJ Subscription television is television that you can watch only if you pay a subscription. A subscription channel is a channel that you can watch only if you pay a subscription. (电视或频道) 付费的 [ADJ n]
1. N-PLURAL the constellation Gemini, the third sign of the zodiac 双子星座; 黄道十二宫中的第三个
1. V-T To pollute water, air, or land means to make it dirty and dangerous to live in or to use, especially with poisonous chemicals or sewage. 污染 2. polluted ADJ 受污染的
1. N-COUNT A pastor is a member of the clergy in some churches, especially Protestant churches. (尤指新教的)牧师
1. ADJ Something that is perceptible can barely be seen or noticed. 勉强看得见的; 勉强察觉的 2. perceptibly ADV [ADV with v]
1. ADJ If you describe someone as nosy, you mean that they are interested in things which do not concern them. 爱管闲事的 [非正式]
n. 朝鲜人；韩国人（Korean的复数形式）
1. V to treat (something) inappropriately as if it can be acquired or marketed like other commodities 使商品化
1. ADJ If you describe something bad, such as a crime or disease, as rampant, you mean that it is very common and is increasing in an uncontrolled way. 猖獗的; 泛滥的
连续；成一长行

1. V-T/V-I If something snaps or if you snap it, it breaks suddenly, usually with a sharp cracking noise. 使喀嚓折断; 喀嚓折断 2. N-SING Snap is also a noun. 喀嚓的断裂声 3. V-T/V-I If you snap something into a particular position, or if it snaps into that position, it moves quickly into that position, with a sharp sound. 使发出啪的一声; 发出啪的一声 4. N-SING Snap is also a noun. 吧嗒声 5. V-T If you snap your fingers, you make a sharp sound by moving your middle finger quickly across your thumb, for example, in order to accompany music or to order someone to do something. 打响指 6. N-SING Snap is also a noun. 打响指 [N 'of' n] 7. V-T/V-I If someone snaps at you, they speak to you in a sharp, unfriendly way. 声色俱厉地说 8. V-I If someone snaps, or if something snaps inside them, they suddenly stop being calm and become very angry because the situation has become too tense or too difficult for them. (人) 突然发怒; (物) 突然爆发 9. V-I If an animal such as a dog snaps at you, it opens and shuts its jaws quickly near you, as if it were going to bite yo

1. V-RECIP If two or more things differ, they are unlike each other in some way. 不同 2. V-RECIP If people differ about something, they do not agree with each other about it. 有异议 3. to agree to differ →see agree

1. V-T If you forgive someone who has done something bad or wrong, you stop being angry with them and no longer want to punish them. 原谅 2. V-T Forgive is used in polite expressions and apologies like "forgive me" and "forgive my ignorance" when you are saying or doing something that might seem rude, silly, or complicated. 请原谅 [礼貌] 3. V-T PASSIVE If you say that someone could be forgiven for doing something, you mean that they were wrong or mistaken, but not seriously, because many people would have done the same thing in those circumstances. 谅解
1. N the level of knowledge and development achieved in a technique, science, etc, esp at present 技术发展最新水平 2. ADJ the most recent and therefore considered the best; up-to-the-minute 最先进的; 最新水平的
adv. 下班；工作完毕后

1. ADJ The singular form of a word is the form that is used when referring to one person or thing. (名词) 单数的 2. N-SING The singular of a noun is the form of it that is used to refer to one person or thing. (名词的) 单数形式
1. ADJ Nordic means relating to the Scandinavian countries of northern Europe. 斯堪的纳维亚的 [ADJ n]
adv. 历史上地；从历史观点上说
1. N-COUNT A client of a professional person or organization is a person or company that receives a service from them in return for payment. 客户 [商业]

1. N-UNCOUNT Liaison is cooperation and the exchange of information between different organizations or between different sections of an organization. 联络 2. N-UNCOUNT If someone acts as liaison with a particular group, or between two or more groups, their job is to encourage co-operation and the exchange of information. 联络员 [also 'a' N, oft N 'with' n]
1. N a person who roves; wanderer 流浪者; 漫游者 1. N a pirate or pirate ship 海盗; 海盗船 1. N a machine for roving wool, cotton, etc, or a person who operates such a machine 粗纺机; 粗纺机工
n. 魁北克（加拿大港市省名）
adv. 共同地，全体地

1. V-T If you deceive someone, you make them believe something that is not true, usually in order to get some advantage for yourself. 欺骗 2. V-T If something deceives you, it gives you a wrong impression and makes you believe something that is not true. 误导
1. V-T/V-I If a company outsources work or things, it pays workers from outside the company and often outside the country to do the work or supply the things. 外包 [商业] 2. outsourcing N-UNCOUNT 外包
1. ADJ If you describe someone as imperious, you mean that they have a proud manner and expect to be obeyed. 专横的; 傲慢的; 飞扬跋扈的 [书面] [ADV with v] 2. imperiously ADV

1. ADJ If you describe an action, rule, or decision as arbitrary, you think that it is not based on any principle, plan, or system. It often seems unfair because of this. 随意的 [表不满] 2. arbitrarily ADV 随意地 [ADV with v]

1. V-T If you support someone or their ideas or aims, you agree with them, and perhaps help them because you want them to succeed. 支持 2. N-UNCOUNT Support is also a noun. 支持 3. N-UNCOUNT If you give support to someone during a difficult or unhappy time, you are kind to them and help them. (给处境困难或不幸者的) 帮助 4. N-UNCOUNT Financial support is money provided to enable an organization to continue. (给组织的) 资助 5. V-T If you support someone, you provide them with money or the things that they need. 资助; 供养 6. V-T If a fact supports a statement or a theory, it helps to show that it is true or correct. 证实 7. N-UNCOUNT Support is also a noun. 证明 8. V-T If something supports an object, it is underneath the object and holding it up. 支撑 9. N-COUNT A support is a bar or other object that supports something. 支撑物 10. V-T If you support yourself, you prevent yourself from falling by holding onto something or by leaning on something. 倚着 11. N-UNCOUNT Support is also a noun. 倚靠 12. V-T If you support a sports team, you
1. PHRASAL VERB If you tell someone not to mess with a person or thing, you are warning them not to get involved with that person or thing. 干涉

1. V-T If you persuade someone to do something, you cause them to do it by giving them good reasons for doing it. 说服 2. V-T If something persuades someone to take a particular course of action, it causes them to take that course of action because it is a good reason for doing so. 引发 (某人采取行动) 3. V-T If you persuade someone that something is true, you say things that eventually make them believe that it is true. 使相信

1. ADJ If you are in a buoyant mood, you feel cheerful and behave in a lively way. 快活的 2. ADJ A buoyant economy is a successful one in which there is a lot of trade and economic activity. 繁荣的 3. ADJ A buoyant object floats on a liquid. 浮起的
1. V-T To emphasize something means to indicate that it is particularly important or true, or to draw special attention to it. 强调

1. V-T If you simulate an action or a feeling, you pretend that you are doing it or feeling it. 假装 2. V-T If you simulate a set of conditions, you create them artificially, for example, in order to conduct an experiment. 模拟
腾讯公司
1. N-COUNT A saga is a long story, account, or sequence of events. 长篇故事; 长篇记叙; 一长串事件 2. N-COUNT A saga is a long story composed in medieval times in Norway or Iceland. 萨迦 (中世纪挪威、冰岛的长篇传说)
1. N-COUNT Theeveof a particular event or occasion is the day before it, or the period of time just before it. 前一天; 前夕 2. → see also Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve

1. N-COUNT Norms are ways of behaving that are considered normal in a particular society. 准则 2. N-SING If you say that a situation is the norm, you mean that it is usual and expected. 惯例; 常规 3. N-COUNT A norm is an official standard or level that organizations are expected to reach. 标准
1. N-VAR A doctrine is a set of principles or beliefs, especially religious ones. (尤指宗教的) 信条; 学说

1. ADJ If people who were working are idle, they have no jobs or work. 无事可做的 [v-link ADJ] 2. ADJ If machines or factories are idle, they are not working or being used. (机器或工厂) 闲置的 [v-link ADJ] 3. ADJ If you say that someone is idle, you disapprove of them because they are not doing anything and you think they should be. 无所事事的 [表不满] 4. idly ADV 无所事事地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ Idle is used to describe something that you do for no particular reason, often because you have nothing better to do. 无聊的 [ADJ n] 6. idly ADV 无聊地 7. ADJ You refer to an idle threat or boast when you do not think the person making it will or can do what they say. 虚张声势的 [ADJ n] 8. V-I If an engine or vehicle is idling, the engine is running slowly and quietly because it is not in gear, and the vehicle is not moving. (发动机等) 低速空转
1. ADJ If you are twitchy, you are behaving in a nervous way that shows you feel anxious and cannot relax. 焦躁不安的 [非正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT Noise is a loud or unpleasant sound. 噪音 2. N-COUNT A noise is a sound that someone or something makes. 声音 3. N-PLURAL If someone makes noises of a particular kind about something, they say things that indicate their attitude to it in a rather indirect or vague way. (间接、含蓄地表达的) 观点 4. PHRASE If you say that someone makes the right noises or makes all the right noises, you think that they are showing concern or enthusiasm about something because they feel they ought to rather than because they really want to. 故作热情地附和
n. 中微子（neutrino的复数）
1. N-COUNT In stories and legends, a dragon is an animal like a big lizard. It has wings and claws, and breathes out fire. 龙

1. ADJ Domestic political activities, events, and situations happen or exist within one particular country. 国内的 2. → see also gross domestic product 3. ADJ Domestic duties and activities are concerned with the running of a home and family. 家务的 [ADJ n] 4. ADJ Domestic items and services are intended to be used in people's homes rather than in factories or offices. 家用的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ A domestic situation or atmosphere is one which involves a family and their home. 家庭的 6. ADJ A domestic animal is one that is not wild and is kept either on a farm to produce food or in someone's home as a pet. 家养的; 饲养的
1. N-COUNT A nameplate is a sign on a door, wall, or desk which shows the name of the person or organization that occupies a particular place. (门上、墙上或桌上的)名牌
1. PHRASE If someone is playing catch-up, they are trying to equal or better someone else's performance. 奋起直追

1. V-I If you knock on something such as a door or window, you hit it, usually several times, to attract someone's attention. 敲 2. N-COUNT Knock is also a noun. 敲的声音 3. knocking N-SING 敲的声音 [also no det] 4. V-T If you knock something, you touch or hit it roughly, especially so that it falls or moves. 碰撞 5. N-COUNT Knock is also a noun. 碰撞 6. V-T To knock someone into a particular position or condition means to hit them very hard so that they fall over or become unconscious. 重击 7. V-T To knock a particular quality or characteristic out of someone means to make them lose it. 使失去 [no cont] 8. V-T If you knock something or someone, you criticize them and say unpleasant things about them. 批评; 指责 [非正式] 9. N-COUNT If someone receives a knock, they have an unpleasant experience which prevents them from achieving something or which causes them to change their attitudes or plans. 打击 10. to knock someone or something into shape →see shape
1. N-COUNT Your passport is an official document containing your name, photograph, and personal details, which you need to show when you enter or leave a country. 护照
1. N-UNCOUNT Litigation is the process of fighting or defending a case in a civil court of law. 诉讼

1. ADJ Someone who is competent is efficient and effective. 有能力的 2. competently ADV 有能力地 3. ADJ If you are competent to do something, you have the skills, abilities, or experience necessary to do it well. 能胜任的

1. N-UNCOUNT If you have access to a building or other place, you are able or allowed to go into it. 进入手段; 进入权 2. N-UNCOUNT If you have access to something such as information or equipment, you have the opportunity or right to see it or use it. 使用权 3. N-UNCOUNT If you have access to a person, you have the opportunity or right to see them or meet them. 接触的机会; 接触的权利 4. V-T If you access something, especially information held on a computer, you succeed in finding or obtaining it. 获取 (尤其电脑信息)
adj. 得克萨斯州的；德克萨斯州人的 n. 得克萨斯州的人
1. ADJ Volcanic means coming from or created by volcanoes. 火山的
1. ADJ Something or someone that is fashionable is popular or approved of at a particular time. 时髦的 2. fashionably ADV 时髦地
1. N an error in writing or printing 书写错误; 印刷错误

1. N-COUNT A performer is a person who acts, sings, or does other entertainment in front of audiences. 表演者 2. N-COUNT You can use performer when describing someone or something in a way that indicates how well they do a particular thing. 表现…者
1. V-T When national leaders or organizations ratify a treaty or written agreement, they make it official by giving their formal approval to it, usually by signing it or voting for it. 批准 (条约或书面协议)
1. N-UNCOUNT Aerospace companies are involved in developing and making rockets, missiles, space vehicles, and related equipment. 航空航天 [usu N n]
1. ADJ A vicious person or a vicious blow is violent and cruel. 凶残的 2. viciously ADV 凶残地 3. ADJ A vicious remark is cruel and intended to upset someone. 恶毒的 4. viciously ADV 恶毒地 [ADV with v]

1. N-UNCOUNT Caution is great care which you take in order to avoid possible danger. 谨慎 2. V-T/V-I If someone cautions you, they warn you about problems or danger. 警告; 告诫 3. N-UNCOUNT Caution is also a noun. 警告; 告诫 4. to err on the side of caution →see err
adj. 最慢的（slow的最高级）
1. ADJ Abdominal is used to describe something that is situated in the abdomen or forms part of it. 腹部的 [正式] [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A guru is a person who some people regard as an expert or leader. 专家 2. N-COUNT/N-TITLE A guru is a religious and spiritual leader and teacher, especially in Hinduism. (尤指印度教的) 精神领袖
1. ADJ A self-inflicted wound or injury is one that you do to yourself deliberately. 自己造成的
1. N-COUNT The venue for an event or activity is the place where it will happen. 举办场所

1. N-COUNT A designer is a person whose job is to design things by making drawings of them. 设计师 2. ADJ Designer clothes or designer labels are expensive, fashionable clothes made by a famous designer, rather than being made in large quantities in a factory. 名师设计的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ You can use designer to describe things that are worn or bought because they are fashionable. 时尚的 [非正式] [ADJ n]
1. ADJ If you say that a person's behaviour or a system is lax, you mean they are not careful or strict about maintaining high standards. 松懈的; 不严格的 2. laxity N-UNCOUNT 松懈
n. 海牙（荷兰一座城市）

1. N-UNCOUNT If something gives you pleasure, you get a feeling of happiness, satisfaction, or enjoyment from it. 愉悦 2. N-UNCOUNT Pleasure is the activity of enjoying yourself, especially rather than working or doing what you have a duty to do. 娱乐 3. N-COUNT A pleasure is an activity, experience, or aspect of something that you find very enjoyable or satisfying. 乐事 4. CONVENTION If you meet someone for the first time, you can say, as a way of being polite, that it is a pleasure to meet them. You can also ask for the pleasure of someone's company as a polite and formal way of inviting them somewhere. 荣幸 (用于初次见面礼貌地打招呼) [礼貌] 5. CONVENTION You can say "It's a pleasure" or "My pleasure" as a polite way of replying to someone who has just thanked you for doing something. 乐意效劳 (用作回应别人的感谢时的礼貌用语) [套语]
n. 部长（minister的复数）；阁僚 v. 伺候；照顾（minister的第三人称单数形式）

1. N-UNCOUNT Inspiration is a feeling of enthusiasm you get from someone or something, that gives you new and creative ideas. 灵感 2. N-SING If you describe someone or something good as an inspiration, you mean that they make you or other people want to do or achieve something. 鼓舞人心的人 (或事物) [表赞许] 3. N-SING If something or someone is the inspiration for a particular book, work of art, or action, they are the source of the ideas in it or act as a model for it. 灵感来源; 原始动力 4. N-COUNT If you suddenly have an inspiration, you suddenly think of an idea of what to do or say. (突然想到的) 妙计
1. N-SING A hard sell is a method of selling in which the salesperson puts a lot of pressure on someone to make them buy something. 强行推销
1. V-T If one thing is offset by another, the effect of the first thing is reduced by the second, so that any advantage or disadvantage is cancelled out. 抵消
1. ADJ If you describe a statement as oblique, you mean that is not expressed directly or openly, making it difficult to understand. 隐晦的 2. obliquely ADV 隐晦地 [ADV with v]

1. N-COUNT A millennium is a period of one thousand years, especially one which begins and ends with a year ending in "000," for example the period from the year 1000 to the year 2000. 一千年 [正式] 2. N-SING Many people refer to the year 2000 as the Millennium. 2000年; 千禧年
adv. 等等，及其他

1. V-I If one thing or person lags behind another thing or person, their progress is slower than that of the other thing or person. 落后 2. V-I to cover (a pipe, cylinder, etc) with lagging to prevent loss of heat 给(管子、柱子等)加防护套来保温 3. N-COUNT A time lag or a lag of a particular length of time is a period of time between one event and another related event. 间隔 4. N-COUNT a convict or ex-convict (esp in the phrase old lag) 犯人(尤其在短语 old lag 中); 前科犯人

1. N-COUNT A drum is a musical instrument consisting of a skin stretched tightly over a round frame. You play a drum by beating it with sticks or with your hands. 鼓 2. N-COUNT A drum is a large cylindrical container which is used to store fuel or other substances. 鼓状容器 3. V-T/V-I If something drums on a surface, or if you drum something on a surface, it hits it regularly, making a continuous beating sound. 连续敲击
adj. 更健康（healthy的比较级）
n. 普朗克（德国物理学家）

1. N (before 1920) a supporter of the union of all Ireland and Great Britain 统一主义者; 1920年前支持爱尔兰与英国统一者 2. N (since 1920) a supporter of union between Britain and Northern Ireland 统一主义者; 1920年后支持北爱尔兰与英国统一者 3. ADJ of, resembling, or relating to Unionists (有关)统一主义者的

1. N-COUNT A mission is an important task that people are given to do, especially one that involves travelling to another country. (尤指远赴他国的) 使命 2. N-COUNT A mission is a group of people who have been sent to a foreign country to carry out an official task. 驻外使团 3. N-COUNT A mission is a special journey made by a military aeroplane or spacecraft. (军用飞机或宇宙飞船的) 飞行任务 4. N-SING If you say that you have a mission, you mean that you have a strong commitment and sense of duty to do or achieve something. 使命; 天职 5. N-COUNT A mission is the activities of a group of Christians who have been sent to a place to teach people about Christianity. 传教活动 6. N-COUNT A mission is a building or group of buildings in which missionary work is carried out. 布道所

1. ADJ Euphemistic language uses polite, pleasant, or neutral words and expressions to refer to things that people may find unpleasant, upsetting, or embarrassing to talk about, for example, sex, the human body, or death. 委婉的 2. euphemistically ADV 委婉地 [ADV with v]

1. N-COUNT The heroine of a book, play, film, or story is the main female character, who usually has good qualities. 女主人公 2. N-COUNT A heroine is a woman who has done something brave, new, or good, and who is therefore greatly admired by a lot of people. 女英雄 3. N-COUNT If you describe a woman as your heroine, you mean that you admire her greatly, usually because of a particular quality or skill that she has. 女性偶像

1. V-T When you purchase something, you buy it. 购买 [正式] 2. purchaser N-COUNT 购买者 3. N-UNCOUNT The purchase of something is the act of buying it. 购买 [正式] 4. N-COUNT A purchase is something that you buy. 购买的东西 [正式]

1. V-T If you stir a liquid or other substance, you move it around or mix it in a container using something such as a spoon. 搅动; 搅拌 2. V-I If you stir, you move slightly, for example because you are uncomfortable or beginning to wake up. 微动 [书面] 3. V-I If you do not stir from a place, you do not move from it. 离开 [书面] [usu with brd-neg] 4. V-T/V-I If something stirs or if the wind stirs it, it moves gently in the wind. 使轻轻拂动; 轻轻拂动 [书面] 5. V-T/V-I If a particular memory, feeling, or mood stirs or is stirred in you, you begin to think about it or feel it. 唤起; 萌生 [书面] 6. N-SING If an event causes a stir, it causes great excitement, shock, or anger among people. 轰动; 愤怒 7. N the act or an instance of stirring or the state of being stirred 搅动; 拨动 8. → see also stirring

1. V-T If you dismiss something, you decide or say that it is not important enough for you to think about or consider. 不予理会 2. V-T If you dismiss something from your mind, you stop thinking about it. 不再考虑 3. V-T When an employer dismisses an employee, the employer tells the employee that they are no longer needed to do the job that they have been doing. 解雇 4. V-T If you are dismissed by someone in authority, they tell you that you can go away from them. 准予…离去 5. V-T When a judge dismisses a case against someone, he or she formally states that there is no need for a trial, usually because there is not enough evidence for the case to continue. 不受理
1. N dead trees or branches 枯木
1. ADJ You use overhead to indicate that something is above you or above the place that you are talking about. 头顶上的 [ADJ n] 2. ADV Overhead is also an adverb. 在头顶 3. N-UNCOUNT →see overheads
adj. 状态性的；有状态的

1. V-I If something such as the value of something slumps, it falls suddenly and by a large amount. (价值等) 暴跌 2. N-COUNT Slump is also a noun. (价值等的) 暴跌 3. N-COUNT A slump is a time when many people in a country are unemployed and poor. 经济萧条时期 4. V-T/V-I If you slump somewhere, you fall or sit down there heavily, for example, because you are very tired or you feel ill. 瘫倒; (因劳累或生病等) 跌坐

1. V-T/V-I If you soften something or if it softens, it becomes less hard, stiff, or firm. 使变软; 变软 2. V-T If one thing softens the damaging effect of another thing, it makes the effect less severe. 使减弱 3. V-T/V-I If you soften your position, if your position softens, or if you soften, you become more sympathetic and less hostile or critical. 使变温和; 变温和 4. V-T/V-I If your voice or expression softens or if you soften it, it becomes much more gentle and friendly. 使温和; 变温和 5. V-T If you soften something such as light, a colour, or a sound, you make it less bright or harsh. 使 (光、颜色或声音) 变柔和 6. V-T Something that softens your skin makes it very smooth and pleasant to touch. 使 (皮肤) 变得光滑柔软
1. ADJ of or designating a Protestant Church, esp the Calvinist as distinct from the Lutheran 新教教会的

1. N-COUNT A decree is an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country. 法令 [also 'by' N] 2. N-COUNT A decree is a judgment made by a law court. 判决 [美国英语] 3. V-T If someone in authority decrees that something must happen, they decide or state this officially. 发布命令

1. ADJ Genuine is used to describe people and things that are exactly what they appear to be, and are not false or an imitation. 真正的 2. ADJ Genuine refers to things such as emotions that are real and not pretended. 真诚的 3. genuinely ADV 真诚地 4. ADJ If you describe a person as genuine, you approve of them because they are honest, truthful, and sincere in the way they live and in their relationships with other people. 诚实可靠的 [表赞许]

1. V-T When you assess a person, thing, or situation, you consider them in order to make a judgment about them. 评估 2. V-T When you assess the amount of money that something is worth or should be paid, you calculate or estimate it. 计算; 估算
n. 微软公司生产的“视窗”操作系统
1. N-SING Theonsetof something is the beginning of it, used especially to refer to something unpleasant. (尤指不愉快事情的) 开始

1. V-T If someone or something exerts influence, authority, or pressure, they use it in a strong or determined way, especially in order to produce a particular effect. 施加 (影响、压力); 运用 (权威) [正式] 2. V-T If you exert yourself, you make a great physical or mental effort, or work hard to do something. 耗费 (自己的精力) 3. exertion N-UNCOUNT 耗费
1. N-COUNT A compass is an instrument that you use for finding directions. It has a dial and a magnetic needle that always points to the north. 罗盘
1. N-VAR Expenditure is the spending of money on something, or the money that is spent on something. 花销; 支出 [正式]
1. V-T If someone taunts you, they say unkind or insulting things to you, especially about your weaknesses or failures. 嘲笑; 羞辱 2. N-COUNT Taunt is also a noun. 嘲笑; 羞辱
n. [图情][计] 目录；登记 vt. 登记；为…编目录 vi. 编目录；按确定价格收入目录（等于catalogue）
1. ABBREVIATION for in New Zealand State Owned Enterprise (新西兰)国有企业

1. N-VAR Admission is permission given to a person to enter a place, or permission given to a country to enter an organization. Admission is also the act of entering a place. 进入许可; 加入许可; 进入 2. N-VAR An admission is a statement that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true. 承认 3. N-PLURAL Admissions to a place such as a school or university are the people who are allowed to enter or join it. 获准入学者; 获准加入者 4. N-UNCOUNT Admission at a park, museum, or other place is the amount of money that you pay to enter it. (公园、博物馆等地的) 门票价格 5. N-UNCOUNT Admission is also used before a noun. 门票价格 (用于名词前)

1. ADJ Internal is used to describe things that exist or happen inside a country or organization. 国内的; 组织内部的 [ADJ n] 2. internally ADV 在国内; 在组织内部 3. ADJ Internal is used to describe things that exist or happen inside a particular person, object, or place. 体内的; 内部的 [ADJ n] 4. internally ADV 在体内; 在内部

1. N-VAR An intention is an idea or plan of what you are going to do. 意图 2. PHRASE If you say that you have no intention of doing something, you are emphasizing that you are not going to do it. If you say that you have every intention of doing something, you are emphasizing that you intend to do it. 不打算/打算 [强调]

1. N-COUNT A sack is a large bag made of thick paper or rough material. Sacks are used to carry or store things such as food or groceries. 大麻袋; 大厚纸袋 2. N-COUNT a tackle on a quarterback which brings him down before he has passed the ball 擒杀四分卫 [American football] 3. V-T If your employers sack you, they tell you that you can no longer work for them because you have done something that they did not like or because your work was not good enough. 开除 [英国英语] [非正式] 4. N-SING Sack is also a noun. 开除 5. N-UNCOUNT the plundering of a place by an army or mob, usually involving destruction, slaughter, etc 洗劫 6. V to plunder and partially destroy (a place) 劫掠(某处) 7. V to tackle and bring down a quarterback before he has passed the ball 四分卫擒抱 [American football]

1. ADJ If someone is libertarian or has libertarian attitudes, they believe in or support the idea that people should be free to think and behave in the way that they want. 持自由论的; 自由论者的 [正式] 2. N-COUNT A libertarian is someone who with libertarian views. 自由论者
1. ADJ If you are affluent, you have a lot of money. 富裕的 2. N-PLURAL The affluent are people who are affluent. 富人

1. N-VAR An interview is a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out if they are suitable for a job or school. 面试 2. V-T If you are interviewed for a particular job or school, someone asks you questions about yourself to find out if you are suitable for it. 对…面试 [usu passive] 3. N-COUNT An interview is a conversation in which a journalist puts questions to someone such as a famous person or politician. 采访 4. V-T When a journalist interviews someone such as a famous person, they ask them a series of questions. 采访 5. V-T When the police interview someone, they ask them questions about a crime that has been committed. 询问
1. ADJ If someone has greying hair, there is a lot of grey hair mixed with the person's natural colour. 变灰白的 [usu ADJ n]
1. N-VAR A briefing is a meeting at which information or instructions are given to people, especially before they do something. 信息发布会; 指示传达会 2. → see also brief
n. 墨尔本（澳大利亚一座城市）

1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES An institute is an organization set up to do a particular type of work, especially research or teaching. You can also use institute to refer to the building the organization occupies. 协会; 研究所 2. V-T If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it. 制定 (规章、制度); 创立 [正式]

1. N-SING The ground is the surface of the earth. 地面 ['the' N] 2. PHRASE Something that is below ground is under the Earth's surface or under a building. Something that is above ground is on top of the earth's surface. 在地面上/在地面下 3. N-SING If you say that something takes place on the ground, you mean it takes place on the surface of the earth and not in the air. 在地面上 4. N-SING Theground is the soil and rock on the earth's surface. 地面土壤和石头 5. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to land as ground, especially when it has very few buildings or when it is considered to be special in some way. 土地 6. N-COUNT You can use ground to refer to an area of land, sea, or air which is used for a particular activity. 场地 7. N-PLURAL The grounds of a large or important building are the garden or area of land which surrounds it. 庭院 8. N-VAR You can use ground to refer to a place or situation in which particular methods or ideas can develop and be successful. 地方; 环境 9. N-UNCOUNT You can use ground in expressions such as on shaky gro

1. N-COUNT A premium is a sum of money that you pay regularly to an insurance company for an insurance policy. 保险费 2. N-COUNT A premium is a sum of money that you have to pay for something in addition to the normal cost. 附加费 3. ADJ Premium products are of a higher than usual quality and are often expensive. 高端的 [ADJ n] 4. PHRASE If something is at a premium, it is wanted or needed, but is difficult to get or achieve. 求之难得 5. PHRASE If you buy or sell something at a premium, you buy or sell it at a higher price than usual, for example, because it is in short supply. 以高价 (买、卖)
1. V-T If you forego something, you decide to do without it, although you would like it. 放弃 [正式] 2. V to precede in time, place, etc 走在(时间、位置等)之前
1. ADJ A condemned man or woman is going to be executed. 判了死刑的
n. 合并；附加物
1. N the derived SI unit of electrical conductance equal to 1 reciprocal ohm 欧姆的倒数 ( symbol: SFormerly called mho)
1. ADJ A handheld device such as a camera or a computer is small and light enough to be used while you are holding it. 手持式的; 掌上的 2. N-COUNT Handheld is also a noun. 手持式装置
1. ADV You use nevertheless when saying something that contrasts with what has just been said. 然而 [正式] [ADV with cl]
大众营销；大规模市场销售

1. N-COUNT A pacifist is someone who believes that violence is wrong and refuses to take part in wars. 和平主义者; 反战者 2. ADJ If someone has pacifist views, they believe that war and violence are always wrong. 和平主义的; 反战的

1. V-T If someone asserts a fact or belief, they state it firmly. 坚定地陈述 [正式] 2. assertion N-VAR 断言 3. V-T If you assert your authority, you make it clear by your behaviour that you have authority. 显示 (权威) 4. assertion N-UNCOUNT (权威的) 显示 5. V-T If you assert your right or claim to something, you insist that you have the right to it. 坚持 (权利或要求) 6. assertion N-UNCOUNT 坚持 7. V-T If you assert yourself, you speak and act in a forceful way, so that people take notice of you. 彰显 (自己)
1. N-VAR If there is a scarcity of something, there is not enough of it for the people who need it or want it. 缺乏; 稀少 [正式]
v. 装备；预备（equip的过去分词）；整装
1. N-UNCOUNT Commerce is the activities and procedures involved in buying and selling things. 商业 2. → see also chamber of commerce

1. ADJ The ruling group of people in a country or organization is the group that controls its affairs. 统治的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT A ruling is an official decision made by a judge or court. 裁决 3. ADJ Someone's ruling passion or emotion is the feeling they have most strongly, which influences their actions. 最强烈的; 主导的 [ADJ n]
1. N → the plural of erratum
1. ADJ If there is an ample amount of something, there is enough of it and usually some extra. 充足的 2. amply ADV 充足地
1. N-UNCOUNT Roaming refers to the service provided by a mobile phone company which makes it possible for you to use your mobile phone when you travel. (移动电话) 漫游
n. 孟买（印度城市）
n. 埃琳娜（女子名，等于Helen）
adv. 悲哀地；悲痛地
为了…
1. N-PLURAL Cattle are cows and bulls. 牛

1. V-T When you compare things, you consider them and discover the differences or similarities between them. 比较 2. V-T If you compare one person or thing to another, you say that they are like the other person or thing. 认为…像… 3. V-I If you say that something does not compare with something else, you mean that it is much worse. 比得上 [usu with neg] 4. V-I If one thing compares favourably with another, it is better than the other thing. If it compares unfavourably, it is worse than the other thing. (与…) 比起来 (好、差) 5. → see also compared

1. N-COUNT A cabinet is a cupboard used for storing things such as medicine or alcoholic drinks or for displaying decorative things in. 贮藏橱; 陈列柜 2. N-COUNT The cabinet is a group of the most senior advisers or ministers in a government, who meet regularly to discuss policies. 内阁

1. ADJ An acoustic guitar or other instrument is one whose sound is produced without any electrical equipment. 自然声的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT If you refer to the acoustics of a space, you are referring to the structural features which determine how well you can hear music or speech in it. 传声效果 3. N-UNCOUNT Acoustics is the scientific study of sound. 声学
1. ADJ If you describe someone as industrious, you mean they work very hard. 勤奋的 [ADV with v] 2. industriously ADV
n. 完成，结束；实现

1. N-VAR The closure of a place such as a business or factory is the permanent ending of the work or activity there. 倒闭; 关闭 2. N-COUNT The closure of a road or border is the blocking of it in order to prevent people from using it. (道路、边界等的) 封闭 3. N-UNCOUNT If someone achieves closure, they succeed in accepting something bad that has happened to them. 认栽 [美国英语]
n. 普林斯顿（美国新泽西州中部的自治市镇）
1. ADJ occurring at the same time; contemporaneous 同时的
n. 西藏（中国一自治区）
adv. 适度地；中庸地；有节制地

1. ADJ Something that is embarrassing makes you feel shy or ashamed. 令人尴尬的 2. embarrassingly ADV 令人尴尬地 3. ADJ Something that is embarrassing to a public figure such as a politician or an organization such as a political party causes problems for them. 为难的
n. 夸张；夸大之词；夸张的手法

1. ADJ If an object or substance is transparent, you can see through it. 透明的 2. ADJ If a situation, system, or activity is transparent, it is easily understood or recognized. 易懂的; 显而易见的 3. ADJ You use transparent to describe a statement or action that is obviously dishonest or wrong, and that you think will not deceive people. If a person is transparent, you can see their true bad motives. 易识破的

1. N-COUNT A plume of smoke, dust, fire, or water is a large quantity of it that rises into the air in a column. 一缕 (烟雾、尘土等); 一股 (水柱); 一道 (火光) 2. N-COUNT A plume is a large, soft bird's feather. 大而柔的羽毛
n. 朱利叶斯（男子名）

1. N-PROPER/N-COUNT In some religions, hell is the place where the Devil lives, and where wicked people are sent to be punished when they die. Hell is usually imagined as being under the ground and full of flames. 地狱 2. N-VAR If you say that a particular situation or place is hell, you are emphasizing that it is extremely unpleasant. 令人痛苦不堪的处境 (或地方) [强调] 3. INTERJ Hell is used by some people when they are angry or excited, or when they want to emphasize what they are saying. This use could cause offence. 该死 [强调] 1. PHRASE You can use as hell after adjectives or some adverbs to emphasize the adjective or adverb. 很 [非正式] 2. PHRASE If someone does something for the hell of it, or just for the hell of it, they do it for fun or for no particular reason. 只是为了好玩 [非正式] 3. PHRASE You can use from hell after a noun when you are emphasizing that something or someone is extremely unpleasant or evil. 极坏 [非正式] 4. PHRASE If you tell someone to go to hell, you are angrily telling them to go away and leave you alone.
1. N a lifting device for heavy stone or concrete blocks consisting of a number of curved pieces of metal or wedges fitting into a dovetailed recess cut into the block 吊楔
n. (Rahm)人名；(英、德、西、芬、瑞典)拉姆

1. N-COUNT Someone who speaks with a particular accent pronounces the words of a language in a distinctive way that shows which country, region, or background they come from. 口音 2. N-COUNT An accent is a short line or other mark which is written above certain letters in some languages and which indicates the way those letters are pronounced. 变音符号

1. ADJ A faulty piece of equipment has something wrong with it and is not working properly. 出故障的 2. ADJ If you describe someone's argument or reasoning as faulty, you mean that it is wrong or contains mistakes, usually because they have not been thinking in a logical way. (常指未按逻辑思考而) 错误的
1. N-VAR An emission of something such as gas or radiation is the release of it into the atmosphere. 排放 [正式]
n. (Sirisena)人名；(斯里)西里塞纳

1. N-COUNT A proposal is a plan or an idea, often a formal or written one, which is suggested for people to think about and decide upon. (常为正式书面的) 提议 2. N-COUNT A proposal is the act of asking someone to marry you. 求婚

1. N-VAR If you are in disguise, you are not wearing your usual clothes or you have altered your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you. 伪装 2. V-T If you disguise yourself, you put on clothes which make you look like someone else or alter your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you. 乔装 3. disguised ADJ 乔装的 4. V-T To disguise something means to hide it or make it appear different so that people will not know about it or will not recognize it. 掩饰 5. disguised ADJ 掩饰的
n. 评价；[审计] 评估；估价；求值
1. N-COUNT A pundit is a person who knows a lot about a subject and is often asked to give information or opinions about it to the public. 权威; 专家
尼日利亚人

1. V-T If someone rigs an election, a job appointment, or a game, they dishonestly arrange it to get the result they want or to give someone an unfair advantage. (欺骗性地) 幕后操纵 2. V to equip (a vessel, mast, etc) with (sails, rigging, etc) 给(船、桅等)装配帆、锁具等 [nautical] 3. N-COUNT A rig is a large structure that is used for looking for oil or gas and for taking it out of the ground or the sea bed. 钻塔 4. N-COUNT A rig is a truck that is made in two or more sections which are jointed together by metal bars, so that the vehicle can turn more easily. 重型铰接式卡车 [美国英语] 5. N the distinctive arrangement of the sails, masts, and other spars of a vessel 船具装配 [nautical] 6. N a ridge or raised strip of unploughed land in a ploughed field 田埂 [SCOTTISH] [DIALECT]
1. V to breed within a single family or strain so as to produce particular characteristics in the offspring 种族内交配
1. N-UNCOUNT If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way. 优秀; 卓越
1. N-COUNT A condiment is a substance such as salt, pepper, or mustard that you add to food when you eat it in order to improve the flavour. 调料

1. N-COUNT Your ribs are the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest. 肋骨 2. N-COUNT A rib of meat such as beef or pork is a piece that has been cut to include one of the animal's ribs. 排骨 3. N a part or element similar in function or appearance to a rib, esp a structural or supporting member or a raised strip or ridge 4. V to furnish or support with a rib or ribs 装肋状物于; 用肋状物支撑 5. V to tease or ridicule 戏弄; 嘲笑 6. N a joke or hoax 玩笑; 恶作剧

1. N-COUNT Your backbone is the column of small linked bones down the middle of your back. 脊骨 2. N-UNCOUNT If you say that someone has no backbone, you think that they do not have the courage to do things which need to be done. 骨气 [oft with brd-neg]
1. N-COUNT An influx of people or things into a place is their arrival there in large numbers. (人或物的) 大量涌入

1. V-I If something quivers, it shakes with very small movements. 颤抖 2. V-I If you say that someone or their voice is quivering with an emotion such as rage or excitement, you mean that they are strongly affected by this emotion and show it in their appearance or voice. (声音因愤怒或激动而) 颤抖 3. N-COUNT Quiver is also a noun. 颤抖 4. N a case for arrows 弓箭箱
1. N-COUNT A funeral is the ceremony that is held when the body of someone who has died is buried or cremated. 葬礼
1. V-T When someone recites a poem or other piece of writing, they say it aloud after they have learned it. 出声背诵 2. V-T If you recite something such as a list, you say it aloud. 说出; 口头列举
1. INTERJ (used in signalling, telecommunications, etc) message received (在发射信号、电讯等使用)信收悉 → compare wilco 2. V (of a man) to copulate (with) 性交 [slang]

1. ADJ Commercial means involving or relating to the buying and selling of goods. 商业的 2. ADJ Commercial organizations and activities are concerned with making money or profits, rather than, for example, with scientific research or providing a public service. 商业化的 3. commercially ADV 商业化地 4. ADJ A commercial product is made to be sold to the public. 商业性的 [ADJ n] 5. commercially ADV 商业性地 6. ADJ A commercial vehicle is a vehicle used for carrying goods, or passengers who pay. 商用的 7. ADJ Commercial television and radio are paid for by the broadcasting of advertisements, rather than by the government. 商业化的 (电视或广播) 8. ADJ Commercial is used to describe something such as a film or a type of music that it is intended to be popular with the public, and is not very original or of high quality. 商业化的 (电影或音乐) 9. N-COUNT A commercial is an advertisement that is broadcast on television or radio. 电视或电台广告

1. N-SING A mass of things is a large number of them grouped together. 一堆 2. N-SING A mass of something is a large amount of it. 许多 3. QUANT Massesof something means a great deal of it. 大量 [非正式] 4. ADJ Mass is used to describe something which involves or affects a very large number of people. 人数众多的 [ADJ n] 5. N-COUNT A mass of a solid substance, a liquid, or a gas is an amount of it, especially a large amount which has no definite shape. 块; 团; 堆 6. N-PLURAL If you talk about the masses, you mean the ordinary people in society, in contrast to the leaders or the highly educated people. 普通百姓 7. N-SING Themassof people are most of the people in a country, society, or group. 大多数 8. V-T/V-I When people or things mass, or when you mass them, they gather together into a large crowd or group. 聚集 9. N-SING If you say that something is a mass of things, you mean that it is covered with them or full of them. 充满 10. N-VAR In physics, the mass of an object is the amount of physical matter that it has. 质量 [技术] 11

1. ADJ Something that is explicit is expressed or shown clearly and openly, without any attempt to hide anything. 明确表达的; 公开显露的 2. explicitly ADV 明确表达地; 公开显露地 3. ADJ If you are explicit about something, you speak about it very openly and clearly. 直言不讳的 [v-link ADJ, oft ADJ 'about' n] 4. explicitly ADV 直言不讳地 [ADV with v]
1. N-VAR The demolition of a structure, for example, a building, is the act of deliberately destroying it, often in order to build something else in its place. 拆毁

1. N-UNCOUNT Poverty is the state of being extremely poor. 贫穷 2. N-SING You can use poverty to refer to any situation in which there is not enough of something or its quality is poor. 贫乏 [正式] [also no det, N 'of' n]
1. N-PLURAL the art and science of the detailed direction and control of movement or manoeuvre of forces in battle to achieve an aim or task 战术 [军事]
非财务性的，非金融类的

1. N-COUNT If you take a step, you lift your foot and put it down in a different place, for example when you are walking. 脚步 2. V-I If you step on something or step in a particular direction, you put your foot on the thing or move your foot in that direction. 踩 3. N-COUNT Steps are a series of surfaces at increasing or decreasing heights, on which you put your feet in order to walk up or down to a different level. 台阶 4. N-COUNT A step is a raised flat surface in front of a door. 门槛 5. → see also doorstep 6. N-COUNT A step is one of a series of actions that you take in order to achieve something. 步骤 7. N-COUNT A step in a process is one of a series of stages. 阶段 8. N-COUNT The steps of a dance are the sequences of foot movements which make it up. 舞步 9. N-SING Someone's step is the way they walk. 步伐 10. PHRASE If you stay one step ahead of someone or something, you manage to achieve more than they do or avoid competition or danger from them. 领先一步; 避开 11. PHRASE If people who are walking or dancing a
1. V-T If you consume something, you eat or drink it. 吃; 喝 [正式] 2. V-T To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up. 消耗 3. → see also consuming
1. V-T If you mash food that is solid but soft, you crush it so that it forms a soft mass. 把…捣成糊状 2. N-COUNT a soft pulpy mass or consistency 糊状物

1. V-I If a condition or problem stems from something, it was caused originally by that thing. 起源于 2. V-T If you stem something, you stop it spreading, increasing, or continuing. 阻止 [正式] 3. N-COUNT The stem of a plant is the thin, upright part on which the flowers and leaves grow. 茎 4. N a technique in which the heel of one ski or both skis is forced outwards from the direction of movement in order to slow down or turn 转动滑雪屐以减速或转弯的技术 [skiing]

1. V-T/V-I If you concentrate on something, or concentrate your mind on it, you give all your attention to it. 集中 (心思); 专心 2. V-T If something is concentrated in an area, it is all there rather than being spread around. 集中 [usu passive]

1. N-VAR To give or be protection against something unpleasant means to prevent people or things from being harmed or damaged by it. 保护 2. N-UNCOUNT If an insurance policy gives you protection against an event such as death, injury, fire, or theft, the insurance company will give you or your family money if that event happens. (保险单提供的) 保险 [oft N 'against' n] 3. N-UNCOUNT If a government has a policy of protection, it helps its own industries by putting a tax on imported goods or by restricting imports in some other way. 贸易保护 [商业]
1. V-I When people congregate, they gather together and form a group. 聚集
1. N-VAR A coincidence is when two or more similar or related events occur at the same time by chance and without any planning. 巧合
1. ADJ Menial work is very boring, and the people who do it have a low status and are usually badly paid. 卑微的

1. N-VAR A quantity is an amount. 数量 2. N-UNCOUNT Things that are produced or available in quantity are produced or available in large amounts. 大量 3. N-UNCOUNT You can use quantity to refer to the amount of something that there is, especially when you want to contrast it with its quality. (尤指相对于质量而言的) 数量 4. PHRASE If you say that someone or something is an unknown quantity, you mean that not much is known about what they are like or how they will behave. 未知量; 未知数

1. V-T/V-I If you consult an expert or someone senior to you or consult with them, you ask them for their opinion, advice, or permission. 咨询 2. V-T If you consult a book or a map, you look in it or look at it in order to find some information. 查阅 3. V-RECIP If a person or group of people consults with other people or consults them, or if two people or groups consult, they talk and exchange ideas and opinions about what they might decide to do. 商量

1. N-COUNT If one country or group of countries imposes an embargo against another, it forbids trade with that country. 贸易禁运 2. V-T If goods of a particular kind are embargoed, people are not allowed to import them from a particular country or export them to a particular country. 禁止贸易

1. ADJ Continental is used to refer to something that belongs to or relates to a continent. 大陆的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ The continental United States consists of all the states which are situated on the continent of North America, as opposed to Hawaii and territories such as the Virgin Islands. 内陆的 (美国) [美国英语] 3. ADJ Continental means existing or happening in the American colonies during the American Revolution. 大陆的 (指在美国独立战争期间的美国殖民地存在或发生的) [美国英语] [usu ADJ n] 4. ADJ Continental means situated on or belonging to the continent of Europe except for Britain. (除英国外的) 欧洲大陆的 [英国英语] [ADJ n] 5. N-COUNT Continentals were soldiers who fought in the Continental Army against the British in the American Revolution. (美国独立战争中的) 大陆军士兵 [美国英语]

1. N-COUNT When you are talking about a crime or something wrong that has been done, you can refer to the person who did it as the culprit. 犯罪者; 犯错者 2. N-COUNT When you are talking about a problem or bad situation, you can refer to its cause as the culprit. (造成问题或麻烦的) 原因

1. ADJ A capitalist country or system supports or is based on the principles of capitalism. 基于资本主义原则的 2. N-COUNT A capitalist is someone who believes in and supports the principles of capitalism. 资本主义者; 资本主义拥护者 3. N-COUNT A capitalist is someone who owns a business which they run in order to make a profit for themselves. 资本家
1. ADJ Someone or something that is anti-Semitic is hostile to or prejudiced against Jewish people. 反犹太主义的

1. ADJ Something that is inset with a decoration or piece of material has the decoration or material set inside it. 镶嵌着...的 2. N-COUNT An inset is a small picture, diagram, or map that is inside a larger one. 大图中插入的小图
1. N a fine soft leather made from goatskins, used for bookbinding, shoes, etc 摩洛哥羊皮革(用于书本装订、制鞋等) 2. N (as modifier) 摩洛哥

1. V-T If you wrest something from someone else, you take it from them, especially when this is difficult or illegal. (尤指艰难或非法)攫取; 抢夺 [journalism] [文学性] 2. V-T If you wrest something from someone who is holding it, you take it from them by pulling or twisting it violently. 抢夺 [文学性]
1. V-I If something dwindles, it becomes smaller, weaker, or less in number. 缩小; 减少

1. ADJ A terminal illness or disease causes death, often slowly, and cannot be cured. (疾病) 晚期的; 致命的 2. terminally ADV 致命地 [ADV adj] 3. N-COUNT A terminal is a place where vehicles, passengers, or goods begin or end a journey. 起点站; 终点站 [usu supp N] 4. N-COUNT A computer terminal is a piece of equipment consisting of a keyboard and a screen that is used for putting information into a computer or getting information from it. (计算机) 终端 [计算机] 5. N-COUNT On a piece of electrical equipment, a terminal is one of the points where electricity enters or leaves it. (电路的) 端头
1. N-COUNT You use situation to refer generally to what is happening in a particular place at a particular time, or to refer to what is happening to you. 情况; 形势
西尔维奥
1. ADJ Someone who is subdued is very quiet, often because they are sad or worried about something. (因难过、担心而) 沉默寡言的 2. ADJ Subdued lights or colours are not very bright. (灯光或颜色) 柔和的
1. V to temper or toughen (something) by heat treatment 使退火 2. N an act of annealing 退火
n. [天] 年；年龄；岁月；年代
vi. 向上促销；增销

1. ADJ Something that is inferior is not as good as something else. 较差的 2. ADJ If one person is regarded as inferior to another, they are regarded as less important because they have less status or ability. 低等的; 次要的 3. N-COUNT Inferior is also a noun. (能力或地位) 低于他人者; 部下 4. inferiority N-UNCOUNT 自卑

1. V-RECIP If two or more things are intertwined or intertwine, they are closely connected with each other in many ways. 交织 2. V-RECIP If two things intertwine, they are twisted together or go over and under each other. 缠绕

1. N-UNCOUNT Horror is a feeling of great shock, fear, and worry caused by something extremely unpleasant. 震惊; 恐惧 2. N-SING If you have a horror of something, you are afraid of it or dislike it very much. 恐惧; 憎恶 3. N-SING The horror of something, especially something that hurts people, is its very great unpleasantness. 恐怖性 4. N-COUNT You can refer to extremely unpleasant or frightening experiences as horrors. 令人恐怖的经历 5. ADJ A horror film or story is intended to be very frightening. (影片或故事) 内容恐怖的 [ADJ n] 6. ADJ You can refer to an account of a very unpleasant experience or event as a horror story. (经历或事件) 非常不愉快的 [ADJ n]
vt. 预先形成 n. 粗加工的成品

1. N-UNCOUNT In linguistics, ellipsis means leaving out words rather than repeating them unnecessarily; for example, saying "I want to go but I can't" instead of "I want to go but I can't go." (语言学中的)省略 [技术] 2. N-UNCOUNT a sequence of three dots (…) indicating an omission in text 省略号 [printing]

1. N-VAR A uniform is a special set of clothes which some people, for example soldiers or the police, wear to work in and which some children wear in school. 制服 2. ADJ If something is uniform, it does not vary, but is even and regular throughout. 一致的 3. uniformity N-UNCOUNT 一致性 4. ADJ If you describe a number of things as uniform, you mean that they are all the same. 同样的 5. uniformity N-UNCOUNT 相同性
n. 缅因州（美国州名）
v. 呼吁；上诉；要求；对…有吸引力

1. N-VAR If you have the nationality of a particular country, you were born there or have the legal right to be a citizen. 国籍 2. N-COUNT You can refer to people who have the same racial origins as a nationality, especially when they do not have their own independent country. (尤指没有自己独立国家的) 民族
1. ADJ A place that is packed is very crowded. 拥挤的 2. ADJ Something that is packed with things contains a very large number of them. 充满的 [v-link ADJ 'with' n]
n. 十字形；矛盾 adj. 十字形的；交叉的 vt. 画十字形于…；使…交叉成十字状 vi. 交叉；交叉往来 adv. 十字形地；十字交叉地
1. N-COUNT A notion is an idea or belief about something. 想法 2. N-PLURAL Notions are small articles for sewing, such as buttons, zips, and thread. 缝纫用的杂物 (如扣子、拉锁、线等) [美国英语]

1. N-VAR Instinct is the natural tendency that a person or animal has to behave or react in a particular way. 本能 2. N-COUNT If you have an instinct for something, you are naturally good at it or able to do it. 天分 3. N-VAR If it is your instinct to do something, you feel that it is right to do it. 本能的反应 4. N-VAR Instinct is a feeling, rather than an opinion or idea based on facts, that something is the case. 直觉
1. ADJ A collecting tin or box is the same as a . collecting tin或box皆同collection box [英国英语] [ADJ n] 2. → see also collect
1. N-VAR Intervention is the act of intervening in a situation. 干涉

1. N-COUNT The resources of an organization or person are the materials, money, and other things that they have and can use in order to function properly. 财力 2. N-COUNT A country's resources are the things that it has and can use to increase its wealth, such as coal, oil, or land. 资源
1. ADJ Logistic or logistical means relating to the organization of something complicated. 在组织上的 [ADJ n] 2. logistically ADV 在组织上 3. N an uninterpreted calculus or system of symbolic logic 数理逻辑; 符号逻辑

1. N-COUNT A survivor of a disaster, accident, or illness is someone who continues to live afterward in spite of coming close to death. 幸存者 2. N-COUNT A survivor of a very unpleasant experience is a person who has had such an experience, and who is still affected by it. 经受过不幸的人 3. N-COUNT A person's survivors are the members of their family who continue to live after they have died. (家中) 尚活着的人 [美国英语]

1. N-COUNT A grave is a place where a dead person is buried. 坟墓 2. ADJ A grave event or situation is very serious, important, and worrying. 严重的 3. gravely ADV 严重地 4. ADJ A grave person is quiet and serious in their appearance or behaviour. 严肃的 5. gravely ADV 严肃地 6. ADJ In some languages, such as French, a grave accent is a symbol that is placed over a vowel in a word to show how the vowel is pronounced. For example, the word "mère" has a grave accent over the first "e." 抑音符号 [ADJ n] 7. PHRASE If you say that someone who is dead would turn or turn over in their grave at something that is happening now, you mean that they would be very shocked or upset by it, if they were alive. (让死者) 在九泉之下不得安宁 8. V to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave 凿; 雕; 刻
1. N-UNCOUNT Patronage is the support and money given by someone to a person or a group such as a charity. 赞助

1. N-COUNT An obstacle is an object that makes it difficult for you to go where you want to go, because it is in your way. 障碍物 2. N-COUNT You can refer to anything that makes it difficult for you to do something as an obstacle. 障碍
1. the CHEMICAL SYMBOL for dysprosium 镝
adv. 含蓄地；暗中地

1. V-T If you calculate a number or amount, you discover it from information that you already have, by using arithmetic, mathematics, or a special machine. 计算 2. V-T If you calculate the effects of something, especially a possible course of action, you think about them in order to form an opinion or decide what to do. 估计; 推测

1. V-I When you smile, the corners of your mouth curve up and you sometimes show your teeth. People smile when they are pleased or amused, or when they are being friendly. 微笑 2. N-COUNT A smile is the expression that you have on your face when you smile. 微笑

1. N-UNCOUNT Your expectations are your strong hopes or beliefs that something will happen or that you will get something that you want. 期盼 [also N in pl] 2. N-COUNT A person's expectations are strong beliefs they have about the proper way someone should behave or something should happen. 期望

1. N-COUNT A rep is a person whose job is to sell a company's products or services, especially by travelling around and visiting other companies. Rep is short for . 销售代表 2. N-COUNT A rep is a person who acts as a representative for a group of people, usually a group of people who work together. 代表 3. N repertory company的缩写 [theatre] → short for repertory company 4. N reputation的缩写 [非正式] → short for reputation 5. N a silk, wool, rayon, or cotton fabric with a transversely corded surface 棱纹平布 (Also repp)
1. V-T If you rebuke someone, you speak severely to them because they have said or done something that you do not approve of. 谴责 [正式] 2. N-VAR Rebuke is also a noun. 谴责
1. N-COUNT An idiom is a group of words that have a different meaning when used together from the one they would have if you took the meaning of each word separately. 习语 [技术]

1. N-COUNT A ceiling is the horizontal surface that forms the top part or roof inside a room. 天花板 2. N-COUNT A ceiling on something such as prices or wages is an official upper limit that cannot be broken. (价格、工资等的) 上限 3. → see also glass ceiling

n. imbibe的变形 vt. 喝，饮： I saw him imbibing liquor. 我看见他正在饮烈酒。 吸收(养分等)，吸进(空气)： These plants imbibe moisture through their roots. 这些植物通过根部吸收水分。 吸收(知识、思想等)，接受： to imbibe knowledge at one's mother's knee 在孩提时代起就开始吸收知识 [废语]浸，渍 喝，饮： I saw him imbibing liquor. 我看见他正在饮烈酒。 吸收(养分等)，吸进(空气)： These plants imbibe moisture through their roots. 这些植物通过根部吸收水分。 吸收(知识、思想等)，接受： to imbibe knowledge at one's mother's knee 在孩提时代起就开始吸收知识 [废语]浸，渍 vi. 喝，饮： Stop your boy from imbibing of the liquor. 别让你儿子喝烈酒。 吸收水分(或光、热等) 喝，饮： Stop your boy from imbibing of the liquor. 别让你儿子喝烈酒。 吸收水分(或光、热等) 变形： vt. imbibed . imbibing

1. V-I If you yield to someone or something, you stop resisting them. 屈服 [正式] 2. V-T If you yield something that you have control of or responsibility for, you allow someone else to have control or responsibility for it. 放弃 [正式] 3. V-I If a moving person or a vehicle yields, they slow down in order to allow other people or vehicles to pass in front of them. 让行 [美国英语] 4.
