V-I If something yields, it breaks or moves position because force or pressure has been put on it. (因受力或受压而) 破碎; 断裂; 移位 5. V-T If an area of land yields a particular amount of a crop, this is the amount that is produced. You can also say that a number of animals yield a particular amount of meat. 产 6. N-COUNT A yield is the amount of food produced on an area of land or by a number of animals. 产量 7. V-T If a tax or investment yields an amount of money or profit, this money or profit is obtained from it. 产生 (收益) [商业] 8. N-COUNT A yield is the amount of money or profit produced by an investment. (投资的) 利润; 收益 [商业] 9. V-T If something yie
在家

1. PHRASAL VERB If you rule out a course of action, an idea, or a solution, you decide that it is impossible or unsuitable. 不考虑; 排除 2. PHRASAL VERB If something rules out a situation, it prevents it from happening or from being possible. 阻止…发生; 使…不可能

1. N-COUNT A country is one of the political units which the world is divided into, covering a particular area of land. 国家 2. N-SING The people who live in a particular country can be referred to as the country. 国民 3. N-SING The country consists of places such as farms, open fields, and villages which are away from towns and cities. 乡村 4. N-UNCOUNT A particular kind of country is an area of land which has particular characteristics or is connected with a particular well-known person. 地区 5. N-UNCOUNT Country music is popular music from the southern United States. 乡村 (音乐)
1. ADJ You can use seasoned to describe a person who has a lot of experience of something. For example, a seasoned traveller is a person who has travelled a lot. 经验丰富的
1. N-COUNT Brewers are people or companies who make beer. 啤酒酿造者; 啤酒酿造公司

1. ADJ Nationalist means connected with the desire of a group of people within a country for political independence. 民族独立主义的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT A nationalist is someone with nationalist views. 民族独立主义者 3. ADJ Nationalist means connected with a person's great love for their nation. It is often associated with the belief that their nation is better than any other nation, and in this case is often used showing disapproval. 民族主义的 [ADJ n] 4. N-COUNT A nationalist is someone with nationalist views. 民族主义者

1. V-T If you overload something such as a vehicle, you put more things or people into it than it was designed to carry. 使超载 2. overloaded ADJ 超载的 3. V-T To overload someone with work, problems, or information means to give them more work, problems, or information than they can cope with. 使负担过重 4. N-UNCOUNT Overload is also a noun. 过重的负担 5. overloaded ADJ 负担过重的 6. V-T If you overload an electrical system, you cause too much electricity to flow through it, and so damage it. 使 (电气系统) 负荷过重
adv. 耀眼地；灿烂地
1. V-I When you boogie, you dance to fast pop music. (合着摇滚乐)跳舞 [非正式，老式]
1. N-UNCOUNT If someone carries out the enforcement of an act or rule, they enforce it. 执行
1. N the act or process of spinning 纺织 2. N (as modifier) 纺织的
1. N-UNCOUNT Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice. 专业技能; 专业知识

1. ADJ If you are immune to a particular disease, you cannot be affected by it. 免疫的 [v-link ADJ] 2. immunity N-UNCOUNT 免疫力 3. ADJ If you are immune to something that happens or is done, you are not affected by it. 不受影响的 [v-link ADJ] 4. ADJ Someone or something that is immune from a particular process or situation is able to escape it. 免除的 [v-link ADJ] 5. immunity N-UNCOUNT 免除
adj. 在当地出产的；本国产的

1. N-COUNT A recipe is a list of ingredients and a set of instructions that tell you how to cook something. 食谱 2. N-SING If you say that something is a recipe for a particular situation, you mean that it is likely to result in that situation. 方法
1. ADJ Residual is used to describe what remains of something when most of it has gone. 残留的
1. N-COUNT A hectare is a measurement of an area of land which is equal to 10,000 square metres, or 2.471 acres. 公顷
1. V-RECIP When people quibble over a small matter, they argue about it even though it is not important. (为琐事) 争辩 2. N-COUNT A quibble is a small and unimportant complaint about something. 微不足道的抱怨
n. 劳伦斯（男子名）

1. ADJ Rational decisions and thoughts are based on reason rather than on emotion. 理性的 2. rationally ADV 理性地 3. ADJ A rational person is someone who is sensible and is able to make decisions based on intelligent thinking rather than on emotion. 理智的

1. N-COUNT A hint is a suggestion about something that is made in an indirect way. 暗示 2. PHRASE If you take a hint, you understand something that is suggested to you indirectly. 领会暗示 3. V-I If you hint at something, you suggest it in an indirect way. 暗示 4. N-COUNT A hint is a helpful piece of advice, usually about how to do something. 建议 5. N-SING A hint of something is a very small amount of it. 微量

1. N-COUNT A desk is a table, often with drawers, which you sit at to write or work. 书桌; 办公桌 2. N-SING The place in a hotel, hospital, airport, or other building where you check in or obtain information is referred to as a particular desk. (接待、咨询) 台 3. N-SING A particular department of a broadcasting company, or of a newspaper or magazine company, can be referred to as a particular desk. …部
照做，遵守
1. N-COUNT Schoolchildren are children who go to school. 小学生
1. N-COUNT A litre is a metric unit of volume that is a thousand cubic centimetres. It is equal to 2.11 pints. 升 (公制容量单位)
1. ADV You use moreover to introduce a piece of information that adds to or supports the previous statement. 此外 [正式]

1. V-T If someone stabs you, they push a knife or sharp object into your body. (用刀等利器) 刺; 捅 2. V-T/V-I If you stab something or stab at it, you push at it with your finger or with something pointed that you are holding. (用手指或手中尖物) 戳; 捅; 按 3. N-SING If you have a stab at something, you try to do it. 尝试 [非正式] 4. N-SING You can refer to a sudden, usually unpleasant feeling as a stab of that feeling. 刺痛 [文学性] 5. PHRASE If you say that someone has stabbed you in the back, you mean that they have done something very harmful to you when you thought that you could trust them. You can refer to an action of this kind as a stab in the back. 在背后捅某人一刀
1. V-T If you impede someone or something, you make their movement, development, or progress difficult. 阻碍 [正式]
蓝领
1. ADJ denoting a certain position in a sequence of numbers 序数的 2. N ordinal number的缩写 → short for ordinal number
1. V-T/V-I When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist. 始创; 起源 [正式]
n. 米歇尔（女子名）
1. N-COUNT-COLL A consortium is a group of people or firms who have agreed to cooperate with each other. 联盟 [正式]

1. N-MASS Linen is a kind of cloth that is made from a plant called flax. It is used for making clothes and things such as tablecloths and sheets. 亚麻布 2. N-UNCOUNT Linen is tablecloths, sheets, pillowcases, and similar things made of cloth that are used in the home. 亚麻织品 [also N in pl]

1. N-UNCOUNT Psychology is the scientific study of the human mind and the reasons for people's behaviour. 心理学 2. N-UNCOUNT The psychology of a person is the kind of mind that they have, which makes them think or behave in the way that they do. 心理
1. N-COUNT Your CV is a written account of your personal details, your education, and the jobs you have had. CV is an abbreviation for "curriculum vitae." 简历 [英国英语]
1. N-COUNT Canaries are small, yellow birds which sing beautifully and are often kept as pets. 金丝雀

1. N a member of an order of preaching friars founded by Saint Dominic in 1215; a Blackfriar 多明我会修士 2. N a nun of one of the orders founded under the patronage of Saint Dominic 多明我会修女 3. ADJ of or relating to Saint Dominic or the Dominican order 圣多明我的; 多明我会的 1. ADJ of or relating to the Dominican Republic or Dominica 多米尼加共和国的; 多米尼加的 2. N a native or inhabitant of the Dominican Republic or Dominica 多米尼加共和国居民; 多米尼加居民

1. ADV If you move something aside, you move it to one side of you. (把某物移或放) 到一边地 [ADV after v] 2. ADV If you take or draw someone aside, you take them a little way away from a group of people in order to talk to them in private. (把某人带或拉) 到一旁地 [ADV after v] 3. ADV If you move aside, you get out of someone's way. 向一旁地 [ADV after v] 4. ADV If you set something such as time, money, or space aside for a particular purpose, you save it and do not use it for anything else. (存留) 在一边地 [ADV after v] 5. ADV If you brush or sweep aside a feeling or suggestion, you reject it. (拒绝而) 置于一旁地 [ADV after v] 6. ADV You use aside to indicate that you have finished talking about something, or that you are leaving it out of your discussion, and that you are about to talk about something else. 除了 7. PHRASE You use aside from when you are making an exception to a general statement. 除…以外 8. PHRASE You use aside from to indicate that you are aware of one aspect of a situation, but that you are going to focus on another aspect
1. N-COUNT A killing is an act of deliberately killing a person. 谋杀 2. PHRASE If you make a killing, you make a large profit very quickly and easily. 发大财 [非正式]

1. ADJ If someone's face or skin is lined, it has lines on it as a result of old age, tiredness, worry, or illness. 有皱纹的 2. ADJ Lined paper has lines printed across it to help you write neatly. (纸张)画有横线的 3. → see also line, line

1. N-COUNT Legal proceedings are legal action taken against someone. 诉讼 [正式] 2. N-COUNT The proceedings are an organized series of events that take place in a particular place. 行动 [正式] 3. N-PLURAL You can refer to a written record of the discussions at a meeting or conference as the proceedings. 会议记录
1. N-COUNT A financier is a person, company, or government that provides money for projects or businesses. (为项目或企业) 提供资金者 [商业]

1. V-T If you grasp something, you take it in your hand and hold it very firmly. 抓牢 2. N-SING A grasp is a very firm hold or grip. 紧握 3. N-SING If you say that something is in someone's grasp, you disapprove of the fact that they possess or control it. If something slips from your grasp, you lose it or lose control of it. 掌控 4. V-T If you grasp something that is complicated or difficult to understand, you understand it. 理解 5. N-SING A grasp of something is an understanding of it. 理解 6. PHRASE If you say that something is within someone's grasp, you mean that it is very likely that they will achieve it. 为某人所能及
导入；引入线；开场白

1. ADJ If you are depressed, you are sad and feel that you cannot enjoy anything, because your situation is so difficult and unpleasant. 沮丧的 2. ADJ A depressed place or industry does not have enough business or employment to be successful. 萧条的

1. N-COUNT A performance involves entertaining an audience by doing something such as singing, dancing, or acting. 表演 2. N-VAR Someone's or something's performance is how successful they are or how well they do something. 业绩; 性能 3. N-SING Theperformanceof a task is the fact or action of doing it. 执行; 实施
adv. 经济地；在经济上；节俭地

1. ADJ If you are licensed to do something, you have official permission from the government or from the authorities to do it. 获许的 2. ADJ If something that you own or use is licensed, you have official permission to own it or use it. 领有许可证的
1. ADJ Communal means relating to particular groups in a country or society. 团体的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You use communal to describe something that is shared by a group of people. 共有的

1. N-COUNT A coupon is a piece of printed paper which allows you to pay less money than usual for a product, or to get it free. 优惠券 2. N-COUNT A coupon is a small form, for example, in a newspaper or magazine, which you send off to ask for information, to order something, or to enter a competition. (报纸、杂志附的) 传单

1. N-COUNT A deterrent is something that prevents people from doing something by making them afraid of what will happen to them if they do it. 威慑物 2. N-COUNT A deterrent is a weapon or set of weapons designed to prevent enemies from attacking by making them afraid to do so. 威慑性武器
1. N-COUNT A walrus is a large, fat animal which lives in the sea. It has two long teeth called tusks that point downward. 海象
1. V-T If you avert something unpleasant, you prevent it from happening. 防止 2. V-T If you avert your eyes or gaze from someone or something, you look away from them. 转移 (视线)
1. ADJ Something that is disproportionate is surprising or unreasonable in amount or size, compared with something else. 不成比例的 2. disproportionately ADV 不成比例地

1. V-T To sacrifice an animal or person means to kill them in a special religious ceremony as an offering to a god. 献祭 2. N-COUNT Sacrifice is also a noun. 祭品 3. V-T If you sacrifice something that is valuable or important, you give it up, usually to obtain something else for yourself or for other people. 舍弃; 牺牲 4. N-VAR Sacrifice is also a noun. 舍弃; 牺牲
提克里特（伊拉克城市）
1. V-T Something that impoverishes a person or a country makes them poor. 使贫困 2. impoverished ADJ 贫困的 3. V-T A person or thing that impoverishes something makes it worse in quality. 使质量下降
1. ADJ A terse statement or comment is brief and unfriendly. 简短生硬的 2. tersely ADV 简短生硬地 [ADV with v]
1. N-COUNT You can refer to someone as an upstart when they behave as if they are important, but you think that they are too new in a place or job to be treated as important. 自命不凡的新手 [表不满]
1. N a Hebrew prophet, seer, and judge, who anointed the first two kings of the Israelites (I Samuel 1–3; 8–15) 塞缪尔; 希伯来先知，法官，曾为两个以色列国王涂膏 [Old Testament]
adv. 间接地；不诚实；迂回地
1. N-COUNT A mosque is a building where Muslims go to worship. 清真寺
1. ADJ Something that is erratic does not follow a regular pattern, but happens at unexpected times or moves along in an irregular way. 不规则的; 不稳定的 2. erratically ADV 不规则地; 不稳定地
1. N-UNCOUNT Terry or terry cloth is a type of fabric which has a lot of very small loops covering both sides. It is used especially for making towels. 有小线圈的棉织物 [usu N n]
n. 盖纳（姓氏）
塔克辛；塔辛（人名）

1. N-UNCOUNT In computer systems, hardware refers to the machines themselves as opposed to the programs which tell the machines what to do. Compare . 硬件 2. N-UNCOUNT Military hardware is the machinery and equipment that is used by the armed forces, such as tanks, aircraft, and missiles. 装备 3. N-UNCOUNT Hardware refers to tools and equipment that are used in the home and garden, for example nuts and bolts, screwdrivers, and hinges. 五金器具

1. N-COUNT A studio is a room where a painter, photographer, or designer works. 工作室 2. N-COUNT A studio is a room where radio or television programmes are recorded, CDs are produced, or movies are made. 演播室; 制作室 3. N-COUNT You can also refer to film-making or recording companies as studios. 电影公司; 录音公司 4. N-COUNT A studio or a studio apartment is a small apartment with one room for living and sleeping in, a kitchen, and a bathroom. You can also talk about a studio apartment. 单间公寓

1. N-UNCOUNT Malt is a substance made from grain that has been soaked in water and then dried in a hot oven. Malt is used in the production of whisky, beer, and other alcoholic drinks. 麦芽 2. N-COUNT A malt is a drink made from malted milk powder, milk, ice cream, and sometimes other flavourings. 麦乳精饮料 [美国英语]
n. 慕尼黑（联邦德国城市）
1. ADJ A high-profile person or a high-profile event attracts a lot of attention or publicity. 引人注目的
1. V-T If you say that someone or something unleashes a powerful force, feeling, activity, or group, you mean that they suddenly start it or send it somewhere. 释放

1. ADJ If one thing or person is superior to another, the first is better than the second. 比…好的 2. superiority N-UNCOUNT 优越性 3. ADJ If you describe something as superior, you mean that it is good, and better than other things of the same kind. 上好的 4. ADJ A superior person or thing is more important than another person or thing in the same organization or system. 上级的 5. N-COUNT Your superior in an organization that you work for is a person who has a higher rank than you. 上级 6. ADJ If you describe someone as superior, you disapprove of them because they behave as if they are better, more important, or more intelligent than other people. 有优越感的 [表不满] 7. superiority N-UNCOUNT 优越 8. ADJ If one group of people has superior numbers to another group, the first has more people than the second, and therefore has an advantage over it. (人数) 占优势的 [正式]
1. N-UNCOUNT If you feel distaste for someone or something, you dislike them and consider them to be unpleasant, disgusting, or immoral. 厌恶; 反感
1. N-COUNT A mall is a very large, enclosed shopping area. 大型购物区

1. N-COUNT A formula is a plan that is invented in order to deal with a particular problem. 方案 2. N-COUNT A formula is a group of letters, numbers, or other symbols which represents a scientific or mathematical rule. 公式 3. N-COUNT In science, the formula for a substance is a list of the amounts of various substances which make up that substance, or an indication of the atoms that it is composed of. 分子式 4. N-SING A formula for a particular situation, usually a good one, is a course of action or a combination of actions that is certain or likely to result in that situation. (达成通常为好的结局的) 行动方案

1. V-T To stimulate something means to encourage it to begin or develop further. 鼓励; 刺激 2. stimulation N-UNCOUNT 鼓励; 刺激 3. V-T If you are stimulated by something, it makes you feel full of ideas and enthusiasm. 激励 [usu passive] 4. stimulating ADJ 激励的 5. V-T If something stimulates a part of a person's body, it causes it to move or start working. 刺激 (身体器官) 6. stimulating ADJ 刺激的
1. ADJ If you describe someone or something as imposing, you mean that they have an impressive appearance or manner. 仪态使人印象深刻的

1. N-VAR If you gain insight or an insight into a complex situation or problem, you gain an accurate and deep understanding of it. 深入了解; 深刻见解 2. N-UNCOUNT If someone has insight, they are able to understand complex situations. 洞察力

1. ADJ Someone who is male is a man or a boy. 男性的 2. N-COUNT Men and boys are sometimes referred to as males when they are being considered as a type. 男性 3. ADJ Male means relating to, belonging to, or affecting men rather than women. 男性的 [ADJ n] 4. N-COUNT You can refer to any creature that belongs to the sex that cannot lay eggs or have babies as a male. 雄性 5. ADJ Male is also an adjective. 雄性的

1. N-UNCOUNT Ferment is excitement and trouble caused by change or uncertainty. 骚动 2. V-T/V-I If a food, drink, or other natural substance ferments, or if it is fermented, a chemical change takes place in it so that alcohol is produced. This process forms part of the production of alcoholic drinks such as wine and beer. 使发酵; 发酵 3. fermentation N-UNCOUNT 发酵
1. N-UNCOUNT If someone is in a state of agitation, they are very worried or upset, and show this in their behaviour, movements, or voice. 焦虑不安
1. V-T/V-I When the tape in a video or tape recorder rewinds or when you rewind it, the tape goes backwards so that you can play it again. Compare . 把 (录像带、录音带) 倒回去; 倒带
adj. 较少的 pron. 较少数 int. 较少数
1. N-UNCOUNT Booze is alcoholic drink. 酒 [非正式] [also 'the' N] 2. V-I If people booze, they drink alcohol. 喝酒 [非正式]

1. V-T/V-I When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes. 点燃; 着火 2. V-T If something or someone ignites your feelings, they cause you to have very strong feelings about something. 激起 [文学性]

1. V-T/V-I If you scrabble for something, especially something that you cannot see, you move your hands or your feet about quickly and hurriedly in order to find it. 扒寻 2. PHRASAL VERB Scrabble around or scrabble about means the same as . Scrabble around或scrabble about同scrabble 3. V-T/V-I If you say that someone is scrabbling to do something, you mean that they are having difficulty because they are in too much of a hurry, or because the task is almost impossible. 苦求 4. PHRASAL VERB Scrabble around means the same as . Scrabble around同scrabble

1. N-COUNT A laser is a narrow beam of concentrated light produced by a special machine. It is used for cutting very hard materials, and in many technical fields such as surgery and telecommunications. 激光

1. N-COUNT Nerves are long thin fibres that transmit messages between your brain and other parts of your body. 神经 2. N-PLURAL If you refer to someone's nerves, you mean their ability to cope with problems such as stress, worry, and danger. (对压力、烦恼和危险等的) 精神承受力 3. N-PLURAL You can refer to someone's feelings of anxiety or tension as nerves. 神经紧张 4. N-UNCOUNT Nerve is the courage that you need in order to do something difficult or dangerous. 勇气 5. PHRASE If someone or something gets on your nerves, they annoy or irritate you. 惹…心烦 [非正式] 6. PHRASE If you say that someone has a nerve or has the nerve to do something, you are criticizing them for doing something which you feel they had no right to do. 放肆 [非正式] 7. PHRASE If you lose your nerve, you suddenly panic and become too afraid to do something that you were about to do. 惊慌失措

1. V-T If you infer that something is the case, you decide that it is true on the basis of information that you already have. 推断 2. V-T Some people use infer to mean "imply," but this use is incorrect. 暗指 (一些人用)(infer)(表示)(imply)(的意思，但这种用法是错误的)
1. N-COUNT A bathrobe is a loose piece of clothing usually made of the same material as towels. You wear it before or after you take a bath or a shower. 浴袍 2. N-COUNT A bathrobe is a . 晨衣

1. N-COUNT A mortgage is a loan of money which you get from a bank or savings and loan association in order to buy a house. 房屋抵押贷款 2. V-T If you mortgage your house or land, you use it as a guarantee to a company in order to borrow money from them. 抵押
1. N-COUNT A portion of something is a part of it. 部分 2. N-COUNT A portion is the amount of food that is given to one person at a meal. (食物的) 一份
1. N →see duck-billed platypus
1. N-COUNT The ramifications of a decision, plan, or event are all its consequences and effects, especially ones that are not obvious at first. (尤指最初并不明显的) 后果
1. Earliest is the superlative of . (early)的最高级 2. PHRASE At the earliest means not before the date or time mentioned. 最早
n. 满意；喜悦；使人满意之事

1. N-VAR The lining of something such as a piece of clothing or a curtain is a layer of cloth attached to the inside of it in order to make it thicker or warmer, or in order to make it hang better. 内衬 2. N-COUNT The lining of your stomach or other organ is a layer of tissue on the inside of it. (胃等器官内部的) 保护层 3. → see also line, line

1. ADJ You use severe to indicate that something bad or undesirable is great or intense. 严重的 2. severely ADV 严重地 3. ADJ Severe punishments or criticisms are very strong or harsh. (惩罚、批评) 严厉的 4. severely ADV 严厉地 [ADV with v]
n. 俄勒冈州（美国州名）

1. N-UNCOUNT In Christianity, salvation is the fact that Christ has saved a person from evil. (基督教中) 灵魂的拯救 2. N-UNCOUNT The salvation of someone or something is the act of saving them from harm, destruction, or an unpleasant situation. 解救; 拯救 3. N-SING If someone or something is your salvation, they are responsible for saving you from harm, destruction, or an unpleasant situation. 救星; 解救物
1. N-COUNT An auditor is an accountant who officially examines the accounts of organizations. 审计员
总公司；总行
n. 占有的财产；所持股份
1. ADJ If you are accountable to someone for something that you do, you are responsible for it and must be prepared to justify your actions to that person. 负有责任的 2. accountability N-UNCOUNT 责任心

1. V-T If you preserve a situation or condition, you make sure that it remains as it is, and does not change or end. 维护 2. preservation N-UNCOUNT 维护 3. V-T If you preserve something, you take action to save it or protect it from damage or decay. 保护 4. preservation N-UNCOUNT 保护 5. V-T If you preserve food, you treat it in order to prevent it from decaying so that you can store it for a long time. 保藏 6. N-PLURAL Preserves are foods made by cooking fruit with a large amount of sugar so that they can be stored for a long time. 果酱 7. N-COUNT If you say that a job or activity is the preserve of a particular person or group of people, you mean that they are the only ones who take part in it. 独揽之事; 独占的活动
回覆式；闲散的
1. ADJ Consecutive periods of time or events happen one after the other without interruption. 连续的
1. ADV If something changes or is done gradually, it changes or is done in small stages over a long period of time, rather than suddenly. 逐渐地 [ADV with v]

1. N-COUNT A pearl is a hard round object that is shiny and creamy white in colour. Pearls grow inside the shell of an oyster and are used for making expensive jewellery. 珍珠 2. ADJ Pearl is used to describe something that looks like a pearl. 珍珠般的 3. ADJ of, made of, or set with pearl or mother-of-pearl 珍珠的; 贝母的; 镶珠的 4. V to set with or as if with pearls 用珍珠镶嵌; 仿珍珠镶嵌

1. N-COUNT A roller coaster is a small railway at an amusement park that goes up and down steep slopes fast that people ride on for pleasure or excitement. 过山车 2. N-COUNT If you say that someone or something is on a roller coaster, you mean that they go through many sudden or extreme changes in a short time. (指人或事急转突变) 过山车 [journalism]

1. N-VAR If you talk about the orientation of an organization or country, you are talking about the kinds of aims and interests it has. 方向; 目标 2. N-VAR Someone's orientation is their basic beliefs or preferences. 基本信仰; 取向 3. N-UNCOUNT Orientation is basic information or training that is given to people starting a new job, school, or course. (任职、上学等之前的) 情况介绍; 训练 4. N-COUNT The orientation of a structure or object is the direction it faces. 朝向
1. ADJ extremely hot 极热的
1. N a turn in which the body is swung sharply round with the skis parallel, originating in Norway and used for stopping, slowing down, or changing direction quickly 挪威式转弯; 快速滑行时的回转方法 [skiing]

1. V-T If you dismantle a machine or structure, you carefully separate it into its different parts. 拆除 2. V-T To dismantle an organization or system means to cause it to stop functioning by gradually reducing its power or purpose. 逐步废除

1. ADJ Something that is hollow has a space inside it, as opposed to being solid all the way through. 空心的 2. ADJ A surface that is hollow curves inward. 凹陷的 3. N-COUNT A hollow is an area that is lower than the surrounding surface. 凹陷处 4. ADJ If you describe a statement, situation, or person as hollow, you mean they have no real value, worth, or effectiveness. 空洞的; 没有价值的 5. hollowness N-UNCOUNT 空洞 6. ADJ If someone gives a hollow laugh, they laugh in a way that shows that they do not really find something amusing. 虚伪的 [ADJ n] 7. ADJ A hollow sound is dull and echoing. (声音) 空洞而沉闷的 [ADJ n] 8. V-T If something is hollowed, its surface is made to curve inward or downward. 使凹陷 [usu passive]

1. V-T If you dent the surface of something, you make a hollow area in it by hitting or pressing it. 使(外表)产生凹痕 2. V-T If something dents your confidence or your pride, it makes you realize that you are not as good or successful as you thought. 挫伤 (信心或自尊等) 3. N-COUNT A dent is a hollow in the surface of something which has been caused by hitting or pressing it. 凹痕 4. N a toothlike protuberance, esp the tooth of a sprocket or gearwheel 齿状突出物; (齿轮的)齿
1. N-COUNT An assortment is a group of similar things that are of different sizes or colours or have different qualities. 花色品种
1. N-COUNT A genre is a particular type of literature, painting, music, film, or other art form which people consider as a class because it has special characteristics. (文学、绘画、音乐、电影等艺术作品的) 体裁 [正式]
1. N-VAR An opal is a precious stone. Opals are colourless or white, but other colours are reflected in them. 蛋白石
1. ADJ A high-ranking person has an important position in a particular organization. 高级的 [ADJ n]

1. ADV Sideways means from or toward the side of something or someone. 从一旁地; 向一旁地 [ADV after v] 2. ADJ Sideways is also an adjective. 从一旁的; 向一旁的 [ADJ n] 3. ADV If you are moved sideways at work, you move to another job at the same level as your old job. 平级地 [ADV after v] 4. ADJ Sideways is also an adjective. 平级的 [ADJ n]
1. N-VAR A procedure is a way of doing something, especially the usual or correct way. 程序

1. V-T If you associate someone or something with another thing, the two are connected in your mind. 将 (…和…) 联系起来 2. V-T If you are associated with a particular organization, cause, or point of view, or if you associate yourself with it, you support it publicly. 使 (某人与某组织、事业、观点等) 有关联 3. V-I If you say that someone is associating with another person or group of people, you mean they are spending a lot of time in the company of people you do not approve of. (与某个或某群人) 混在一起 4. N-COUNT Your associates are the people you are closely connected with, especially at work. (尤指工作中的) 伙伴 5. N-COUNT An associate is a retail worker who does not have previous experience or qualifications. 准零售工 6. ADJ Associate is used before a rank or title to indicate a slightly different or lower rank or title. 副的 (用在级别或头衔前，表示稍有不同或略低的) [ADJ n]

1. ADJ Something that is redundant is unnecessary, for example, because it is no longer needed or because its job is being done by something else. 多余的 2. ADJ If you are made redundant, your employer tells you to leave because your job is no longer necessary or because your employer cannot afford to keep paying you. 被裁减的 [英国英语] [商业]
1. N-VAR Smog is a mixture of fog and smoke which occurs in some busy industrial cities. 烟雾

1. ADJ If you describe someone's behaviour or feelings as understandable, you think that they have reacted to a situation in a natural way or in the way you would expect. 可以理解的 2. understandably ADV 可以理解地 3. ADJ If you say that something such as a statement or theory is understandable, you mean that people can easily understand it. (陈述、理论等) 易懂的

1. N-UNCOUNT Phishing is the practice of trying to trick people into giving secret financial information by sending e-mails that look as if they come from a bank, credit-card account, etc. The details are then used to steal people's money, or to steal their identity in order to commit crimes. 网络钓鱼 [计算机]
1. N-COUNT Cigarettes are small tubes of paper containing tobacco which people smoke. 香烟

1. V-I When ice, snow, or something else that is frozen thaws, it melts. (冰雪等) 融化 2. N-COUNT A thaw is a period of warmer weather when snow and ice melt, usually at the end of winter. (通常指冬末的) 解冻期 3. V-T/V-I When you thaw frozen food or when it thaws, you leave it in a place where it can reach room temperature so that it is ready for use. 解冻 4. PHRASAL VERB Thaw out means the same as . 解冻
n. 美国的选举（文章名）
1. N-COUNT A molecule is the smallest amount of a chemical substance which can exist by itself. 分子

1. N-COUNT A warranty is a written promise by a company that, if you find a fault in something they have sold you within a certain time, they will repair it or replace it free of charge. 保修单 [also 'under' N]

1. ADJ Something that is eternal lasts forever. 永恒的 2. eternally ADV 永恒地 3. ADJ If you describe something as eternal, you mean that it seems to last forever, often because you think it is boring or annoying. 无休止的
1. N-UNCOUNT Methane is a colourless gas that has no smell. Natural gas consists mostly of methane. 甲烷
1. ADJ A viral disease or infection is caused by a virus. 病毒性的

1. N-COUNT A priest is a member of the Christian clergy in the Catholic, Anglican, or Orthodox church. (圣公会教的) 牧师; (天主教、东正教的) 神父 2. N-COUNT In many non-Christian religions a priest is a man who has particular duties and responsibilities in a place where people worship. (非基督教的) 祭司

1. N-UNCOUNT Detention is when someone is arrested or put into prison. 拘留; 监禁 [also N in pl] 2. N-VAR Detention is a punishment for students who misbehave, who are made to stay at school after the other students have gone home. (为惩罚学生的) 课后留校
1. ADV You use painfully to emphasize a quality or situation that is undesirable. (用以强调不好的性质或情形) 非常 [ADV adv/adj] [强调] 2. → see also painful
1. N-VAR If something is an incentive to do something, it encourages you to do it. 鼓励
1. V-I If you participate in an activity, you take part in it. 参加 2. participation N-UNCOUNT 参加
int. 再见 n. 散步；机关枪 n. (Tata)人名；(印、土、意)塔塔
n. 消灭，扑灭；根除

1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES You can refer to a narrow strip of sea which joins two large areas of sea as a strait or the straits. 海峡 2. N-PLURAL If someone is in dire or desperate straits, they are in a very difficult situation, usually because they do not have much money. (常指缺钱造成的) 困境 [adj N]

1. ADJ Something that is dense contains a lot of things or people in a small area. 稠密的 2. densely ADV 稠密地 3. ADJ Dense fog or smoke is difficult to see through because it is very heavy and dark. (烟、雾等) 浓重的 4. ADJ In science, a dense substance is very heavy in relation to its volume. (物质) 密度大的 [技术]
格里夫尼亚（乌克兰的货币单位）

1. ADJ If you are dressed, you are wearing clothes rather than being naked or wearing your nightclothes. If you get dressed, you put on your clothes. 穿上衣服的 2. ADJ If you are dressed in a particular way, you are wearing clothes of a particular colour or kind. 穿着…衣服的 [v-link ADJ] 3. → see also well-dressed

1. N-COUNT A grant is an amount of money that a government or other institution gives to an individual or to an organization for a particular purpose such as education or home improvements. 补助金 2. V-T If someone in authority grants you something, or if something is granted to you, you are allowed to have it. 准予 [正式] 3. V-T If you grant that something is true, you accept that it is true, even though your opinion about it does not change. 承认 4. PHRASE If you say that someone takes you for granted, you are complaining that they benefit from your help, efforts, or presence without showing that they are grateful. 对某人无感激之心 5. PHRASE If you take something for granted, you believe that it is true or accept it as normal without thinking about it. 视某事为理所当然 6. PHRASE If you take it for granted that something is the case, you believe that it is true or you accept it as normal without thinking about it. 理所当然地认为

1. V-T If you display something that you want people to see, you put it in a particular place, so that people can see it easily. 陈列; 展出 2. N-UNCOUNT Display is also a noun. 陈列; 展出 3. V-T If you display something, you show it to people. 展示 4. V-T If you display a characteristic, quality, or emotion, you behave in a way which shows that you have it. 表露 (特点、素质、情感) 5. N-VAR Display is also a noun. 表露 6. V-T When a computer displays information, it shows it on a screen. (在计算机屏幕上) 显示 7. N-COUNT A display is an arrangement of things that have been put in a particular place, so that people can see them easily. 陈列 8. N-COUNT A display is a public performance or other event which is intended to entertain people. 表演 9. N-COUNT The display on a computer screen is the information that is shown there. The screen itself can also be referred to as the display. (屏幕) 显示内容; (计算机) 屏幕
1. ADJ Homeless people have nowhere to live. 无家可归的 2. N-PLURAL The homeless are people who are homeless. 无家可归的人 3. homelessness N-UNCOUNT 无家可归

1. N-COUNT A keystone of a policy, system, or process is an important part of it, which is the basis for later developments. 基础; 根本 2. N-COUNT A keystone is a stone at the top of an arch, which keeps the other stones in place by its weight and position. 拱顶石 [技术]

1. N-VAR If strain is put on an organization or system, it has to do more than it is able to do. 压力 2. V-T To strain something means to make it do more than it is able to do. 使受到压力 3. N-UNCOUNT Strain is a state of worry and tension caused by a difficult situation. 压力 [also N in pl] 4. N-SING If you say that a situation is a strain, you mean that it makes you worried and tense. 负担 5. N-UNCOUNT Strain is a force that pushes, pulls, or stretches something in a way that may damage it. 压力 6. N-VAR Strain is an injury to a muscle in your body, caused by using the muscle too much or twisting it. 损伤; 扭伤 7. V-T If you strain a muscle, you injure it by using it too much or twisting it. 损伤; 扭伤 8. V-T If you strain to do something, you make a great effort to do it when it is difficult to do. 努力做 9. V-T When you strain food, you separate the liquid part of it from the solid parts. 过滤 10. N-COUNT A strain of a germ, plant, or other organism is a particular type of it. 类型; 品种
1. N-VAR Injustice is a lack of fairness in a situation. 不公正 2. N-COUNT An injustice is an action or statement in which someone judges you or treats you unfairly. 不公正的行为; 不公平的评论

1. N-UNCOUNT Therapy is the process or talking to a trained counsellor about your emotional and mental problems and your relationships in order to understand and improve the way you feel and behave. 心理治疗 2. N-VAR Therapy or a therapy is a treatment for a particular illness or condition. (针对某种病情的) 治疗 [医学]

1. V-I If you say that someone waffles or waffles on, you are critical of them because they talk or write a lot without actually making any clear or important points. [英国英语] [非正式] 2. N vague and wordy speech or writing 犹豫不决; 含糊其词 3. V-I If someone waffles on an issue or question, they cannot decide what to do or what their opinion is about it. 含糊其辞 [美国英语] 4. N-COUNT a crisp golden-brown pancake with deep indentations on both sides 华夫饼

1. V-T If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain. 推测 2. V-T If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it. 擅自 (做某事) [正式] 3. V-T If an idea, theory, or plan presumes certain facts, it regards them as true so that they can be used as a basis for further ideas and theories. 假定 (某事实) 为真 [正式]

1. ADJ If you are conscious of something, you notice it or realize that it is happening. 意识到的 [v-link ADJ] 2. ADJ If you are conscious of something, you think about it a lot, especially because you are unhappy about it or because you think it is important. (尤指因为自认不满意或很重要而) 在意的 [v-link ADJ] 3. ADJ A conscious decision or action is made or done deliberately with you giving your full attention to it. 刻意的 4. consciously ADV 刻意地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ Someone who is conscious is awake rather than asleep or unconscious. 神志清醒的 6. ADJ Conscious memories or thoughts are ones that you are aware of. 清楚的 (记忆、想法) [ADJ n] 7. consciously ADV 清楚地 (记得、想起)
n. 黑石集团（美国一家债券基金管理公司）
欧尔班；奥尔班（人名，地名）
1. ADJ broken, discontinued, or hindered 打断的

1. ADJ If you feel put out, you feel annoyed or upset. 生气的; 心烦的 [v-link ADJ] 2. PHRASAL VERB 发布 3. PHRASAL VERB If you put out a fire, candle, or cigarette, you make it stop burning. 熄灭 4. PHRASAL VERB If you put out an electric light, you make it stop shining by pressing a switch. 关闭 (电灯等) 5. PHRASAL VERB If you put out things that will be needed, you place them somewhere ready to be used. 把…放好备用 6. PHRASAL VERB If you put out your hand, you move it forward, away from your body. 伸 (手) 7. PHRASAL VERB If you put someone out, you cause them trouble because they have to do something for you. 给…带来麻烦

1. ADJ Someone who is consistent always behaves in the same way, has the same attitudes towards people or things, or achieves the same level of success in something. 始终如一的 2. consistently ADV 始终如一地 3. ADJ If one fact or idea is consistent with another, they do not contradict each other. 相符的 [v-link ADJ, usu ADJ 'with' n] 4. ADJ An argument or set of ideas that is consistent is one in which no part contradicts or conflicts with any other part. (论点、观点) 前后一致的

1. ADJ If you describe a building or a piece of scenery as grand, you mean that its size or appearance is very impressive. 宏伟的 2. ADJ Grand plans or actions are intended to achieve important results. (计划等) 宏大的 3. ADJ People who are grand think they are important or socially superior. 自视高贵的 [表不满] 4. ADJ A grand total is one that is the final amount or the final result of a calculation. 总计的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ Grand is often used in the names of buildings such as hotels, especially when they are very large. 大的 (常用于大建筑物的名称前) [ADJ n] 6. N-COUNT A grand is a thousand dollars or a thousand pounds. 一千美元; 一千英镑 [非正式]

1. ADV You can use literally to emphasize an exaggeration. Some careful speakers of English think that this use is incorrect. 真地 [强调] 2. ADV You use literally to emphasize that what you are saying is true, even though it seems exaggerated or surprising. 确实地 [强调] 3. ADV If a word or expression is translated literally, its most simple or basic meaning is translated. 字面上地

1. N-UNCOUNT Recognition is the act of recognizing someone or identifying something when you see it. 认出; 识别 2. N-UNCOUNT Recognitionof something is an understanding and acceptance of it. 认可; 接受 3. N-UNCOUNT When a government gives diplomatic recognition to another country, they officially accept that its status is valid. (国际上的) 正式承认 4. N-UNCOUNT When a person receives recognition for the things that they have done, people acknowledge the value or skill of their work. 赞赏; 赏识 5. PHRASE If something is done in recognition of someone's achievements, it is done as a way of showing official appreciation of them. 用以肯定
1. ADJ If people or things are numerous, they exist or are present in large numbers. 许多的
n. 许多（dozen的复数）
n. 老挝

1. ADJ If an action is underhand or if it is done in an underhand way, it is done secretly and dishonestly. 秘密的; 不诚实的 [usu ADJ n] [表不满] 2. ADJ You use underhand or underhanded to describe actions, such as throwing a ball, in which you do not raise your arm above your shoulder. (投球等) 低手的 (指手不过肩) [美国英语] [ADJ n] 3. ADV Underhand is also an adverb. 低手地 [ADV after v]

1. V-I If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength. 下降 2. V-T/V-I If you decline something or decline to do something, you politely refuse to accept it or do it. 谢绝 [正式] 3. N-VAR If there is a decline in something, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or quality. 下降 4. PHRASE If something is in decline or on the decline, it is gradually decreasing in importance, quality, or power. 在下降 5. PHRASE If something goes or falls into decline, it begins to gradually decrease in importance, quality, or power. 开始下降

1. ADV You use especially to emphasize that what you are saying applies more to one person, thing, time, or area than to any others. 特别是 (用于强调所指内容更适合) [ADV with cl/group] [强调] 2. ADV You use especially to emphasize a characteristic or quality. 尤其 (用于强调某种特质) [ADV adj/adv] [强调]

1. N-UNCOUNT Immigration is the coming of people into a country in order to live and work there. 移居 2. N-UNCOUNT Immigration or immigration control is the place at a port, airport, or international border where officials check the passports of people who wish to come into the country. 移民局的检查

1. N-COUNT The host at a party is the person who has invited the guests and provides the food, drink, or entertainment. (聚会的) 主人 2. V-T If someone hosts a party, dinner, or other function, they have invited the guests and provide the food, drink, or entertainment. 主办 (聚会、宴会或其他集会) 3. N-COUNT A country, city, or organization that is the host of an event provides the facilities for that event to take place. (举办某活动的) 东道主 4. V-T If a country, city, or organization hosts an event, they provide the facilities for the event to take place. 主办 5. PHRASE If a person or country plays host to an event or an important visitor, they host the event or the visit. 主办 (活动); 款待 (重要宾客) 6. N-COUNT The host of a radio or television show is the person who introduces it and talks to the people who appear in it. (广播或电视的) 节目主持人 7. V-T The person who hosts a radio or television show introduces it and talks to the people who appear in it. 主持 (广播或电视节目) 8. QUANT A host of things is a lot of them. 大量 9. N-COUNT A host or a host co
1. V-T If someone in authority abolishes a system or practice, they formally put an end to it. 废除

1. ADJ Someone who is assured is very confident and relaxed. 雄有成竹的 2. ADJ If something is assured, it is certain to happen. 确定的 [v-link ADJ] 3. ADJ If you are assured of something, you are certain to get it or achieve it. 有把握得到的 [v-link ADJ 'of' n] 4. PHRASE If you say that someone can rest assured that something is the case, you mean that it is definitely the case, so they do not need to worry about it. 尽管放心 [强调]
有存货；现有

1. N-COUNT A niche in the market is a specific area of marketing which has its own particular requirements, customers, and products. (有特定的要求、顾客群和产品的) 专营市场 [商业] 2. ADJ Niche marketing is the practice of dividing the market into specialized areas for which particular products are made. A niche market is one of these specialized areas. 专营市场的 [商业] [ADJ n] 3. N-COUNT A niche is a hollow area in a wall which has been made to hold a statue, or a natural hollow part in a hill or cliff. 壁龛; (山坡或峭壁上) 天然凹陷处 4. N-COUNT Your niche is the job or activity which is exactly suitable for you. 合适的职位; 合适的活动

1. ADJ Something that is high extends a long way from the bottom to the top when it is upright. You do not use high to describe people, animals, or plants. 高的 (不用于形容人、动物或植物) 2. ADV High is also an adverb. 高高地 [ADV after v] 3. ADJ You use high to talk or ask about how much something upright measures from the bottom to the top. 高度为…的 4. ADJ If something is high, it is a long way above the ground, above sea level, or above a person or thing. (与地面、海平面、其他人或物相比而言) 高的 5. ADV High is also an adverb. 高高地 [ADV after v] 6. PHRASE If something is high up, it is a long way above the ground, above sea level, or above a person or thing. (与地面、海平面、其他人或物相比而言) 高的 7. ADJ You can use high to indicate that something is great in amount, degree, or intensity. (数量、程度或强度) 高的 8. ADV High is also an adverb. 高地 [ADV after v] 9. PHRASE You can use phrases such as "in the high 80s" to indicate that a number or level is, for example, more than 85 but not as much as 90. 中间偏上 10. ADJ If a food or other substance is high in a partic
1. V-T If an event or programme is televised, it is broadcast so that it can be seen on television. 在电视上播放 [usu passive]

1. ADJ You can use petty to describe things such as problems, rules, or arguments that you think are unimportant or relate to unimportant things. 不重要的 [表不满] 2. ADJ If you describe someone's behaviour as petty, you mean that they care too much about small, unimportant things and perhaps that they are unnecessarily unkind. 过分在乎琐事的 [表不满] 3. pettiness N-UNCOUNT 狭隘 4. ADJ Petty is used of people or actions that are less important, serious, or great than others. (人或行动) 次要的 [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A hose is a long, flexible pipe made of rubber or plastic. Water is directed through a hose in order to do things such as put out fires, clean cars, or water gardens. (橡胶或塑料制的) 水管 2. N-COUNT A hose is a pipe made of rubber or plastic, along which a liquid or gas flows, for example from one part of an engine to another. (用来输送液体或气体的) 软管 3. V-T If you hose something, you wash or water it using a hose. 用水管冲洗; 用水管浇灌 4. N stockings, socks, and tights collectively 袜子统称

1. N-COUNT A ladder is a piece of equipment used for climbing up something or down from something. It consists of two long pieces of wood, metal, or rope with steps fixed between them. 梯子 2. N-SING You can use the ladder to refer to something such as a society, organization, or system which has different levels that people can progress up or drop down. 阶梯 3. N-COUNT A ladder is a hole or torn part in a woman's stocking or tights, where some of the vertical threads have broken, leaving only the horizontal threads. (长筒丝袜等的) 脱丝 [英国英语]
1. N-VAR Terrain is used to refer to an area of land or a type of land when you are considering its physical features. 地形

1. N-VAR Someone who has an apprenticeship works for a fixed period of time for a person who has a particular skill in order to learn the skill. Apprenticeship is the system of learning a skill like this. 学徒期; 学徒制

1. N-VAR A threat to a person or thing is a danger that something bad might happen to them. A threat is also the cause of this danger. 威胁; 造成威胁的原因 2. N-COUNT A threat is a statement by someone that they will hurt you in some way, especially if you do not do what they want. 威胁的言论 3. PHRASE If a person or thing is under threat, there is a danger that something bad might be done to them, or that they might cease to exist. 受到威胁

1. N-COUNT A sperm is a cell which is produced in the sex organs of a male animal and can enter a female animal's egg and fertilize it. 精子 2. N-UNCOUNT Sperm is used to refer to the liquid that contains sperm when it is produced. 精液
1. N-MASS Shampoo is a soapy liquid that you use for washing your hair. 洗发液 2. V-T When you shampoo your hair, you wash it using shampoo. 用洗发水洗
vt. 吹捧

1. N-VAR An error is something you have done that is considered to be incorrect or wrong, or that should not have been done. 错误 2. PHRASE If you do something in error or if it happens in error, you do it or it happens because you have made a mistake, especially in your judgment. 错误地 3. PHRASE If someone sees the error of their ways, they realize or admit that they have made a mistake or behaved badly. 认识到自身错误

1. N-COUNT A dividend is the part of a company's profits which is paid to people who own shares in the company. 股息 [商业] 2. PHRASE If something pays dividends, it brings advantages at a later date. 有回报; 可获益
1. CONVENTION Farewell means the same as . 别了 (L>同)(goodbye) [文学性，老式] 2. N-COUNT Farewell is also a noun. 告别
n. 索契（苏联城市）

1. N-VAR Thread or a thread is a long very thin piece of a material such as cotton, nylon, or silk, especially one that is used in sewing. (尤指用于缝纫的) 线 2. V-T When you thread a needle, you put a piece of thread through the hole in the top of the needle in order to sew with it. 穿 (针) 3. N-COUNT The thread of an argument, a story, or a situation is an aspect of it that connects all the different parts together. 主线 4. N-COUNT A thread of something such as liquid, light, or colour is a long thin line or piece of it. 线状物; 一线 5. N-COUNT The thread on a screw, or on something such as a lid or a pipe, is the raised spiral line of metal or plastic around it which allows it to be fixed in place by twisting. 螺纹 6. V-T/V-I If you thread your way through a group of people or things, or thread through it, you move through it carefully or slowly, changing direction frequently as you move. 穿行 7. V-T If you thread a long thin object through something, you pass it through one or more holes or narrow spaces. 把 (细长物体) 穿进

1. N-VAR A denial of something is a statement that it is not true, does not exist, or did not happen. 否认 2. N-UNCOUNT The denial of something to someone is the act of refusing to let them have it. 拒绝给予 [正式] 3. N-UNCOUNT In psychology, denial is when a person cannot or will not accept an unpleasant truth. (不愉快事实的) 拒绝接受

1. ADJ Compact things are small or take up very little space. You use this word when you think this is a good quality. 小巧的 [表赞许] 2. ADJ A compact person is small but looks strong. 矮小结实的 3. N-COUNT A compact or a compact car is a car that is smaller than the average car, and that is economical to run. 小型汽车 4. N-COUNT a small flat case containing a mirror, face powder, etc, designed to be carried in a woman's handbag 化妆盒 5. N an official contract or agreement 官方合同; 官方协议 6. V to pack or join closely together; compress; condense 紧密地装、连在一起; 压缩; 浓缩

1. N-COUNT An affiliate is an organization which is officially connected with another, larger organization or is a member of it. 分支机构; 成员组织 [正式] 2. V-I If an organization affiliates with another larger organization, it forms a close connection with the larger organization or becomes a member of it. 成为隶属机构; 成为会员组织 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A borough is a town, or a district within a large city, which has its own council, government, or local services. 自治市; (大城市中的) 自治区

1. N the god of light, poetry, music, healing, and prophecy: son of Zeus and Leto 阿波罗; 太阳神，宙斯和勒托之子 [classical myth] 1. N any of a series of manned US spacecraft designed to explore the moon and surrounding space. Apollo 11 made the first moon landing in July 1969 “阿波罗”号宇宙飞船

1. V-T To launch a rocket, missile, or satellite means to send it into the air or into space. 发射 2. N-VAR Launch is also a noun. 发射 3. V-T To launch a ship or a boat means to put it into water, often for the first time after it has been built. 使 (新船等) 下水 4. N-COUNT Launch is also a noun. 下水 5. V-T To launch a large and important activity, for example, a military attack, means to start it. 发起 6. N-COUNT Launch is also a noun. 发起 7. V-T If a company launches a new product, it makes it available to the public. 推出 (新产品) 8. N-COUNT Launch is also a noun. 推出 9. N a motor driven boat used chiefly as a transport boat 摩托艇
1. N-COUNT A stimulant is a drug that makes your body work faster, often increasing your heart rate and making you less likely to sleep. 兴奋剂

1. N-COUNT A siege is a military or police operation in which soldiers or police surround a place in order to force the people there to come out or give up control of the place. 包围 [also 'under' N] 2. PHRASE If police, soldiers, or journalists lay siege to a place, they surround it in order to force the people there to come out or give up control of the place. 包围
1. N-UNCOUNT Compliancewith something, for example a law, treaty, or agreement, means doing what you are required or expected to do. 遵从 [正式]

1. ADJ Someone who is informed knows about a subject or what is happening in the world. 见多识广的; 了解情况的 2. → see also well-informed 3. ADJ When journalists talk about informed sources, they mean people who are likely to give correct information because of their private or special knowledge. 有根据的 (消息来源) [ADJ n] 4. ADJ An informed guess or decision is one that likely to be good, because it is based on definite knowledge or information. 明智的 (猜测或决定) [ADJ n] 5. → see also inform
1. N-COUNT An offender is a person who has committed a crime. 罪犯 2. N-COUNT You can refer to someone or something which you think is causing a problem as an offender. 制造麻烦者; 造成麻烦之物
1. N-SING Theaftermathof an important event, especially a harmful one, is the situation that results from it. (灾难性大事件的) 后果

1. N-COUNT A slave is someone who is the property of another person and has to work for that person. 奴隶 2. N-COUNT You can describe someone as a slave when they are completely under the control of another person or of a powerful influence. 奴隶般受控制的人 3. V-I If you say that a person is slaving over something or is slaving for someone, you mean that they are working very hard. 苦干 4. PHRASAL VERB Slave away means the same as . 苦干

1. N-COUNT The leader of the government of a country is sometimes referred to as the country's premier. 总理 2. ADJ Premier is used to describe something that is considered to be the best or most important thing of a particular type. 最好的; 首要的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ Cognitive means relating to the mental process involved in knowing, learning, and understanding things. 认知的 [正式] [ADJ n]

1. V-I When the tide or the sea ebbs, its level gradually falls. 退潮 2. N-COUNT Theebb or the ebb tide is one of the regular periods, usually two per day, when the sea gradually falls to a lower level as the tide moves away from the land. 退潮 3. V-I If someone's life, support, or feeling ebbs, it becomes weaker and gradually disappears. 衰退 [正式] 4. PHRASAL VERB Ebb away means the same as . 衰退 5. PHRASE If someone or something is at a low ebb or at their lowest ebb, they are not very successful or profitable. 处于低潮

1. N-VAR Distortion is the changing of something into something that is not true or not acceptable. 歪曲; 曲解 [表不满] 2. N-VAR Distortion is the changing of the appearance or sound of something in a way that makes it seem strange or unclear. 变形; 失真
n. 拉脱维亚
1. V-I If people subsist, they are just able to obtain the food or money that they need in order to stay alive. 生存 [正式]
1. N a person who boasts loudly or exaggeratedly; bragger 吹牛者 2. ADJ boastful 爱吹牛的

1. N-COUNT A stile is an entrance to a field or path consisting of a step on either side of a fence or wall to help people climb over it. 梯磴; 台阶 2. N a vertical framing member in a door, window frame, or piece of panelling 门梃; 窗梃
1. N-COUNT A landowner is a person who owns land, especially a large amount of land. 土地所有者(尤指地主)
1. N-VAR Partnership or a partnership is a relationship in which two or more people, organizations, or countries work together as partners. 伙伴关系
1. V-T To segregate two groups of people or things means to keep them physically apart from each other. 隔离; 分开
adv. 一般地；通常地；普通地

1. N-COUNT A technician is someone whose job involves skilled practical work with scientific equipment, for example, in a laboratory. 技术人员 2. N-COUNT A technician is someone who is very good at the detailed technical aspects of an activity. 精于某项技术的人
n. 通勤者，经常乘公共车辆往返者；[交] 月季票乘客
1. N a tax collector of Capernaum called by Christ to be one of the 12 apostles (Matthew 9:9–13; 10:3). Feast day: Sept 21 or Nov 16 马太; 迦百农一税吏，后成为耶稣十二使徒之一 [New Testament]
股市内幕交易

1. ADJ You use musical to indicate that something is connected with playing or studying music. 关于音乐的 [ADJ n] 2. musically ADV 关于音乐地 3. N-COUNT A musical is a play or film that uses singing and dancing in the story. 音乐剧; 音乐歌舞片 4. ADJ Someone who is musical has a natural ability and interest in music. 有音乐天赋的; 喜爱音乐的 5. ADJ Sounds that are musical are light and pleasant to hear. 悦耳的

1. ADJ A classic example of a thing or situation has all the features which you expect such a thing or situation to have. 典型的 2. N-COUNT Classic is also a noun. 典范 3. ADJ A classic film, piece of writing, or piece of music is of very high quality and has become a standard against which similar things are judged. 经典的 [ADJ n] 4. N-COUNT Classic is also a noun. 经典 5. N-COUNT A classic is a book which is well-known and considered to be of a high literary standard. You can refer to such books generally as the classics. 文学名著 6. N-UNCOUNT Classics is the study of the ancient Greek and Roman civilizations, especially their languages, literature, and philosophy. 古典学
1. N-COUNT The belly of a person or animal is their stomach or abdomen. 肚子; 腹部
1. ADJ Something that is startling is so different, unexpected, or remarkable that people react to it with surprise. 惊人的
1. N-COUNT A canton is a political or administrative region in some countries, for example Switzerland. (瑞士等国家的)行政区

1. N-COUNT A politician's opponents are other politicians who belong to a different party or who have different aims or policies. (政) 敌 2. N-COUNT In a sports contest, your opponent is the person who is playing against you. (体育比赛中的) 对手 3. N-COUNT The opponents of an idea or policy do not agree with it and do not want it to be carried out. 反对者
n. 后端
1. ADJ If you describe someone or something as convincing, you mean that they make you believe that a particular thing is true, correct, or genuine. 有说服力的 2. convincingly ADV 有说服力地
1. ADJ of or relating to Venezuela or its inhabitants 委内瑞拉的; 委内瑞拉人的 2. N a native or inhabitant of Venezuela 委内瑞拉人
1. ADJ A handsome man has an attractive face with regular features. 英俊的 2. ADJ A handsome sum of money is a large or generous amount. (款项) 相当大的; 可观的 [正式] [ADJ n]
1. ADJ (of a dielectric material, transmission line, etc) designed to have a high attenuation; dissipating energy (介电材料、传输线等)高损耗的 → compare lossless
1. N-COUNT An infection is a disease caused by germs or bacteria. 传染病 2. → see also infect
步行；在进行中

1. ADJ If you are delighted, you are extremely pleased and excited about something. 高兴的 2. delightedly ADV 高兴地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If someone invites or asks you to do something, you can say that you would be delighted to do it, as a way of showing that you are very willing to do it. 乐意的 [情感]
adv. 每年；一年一次

1. N-COUNT A Latino is an American boy or man who originally came from Latin America, or whose family originally came from Latin America. 美籍拉美后裔男性 [美国英语] [oft N n] 2. ADJ Latino means belonging or relating to Latino people or their culture. 美籍拉美人的; 美籍拉美文化的
1. V-T If something irritates you, it keeps annoying you. 激怒 2. irritated ADJ 被激怒的 3. V-T If something irritates a part of your body, it causes it to itch or become sore. 刺激

1. N-COUNT A rally is a large public meeting that is held in order to show support for something such as a political party. 集会 2. V-T/V-I When people rally to something or when something rallies them, they unite to support it. 一致支持; 团结起来 3. V to bring (a group, unit, etc) into order, as after dispersal, or (of such a group) to reform and come to order 重整; 整编 4. V-I When someone or something rallies, they begin to recover or improve after having been weak. 恢复健康; 好转 5. N-COUNT Rally is also a noun. 恢复健康; 好转 6. N-COUNT A rally in tennis, badminton, or squash is a continuous series of shots that the players exchange without stopping. (网球、羽毛球、壁球中的) 连续对打 7. N-COUNT A rally is a competition in which vehicles are driven over public roads. 公路车赛 8. V to mock or ridicule (someone) in a good-natured way; chaff; tease (善意地)取笑; 打趣
1. ADJ Steamy means involving exciting sex. 色情的 [非正式] 2. ADJ A steamy place has hot, wet air. 湿热的

1. N-COUNT A veteran is someone who has served in the armed forces of their country, especially during a war. 退伍军人 2. N-COUNT You use veteran to refer to someone who has been involved in a particular activity for a long time. 经验丰富的人
1. N-COUNT Insurgents are people who are fighting against the government or army of their own country. 起义者 [正式] [usu pl]
1. N-COUNT A nominee is someone who is nominated for a job, position, or award. 候选人
n. 效力

1. PHRASE A person or thing of repute or of high repute is respected and known to be good. 名声好的; 有良好名誉的 [正式] [n PHR] 2. N-UNCOUNT A person's or organization's repute is their reputation, especially when this is good. 名声; 名望; 美名 [正式] [usu with supp]
1. ADJ If someone or their conduct is culpable, they are responsible for something wrong or bad that has happened. 难辞其咎的 [正式] 2. culpability N-UNCOUNT
1. ADJ If things are distributed throughout an area, object, or group, they exist throughout it. 分布式的

1. N-COUNT Pyramids are ancient stone buildings with four triangular sloping sides. The most famous pyramids are those built in ancient Egypt to contain the bodies of their kings and queens. 金字塔 2. N-COUNT A pyramid is a shape, object, or pile of things with a flat base and sloping triangular sides that meet at a point. 角锥形; 角锥体 3. N-COUNT You can describe something as a pyramid when it is organized so that there are fewer people at each level as you go toward the top. 金字塔形结构

1. V-T To insulate something such as a building means to protect it from cold, heat, or noise by placing a layer of other material around it or inside it. 使隔 (冷) 热; 使隔音 2. V-T If a piece of equipment is insulated, it is covered with rubber or plastic to prevent electricity from passing through it and giving the person using it an electric shock. 使绝缘 3. V-T If a person or group is insulated from the rest of society or from outside influences, they are protected from them. 使隔离 4. insulation N-UNCOUNT 隔绝
1. ADJ Evolutionary means relating to a process of gradual change and development. 进化的

1. N-COUNT A hoop is a ring made of wood, metal, or plastic. (木头、金属或塑料制成的) 环 2. N-COUNT A basketball hoop is the ring that players try to throw the ball into in order to score points for their team. (篮球) 篮圈 3. V to surround with or as if with a hoop 包围 4. N/V → a variant spelling of whoop 5. PHRASE If someone makes you jump through hoops, they make you do lots of difficult or boring things in order to please them or achieve something. 饱受折磨
1. N-COUNT A dram is a small measure of whisky. 少量威士忌 [SCOTTISH] [oft N 'of' n]
1. N-COUNT The participants in an activity are the people who take part in it. 参加者

1. CONJ You use though to introduce a statement in a subordinate clause which contrasts with the statement in the main clause. You often use though to introduce a fact which you regard as less important than the fact in the main clause. 尽管 2. CONJ You use though to introduce a subordinate clause which gives some information that is relevant to the main clause and weakens the force of what it is saying. 不过 3. as though →see as 4. even though →see even
1. N → a dialect or informal word for potato
1. N-COUNT If something is an anomaly, it is different from what is usual or expected. 反常的事物 [正式]
1. →see mild 2. PHRASE You use to put it mildly to indicate that you are describing something in language that is much less strong, direct, or critical than what you really think. 说得委婉些
1. N any temporary structure used in the process of building, esp the horizontal platforms supported by scaffolding (施工中用的临时)脚手架工作平台

1. N-COUNT A tank is a large container for holding liquid or gas. (盛放液体或气体的) 罐; 箱; 槽 2. N-COUNT A tank is a large military vehicle that is equipped with weapons and moves along on metal tracks that are fitted over the wheels. 坦克 3. V-I If something such as a stock price or a movie tanks, it performs very badly, for example because it loses a lot of money. 表现得很糟糕 [美国英语] [非正式]

1. V-T If you drag something, you pull it along the ground, often with difficulty. (费力地) 拖 2. V-T To drag a computer image means to use the mouse to move the position of the image on the screen, or to change its size or shape. (用鼠标) 拖 [计算机] 3. V-T If someone drags you somewhere, they pull you there, or force you to go there by physically threatening you. 硬拉; 硬拽 4. V-T If someone drags you somewhere you do not want to go, they make you go there. 强迫 5. V-T If you say that you drag yourself somewhere, you are emphasizing that you have to make a very great effort to go there. 勉强 [强调] 6. V-T If you drag your foot or your leg behind you, you walk with great difficulty because your foot or leg is injured in some way. 拖着 (受伤的脚或腿) 行走 7. V-T If the police drag a river or lake, they pull nets or hooks across the bottom of it in order to look for something. (用网或钩) 在水中搜寻 8. V-I If a period of time or an event drags, it is very boring and seems to last a long time. (时间或事件) 拖沓 9. N-SING If something is a drag on t
1. N-COUNT A concept is an idea or abstract principle. 概念; 观念
1. N-COUNT A comma is the punctuation mark , which is used to separate parts of a sentence or items in a list. 逗号
n. 合并多个数组；合并多个字符串

1. V-T If you slash something, you make a long, deep cut in it. 砍; 劈 2. N-COUNT Slash is also a noun. 劈砍; 砍击 3. V-I If you slash at a person or thing, you quickly hit at them with something such as a knife. 挥舞 (刀等) 击打 4. V-T To slash something such as costs or jobs means to reduce them by a large amount. 大幅度削减 [journalism] 5. N-COUNT A slash is a sloping line that separates letters, words, or numbers, for example, in 340/2/K. 斜线号

1. N-VAR A custom is an activity, a way of behaving, or an event which is usual or traditional in a particular society or in particular circumstances. 风俗 2. N-SING If it is your custom to do something, you usually do it in particular circumstances. 习惯 3. → see also customs

1. N-COUNT Journalists use heartland or heartlands to refer to the area or region where a particular set of activities or beliefs is most significant. (某活动或信仰占优势的) 中心区域 2. N-COUNT The most central area of a country or continent can be referred to as its heartland or heartlands. (国家或大陆的) 心脏地带 [书面]

1. ADJ If you describe something as devastating, you are emphasizing that it is very harmful or damaging. 破坏性极强的 [强调] 2. ADJ You can use devastating to emphasize that something is very shocking, upsetting, or terrible. 令人震惊的 [强调] 3. ADJ You can use devastating to emphasize that something or someone is very impressive. 给人印象深刻的 [强调]
n. 创造力；创造性
n. 沙特（人名）

1. N-COUNT An outpost is a small group of buildings used for trading or military purposes, either in a distant part of your own country or in a foreign country. (设在国内边远地区或国外的) 军事基地; 贸易基地 2. N-COUNT An outpost is a small settlement or community that is situated in a remote part of a country. 边远居民点
n. 马尔科姆（男子名）

1. ADJ If you describe something as exclusive, you mean that it is limited to people who have a lot of money or who are privileged, and is therefore not available to everyone. 仅限富贵人士的 2. ADJ Something that is exclusive is used or owned by only one person or group, and not shared with anyone else. 专用的; 独有的 3. ADJ If a newspaper, magazine, or broadcasting organization describes one of its reports as exclusive, they mean it is a special report that does not appear in any other publication or on any other channel. 独家的 (新闻报道) 4. N-COUNT An exclusive is an exclusive article or report. 独家文章; 独家报道 5. ADJ If a company states that its prices, goods, or services are exclusive of something, that thing is not included in the stated price, although it usually still has to be paid for. 不包括…的 6. PHRASE If two things are mutually exclusive, they are separate and very different from each other, so that it is impossible for them to exist or happen together. 互相排斥的; 不兼容的

1. N-COUNT A jetty is a wide stone wall or wooden platform where boats stop to let people get on or off, or to load or unload goods. 码头 2. N-COUNT A jetty is a structure that is built at the edge of a shore in order to protect a harbour or to reduce the force of currents and waves. 防波堤 3. ADJ of or resembling jet, esp in colour or polish 黑玉的; (颜色和光泽)像黑玉的
1. V-T If you provoke someone, you deliberately annoy them and try to make them behave aggressively. 对…挑衅 2. V-T If something provokes a reaction, it causes it. 引起
1. V-I If you swagger, you walk in a very proud, confident way, holding your body upright and swinging your hips. 大摇大摆地走 2. N-SING Swagger is also a noun. 大摇大摆

1. V-T When an accountant audits an organization's accounts, he or she examines the accounts officially in order to make sure that they have been done correctly. 审计 2. N-COUNT Audit is also a noun. 审计
1. N-COUNT Themetro is the subway system in some cities, for example in Washington or Paris. 地铁
n. 罗兹岛（希腊东南端佐泽卡尼索斯群岛中最大的岛屿）；罗兹市（罗兹岛上的港口城市）
1. N-UNCOUNT Hatred is an extremely strong feeling of dislike for someone or something. 憎恨
1. N-COUNT A forecaster is someone who uses detailed knowledge about a particular activity in order to work out what they think will happen in that activity in the future. 预报员

1. N-COUNT A metre is a metric unit of length equal to 100 centimetres. 米 2. N-VAR the rhythmic arrangement of syllables in verse, usually according to the number and kind of feet in a line (诗歌的)韵律; 格律 [prosody]
n. (Munk)人名；(英)芒克；(德、丹、匈、捷、塞、瑞典)蒙克
1. ADJ If something is adequate, there is enough of it or it is good enough to be used or accepted. 足够的 2. adequately ADV 足够地 [ADV with v]

1. N-COUNT Thefoundationof something such as a belief or way of life is the things on which it is based. 基础 2. N-COUNT A foundation is an organization which provides money for a special purpose such as research or charity. 基金会 3. N-PLURAL The foundations of a building or other structure are the layer of bricks or concrete below the ground that it is built on. 地基 4. N-UNCOUNT If a story, idea, or argument has no foundation, there are no facts to prove that it is true. 根据 5. N-MASS Foundation is a skin-coloured cream that you put on your face before putting on the rest of your makeup. 粉底霜 6. → see also found

1. V-T If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way. 违抗 2. V-T If you defy someone to do something, you challenge them to do it when you think that they will be unable to do it or too frightened to do it. 向…挑战; 惹 3. V-T If something defies description or understanding, it is so strange, extreme, or surprising that it is almost impossible to understand or explain. 使不可能 (理解或解释) [no passive, no cont]

1. ADJ A tame animal or bird is one that is not afraid of humans. 驯服的 2. ADJ If you say that something or someone is tame, you are criticizing them for being weak and uninteresting, rather than forceful or shocking. 软弱的; 乏味的 [表不满] 3. V-T If someone tames a wild animal or bird, they train it not to be afraid of humans and to do what they say. 驯化
1. N-VAR Departure or a departure is the act of going away from somewhere. 离开 2. N-COUNT If someone does something different or unusual, you can refer to their action as a departure. 背离

1. N-SING If an event or a series of events has been mentioned and you want to talk about it again, you can refer to it as the affair. 事件 2. N-SING You can refer to an important or interesting event or situation as "the ... affair." (…) 事件 [journalism] 3. N-SING You can describe the main quality of an event by saying that it is a particular kind of affair. (某种性质的) 事 4. N-COUNT If two people who are not married to each other have an affair, they have a sexual relationship. 不正当关系 5. → see also love affair 6. N-PLURAL You can use affairs to refer to all the important facts or activities that are connected with a particular subject. (有关某话题的) 事务 7. → see also current affairs, state of affairs 8. N-PLURAL Your affairs are all the matters connected with your life that you consider to be private and normally deal with yourself. (个人的) 事情

1. ADJ The underlying features of an object, event, or situation are not obvious, and it may be difficult to discover or reveal them. 潜在的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You describe something as underlying when it is below the surface of something else. 在下面的 [ADJ n] 3. → see also underlie
n. 进步派；进步人士（progressive的复数形式）；进步论者
1. N-UNCOUNT Replenishment is the process by which something is made full or complete again. 补充; 充满 [正式] [usu with supp]

1. ADJ You use typical to describe someone or something that shows the most usual characteristics of a particular type of person or thing, and is therefore a good example of that type. (某人或某物) 有典型性的; 有代表性的 2. ADJ If a particular action or feature is typical of someone or something, it shows their usual qualities or characteristics. (行为或特征) 典型的 3. ADJ If you say that something is typical of a person, situation, or thing, you are criticizing them or complaining about them and saying that they are just as bad or disappointing as you expected them to be. 一贯的 (用于批评或抱怨) [情感]
1. N-PLURAL You can refer to chickens, ducks, and other birds that are kept for their eggs and meat as poultry. 家禽 2. N-UNCOUNT Meat from these birds is also referred to as poultry. 家禽肉
由于，因为…

1. V-T When an army repels an attack, they successfully fight and drive back soldiers from another army who have attacked them. 击退; 打退 [正式] 2. V-T If something repels you, you find it horrible and disgusting. 使厌恶; 使反感 [no cont] 3. repelled ADJ 厌恶的; 反感的 4. V-RECIP When a magnetic pole repels another magnetic pole, it gives out a force that pushes the other pole away. You can also say that two magnetic poles repel each other or that they repel. 排斥; (磁极间) 相斥 [技术]
1. V-T If something or someone withstands a force or action, they survive it or do not give in to it. 抵御 [正式]

1. V-T To wreck something means to completely destroy or ruin it. 摧毁 2. N-COUNT A wreck is something such as a ship, car, plane, or building that has been destroyed, usually in an accident. (轮船、汽车、飞机或房屋失事后的) 残骸 3. N-COUNT A wreck is an accident in which a moving vehicle hits something and is damaged or destroyed. 撞车事故 [美国英语] 4. N-COUNT If you say that someone is a wreck, you mean that they are very exhausted or unhealthy. 疲惫不堪的人; 不健康的人 [非正式]

1. V-T/V-I If you drain a liquid from a place or object, you remove the liquid by causing it to flow somewhere else. If a liquid drains somewhere, it flows there. 使流走; 流走 2. V-T/V-I If you drain a place or object, you dry it by causing water to flow out of it. If a place or object drains, water flows out of it until it is dry. 排干; 流干 3. V-T/V-I If you drain food or if food drains, you remove the liquid that it has been in, especially after it has been cooked or soaked in water. 使沥干; 沥干 4. V-T/V-I If the colour or the blood drains or is drained from someone's face, they become very pale. You can also say that someone's face drains or is drained of colour. 使 (色泽) 消退; (色泽) 消退 [文学性] 5. V-T If something drains you, it leaves you feeling physically and emotionally exhausted. 使心力交瘁 6. drained ADJ 使心力交瘁的 7. V-T If you say that a country's or a company's resources or finances are drained, you mean that they are used or spent completely. 耗尽 (资源、资金) 8. N-COUNT A drain is a pipe that carries water or sewage away
1. ADJ Medium-sized means neither large nor small, but approximately halfway between the two. 中型的; 中等大小的 [usu ADJ n]
1. ADJ Something or someone that is elusive is difficult to find, describe, remember, or achieve. 难 (找、形容、记、取得) 的

1. N-COUNT A demonstration is a march or gathering which people take part in to show their opposition to something or their support for something. 示威游行; 示威集会 2. N-COUNT A demonstration of something is a talk by someone who shows you how to do it or how it works. 展示 3. N-COUNT A demonstration of a fact or situation is a clear proof of it. 证明 4. N-COUNT A demonstration of a quality or feeling is an expression of it. (品质、感情的) 展现

1. V-T When you spell a word, you write or speak each letter in the word in the correct order. 拼写; 拼读 2. PHRASAL VERB Spell out means the same as . 拼写; 拼读 3. V-T/V-I Someone who can spell knows the correct order of letters in words. 写; 写字 [no cont] 4. V-T If something spells a particular outcome, often an unpleasant one, it suggests that this will be the result. 预示 (通常不好的结果) [no cont] 5. N-COUNT A spell of a particular type of weather or a particular activity is a short period of time during which this type of weather or activity occurs. (某种天气或活动的) 短暂发生期 6. V to take over from (a person) for an interval of time; relieve temporarily 在间歇期接替(某人); 暂时换岗 7. N-COUNT A spell is a situation in which events are controlled by a magical power. 魔 8. N a period or tour of duty after which one person or group relieves another 轮班的时间 9. → see also spelling
1. N-COUNT A Frisbee is a light plastic disc that one person throws to another as a game. 飞盘 [trademark]
1. V-T If you unplug an electrical device or telephone, you pull a wire out of an outlet so that it stops working. 拔去…的电源插头
n. 唐纳德（男子名）

1. N-COUNT A graft is a piece of healthy skin or bone, or a healthy organ, which is attached to a damaged part of your body by a medical operation in order to replace it. (皮肤、骨头等的) 移植物 2. V-T If a piece of healthy skin or bone or a healthy organ is grafted onto a damaged part of your body, it is attached to that part of your body by a medical operation. 移植 [usu passive] 3. V-T If a part of one plant or tree is grafted onto another plant or tree, they are joined together so that they will become one plant or tree, often in order to produce a new variety. 将…嫁接 (于…) 4. N-UNCOUNT work (esp in the phrase hard graft) (尤指辛苦的)工作 5. V to work 工作

1. N the occurrence of more than one form of individual in a single species within an interbreeding population 多态性 2. N the occurrence of more than one form in the individual polyps of a coelenterate colony (腔肠动物)多形态

1. PRON-INDEF You use something to refer to a thing, situation, event, or idea, without saying exactly what it is. 某物; 某事 2. PRON-INDEF You can use something to say that the description or amount that you are giving is not exact. 有点像; 差不多 [PRON prep] 3. PRON-INDEF If you say that a person or thing is something or is really something, you mean that you are very impressed by them. 真不错 [非正式] 4. PRON-INDEF You can use something in expressions like "that's something" when you think that a situation is not very good but is better than it might have been. 差强人意 5. PRON-INDEF If you say that a thing is something of a disappointment, you mean that it is quite disappointing. If you say that a person is something of an artist, you mean that they are quite good at art. 有点儿 [PRON 'of' n] 6. PRON-INDEF If you say that there is something in an idea or suggestion, you mean that it is quite good and should be considered seriously. (想法或建议) 有道理 [PRON 'in' n] 7. PRON-INDEF You use something in expressions such as "or some
1. N any cephalopod mollusc of the genus Nautilus, esp the pearly nautilus 鹦鹉螺目软体动物

1. N-UNCOUNT Culture consists of activities such as the arts and philosophy, which are considered to be important for the development of civilization and of people's minds. 文化 2. N-COUNT A culture is a particular society or civilization, especially considered in relation to its beliefs, way of life, or art. (与某种特定信仰、生活方式或艺术相连的) 社会或文明 3. N-COUNT The culture of a particular organization or group consists of the habits of the people in it and the way they generally behave. (组织或团体的) 习惯和行为方式 4.
