N-COUNT In science, a culture is a group of bacteria or cells which are grown, usually in a laboratory as part of an experiment. 一组培养菌; 一组培养细胞 [技术]
节约用水
1. N-VAR Sediment is solid material that settles at the bottom of a liquid, especially earth and pieces of rock that have been carried along and then left somewhere by water, ice, or wind. 沉淀物; 沉渣
1. ADJ If you say that someone or something is dignified, you mean they are calm, impressive, and deserve respect. 有尊严的; 高贵的

1. V-T/V-I If something said or written is translated from one language into another, it is said or written again in the second language. 翻译 2. translation N-UNCOUNT 翻译 3. V-I If a name, a word, or an expression translates as something in a different language, that is what it means in that language. (翻译过来) 意思是 4. V-T/V-I If one thing translates or is translated into another, the second happens or is done as a result of the first. 转变
1. N-COUNT If there is an outbreak of something unpleasant, such as violence or a disease, it suddenly starts to happen. (暴动、疾病等的) 爆发
n. 索尼（日本电子娱乐公司） n. (Sony)人名；(中非、印尼)索尼
1. N a huge self-service shop, usually built on the outskirts of a town 超级购物商城 [英国英语]

1. N-VAR An election is a process in which people vote to choose a person or group of people to hold an official position. 选举 2. N-UNCOUNT The election of a particular person or group of people is their success in winning an election. 当选 [usu with poss]

1. N-VAR The separation of two or more things or groups is the fact that they are separate or become separate, and are not linked. 分离; 分开; 隔离 [oft N 'of/from/between' n] 2. N-VAR During a separation, people who usually live together are not together. 分离期间 3. N-VAR If a couple who are married or living together have a separation, they decide to live apart. 分居
1. N-UNCOUNT Botox is a substance that is injected into the face in order to make the skin look smoother. 肉毒杆菌素 [trademark] [oft N n]
n. 哈米德（人名）
1. N the placenta and fetal membranes expelled from the uterus after the birth of the offspring 胎衣; 分娩以后从子宫脱落的胎盘及胎膜

1. ADJ If you say that someone is a noble person, you admire and respect them because they are unselfish and morally good. 高尚的 [表赞许] 2. nobly ADV 高尚地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If you say that something is a noble idea, goal, or action, you admire it because it is based on high moral principles. 崇高的 [表赞许] 4. ADJ If you describe something as noble, you think that its appearance or quality is very impressive, making it superior to other things of its type. 卓越的; 超群的 5. ADJ Noble means belonging to a high social class and having a title. 高贵的; 贵族的
1. ADJ If a person or society has humanitarian ideas or behaviour, they try to avoid making people suffer or they help people who are suffering. 人道主义的
唯唯诺诺的人；唯命是从的人
n. 雅加达（印尼首都，等于Djakarta）
1. V ken的过去式和过去分词 → a past tense and past participle of ken

1. N any of a number of categories of relations that permit at least some members of their domain to be placed in order. A linear or simple ordering is reflexive, antisymmetric, transitive, and connected, as less than or equal to on the integers. A partial ordering is reflexive, antisymmetric, and transitive, as set inclusion. Either of these orderings is called strict if it is asymmetric instead of reflexive and antisymmetric. It is a well-ordering if every nonempty subset has a least member under the relation 排序 [logic]

1. V-T If you alienate someone, you make them become unfriendly or unsympathetic toward you. 冷落 2. V-T To alienate a person from someone or something that they are normally linked with means to cause them to be emotionally or intellectually separated from them. 使疏远

1. ADJ Something that is stiff is firm or does not bend easily. 硬的; 不易弯曲的 2. stiffly ADV 硬地; 不易弯曲地 3. ADJ Something such as a door or drawer that is stiff does not move as easily as it should. (门或抽屉) 难移动的 4. ADJ If you are stiff, your muscles or joints hurt when you move, because of illness or because of too much exercise. 酸痛的 5. stiffly ADV 酸痛地 6. ADJ Stiff behaviour is rather formal and not very friendly or relaxed. 拘谨的; 生硬的 7. stiffly ADV 拘谨地; 生硬地 8. ADJ Stiff can be used to mean difficult or severe. 艰难的; 激烈的 9. ADV If you are bored stiff, worried stiff, or scared stiff, you are extremely bored, worried, or scared. 极度地 [非正式] [adj ADV] 10. ADJ Stiff is also an adjective. 极度的 [v n ADJ]
n. [计][环境] 资源；物力（resource的复数） v. 向…提供资金（resource的第三人称单数）

1. N-UNCOUNT Overtime is time that you spend doing your job in addition to your normal working hours. 加班 2. PHRASE If you say that someone is working overtime to do something, you mean that they are using a lot of energy, effort, or enthusiasm trying to do it. 全力以赴地做 [非正式] 3. N-UNCOUNT Overtime is an additional period of time that is added to the end of a sports game in which the score is tied, so that one team can score and win the game. 加时赛
1. N-UNCOUNT Equality is the same status, rights, and responsibilities for all the members of a society, group, or family. 平等

1. N-COUNT A conviction is a strong belief or opinion. 坚定的信念 [usu N that] 2. N-COUNT If someone has a conviction, they have been found guilty of a crime in a court of law. 判罪 3. N-UNCOUNT If you have conviction, you have great confidence in your beliefs or opinions. 坚信

1. V-T If you demand something such as information or action, you ask for it in a very forceful way. 强烈要求 2. V-T If one thing demands another, the first needs the second in order to happen or be dealt with successfully. 需要 3. N-COUNT A demand is a firm request for something. 坚决的要求 4. N-UNCOUNT If you refer to demand, or to the demand for something, you are referring to how many people want to have it, do it, or buy it. 需求量 5. N-PLURAL Thedemandsof something or its demands on you are the things which it needs or the things which you have to do for it. 要求 6. PHRASE If someone or something is in demand or in great demand, they are very popular and a lot of people want them. 受欢迎的 7. PHRASE If something is available or happens on demand, you can have it or it happens whenever you want it or ask for it. 一经要求
1. N-COUNT A fisherman is a person who catches fish as a job or for sport. 渔民; 垂钓者
1. V-T If you modify something, you change it slightly, usually in order to improve it. 修改 2. modification N-VAR 修改

1. ADJ A profitable organization or practice makes a profit. 可盈利的 2. profitably ADV 可盈利地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ Something that is profitable results in some benefit for you. 能带来利益的 4. profitably ADV 能带来利益地 [ADV with v]

1. V-I If people migrate, they move from one place to another, especially in order to find work or to live somewhere for a short time. 迁移 2. migration N-VAR 迁移 3. V-I When birds, fish, or animals migrate, they move at a particular season from one part of the world or from one part of a country to another, usually in order to breed or to find new feeding grounds. 迁徙 4. migration N-VAR 迁徙
n. 尼古拉斯（男子名）

1. N-COUNT The failings of someone or something are their faults or unsatisfactory features. 错误; 缺点 2. PHRASE You say failing that to introduce an alternative, in case what you have just said is not possible. 如果不能的话
adv. 精神上，智力上；心理上

1. ADJ If something or someone is obscure, they are unknown, or are known by only a few people. 鲜为人知的 2. ADJ Something that is obscure is difficult to understand or deal with, usually because it involves so many parts or details. 复杂难懂的; 难处理的 3. V-T If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly. 遮掩 4. V-T To obscure something means to make it difficult to understand. 使…难懂

1. N-COUNT A portfolio is a set of pictures by someone, photographs of their work, or examples of their writing, which they use when entering competitions or applying for work. (用于参赛或求职的) 作品选辑 2. N-COUNT In finance, a portfolio is the combination of investments that a particular person or company owns. 投资组合 [商业] 3. N-COUNT In politics, a portfolio is a high-ranking official's responsibility for a particular area of a government's activities. (高官的) 职责 4. N-COUNT A company's portfolio of products or designs is their range of products or designs. (产品或设计的) 系列 [商业]
n. 巴勃罗（西班牙籍体育明星）；帕布洛（英国水槽产品品牌）；帕布鲁（西班牙著名画家毕加索的姓）
1. N a coarse hair or strand of hair, esp one in a fleece that resists dyeing 粗毛

1. N-COUNT A draft is an early version of a letter, book, or speech. 草稿; 初稿 2. N-COUNT A draft is a written order for payment of money by a bank, especially from one bank to another. 汇票 3. N-COUNT A draft is a current of air that comes into a place in an undesirable way. (钻进某处的) 风 [美国英语] 4. V-T When you draft a letter, book, or speech, you write the first version of it. 起草 5. V-T If you are drafted, you are ordered to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time. 征兵 [美国英语] [usu passive] 6. V-T If people are drafted to do something, they are asked to do a particular job. 选派 7. N-SING The draft is the practice of ordering people to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time. 征兵 [美国英语]

1. V-T When creatures such as insects or rats infest plants or a place, they are present in large numbers and cause damage. (昆虫或老鼠等) 大批出没于 2. infested ADJ 大批出没的 3. V-T If you say that people or things you disapprove of or regard as dangerous are infesting a place, you mean that there are large numbers of them in that place. 充斥着 [表不满] 4. infested ADJ 成群危害的

1. N-COUNT Your fingers are the long thin parts at the end of each hand, sometimes also including the thumb. 手指 2. N-COUNT The fingers of a glove are the parts that a person's fingers fit into. (手套的) 指套 3. N-COUNT A finger of something such as smoke or land is an amount of it that is shaped rather like a finger. 指状物 4. V-T If you finger something, you touch or feel it with your fingers. 用手指触摸 5. PHRASE If you cross your fingers, you put one finger on top of another and hope for good luck. If you say that someone is keeping their fingers crossed, you mean they are hoping for good luck. (交叉手指以) 祈求好运 6. PHRASE If you say that someone did not lay a finger on a particular person or thing, you are emphasizing that they did not touch or harm them at all. 动…一个指头 [强调] 7. PHRASE If you say that a person does not lift a finger or raise a finger to do something, especially to help someone, you are critical of them because they do nothing. 尽举手之劳 [表不满] 8. PHRASE If you point the finger at someone or point an accus

1. ADJ If something is distinct from something else of the same type, it is different or separate from it. 有区别的 2. distinctly ADV 不同地 [ADV adj] 3. ADJ If something is distinct, you can hear, see, or taste it clearly. 清楚的 4. distinctly ADV 清楚地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ If an idea, thought, or intention is distinct, it is clear and definite. 明显的; 确切的 6. distinctly ADV 明显地; 确切地 [ADV with v] 7. ADJ You can use distinct to emphasize that something is great enough in amount or degree to be noticeable or important. 显著的 [ADJ n] [强调] 8. distinctly ADV 显著地 [ADV adj/-ed] 9. PHRASE If you say that you are talking about one thing as distinct from another, you are indicating exactly which thing you mean. 与…有区别的
1. N-UNCOUNT Legislation consists of a law or laws passed by a government. 立法 [正式]
1. ADV You use wholly to emphasize the extent or degree to which something is the case. 完全地 [强调]

1. V-T If something is graded, its quality is judged, and it is often given a number or a name that indicates how good or bad it is. 将…分等级; 给…评分 2. N-COUNT The grade of a product is its quality, especially when this has been officially judged. 质量等级 3. COMB in ADJ Grade is also a combining form. 也用于组合式构词 4. N-COUNT Your grade in an examination or piece of written work is the mark you get, usually in the form of a letter or number, that indicates your level of achievement. (用字母或数字表示的) 成绩 5. N-COUNT Your grade in a company or organization is your level of importance or your rank. (职员的) 等级 6. N-COUNT In the United States, a grade is a group of classes in which all the children are of a similar age. When you are six years old you go into the first grade and you leave school after the twelfth grade. (美国学校中的) 年级 7. N-COUNT A grade is a slope. 斜坡 [美国英语] 8. N-COUNT Someone's grade is their military rank. 军衔 [美国英语] 9. PHRASE If someone makes the grade, they succeed, especially by reaching a particular standar

1. N-COUNT Something or someone which is a shield against a particular danger or risk provides protection from it. 防护物; 保护人 2. V-T If something or someone shields you from a danger or risk, they protect you from it. 保护 3. V-T If you shield your eyes, you put your hand above your eyes to protect them from direct sunlight. 遮挡 4. N-COUNT A shield is a large piece of metal or leather which soldiers used to carry to protect their bodies while they were fighting. 盾 5. N-COUNT A shield is a sports prize or badge that is shaped like a shield. 盾形奖章; 盾形徽章
1. ADJ full of or covered with pitch 涂满沥青的

1. N-COUNT A Protestant is a Christian who belongs to the branch of the Christian church that separated from the Catholic church in the sixteenth century. 新教徒 2. ADJ Protestant means relating to Protestants or their churches. 新教的; 新教徒的
n. （尤指大专院校的）学生（student的复数）
1. N-VAR Brutality is cruel and violent treatment or behaviour. A brutality is an instance of cruel and violent treatment or behaviour. 残暴; 残暴行为

1. V-T If you dye something such as hair or cloth, you change its colour by soaking it in a special liquid. 染色 2. N-MASS Dye is a substance made from plants or chemicals which is mixed into a liquid and used to change the colour of something such as cloth or hair. 染料

1. N-COUNT The flagship of a group of things that are owned or produced by a particular organization is the most important one. 王牌产品 2. N-COUNT A flagship is the most important ship in a fleet of ships, especially the one on which the commander of the fleet is sailing. 旗舰 [英国英语]
1. ADJ Oval things have a shape that is like a circle but is wider in one direction than the other. 椭圆的 2. N-COUNT Oval is also a noun. 椭圆

1. N-UNCOUNT Daylight is the natural light that there is during the day, before it gets dark. 日光 2. N-UNCOUNT Daylight is the time of day when it begins to get light. 拂晓 3. PHRASE If you say that a crime is committed in broad daylight, you are expressing your surprise that it is done during the day when people can see it, rather than at night. 光天化日之下 [强调]

1. N-COUNT A particular perspective is a particular way of thinking about something, especially one that is influenced by your beliefs or experiences. 思维方式; 看法 2. PHRASE If you get something in perspective or into perspective, you judge its real importance by considering it in relation to everything else. If you get something out of perspective, you fail to judge its real importance in relation to everything else. (看待事物) 正确/不正确地

1. N-COUNT An exception is a particular thing, person, or situation that is not included in a general statement, judgment, or rule. 例外 2. PHRASE If you make a general statement, and then say that something or someone is no exception, you are emphasizing that they are included in that statement. 不例外; 无例外 [强调] 3. PHRASE If you take exception to something, you feel offended or annoyed by it, usually with the result that you complain about it. 厌恶; 反感 4. PHRASE You use with the exception of to introduce a thing or person that is not included in a general statement that you are making. 除外 5. PHRASE You use without exception to emphasize that the statement you are making is true in all cases. 无例外地 [强调]
让……搭车
1. N-COUNT The connotations of a particular word or name are the ideas or qualities which it makes you think of. 内涵意义

1. N-COUNT The apostles were the followers of Jesus Christ who went from place to place telling people about him and trying to persuade them to become Christians. (耶稣的)使徒 2. N-COUNT An apostle of a particular philosophy, policy, or cause is someone who strongly believes in it and works hard to promote it. (哲学、政策或事业的)信徒 [usu N 'of' n]

1. N-UNCOUNT If someone moves with grace, they move in a smooth, controlled, and attractive way. 优美 2. N-PLURAL The graces are the ways of behaving and doing things which are considered polite and well-mannered. 风度 3. V-T If you say that something graces a place or a person, you mean that it makes them more attractive. 使优美 [正式] 4. N-UNCOUNT In Christianity and some other religions, grace is the kindness that God shows to people because He loves them. (上帝的) 恩惠 5. N-VAR When someone says grace before or after a meal, they say a prayer in which they thank God for the food and ask Him to bless it. (饭前或饭后的) 谢恩祷告
1. ADJ Carnivorous animals eat meat. 食肉的 [技术] 2. ADJ Carnivorous can be used, especially humorously, to describe someone who eats meat. (幽默方式描述某人)食肉的

1. V-T If you ignore someone or something, you pay no attention to them. 不理睬 2. V-T If you say that an argument or theory ignores an important aspect of a situation, you are criticizing it because it fails to consider that aspect or to take it into account. (某论断或理论) 忽视
1. N-VAR In linguistics, collocation is the way that some words occur regularly whenever another word is used. 词语搭配 [技术]

1. V-T/V-I If something impresses you, you feel great admiration for it. 使钦佩 2. impressed ADJ 使钦佩的 [v-link ADJ] 3. V-T If you impress something on someone, you make them understand its importance or degree. 使明白 (重要性或程度) 4. V-T If something impresses itself on your mind, you notice and remember it. 使铭记在心 5. V-T If someone or something impresses you as a particular thing, usually a good one, they give you the impression of being that thing. 使留下印象 6. V-T to commandeer or coerce (men or things) into government service; press-gang 横征暴敛; 强征入伍
1. N-COUNT A precaution is an action that is intended to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening. 防范行动
n. 老友记（剧集）

1. V-T If you endure a painful or difficult situation, you experience it and do not avoid it or give up, usually because you cannot. 承受 2. V-I If something endures, it continues to exist without any loss in quality or importance. 延续 3. enduring ADJ 持久的

1. V-T If you reproach someone, you say or show that you are disappointed, upset, or angry because they have done something wrong. 责备; 指责 2. N-VAR If you look at or speak to someone with reproach, you show or say that you are disappointed, upset, or angry because they have done something wrong. 责备; 指责 3. V-T If you reproach yourself, you think with regret about something you have done wrong. 责备 (自己)
1. N-UNCOUNT Titanium is a light strong white metal. 钛

1. V-T/V-I If a person or living thing survives in a dangerous situation such as an accident or an illness, they do not die. 存活 2. V-T/V-I If you survive in difficult circumstances, you manage to live or continue in spite of them and do not let them affect you very much. 挺过 3. V-T/V-I If something survives, it continues to exist even after being in a dangerous situation or existing for a long time. 幸存 4. V-T If you survive someone, you continue to live after they have died. 比…活得长
1. N-COUNT A tsunami is a very large wave, often caused by an earthquake, that flows onto the land and can cause widespread deaths and destruction. 海啸
1. N-COUNT A stool is a seat with legs but no support for your arms or back. 凳子

1. N-UNCOUNT Fallout is the radiation that affects a particular place or area after a nuclear explosion has taken place. 核辐射 2. N-UNCOUNT If you refer to the fallout from something that has happened, you mean the unpleasant consequences that follow it. 后果

1. ADJ If something is confined to a particular place, it exists only in that place. If it is confined to a particular group, only members of that group have it. 只限于 (某地、某团体) 的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n] 2. ADJ A confined space or area is small and enclosed by walls. (空间、区域) 有限的 3. ADJ If someone is confined to a wheelchair, bed, or house, they have to stay there, because they are disabled or ill. 被困在 (轮椅、床上、家里) 的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n]

1. N-COUNT A plant is a living thing that grows in the earth and has a stem, leaves, and roots. 植物 2. V-T When you plant a seed, plant, or young tree, you put it into the ground so that it will grow there. 栽种 3. planting N-UNCOUNT 栽种 4. V-T When someone plants land with a particular type of plant or crop, they put plants, seeds, or young trees into the land to grow them there. 将 (土地) 种植 (植被) 5. N-COUNT A plant is a factory or a place where power is produced. 工厂; 电厂 6. N-UNCOUNT Plant is large machinery that is used in industrial processes. (工业用) 大型机械设备 7. V-T If you plant something somewhere, you put it there firmly. (稳固地) 放置 8. V-T To plant something such as a bomb means to hide it somewhere so that it explodes or works there. 埋设 (炸弹等) 9. V-T If something such as a weapon or drugs is planted on someone, it is put among their possessions or in their house so that they will be wrongly accused of a crime. 放置 (武器、毒品等以栽赃) [oft passive] 10. V-T If an organization plants someone somewhere, they send that

1. ADJ A machine or piece of equipment that is operational is in use or is ready for use. (机器、设备) 使用中的; 可以使用的 2. ADJ Operational factors or problems relate to the working of a system, device, or plan. 操作上的 3. operationally ADV 操作上地
1. N-UNCOUNT Competence is the ability to do something well or effectively. 能力
1. N-COUNT Your autobiography is an account of your life, which you write yourself. 自传
1. N-UNCOUNT Poems, considered as a form of literature, are referred to as poetry. 诗歌 2. N-UNCOUNT You can describe something very beautiful as poetry. 富有诗意的东西

1. V-T If you condense something, especially a piece of writing or a speech, you make it shorter, usually by including only the most important parts. 简缩 (尤指文章、演讲稿) 2. V-T/V-I When a gas or vapour condenses, or is condensed, it changes into a liquid. (气体、蒸汽) 冷凝
1. ADJ Something that is chaotic is in a state of complete disorder and confusion. 混乱的
1. N-COUNT A buzzword is a word or expression that has become fashionable in a particular field and is being used a lot by the media. 某领域的时髦用语
1. N-COUNT A comet is a bright object with a long tail that travels around the sun. 彗星
1. N-UNCOUNT Nicotine is the substance in tobacco that people can become addicted to. 尼古丁
1. N-COUNT A listing is a published list, or an item in a published list. (公布的)目录; (公布的)名册; (目录或名册上的)一项
1. V-I If you emigrate, you leave your own country to live in another country. 移居外国 2. emigration N-UNCOUNT 移居外国
n. 倒相

1. V-T If something obliterates an object or place, it destroys it completely. 摧毁 2. obliteration N-UNCOUNT 摧毁 3. V-T If you obliterate something such as a memory, emotion, or thought, you remove it completely from your mind. (从头脑中) 抹掉

1. V-T If something warrants a particular action, it makes the action seem necessary or appropriate for the circumstances. 使…显得必要; 使…显得适当 2. N-COUNT A warrant is a legal document that allows someone to do something, especially one that is signed by a judge or magistrate and gives the police permission to arrest someone or search their house. 搜查令; 拘捕令 [oft N 'for' n, also 'by' N]
1. ADJ If someone is jittery, they feel nervous or are behaving nervously. 紧张不安的 [非正式]

1. N-MASS Stone is a hard solid substance found in the ground and often used for building houses. 石头 2. N-COUNT A stone is a small piece of rock that is found on the ground. 石子 3. N-COUNT A stone is a large piece of stone put somewhere in memory of a person or event, or as a religious symbol. 石碑 4. N-UNCOUNT Stone is used in expressions such as set in stone and tablets of stone to suggest that an idea or rule is firm and fixed, and cannot be changed. (思想或规则) 固定不变 5. N-COUNT You can refer to a jewel as a stone. 宝石 6. N-COUNT A stone is a small hard ball of minerals and other substances which sometimes forms in a person's kidneys or gallbladder. 结石 7. N-COUNT The stone in a plum, cherry, or other fruit is the large hard seed in the middle of it. 果核 [英国英语] 8. V-T If people stone someone or something, they throw stones at them. 向…扔石头 9. → see also stepping stone, stoned

1. ADJ A steady situation continues or develops gradually without any interruptions and is not likely to change quickly. 稳定的 2. steadily ADV 稳定地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If an object is steady, it is firm and does not shake or move around. 平稳的 4. ADJ If you look at someone or speak to them in a steady way, you look or speak in a calm, controlled way. 镇定的 5. steadily ADV 镇定地 [ADV after v] 6. ADJ If you describe a person as steady, you mean that they are sensible and reliable. 可靠的 7. V-T/V-I If you steady something or if it steadies, it stops shaking or moving around. 使平稳; 平稳 8. V-T If you steady yourself, you control your voice or expression, so that people will think that you are calm and not nervous. 使镇定
1. N-VAR A sturgeon is a large fish which lives in northern parts of the world. Sturgeon are usually caught for their eggs, which are known as caviar. 鲟鱼

1. N-VAR If someone makes a discovery, they become aware of something that they did not know about before. 发现 2. N-VAR If someone makes a discovery, they are the first person to find or become aware of a place, substance, or scientific fact that no one knew about before. 新发现 3. N-VAR When the discovery of people or objects happens, someone finds them, either by accident or as a result of looking for them. 发现
1. ADJ Someone or something that is federalist believes in, supports, or follows a federal system of government. 联邦主义的 2. N-COUNT Federalist is also a noun. 联邦主义者
1. ADJ Seismic means caused by or relating to an earthquake. 地震的; 地震引起的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ A seismic shift or change is a very sudden or dramatic change. 突然的 [usu ADJ n]

1. N-UNCOUNT Philosophy is the study or creation of theories about basic things such as the nature of existence, knowledge, and thought, or about how people should live. 哲学 2. N-COUNT A philosophy is a particular set of ideas that a philosopher has. 哲学思想 3. N-COUNT A philosophy is a particular theory that someone has about how to live or how to deal with a particular situation. 人生哲学; 处事原则
1. ADJ Suburban means relating to a suburb. 郊区的 [ADJ n]
1. V-I If something fluctuates, it changes a lot in an irregular way. 波动 2. fluctuation N-VAR 波动
1. N-PLURAL basic realities; hard facts (esp in the phrase get down to brass tacks) 基本实情; 铁证 [非正式]
n. 套头衫；年轻小混混
1. V-I If you hobble, you walk in an awkward way with small steps, for example because your foot is injured. 跛行

1. V-T If you hurt yourself or hurt a part of your body, you feel pain because you have injured yourself. 使受伤 2. V-I If a part of your body hurts, you feel pain there. 感到疼痛 3. ADJ If you are hurt, you have been injured. 受了伤的 4. V-T/V-I If you hurt someone, you cause them to feel pain. 弄痛 5. V-T/V-I If someone hurts you, they say or do something that makes you unhappy. 使伤心; 伤心 6. ADJ If you are hurt, you are upset because of something that someone has said or done. (感情上) 受到伤害的 7. V-I If you say that you are hurting, you mean that you are experiencing emotional pain. 感到痛苦的 [only cont] 8. V-T To hurt someone or something means to have a bad effect on them or prevent them from succeeding. 对…产生不良影响 9. N-VAR A feeling of hurt is a feeling that you have when you think that you have been treated badly or judged unfairly. (感情上的) 伤心或痛苦 10. N (Also whort) [Southern English] [DIALECT] → another name for whortleberry 11. PHRASE If you say "It won't hurt to do something" or "It never hurts to do something," you
曼德拉（人名）
n. [化学] 挥发性；易变；活泼

1. V-I To emerge means to come out from an enclosed or dark space such as a room or a vehicle, or from a position where you could not be seen. (从视线以外的地方) 出现; 出来 2. V-I If you emerge from a difficult or bad experience, you come to the end of it. 摆脱 3. V-T/V-I If a fact or result emerges from a period of thought, discussion, or investigation, it becomes known as a result of it. 显露 (事实、结果) 4. V-I If someone or something emerges as a particular thing, they become recognized as that thing. 立足成为 [journalism] 5. V-I When something such as an organization or an industry emerges, it comes into existence. 兴起 [journalism]
1. N-COUNT A locality is a small area of a country or city. (小片) 地区 [正式]

1. N-COUNT The scent of something is the pleasant smell that it has. 香味 2. V-T If something scents a place or thing, it makes it smell pleasant. 使充满香味 3. N-MASS Scent is a liquid which women put on their necks and wrists to make themselves smell nice. 香水 4. N-VAR The scent of a person or animal is the smell that they leave and that other people sometimes follow when looking for them. (人的) 气味; (动物留下的) 臭迹 5. V-T When an animal scents something, it becomes aware of it by smelling it. 嗅到 [no cont]

1. N-COUNT An object is anything that has a fixed shape or form, that you can touch or see, and that is not alive. 物体 2. N-COUNT The object of what someone is doing is their aim or purpose. 目的 3. N-COUNT The object of a particular feeling or reaction is the person or thing it is directed toward or that causes it. (某情感或反应的) 对象 4. N-COUNT In grammar, the object of a verb or a preposition is the word or phrase which completes the structure begun by the verb or preposition. 宾语 5. → see also direct object, indirect object 6. V-T If you object to something, you express your dislike or disapproval of it. 反对 7. PHRASE If you say that money is no object or distance is no object, you are emphasizing that you are willing or able to spend as much money as necessary or travel whatever distance is required. …不成问题 [强调]

1. N-VAR Spring is the season between winter and summer when the weather becomes warmer and plants start to grow again. 春季 2. N-COUNT A spring is a spiral of wire which returns to its original shape after it is pressed or pulled. 弹簧 3. N-COUNT A spring is a place where water comes up through the ground. It is also the water that comes from that place. 泉; 泉水 4. V-I When a person or animal springs, they jump upward or forward suddenly or quickly. (人、动物) 跳 5. V-I If something springs in a particular direction, it moves suddenly and quickly. 弹 (向某方向) 6. V-I If one thing springs from another thing, it is the result of it. 起源 7. V-T If you spring some news or a surprise on someone, you tell them something that they did not expect to hear, without warning them. 出其不意地告知; 冷不防给 8. to spring to mind →see mind

1. N-COUNT An essay is a short piece of writing on a particular subject written by a student. (学生写的) 短文 2. N-COUNT An essay is a short piece of writing on a particular subject that is written by a writer for publication. (作家写的) 文章

1. N-COUNT An incumbent is someone who holds an official post at a particular time. 在职者 [正式] 2. ADJ Incumbent is also an adjective. 在职的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ If it is incumbent on or upon you to do something, it is your duty or responsibility to do it. 有责任履行的 [正式]
n. 卡洛斯（男子名）
1. ADJ A long-standing situation has existed for a long time. 长期存在的

1. N-COUNT An assembly is a large group of people who meet regularly to make decisions or laws for a particular region or country. 议会 2. N-COUNT An assembly is a group of people gathered together for a particular purpose. 集会者 3. N-UNCOUNT When you refer to rights of assembly or restrictions on assembly, you are referring to the legal right that people have to gather together. 集会 [正式] 4. N-UNCOUNT The assembly of a machine, device, or object is the process of fitting its different parts together. 组装 5. N-VAR In a school, an assembly is a gathering of all the teachers and students for a particular purpose. (学校师生的) 大会
1. ADJ If something is tangible, it is clear enough or definite enough to be easily seen, felt, or noticed. 清晰明确的

1. N-UNCOUNT Observation is the action or process of carefully watching someone or something. 观察 2. N-COUNT An observation is something that you have learned by seeing or watching something and thinking about it. 观察结果 3. N-COUNT If a person makes an observation, they make a comment about something or someone, usually as a result of watching how they behave. 观察评论 4. N-UNCOUNT Observation is the ability to pay a lot of attention to things and to notice more about them than most people do. 观察力

1. ADV If something is universally believed or accepted, it is believed or accepted by everyone with no disagreement. 普遍(相信、接受) 地 2. ADV If something is universally true, it is true everywhere in the world or in all situations. 普遍(真实) 地

1. ADV If you fall overboard, you fall over the side of a boat into the water. 从船上 (落) 入水中 [ADV after v] 2. PHRASE If you say that someone goes overboard, you mean that they do something to a greater extent than is necessary or reasonable. 过分 [非正式]
n. 洛克菲勒（姓氏）

1. ADJ Artificial objects, materials, or processes do not occur naturally and are created by human beings, often using science or technology. 人造的 (物体、材料、工艺等) 2. artificially ADV 人造地 3. ADJ An artificial state or situation exists only because someone has created it, and therefore often seems unnatural or unnecessary. 人为的 (状态、状况) 4. artificially ADV 人为地

1. V-T/V-I When people assemble or when someone assembles them, they come together in a group, usually for a particular purpose such as a meeting. 集合 2. V-T To assemble something means to collect it together or to fit the different parts of it together. 聚集; 组装
1. N a code word for the letter g 表示“g”的电码 [communications]

1. N-UNCOUNT If you gain entry to a particular place, you are able to go in. 进入许可 2. PHRASE No Entry is used on signs to indicate that you are not allowed to go into a particular area or go through a particular door or gate. 禁止入内 3. N-COUNT You can refer to someone's arrival in a place as their entry, especially when you think that they are trying to be noticed and admired. 驾到; 莅临 4. N-UNCOUNT Someone's entry into a particular society or group is their joining of it. 加入 5. N-COUNT An entry in a diary, account book, computer file, or reference book is a short piece of writing in it. (日记中的) 简短记录; (账簿中的) 账目; (计算机文档或参考书中的) 条目 6. N-COUNT An entry for a competition is a piece of work, a story or drawing, or the answers to a set of questions, which you complete in order to take part in the competition. 参赛作品; 参赛答卷 7. N-SING Journalists sometimes use entry to refer to the total number of people taking part in an event or competition. For example, if a competition has an entry of twenty people, twenty people ta
1. ADV Nearly is used to indicate that something is not quite the case, or not completely the case. 几乎 2. ADV Nearly is used to indicate that something will soon be the case. 即将

1. N-UNCOUNT Compensation is money that someone who has experienced loss or suffering claims from the person or organization responsible, or from the state. 补偿金 2. N-VAR If something is some compensation for something bad that has happened, it makes you feel better. 补偿
1. ADJ In-house work or activities are done by employees of an organization or company, rather than by workers outside the organization or company. 机构内部的 2. ADV In-house is also an adverb. 在机构内部
现金价格；等值
1. N-COUNT If you have or bear a grudge against someone, you have unfriendly feelings toward them because of something they did in the past. 积怨
1. N-COUNT A utility is an important service such as water, electricity, or gas that is provided for everyone, and that everyone pays for. 公用事业

1. V-RECIP If you communicate with someone, you share or exchange information with them, for example by speaking, writing, or using equipment. You can also say that two people communicate. 交流 2. communication N-UNCOUNT 交流 [oft N 'with/between' n] 3. V-RECIP If one person communicates with another, they successfully make each other aware of their feelings and ideas. You can also say that two people communicate. 沟通 4. communication N-UNCOUNT 沟通 5. V-T If you communicate information, a feeling, or an idea to someone, you let them know about it. 传达
n. 绑架；诱拐 v. 绑架（kidnap的ing形式）；诱拐

1. V-T If an unpleasant event or feeling overshadows something, it makes it less happy or enjoyable. 给…蒙上阴影 2. V-T If you are overshadowed by a person or thing, you are less successful, important, or impressive than they are. 使黯然失色 [usu passive] 3. V-T If one building, tree, or large structure overshadows another, it stands near it, is much taller than it, and casts a shadow over it. 遮蔽
成为…的牺牲品；成为…的受害者；屈服于…；被…降服
1. N-UNCOUNT Someone's insistence on something is the fact that they insist that it should be done or insist that it is the case. 坚持; 坚决要求

1. PHRASE You use rather than when you are contrasting two things or situations. Rather than introduces the thing or situation that is not true or that you do not want. 而不是 2. CONJ Rather is also a conjunction. 而不是 3. ADV You use rather when you are correcting something that you have just said, especially when you are describing a particular situation after saying what it is not. (尤指修正上文时) 更确切地说 [ADV with cl/group] 4. PHRASE If you say that you would rather do something or you'd rather do it, you mean that you would prefer to do it. If you say that you would rather not do something, you mean that you do not want to do it. 宁愿/宁愿不 5. ADV You use rather to indicate that something is true to a fairly great extent, especially when you are talking about something unpleasant or undesirable. (尤指谈论令人不快的事时) 相当地 6. ADV You use rather before verbs that introduce your thoughts and feelings, in order to express your opinion politely, especially when a different opinion has been expressed. (尤指有礼貌地表达相反意见) 或多或少地 [英国英语]
1. N-VAR If you have an aversion to someone or something, you dislike them very much. 厌恶
1. N-COUNT Antibodies are substances that a person's or an animal's body produces in their blood in order to destroy substances that carry disease. 抗体
1. N-COUNT A cruiser is a motorboat which has an area for people to live or sleep. 游艇 2. N-COUNT A cruiser is a large fast warship. 巡洋舰 3. N-COUNT A cruiser is a police car. 警车 [美国英语]

1. ADJ Someone who is romantic or does romantic things says and does things that make their wife, husband, girlfriend, or boyfriend feel special and loved. 浪漫的 2. ADJ Romantic means connected with sexual love. 有关性爱的 [ADJ n] 3. romantically ADV 性爱上地 4. ADJ A romantic play, movie, or story describes or represents a love affair. 关于爱情的 (戏剧、影片或故事) [ADJ n] 5. ADJ If you say that someone has a romantic view or idea of something, you are critical of them because their view of it is unrealistic and they think that thing is better or more exciting than it really is. 浪漫主义的; 不切实际的 [表不满] 6. N-COUNT A romantic is a person who has romantic views. 浪漫主义者; 不切实际的人 7. ADJ Something that is romantic is beautiful in a way that strongly affects your feelings. 有浪漫情调的 8. romantically ADV 有浪漫情调地

1. N-COUNT A definition is a statement giving the meaning of a word or expression, especially in a dictionary. 定义 2. PHRASE If you say that something has a particular quality by definition, you mean that it has this quality simply because of what it is. 按照释义 3. N-UNCOUNT Definition is the quality of being clear and distinct. 清晰度

1. V-T If you immerse yourself in something that you are doing, you become completely involved in it. 使专心于 2. immersed ADJ 专心的 [v-link ADJ 'in' n] 3. V-T If something is immersed in a liquid, someone puts it into the liquid so that it is completely covered. 使浸没 [usu passive]
n. 爱丁堡（英国城市名）
1. N-COUNT A lesion is an injury or wound to someone's body. 损伤; 伤口 [医学]

1. N-COUNT A suburb of a city or large town is a smaller area which is part of the city or large town but is outside its centre. 市郊 2. N-PLURAL If you live in the suburbs, you live in an area of houses outside the centre of a city or large town. 郊区
1. ADJ Things that are dispersed are situated in many different places, a long way apart from each other. 分散的

1. ADJ Someone who is vulnerable is weak and without protection, with the result that they are easily hurt physically or emotionally. 易受伤害的 2. vulnerability N-VAR 脆弱 3. ADJ If a person, animal, or plant is vulnerable to a disease, they are more likely to get it than other people, animals, or plants. 容易患…病的 4. vulnerability N-UNCOUNT 患病的可能性 5. ADJ Something that is vulnerable can be easily harmed or affected by something bad. 易受损害的 6. vulnerability N-UNCOUNT 易受攻击性
n. 韦恩（男子名）
1. PREP If something is true notwithstanding something else, it is true in spite of that other thing. 尽管 [正式] 2. ADV Notwithstanding is also an adverb. 尽管 [n ADV]

1. ADJ Something that is permanent lasts forever. 永久的 2. permanently ADV 永久地 3. ADJ You use permanent to describe situations or states that keep occurring or that seem to exist all the time; used especially to describe problems or difficulties. (问题或困难) 不断发生的; 一直存在的 4. permanently ADV (问题或困难) 不断发生地; 一直存在地 5. ADJ A permanent employee is one who is employed for an unlimited length of time. 终身的 [ADJ n] 6. permanently ADV 终身地 [ADV with v] 7. ADJ Your permanent home or your permanent address is the one at which you spend most of your time or the one that you return to after having stayed in other places. 固定的 (住所或地址) [ADJ n] 8. N-COUNT A permanent is a treatment in which a hairstylist curls your hair and treats it with a chemical so that it stays curly for several months. 烫发 [美国英语]
1. N-COUNT Your creditors are the people who you owe money to. 债权人
n. 成都市（中国四川省省会）
n. (Salmond)人名；(英)萨蒙德

1. V-T If you propose something such as a plan or an idea, you suggest it for people to think about and decide upon. 建议 2. V-T If you propose to do something, you intend to do it. 打算 3. V-T If you propose a motion for debate, or a candidate for election, you begin the debate or the election procedure by formally stating your support for that motion or candidate. 提出; 提名 4. V-T/V-I If you propose to someone, or propose marriage to them, you ask them to marry you. 求婚
1. N-PLURAL (esp in European armies) any of various regiments responsible for ceremonial duties and, formerly, the protection of the head of state (尤在欧洲军队中)皇家近卫队 2. N-PLURAL (as modifier) 皇家近卫队的
1. N-COUNT An insect is a small animal that has six legs. Most insects have wings. Ants, flies, butterflies, and beetles are all insects. 昆虫
n. 侯赛因（姓氏）
adv. 身体上，身体上地
adv. 非常；可怕地；极度地

1. ADJ A significant amount or effect is large enough to be important or affect a situation to a noticeable degree. 重大的; 显著的 2. significantly ADV 重大地; 显著地 3. ADJ A significant fact, event, or thing is one that is important or shows something. 重要的; 说明问题的 4. significantly ADV 重要地; 说明问题地

1. V-T/V-I You can say that you are going to recap when you want to draw people's attention to the fact that you are going to repeat the main points of an explanation, argument, or description, as a summary of it. 概括 2. N-SING Recap is also a noun. 概要
由…来决定
1. N-COUNT A polluter is someone or something that pollutes the environment. 污染者; 污染源
1. N-VAR If you feel longing or a longing for something, you have a rather sad feeling because you want it very much. 渴望; 极想念

1. ADJ Something that is flat is level, smooth, or even, rather than sloping, curved, or uneven. 平的 2. ADJ Flat means horizontal and not upright. 水平的 3. PHRASE If you fall flat on your face, you fall over. 脸朝下摔倒 4. ADJ A flat object is not very tall or deep in relation to its length and width. 扁平的 5. ADJ Flat land is level, with no high hills or other raised parts. (地势) 平坦的 6. ADJ Flat shoes have no heels or very low heels. 平底的 7. N-PLURAL Flats are flat shoes. 平底鞋 [美国英语] 8. ADJ A flat tyre, ball, or balloon does not have enough air in it. 瘪的 9. N-COUNT You can refer to one of the broad flat surfaces of an object as the flat of that object. 平面 10. N-COUNT A flat is a tyre that does not have enough air in it. 瘪胎 11. N-COUNT A low flat area of uncultivated land, especially an area where the ground is soft and wet, can be referred to as flats or a flat. 低洼沼泽地 12. ADJ If you have flat feet, the arches of your feet are too low. 平足的 1. ADJ A drink that is flat has lost its fizz. (饮料) 走了汽的 2. ADJ A fl
1. N-COUNT A lawsuit is a case in a court of law which concerns a dispute between two people or organizations. 诉讼案 [正式]
n. 代表；众议院（representative的复数形式）

1. N-COUNT A campaign is a planned set of activities that people carry out over a period of time in order to achieve something such as social or political change. (有计划的) 活动; 运动 2. N-COUNT In a war, a campaign is a series of planned movements carried out by armed forces. 一系列军事行动; 战役 3. V-I If someone campaigns for something, they carry out a planned set of activities over a period of time in order to achieve their aim. 从事运动 4. → see also ad campaign
1. N-COUNT Your employer is the person or organization that you work for. 雇主
1. N-UNCOUNT You use mayhem to refer to a situation that is not controlled or ordered, when people are behaving in a disorganized, confused, and often violent way. 混乱

1. V-T If you concede something, you admit, often unwillingly, that it is true or correct. (常指不情愿地) 承认 2. V-T If you concede something to someone, you allow them to have it as a right or privilege. 给予 (权利或特权) 3. V-T If you concede something, you give it to the person who has been trying to get it from you. 让与 4. V-T If you concede a game, contest, or argument, you end it by admitting that you can no longer win. (通过认输而) 使 (比赛、竞赛、争论等) 结束 5. V-T If you concede defeat, you accept that you have lost a struggle. 承认 (失败)
1. N-UNCOUNT In the United States, Medicaid is a government programme that helps to pay medical costs for people. (美国)医疗补助署 [oft N n]
1. N-COUNT A yacht is a large boat with sails or a motor, used for racing or pleasure trips. 赛艇; 游艇

1. V-T/V-I If the amount or size of something swells or if something swells it, it becomes larger than it was before. 使增大; 增大 2. V-I If something such as a part of your body swells, it becomes larger and rounder than normal. (身体部位等) 肿胀 3. PHRASAL VERB Swell up means the same as . 肿胀 4. → see also swollen

1. N-COUNT If you have a bout of an illness or of an unpleasant feeling, you have it for a short period. (疾病或不愉快情绪) 发作 2. N-COUNT A bout of something that is unpleasant is a short time during which it occurs a great deal. 爆发 3. N-COUNT A bout is a boxing or wrestling match. 拳击 (或摔跤) 比赛

1. V-T If you twist something, you turn it to make a spiral shape, for example, by turning the two ends of it in opposite directions. 扭曲; 拧 2. V-T/V-I If you twist something, especially a part of your body, or if it twists, it moves into an unusual, uncomfortable, or bent position, for example, because of being hit or pushed, or because you are upset. 扭弯; 扭曲 3. V-T/V-I If you twist part of your body such as your head or your shoulders, you turn that part while keeping the rest of your body still. 转动 (身体某部分) 4. V-T If you twist a part of your body such as your ankle or wrist, you injure it by turning it too sharply, or in an unusual direction. 扭伤 (脚踝或手腕等) 5. V-T If you twist something, you turn it so that it moves around in a circular direction. 旋转 6. N-COUNT Twist is also a noun. 旋转 7. V-I If a road or river twists, it has a lot of sudden changes of direction in it. (道路或河流) 迂回曲折 8. N-COUNT Twist is also a noun. (道路或河流的) 迂回曲折 [usu pl] 9. V-T If you say that someone has twisted something that you have
1. N-VAR An affliction is something that causes physical or mental suffering. 折磨人的事物 [正式]
vt. 肢解，用链锯割
1. N-COUNT An employee is a person who is paid to work for an organization or for another person. 雇员
1. ADJ Martial is used to describe things relating to soldiers or war. 军人的; 军事的 [正式] 2. → see also court martial

1. N-COUNT An outsider is someone who does not belong to a particular group or organization. (不属于某组织或团体的) 外部人士 2. N-COUNT An outsider is someone who is not accepted by a particular group, or who feels that they do not belong in it. (未被某组织接受或自感不属其内的) 外人 3. N-COUNT In a competition, an outsider is a competitor who is unlikely to win. (在比赛中) 无望获胜者
[加强语气]但是
1. N-COUNT A militia is an organization that operates like an army but whose members are not professional soldiers. 民兵组织
1. N-VAR The pronunciation of a word or language is the way it is pronounced. 发音

1. ADJ If you say that a person is versatile, you approve of them because they have many different skills. 多才多艺的 [表赞许] 2. versatility N-UNCOUNT 多才多艺 3. ADJ A tool, machine, or material that is versatile can be used for many different purposes. 用途广泛的 4. versatility N-UNCOUNT 用途广泛
1. N-UNCOUNT Discontent is the feeling that you have when you are not satisfied with your situation. 不满 [also N in pl]
1. N-COUNT A particular kind of gait is a particular way of walking. 步态 [书面]
adj. 强硬的；不妥协的 n. 强硬路线
1. N-COUNT A turban is a long piece of cloth that is wound around the head. It is worn by Sikh men and by some Hindu and Muslim men. (锡克教男教徒及一些印度教和伊斯兰教男人缠在头上的)包头巾
1. ADV If a situation will continue indefinitely, it will continue forever or until someone decides to change it or end it. 无限期地 [ADV with v]

1. V-T If someone or something discourages you, they cause you to lose your enthusiasm about your actions. 使气馁 2. discouraged ADJ 气馁的 3. V-T To discourage an action or to discourage someone from doing it means to make them not want to do it. 阻拦
n. 约克郡（英格兰东北的一郡）

1. N-UNCOUNT Radiation consists of very small particles of a radioactive substance. Large amounts of radiation can cause illness and death. 辐射物 2. N-UNCOUNT Radiation is energy, especially heat, that comes from a particular source. 辐射能 (尤指热能)

1. V-T If someone formally unveils something such as a new statue or painting, they draw back the curtain which is covering it. 为…揭幕 2. V-T If you unveil a plan, new product, or some other thing that has been kept secret, you introduce it to the public. 公布
n. 克钦（缅甸地名）；克钦人；克钦语

1. ADJ If someone or something is exempt from a particular rule, duty, or obligation, they do not have to follow it or do it. 免除 (规则、职责、义务等) 的 2. V-T To exempt a person or thing from a particular rule, duty, or obligation means to state officially that they are not bound or affected by it. 免除 3. exemption N-VAR 免除

1. N-COUNT A seminar is a meeting where a group of people discuss a problem or topic. 研讨会; 专题讨论会 2. N-COUNT A seminar is a class at a college or university in which the teacher and a small group of students discuss a topic. (大学里由教师指导小组学生参加的) 研讨班
adv. 偶尔；间或
1. ADJ Something that is bizarre is very odd and strange. 怪异的 2. bizarrely ADV 怪异地
1. N a small crater in the NW quadrant of the moon, centre of a large bright ray system 开普勒环形山

1. V-T/V-I If you twirl something or if it twirls, it turns around and around with a smooth, fast movement. 旋转 2. V-I If you twirl, you turn around and around quickly, for example, when you are dancing. (跳舞等时) 旋转

1. V-T/V-I When you simmer food or when it simmers, you cook it by keeping it at boiling point or just below boiling point. 用文火炖; 煨 2. N-SING Simmer is also a noun. 炖; 煨 3. V-I If a conflict or a quarrel simmers, it does not actually happen for a period of time, but eventually builds up to the point where it does. (冲突或争吵) 酝酿; 趋于激化
n. 领跑者

1. ADJ Spiritual means relating to people's thoughts and beliefs, rather than to their bodies and physical surroundings. 精神的 2. spiritually ADV 精神地 3. ADJ Spiritual means relating to people's religious beliefs. 宗教的

1. N-VAR Liberty is the freedom to live your life in the way that you want, without interference from other people or the authorities. 自由 2. N-UNCOUNT Liberty is the freedom to go wherever you want, which you lose when you are a prisoner. 人身自由 3. PHRASE If someone is at liberty to do something, they have been given permission to do it. 获得许可的
1. N-UNCOUNT Supervision is the supervising of people, activities, or places. 监督

1. N-COUNT An offence is a crime that breaks a particular law and requires a particular punishment. 犯罪行为 2. N-VAR Offence or an offence is behaviour that causes people to be upset or embarrassed. 冒犯行为 3. N-SING In sports such as football or basketball, the offence is the team which has possession of the ball and is trying to score. (足球、篮球等运动中的) 进攻方 [美国英语] ['the' N] 4. CONVENTION Some people say "no offence" to make it clear that they do not want to upset you, although what they are saying may seem rude. 无意冒犯 [套语] 5. PHRASE If someone takes offence at something you say or do, they feel upset, often unnecessarily, because they think you are being rude to them. 生气

1. V-I If you qualify in a competition, you are successful in one part of it and go on to the next stage. 通过预赛; 取得下一轮比赛资格 2. qualifier N-COUNT 通过预赛者 3. V-T/V-I To qualify as something or to be qualified as something means to have all the features that are needed to be that thing. 使…符合 (某物的全部特征); 符合 4. V-T If you qualify a statement, you make it less strong or less general by adding a detail or explanation to it. (通过增加细节、解释) 使语气缓和; 使…不太笼统 5. V-T/V-I If you qualify for something or if something qualifies you for it, you have the right to do it or have it. (使) 有权做; (使) 有资格拥有 6. V-I When someone qualifies, they receive the certificate, licence, diploma, or degree that they need to be able to work in a particular profession. 取得资格; 获得文凭 7. → see also qualified

1. ADV If you do something readily, you do it in a way which shows that you are very willing to do it. 乐意地 [ADV with v] 2. ADV You also use readily to say that something can be done or obtained quickly and easily. For example, if you say that something can be readily understood, you mean that people can understand it quickly and easily. 容易地; 迅速地
n. 萨尔曼（男子名）

1. ADJ If you describe someone as pompous, you mean that they behave or speak in a very serious way because they think they are more important than they really are. 爱摆架子的 [表不满] 2. pompously ADV 爱摆架子地 3. ADJ A pompous building or ceremony is very grand and elaborate. (建筑物) 气派的; (仪式) 盛大铺张的

1. V-T To embody an idea or quality means to be a symbol or expression of that idea or quality. 体现; 具体象征 2. V-T If something is embodied in a particular thing, the second thing contains or consists of the first. 包含; 收录
1. N-VAR If you have a particular allergy, you become ill or get a rash when you eat, smell, or touch something that does not normally make people ill. 过敏

n. 模范，典型，榜样 模型 设计图样；样式；模式；雏形 原型；样品；样机 (汽车的)型号；跑车型汽车；特定型号的汽车(或洗衣机) 假定的模型 (妇女衣帽的)款式；[英国英语]款式独特仅此一件的衣服样品 [英国英语]极相像的人(或物) 模特；时装模特；商品模特 【逻辑学、数学】(用于分析、说明事物的)模型；模型(一个由假设、数据和推论组成的系统) [委婉语]妓女；男妓 模范，典型，榜样 模型 设计图样；样式；模式；雏形 原型；样品；样机 (汽车的)型号；跑车型汽车；特定型号的汽车(或洗衣机) 假定的模型 (妇女衣帽的)款式；[英国英语]款式独特仅此一件的衣服样品 [英国英语]极相像的人(或物) 模特；时装模特；商品模特 【逻辑学、数学】(用于分析、说明事物的)模型；模型(一个由假设、数据和推论组成的系统) [委婉语]妓女；男妓 adj. 模范的，榜样的 用作模型的 产品型号的 典型的 模范的，榜样的 用作模型的 产品型号的 典型的 vt. 做…模型；(用泥、蜡)塑造： to model a little horse out of clay 用黏土做小马模型 to model a ship out of bits of wood 用木片做船的模型 to model an aeroplane out of balsa-wood 用西印度轻木做飞机模型 仿特定样式做出，按特定模型制造(或设计)： The library was modelled after the library of Congress of Washington. 这个图书馆是按华盛顿国会图书馆的式样设计建造的。 使模仿,使仿效(after,on,upon): The boy modelled himself after his father. 这个男孩以父亲为榜样。 当模特展示服装： Angela is modelling an attractive blue silk dress. 安吉拉做模特儿向顾客展示一种漂亮的蓝色丝绸服装。 使(画)具有立体感 做出(系统)的模型，为…提供描述模型；使模型化 [古语]组织(军队、政府) 做…模型；(用泥、蜡)塑造： to model a little horse out of clay 用黏土做小马模型 to model a ship out of bits of wood 用木片做船的模型 to mod

1. V-T/V-I When a member of the clergy preaches a sermon, he or she gives a talk on a religious or moral subject during a religious service. 布 (道); 布道 2. V-T/V-I When people preach a belief or a course of action, they try to persuade other people to accept the belief or to take the course of action. 宣扬 3. V-I If someone gives you advice in a very serious, boring way, you can say that they are preaching at you. 说教 [表不满]

1. N-COUNT A revelation is a surprising or interesting fact that is made known to people. 被透露的事实; 被泄露的秘密 2. N-VAR The revelation of something is the act of making it known. 揭露; 透露 3. N-SING If you say that something you experienced was a revelation, you are saying that it was very surprising or very good. (惊人的、极好的) 发现

1. N-VAR A crime is an illegal action or activity for which a person can be punished by law. 罪行 2. N-COUNT If you say that doing something is a crime, you think it is very wrong or a serious mistake. 严重错误 [表不满]
n. 价格，金额，[数] 数字；人物（figure的复数）；[数] 图形，图表；规定动作 n. (Figures)人名；(英)菲格斯
1. N-COUNT An abbess is the nun who is in charge of the other nuns in a convent. 女修道院院长

1. N-COUNT An exhibition is a public event at which pictures, sculptures, or other objects of interest are displayed, for example at a museum or art gallery. 展览会 2. N-SING An exhibition of a particular skilful activity is a display or example of it that people notice or admire. (技能的) 展示 3. → see also exhibit
n. （西）书信；纸牌 n. (Carta)人名；(法、西、意、葡)卡尔塔

1. V-T If you conceal something, you cover it or hide it carefully. 掩盖; 隐藏 2. V-T If you conceal a piece of information or a feeling, you do not let other people know about it. 隐瞒 (信息); 掩饰 (情感) 3. V-T If something conceals something else, it covers it and prevents it from being seen. 遮盖
n. [电磁] 磁阻；勉强；不情愿

1. N-COUNT Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose. 设施 2. N-COUNT A facility is something such as an additional service provided by an organization or an extra feature on a machine which is useful but not essential. 附加服务; 附加功能 3. N-COUNT If you have a facility for something, for example learning a language, you find it easy to do. 天赋 [usu sing, usu N 'for' n, N to-inf]
n. 增殖，扩散；分芽繁殖
1. N-COUNT A centenary is the same as a . 一百周年 [英国英语]
1. N a demand for a very specialized product or commodity 缝隙市场
1. N → another name for Mossi
abbr. 经济研究委员会（Economic Research Council）；电子设备研究中心（Electronic Research Center）

1. V-T If something exceeds a particular amount or number, it is greater or larger than that amount or number. 超过 (某数量) [正式] 2. V-T If you exceed a limit or rule, you go beyond it, even though you are not supposed to or it is against the law. 超越 (限制、规定) [正式]

1. N-COUNT A breed of a pet animal or farm animal is a particular type of it. For example, terriers are a breed of dog. (动物的) 品种 2. V-T If you breed animals or plants, you keep them for the purpose of producing more animals or plants with particular qualities, in a controlled way. 养殖 3. breeding N-UNCOUNT 养殖 4. V-I When animals breed, they have babies. 繁殖 5. breeding N-UNCOUNT 繁殖 6. V-T If you say that something breeds bad feeling or bad behaviour, you mean that it causes bad feeling or bad behaviour to develop. 酿成 (不良情绪或不良行为) 7. → see also breeding

1. N-COUNT A limit is the greatest amount, extent, or degree of something that is possible. 极限 2. N-COUNT A limit of a particular kind is the largest or smallest amount of something such as time or money that is allowed because of a rule, law, or decision. 限制 3. N-COUNT The limit of an area is its boundary or edge. 界限 4. N-PLURAL Thelimitsof a situation are the facts involved in it which make only some actions or results possible. 范围 5. V-T If you limit something, you prevent it from becoming greater than a particular amount or degree. 限制 6. V-T If you limit yourself to something, or if someone or something limits you, the number of things that you have or do is reduced. 对…作出限制 7. limiting ADJ 限制的 8. V-T If something is limited to a particular place or group of people, it exists only in that place, or is had or done only by that group. 仅限于 (某地、某团体) [usu passive] 9. → see also limited 10. PHRASE If an area or a place is off limits, you are not allowed to go there. 禁止入内
1. ADJ If you say that one thing is reminiscent of another, you mean that it reminds you of it. 令人想起的 [正式] [v-link ADJ 'of' n]
1. N-COUNT A turbine is a machine or engine which uses a stream of air, gas, water, or steam to turn a wheel and produce power. 涡轮机
adv. 根本上；彻底地；以激进的方式
1. ADJ Interpersonal means relating to relationships between people. 人际的 [ADJ n]

1. N-UNCOUNT A person's or animal's hearing is the sense which makes it possible for them to be aware of sounds. 听力 2. N-COUNT A hearing is an official meeting which is held in order to collect facts about an incident or problem. 听证会 3. PHRASE If someone gives you a fair hearing or a hearing, they listen to you when you give your opinion about something. 发表意见的机会 4. PHRASE If someone says something in your hearing or within your hearing, you can hear what they say because they are with you or near you. 某人听得见的范围内

1. N-UNCOUNT If you talk about the magnitude of something, you are talking about its great size, scale, or importance. (尺寸、规模、重要性等) 大的程度 2. PHRASE You can use order of magnitude when you are giving an approximate idea of the amount or importance of something. 重要级; 数量级
1. N-COUNT A caravan is a temporary holiday home that is pulled by a car. (汽车拖行的) 临时度假屋 [英国英语] 2. N-COUNT A caravan is a group of people and animals or vehicles who travel together. 旅行队

1. N-VAR Olives are small green or black fruits with a bitter taste. Olives are often pressed to make olive oil. 橄榄 2. N-COUNT An olive tree or an olive is a tree on which olives grow. 橄榄树 3. COLOR Something that is olive is yellowish-green in colour. 橄榄色的 4. COMB in COLOR Olive is also a combining form. (用于构成表示颜色的复合词) 橄榄色的 5. ADJ If someone has olive skin, the colour of their skin is yellowish brown. (皮肤) 黄褐色的
1. N-COUNT Pronouncements are public or official statements on an important subject. 公告
1. N-COUNT A motorist is a person who drives a car. 汽车驾驶员
1. V-I If you tinker with something, you make some small changes to it, in an attempt to improve it or repair it. 小修改
管理人员；行政人员
超低的

1. ADJ If you are uneasy, you feel anxious, afraid, or embarrassed, because you think that something is wrong or that there is danger. 不安的 2. uneasily ADV 不安地 3. ADJ If you are uneasy about doing something, you are not sure that it is correct or wise. 不确信的 4. uneasiness N-UNCOUNT 不确信 5. ADJ If you describe a situation or relationship as uneasy, you mean that the situation is not settled and may not last. 不稳定的 [journalism] 6. uneasily ADV 不稳定地
1. N-COUNT An immigrant is a person who has come to live in a country from some other country. Compare . (外来) 移民
1. N-COUNT A manufacturer is a business or company which makes goods in large quantities to sell. 生产商 [商业]

1. N-COUNT A crown is a circular ornament, usually made of gold and jewels, which a king or queen wears on their head at official ceremonies. You can also use crown to refer to anything circular that is worn on someone's head. 王冠; 冠 2. N-COUNT Your crown is the top part of your head, at the back. 头顶后部 3. N-COUNT A crown is an artificial top piece fixed over a broken or decayed tooth. 齿冠 4. N-PROPER The government of a country that has a king or queen is sometimes referred to as the Crown. 王国政府 5. V-T When a king or queen is crowned, a crown is placed on their head as part of a ceremony in which they are officially made king or queen. 为…加冕 [usu passive]

1. V-T The people who occupy a building or a place are the people who live or work there. 占用 (某建筑、某地) 2. V-T PASSIVE If a room or something such as a seat is occupied, someone is using it, so that it is not available for anyone else. 占用 (座位等) 3. V-T If a group of people or an army occupies a place or country, they move into it, using force in order to gain control of it. 占领 4. V-T If someone or something occupies a particular place in a system, process, or plan, they have that place. 占有 (某位置) 5. V-T If something occupies you, or if you occupy yourself, your time, or your mind with it, you are busy doing that thing or thinking about it. (某事物) 占据 (某人); 使 (自己、自己的时间、自己的思维) 被 (某事物) 占据 6. occupied ADJ 占用的 [v-link ADJ] 7. V-T If something occupies you, it requires your efforts, attention, or time. (某事物) 占用 (某人) 8. V-T If something occupies a particular area or place, it fills or covers it, or exists there. (某事物) 占据 (某区域、某地)
n. [经][生态] 消费者，消耗者；用户，顾客（consumer的复数）
1. ADJ Something, especially something bad, that is pervasive is present or felt throughout a place or thing. (尤指不好的事物) 无处不在的 [正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT The maintenance of a building, vehicle, road, or machine is the process of keeping it in good condition by regularly checking it and repairing it when necessary. 检修 2. N-UNCOUNT Maintenance is money that someone gives regularly to another person to pay for the things that the person needs. 赡养费; 抚养费 3. N-UNCOUNT If you ensure the maintenance of a state or process, you make sure that it continues. 维持
1. ADJ Something that is imperfect has faults and is not exactly as you would like it to be. 不完美的 [正式]
1. ADJ If you describe someone or something as glamorous, you mean that they are more attractive, exciting, or interesting than ordinary people or things. 富有魅力的

1. N-COUNT-COLL A crowd is a large group of people who have gathered together, for example, to watch or listen to something interesting, or to protest about something. 人群 2. N-COUNT A particular crowd is a group of friends, or a set of people who share the same interests or job. 一帮 (朋友); 一群 (志趣相投的人) [非正式] 3. V-I When people crowd around someone or something, they gather closely together around them. 聚集 4. V-T/V-I If people crowd into a place or are crowded into a place, large numbers of them enter it so that it becomes very full. 挤满; 挤进 5. V-T If a group of people crowd a place, there are so many of them there that it is full. 挤满 6. N-COUNT an ancient bowed stringed instrument; crwth 克鲁斯琴 [music]
1. N-COUNT A tabloid is a newspaper that has small pages, short articles, and a lot of photographs. Tabloids are usually considered to be less serious than other newspapers. Compare . 通俗小报
1. V to be anxious or nervous 感觉焦虑或紧张

1. V-I If you curse, you use very impolite or offensive language, usually because you are angry about something. 诅咒 [书面] 2. N-COUNT Curse is also a noun. 诅咒 3. V-T If you curse someone, you say insulting things to them because you are angry with them. 咒骂 (某人) 4. V-T If you curse something, you complain angrily about it, especially using very impolite language. 诅咒 (某事) 5. N-COUNT If you say that there is a curse on someone, you mean that there seems to be a supernatural power causing unpleasant things to happen to them. (对某人的) 诅咒 6. N-COUNT You can refer to something that causes a great deal of trouble or harm as a curse. 祸根
n. 顺从；服从；遵守 n. (Obedience)人名；(英)奥贝丁丝
1. N-COUNT A submarine is a type of ship that can travel both above and below the surface of the sea. The abbreviation is also used. 潜水艇

1. N-COUNT A hostage is someone who has been captured by a person or organization and who may be killed or injured if people do not do what that person or organization demands. 人质 2. PHRASE If someone is taken hostage or is held hostage, they are captured and kept as a hostage. 将某人扣作人质 3. N-VAR If you say you are hostage to something, you mean that your freedom to take action is restricted by things that you cannot control. 受到…的限制
1. V-T To enrich something means to improve its quality, usually by adding something to it. 充实; 丰富 2. V-T To enrich someone means to increase the amount of money that they have. 使富裕
1. ADJ Someone who is well-off is rich enough to be able to do and buy most of the things that they want. 富裕的 [非正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT If someone behaves or moves with dignity, they are calm, controlled, and admirable. 尊贵 2. N-UNCOUNT If you talk about the dignity of people or their lives or activities, you mean that they are valuable and worthy of respect. 尊严 3. N-UNCOUNT Your dignity is the sense that you have of your own importance and value, and other people's respect for you. 自尊

1. ADJ If you describe something such as a barrier or a forest as impenetrable, you mean that it is impossible or very difficult to get through. (障碍或森林等) 难以穿越的 2. ADJ If you describe something such as a book or a theory as impenetrable, you are emphasizing that it is impossible or very difficult to understand. 不能理解的 [强调]

1. ADJ If a way of doing something is convenient, it is easy, or very useful or suitable for a particular purpose. 方便的 2. convenience N-UNCOUNT 方便 3. ADJ If you describe a place as convenient, you are pleased because it is near to where you are, or because you can reach another place from there quickly and easily. 近便的 [表赞许] 4. conveniently ADV 近便地 5. ADJ A convenient time to do something, for example to meet someone, is a time when you are free to do it or would like to do it. 方便的
1. N-VAR Someone's aptitude for a particular kind of work or activity is their ability to learn it quickly and to do it well. 天资
1. V-I If you extrapolate from known facts, you use them as a basis for general statements about a situation or about what is likely to happen in the future. 推断 [正式] 2. extrapolation N-VAR 推断
1. V-T If someone is ousted from a position of power, job, or place, they are forced to leave it. 罢黜; 把…撤职; 驱逐 [journalism] 2. ouster N-COUNT 罢黜; 撤职; 驱逐

1. N-COUNT Your views on something are the beliefs or opinions that you have about it, for example,whether you think it is good, bad, right, or wrong. 观点 2. N-SING Your view of a particular subject is the way that you understand and think about it. 看法 3. V-T If you view something in a particular way, you think of it in that way. 看待 4. N-COUNT The view from a window or high place is everything that can be seen from that place, especially when it is considered to be beautiful. 景色 5. N-SING If you have a view of something, you can see it. 看到 6. N-UNCOUNT You use view in expressions to do with being able to see something. For example, if something is in view, you can see it. If something is in full view of everyone, everyone can see it. 在视线内 7. V-T If you view something, you look at it for a particular purpose. 察看 [正式] 8. V-T If you view a television programme, video, or movie, you watch it. 观看 [正式] 9. N-SING View refers to the way in which a piece of text or graphics is displayed on a computer screen.

1. N-UNCOUNT Twine is strong string used especially in gardening and farming. (尤用于园艺和农事的)股线 2. V-T/V-I If you twine one thing around another, or if one thing twines around another, the first thing is twisted or wound around the second. 使...盘绕; 盘绕

1. V-T If you tackle a difficult problem or task, you deal with it in a very determined or efficient way. 处理 2. V-T If you tackle someone in a game such as American football or rugby, you knock them to the ground. If you tackle someone in soccer or hockey, you try to take the ball away from them. (美式或英式橄榄球比赛中) 擒抱摔倒; (足球运动或曲棍球运动中) 抢断 3. N-COUNT Tackle is also a noun. 擒抱撞倒; 抢断 4. V-T If you tackle someone about a particular matter, you speak to them honestly about it, usually in order to get it changed or done. 坦率地与某人交谈 5. V-T If you tackle someone, you attack them and fight them. 攻击 6. N-UNCOUNT Tackle is the equipment that you need for a sport or activity, especially fishing. (尤指钓鱼等活动的) 器具
1. ADJ Year-long is used to describe something that lasts for a year. 一整年的; 持续一年的 [ADJ n]

1. V-I If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused. 主宰 [书面] 2. V-I When a king or queen reigns, he or she rules a country. 在位统治 3. N-COUNT Reign is also a noun. 统治时期
1. V-T Something that imperils you puts you in danger. 危及; 使陷于危险 [正式]
索马里人（Somali的复数）
adj. 暗示的；告知的 v. 标志着（signal的过去分词形式）；给…发信号；用信号传递

1. ADJ Something that is handy is useful. 有用的 2. PHRASE If something comes in handy, it is useful in a particular situation. 派上用场 3. ADJ A thing or place that is handy is nearby and therefore easy to get or reach. 手边的

1. N-COUNT Stocks are shares in the ownership of a company, or investments on which a fixed amount of interest will be paid. 股票; 证券 [商业] 2. N-UNCOUNT A company's stock is the amount of money which the company has through selling shares. (公司的) 股票价值 [商业] 3. V-T If a shop stocks particular products, it keeps a supply of them to sell. 有…存货 [no cont] 4. N-UNCOUNT A shop's stock is the total amount of goods which it has available to sell. 存货 5. V-T If you stock something such as a cupboard, shelf, or room, you fill it with food or other things. 给…装满 6. PHRASAL VERB Stock up means the same as . 给…装满 7. N-COUNT If you have a stock of things, you have a supply of them stored in a place ready to be used. 储备 8. ADJ A stock answer, expression, or way of doing something is one that is very commonly used, especially because people cannot be bothered to think of something new. (回答、表达或做事方式) 老一套的 [ADJ n] 9. N-MASS Stock is a liquid, usually made by boiling meat, bones, or vegetables in water, that is used to give fl

1. N-UNCOUNT Water is a clear thin liquid that has no colour or taste when it is pure. It falls from clouds as rain and enters rivers and seas. All animals and people need water in order to live. 水 2. N-PLURAL You use waters to refer to a large area of sea, especially the area of sea that is near to a country and that is regarded as belonging to it. 海域; (尤指) 领海 3. V-T If you water plants, you pour water over them in order to help them to grow. 浇水 4. V-I If your eyes water, tears build up in them because they are hurting or because you are upset. 流泪 5. V-I If you say that your mouth is watering, you mean that you can smell or see some nice food that makes you want to eat it. 流口水 6. PHRASE If you say that an event or incident is water under the bridge, you mean that it has happened and cannot now be changed, so there is no point in worrying about it anymore. 桥下水 (比喻无需再挂怀的往事) 7. PHRASE If you are in deep water, you are in a difficult or awkward situation. 陷入困境 8. PHRASE If an argument or theory does not

1. V-T/V-I If you speculate about something, you make guesses about its nature or identity, or about what might happen. 猜测 2. speculation N-VAR 猜测 3. V-I If someone speculates financially, they buy property, stocks, or shares, in the hope of being able to sell them again at a higher price and make a profit. 做投机买卖

1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES An institution is a large important organization such as a university, church, or bank. 机构 2. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES An institution is a building where certain people are cared for, such as people who are mentally ill or children who have no parents. 社会福利机构 3. N-COUNT An institution is a custom or system that is considered an important or typical feature of a particular society or group, usually because it has existed for a long time. 习俗; 制度 4. N-UNCOUNT The institution of a new system is the act of starting it or bringing it in. 建立

1. V-T To illuminate something means to shine light on it and to make it brighter and more visible. 照亮 [正式] 2. V-T If you illuminate something that is unclear or difficult to understand, you make it clearer by explaining it carefully or giving information about it. 阐明 [正式] 3. illuminating ADJ 富有启发性的
1. PHRASE If two things are out of sync, they do not match or do not happen together as they should. If two things are in sync, they match or happen together as they should. 不协调/协调; 不同步/同步 [非正式]
1. N-COUNT In grammar, a modal or a modal auxiliary is a word such as "can" or "would" which is used with a main verb to express ideas such as possibility, intention, or necessity. 情态动词 [技术]
1. N-COUNT You can describe something as a boon when it makes life better or easier for someone. 福音 2. ADJ close, special, or intimate (in the phrase boon companion) 亲密的; 特别的
1. PHRASAL VERB If something is phased out, people gradually stop using it. 逐步淘汰
1. N-UNCOUNT Wartime is a period of time when a war is being fought. 战争时期
1. V to consider or make (an abstract idea or concept) real or concrete 使(抽象的想法或概念)具体化或真实化
1. V-T When people such as the police detain someone, they keep them in a place under their control. 拘留 [正式] 2. V-T To detain someone means to delay them, for example, by talking to them. 耽搁 [正式]
1. N Santa Claus的缩写 [非正式] → short for Santa Claus
1. V-T If you devise a plan, system, or machine, you have the idea for it and design it. 构思; 设计
1. V-T To enhance something means to improve its value, quality, or attractiveness. 提高

1. N-COUNT A landmark is a building or feature which is easily noticed and can be used to judge your position or the position of other buildings or features. 地标 2. N-COUNT You can refer to an important stage in the development of something as a landmark. 里程碑
1. V to set the sails of (a square-rigger) at right angles to the keel 调整(横帆船)风帆到合适角度; 迎风扬帆

1. V-T If you encourage someone, you give them confidence, for example by letting them know that what they are doing is good and telling them that they should continue to do it. 鼓励 2. V-T If someone is encouraged by something that happens, it gives them hope or confidence. 鼓舞 [usu passive] 3. encouraged ADJ 受到鼓舞的 [v-link ADJ] 4. V-T If you encourage someone to do something, you try to persuade them to do it, for example, by telling them that it would be a pleasant thing to do, or by trying to make it easier for them to do it. You can also encourage an activity. 激励 5. V-T If something encourages a particular activity or state, it causes it to happen or increase. 促使.

1. ADJ Sweet food and drink contains a lot of sugar. 甜的 2. sweetness N-UNCOUNT 甜味 3. ADJ A sweet smell is a pleasant one, for example the smell of a flower. 芳香的 4. ADJ A sweet sound is pleasant, smooth, and gentle. 悦耳的 5. sweetly ADV 悦耳地 6. ADJ If you describe something as sweet, you mean that it gives you great pleasure and satisfaction. 令人痛快的 [书面] 7. ADJ If you describe someone as sweet, you mean that they are pleasant, kind, and gentle toward other people. 温柔的 8. sweetly ADV 温柔地 9. ADJ If you describe a small person or thing as sweet, you mean that they are attractive in a simple or unsophisticated way. (小孩或小东西) 可爱的 [非正式] 10. N-PLURAL Sweets are foods that have a lot of sugar. 甜食 [美国英语] 11. N-COUNT Sweets are small sweet things such as chocolates and mints. 糖果 [英国英语] 12. N-VAR A sweet is the same as a . 餐后甜点 [英国英语] 13. → see also sweetness 14. a sweet tooth →see tooth

1. N-COUNT A suite is a set of rooms in a hotel or other building. 套房 2. N-COUNT A suite is a set of matching furniture. 一套家具 3. N-COUNT A bathroom suite is a matching bathtub, sink, and toilet. (浴室) 套件
1. ADJ Socialist means based on socialism or relating to socialism. 社会主义的 2. N-COUNT A socialist is a person who believes in socialism or who is a member of a socialist party. 社会主义者; 社会主义党成员
1. N-UNCOUNT Boredom is the state of being bored. 厌烦
1. N-UNCOUNT Perseverance is the quality of continuing with something even though it is difficult. 坚持不懈
1. ADJ of, relating to, or having the properties of a mirror 镜的; 与镜有关的; 镜子似的
1. N-COUNT A blockbuster is a film or book that is very popular and successful, usually because it is very exciting. 大片; 畅销书 [非正式]
1. N-UNCOUNT Accession is the act of taking up a position as the ruler of a country. 继位 [正式] [with poss, oft N 'to' n]
1. N an informer whose information implicates a large number of people in terrorist activities or other major crimes 向警方提供大量罪犯活动情报的人
n. 刺细胞动物

1. N-COUNT A victim is someone who has been hurt or killed. 受害者 2. N-COUNT A victim is someone who has suffered as a result of someone else's actions or beliefs, or as a result of unpleasant circumstances. 牺牲品
1. ADJ A circuitous route is long and complicated rather than simple and direct. 迂回的 [正式] [usu ADJ n]
1. N →see Virgin Mary 1. N the constellation Virgo, the sixth sign of the zodiac 室女星座

1. PHRASE If you are in the midst of doing something, you are doing it at the moment. 正当…的时候 2. PHRASE If something happens in the midst of an event, it happens during it. 正当…时 3. PHRASE If someone or something is in the midst of a group of people or things, they are among them or surrounded by them. 在…当中

item.word: get in on the ground floor
item.trans: （因一开始就参加或入股而）获得有利地位；以享受与企业创办人同样优先权的资格入股
1. V-T To deter someone from doing something means to make them not want to do it or continue doing it. 阻止

1. N-UNCOUNT Opposition is strong, angry, or violent disagreement and disapproval. 强烈的反对 2. N-COUNT-COLL Theopposition is the political parties or groups that are opposed to a government. 反对党 3. N-COUNT-COLL In countries with a parliament, such as Britain, the opposition refers to the politicians or political parties that form part of the parliament, but are not the government. 在野党 4. N-SING-COLL Theopposition is the person or team you are competing against in a sports event. 对手
1. V-I If someone or something withers, they become very weak. 变虚弱 2. PHRASAL VERB Wither away means the same as . 变虚弱 3. V-I If a flower or plant withers, it dries up and dies. (花朵或植物) 枯萎
