1. ADJ Regional is used to describe things which relate to a particular area of a country or of the world. 地区的

1. N-COUNT A bond between people is a strong feeling of friendship, love, or shared beliefs and experiences that unites them. (强烈的感情) 纽带 2. V-RECIP When people bond with each other, they form a relationship based on love or shared beliefs and experiences. You can also say that people bond or that something bonds them. 建立关系 3. N-COUNT A bond between people or groups is a close connection that they have with each other, for example because they have a special agreement. 密切联系 4. N-COUNT A bond between two things is the way in which they stick to one another or are joined in some way. 黏合 5. V-RECIP When one thing bonds with another, it sticks to it or becomes joined to it in some way. You can also say that two things bond together, or that something bonds them together. (使) 黏合 6. N-COUNT When a government or company issues a bond, it borrows money from investors. The certificate that is issued to investors who lend money is also called a bond. (政府或公司发行的) 债券 [商业] 7. → see also junk bond

1. N-COUNT A period is a length of time. 一段时间 [usu with supp] 2. N-COUNT A period in the life of a person, organization, or society is a length of time that is remembered for a particular situation or activity. (个人、组织或社会的) 时期 3. N-COUNT A particular length of time in history is sometimes called a period. For example, you can talk about the Civil War period or the Prohibition period in the U.S. (历史) 时期 4. ADJ Period costumes, furniture, and instruments were made at an earlier time in history, or look as if they were made then. 具特定历史时期特点的 [ADJ n] 5. N-COUNT Exercise, training, or study periods are lengths of time that are set aside for exercise, training, or study. (练习、训练或学习的) 时段 6. N-COUNT A period is the punctuation mark (.) that you use at the end of a sentence when it is not a question or an exclamation. 句号 [美国英语] 7. N-COUNT When a woman has a period, she bleeds from her uterus. This usually happens once a month, unless she is pregnant. 经期

1. N-VAR The turnover of a company is the value of the goods or services sold during a particular period of time. 营业额 [商业] 2. N-VAR The turnover of people in an organization or place is the rate at which people leave and are replaced. 人员流动率 [商业]

1. N-UNCOUNT Taxation is the system by which a government takes money from people and spends it on things such as education, health, and defence. 税制 [商业] 2. N-UNCOUNT Taxation is the amount of money that people have to pay in taxes. 税额 [商业]
1. V-T If you woo people, you try to encourage them to help you, support you, or vote for you, for example, by promising them things which they would like. 争取
1. ADJ An engaging person or thing is pleasant, interesting, and entertaining. 迷人的

1. N-COUNT A stump is a small part of something that remains when the rest of it has been removed or broken off. 残余部分 2. V-T If you are stumped by a question or problem, you cannot think of any solution or answer to it. 把…难住 3. V-I If politicians stump for a candidate, they travel around making campaign speeches before an election. (选举前为候选人) 作巡回政治演说 [美国英语]

1. N-VAR Bias is a tendency to prefer one person or thing to another, and to favour that person or thing. 偏见 2. V-T To bias someone means to influence them in favour of a particular choice. (影响某人) 使偏心; 使产生偏见
adv. 明显地；公然地；明白地

1. V-T If something is festooned with, for example, lights, balloons, or flowers, large numbers of these things are hung from it or wrapped around it, especially in order to decorate it. 以灯光、气球或花彩装饰 [usu passive]

1. N-COUNT A vice is a habit that is regarded as a weakness in someone's character, but not usually as a serious fault. 不良习惯 2. N-UNCOUNT Vice refers to criminal activities, especially those connected with pornography or prostitution. (尤指与色情、卖淫等有关的) 犯罪活动 3. N-COUNT A vice is a tool with a pair of parts that hold an object tightly while you do work on it. 虎钳 [英国英语] 4. V to grip (something) with or as if with a vice 握住; 钳紧 5. ADJ serving in the place of or as a deputy for 代替的; 代理的 6. ADJ (in combination) 副的 7. N a person who serves as a deputy to another 代理人; 任副职者 [非正式] 8. PREP instead of; as a substitute for 代替; 取代

1. ADJ If one thing is associated with another, the two things are connected with each other. (与…) 相关联的 2. ADJ Associated is used in the name of a company that is made up of a number of smaller companies that have joined together. 联合的 (用于由若干小公司组成的公司名称中) [ADJ n]
n. 阿斯利康（公司名）
1. N-UNCOUNT Woe is great sadness. 悲伤 [文学性]

1. N-COUNT The boundary of an area of land is an imaginary line that separates it from other areas. 边界 2. N-COUNT The boundaries of something such as a subject or activity are the limits that people think that it has. 界限
1. ADJ Armoured vehicles are equipped with a hard metal covering in order to protect them from gunfire and other missiles. 装甲的 (车辆) 2. ADJ Armoured troops are troops in armoured vehicles. 配备装甲车的 (部队)

1. V-T If you dip something in a liquid, you put it into the liquid for a short time, so that only part of it is covered, and take it out again. 蘸 2. N-COUNT Dip is also a noun. 蘸 3. V-T/V-I If you dip your hand into a container or dip into the container, you put your hand into it in order to take something out of it. (将手) 伸入 4. V-I If something dips, it makes a downward movement, usually quickly. (突然) 下沉 5. N-COUNT Dip is also a noun. (突然的) 下沉 6. V-I If an area of land, a road, or a path dips, it goes down quite suddenly to a lower level. (土地、地段、道路等) 突陷 7. N-COUNT Dip is also a noun. (土地、地段、道路等的) 突陷 8. V-I If the amount or level of something dips, it becomes smaller or lower, usually only for a short period of time. (暂时) 下降 9. N-COUNT Dip is also a noun. (暂时的) 下降 10. V-I If you dip into a book, you take a brief look at it without reading or studying it seriously. 浏览 11. V-I If you dip into a sum of money that you had intended to save, you use some of it to buy something or pay for something. 动用 (
1. ADJ Dysfunctional is used to describe relationships or behaviour which are different from what is considered to be normal. (关系或行为)异常的 [正式] [usu ADJ n]

1. N-VAR A holocaust is an event in which there is a lot of destruction and many people are killed, especially one caused by war. (尤指战争引起的) 大灾难 2. N-SING The Holocaust is used to refer to the killing by the Nazis of millions of Jews during the Second World War. (第二次世界大战中纳粹对犹太人的) 大屠杀
1. Did is the past tense of . (do)的过去式
[服装] 蝴蝶结 领结
1. N-COUNT A hovercraft is a vehicle that can travel across land and water. It floats above the land or water on a cushion of air. 气垫船; 气垫飞行器 [also 'by' N]
n. [助剂] 澄清剂；清洁器 adj. 更清楚的
1. N-COUNT A cluster of people or things is a small group of them close together. (人或物的) 群 2. V-I If people cluster together, they gather together in a small group. (人) 结成群
1. N-COUNT A legislator is a person who is involved in making or passing laws. 立法者 [正式]
1. N-VAR If someone or something causes inconvenience, they cause problems or difficulties. 不方便 2. V-T If someone inconveniences you, they cause problems or difficulties for you. 给…带来不便
1. →see concern 2. ADJ If you are concerned to do something, you want to do it because you think it is important. 想 (作某事) 的 [v-link ADJ to-inf]

1. ADJ Someone or something that is solemn is very serious rather than cheerful or humorous. (人) 严肃的; (物) 庄严的 2. solemnity N-UNCOUNT 严肃; 庄严 3. ADJ A solemn promise or agreement is one that you make in a very formal, sincere way. 正式的; 郑重的

1. N-COUNT A bolt is a long metal object that screws into a nut and is used to fasten things together. 螺钉 2. V-T When you bolt one thing to another, you fasten them firmly together, using a bolt. 栓牢 3. N-COUNT A bolt on a door or window is a metal bar that you can slide across in order to fasten the door or window. (门或窗的)闩 4. V-T When you bolt a door or window, you slide the bolt across to fasten it. 闩 (门或窗) 5. V-I If a person or animal bolts, they suddenly start to run very fast, often because something has frightened them. (因受惊吓) 突然快跑 6. V-T If you bolt your food, you eat it so quickly that you hardly chew it or taste it. 吞吃 7. V to pass (flour, a powder, etc) through a sieve 筛(面粉、粉末等) 8. PHRASAL VERB Bolt down means the same as . 吞吃 9. N-COUNT A bolt of lightning is a flash of lightning that is seen as a white line in the sky. (闪电) 道 10. PHRASE If someone is sitting or standing bolt upright, they are sitting or standing very straight. 笔直地
1. N-COUNT A pantry is a small room in a house, usually near the kitchen, where food is kept. 食品储藏室
1. N-COUNT An illustration is an example or a story that is used to make a point clear. 实例 2. N-COUNT An illustration in a book is a picture, design, or diagram. (书中的) 插图 3. → see also illustrate

1. N-COUNT A sketch is a drawing that is done quickly without a lot of details. Artists often use sketches as a preparation for a more detailed painting or drawing. 草图; 略图; 素描 2. V-T/V-I If you sketch something, you make a quick, rough drawing of it. 画…的素描; 画…的速写 3. N-COUNT A sketch of a situation, person, or incident is a brief description of it without many details. 概述 4. V-T If you sketch a situation or incident, you give a short description of it, including only the most important facts. 概述; 简述 5. PHRASAL VERB Sketch out means the same as . 概述; 简述 6. N-COUNT A sketch is a short humorous piece of acting, usually forming part of a comedy show. 幽默短剧; 滑稽小品

1. N-COUNT Your predecessor is the person who had your job before you. 前任 2. N-COUNT The predecessor of an object or machine is the object or machine that came before it in a sequence or process of development. 前一代
vt. 痛打；抨击；过度说明；反复讨论
1. N-UNCOUNT Funding is money which a government or organization provides for a particular purpose. (政府或组织为某目的而提供的) 资金

1. PHRASE When something is liable to happen, it is very likely to happen. 很有可能的 2. ADJ If people or things are liable to something unpleasant, they are likely to experience it or do it. 易于…的 [v-link ADJ 'to' n] 3. ADJ If you are liable for something such as a debt, you are legally responsible for it. 负法律责任的 [v-link ADJ] 4. liability N-UNCOUNT 责

1. V-T To compensate someone for money or things that they have lost, means to pay them money or give them something to replace those things. 补偿 (损失) 2. V-I If you compensate for a lack of something or for something you have done wrong, you do something to make the situation better. 弥补 (过失) 3. V-I Something that compensates for something else balances it or reduces its effects. 抵消 4. V-I If you try to compensate for something that is wrong or missing in your life, you try to do something that removes or reduces the harmful effects. 弥补

1. ADJ Someone who is bold is not afraid to do things that involve risk or danger. 无畏的; 大胆的 2. boldly ADV 无畏地; 大胆地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ Someone who is bold is not shy or embarrassed in the company of other people. 大胆的 4. boldly ADV 大胆地 5. ADJ A bold colour or pattern is very bright and noticeable. (色彩或图案) 鲜明的; 醒目的 6. ADJ Bold lines or designs are drawn in a clear, strong way. 清晰的; (线条、轮廓) 刚劲的; 大胆的 7. N-UNCOUNT Bold is print which is thicker and looks blacker than ordinary printed letters. 粗体 [技术]
1. ADV If something involves solely one thing, it involves only this thing and no others. 惟一地

1. ADJ You use generic to describe something that refers or relates to a whole class of similar things. 通用的 2. ADJ A generic drug or other product is one that does not have a trademark and that is known by a general name, rather than the manufacturer's name. 非注册商标的 (药等产品) 3. N-COUNT Generic is also a noun. 非注册商标的药品

1. V-T If you commission something or commission someone to do something, you formally arrange for someone to do a piece of work for you. 委托 2. N-VAR Commission is also a noun. 委托 3. N-COUNT A commission is a piece of work that someone is asked to do and is paid for. 委托任务 4. N-VAR Commission is a sum of money paid to a salesperson for every sale that he or she makes. If a salesperson is paid on commission, the amount they receive depends on the amount they sell. 销售佣金 5. N-UNCOUNT If a bank or other company charges commission, they charge a fee for providing a service, for example for exchanging money or issuing an insurance policy. 服务费 [商业] 6. N-COUNT-COLL A commission is a group of people who have been appointed to find out about something or to control something. 委员会 7. N-COUNT If a member of the armed forces receives a commission, he or she becomes an officer. 任命

1. V-T If you pursue an activity, interest, or plan, you carry it out or follow it. 执行; 贯彻 [正式] 2. V-T If you pursue a particular aim or result, you make efforts to achieve it, often over a long period of time. 追求; 努力实现 [正式] 3. V-T If you pursue a particular topic, you try to find out more about it by asking questions. 追问 [正式] 4. V-T If you pursue a person, vehicle, or animal, you follow them, usually in order to catch them. 追赶 [正式]
adv. 压倒性地；不可抵抗地
1. N-VAR If you have a fever when you are ill, your body temperature is higher than usual. 发烧 2. → see also hay fever
n. 哈里斯（英国苏格兰一地区）；哈里斯（姓氏）

1. V-I When people or animals snort, they breathe air noisily out through their noses. People sometimes snort in order to express disapproval or amusement. 喷鼻息 (有时表示不赞同或可笑) 2. N-COUNT Snort is also a noun. 喷鼻息 3. V-T To snort a drug such as cocaine means to breathe it in quickly through your nose. 用鼻子吸食 (毒品)
1. N-UNCOUNT Bloodshed is violence in which people are killed or wounded. 流血暴力

1. V-T If one event or period of time precedes another, it happens before it. (某事件) 先于 (另一事件) 而发生; (某时段) 先于 (另一时段) 而存在 [正式] 2. V-T If you precede someone somewhere, you go in front of them. 走在…的前面 [正式] 3. V-T A sentence, paragraph, or chapter that precedes another one comes just before it. (句、段、章) 处于 (另一句、段、章) 之前

1. V-T/V-I If something overturns or if you overturn it, it turns upside down or on its side. 打翻; 翻倒 2. V-T If someone in authority overturns a legal decision, they officially decide that that decision is incorrect or not valid. 推翻

1. N-VAR A convention is a way of behaving that is considered to be correct or polite by most people in a society. 习俗 2. N-COUNT In art, literature, or the theatre, a convention is a traditional method or style. 惯例 3. N-COUNT A convention is an official agreement between countries or groups of people. 公约 4. N-COUNT A convention is a large meeting of an organization or political group. 大型会议
尽量利用；十分重视
n. 办公桌轮用制

1. N-COUNT A module is a part of a machine, especially a computer, which performs a particular function. (尤指计算机的) 组件 2. N-COUNT A module is a part of a spacecraft which can operate by itself, often away from the rest of the spacecraft. (航天器的) 舱
1. N-COUNT A reformer is someone who tries to change and improve something such as a law or a social system. 改革者; 改良者
1. N-UNCOUNT The sophistication of people, places, machines, or methods is their quality of being sophisticated. 老练; 复杂性; 先进
1. N-VAR The terminology of a subject is the set of special words and expressions used in connection with it. 术语
1. ADJ Neural means relating to a nerve or to the nervous system. 神经的; 神经系统的 [医学]

1. N-COUNT A reel is a cylindrical object around which you wrap something such as movie film, magnetic tape, or fishing line. 卷轴 2. V to wind (cotton, thread, etc) onto a reel 绕上卷轴 3. V-I If someone reels, they move about in an unsteady way as if they are going to fall. 踉跄 4. V-I If you are reeling from a shock, you are feeling extremely surprised or upset because of it. 感到震惊; 心烦意乱 [usu cont] 5. N a staggering or swaying motion or sensation 蹒跚的动作; 摇晃的动作 6. V-I If you say that your brain or your mind is reeling, you mean that you are very confused because you have too many things to think about. 混乱 7. N any of various lively Scottish dances, such as the eightsome reel and foursome reel for a fixed number of couples who combine in square and circular formations (苏格兰)里尔舞; 由数量固定的一对对人编成方队和圆队表演
1. N-UNCOUNT Something's relevance to a situation or person is its importance or significance in that situation or to that person. 相关性

1. V-T When someone or something achieves a more important rank or status, you can say that they are elevated to it. 提拔 [正式] [usu passive] 2. elevation N-UNCOUNT 提拔 3. V-T If you elevate something to a higher status, you consider it to be better or more important than it really is. 抬高 (地位) 4. V-T To elevate something means to increase it in amount or intensity. 提高 [正式] 5. V-T If you elevate something, you raise it higher. 举起; 抬高

1. ADJ If something is doomed to happen, or if you are doomed to a particular state, something unpleasant is certain to happen, and you can do nothing to prevent it. 注定的 [v-link ADJ] 2. ADJ Someone or something that is doomed is certain to fail or be destroyed. 注定要失败的
1. ADJ A spoken statement that is slanderous is untrue and intended to damage the reputation of the person that it refers to. 中伤的; 诽谤的

1. N-UNCOUNT Sweat is the salty colourless liquid which comes through your skin when you are hot, sick, or afraid. 汗 2. V-I When you sweat, sweat comes through your skin. 出汗 3. sweating N-UNCOUNT 出汗 4. N-COUNT If someone is in a sweat, they are sweating a lot. 满身汗 5. PHRASE If someone is in a cold sweat or in a sweat, they feel frightened or embarrassed. (害怕或尴尬时) 出冷汗

1. N-COUNT A reef is a long line of rocks or sand, the top of which is just above or just below the surface of the sea. 礁 2. N the part gathered in when sail area is reduced, as in a high wind 帆的可收缩部 3. V to reduce the area of (sail) by taking in a reef 收帆
1. N-VAR A stimulus is something that encourages activity in people or things. 刺激物

1. N-VAR A strategy is a general plan or set of plans intended to achieve something, especially over a long period. 策略 2. N-UNCOUNT Strategy is the art of planning the best way to gain an advantage or achieve success, especially in war. 战略
n. 俄罗斯石油公司

1. N-UNCOUNT Solitaire is a card game for only one player. It is often played on a computer. 单人纸牌游戏 [美国英语] 2. N-COUNT A solitaire is a diamond or other jewel that is set on its own in a ring or other piece of jewellery. 单粒宝石
1. ADJ Opposing ideas or tendencies are totally different from each other. 相反的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Opposing groups of people disagree about something or are in competition with one another. 对立的 [ADJ n]
n. 汉普郡（英国南部之一郡）

1. ADJ Something that is premature happens earlier than usual or earlier than people expect. 提早的 2. prematurely ADV 提早地 3. ADJ You can say that something is premature when it happens too early and is therefore inappropriate. 过早的 4. prematurely ADV 过早地 5. ADJ A premature baby is one that was born before the date when it was expected to be born. 早产的 6. prematurely ADV 早产地 [ADV after v]
1. N the first test vehicle of the NASA space shuttle fleet to prove the possibility of routine access to space for scientific and commercial ventures 哥伦比亚号航天飞机
1. ADJ Lebanese means belonging or relating to Lebanon, or to its people or culture. 黎巴嫩的; 黎巴嫩人的; 黎巴嫩文化的 2. N-COUNT A Lebanese is a Lebanese citizen, or a person of Lebanese origin. 黎巴嫩人
1. N-COUNT Your adversary is someone you are competing with, or arguing or fighting against. 对手
n. 斯德哥尔摩（瑞典首都）
1. N-COUNT A distillery is a place where whisky or a similar strong alcoholic drink is made by a process of distilling. 蒸馏间
1. ADJ If someone's voice, smile, or actions are tremulous, they are unsteady because the person is uncertain, afraid, or upset. 震颤的 [文学性] [ADV with v] 2. tremulously ADV
1. ADJ Linguistic abilities or ideas relate to language or linguistics. 语言的; 语言学的 2. N-UNCOUNT Linguistics is the study of the way in which language works. 语言学

1. V-T/V-I If you slog through something, you work hard and steadily through it. 苦干 [非正式] 2. PHRASAL VERB Slog away means the same as . 苦干 3. N-SING If you describe a task as a slog, you mean that it is tiring and requires a lot of effort. 苦干 [非正式] [also no det]
n. 利库德集团（以色列右翼政党）
n. 美国路易斯安那州

1. V-T If you consolidate something that you have, for example power or success, you strengthen it so that it becomes more effective or secure. 巩固 2. V-T To consolidate a number of small groups or companies means to make them into one large organization. 合并
n. (Draghi)人名；(法、意)德拉吉
生物力学
1. ADV in accordance with the facts; correctly 与事实相符地; 正确地

1. N-VAR An injury is damage done to a person's or an animal's body. 伤害; 损害 2. N-VAR If someone suffers injury to their feelings, they are badly upset by something. If they suffer injury to their reputation, their reputation is seriously harmed. (对感情或名誉等的) 伤害 [法律] 3. to add insult to injury →see insult

1. N-COUNT A pallet is a flat wooden or metal platform on which goods are stored so that they can be lifted and moved using a forklift truck. (运货用的)托盘 2. N-COUNT A pallet is a narrow mattress filled with straw that is put on the floor for someone to sleep on. (睡觉用的)草垫子 3. N-COUNT A pallet is a hard, narrow bed. 小硬板床 4. N an instrument with a handle and a flat, sometimes flexible, blade used by potters for shaping 抹子

1. N-COUNT A levy is a sum of money that you have to pay, for example, as a tax to the government. 税款 2. V-T If a government or organization levies a tax or other sum of money, it demands it from people or organizations. 征 (税)

1. V-T/V-I If you detach one thing from another that it is attached to, you remove it. If one thing detaches from another, it becomes separated from it. 拆卸; 分离 [正式] 2. V-T If you detach yourself from something, you become less involved in it or less concerned about it than you used to be. 超脱
1. N-UNCOUNT Moisture is tiny drops of water in the air, on a surface, or in the ground. 潮气; 水分
n. 倔强；顽强；棘手

1. V-T To extract a substance means to obtain it from something else, for example, by using industrial or chemical processes. 提炼; 提取 2. extraction N-UNCOUNT 提炼; 提取 3. V-T If you extract something from a place, you take it out or pull it out. 取出 4. V-T When a dentist extracts a tooth, they remove it from the patient's mouth. 拔 (牙) 5. extraction N-VAR 拔牙 6. V-T If you say that someone extracts something, you disapprove of them because they take it for themselves to gain an advantage. 谋取 [表不满] 7. V-T If you extract information or a response from someone, you get it from them with difficulty, because they are unwilling to say or do what you want. 探取 (消息、反映) 8. V-T If you extract a particular piece of information, you obtain it from a larger amount or source of information. 摘取 (信息) 9. V-T PASSIVE If part of a book or text is extracted from a particular book, it is printed or published. (从书中) 摘录 [journalism] 10. N-COUNT An extract from a book or piece of writing is a small part of it that is printed or p

1. N-MASS Paint is a coloured liquid that you put onto a surface with a brush in order to protect the surface or to make it look nice, or that you use to produce a picture. 油漆; 涂料 2. N-SING On a wall or object, the paint is the covering of dried paint on it. 油漆层; 涂层 3. V-T/V-I If you paint a wall or an object, you cover it with paint. 给…刷油漆; 给…刷涂料 4. V-T If you paint something or paint a picture of it, you produce a picture of it using paint. 画 5. V-T When you paint a design or message on a surface, you put it on the surface using paint. 用颜料画; 用颜料写 6. V-T If you paint a grim or vivid picture of something, you give a description of it that is grim or vivid. 把…描绘成 7. → see also gloss paint, oil paint, painting
1. ADJ Educational matters or institutions are concerned with or relate to education. 教育的 2. ADJ An educational experience teaches you something. 有教育意义的

1. N-UNCOUNT Conservatism is a political philosophy which believes that if changes need to be made to society, they should be made gradually. You can also refer to the political beliefs of a conservative party in a particular country as conservatism. (政治) 保守主义; (特指某国) 保守政党的政治主张 2. N-UNCOUNT Conservatism is unwillingness to accept changes and new ideas. 守旧性

1. N-COUNT Someone's butt is their bottom. 屁股 [美国英语] [非正式] 2. N-COUNT The butt or the butt end of a weapon or tool is the thick end of its handle. (武器或工具的) 柄较粗的一端 3. N-COUNT The butt of a cigarette or cigar is the small part of it that is left when someone has finished smoking it. 烟蒂 4. N-COUNT A butt is a large barrel used for collecting or storing liquid. 大桶 5. N-SING If someone or something is the butt of jokes or criticism, people often make fun of them or criticize them. 笑柄 6. V-T If a person or animal butts you, they hit you with the top of their head. 用头撞 7. V to lie or be placed end on to; abut 毗邻 8. V to intrude, esp into a conversation; interfere; meddle 插嘴; 打扰

1. N-COUNT A person's mentor is someone who gives them help and advice over a period of time, especially help and advice related to their job. 导师 2. V-T To mentor someone means to give them help and advice over a period of time, especially help and advice related to their job. 指导
n. 喀麦隆（西非国名）

1. V-T/V-I If you lament something, you express your sadness, regret, or disappointment about it. 感到悲痛; 感到遗憾; 感到失望 [FORMAL, WRITTEN] 2. N-COUNT Someone's lament is an expression of their sadness, regret, or disappointment about something. 哀叹 [FORMAL, WRITTEN] 3. N-COUNT A lament is a poem, song, or piece of music which expresses sorrow that someone has died. 悼诗; 悼歌; 哀乐

1. ADJ Someone who is prominent is important and well-known. 重要的; 著名的 2. ADJ Something that is prominent is very noticeable or is an important part of something else. 突出的 3. prominently ADV 突出地 [ADV with v]

1. V-T If you escort someone somewhere, you accompany them there, usually in order to make sure that they leave a place or get to their destination. 护送 2. N-COUNT An escort is a person who travels with someone in order to protect or guard them. 护送者 3. PHRASE If someone is taken somewhere under escort, they are accompanied by guards, either because they have been arrested or because they need to be protected. 在押送下; 在护送下 4. N-COUNT An escort is a person who accompanies another person of the opposite sex to a social event. Sometimes people are paid to be escorts. (异性的) 社交陪同
1. N-UNCOUNT Aviation is the operation and production of aircraft. 航空; 飞机制造业

1. N-COUNT A fraction of something is a tiny amount or proportion of it. 少量 2. N-COUNT A fraction is a number that can be expressed as a proportion of two whole numbers. For example, 1/2 and 1/3 are both fractions. 分数
1. N-VAR A polemic is a very strong written or spoken attack on, or defence of, a particular belief or opinion. (口头或书面的) 猛烈抨击; 辩护

1. N-COUNT A bunch of people is a group of people who share one or more characteristics or who are doing something together. 伙 [非正式] 2. N-COUNT A bunch of flowers is a number of flowers with their stalks held or tied together. 束 3. N-COUNT A bunch of bananas or grapes is a group of them growing on the same stem. 串 4. N-COUNT A bunch of keys is a set of keys kept together on a metal ring. 串
1. N-VAR If you describe a person's action as provocation or a provocation, you mean that it is a reason for someone else to react angrily, violently, or emotionally. 挑衅
1. N-COUNT The legislature of a particular state or country is the group of people in it who have the power to make and pass laws. 立法机构; 议会 [正式]

1. V-T To eliminate something, especially something you do not want or need, means to remove it completely. 根除 [正式] 2. elimination N-UNCOUNT 根除 3. V-T PASSIVE When a person or team is eliminated from a competition, they are defeated and so stop participating in the competition. 淘汰 4. V-T If someone says that they have eliminated an enemy, they mean that they have killed them. By using the word "eliminate," they are trying to make the action sound more positive than if they used the word "kill." 消灭
n. 迪拜（阿拉伯联合酋长国的酋长国之一）；迪拜港（阿拉伯联合酋长国港市）

1. N-VAR Haze is light mist, caused by particles of water or dust in the air, which prevents you from seeing distant objects clearly. Haze often forms in hot weather. 薄雾 2. N-VAR the moisture or dust causing this (形成薄雾的)水汽; 尘雾 3. N-SING If there is a haze of something such as smoke or steam, you cannot see clearly through it. 烟雾 [文学性] 4. V to make or become hazy 使朦胧; 变朦胧 5. V to subject (fellow students) to ridicule or abuse 戏弄; 凌辱(同学) [美国英语]

1. V-T/V-I To invade a country means to enter it by force with an army. 侵入 2. V-T If you say that people or animals invade a place, you mean that they enter it in large numbers, often in a way that is unpleasant or difficult to deal with. 拥入

1. ADJ If you say that something is probable, you mean that it is likely to be true or likely to happen. 可能 (是真实、发生) 的 [含糊] 2. ADJ You can use probable to describe a role or function that someone or something is likely to have. 可能 (拥有) 的 [ADJ n]

1. V-I To lurch means to make a sudden movement, especially forward, in an uncontrolled way. (尤指向前) 打趔趄 2. N-COUNT Lurch is also a noun. 趔趄 3. V-I If you say that a person or organization lurches from one thing to another, you mean they move suddenly from one course of action or attitude to another in an uncontrolled way. (行为或态度随意的) 突然改变 [表不满] 4. N-COUNT Lurch is also a noun. (行为或态度随意地) 突然改变 5. V to desert someone in trouble 弃...于危难; 见死不救

1. N-COUNT If you describe a situation or a feeling as a void, you mean that it seems empty because there is nothing interesting or worthwhile about it. 空白; 空虚感 2. N-COUNT You can describe a large or frightening space as a void. (空间) 大而恐怖的 3. ADJ Something that is void or null and void is officially considered to have no value or authority. 无效的 [v-link ADJ] 4. ADJ If you are void of something, you do not have any of it. 没有…的 [正式] [v-link ADJ 'of' n] 5. V-T To void something means to officially say that it is not valid. 正式宣布…无效 [正式]
1. ADJ Something that is shaped like a particular object or in a particular way has the shape of that object or a shape of that type. 有…形状的 [v-link ADJ]

1. V-T If you scratch yourself, you rub your fingernails against your skin because it is itching. 挠 2. V-T If a sharp object scratches someone or something, it makes small shallow cuts on their skin or surface. 划破 3. N-COUNT Scratches on someone or something are small shallow cuts. 划伤 4. PHRASE If you do something from scratch, you do it without making use of anything that has been done before. 从零开始 5. PHRASE If you say that someone is scratching their head, you mean that they are thinking hard and trying to solve a problem or puzzle. 绞尽脑汁思考

1. N-COUNT A pipe is a long, round, hollow object, usually made of metal or plastic, through which a liquid or gas can flow. 管子 2. N-COUNT A pipe is an object that is used for smoking tobacco. You put the tobacco into the cup-shaped part at the end of the pipe, light it, and breathe in the smoke through a narrow tube. 烟斗 3. N-COUNT A pipe is a simple musical instrument in the shape of a tube with holes in it. You play a pipe by blowing into it while covering and uncovering the holes with your fingers. 管乐器 4. N-COUNT An organ pipe is one of the long hollow tubes in which air vibrates and produces a musical note. 管风琴的音管 5. N a large cask for wine, oil, etc 装酒、油等的大桶 6. V-T If liquid or gas is piped somewhere, it is transferred from one place to another through a pipe. 用管道输送 7. V to play (music) on a pipe 以管乐器吹奏(音乐) 8. → see also piping
1. ADJ withheld over a certain period; postponed 推迟的; 延期的
1. N-UNCOUNT Paediatrics is the area of medicine that is concerned with the treatment of children. 儿科学
n. 检查；视察；安全检测（inspection的复数）
n. 修改，修正；改变

1. ADJ If you say that something is absurd, you are criticizing it because you think that it is ridiculous or that it does not make sense. 荒谬的 [表不满] 2. N-SING The absurd is something that is absurd. 荒谬之事 [正式] ['the' N] 3. absurdly ADV 荒谬地
1. N-COUNT A predator is an animal that kills and eats other animals. 食肉动物 2. N-COUNT People sometimes refer to predatory people or organizations as predators. 掠夺者

1. V-I If you jog, you run slowly, often as a form of exercise. 慢跑 2. N-COUNT Jog is also a noun. 慢跑 3. jogging N-UNCOUNT 慢跑 4. V-T If you jog something, you push or bump it slightly so that it moves. 轻推; 轻撞 5. PHRASE If something or someone jogs your memory, they cause you to suddenly remember something that you had forgotten. 唤起某人的记忆 6. N a sharp protruding point in a surface; jag 突出端

1. N-COUNT A conference is a meeting, often lasting a few days, which is organized on a particular subject or to bring together people who have a common interest. 专题讨论会 2. N-COUNT A conference is a meeting at which formal discussions take place. (进行正式讨论的) 会议 [also 'in' N] 3. → see also press conference
1. N-COUNT An allegation is a statement saying that someone has done something wrong. 指控
1. ADJ If you are reluctant to do something, you are unwilling to do it and hesitate before doing it, or do it slowly and without enthusiasm. 不愿意的; 勉强的 2. reluctantly ADV 不愿意地; 勉强地 [ADV with v]

1. V-T To bury something means to put it into a hole in the ground and cover it up with earth. 埋 2. V-T To bury a dead person means to put their body into a grave and cover it with earth. 埋葬 3. V-T If someone says they have buried one of their relatives, they mean that one of their relatives has died. 丧失 (亲人) 4. V-T If you bury something under a large quantity of things, you put it there, often in order to hide it. 埋藏 5. V-T If something buries a place or person, it falls on top of them so that it completely covers them and often harms them in some way. 掩埋 6. V-T If you bury your head or face in something, you press your head or face against it, often because you are unhappy. 埋进…中 7. V-T If something buries itself somewhere, or if you bury it there, it is pushed very deeply in there. 嵌入 8. to bury the hatchet →see hatchet
1. N-VAR The cargo of a ship or plane is the goods that it is carrying. 货物

1. N-UNCOUNT Malaise is a state in which there is something wrong with a society or group, for which there does not seem to be a quick or easy solution. 痼疾 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Malaise is a state in which people feel dissatisfied or unhappy but feel unable to change, usually because they do not know what is wrong. 不安; 不适 [正式]

1. PHRASAL VERB If you bail someone out, you help them out of a difficult situation, often by giving them money. (常通过提供资金) 帮助…摆脱困境 2. → see also bailout 3. PHRASAL VERB If you bail someone out, you pay bail on their behalf. 把…保释出来 4. PHRASAL VERB If a pilot bails out of an aircraft that is crashing, he or she jumps from it, using a parachute to land safely. 跳伞逃生 5. →see bail
1. N-COUNT A mineral is a substance such as tin, salt, or sulphur that is formed naturally in rocks and in the earth. Minerals are also found in small quantities in food and drink. 矿物

1. N-UNCOUNT You can use stuff to refer to things such as a substance, a collection of things, events, or ideas, or the contents of something in a general way without mentioning the thing itself by name. 东西 [非正式] [usu with supp] 2. V-T If you stuff something somewhere, you push it there quickly and roughly. 把…塞进 3. V-T If you stuff a container or space with something, you fill it with something or with a quantity of things until it is full. 把…装满 4. V-T If you stuff yourself, you eat a lot of food. 使吃饱 [非正式] 5. V-T If you stuff a bird such as a chicken or a vegetable such as a pepper, you put a mixture of food inside it before cooking it. 把填料塞入 (鸡或辣椒等) 6. V-T If a dead animal is stuffed, it is filled with a substance so that it can be preserved and displayed. 把…制成标本 [usu passive] 7. PHRASE If you say that someone knows their stuff, you mean that they are good at doing something because they know a lot about it. 懂行 [非正式]
n. 邱吉尔（英国政治家及作家）
1. N-COUNT An investor is a person or organization that buys securities or property in order to receive a profit. 投资者

1. N-UNCOUNT Perplexity is a feeling of being confused and frustrated because you do not understand something. 困惑; 迷惘 2. N-COUNT The perplexities of something are those things about it that are difficult to understand because they are complicated. 疑难问题 [usu pl]

1. N-COUNT Accessories are items of equipment that are not usually essential, but can be used with or added to something else in order to make it more efficient, useful, or decorative. 附件 2. N-COUNT Accessories are articles such as belts and scarves which you wear or carry but which are not part of your main clothing. 配饰 3. N-COUNT If someone is guilty of being an accessory to a crime, they helped the person who committed it, or knew it was being committed but did not tell the police. 从犯 [法律]

1. N-COUNT An orbit is the curved path in space that is followed by an object going around and around a planet, moon, or star. (天体运行的) 轨道 [also 'in/into' N] 2. V-T If something such as a satellite orbits a planet, moon, or sun, it moves around it in a continuous, curving path. 环绕…的轨道运行
1. ADJ Something that is chilly is unpleasantly cold. 阴冷的 2. ADJ If you feel chilly, you feel rather cold. 寒冷的 [v-link ADJ]
1. N-COUNT Your siblings are your brothers and sisters. 兄弟姐妹 [正式]

1. N-TITLE/N-COUNT Chancellor is the title of the head of government in Germany and Austria. (德国、奥地利) 总理 2. N-COUNT The head of some American universities is called the chancellor. (美国) 大学校长 3. N-COUNT In Britain, the chancellor is the chancellor of the exchequer. (英国) 财政大臣
1. PHRASE If you upset the applecart, you do something that causes a plan, system, or arrangement to go wrong. 破坏计划; 扰乱制度; 打乱安排

1. N-COUNT If someone is your subordinate, they have a less important position than you in the organization that you both work for. 下级 2. ADJ Someone who is subordinate to you has a less important position than you and has to obey you. 下级的 3. ADJ Something that is subordinate to something else is less important than the other thing. 次要的; 从属的 4. V-T If you subordinate something to another thing, you regard it or treat it as less important than the other thing. 使从属于; 把…列于次要地位 5. subordination N-UNCOUNT 从属; 次要
n. 马库斯（男子名）

1. ADJ If your opinion or your reaction is favourable to something, you agree with it and approve of it. 赞成的 [ADJ n, v-link ADJ 'to' n] 2. ADJ Favourable conditions make something more likely to succeed or seem more attractive. 有利的 3. ADJ If you make a favourable comparison between two things, you say that the first is better than or as good as the second. 更优的; 不逊色的
n. 古吉拉特邦（印度西部的邦）

1. ADJ A devout person has deep religious beliefs. 虔诚的 2. N-PLURAL The devout are people who are devout. 虔诚者 3. ADJ If you describe someone as a devout supporter or a devout opponent of something, you mean that they support it enthusiastically or oppose it strongly. 坚定的 [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A margin is the difference between two amounts, especially the difference in the number of votes or points between the winner and the loser in an election or other contest. 差数 2. N-COUNT The margin of a written or printed page is the empty space at the side of the page. 页边的空白 3. N-VAR If there is a margin for something in a situation, there is some freedom to choose what to do or decide how to do it. 余地 4. N-COUNT The margin of a place or area is the extreme edge of it. 边缘 5. N-PLURAL To be on the margins of a society, group, or activity means to be among the least typical or least important parts of it. 非主体部分 6. → see also profit margin
1. V-T To obtain something means to get it or achieve it. 获得 [正式]
adv. 频繁地，经常地；时常，屡次
1. ADJ A world-class athlete, performer, or organization is one of the best in the world. 世界级的 [journalism]
1. N-COUNT A windfall is a sum of money that you receive unexpectedly or by luck, for example, if you win a lottery. 意外之财

1. ADV You use personally to emphasize that you are giving your own opinion. 在个人看来 [ADV with cl] [强调] 2. ADV If you do something personally, you do it yourself rather than letting someone else do it. 亲自 [ADV with v] 3. ADV If you meet or know someone personally, you meet or know them in real life, rather than knowing about them or knowing their work. 当面地; 本人直接地 [ADV with v] 4. ADV You can use personally to say that something refers to an individual person rather than to other people. 关于个人地 5. ADV You can use personally to show that you are talking about someone's private life rather than their professional or public life. 涉及私生活地 6. PHRASE If you take someone's remarks personally, you are upset because you think that they are criticizing you in particular. 视 (言论等) 针对自己而不悦

1. N-COUNT A pipeline is a large pipe that is used for carrying oil or gas over a long distance, often underground. (长距离输送石油、天然气等的地下) 管道 2. PHRASE If something is in the pipeline, it has already been planned or begun. 已筹划的; 已实施的

1. N-COUNT A hawk is a large bird with a short, hooked beak, sharp claws, and very good eyesight. Hawks catch and eat small birds and animals. 鹰 2. N-COUNT In politics, if you refer to someone as a hawk, you mean that they believe in using force and violence to achieve something, rather than using more peaceful or diplomatic methods. Compare . (主张使用武力或强硬手段的) 鹰派人物 3. N-COUNT a noisy clearing of the throat 清嗓声 4. N-COUNT a small square board with a handle underneath, used for carrying wet plaster or mortar 灰泥托板 (Also called mortar board) 5. V to hunt with falcons, hawks, etc 放鹰行猎 6. V to clear the throat noisily 大声清嗓 7. V to offer (goods) for sale, as in the street (沿街)兜售 8. PHRASE If you watch someone like a hawk, you observe them very carefully, usually to make sure that they do not make a mistake or do something you do not want them to do. 密切监视
1. PHRASE If you say that someone does something with impunity, you disapprove of the fact that they are not punished for doing something bad. 不受惩罚 [PHR after v] [表不满]
1. ADJ An object that is cracked has lines on its surface because it is damaged. 破裂的; 有裂纹的 2. ADJ A cracked voice or a cracked musical note sounds rough and unsteady. 沙哑的

1. N-COUNT Your objective is what you are trying to achieve. 目标 2. ADJ Objective information is based on facts. 客观的 [ADJ n] 3. objectively ADV 客观地 4. ADJ If someone is objective, they base their opinions on facts rather than on their personal feelings. 客观的 5. objectively ADV 客观地
1. N a symbol (‸) used to indicate the place in written or printed matter at which something is to be inserted 脱字符号

1. N-COUNT A charity is an organization which raises money in order to help people who are ill, disabled, or very poor. 慈善机构 2. N-UNCOUNT If you give money to charity, you give it to one or more charitable organizations. If you do something for charity, you do it in order to raise money for one or more charitable organizations. 慈善 3. N-UNCOUNT People who live on charity live on money or goods which other people give them because they are poor. 救济金; 救济物
1. ADJ If you describe something as ambiguous, you mean that it is unclear or confusing because it can be understood in more than one way. 模棱两可的 2. ambiguously ADV 模棱两可地
1. ADJ If someone has a worshipful attitude to a person or thing, they show great respect and admiration for them. 尊敬的; 崇拜的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A shirt is a piece of clothing that you wear on the upper part of your body. Shirts have a collar, sleeves, and buttons down the front. 衬衫 2. → see also sweatshirt, T-shirt
1. ADV You use hitherto to indicate that something was true up until the time you are talking about, although it may no longer be the case. 迄今 [正式]
1. N-VAR The climate of a place is the general weather conditions that are typical of it. 气候 2. N-COUNT You can use climate to refer to the general atmosphere or situation somewhere. 氛围; 形势

1. N-COUNT A tendency is a worrying or unpleasant habit or action that keeps occurring. 倾向 2. N-COUNT A tendency is a part of your character that makes you often behave in an unpleasant or worrying way. (性格方面不好的) 倾向

1. N-COUNT A toilet is a large bowl with a seat, or a platform with a hole, which is connected to a water system and which you use when you want to get rid of urine or faeces from your body. 抽水马桶 2. N-COUNT A toilet is a room in a house or public building that contains a toilet. 厕所 [英国英语] 3. PHRASE You can say that someone goes to the toilet to mean that they get rid of waste substances from their body, especially when you want to avoid using words that you think may offend people. 上厕所 [英国英语]

1. ADJ A messy person or activity makes things dirty or not neat. 邋遢的 2. ADJ Something that is messy is dirty or not neat. 脏的 3. ADJ If you describe a situation as messy, you are emphasizing that it is confused or complicated, and therefore unsatisfactory. 混乱而复杂的
1. N-COUNT A clause is a section of a legal document. (法律文件的) 条款 2. N-COUNT In grammar, a clause is a group of words containing a verb. Sentences contain one or more clauses. 分句

1. N-COUNT/N-TITLE/N-VOC A general is a high-ranking officer in the armed forces, usually in the army. 将军 2. ADJ If you talk about the general situation somewhere or talk about something in general terms, you are describing the situation as a whole rather than considering its details or exceptions. 大体的 [ADJ n] 3. PHRASE If you describe something in general terms, you describe it without giving details. 笼统地说 4. ADJ You use general to describe several items or activities when there are too many of them or when they are not important enough to mention separately. 多种的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ You use general to describe something that involves or affects most people, or most people in a particular group. 普遍的 [ADJ n] 6. ADJ If you describe something as general, you mean that it is not restricted to any one thing or area. 整体的 [ADJ n] 7. ADJ General is used to describe a person's job, usually as part of their title, to indicate that they have complete responsibility for the administration of an organization or busines

1. V-I If you slip, you accidentally slide and lose your balance. 滑; 滑倒 2. V-I If something slips, it slides out of place or out of your hand. 滑走; 滑落 3. V-I If you slip somewhere, you go there quickly and quietly. 溜走 4. V-T If you slip something somewhere, you put it there quickly in a way that does not attract attention. 把…悄悄地放在 5. V-T If you slip something to someone, you give it to them secretly. 偷偷地给 6. V-I To slip into a particular state or situation means to pass gradually into it, in a way that is hardly noticed. (不知不觉地) 陷入 7. V-T/V-I If something slips to a lower level or standard, it falls to that level or standard. 使下降; 下降 8. N-SING Slip is also a noun. 下降 9. V-T/V-I If you slip into or out of clothes or shoes, you put them on or take them off quickly and easily. 迅速轻松地穿上; 迅速轻松地脱下 10. V to detach (portions of stem, etc) from (a plant) for propagation (从植物)取接枝 11. N-COUNT A slip is a small or unimportant mistake. 差错; 疏漏 12. N-COUNT A slip of paper is a small piece of paper. 纸条 13. N-COUN

1. N-UNCOUNT Discrimination is the practice of treating one person or group of people less fairly or less well than other people or groups. 歧视 2. N-UNCOUNT Discrimination is knowing what is good or of high quality. 鉴赏力 3. N-UNCOUNT Discrimination is the ability to recognize and understand the differences between two things. 辨别力
1. ADJ Libyan means belonging or relating to Libya, or to its people or culture. 利比亚的; 利比亚人的; 利比亚文化的 2. N-COUNT A Libyan is a Libyan citizen, or a person of Libyan origin. 利比亚人
1. ADJ Someone who is unmarried is not married. 未婚的

1. V-T If you devote yourself, your time, or your energy to something, you spend all or most of your time or energy on it. 把…奉献给 2. V-T If you devote a particular proportion of a piece of writing or a speech to a particular subject, you deal with the subject in that amount of space or time. 作…专用

1. N-COUNT A dairy is a company that sells milk and food made from milk, such as butter, cream, and cheese. 乳品公司 2. ADJ Dairy is used to refer to foods such as butter and cheese that are made from milk. 奶制的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ Dairy is used to refer to the use of cattle to produce milk rather than meat. 产乳的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ If you are secretive, you like to have secrets and to keep your knowledge, feelings, or intentions hidden. 藏而不露的; 讳莫如深的
1. ADJ A placid person or animal is calm and does not easily become excited, angry, or upset. 温和的 2. ADJ A placid place, area of water, or life is calm and peaceful. 平静的
1. N-UNCOUNT Bribery is the act of offering someone money or something valuable in order to persuade them to do something for you. 贿赂行为
n. 小型汽车

1. N-UNCOUNT Ammunition is bullets and rockets that are made to be fired from weapons. 弹药 2. N-UNCOUNT You can describe information that you can use against someone in an argument or discussion as ammunition. (可用于争辩的) 论据
1. N-COUNT A lorry is a large vehicle that is used to transport goods by road. 卡车 [英国英语]
adv. 独特地；珍奇地
1. ADJ Someone who is well-connected has important or influential relatives or friends. 社会关系优越的

1. N-COUNT A buoy is a floating object that is used to show ships and boats where they can go and to warn them of danger. 浮标 2. V-T If someone in a difficult situation is buoyed by something, it makes them feel more cheerful and optimistic. 使振奋 3. PHRASAL VERB Buoy up means the same as . 使振奋

1. Stuck is the past tense and past participle of . (stick)的过去式和过去分词 2. ADJ If something is stuck in a particular position, it is fixed tightly in this position and is unable to move. 动不了的 [v-link ADJ] 3. ADJ If you are stuck in a place, you want to get away from it, but are unable to. 被困住的 [v-link ADJ prep/adv] 4. ADJ If you are stuck in a boring or unpleasant situation, you are unable to change it or get away from it. 陷入的 [v-link ADJ prep/adv] 5. ADJ If something is stuck at a particular level or stage, it is not progressing or changing. 停滞不前的 [v-link ADJ prep/adv] 6. ADJ If you are stuck with something that you do not want, you cannot get rid of it. 无法摆脱的 [v-link ADJ 'with' n] 7. ADJ If you get stuck when you are trying to do something, you are unable to continue doing it because it is too difficult. (因困难) 无法继续的 [v-link ADJ]

1. N-COUNT A pile of things is a mass of them that is high in the middle and has sloping sides. 堆 2. N-COUNT A pile of things is a quantity of things that have been put neatly somewhere so that each thing is on top of the one below. 叠 3. V-T If you pile things somewhere, you put them there so that they form a pile. 堆放 4. V-T If something is piled with things, it is covered or filled with piles of things. 堆满 [usu passive] 5. V-I If a group of people pile into or out of a vehicle, they all get into it or out of it in a disorganized way. 涌入/出 6. N-COUNT Piles are wooden, concrete, or metal posts that are pushed into the ground and on which buildings or bridges are built. Piles are often used in very wet areas so that the buildings do not flood. 地桩 7. V to drive (piles) into the ground 将(地桩)打进地里 8. N-PLURAL Piles is an informal word meaning haemorrhoids. 痔疮 9. N-SING The pile of a carpet or of a fabric such as velvet is its soft surface. It consists of a lot of little threads standing on end. 绒面 10. PH

1. V-T If you fling something somewhere, you throw it there using a lot of force. 猛掷 2. V-T If you fling yourself somewhere, you move or jump there suddenly and with a lot of force. 突然移向; 突然跳到 3. V-T If you fling a part of your body in a particular direction, especially your arms or head, you move it there suddenly. 猛然移动 (臂、头等身体部位) 4. V-T If you fling someone to the ground, you push them very roughly so that they fall over. 推倒 5. V-T If you fling something into a particular place or position, you put it there in a quick or angry way. 扔 6. V-T If you fling yourself into a particular activity, you do it with a lot of enthusiasm and energy. 投身于 7. Fling can be used instead of "throw" in many expressions that usually contain "throw." 在许多短语中可以替代(throw) 8. N-COUNT If two people have a fling, they have a brief sexual relationship. 短暂的风流韵事 [非正式]
1. ADV If you manage to do something comfortably, you do it easily. 容易地 [ADV with v] 2. → see also comfortable
1. N-COUNT A protectionist is someone who agrees with and supports protectionism. 贸易保护主义者 [商业] 2. ADJ Protectionist policies, measures, and laws are meant to stop or reduce imports. 贸易保护主义的 [商业]

1. V-T If you haul something which is heavy or difficult to move, you move it using a lot of effort. (用力地) 拉 2. V-T If someone is hauled before a court or someone in authority, they are made to appear before them because they are accused of having done something wrong. 传讯 [usu passive] 3. PHRASAL VERB Haul up means the same as . 传讯 4. N-COUNT A haul is a quantity of things that are stolen, or a quantity of stolen or illegal goods found by police or customs. 一次偷得之量; (警察或海关) 一次查获之量 5. PHRASE If you say that a task or a journey is a long haul, you mean that it takes a long time and a lot of effort. 费时费力的工作 6. → see also long-haul
1. ADJ A hacking cough is a dry, painful cough with a harsh, unpleasant sound. 干涩、疼痛而又很不舒服的(咳嗽声) [ADJ n] → see also hack
1. N-COUNT A portrait is a painting, drawing, or photograph of a particular person. 画像; 像片 2. N-COUNT A portrait of a person, place, or thing is a verbal description of them. 文字描述 [usu N of n]

1. ADV Squarely means directly or in the middle, rather than indirectly or at an angle. 垂直正对地; 正中地 [ADV with v] 2. ADV If something such as blame or responsibility lies squarely with someone, they are definitely the person responsible. 明确地 [ADV with v]
n. 证书；凭据；国书
1. N-COUNT A district is a particular area of a town or country. 地区

1. V-T If you cite something, you quote it or mention it, especially as an example or proof of what you are saying. 引用 [正式] 2. V-T To cite a person means to officially name them in a legal case. To cite a reason or cause means to state it as the official reason for your case. 引证 3. V-T If someone is cited, they are officially ordered to appear before a court. 传讯 [美国英语] [法律] [usu passive] 4. V-T If a judge cites someone, he or she officially names them in a critical way in court. 指控 [美国英语] [法律]
1. ADV If something happened or was true formerly, it happened or was true in the past. 以前
敬酒；举杯

1. N-VAR A myth is a well-known story which was made up in the past to explain natural events or to justify religious beliefs or social customs. 神话 2. N-VAR If you describe a belief or explanation as a myth, you mean that many people believe it but it is actually untrue. 谬见

1. V-RECIP If you embrace someone, you put your arms around them and hold them tightly, usually in order to show your love or affection for them. You can also say that two people embrace. 拥抱 2. N-COUNT Embrace is also a noun. 拥抱 3. V-T If you embrace a change, political system, or idea, you accept it and start supporting it or believing in it. 欣然接受; 信奉 [正式] 4. N-SING Embrace is also a noun. 欣然接受; 信奉 5. V-T If something embraces a group of people, things, or ideas, it includes them in a larger group or category. 囊括 [正式] 6. V to commit or attempt to commit embracery against (a jury, etc) 笼络(陪审员等) [criminal law]
1. N-COUNT A commissioner is an important official in a government department or other organization. (政府部门等的) 重要官员
adv. 宽松地；放荡地；轻率地

1. ADJ Voluntary actions or activities are done because someone chooses to do them and not because they have been forced to do them. 自愿的 2. voluntarily ADV 自愿地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ Voluntary work is done by people who are not paid for it, but who do it because they want to do it. 义务的 4. ADJ A voluntary organization is controlled and organized by the people who have chosen to work for it, often without being paid, rather than receiving help or money from the government. 志愿的 [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A rumble is a low, continuous noise. 隆隆声 2. V-I If a vehicle rumbles somewhere, it moves slowly forward while making a low, continuous noise. 轰隆着缓慢行进 3. V-I If something rumbles, it makes a low, continuous noise. 隆隆作响 4. V-I If your stomach rumbles, it makes a vibrating noise, usually because you are hungry. (肚子因饥饿) 发咕咕声
1. V-T If you curtail something, you reduce or limit it. 缩减 [正式]
1. N-COUNT A forum is a place, situation, or group in which people exchange ideas and discuss issues, especially important public issues. 论坛

1. N-VAR A hierarchy is a system of organizing people into different ranks or levels of importance, for example in society or in a company. 等级制度 2. N-COUNT-COLL The hierarchy of an organization is the group of people who manage and control it. 统治集团
1. N-UNCOUNT Hostility is unfriendly or aggressive behaviour toward people or ideas. 敌意; 敌对 2. N-UNCOUNT Your hostility to something you do not approve of is your opposition to it. 反对
n. 起点；边远地区，世界尽头；文明终结
1. V-T/V-I If something alters or if you alter it, it changes. 更改

1. N-VAR A muscle is a piece of tissue inside your body that connects two bones and which you use when you make a movement. 肌肉 2. N-UNCOUNT If you say that someone has muscle, you mean that they have power and influence, which enables them to do difficult things. 影响力 3. PHRASE If a group, organization, or country flexes its muscles, it does something to impress or frighten people, in order to show them that it has power and is considering using it. 显示实力 4. PHRASE If you say that someone did not move a muscle, you mean that they stayed absolutely still. 动一下

1. N-COUNT The different elements of something are the different parts it contains. 组成部分 2. N-COUNT A particular element of a situation, activity, or process is an important quality or feature that it has or needs. 要素; 特点 3. N-COUNT When you talk about elements within a society or organization, you are referring to groups of people who have similar aims, beliefs, or habits. (具有相似目标、信仰或者习惯的) 群体; 分子 4. N-COUNT If something has an element of a particular quality or emotion, it has a certain amount of this quality or emotion. 成分 5. N-COUNT An element is a substance such as gold, oxygen, or carbon that consists of only one type of atom. 元素 6. N-COUNT The element in an electric or water heater is the metal part that changes the electric current into heat. 电阻丝 7. N-PLURAL You can refer to the weather, especially wind and rain, as the elements. 天气 (尤指风雨) 8. PHRASE If you say that someone is in their element, you mean that they are in a situation they enjoy. 如鱼得水

1. ADJ An incoming message or phone call is one that you receive. (短信、邮件等) 进来的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ An incoming plane or passenger is one that is arriving at a place. (飞机、旅客等) 正到达的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ An incoming official or government is one that has just been appointed or elected. 新任的 [ADJ n]

1. ADJ You use defensive to describe things that are intended to protect someone or something. 防御性的; 防卫用的 2. ADJ Someone who is defensive is behaving in a way that shows they feel unsure or threatened. 自卫的 3. defensively ADV 自卫地 4. ADJ In sports, defensive play is play that is intended to prevent your opponent from scoring points against you. 防守的 5. defensively ADV 防守地 [ADV after v] 6. PHRASE If someone is on the defensive, they are trying to protect themselves or their interests because they feel unsure or threatened. 采取防卫措施

1. N-UNCOUNT Leisure is the time when you are not working and you can relax and do things that you enjoy. 空闲时间 2. PHRASE If someone does something at leisure or at their leisure, they enjoy themselves by doing it when they want to, without hurrying. 悠闲地
n. 形式发票；备考报表；循例；估价单；预计报表；拟制报表 adj. 形式上的，预计的
1. N-UNCOUNT If people or things are in disarray, they are disorganized and confused. 混乱 2. N-UNCOUNT If things or places are in disarray, they are in a very disorganized state. 凌乱
1. ADJ If you become embroiled in a fight or argument, you become deeply involved in it. 使卷入的 [v-link ADJ]

1. V-T To crush something means to press it very hard so that its shape is destroyed or so that it breaks into pieces. 压扁; 压碎 2. V-T To crush a protest or movement, or a group of opponents, means to defeat it completely, usually by force. 镇压 3. crushing N-UNCOUNT 镇压 4. V-T If you are crushed by something, it upsets you a great deal. 使精神崩溃 [usu passive] 5. V-T If you are crushed against someone or something, you are pushed or pressed against them. (与某人或某物) 挤在一起 [usu passive] 6. N-COUNT A crush is a crowd of people close together, in which it is difficult to move. 拥挤的人群 7. N-COUNT If you have a crush on someone, you are in love with them but do not have a relationship with them. 暗恋 [非正式] 8. N-COUNT a construction designed to confine and limit the movement of an animal, esp a large or dangerous animal, for examination or to perform a procedure on it 猛兽隔离区 [vet science]

1. N-COUNT A gesture is a movement that you make with a part of your body, especially your hands, to express emotion or information. 手势 2. N-COUNT A gesture is something that you say or do in order to express your attitude or intentions, often something that you know will not have much effect. 姿态; 表示 3. V-I If you gesture, you use movements of your hands or head in order to tell someone something or draw their attention to something. 打手势; 用动作示意

1. V-I If you cling to someone or something, you hold onto them tightly. 紧紧抓住 2. V-I If someone clings to a position or a possession they have, they do everything they can to keep it even though this may be very difficult. 固守
1. N-COUNT A showpiece is something that is admired because it is the best thing of its type, especially something that is intended to be impressive. 展示的样品

1. ADJ An indirect result or effect is not caused immediately and obviously by a thing or person, but happens because of something else that they have done. 间接的 2. indirectly ADV 间接地 3. ADJ An indirect route or journey does not use the shortest or easiest way between two places. 迂回的 4. ADJ Indirect remarks and information suggest something or refer to it, without actually mentioning it or stating it clearly. 拐弯抹角的 5. indirectly ADV 拐弯抹角地 [ADV with v]
n. 纳粹；纳粹党人（nazi的复数）

1. N-COUNT A concierge is an employee of a hotel who assists guests. 旅馆服务员 2. N-COUNT A concierge is a person, especially in France, who takes care of an apartment house and decides who can enter the building. (法国的)看门人
1. N-VAR A country's heritage is all the qualities, traditions, or features of life there that have continued over many years and have been passed on from one generation to another. 遗产; 传统
1. ADJ Shiny things are bright and reflect light. 闪亮的
1. N-VAR Clover is a small plant with pink or white ball-shaped flowers and usually three round leaves. 三叶草

1. ADV When someone goes forth from a place, they leave it. 离开 [文学性] [ADV after v] 2. ADV If one thing brings forth another, the first thing produces the second. (得) 出来 [文学性] [ADV after v] 3. ADV When someone or something is brought forth, they are brought to a place or moved into a position where people can see them. (带) 出来 [文学性] [ADV after v] 4. back and forth →see back 5. to hold forth →see hold

1. V-T If you pour a liquid or other substance, you make it flow steadily out of a container by holding the container at an angle. 倒 (液体等) 2. V-T If you pour someone a drink, you put some of the drink in a cup or glass so that they can drink it. (给某人) 倒 (一杯饮料) 3. V-I When a liquid or other substance pours somewhere, for example, through a hole, it flows quickly and in large quantities. 喷涌 4. V-I When it rains very heavily, you can say that it is pouring. (雨) 倾盆而下 [usu cont] 5. V-I If people pour into or out of a place, they go there quickly and in large numbers. (人) 大量涌至 6. V-I If something such as information pours into a place, a lot of it is obtained or given. (信息等) 大量涌至 7. to pour cold water on something →see water

1. PREP Something that is beneath another thing is under the other thing. 在…之下 2. ADV Beneath is also an adverb. 在下方 3. PREP If you talk about what is beneath the surface of something, you are talking about the aspects of it which are hidden or not obvious. 在 (表面) 之下 4. PREP If you say that someone or something is beneath you, you feel that they are not good enough for you or not suitable for you. 不如; 配不上
1. N a means of attaching one thing to another, as a pipe to a wall, slate to a roof, etc 固着
1. N-COUNT A multiplex is a cinema complex with several screens. 多映厅影院

1. N-COUNT A bull is a male animal of the cow family. 公牛 2. N-COUNT Some other male animals, including elephants and whales, are called bulls. 巨大的雄性动物 3. N-COUNT In the stock market, bulls are people who buy shares in expectation of a price rise, in order to make a profit by selling the shares again after a short time. Compare bear. (股票市场上) 买空的人 [商业] 4. N-COUNT In the Roman Catholic church, a papal bull is an official statement on a particular subject that is issued by the pope. 教皇训谕 5. N-UNCOUNT If you say that something is bull or a load of bull, you mean that it is complete nonsense or absolutely untrue. 胡说八道 [非正式] 6. ADJ male; masculine 男性的; 雄性的 7. V to raise or attempt to raise the price or prices of (a stock market or a security) by speculative buying (通过投机)推高股价
1. ADV at the weekend, esp regularly or during every weekend 在周未; 每周未地 [非正式]
1. ADJ Optical devices, processes, and effects involve or relate to vision, light, or images. 视力的; 光学的

1. N-COUNT An anemone is a garden plant with red, purple, or white flowers. 银莲花 2. N-COUNT An anemone or a sea anemone is a small creature with brightly-coloured tentacles that lives at the bottom of the sea. 海葵

1. V-T To harm a person or animal means to cause them physical injury, usually on purpose. (故意地) 伤害 2. N-UNCOUNT Harm is physical injury to a person or an animal which is usually caused on purpose. (故意的) 伤害 3. V-T To harm a thing, or sometimes a person, means to damage them or make them less effective or successful than they were. 损害 4. N-UNCOUNT Harm is the damage to something which is caused by a particular course of action. 损害 5. PHRASE If you say it does no harm to do something or there is no harm in doing something, you mean that it might be worth doing, and you will not be blamed for doing it. 不妨 (做某事) 6. PHRASE If someone or something is out of harm's way, they are in a safe place away from danger or from the possibility of being damaged. 免于伤害 7. PHRASE If you say that there is no harm done, you are telling someone not to worry about something that has happened because it has not caused any serious injury or damage. 没有造成伤害 (或损害) 8. PHRASE If you say that someone or something will come to no ha
比喻一件事情“未如原先预期”或“搞砸了”

1. N-MASS Cotton is a type of cloth made from soft fibres from a particular plant. 棉布 2. N-UNCOUNT Cotton is a plant which is grown in warm countries and which produces soft fibres used in making cotton cloth. 棉花 3. N-UNCOUNT Cotton or absorbent cotton is a soft mass of cotton, used especially for applying liquids or creams to your skin. 脱脂棉; 药棉 [美国英语] 4. N-MASS Cotton is thread that is used for sewing, especially thread that is made from cotton. 棉线 [英国英语]
1. N-COUNT A sled is the same as a . 雪橇 [美国英语] 2. V-I If you sled or go sledding, you ride on a sled. 乘雪橇 [美国英语]
1. N-UNCOUNT Footage of a particular event is a film of it or the part of a film which shows this event. (描述某一事件的) 片段镜头
1. ADJ → same as gnarled
1. ADJ Geopolitical means relating to or concerned with geopolitics. 地缘政治学的 [usu ADJ n]
1. ADV Decidedly means to a great extent and in a way that is very obvious. 明确地 [ADV group]
1. ADJ If something is situated in a particular place or position, it is in that place or position. 坐落于…的; 位于…的

1. ADJ A dramatic change or event happens suddenly and is very noticeable and surprising. 突然引人注目的 2. dramatically ADV 突然引人注目地 3. ADJ A dramatic action, event, or situation is exciting and impressive. 紧张刺激的; 扣人心弦的 4. dramatically ADV 戏剧性地 5. ADJ You use dramatic to describe things connected with or relating to the theatre, drama, or plays. 戏剧的; 有关戏剧的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A shredder is a machine for shredding things such as documents, food, or parts of bushes or trees that have been cut off. 切碎机

1. N a blunt weapon, often made of hard rubber; bludgeon (硬橡胶制)钝武器; 大头短棒 2. V to hit with such a weapon, esp on the head 用短棒击(头) 1. N hyperbolic cosine; a hyperbolic function, cosh z = (e + e), related to cosine by the expression cosh iz = cos z, where i = √–1 返回数的双曲线余弦
1. ADJ Robotic equipment can perform certain tasks automatically. 自动操作的 [ADJ n]

1. N-PLURAL The demographics of a place or society are the statistics relating to the people who live there. 人口统计数据 2. N-SING In business, a demographic is a group of people in a society, especially people in a particular age group. 特定年龄段的人口 [商业]

1. N-MASS Fabric is cloth or other material produced by weaving together cotton, nylon, wool, silk, or other threads. Fabrics are used for making things such as clothes, curtains, and sheets. 织物 2. N-SING The fabric of a society or system is its basic structure, with all the customs and beliefs that make it work successfully. (社会或系统的) 结构
1. N-PLURAL Viscera are the large organs inside the body, such as the heart, liver, and stomach. 内脏 [医学]

1. V-T If you repair something that has been damaged or is not working properly, you fix it. 修理; 修补; 整修 2. repairer N-COUNT 修理工 3. V-T If you repair a relationship or someone's reputation after it has been damaged, you do something to improve it. 弥补; 补救 4. N-VAR A repair is something that you do to mend a machine, building, piece of clothing, or other thing that has been damaged or is not working properly. 修理; 修补; 整修 5. V to go (to a place) 去; 往(某地) 6. N the act of going or returning 往返

1. N-VAR A wire is a long thin piece of metal that is used to fasten things or to carry electric current. (用以绑东西或导电的) 金属丝 2. N-COUNT A wire is a cable that carries power or signals from one place to another. 电线; 电缆 3. V-T If you wire something such as a building or piece of equipment, you put wires inside it so that electricity or signals can pass into or through it. 在…里装设电线 4. PHRASAL VERB Wire up means the same as . 在…里装设电线 5. PHRASE If something goes to the wire, it continues until the last possible moment. 直至最后一刻 [journalism] 6. → see also barbed wire

1. PHRASE If you do something on someone's behalf, you do it for that person as their representative. 代表 2. PHRASE If you feel, for example, embarrassed or angry on someone's behalf, you feel embarrassed or angry for them. 替某人 (感到害羞、愤怒等)
n. 中立；中性；中立立场
1. N → the us spelling of kerbing

1. ADV If you say that ideally a particular thing should happen or be done, you mean that this is what you would like to happen or be done, but you know that this may not be possible or practical. 作为理想的做法 [ADV with cl/group] 2. ADV If you say that someone or something is ideally suited, ideally located, or ideally qualified, you mean that they are as well suited, located, or qualified as they could possibly be. 完美地

1. V-T/V-I If someone boasts about something that they have done or that they own, they talk about it very proudly, in a way that other people may find irritating or offensive. 吹嘘 [表不满] 2. N-COUNT Boast is also a noun. 吹嘘 3. V-T If someone or something can boast a particular achievement or possession, they have achieved or possess that thing. 取得 (成功); 拥有 4. V to shape or dress (stone) roughly with a broad chisel 凿(石头) 5. N a stroke in which the ball is hit on to one of the side walls before hitting the front wall 弧线击球 6. V to hit (the ball) in this way or make such a stroke 击弧线(球)
1. Repaid is the past tense and past participle of . (repay)的过去式和过去分词
伦理规章
1. N-UNCOUNT The secession of a region or group from the country or larger group to which it belongs is the action of formally becoming separate. (从国家或大集团中正式的)脱离

1. V-T/V-I If something hard cracks, or if you crack it, it becomes slightly damaged, with lines appearing on its surface. 使…破裂; 破裂 2. V-T/V-I If something cracks, or if you crack it, it makes a sharp sound like the sound of a piece of wood breaking. 使…噼啪作响; 发出辟裂声 3. V-T If you crack a hard part of your body, such as your knee or your head, you hurt it by accidentally hitting it hard against something. 撞击 4. V-T When you crack something that has a shell, such as an egg or a nut, you break the shell in order to reach the inside part. 叩开 5. V-T If you crack a problem or a code, you solve it, especially after a lot of thought. 破解 (难题、密码) 6. V-I If someone cracks, they lose control of their emotions or actions because they are under a lot of pressure. (精神) 垮掉 [非正式] 7. V-I If your voice cracks when you are speaking or singing, it changes in pitch because you are feeling a strong emotion. (嗓音) 突然变化 8. V-T If you crack a joke, you tell it. 说 (笑话) 1. N-COUNT A crack is a very narrow gap between two things,

1. N-COUNT A forecast is a statement of what is expected to happen in the future, especially in relation to a particular event or situation. 预报 2. V-T If you forecast future events, you say what you think is going to happen in the future. 预言 3. → see also weather forecast

1. ADJ If you describe something as posh, you mean that it is elegant, fashionable, and expensive. 时髦的; 豪华的 [非正式] 2. ADJ If you describe a person as posh, you mean that they belong to or behave as if they belong to the upper classes. 上流社会的; 看似上流社会的 [英国英语] [非正式]

1. ADJ A rhetorical question is one that is asked in order to make a statement rather than to get an answer. 修辞上的 (设问); 反问的 2. rhetorically ADV 修辞上地 (设问); 反问地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ Rhetorical language is intended to be grand and impressive. 词藻华丽的; 修辞性的 (语言) [正式] 4. rhetorically ADV 词藻华丽地; (语言) 修辞性地

1. N-VAR If you express or raise an objection to something, you say that you do not like it or agree with it. 反对 2. N-UNCOUNT If you say that you have no objection to something, you mean that you are not annoyed or bothered by it. 反对意见
1. N-COUNT A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something. (判断的) 标准
1. N-COUNT A treaty is a written agreement between countries in which they agree to do a particular thing or to help each other. 条约
1. INTERJ an expression of surprise 天啊！; 表示惊讶的表达 [OLD-FASHIONED, slang]
1. N-UNCOUNT Chlorine is a strong-smelling gas that is used to clean water and to make cleaning products. 氯气

1. V-T If you are confronted with a problem, task, or difficulty, you have to deal with it. 面临 (问题、任务、困难等) 2. V-T If you confront a difficult situation or issue, you accept the fact that it exists and try to deal with it. 正视 (困难局面或问题) 3. V-T If you are confronted by something that you find threatening or difficult to deal with, it is there in front of you. 面对 (有威胁或难处理的事物) [usu passive] 4. V-T If you confront someone, you stand or sit in front of them, especially when you are going to fight, argue, or compete with them. 与 (某人) 对峙 (尤指准备打斗、争论或竞争) 5. V-T If you confront someone with something, you present facts or evidence to them in order to accuse them of something or force them to deal with a situation. (以某事物) 与 (某人) 对质

1. N-COUNT A hybrid is an animal or plant that has been bred from two different species of animal or plant. 杂交种 [技术] 2. ADJ Hybrid is also an adjective. 杂交的 [ADJ n] 3. N-COUNT A hybrid or a hybrid car is a car that can be powered by either petrol or electricity. 混合动力汽车 4. N-COUNT You can use hybrid to refer to anything that is a mixture of other things, especially two other things. 混合物 5. ADJ Hybrid is also an adjective. 混合的 [ADJ n]

1. V-T If you withdraw something from a place, you remove it or take it away. 移开; 拿走 [正式] 2. V-T/V-I When groups of people such as troops withdraw or when someone withdraws them, they leave the place where they are fighting or where they are based and return nearer home. 使撤退; 撤退 3. V-T If you withdraw money from a bank account, you take it out of that account. (从银行) 取 (钱) 4. V-I If you withdraw from an activity or organization, you stop taking part in it. (从活动或组织中) 退出
vt. 在…获得成功，于…友好相处；继续干

1. N-UNCOUNT Defence is action that is taken to protect someone or something against attack. 保护; 防卫 2. N-UNCOUNT Defence is the organization of a country's armies and weapons, and their use to protect the country or its interests. 国防机构 3. N-PLURAL The defences of a country or region are all its armed forces and weapons. 防卫力量 4. N-COUNT A defence is something that people or animals can use or do to protect themselves. 防御物 5. N-COUNT A defence is something that you say or write which supports ideas or actions that have been criticized or questioned. 辩词 [oft N 'of' n, also 'in' N] 6. N-SING Thedefence is the case that is presented by a lawyer in a trial for the person who has been accused of a crime. You can also refer to this person's lawyers as the defence. (被告对指控的) 答辩; 被告律师 7. N-SING-COLL In games such as football or hockey, the defence is the group of players in a team who try to stop the opposing players from scoring a goal or a point. 防守队员 [oft poss N, also 'in' N] 8. PHRASE If you come to someone

1. N-UNCOUNT Rubbish consists of unwanted things or waste material such as used paper, empty cans and bottles, and waste food. 垃圾 [英国英语] 2. N-UNCOUNT If you think that something is of very poor quality, you can say that it is rubbish. 垃圾 (强调质量极差) [英国英语] [非正式] 3. V-T If you rubbish a person, their ideas or their work, you say they are of little value. 把…说得一文不值 [英国英语] [非正式]

1. V-T/V-I If you celebrate an occasion or if you celebrate, you do something enjoyable because of a special occasion or to mark someone's success. 庆祝 2. V-T If an organization or country is celebrating an anniversary, it has existed for that length of time and is doing something special because of it. 庆祝 (周年纪念日) 3. V-T When priests celebrate Holy Communion or Mass, they officially perform the actions and ceremonies that are involved. 主持 (圣餐或弥撒等宗教仪式)
1. ADV Vastly means to an extremely great degree or extent. 极其
1. N-COUNT A grower is a person who grows large quantities of a particular plant or crop in order to sell them. 种植者

1. N-COUNT A jet is an aircraft that is powered by jet engines. 喷气式飞机 [also 'by' N] 2. V-I If you jet somewhere, you travel there in a fast plane. 乘喷气式飞机前往 3. N-COUNT A jet of liquid or gas is a strong, fast, thin stream of it. 喷射流 4. V to issue or cause to issue in a jet 喷出; 使喷出 5. N a hard black variety of coal that takes a brilliant polish and is used for jewellery, ornaments, etc 黑玉 6. N (as modifier) 黑玉

1. ADV If you say that something normally happens or that you normally do a particular thing, you mean that it is what usually happens or what you usually do. 通常 2. ADV If you do something normally, you do it in the usual or conventional way. 按常规地 [ADV after v]

1. N-VAR A massacre is the killing of a large number of people at the same time in a violent and cruel way. 大屠杀 2. V-T If people are massacred, a large number of them are attacked and killed in a violent and cruel way. 大规模屠杀

1. ADJ Outgoing things such as planes, mail, and passengers are leaving or being sent somewhere. 往外去的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Someone who is outgoing is very friendly and likes meeting and talking to people. 友好的; 喜欢交际的 3. ADJ You use outgoing to describe a person in charge of something who is soon going to leave that position. 行将离职的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A reactor is the same as a . 核反应堆
1. N-COUNT Your pores are the tiny holes in your skin. 毛孔 2. V-I If you pore over or through information, you look at it and study it very carefully. 仔细研究

1. ADJ If you describe someone as middle-aged, you mean that they are neither young nor old. People between the ages of 40 and 60 are usually considered to be middle-aged. 中年的 2. ADJ If you describe someone's activities or interests as middle-aged, you are critical of them because you think they are typical of a middle-aged person, for example by being conventional or old-fashioned. 具有中年人特点的 (如保守、守旧) [表不满]
1. V-T If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it. 使着迷

1. ADV You use specifically to emphasize that something is given special attention and considered separately from other things of the same kind. 专门地 [ADV with v] [强调] 2. ADV You use specifically to add something more precise or exact to what you have already said. 更确切地说 [ADV with group] 3. ADV You use specifically to indicate that something has a restricted nature, as opposed to being more general in nature. 仅限地 [ADV adj] 4. ADV If you state or describe something specifically, you state or describe it precisely and clearly. 明确地 [ADV with v]
1. N-COUNT A correlation between things is a connection or link between them. 相互关系; 关联 [正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT Taste is one of the five senses that people have. When you have food or drink in your mouth, your sense of taste makes it possible for you to recognize what it is. 味觉 2.
