N-COUNT The taste of something is the individual quality that it has when you put it in your mouth and that distinguishes it from other things. For example, something may have a sweet, bitter, sour, or salty taste. 味道 3. N-SING If you have a taste of some food or drink, you try a small amount of it in order to see what the flavour is like. 尝 4. V-I If food or drink tastes of something, it has that particular flavour, which you notice when you eat or drink it. 有…味道 [no cont] 5. V-T If you taste some food or drink, you eat or drink a small amount of it in order to try its flavour, for example, to see if you like it or not. 品尝 6. V-T If you can taste something that you are eating or drinking, you are aware of its flavour. 尝出…味道 [no passive] 7. N-SING If you have a taste of a particular way of life or activity, you have a bri
别把我算在内
n. 事物（thing的复数形式）；用品；形势

1. N-COUNT Archives are a collection of documents and records that contain historical information. You can also use archives to refer to the place where archives are stored. 档案; 档案馆 2. ADJ Archive material is information that comes from archives. 记入档案的 [ADJ n] 3. V-T If you archive material such as documents or data, you store it in an archive. 把…存档

1. V-T If you wipe something, you rub its surface to remove dirt or liquid from it. 擦拭 2. N-COUNT Wipe is also a noun. 擦拭 3. V-T If you wipe dirt or liquid from something, you remove it by using a cloth or your hand. (用布或手) 擦去 4. N-COUNT A wipe is a small moist cloth for cleaning things and is designed to be used only once. 一次性湿巾

1. ADJ A situation that is volatile is likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly. 变化无常的 2. ADJ If someone is volatile, their mood often changes quickly. 情绪不稳定的 3. ADJ A volatile liquid or substance is one that will quickly change into a gas. 易挥发的 [技术]

1. V-T/V-I If someone integrates into a social group, or is integrated into it, they behave in such a way that they become part of the group or are accepted into it. 使融入; 结合在一起 2. integrated ADJ 融合的 3. V-T/V-I When races integrate or when schools and organizations are integrated, people who belong to ethnic minorities can join others in their schools and organizations. 使合并; 成为一体 [美国英语] 4. integrated ADJ (种族) 融合的 [ADJ n] 5. V-RECIP If you integrate one thing with another, or one thing integrates with another, the two things become closely linked or form part of a whole idea or system. You can also say that two things integrate. 结合 6. integrated ADJ 整体的

1. N-SING If you are at the cutting edge of a particular field of activity, you are involved in its most important or most exciting developments. 前沿 2. ADJ Cutting-edge techniques or equipment are the most advanced that there are in a particular field. 尖端的
1. N-UNCOUNT Espionage is the activity of finding out the political, military, or industrial secrets of your enemies or rivals by using spies. 间谍活动 [正式]

1. N-COUNT The characteristics of a person or thing are the qualities or features that belong to them and make them recognizable. 特征 2. ADJ A quality or feature that is characteristic of someone or something is one which is often seen in them and seems typical of them. 典型的 3. characteristically ADV 典型地
1. N-COUNT A mansion is a very large house. 大厦
adj. 无法支撑的；不可证实的；不能成立的
1. ADJ If something is located in a particular place, it is present or has been built there. 位于…的 [正式] [v-link ADJ prep, adv ADJ]
1. V-T If you postpone an event, you delay it or arrange for it to take place at a later time than was originally planned. 推迟

1. N-COUNT The circumstances of a particular situation are the conditions which affect what happens. 情形 2. N-PLURAL The circumstances of an event are the way it happened or the causes of it. 详情; 原委 3. N-PLURAL Your circumstances are the conditions of your life, especially the amount of money that you have. 境况 (尤指经济状况) 4. N-UNCOUNT Events and situations which cannot be controlled are sometimes referred to as circumstance. 命运; 客观环境 5. PHRASE You can emphasize that something must not or will not happen by saying that it must not or will not happen under any circumstances. 在任何情况下 [强调] 6. PHRASE You can use in the circumstances or under the circumstances before or after a statement to indicate that you have considered the conditions affecting the situation before making the statement. 在那种情况下

1. ADJ You use specific to refer to a particular exact area, problem, or subject. 特定的 (部位、问题、主题等) [ADJ n] 2. ADJ If someone is specific, they give a description that is precise and exact. You can also use specific to describe their description. 确切的 3. ADJ Something that is specific to a particular thing is connected with that thing only. 针对…的 4. COMB in ADJ Specific is also used after nouns. 针对…的 (用于名词后)

1. N-COUNT An enterprise is a company or business. 公司; 企业 [商业] 2. N-COUNT An enterprise is something new, difficult, or important that you do or try to do. 事业 3. N-UNCOUNT Enterprise is the activity of managing companies and businesses and starting new ones. 创业 [商业] 4. N-UNCOUNT Enterprise is the ability to think of new and effective things to do, together with an eagerness to do them. 开创力; 开拓精神 [表赞许]

1. N-UNCOUNT The provision of something is the act of giving it or making it available to people who need or want it. 提供 [also 'a' N] 2. N-VAR If you make provision for something that might happen or that might need to be done, you make arrangements to deal with it. 准备 3. N-UNCOUNT If you make provision for someone, you support them financially and make sure that they have the things that they need. 供给 [also N in pl, N 'for' n] 4. N-COUNT A provision in a law or an agreement is an arrangement which is included in it. 规定
1. ADV If you say that something has purportedly been done, you mean that you think that it has been done but you cannot be sure. 据称 [正式]
1. V-I If you embark on something new, difficult, or exciting, you start doing it. 开始从事 2. V-I When someone embarks on a ship, they go on board before the start of a journey. 登上 (船)
1. ADJ If you describe an amount or quantity of something as meagre, you are critical of it because it is very small or not enough. 数量很少的 [表不满]

1. V-T If you flip a device on or off, or if you flip a switch, you turn it on or off by pressing the switch quickly. 快速地按动 (装置或开关) 2. V-I If you flip through the pages of a book, for example, you quickly turn over the pages in order to find a particular one or to get an idea of the contents. 快速翻阅 3. V-T/V-I If something flips over, or if you flip it over or into a different position, it moves or is moved into a different position. 翻动 4. V-T If you flip something, especially a coin, you use your thumb to make it turn over and over, as it goes through the air. 投掷 (尤指硬币)
谴责，控告

1. V-T If you revisit a place, you return there for a visit after you have been away for a long time, often after the place has changed a lot. 重游 2. V-T If you revisit a subject or topic, you discuss it again or consider it again. 重新讨论; 重新考虑

1. N-COUNT A preface is an introduction at the beginning of a book that explains what the book is about or why it was written. 前言 2. V-T If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first. 说…作为开场白; 做…作为开始

1. N-UNCOUNT Mandarin is the official language of China. (中国)普通话 2. N-COUNT A mandarin or a mandarin orange is a small orange whose skin comes off easily. 柑橘 3. N-COUNT A mandarin was, in former times, an important government official in China. (旧中国的)官员
1. V-T If you dissuade someone from doing or believing something, you persuade them not to do or believe it. 劝阻 [正式]
1. ADJ A sequestered place is quiet and far away from busy places. 幽静的; 与世隔绝的 [文学性]

1. V-T If a child outgrows a piece of clothing, they grow bigger, so that it no longer fits them. 长大而穿不下 (衣服) 2. V-T If you outgrow a particular way of behaving or thinking, you change and become more mature, so that you no longer behave or think in that way. 长大而不再具有
1. N-COUNT A leftist is someone who supports the ideas of the political left. 左派分子

1. N a direct marketing technique in which a company persuades internet users to forward its publicity material in e-mails (usually by including jokes, games, video clips, etc) 病毒式营销(公司使互联网用户转发带有其宣传资料邮件的一种直接营销方式，邮件内容有笑话、游戏、视频等)
1. N-COUNT Thepope is the head of the Roman Catholic Church. 罗马天主教教皇 [usu 'the' N; N-TITLE] 2. N → another name for ruffe

1. N-UNCOUNT Pop is modern music that usually has a strong rhythm and uses electronic equipment. 流行乐 2. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to carbonated drinks such as cola as pop. 碳酸饮料 [英国英语] [非正式] 3. N-COUNT/SOUND Pop is used to represent a short sharp sound such as the sound made by bursting a balloon or by pulling a cork out of a bottle. 爆裂声 4. V-I If something pops, it makes a short sharp sound. 发爆裂声 5. ADV with a popping sound 砰的一声地; 啪的一声地 6. INTERJ an exclamation denoting a sharp explosive sound (感叹词，表示)砰的爆炸声 7. V-I If your eyes pop, you look very surprised or excited when you see something. (因惊讶或兴奋而)睁大眼 [非正式] 8. V-T If you pop something somewhere, you put it there quickly. 迅速放置 [非正式] 9. N-FAMILY Some people call their father pop. 爸爸 [美国英语] [非正式] 10. to pop the question →see question
1. N-COUNT A newcomer is a person who has recently arrived in a place, joined an organization, or started a new activity. 新来的人
1. V-T If you exhort someone to do something, you try hard to persuade or encourage them to do it. 劝告; 勉励 [正式] 2. exhortation N-VAR

1. N-COUNT Rebels are people who are fighting against their own country's army in order to change the political system there. 反叛者 2. N-COUNT Politicians who oppose some of their own party's policies can be referred to as rebels. (政党内部的) 反对者 3. V-I If politicians rebel against one of their own party's policies, they show that they oppose it. (因不同政见) 反对 4. N-COUNT You can say that someone is a rebel if you think that they behave differently from other people and have rejected the values of society or of their parents. 叛逆者 5. V-I When someone rebels, they start to behave differently from other people and reject the values of society or of their parents. 叛逆
同样地；本身；就其本身而论
1. N-UNCOUNT Hegemony is a situation in which one country, organization, or group has more power, control, or importance than others. 霸权 [正式]
1. ADJ An autocratic person or organization has complete power and makes decisions without asking anyone else's advice. 独裁的 [usu ADJ n]

1. N-PLURAL Pickles are vegetables or fruit, sometimes cut into pieces, which have been kept in vinegar or salt water for a long time so that they have a strong, sharp taste. 泡菜 2. N-MASS Pickle is a cold spicy sauce with pieces of vegetables and fruit in it. 泡菜酱 3. V-T When you pickle food, you keep it in vinegar or salt water so that it does not go bad and it develops a strong, sharp taste. 腌制

1. N-SING-COLL The majority of people or things in a group is more than half of them. 多数 2. PHRASE If a group is in a majority or in the majority, they form more than half of a larger group. 占多数 3. N-COUNT A majority is the difference between the number of votes or seats in a legislature or parliament that the winner gets in an election, and the number of votes or seats that the next person or party gets. 多得的票数; 多获得的席位 4. ADJ Majority is used to describe opinions, decisions, and systems of government that are supported by more than half the people involved. 多数人支持的 [ADJ n] 5. N-UNCOUNT Majority is the state of legally being an adult. In most states in the United States, people reach their majority at the age of eighteen. 成年
1. N any solitary freshwater hydroid coelenterate of the genus Hydra, in which the body is a slender polyp with tentacles around the mouth 水螅

1. V-T If you distrust someone or something, you think they are not honest, reliable, or safe. 不信任 2. N-UNCOUNT Distrust is the feeling of doubt that you have toward someone or something you distrust. 怀疑 [also 'a' N, oft N 'of' n]
1. N-UNCOUNT Plutonium is a radioactive element used especially in nuclear weapons and as a fuel in nuclear power stations. 钚 (一种放射性元素)

1. ADJ Downtown places are in or toward the centre of a large town or city, where the stores and places of business are. 市中心的 [美国英语] [ADJ n] 2. ADV Downtown is also an adverb. 在市中心 3. N-UNCOUNT Downtown is also a noun. 市中心 [oft 'the' N]

1. V-T If you restrict something, you put a limit on it in order to reduce it or prevent it from becoming too great. 限制 2. restriction N-UNCOUNT 限制 3. V-T To restrict the movement or actions of someone or something means to prevent them from moving or acting freely. 限制 4. restriction N-UNCOUNT 限制 5. V-T If you restrict someone or their activities to one thing, they can only do, have, or deal with that thing. If you restrict them to one place, they cannot go anywhere else. 限制 (在某范围) 6. V-T If you restrict something to a particular group, only that group can do it or have it. If you restrict something to a particular place, it is allowed only in that place. 限定

1. N-COUNT A capitol is a government building in which a state legislature meets. 州议会大厦 [美国英语] 2. N-PROPER The Capitol is the government building in Washington, D.C., in which the U.S. Congress meets. 美国国会大厦 [美国英语] ['the' N]
1. N-UNCOUNT Aluminium is a lightweight metal used, for example, for making cooking equipment and aircraft parts. 铝
1. N-COUNT A progression is a gradual development from one state to another. (从一状态到另一状态的) 逐步发展
1. N-COUNT In former times, serfs were a class of people who had to work on a particular person's land and could not leave without that person's permission. 农奴
1. N-COUNT If there is a shortfall in something, there is less of it than you need. 不足
1. ADJ If you say that something is imminent, especially something unpleasant, you mean it is almost certain to happen very soon. (尤指不好的事情) 即将发生的

1. N-COUNT If you describe a question or decision as a no-brainer, you mean that it is a very easy one to answer or make. 非常容易的问题; 容易作的决定 [非正式] 2. N-COUNT If you describe a person or action as a no-brainer, you mean that they are stupid. 愚蠢的人(或行为) [美国英语] [非正式]

1. N-COUNT A chapter is one of the parts that a book is divided into. Each chapter has a number, and sometimes a title. 章 [also N num] 2. N-COUNT A chapter in someone's life or in history is a period of time during which a major event or series of related events takes place. (事件发生的) 时期 [书面]

1. PHRASAL VERB If a changing number or amount levels off or levels out, it stops increasing or decreasing at such a fast speed. 趋向稳定 2. PHRASAL VERB If an aircraft levels off or levels out, it travels horizontally after having been travelling in an upward or downward direction. (飞机在爬升或俯冲后) 水平飞行

1. V-I When something broadens, it becomes wider. 变宽 2. V-T/V-I When you broaden something such as your experience or popularity, or when it broadens, the number of things or people that it includes becomes greater. 扩宽; 开阔

1. N-COUNT A catalogue is a list of things such as the goods you can buy from a particular company, the objects in a museum, or the books in a library. 目录 2. N-COUNT A catalogue of similar things, especially bad things, is a number of them considered or discussed one after another. 一连串 (尤指不幸的事)
1. N-COUNT A malady is an illness or disease. 疾病 [老式] 2. N-COUNT In written English, people sometimes use maladies to refer to serious problems in a society or situation. 固疾; 弊病
1. N-UNCOUNT Dexterity is skill in using your hands, or sometimes your mind. (手或心思)灵巧
1. N-UNCOUNT If a group of people show solidarity, they show support for each other or for another group, especially in political or international affairs. 团结一致; 相互支持

1. V-T If you declare that something is true, you say that it is true in a firm, deliberate way. You can also declare an attitude or intention. 声明; 表明 [书面] 2. V-T If you declare something, you state officially and formally that it exists or is the case. 宣告 3. V-T If you declare goods that you have bought in another country or money that you have earned, you say how much you have bought or earned so that you can pay tax on it. 申报 (在国外所购之物或收入等)

1. V-T/V-I If you differentiate between things or if you differentiate one thing from another, you recognize or show the difference between them. 区分 2. V-T A quality or feature that differentiates one thing from another makes the two things different. 使有差别 3. differentiation N-UNCOUNT 差别
n. 盖理

1. ADJ Something that is nasty is very unpleasant to see, experience, or feel. 可恶的 (事物) 2. nastiness N-UNCOUNT 可恶 3. ADJ If you describe a person or their behaviour as nasty, you mean that they behave in an unkind and unpleasant way. 可恶的 (人或行为) 4. nastily ADV 厌恶地 [ADV after v] 5. ADJ If you describe something as nasty, you mean it is unattractive, undesirable, or in bad taste. 低俗可厌的 (事物) 6. ADJ A nasty problem or situation is very worrisome and difficult to deal with. 难对付的 (问题、情况等) 7. ADJ If you describe an injury or a disease as nasty, you mean that it is serious or looks unpleasant. (伤、疾病等) 严重的
1. N-COUNT A pond is a small area of water that is smaller than a lake. Ponds are often made artificially. 池塘 2. N-SING People sometimes refer to the Atlantic Ocean as the pond. 大西洋 [journalism]

1. V-T If you imply that something is the case, you say something that indicates that it is the case in an indirect way. 暗指 2. V-T If an event or situation implies that something is the case, it makes you think that it is the case. 意味着

1. ADJ Stark choices or statements are harsh and unpleasant. 严酷的 2. starkly ADV 严酷地 3. ADJ If two things are in stark contrast to one another, they are very different from each other in a way that is very obvious. (对比) 鲜明的 4. starkly ADV 鲜明地 5. ADJ Something that is stark is very plain in appearance. 普通的 6. starkly ADV 普通地
n. 爆发，喷发；火山灰；出疹

1. V-T/V-I When you recall something, you remember it and tell others about it. 记起; 回忆道 2. N-UNCOUNT Recall is the ability to remember something that has happened in the past or the act of remembering it. 记忆力; 回忆 3. V-T If you are recalled to your home, country, or the place where you work, you are ordered to return there. 召回 (某人) 4. N-SING Recall is also a noun. 召回 5. V-T If a company recalls a product, it asks the stores or the people who have bought that product to return it because there is something wrong with it. 召回 (产品) 6. N-COUNT Recall is also a noun. 召回

1. ADJ If you describe someone as incompetent, you are criticizing them because they are unable to do their job or a task properly. 无能的; 不称职的 [表不满] 2. N-COUNT An incompetent is someone who is incompetent. 无能的人; 不称职者
1. N-COUNT The detractors of a person or thing are people who criticize that person or thing. 诋毁者 [journalism] [usu pl, usu with poss]
n. [计] 实现；履行；安装启用

1. N-COUNT A pocket is a kind of small bag that forms part of a piece of clothing, and that is used for carrying small things such as money or a handkerchief. 衣兜 2. N-COUNT You can use pocket in a lot of different ways to refer to money that people have, get, or spend. For example, if someone gives or pays a lot of money, you can say that they dig deep into their pocket. If you approve of something because it is very cheap to buy, you can say that it suits people's pockets. 财力 3. ADJ You use pocket to describe something that is small enough to fit into a pocket, often something that is a smaller version of a larger item. 袖珍的 [ADJ n] 4. N-COUNT A pocket of something is a small area where something is happening, or a small area which has a particular quality, and which is different from the other areas around it. (与周围区域不同或孤立的) 小块地区 5. V-T If someone who is in possession of something valuable such as a sum of money pockets it, they steal it or take it for themselves, even though it does not belong to them.
abbr. （美国）全国大学生体育协会（National Collegiate Athletic Association）

1. V-T If you acquire something, you buy or obtain it for yourself, or someone gives it to you. 获得 [正式] 2. V-T If you acquire something such as a skill or a habit, you learn it, or develop it through your daily life or experience. 习得 3. V-T If someone or something acquires a certain reputation, they start to have that reputation. 获得 (名声)
1. N-COUNT A warehouse is a large building where raw materials or manufactured goods are stored until they are exported to other countries or distributed to stores to be sold. 仓库; 货栈
1. ADJ If you describe something as misleading, you mean that it gives you a wrong idea or impression. 误导性的 2. misleadingly ADV 误导性地

1. N-COUNT A commentator is a broadcaster who gives a radio or television commentary on an event. (电台或电视的) 解说员 2. N-COUNT A commentator is also someone who often writes or broadcasts about a particular subject. 评论员
adv. 残酷地，无情地
1. N-UNCOUNT Algebra is a type of mathematics in which letters are used to represent possible quantities. 代数

1. ADV Fairly means to quite a large degree. For example, if you say that something is fairly old, you mean that it is old but not very old. 在很大程度上 [ADV adj/adv] 2. ADV You use fairly instead of "very" to add emphasis to an adjective or adverb without making it sound too forceful. 相当 [ADV adj/adv] [含糊] 3. → see also fair
1. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES A cove is a part of a coast where the land curves inward so that the sea is partly enclosed. 小海湾 2. N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES a fellow; chap 家伙; 小伙子 [英国英语] [OLD-FASHIONED, slang]

1. V-I When a child or young animal matures, it becomes an adult. (小孩、幼崽) 发育成熟 2. V-I When something matures, it reaches a state of complete development. (某物) 长成 3. V-I If someone matures, they become more fully developed in their personality and emotional behaviour. 成熟 4. ADJ If you describe someone as mature, you think that they are fully developed and balanced in their personality and emotional behaviour. 成熟的 [表赞许] 5. V-T/V-I If something such as wine or cheese matures or is matured, it is left for a time to allow its full flavour or strength to develop. 使酿熟; 酿成 6. ADJ Mature cheese or wine has been left for a time to allow its full flavour or strength to develop. 酿熟的 7. V-I When an investment such as an insurance policy or bond matures, it reaches the stage when the company pays you back the money you have saved, and the interest your money has earned. (保险单、债券等) 到期 [商业] 8. ADJ If you say that someone is mature or of mature years, you are saying politely that they are middle-aged or old. 成年的 (中年和老
n. 耶基斯（姓氏）

1. ADJ Something that is unaccountable does not seem to have any sensible explanation. 难以解释的 [usu ADJ n] 2. unaccountably 3. ADJ If you describe a person or organization as unaccountable, you are critical of them because they are not responsible to anyone for their actions, or do not feel they have to explain their actions to anyone. 无解释责任的; 不担负责任的 [表不满]

1. N-COUNT A pedestrian is a person who is walking, especially in a town or city, rather than travelling in a vehicle. 行人 2. ADJ If you describe something as pedestrian, you mean that it is ordinary and not at all interesting. 平庸乏味的 [表不满]

1. ADJ You use prospective to describe someone who wants to be the thing mentioned or who is likely to be the thing mentioned. 预期的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You use prospective to describe something that is likely to happen soon. 可能很快发生的 [ADJ n]
n. 公司；合并，编入；团体组织

1. ADJ Your inward thoughts or feelings are the ones that you do not express or show to other people. 内心的 [ADJ n] 2. inwardly ADV 内心地 3. ADJ An inward movement is one toward the inside or centre of something. 向内的 [ADJ n] 4. ADV If something moves or faces inward, it moves or faces toward the inside or centre of something. 向内地 [ADV after v]

1. N-COUNT The shores or the shore of a sea, lake, or wide river is the land along the edge of it. Someone who is on shore is on the land rather than on a ship. 岸 [also prep N] 2. N a prop, post, or beam used to support a wall, building, ship in dry dock, etc 支柱 3. V to move or drag (a boat) onto a shore 把(船)拖上海岸 4. V to prop or make safe with or as if with a shore 用支柱撑住; 使稳住
1. ADJ Something that is relevant to a situation or person is important or significant in that situation or to that person. 相关的
1. N-VAR A calculation is something that you think about and work out mathematically. Calculation is the process of working something out mathematically. 计算
1. V to place in or establish as headquarters 设立总部 [美国英语] [非正式]
1. ABBREVIATION for public limited company 公共有限公司 → see also limited
1. N-COUNT When there is a coup, a group of people seize power in a country. 政变 2. N-COUNT A coup is an achievement which is thought to be especially good because it was very difficult. 极为难得的成就
1. N a member or supporter of a Progressive Party 进步政党党员; 进步政党的支持者 [美国英语] [history] 2. ADJ of, relating to, or characteristic of a Progressive Party, Progressive movement, or Progressives 进步政党的

1. ADJ If something is common, it is found in large numbers or it happens often. 常见的 2. commonly ADV 常见地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ If something is common to two or more people or groups, it is done, possessed, or used by them all. 共同的; 共有的; 共用的 4. ADJ When there are more animals or plants of a particular species than there are of related species, then the first species is called common. (物种) 常见的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ Common is used to indicate that someone or something is of the ordinary kind and not special in any way. 普通的 [ADJ n] 6. ADJ Common decency or common courtesy is the decency or courtesy which most people have. You usually talk about this when someone has not shown these characteristics in their behaviour to show your disapproval of them. 起码的 (修养、礼貌等) [表不满] 7. ADJ You can use common to describe knowledge, an opinion, or a feeling that is shared by people in general. 普遍的 (知识、观点、情感等) [ADJ n] 8. commonly ADV 普遍地 [ADV -ed] 9. ADJ If you describe someone or their behaviour as common, you mean that they sho
1. ADJ A congressional policy, action, or person relates to the U.S. Congress. 美国国会的 [ADJ n]
1. N-COUNT A sophisticate is someone who knows about culture, fashion, and other matters that are considered socially important. 通达之人
1. ADJ If you have a cloistered way of life, you live quietly and are not involved in the normal busy life of the world around you. 与世无争的 [usu ADJ n]
1. ADJ Outdoor activities or things happen or are used outside and not in a building. 户外的 [ADJ n]
adv. 个别地，单独地

1. N-COUNT A poll is a survey in which people are asked their opinions about something, usually in order to find out how popular something is or what people intend to do in the future. 民意测验 2. → see also opinion poll 3. V-T If you are polled on something, you are asked what you think about it as part of a survey. 对…进行民意测验 [usu passive] 4. N-PLURAL The polls means an election for a country's government, or the place where people go to vote in an election. 政治大选; 投票地点 5. V-T If a political party or a candidate polls a particular number or percentage of votes, they get that number or percentage of votes in an election. 获得…选票 6. → see also polling
1. V-T If you amass something such as money or information, you gradually get a lot of it. 聚集

1. N-UNCOUNT The weather is the condition of the atmosphere in one area at a particular time, for example, if it is raining, hot, or windy. 天气 2. V-T/V-I If something such as wood or rock weathers or is weathered, it changes colour or shape as a result of the wind, sun, rain, or cold. 风化; 褪色 3. V-T If you weather a difficult time or a difficult situation, you survive it and are able to continue normally after it has passed or ended. 经受住 4. PHRASE If you say that you are under the weather, you mean that you feel slightly ill. 身体不适
1. PHRASAL VERB To kick someone out of a place or an organization means to force them to leave it. 撵走; 开除 [非正式] 2. → see also kick

1. N-COUNT A buck is a U.S. or Australian dollar. 美元; 澳元 [非正式] 2. N-COUNT A buck is the male of various animals, including the deer, antelope, rabbit, and kangaroo. (雄鹿、公羊、雄兔、雄袋鼠等) 雄性动物 3. N a young man 年轻男人 [美国英语] [非正式] 4. N a type of vaulting horse 鞍马 [gymnastics] 5. N a marker in the jackpot to remind the winner of some obligation when his turn comes to deal (提醒赢家履行义务的)标识 [poker] 6. ADJ If someone has buck teeth, their upper front teeth stick forward out of their mouth. 外龅的 [ADJ n] 7. V-I If a horse bucks, it kicks both of its back legs wildly into the air, or jumps into the air wildly with all four feet off the ground. (马) 狂蹬后腿跃起; 四蹄离地狂跳 8. V-T If you buck the trend, you obtain different results from others in the same area. If you buck the system, you get what you want by breaking or ignoring the rules. 违逆 (潮流); 抗拒 (体制) 9. V to cut (a felled or fallen tree) into lengths 把(伐倒的树木)截成段 [美国英语] 10. PHRASE If you pass the buck, you refuse to accept responsibility for something, and say that someone e
1. V-T/V-I If you flee from something or someone, or flee a person or thing, you escape from them. 逃离 [书面] [no passive]

1. V-T If a person, event, or achievement is hailed as important or successful, they are praised publicly. 称赞 [usu passive] 2. N-UNCOUNT Hail consists of small balls of ice that fall like rain from the sky. 冰雹 3. V-I When it hails, hail falls like rain from the sky. 下冰雹 4. N-SING A hail of things, usually small objects, is a large number of them that hit you at the same time and with great force. (雹子般的) 一阵 5. V-I Someone who hails from a particular place was born there or lives there. 出生于 [正式] 6. V-T If you hail a taxi, you wave at it in order to stop it because you want the driver to take you somewhere. 挥手呼叫 7. V-T to greet, esp enthusiastically (热烈)欢迎 8. SENTENCE SUBSTITUTE an exclamation of greeting 欢迎的喊叫声 [POETIC]

1. V-T If something such as a box, bag, room, or place contains things, those things are inside it. 有…在里面 [no cont] 2. V-T If a substance contains something, that thing is a part of it. 含有 [no cont] 3. V-T If writing, speech, or film contains particular information, ideas, or images, it includes them. (文章、演讲、电影) 包含 (某些信息、观点、图像等) [no cont] 4. V-T If a group or organization contains a certain number of people, those are the people that are in it. (团体、组织等) 包括 (某数量的成员) [no cont] 5. V-T If you contain something, you control it and prevent it from spreading or increasing. 控制; 阻止 6. → see also self-contained

1. N-SING Appreciationof something is the recognition and enjoyment of its good qualities. 欣赏 [also no det, oft N 'of' n] 2. N-SING Your appreciation for something that someone does for you is your gratitude for it. 感激 [also no det] 3. N-SING An appreciation of a situation or problem is an understanding of what it involves. 了解 [also no det] 4. N-UNCOUNT Appreciation in the value of something is an increase in its value over a period of time. 增值
1. ADJ Punitive actions are intended to punish people. 惩罚性的 [正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT If you have an interest in something, you want to learn or hear more about it. 兴趣 [also 'a' N] 2. N-COUNT Your interests are the things that you enjoy doing. 爱好 3. V-T If something interests you, it attracts your attention so that you want to learn or hear more about it or continue doing it. 使感兴趣 4. V-T If you are trying to persuade someone to buy or do something, you can say that you are trying to interest them in it. 引起 (购买或做某事) 的意愿 5. N-COUNT If something is in the interests of a particular person or group, it will benefit them in some way. 利益 6. N-COUNT You can use interests to refer to groups of people who you think use their power or money to benefit themselves. 利益集团 7. N-COUNT A person or organization that has an interest in an area, a company, a property or in a particular type of business owns stock in it. 股权 [商业] 8. N-COUNT If a person, country, or organization has an interest in a possible event or situation, they want that event or situation to happen because they are likely
1. ADJ If someone is adamant about something, they are determined not to change their mind about it. 坚决的 2. adamantly ADV 坚决地

1. N-UNCOUNT Evidence is anything that you see, experience, read, or are told that causes you to believe that something is true or has really happened. 证据; 依据 2. N-UNCOUNT Evidence is the information that is used in a court of law to try to prove something. Evidence is obtained from documents, objects, or witnesses. (法律上的) 证据 [法律] 3. PHRASE If you give evidence in a court of law or an official inquiry, you officially say what you know about people or events, or describe an occasion at which you were present. (在法庭上或官方调查中) 作证 4. PHRASE If someone or something is in evidence, they are present and can be clearly seen. 显然可见

1. N-COUNT A feature of something is an interesting or important part or characteristic of it. 特点 2. N-COUNT A feature is a special article in a newspaper or magazine, or a special programme on radio or television. (报纸、杂志的) 特写; (广播、电视的) 特别节目 3. N-COUNT A feature or a feature film or movie is a full-length film about a fictional situation, as opposed to a short film or a documentary. 正片; 故事片 4. N-COUNT A geographical feature is something noticeable in a particular area of country, for example, a hill, river, or valley. (地理) 特征 5. N-PLURAL Your features are your eyes, nose, mouth, and other parts of your face. 容貌 6. V-T When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it. (电影等) 由…主演; (展览会等) 以…为重点 7. V-I If someone or something features in something such as a show, exhibition, or magazine, they are an important part of it. 担任主演; 是 (展览、杂志等) 的重要内容
n. 地方分权；疏散（等于decentralization）
adv. 残忍地；野蛮地；兽性地
1. N-SING The private sector is the part of a country's economy that consists of industries and commercial companies that are not owned or controlled by the government. (经济的) 私营部分 [商业]

1. CONJ You use either in front of the first of two or more alternatives, when you are stating the only possibilities or choices that there are. The other alternatives are introduced by "or." 与(or)连用，表示几个可选项中只能选其一 2. CONJ You use either in a negative statement in front of the first of two alternatives to indicate that the negative statement refers to both the alternatives. 用于否定句中，表示“两者都不” 3. PRON You can use either to refer to one of two things, people, or situations, when you want to say that they are both possible and it does not matter which one is chosen or considered. 用于表示“两者中的任一个” 4. QUANT Either is also a quantifier. 用于表示“两者中任一…” [QUANT 'of' def-pl-n] 5. DET Either is also a determiner. 用于表示“两者中任一…” 6. PRON You use either in a negative statement to refer to each of two things, people, or situations to indicate that the negative statement includes both of them. 用于否定句中，表示“两者中任何一个都不” [with brd-neg] 7. QUANT Either is also a quantifier. 用于否定句，表示“两者中任何一个…都不” 8. DET Either is also a determiner. 用于否定

1. ADJ You use proper to describe things that you consider to be real and satisfactory rather than inadequate in some way. 像样的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ The proper thing is the one that is correct or most suitable. 正规的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ If you say that a way of behaving is proper, you mean that it is considered socially acceptable and right. 适宜的 4. ADJ You can add proper after a word to indicate that you are referring to the central and most important part of a place, event, or object and want to distinguish it from other things that are not regarded as being important or central to it. 严格意义上的 [n ADJ]

1. V-T/V-I If you protest something or protest against something, you say or show publicly that you object to it. 抗议 2. N-VAR A protest is the act of saying or showing publicly that you object to something. 抗议 3. V-T If you protest that something is the case, you insist that it is the case, when other people think that it may not be. 断言
1. N-UNCOUNT Procurement is the act of obtaining something such as supplies for an army or other organization. 获得 (军需品等的) 行为 [正式]
1. N-UNCOUNT Harassment is behaviour which is intended to trouble or annoy someone, for example repeated attacks on them or attempts to cause them problems. 骚扰

1. ADV If something or someone is popularly known as something, most people call them that, although it is not their official name or title. 通俗地 [ADV with -ed] 2. ADV If something is popularly believed or supposed to be the case, most people believe or suppose it to be the case, although it may not be true. 普遍地 (认为) [ADV -ed] 3. ADV A popularly elected leader or government has been elected by a majority of the people in a country. 由广大人民选举的 [ADV -ed]

1. N-VAR Emphasis is special or extra importance that is given to an activity or to a part or aspect of something. 重点 2. N-VAR Emphasis is extra force that you put on a syllable, word, or phrase when you are speaking in order to make it seem more important. 重音

1. ADJ A house or room that is cosy is comfortable and warm. (指房子或房间) 温暖舒适的 2. ADJ If you are cosy, you are comfortable and warm. (指人) 温暖舒适的 [v-link ADJ] 3. ADJ You use cosy to describe activities that are pleasant and friendly, and involve people who know each other well. 亲切的 4. N-COUNT A cosy or a tea cosy is a soft knitted or fabric cover which you put over a teapot in order to keep the tea hot. 茶壶套

1. N-COUNT Bumpers are bars at the front and back of a vehicle that protect it if it bumps into something. 保险杠 2. N a glass, tankard, etc, filled to the brim, esp as a toast (尤用于祝酒)满杯 3. V to toast with a bumper 用满杯祝酒 4. ADJ A bumper crop or harvest is one that is larger than usual. 丰收的 [ADJ n] 5. ADJ If you say that something is bumper size, you mean that it is very large. 巨大的 [ADJ n] 6. PHRASE If traffic is bumper to bumper, the vehicles are so close to one another that they are almost touching and are moving very slowly. (车辆) 首尾相接的

1. N-COUNT The cost of something is the amount of money that is needed in order to buy, do, or make it. 费用 2. V-T If something costs a particular amount of money, you can buy, do, or make it for that amount. 要价 3. V-T When something that you plan to do or make is costed, the amount of money you need is calculated in advance. 估算…的费用 [usu passive] 4. V-T If an event or mistake costs you something, you lose that thing as the result of it. 使…付出 5. N-PLURAL Your costs are the total amount of money that you must spend on running your home or business. (家庭或公司) 开销 6. N-PLURAL If someone is ordered by a court of law to pay costs, they have to pay a sum of money toward the expenses of a court case they are involved in. 诉讼费用 7. N-UNCOUNT If something is sold at cost, it is sold for the same price as it cost the seller to buy it. 成本价格 8. N-SING The cost of something is the loss, damage, or injury that is involved in trying to achieve it. 代价 9. PHRASE If you say that something must be avoided at all costs, you a
1. N-COUNT A tyre is a thick piece of rubber which is fitted onto the wheels of vehicles such as cars, buses, and bicycles. 轮胎

1. N-UNCOUNT If you say that something spoken or written is nonsense, you mean that you consider it to be untrue or silly. 胡言乱语; 蠢话 [表不满] 2. N-UNCOUNT You can use nonsense to refer to something that you think is foolish or that you disapprove of. 蠢事 [also 'a' N, usu supp N] [表不满] 3. N-UNCOUNT You can refer to spoken or written words that do not mean anything because they do not make sense as nonsense. 无意义的话 4. → see also no-nonsense 5. PHRASE To make a nonsense of something or to make nonsense of it means to make it seem ridiculous or pointless. 使…荒唐可笑; 使…失去意义

1. ADJ If you are miserable, you are very unhappy. 痛苦的 2. miserably ADV 痛苦地 3. ADJ If you describe a place or situation as miserable, you mean that it makes you feel unhappy or depressed. 令人忧伤的 4. ADJ If you describe the weather as miserable, you mean that it makes you feel depressed, because it is raining or dull. 阴冷多雨的 5. ADJ If you describe someone as miserable, you mean that you do not like them because they are bad-tempered or unfriendly. 脾气不好的; 不友好的 [ADJ n] 6. ADJ You can describe a quantity or quality as miserable when you think that it is much smaller or worse than it ought to be. 少得可怜的 [强调] 7. miserably ADV 少得可怜地 [ADV adj] 8. ADJ A miserable failure is a very great one. 惨痛的 [ADJ n] [强调] 9. miserably ADV 悲惨地 [ADV with v]

1. N-UNCOUNT Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something. 宣传 2. N-UNCOUNT When the news media and the public show a lot of interest in something, you can say that it is receiving publicity. 公众的关注
1. ADJ An unwelcome experience is one that you do not like and did not want. 不喜欢的; 不想要的 2. ADJ If you say that a visitor is unwelcome, you mean that you did not want them to come. 不受欢迎的 (来访者)

1. ADJ A well-known person or thing is known about by a lot of people and is therefore famous or familiar. If someone is well-known for a particular activity, a lot of people know about them because of their involvement with that activity. 有名的; 熟悉的 2. ADJ A well-known fact is a fact that is known by people in general. 众所周知的
1. N-UNCOUNT Officialdom is used to refer to officials who work for the government or in other organizations, especially when you think that their rules are unhelpful. 官僚 [表不满]

1. V-T If someone shoots a person or an animal, they kill them or injure them by firing a bullet or arrow at them. 射死; 射伤 2. V-I To shoot means to fire a bullet from a weapon such as a gun. 射击 3. V-I If someone or something shoots in a particular direction, they move in that direction quickly and suddenly. 猛冲 4. V-T/V-I If you shoot something somewhere or if it shoots somewhere, it moves there quickly and suddenly. 猛然移动 5. V-T If you shoot a look at someone, you look at them quickly and briefly, often in a way that expresses your feelings. 瞥 6. V-I If someone shoots to fame, they become famous or successful very quickly. 迅速 (成名) 7. V-T When people shoot a movie or shoot photographs, they make a movie or take photographs using a camera. 拍摄 8. N-COUNT Shoot is also a noun. 拍摄 9. N-COUNT Shoots are plants that are beginning to grow, or new parts growing from a plant or tree. 新芽 10. V-I In sports such as football or basketball, when someone shoots, they try to score by kicking or throwing the ball towa
1. N-COUNT You can refer to a sudden great increase in wealth, success, or luck as a bonanza. 鸿运

1. N-COUNT A pit is the underground part of a mine, especially a coal mine. 矿井 2. N-COUNT A gravel pit or clay pit is a very large hole that is left where gravel or clay has been dug from the ground. (挖出沙砾或黏土后留下的) 大坑 3. V-T If two opposing things or people are pitted against one another, they are in conflict. 使对立 [usu passive] 4. N-COUNT A pit is a large hole that is dug in the ground. 大坑 5. N-PLURAL In motor racing, the pits are the areas at the side of the track where drivers stop to get more fuel and to repair their cars during races. (赛车道旁的) 检修加油站 6. N-PLURAL The pits is a slang word for the worst possible person, place, or thing. (俗语)最糟的人、地方或事情 7. N-COUNT A pit is the large hard seed of a fruit or vegetable. 核 [美国英语] 8. V to extract the stone from (a fruit) 除去(水果的)核 9. → see also orchestra pit, pitted 10. PHRASE If you pit your wits against someone, you compete with them in a test of knowledge or intelligence. 与…斗智 11. PHRASE If you have a feeling in the pit of your stomach, you have a tight
1. PHRASE If you tell someone to get cracking, you are telling them to start doing something immediately. 立即着手做; 抓紧做 [非正式]

1. N-COUNT Pins are very small thin pointed pieces of metal. They are used in sewing to fasten pieces of material together until they have been sewn. 别针 2. V-T If you pin something on or to something, you attach it with a pin, a safety pin or a thumbtack. 用别针别住; 用图钉钉住 3. V-T If someone pins you to something, they press you against a surface so that you cannot move. 按住; 使不能动弹 4. N-COUNT A pin is any long narrow piece of metal or wood that is not sharp, especially one that is used to fasten two things together. (把两件物品固定在一起的) 销; 钉; 栓 5. V-T If someone tries to pin something on you or to pin the blame on you, they say, often unfairly, that you were responsible for something bad or illegal. 把…归罪于 6. V-T If you pin your hopes on something or pin your faith on something, you hope very much that it will produce the result you want. 寄 (希望、信念) 于 7. N-COUNT A pin is something worn on your clothing, for example, as jewellery, which is fastened with a pointed piece of metal. 胸针 [美国英语] 8. → see also safety pin

1. ADJ Gourmet food is nicer or more unusual or sophisticated than ordinary food, and is often more expensive. 菜肴精美的 [ADJ n] 2. N-COUNT A gourmet is someone who enjoys good food, and who knows a lot about food and wine. 美食家
1. ADJ Olfactory means concerned with the sense of smell. 嗅觉的 [正式] [ADJ n]

1. N-COUNT A criminal is a person who has committed a crime. 罪犯 2. ADJ Criminal means connected with crime. 犯罪的; 刑事的 3. ADJ If you describe an action as criminal, you think it is very wrong or a serious mistake. 严重错误的 [表不满]

1. ADJ Distant means very far away. 遥远的 2. ADJ You use distant to describe a time or event that is very far away in the future or in the past. 久远的 3. ADJ A distant relative is one who you are not closely related to. 远房的 4. distantly ADV 远亲地 5. ADJ If you describe someone as distant, you mean that you find them cold and unfriendly. 冷淡的; 不友好的 [v-link ADJ] 6. ADJ If you describe someone as distant, you mean that they are not concentrating on what they are doing because they are thinking about other things. 恍惚的; 茫然的

1. ADJ Postal is used to describe things or people connected with the public service of carrying letters and packages from one place to another. 邮政的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ Postal is used to describe activities that involve sending things by mail. 邮寄的 [ADJ n]
1. ADJ ornamented with angular designs or frets 有格子纹的; 饰有万字浮雕的

1. N-UNCOUNT Corn is a tall plant which produces long vegetables covered with yellow seeds. It can also be used to refer to the yellow seeds. 玉米; 玉米粒 2. N-UNCOUNT Corn is used to refer to crops such as wheat and barley. It can also be used to refer to the seeds from these plants. 谷物 (指小麦、燕麦等); (小麦、燕麦等的) 谷粒 [英国英语] 3. N-COUNT a hardening or thickening of the skin around a central point in the foot, caused by pressure or friction 鸡眼 4. → see also popcorn, sweetcorn

1. PREP Following a particular event means after that event. 在…之后 2. ADJ The following day, week, or year is the day, week, or year after the one you have just mentioned. 其后的 (日、月、年等) [det ADJ] 3. ADJ You use following to refer to something that you are about to mention. 以下的 [det ADJ] 4. PRON The following refers to the thing or things that you are about to mention. 以下的事或物 ['the' PRON] 5. N-COUNT A person or organization that has a following has a group of people who support or admire their beliefs or actions. 支持者
1. ADV You use strangely to emphasize that what you are saying is surprising. 令人奇怪的是 [ADV with cl] [强调] 2. → see also strange

1. N-PLURAL Theauthorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed. 当局 2. N-COUNT An authority is an official organization or government department that has the power to make decisions. 官方机构 3. → see also local authority 4. N-COUNT Someone who is an authority on a particular subject knows a lot about it. (某一学科的) 权威人士 5. N-UNCOUNT Authority is the right to command and control other people. 职权 6. N-UNCOUNT If someone has authority, they have a quality which makes other people take notice of what they say. 威信 7. N-UNCOUNT Authority is official permission to do something. 官方的许可
1. ADJ If someone is obsessed with a person or thing, they keep thinking about them and find it difficult to think about anything else. 受困扰的; 对…痴迷的

1. V-T If you say that someone manipulates people, you disapprove of them because they skilfully force or persuade people to do what they want. 控制 [表不满] 2. manipulation N-VAR 控制 3. V-T If you say that someone manipulates an event or situation, you disapprove of them because they use or control it for their own benefit, or cause it to develop in the way they want. 操纵 [表不满] 4. manipulation N-VAR 操纵 5. V-T If you manipulate something that requires skill, such as a complicated piece of equipment or a difficult idea, you operate it or process it. 操作 6. manipulation N-VAR 操作 7. V-T If someone manipulates your bones or muscles, they skilfully move and press them with their hands in order to push the bones into their correct position or make the muscles less stiff. 使脱臼复位; 用推拿术治疗 8. manipulation N-VAR 推拿术
1. N-VAR Cord is strong, thick string. 绳索 2. N-VAR Cord is wire covered in rubber or plastic which connects electrical equipment to an electricity supply. 电线

1. V-T If you dispatch someone to a place, you send them there for a particular reason. 派遣 [正式] 2. N-UNCOUNT Dispatch is also a noun. 派遣 3. V-T If you dispatch a message, letter, or parcel, you send it to a particular person or destination. 发送 [正式] 4. N-UNCOUNT Dispatch is also a noun. 发送

1. N-COUNT A stamp or a postage stamp is a small piece of paper which you lick and stick on an envelope or package before you mail it to pay for the cost of the postage. 邮票 2. N-COUNT A stamp is a small block of wood or metal which has a pattern or a group of letters on one side. You press it onto an pad of ink and then onto a piece of paper in order to produce a mark on the paper. The mark that you produce is also called a stamp. 印章; 印记 3. V-T If you stamp a mark or word on an object, you press the mark or word onto the object using a stamp or other device. 盖 (章); 印 (某标记); 打上 (某字) 4. V-T/V-I If you stamp or stamp your foot, you lift your foot and put it down very hard on the ground, for example because you are angry or because your feet are cold. 跺 (脚); 跺脚; 重重地踩 5. N-COUNT Stamp is also a noun. 跺脚 6. V-I If you stamp somewhere, you walk there putting your feet down very hard on the ground because you are angry. (因生气而) 顿足 7. V-I If you stamp on something, you put your foot down on it very hard. (在…上)
1. N-VAR Restraints are rules or conditions that limit or restrict someone or something. 限制 2. N-UNCOUNT Restraint is calm, controlled, and unemotional behaviour. 克制

1. N-VAR If there is some prospect of something happening, there is a possibility that it will happen. 可能性; 前景 2. N-SING A particular prospect is something that you expect or know is going to happen. 将要发生的事 3. N-PLURAL Someone's prospects are their chances of being successful, especially in their career. 成功的机会; 前途 4. V-I When people prospect for oil, gold, or some other valuable substance, they look for it in the ground or under the sea. 勘探

1. V-T/V-I If you leap, you jump high in the air or jump a long distance. 跳跃 2. N-COUNT Leap is also a noun. 跳跃 3. V-I If you leap somewhere, you move there suddenly and quickly. 急速移动 4. V-I If a vehicle leaps somewhere, it moves there in a short sudden movement. (车辆) 突然移动 5. N-COUNT A leap is a large and important change, increase, or advance. 巨变; 剧增 [journalism] 6. V-I If you leap to a particular place or position, you make a large and important change, increase, or advance. 巨变; 剧增
1. ADJ If someone is composed, they are calm and able to control their feelings. 镇定的; 泰然自若的 [usu v-link ADJ]

1. V-I When you lean in a particular direction, you bend your body in that direction. (身体) 倾斜 2. V-T/V-I If you lean on or against someone or something, you rest against them so that they partly support your weight. If you lean an object on or against something, you place the object so that it is partly supported by that thing. 把…靠 (在…上); 靠 (在…上) 3. N the condition of inclining from a vertical position 倾斜 4. ADJ If you describe someone as lean, you mean that they are thin but look strong and healthy. 清瘦而且健康 [表赞许] 5. ADJ If meat is lean, it does not have very much fat. 少脂肪的 6. N the part of meat that contains little or no fat 瘦肉 7. ADJ If you describe an organization as lean, you mean that it has become more efficient and less wasteful by getting rid of staff, or by dropping projects which were unprofitable. 高效的 8. ADJ If you describe periods of time as lean, you mean that people have less of something such as money or are less successful than they used to be. 贫乏的
1. N-COUNT A county is a region of the U.S., Britain, or Ireland, which has its own local government. (英国、爱尔兰的) 郡; (美国的) 县
1. N-COUNT An astronomer is a scientist who studies the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space. 天文学家

1. N-UNCOUNT You use reality to refer to real things or the real nature of things rather than imagined, invented, or theoretical ideas. 现实 2. → see also virtual reality 3. N-COUNT Therealityof a situation is the truth about it, especially when it is unpleasant or difficult to deal with. (尤指令人不快或难对付的) 真实情形 4. N-SING You say that something has become a reality when it actually exists or is actually happening. 事实存在; 真实发生的事 5. PHRASE You can use in reality to introduce a statement about the real nature of something, when it contrasts with something incorrect that has just been described. 事实上; 实际上

1. V-RECIP If one person or institution forges an agreement or relationship with another, they create it with a lot of hard work, hoping that it will be strong or lasting. 努力地缔造 2. V-T If someone forges something such as paper money, a document, or a painting, they copy it or make it so that it looks genuine, in order to deceive people. 伪造 (纸币、文件或画作等) 3. forger N-COUNT 伪造者 4. V to shape (metal) by heating and hammering 锻造(金属) 5. V to move at a steady and persevering pace 匀速移动 6. N a place in which metal is worked by heating and hammering; smithy 锻造间

1. V-T/V-I When people cheer, they shout loudly to show their approval or to encourage someone who is doing something such as taking part in a game. 欢呼 2. N-COUNT Cheer is also a noun. 欢呼 3. V-T If you are cheered by something, it makes you happier or less worried. 感到振奋 4. cheering ADJ 令人振奋的 5. CONVENTION People sometimes say "Cheers" to each other just before they drink an alcoholic drink. 干杯 [英国英语]
1. ADJ You use humid to describe an atmosphere or climate that is very damp, and usually very hot. 湿热的

1. N-UNCOUNT Fire is the hot, bright flames produced by things that are burning. 火 2. N-VAR Fire or a fire is an occurrence of uncontrolled burning which destroys buildings, forests, or other things. 火灾 3. N-COUNT A fire is a burning pile of wood, coal, or other fuel that you make, for example, to use for heat, light, or cooking. 炉火 4. N-COUNT A fire is a device that uses electricity or gas to give out heat and warm a room. 电炉; 煤气炉 [英国英语] 5. V-T When a pot or clay object is fired, it is heated at a high temperature in a special oven, as part of the process of making it. 烧制 6. V-I When the engine of a motor vehicle fires, an electrical spark is produced which causes the fuel to burn and the engine to work. (引擎等) 点火 7. V-T If you fire someone with enthusiasm, you make them feel very enthusiastic. If you fire someone's imagination, you make them feel interested and excited. 激发 8. PHRASE If an object or substance catches fire, it starts burning. 起火 9. PHRASE If something is on fire, it is burning and be
1. N-VAR Rivalry is competition or fighting between people, businesses, or organizations who are in the same area or want the same things. 竞争; 斗争
1. N-MASS Dessert is something sweet, such as fruit, pastry, or ice cream, that you eat at the end of a meal. 餐后甜点
n. 挫折

1. ADJ Someone who is cruel deliberately causes pain or distress to people or animals. 残忍的 2. cruelly ADV 残忍地 [ADV with v] 3. ADJ A situation or event that is cruel is very harsh and causes people distress. 严酷的 4. cruelly ADV 严酷地
n. 花费；开销 v. 花费；度过（spend的现在分词形式）

1. V-T/V-I If a process stalls, or if someone or something stalls it, the process stops but may continue at a later time. 使暂停; 暂停 2. V-I If you stall, you try to avoid doing something until later. 拖延 3. V-T If you stall someone, you prevent them from doing something until a later time. 拖住 (某人) 4. V-T/V-I If a vehicle stalls or if you accidentally stall it, the engine stops suddenly. 使 (发动机) 突然熄火; (发动机) 突然熄火 5. N-COUNT A stall is a large table on which you put goods that you want to sell, or information that you want to give people. 货摊; 咨询台 6. N-PLURAL The stalls in a theatre or concert hall are the seats on the ground floor directly in front of the stage. 舞台前排座位 [英国英语] 7. N-COUNT A stall is a small enclosed area in a room which is used for a particular purpose, for example a shower. 小隔间 [美国英语] 8. N a compartment in a stable or shed for confining or feeding a single animal (马厩或牛棚里圈养一个动物的)小隔间

1. N-COUNT The stalk of a flower, leaf, or fruit is the thin part that joins it to the plant or tree. (花、叶、果实与植株相连的) 柄; 梗 2. V-T If you stalk a person or a wild animal, you follow them quietly in order to kill them, catch them, or observe them carefully. 悄悄跟踪 3. V-T If someone stalks someone else, especially a famous person or a person they used to have a relationship with, they keep following them or contacting them in an annoying and frightening way. 骚扰; 纠缠
（使）相信；说服

1. N-COUNT If you make a copy of something, you produce something that looks like the original thing. 复制品 2. N-COUNT A copy of a book, newspaper, or CD is one of many that are exactly the same. 一份 (书籍、报纸、CD等) 3. V-T If you copy something, you produce something that looks like the original thing. 复制 4. V-T/V-I If you copy, or copy a piece of writing, you write it again exactly. 抄写 5. PHRASAL VERB Copy out means the same as . 抄写 6. V-T If you copy a letter, document, or e-mail to someone, you send them a copy of a letter or document that you have sent to someone else. 抄送 7. V-T If you copy someone's answer, you look at what that person has written and write the same thing yourself, in order to cheat in a test or exam. 抄袭 8. V-T If you copy a person or what they do, you try to do what they do or try to be like them, usually because you admire them or what they have done. 效仿 9. → see also hard copy

1. Worn is the past participle of . (wear)的过去分词 2. ADJ Worn is used to describe something that is damaged or thin because it is old and has been used a lot. 用旧的; 用坏的 3. ADJ If someone looks worn, they look tired and old. 疲倦的; 衰老的 [v-link ADJ]
蓊
n. 停滞；滞止
1. Wore is the past tense of . (wear)的过去式
adv. 临时地，临时

1. V-T If you soothe someone who is angry or upset, you make them feel calmer. 使镇定 2. soothing ADJ 抚慰的 3. V-T Something that soothes a part of your body where there is pain or discomfort makes the pain or discomfort less severe. 缓和 (疼痛或不适) 4. soothing ADJ 缓和的
1. ADJ (of vegetables) cut into thin shreds (蔬菜)切成细长条的 2. N a clear consommé to which a mixture of such vegetables has been added 什锦菜丝汤
1. N-UNCOUNT The emergence of something is the process or event of its coming into existence. 兴起

1. N-COUNT A faction is an organized group of people within a larger group, which opposes some of the ideas of the larger group and fights for its own ideas. 派系 2. N a television programme, film, or literary work comprising a dramatized presentation of actual events (电视、电影、文学等的)纪实

1. N-COUNT A fracture is a crack or break in something, especially a bone. (尤指骨头) 断裂 2. V-T/V-I If something such as a bone is fractured or fractures, it gets a crack or break in it. 折断 3. V-T/V-I If something such as an organization or society is fractured or fractures, it splits into several parts or stops existing. 分裂 [正式]

1. N-COUNT A sentence is a group of words which, when they are written down, begin with a capital letter and end with a period, question mark, or exclamation mark. Most sentences contain a subject and a verb. 句子 2. N-VAR In a law court, a sentence is the punishment that a person receives after they have been found guilty of a crime. 刑罚 3. → see also death sentence 4. V-T When a judge sentences someone, he or she states in court what their punishment will be. 宣判; 判决
1. V to jump up and down in one spot, as in a punk dance of the 1970s (像1970年代的一种舞蹈那样)原地上下跳动
n. 里卡多（姓氏）

1. ADJ You use ultimate to describe the final result or aim of a long series of events. 最终的 [ADJ n] 2. ADJ You use ultimate to describe the original source or cause of something. 最终的; 根本的 [ADJ n] 3. ADJ You use ultimate to describe the most important or powerful thing of a particular kind. 终极的 (指最重要或最强大的) [ADJ n] 4. ADJ You use ultimate to describe the most extreme and unpleasant example of a particular thing. 终极的 (指最极端、最恶劣的) [ADJ n] 5. ADJ You use ultimate to describe the best possible example of a particular thing. 终极的 (指最好的) [ADJ n] 6. PHRASE The ultimate in something is the best or most advanced example of it. 极致; 最佳典范

1. V-I If you cope with a problem or task, you deal with it successfully. (妥善地) 处理 2. V-I If you have to cope with an unpleasant situation, you have to accept it or bear it. 应付 (困难局面) 3. V-I If a machine or a system can cope with something, it is large enough or complex enough to deal with it satisfactorily. (用机器) 处理 4. N a large ceremonial cloak worn at solemn liturgical functions by priests of certain Christian sects (基督教教士的)法衣
1. N-COUNT Your colleagues are the people you work with, especially in a professional job. 同事

1. ADJ Something that is subtle is not immediately obvious or noticeable. 不易察觉的 2. subtly ADV 不易察觉地 3. ADJ A subtle person cleverly uses indirect methods to achieve something. 不露声色的 4. subtly ADV 不露声色地 [ADV with v] 5. ADJ Subtle smells, tastes, sounds, or colours are pleasantly complex and delicate. 淡的; 精妙的 6. subtly ADV 淡地; 精妙地

1. N-VAR If there is confusion about something, it is not clear what the true situation is, especially because people believe different things. 不明朗 2. N-UNCOUNT Confusion is a situation in which everything is in disorder, especially because there are lots of things happening at the same time. 混乱 3. → see also confuse
n. [工业] 流程图；作业图
n. 西雅图（美国一港市）
风险资本

1. N-COUNT If you have a sauna, you sit or lie in a room that is so hot that it makes you sweat. People have saunas in order to relax and to clean their skin thoroughly. 桑拿 2. N-COUNT A sauna is a room or building where you can have a sauna. 桑拿浴室

1. V-T/V-I When you push something, you use force to make it move away from you or away from its previous position. 推 2. N-COUNT Push is also a noun. 推 3. V-T/V-I If you push through things that are blocking your way or push your way through them, you use force in order to move past them. 挤过 4. V-I If an army pushes into a country or area that it is attacking or invading, it moves further into it. 挺进 5. N-COUNT Push is also a noun. 挺进 6. V-T To push a value or amount up or down means to cause it to increase or decrease. 推动 (价值、数量上升或下降) 7. V-T If someone or something pushes an idea or project in a particular direction, they cause it to develop or progress in a particular way. 使发展; 推进 8. V-T If you push someone to do something or push them into doing it, you encourage or force them to do it. 鼓励; 逼迫 9. N-COUNT Push is also a noun. 鼓励; 逼迫 10. V-I If you push for something, you try very hard to achieve it or to persuade someone to do it. 努力争取; 力劝…做 11. N-COUNT Push is also a noun. 努力; 劝服 12. V-T If so

1. V-T If you denounce a person or an action, you criticize them severely and publicly because you feel strongly that they are wrong or evil. 谴责 2. V-T If you denounce someone who has broken a rule or law, you report them to the authorities. 告发
n. 情态助动词

1. ADV Halfway means in the middle of a place or between two points, at an equal distance from each of them. 在中途地 2. ADV Halfway means in the middle of a period of time or of an event. 在中间地 [ADV prep/adv] 3. ADJ Halfway is also an adjective. 在中间的 [ADJ n] 4. PHRASE If you meet someone halfway, you accept some of the points they are making so that you can come to an agreement with them. 对某人让步 5. ADV Halfway means fairly or reasonably. 相当地 [非正式] [ADV adj]
（尤指人或动物）凶猛的 （尤指动作或情感）强烈的 （天气或温度）恶劣的（fierce的最高级）

1. V-T If someone commits a crime or a sin, they do something illegal or bad. 犯 (罪); 做 (坏事) 2. V-T If someone commits suicide, they deliberately kill themselves. 进行 (自杀) 3. V-T If you commit money or resources to something, you decide to use them for a particular purpose. 调拨 (钱、资源) 4. V-T/V-I If you commit yourself to something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you commit yourself to someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them. 使 (自己) 致力于; 使 (自己) 承诺 (与某人的长期关系) 5. V-T If you do not want to commit yourself on something, you do not want to say what you really think about it or what you are going to do. (就某事) 表态 [with brd-neg] 6. V-T If someone is committed to a mental hospital, prison, or other institution, they are officially sent there for a period of time. 送交 (到精神病院、监狱等) [usu passive] 7. V-T If you commit something to paper or to writing, you record it by writing it down. If you commit something to memory, you learn it so that you will remember it. 记 (在纸上、记忆中
1. N an agent or deputy 职员; 副手 2. ADJ (of a waiter or chef) apprentice (侍者或厨师的)学徒
1. N-COUNT A coop is a cage where you keep small animals or birds such as chickens and rabbits. (关小动物或鸟的)笼子 2. V to confine in a restricted area 拘禁

1. N-COUNT You can refer to a level on a scale of measurement or achievement as a notch. 等级 [journalism] 2. V-T If you notch a success, especially in a sports contest, you achieve it. (尤指体育比赛) 赢得 [journalism] 3. N-COUNT A notch is a small V-shaped or circular cut in the surface or edge of something. V形槽口; 圆形凹口

1. ADJ Something that is cool has a temperature which is low but not very low. 凉的 2. ADJ If it is cool, or if a place is cool, the temperature of the air is low but not very low. 凉爽的 3. N-SING Cool is also a noun. 凉爽 4. ADJ Clothing that is cool is made of thin material so that you do not become too hot in hot weather. (衣服) 凉快的 5. ADJ Cool colours are light colours which give an impression of coolness. 冷色的 [ADJ n] 6. ADJ If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are calm and unemotional, especially in a difficult situation. 冷静的 [表赞许] 7. coolly ADV 冷静地 8. ADJ If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are unfriendly or not enthusiastic. 冷漠的 9. coolly ADV 冷漠地 10. ADJ If you say that a person or thing is cool, you mean that they are fashionable and attractive. 酷的 [非正式] 11. V-T/V-I When something cools or when you cool it, it becomes lower in temperature. 使变凉; 变凉 12. PHRASAL VERB To cool down means the same as to . 降温 13. V-T/V-I When a feel
1. V-T If something exacerbates a problem or bad situation, it makes it worse. 使…恶化 [正式] 2. exacerbation N-UNCOUNT 恶化

1. N-COUNT A privilege is a special right or advantage that only one person or group has. (某人、某团体拥有的) 特权 2. N-UNCOUNT If you talk about privilege, you are talking about the power and advantage that only a small group of people have, usually because of their wealth or their connections with powerful people. (一小部分人因其财富或与有权人的关系而拥有的) 特权 3. N-SING You can use privilege in expressions such as be a privilege or have the privilege when you want to show your appreciation of someone or something, or to show your respect. 荣幸

1. N-UNCOUNT Copper is reddish brown metal that is used to make things such as coins and electrical wires. 铜 2. N-COUNT (Often shortened to cop) → a slang word for policeman 3. ADJ Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour. 铜色的 [文学性]

1. N-MASS An ointment is a smooth thick substance that is put on sore skin or a wound to help it heal. 药膏 2. PHRASE If you describe someone or something as a fly in the ointment, you think they spoil a situation and prevent it from being as successful as you had hoped. 扫兴的人或事; 美中不足之处

1. N-COUNT A hedge is a row of bushes or small trees, usually along the edge of a lawn, garden, field, or road. 树篱 2. V-I If you hedge against something unpleasant or unwanted that might affect you, especially losing money, you do something which will protect you from it. 防备 (尤指金钱损失) 3. N-COUNT Something that is a hedge against something unpleasant will protect you from its effects. 防备手段 4. PHRASE If you hedge your bets, you reduce the risk of losing a lot by supporting more than one person or thing in a situation where they are opposed to each other. 几面下注

1. V-T/V-I When radio and television programmes, computer data, or other electronic messages are transmitted, they are sent from one place to another, using wires, radio waves, or satellites. 传播 (广播电视节目、计算机信息等) 2. V-T If one person or animal transmits a disease to another, they have the disease and cause the other person or animal to have it. 传播 (疾病) [正式] 3. V-T If an object or substance transmits something such as sound or electrical signals, the sound or signals are able to pass through it. 传导 (声音、电子信号等)
adj. 污染的；传染的 n. 污染物；传染物
1. ADJ Something that is confusing makes it difficult for people to know exactly what is happening or what to do. 令人困惑的
n. 库尔德斯坦（西南亚库尔德人分布地区）
1. N-UNCOUNT If you regard someone or something with affection, you like them and are fond of them. 喜爱 2. N-PLURAL Your affections are your feelings of love or fondness for someone. 感情
n. 恶化；退化；堕落

1. N-COUNT An equation is a mathematical statement saying that two amounts or values are the same, for example 6x4=12x2. 等式 2. N-COUNT An equation is a situation in which two or more parts have to be considered together so that the whole situation can be understood or explained. 制衡局面
1. N-VAR A flute is a musical instrument of the woodwind family. You play it by blowing over a hole near one end while holding it sideways to your mouth. 长笛

1. N-COUNT A peg is a small piece of wood or metal that is used for fastening something to something else. 销钉 2. N-COUNT A peg is a small hook or knob that is attached to a wall or door and is used for hanging things on. 挂钩; 挂环 3. N-COUNT A peg is a small device that you use to fasten clothes to a clothes line. 衣夹 [英国英语] 4. V-T If you peg something somewhere or peg it down, you fix it there with pegs. 用衣夹夹住; 用销钉固定 5. V-T If a price or amount of something is pegged at a particular level, it is fixed at that level. 固定 (价格、数量等)

1. N-COUNT A declaration is an official announcement or statement. 官方声明 2. N-COUNT A declaration is a firm, emphatic statement which shows that you have no doubts about what you are saying. 宣言 3. N-COUNT A declaration is a written statement about something which you have signed and which can be used as evidence in a court of law. 书面声明

1. V-I If you sprawl somewhere, you sit or lie down with your legs and arms spread out in a careless way. 伸开四肢坐着; 摊开四肢躺着 2. PHRASAL VERB Sprawl out means the same as . 伸开四肢坐着; 摊开四肢躺着 3. V-I If you say that a place sprawls, you mean that it covers a large area of land. 延伸 4. N-UNCOUNT You can use sprawl to refer to an area where a city has grown outward in an uncontrolled way. (城市的) 无计划扩张区域
银（argentine的名词复数） 银色素 银色工艺材料

1. N-VAR In football, the kick-off is the time at which a particular game starts. (足球比赛中的) 开球 2. N-COUNT In American football, a kick-off is the kick that begins a play, for example at the beginning of a half or after a touchdown or goal has been scored. (橄榄球比赛中的) 中线开球 [美国英语] 3. N-SING The kick-off of an event or activity is its beginning. (事件或活动的) 开始 [非正式]

1. V-I If someone or something thrives, they do well and are successful, healthy, or strong. 兴旺发达; 茁壮成长 2. V-I If you say that someone thrives on a particular situation, you mean that they enjoy it or that they can deal with it very well, especially when other people find it unpleasant or difficult. 喜欢; 从容应对 (尤指别人不喜欢或认为困难的事)

1. N-COUNT Wrinkles are lines that form on someone's face as they grow old. 皱纹 2. V-T/V-I When someone's skin wrinkles or when something wrinkles it, lines start to form in it because the skin is getting old or damaged. 使起皱纹; 起皱纹 3. wrinkled ADJ 有皱纹的 4. N-COUNT A wrinkle is a raised fold in a piece of cloth or paper that spoils its appearance. (布或纸上的) 皱褶 5. V-T/V-I If cloth wrinkles, or if someone or something wrinkles it, it gets folds or lines in it. 使起皱褶; 起皱褶 6. wrinkled ADJ 起皱褶的 7. V-T/V-I When you wrinkle your nose or forehead, or when it wrinkles, you tighten the muscles in your face so that the skin folds. 皱起 8. N a clever or useful trick, hint, or dodge 妙计; 窍门 [非正式]

1. V-T If people in authority enforce a law or a rule, they make sure that it is obeyed, usually by punishing people who do not obey it. 施行 2. V-T To enforce something means to force or cause it to be done or to happen. 强制执行
1. ADV You use primarily to say what is mainly true in a particular situation. 主要地

1. V-T If someone or something highlights a point or problem, they emphasize it or make you think about it. 强调; 使注意 2. V-T To highlight a piece of text means to mark it in a different colour, either with a special type of pen or on a computer screen. (用不同颜色) 标出; (在电脑屏幕上) 突出显示 3. N-COUNT The highlights of an event, activity, or period of time are the most interesting or exciting parts of it. 最精彩的部分
1. ADJ Someone who is adept at something can do it skilfully. 娴熟的
1. N-UNCOUNT Silicon is an element that is found in sand and in minerals such as quartz and granite. Silicon is used to make parts of computers and other electronic equipment. 硅

1. V-T If you contradict someone, you tell them that what they have just said is wrong, or suggest that it is wrong by saying something different. 反驳 2. V-T If one statement or piece of evidence contradicts another, the first one makes the second one appear to be wrong. 与…矛盾

1. N-UNCOUNT Your pursuit of something is your attempts at achieving it. If you do something in pursuit of a particular result, you do it in order to achieve that result. 追求 2. N-UNCOUNT The pursuit of an activity, interest, or plan consists of all the things that you do when you are carrying it out. 执行 3. N-UNCOUNT Someone who is in pursuit of a person, vehicle, or animal is chasing them. 追赶 4. N-COUNT Your pursuits are your activities, usually activities that you enjoy when you are not working. 消遣活动
1. ADJ Successive means happening or existing one after another without a break. 连续的

1. V-T If something frustrates you, it upsets or angers you because you are unable to do anything about the problems it creates. 使懊丧 2. frustrated ADJ 懊丧的 3. V-T If someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding. 挫败
麦康内尔（美国地名） n. (McConnell)人名；(英)麦康奈尔
n. (Kadyrov)人名；(俄)卡德罗夫
1. N a page boy 侍童 [英国英语] [非正式]

1. N-UNCOUNT Arabic is a language that is spoken in the Middle East and in parts of North Africa. 阿拉伯语 2. ADJ Something that is Arabic belongs or relates to the language, writing, or culture of the Arabs. 阿拉伯语的; 阿拉伯文字的; 阿拉伯文化的 3. ADJ An Arabic numeral is one of the written figures such as 1, 2, 3, or 4. 阿拉伯数字的 [ADJ n]

1. ADJ If you are curious about something, you are interested in it and want to know more about it. 好奇的 2. curiously ADV 好奇地 [ADV after v] 3. ADJ If you describe something as curious, you mean that it is unusual or difficult to understand. 不寻常的; 难以理解的 4. curiously ADV 令人不解的地

1. V-T If a government deports someone, usually someone who is not a citizen of that country, it sends them out of the country because they have committed a crime or because it believes they do not have the right to be there. 把…驱逐出境 2. deportation N-VAR 驱逐出境

1. N-COUNT Someone who is in a coma is in a state of deep unconsciousness. 昏迷 2. N the luminous cloud surrounding the frozen solid nucleus in the head of a comet, formed by vaporization of part of the nucleus when the comet is close to the sun 慧发; 慧星头部的发光云 [astronomy]

1. V-T If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it. 发誓 2. N-COUNT A vow is a serious promise or decision to do a particular thing. 誓言 3. N-COUNT Vows are a particular set of serious promises, such as the promises two people make when they are getting married. 誓约
1. N-UNCOUNT Largesse is a generous gift of money or a generous act of kindness. 慷慨捐助; 善举 [正式]

1. PHRASAL VERB If you take over a company, you get control of it, for example, by buying its shares. 接管 (公司) [商业] 2. PHRASAL VERB If someone takes over a country or building, they get control of it by force, for example, with the help of the army. (用武力) 接管 3. PHRASAL VERB If you take over a job or role or if you take over, you become responsible for the job after someone else has stopped doing it. 接替 4. PHRASAL VERB If one thing takes over from something else, it becomes more important, successful, or powerful than the other thing, and eventually replaces it. 取代 5. → see also takeover

1. V-T If you rescue someone, you get them out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation. 营救 2. rescuer N-COUNT 救援者 3. N-UNCOUNT Rescue is help which gets someone out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation. 营救 4. N-COUNT A rescue is an attempt to save someone from a dangerous or unpleasant situation. 营救行动 5. PHRASE If you go to someone's rescue or come to their rescue, you help them when they are in danger or difficulty. 营救某人
n. 加纳（非洲西部国家）

1. N-COUNT A blanket is a large square or rectangular piece of thick cloth, especially one that you put on a bed to keep you warm. 毯子 2. N-COUNT A blanket of something such as snow is a continuous layer of it which hides what is below or beyond it. 覆盖层 3. V-T If something such as snow blankets an area, it covers it. 覆盖 4. ADJ You use blanket to describe something when you want to emphasize that it affects or refers to every person or thing in a group, without any exceptions. 适用于全体的 [ADJ n] [强调]
1. N-COUNT A phenomenon is something that is observed to happen or exist. 现象 [正式]

1. V-T/V-I When a liquid evaporates, or is evaporated, it changes from a liquid state to a gas, because its temperature has increased. 使…蒸发; 蒸发 2. evaporation N-UNCOUNT 蒸发 3. V-I If a feeling, plan, or activity evaporates, it gradually becomes weaker and eventually disappears completely. (情绪、计划、活动) 逐渐消逝

1. N-COUNT Someone who is a protagonist of an idea or movement is a supporter of it. 倡导者; 拥护者 [正式] 2. N-COUNT A protagonist in a play, novel, or real event is one of the main people in it. (戏剧、小说或真实事件里的) 主人公 [正式]
1. ADJ A hierarchical system or organization is one in which people have different ranks or positions, depending on how important they are. 等级制度的
n. 取得

1. V-T If you rethink something such as a problem, a plan, or a policy, you think about it again and change it. 重新考虑 2. N-SING If you have a rethink of a problem, a plan, or a policy, you think about it again and change it. 重新考虑 [journalism]
1. N-COUNT If a country holds a referendum on a particular policy, they ask the people to vote on the policy and show whether or not they agree with it. 公民投票; 全民公决
1. N-UNCOUNT If someone is in hiding, they have secretly gone somewhere where they cannot be seen or found. 躲藏 (处) 2. N a flogging; beating 鞭笞; 痛打 [非正式]
1. ADV You use bitterly when you are describing an attitude which involves strong, unpleasant emotions such as anger or dislike. 强烈地 [ADV adj]

1. V-I If someone or something tumbles somewhere, they fall there with a rolling or bouncing movement. 摔倒 2. N-COUNT Tumble is also a noun. 摔 [usu sing] 3. V-I If prices or levels of something are tumbling, they are decreasing rapidly. (价格或水平) 暴跌 [journalism] 4. N-COUNT Tumble is also a noun. (价格或水平的) 暴跌 5. V-I If water tumbles, it flows quickly over an uneven surface. (水流) 翻滚
adj. 最弱的

1. V-T If something reflects an attitude or situation, it shows that the attitude or situation exists or it shows what it is like. 反映; 表现; 显示 2. V-T/V-I When light, heat, or other rays reflect off a surface or when a surface reflects them, they are sent back from the surface and do not pass through it. 反射 3. V-T When something is reflected in a mirror or in water, you can see its image in the mirror or in the water. 映出 [usu passive] 4. V-I When you reflect on something, you think deeply about it. 深思 5. V-T You can use reflect to indicate that a particular thought occurs to someone. 想到 (某事) 6. V-I If an action or situation reflects in a particular way on someone or something, it gives people a good or bad impression of them. 使对…产生某种印象

1. N-COUNT An hourglass is a device that was used to measure the passing of an hour. It has two round glass sections linked by a narrow channel, and contains sand which takes an hour to flow from the top section into the lower one. (计时用的)沙漏

1. N-UNCOUNT Radio is the broadcasting of programmes for the public to listen to, by sending out signals from a transmitter. 无线电广播 2.
